<<Image 'BoardGame/MallMadnessGirls.webp' "fullWidth">>\ Emily gave an eager nod, @@.emilyVoice;"first you need to pick a character."@@ She gestured down at the assorted characters. Naturally they were all girls, but this wasn't surprising it //was// a shopping game. Since Emily hadn't even bothered explaining the rules yet you doubted that the choice would be //too// important. @@.emilyVoice;"Now this is a very special game, so make sure you choose your favourite."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Are there special powers or something?\"">> Emily shook her head, @@.emilyVoice;"nuh uh, no powers, but you still gotta pick carefully."@@ You couldn't tell if she was just messing with you or this actually was going to be an important choice. They all played the same so you supposed all that mattered was whose look you liked best... [[Vanessa|Board Game Accept 2][$mallMadnessGirl to "Vanessa"]] [[Sarah|Board Game Accept 2][$mallMadnessGirl to "Sarah"]] [[Kara|Board Game Accept 2][$mallMadnessGirl to "Kara"]] [[Tameka|Board Game Accept 2][$mallMadnessGirl to "Tameka"]] [[Rachael|Board Game Accept 2][$mallMadnessGirl to "Rachael"]] [[Megan|Board Game Accept 2][$mallMadnessGirl to "Megan"]] <<set $acceptActivityAccount++>>\<<if $mallMadnessGirl === "Kara">>\ <<if $karaInferiorityComplex >= 3>>\ You snap picked Kara, @@.girlThought;she's probably the best, I bet she's super smart@@. Only belatedly did you worry that the actual genius Kara would be annoyed, but she didn't seem to mind at all. The reason for that was revealed only moments later. <<else>>\ You wondered if Kara would be annoyed at you picking her namesake before she had a chance, but she didn't seem to mind at all. The reason for that was revealed only moments later. <</if>>\ <<else>>\ None of the girls seemed particularly concerned with your choice though Emily was still grinning from the fact you were playing in the first place. <</if>>\ <<playerVoice "\"Aren't you all going to pick?\"">> The girls looked between each other, they knew something you didn't and you didn't like it. @@.emilyVoice;"Time to play!"@@ Emily shouted. Cutting off any of your protests about not knowing the rules. There was an electronic buzzing building in your ears, yet seemingly coming from inside your own head. It built to the point of discomfort before it suddenly ceased, leaving you in silence. At that same moment the world went black. [[The world came back|Board Game Accept 3]] <<set $preMallPlayerAge to $playerAge>>\As your hearing returned you could hear a general din in all directions, voices that you didn't recognize. As your sight came back you could see that you weren't in your house anymore. At first glance it actually looked like you were in a mall, though a few things made it clear this wasn't quite a regular mall. For one you didn't recognize any of the store names: "Glitter", "Jimmies", "Jean Scene". Each with a moniker underneath to explain what they were "Accessory Store", "Ice Cream Shop", "Clothing Store". It was way too on the nose for any real store, these were designed for maximum clarity so you'd know exactly where you were going. @@.emilyVoice;"So are you ready to play?"@@ A voice came from your left which was oddly familiar and not quite right. As you turned you saw a blonde girl that you didn't recognize, though her blue eyes sparkled with mischief in a way you suddenly recognized. <<playerVoice "\"Emily?\"">> The teenage girl nodded as the three others walked into view beside her. Miki, Kara and Sophie progressed well into teenagehood. They all looked a little unsure of their new bodies, glancing down at them as if they might vanish at any moment. @@.mikiVoice;"This feels weird,"@@ Miki murmured, to the general agreement of the others. @@.emilyVoice;"Well if we were going to play we had to look the part,"@@ Emily spoke as if the transformations had been an obvious necessity, @@.emilyVoice;"we're all supposed to be teenage girls."@@ [[Teenage girls?|Board Game Accept 4]] <<set $playerAge to 16>>\ <<set $mallMadnessTransformation to 1>>\ <<set $voiceClassOverride to 6>>\Your realized in that moment that in the deluge of unexpected things you hadn't actually checked your own body. Which quickly revealed that you weren't in your own body any more at all. <<if $oldPlayerAge >= 14>>You were about the same age as before, but you were suddenly a girl.<<elseif $oldPlayerAge <= 10>>You were back to your old age, or at least close enough, but you were still a girl.<<else>>You were a little older than before, back to your old age, but now you were a girl.<</if>> You'd gotten a whole new wardrobe and a serious makeover, you took a moment to examine yourself. Your choice of $mallMadnessGirl as your avatar had become rather literal. It wasn't an exact match of course, since you were a real person, but you could see the resemblance. Luckily you hadn't been saddled with their absurdly long necks. <<switch $mallMadnessGirl>>\ <<case "Vanessa">>\ You were sporting a black turtleneck with an @@.girlVoice;orange skirt@@ that stopped just above the knee. You had a @@.girlVoice;pink bag@@ and red glasses as accessories, though a quick check revealed the glasses were just for show. On your feet were @@.girlVoice;bright yellow heels@@ that you really hoped you could walk in. <<case "Sarah">>\ You had on an unmarked blue t-shirt and long brown pants that almost entirely covered your @@.girlVoice;flats@@. A thick black belt held up the pants and a green beret sat upon your head and a @@.girlVoice;bright yellow purse@@ helped complete your 'look'. <<case "Kara">>\ You had an off the shoulder purple shirt and long black pants, though the shirt was short enough that it always left a little of your stomach exposed. Simple @@.girlVoice;black flats@@ and a @@.girlVoice;yellow bag@@ continued the look. A studded belt and a few @@.girlVoice;beads@@ in your hair completing your new outfit. <<case "Tameka">>\ You were wearing a small green t-shirt with a star on the front and long brown pants with a pocket chain, though the shirt left a lot of your stomach exposed. You had a backpack on and sneakers, one of which was standing on a @@.girlVoice;small pink skateboard@@. <<case "Rachael">>\ Your asymmetric white shirt left not only your right shoulder exposed, but also a bit of your stomach. Your chunky belt held up jeans that entirely covered up your shoes. A @@.girlVoice;small purse@@ and @@.girlVoice;large hoop earrings@@ completed your new look. <<case "Megan">>\ Your new look had a lot going on. A @@.girlVoice;purple and black striped dress@@ was your main garment though it was awfully short. A white belt cinched around your tiny waist. In your hair was not only a @@.girlVoice;scrunchie@@ to keep your hair up, but also a set of sparkly glasses. With both a necklace and a bracelet you were well accessorized, with a @@.girlVoice;tiny red bag@@ you weren't sure would hold much of anything. You had @@.girlVoice;strappy red wedges@@ on your feet, the height making you a little uncomfortable. <</switch>>\ @@.emilyVoice;"Don't worry, we'll still call you <<playerName>>."@@ Emily clarified. <<if $mallMadnessGirl === "Kara">>\ @@.karaVoice;"Otherwise it'd get kinda confusing."@@ Kara, the original Kara, elaborated. <</if>>\ How they would refer to you wasn't your real concern. How were you in this game? Why were you in a new form? How did this game even work? [[The intercom crackled to life|Board Game Accept 5]]<span class="gray">"There is a sale at the...Shoe Store."</span> The electronic voice droned. The store name clearly recorded separately. //Really? An entire magical shopping mall, but it still has the shitty robot voice?// Any chance you had to ask further questions was cut off as the girls suddenly hurried away, presumably towards the shoe store. You glanced down at the shopping list that had appeared in your hand. No shoes on your list, so you had no real reason to follow. The game didn't need too much of an explanation, you had a shopping list, you had to get everything on it. First one to get them all and exit the mall wins. <<if $traitShopaholic>>\ @@.girlThought;OMG actual shopping! This is ''way'' better than playing some board game.@@ The only thing you weren't sure about was whether you wanted to actually play the game, or just go shopping at your own pace. [[Play the game|Board Game Accept Shop 1]] [[Shop at your own pace|Board Game Accept Sit 1]] <<else>>\ This was hardly the game that you'd signed up for. Did you still want to continue? [[Start shopping|Board Game Accept Shop 1]] [[Sit and wait|Board Game Accept Sit 1]] <</if>>\<<if $playerMaturity <= 11>>This was @@.girlVoice;a lot more fun@@ than just playing some board game.<<else>>If you were stuck in the game then you supposed you should at least try and play.<</if>> Though you were going to have to figure out how to approach the situation. You had your shopping list, but you'd never gotten a chance to look at the layout of the mall. Well you knew that the shoe store was in the direction the girls had run, and the sunglasses hut was around that corner, and the high end fashion store was all the way across the store on the second floor...Apparently you //did// know the layout of the entire mall which would make life a lot easier when they started announcing more sales. Now came the question of strategy. This was a board game for little girls so there weren't too many different choices. 1. You could try and move efficiently through your list, making sure you were always moving to the closest store. Though eventually you would run out of money and have to make the long trek to the ATM. 2. You could chase sales. You'd end up running around a lot, but you wouldn't have to make so many ATM trips. [[Chase the sales|Board Game Accept Shop 2][$MMChaseSales to true]] [[Try to move efficiently|Board Game Accept Shop 2][$MMChaseSales to false]] <<set $MMScore to 0>>\<<if $MMChaseSales>>\ You decided that chasing after sales would be the best option. Running back and forth from the ATM was bound to waste a bunch of your time. It seemed that the game supported those tactics. You'd already gotten a few items on your list in no time at all. Though you were running to and fro none of the stores were //too// far away. Plus a lucky clearance sale meant that you skipped a whole visit to the ATM. Maybe it wasn't surprising that a game all about shopping wanted to encourage a little 'bargain hunting', but you still felt clever for having figured it out. <<set $MMScore++>>\ <<else>>\ Chasing sales would be a good way to end up running around the mall like a chicken with it's head cut off. Surely it would be better to try and plot an efficient path between the stores, rather than getting stuck backtracking all the time. Though quickly enough several flaws were revealed in your plan. Trips to the ATM took you further out of the way than you'd expected, and even when you got there it hardly dispensed any money at all. Worse still the second time you went there the ATM was actually //broken//. Meaning you were left with no money, and no way to get more, so you just had to sit there and wait until it was repaired. You'd gotten a few items on your list, but it'd taken way too long. <</if>>\ //BZZT// There was a sudden buzz from your bag, opening it up you were confronted with a painfully stereotypical purse full of items: lipstick, a compact, hand lotion, mascara...but the item that caught your attention was the cell phone. A //flip phone// of all things. //This game is showing it's age.// You had a text from "Mall Administration". <span class="gray">Please respond with the name of a player you want to send for ice cream.</span> You doubted anyone needed anything from the ice cream store, it was just a chance to slow someone down. Who should you sabotage? [[Kara|Board Game Accept Shop 3][$MMIceCreamVictim to "Kara"]] [[Emily|Board Game Accept Shop 3][$MMIceCreamVictim to "Emily"]] [[Miki|Board Game Accept Shop 3][$MMIceCreamVictim to "Miki"]] [[Sophie|Board Game Accept Shop 3][$MMIceCreamVictim to "Sophie"]]The loudspeaker crackled to life, <span class="gray">"$MMIceCreamVictim...please make your way to...Jimmie's Ice Cream Shop."</span> You <<if $traitGiggly>>@@.girlVoice;giggled@@<<else>>laughed<</if>> at the absurdity of the voice. It couldn't say the sentence without the awkward pause, but it could somehow do your actual names? The actual message was phrased as a request, but you were quite sure that $MMIceCreamVictim wouldn't have a choice in the matter. You also knew that she wouldn't be happy with you about it, but it was just a game, she couldn't get //that// annoyed, right? A few minutes later you found out how annoying it was. <span class="gray">"<<playerName>>, meet up with your friend at the...Arcade."</span> You thought you'd just ignore it for a moment, you were only a few feet from the pet store, but your feet wouldn't obey you. Taking you on the shortest path to the Arcade where $MMIceCreamVictim was waiting. <<switch $MMIceCreamVictim>>\ <<case "Miki">>\ Miki was happily licking an ice cream cone as you approached the Arcade. Her eyes narrowed as she spoke, @@.mikiVoice;"you were mean, so you don't get any ice cream."@@ <<changeHappiness "Miki" false>>\ <<case "Kara">>\ Kara looked a little nervous as you approached the Arcade. @@.karaVoice;"Since you chose me last time, I thought it was only fair."@@ <<if $karaInferiorityComplex >= 2>>\ <<playerVoice "\"I didn't think I'd have a chance otherwise.\"">> You admitted. Kara was @@.girlVoice;too smart@@ to beat otherwise, and you knew it. Your words puffed Kara's ego enough that any annoyance she had at your sabotage faded away. <<changeHappiness "Kara" true>>\ <<elseif $karaInferiorityComplex>>\ <<playerVoice "\"I needed something to slow you down.\"">> You stopped short of outright admitting you were worried she'd win, but you were. Kara was @@.girlVoice;super smart@@ and without a little sabotage you weren't sure you could win. Kara seemed to accept this logic, blunting her annoyance at your original choice. <<else>>\ You shrugged in agreement. The logic was sound, and she only seemed a little annoyed. <<changeHappiness "Kara" false>>\ <</if>>\ <<set $MMScore++>>\ <<case "Sophie">>\ Sophie looked smug as you approached the Arcade. @@.sophieVoice;"Not so fun to get dragged around is it?"@@ <<changeHappiness "Sophie" false>>\ <<case "Emily">>\ Emily looked slightly annoyed as you approached the Arcade. @@.emilyVoice;"You could have just not texted anything you know."@@ You hadn't known. But you didn't regret it, you were trying to win after all. This was part of the game. <<changeHappiness "Emily" false>>\ <</switch>>\ The two of you waited there for a moment when the loudspeaker crackled to life again, <span class="gray">"Meet all shoppers at the...Food Court."</span> You sighed, another interruption, but your feet were already on their way, so neither you nor $MMIceCreamVictim had a choice. [[To the food court|Board Game Accept Shop 4]]The five of you arrived at the food court almost simultaneously. The whole mall was a simple rectangle, so no one ever got too far from the Food Court in the centre. A table had already been selected for you and a snack had been provided. A diet Coke and a small fries. It seemed a little silly, but you did have to admit to feeling a little hungry. All this shopping was tiring work. As you ate you tried to get a good look at the bags of the other girls. Not all items were of equal size, so it was tough to be sure who was winning. Sophie didn't have a lot of bags, but it looked like the ones she did were pretty full. Meanwhile Miki had a ton of nearly empty bags. Overall your best guess was that Kara was in the lead. <<if $MMIceCreamVictim === "Kara">>Though your sabotage attempt plus her revenge on you had wasted a lot of her time. So it was a narrow lead.<<else>>She had a good number of bags, and they seemed pretty full. She was already cross checking her shopping list with the contents of her bags, planning her next move.<</if>> Though all of them were still a little distracted by their new forms. It'd been easy to ignore when they were running around shopping, but now that they had to sit still they were forced to confront new alien sensations. //Finally they'll know what it's like.// @@.karaVoice;"Is this what we're actually going to look like as teenagers?"@@ Kara questioned Emily. [[Emily considered the question|Board Game Accept Shop 5]]@@.emilyVoice;"Sorta. Mommy said it was a //po-jection//. It might not happen if things change."@@ Emily's description didn't make things any clearer. <<if $playerMaturity <= 9>>What was a "po-jection"?<<else>>You knew she meant "projection", but that still didn't explain it all.<</if>> @@.karaVoice;"Ah, so its what we would look like if we kept acting the same."@@ Kara stated directly, grasping the complex situation in an instant. @@.sophieVoice;"Well I think that's enough of this,"@@ Sophie polished off the last of the fries and stood up. @@.mikiVoice;"Shopping!"@@ Miki shouted and stood. It was weird seeing her six year old exuberance coming from a sixteen year old body. <span class="gray">"There is a sale at the...Pet Store."</span> Each of you checked your lists. You didn't need a pet, but Kara and Miki did. The two of them rushed off. You'd need to hurry as well, if you didn't want to be left behind. You were hurrying towards a store on the opposite side of the mall when a woman accosted you. @@.mikiMomVoice;"Would you like to try some makeup?"@@ She gestured to her little makeup stand. @@.mikiMomVoice;"It's free to try, you should sit, it will make you look even prettier."@@ There was no telling how long this woman's makeover session would last, however you did have makeup on your list, she might give you a discount if you humoured her. [[Try some makeup|Board Game Accept Shop 6][$mallMadnessTriedMakeup to true]] [[Decline|Board Game Accept Shop 6][$mallMadnessTriedMakeup to false]]You wondered about this woman, and all the other "people" you'd seen wandering around the mall. It was clear they weren't real people, sometimes they repeated the same line and lots of them had the same face, but what were they? <<if $playerMaturity >= 11 && $knowledgeVideoGames>>\ Perhaps they were like NPCs in a video game. They looked like people, but just ran a simple set of instructions. It added to the ambiance without interfering with the players too much. The makeup stall owner was probably as complex as they got. A simple question and then waiting for a straightforward answer. You doubted she could do much else. <<if $karaInferiorityComplex>>You bet Kara would understand it.<<if $karaInferiorityComplex >= 2>>You'd @@.girlVoice;ask her to explain it to you@@ later.<</if>><</if>> <<else>>\ Maybe they were like @@.girlVoice;talking dolls@@. The kind where you could push a button or pull a string and make them say a random line. They were just there so the mall didn't seem so empty. <<if $karaInferiorityComplex>>You bet Kara would understand it.<<if $karaInferiorityComplex >= 2>>You'd @@.girlVoice;ask her to explain it to you@@ later.<</if>><</if>> <</if>>\<<if $mallMadnessTriedMakeup || $traitVain>>\ <<if $traitVain>>\ <<playerVoice "\"Of course I will!\"">> <<if $mallMadnessTriedMakeup === false>>You'd meant to decline, but your lack of makeup had been @@.girlVoice;bothering you@@ this whole time. The rest of you was so well put together, it felt like an obvious oversight.<<else>>Your lack of makeup had been @@.girlVoice;bothering you@@ this whole time. The rest of you was so well put together, it felt like an obvious oversight.<</if>> <<else>>\ <<playerVoice "\"I guess I can spare a minute.\"">> <</if>>\ The woman ushered you into a seat beside the stall. Turning you away from the mirror so you couldn't see yourself until her work was done. Work that occurred at a shocking speed. She pulled out a powder puff and began to dab at your face. There seemed to be little rhyme or reason to her movements, and it was kicking up enough powder that it was hard to see. @@.mikiMomVoice;"Done!"@@ The woman unexpectedly declared, @@.mikiMomVoice;"look how pretty you are now."@@ She spun the chair towards the mirror. You expected to see nothing more than some random powder marks, but you'd been very wrong. You had received a thorough makeover. Glossy lipstick, full curled lashes, eye shadow, blush...the works. It seemed the game had taken a few shortcuts in the process. @@.mikiMomVoice;"You want to buy? I'll give you a good deal."@@ The words were music to your ears. Another item checked off your list and at clearance prices, this would give you a boost for sure. You gave the woman her money, stood, and began to walk away from the stand. <<set $MMScore++>>\ <<else>>\ You shook your head. You had more important things to do then mess around with makeup. The woman immediately stopped her sales pitch. Walking back to her stall and standing there quietly. <</if>>\ <<include "Board Game Accept Shop 6 NPC Fragment">>\ [[Back to shopping|Board Game Accept Shop 7]]It was time to get serious, you'd already gotten half your list and you didn't doubt the girls were close to that. You needed to get those last items. Your first stop was the Clothing Store. <<if $traitFashionista>>\ The place was an assault on the senses. There were so many @@.girlVoice;pretty dresses@@ and @@.girlVoice;cute tops@@ and you had a whole new figure. You just @@.girlVoice;had to try a few things on@@. You tried to not waste too much time, but your impromptu @@.girlVoice;dressup session@@ had wasted some time. Finally you were able to drag yourself away from the cornucopia, purchasing the @@.girlVoice;dress@@ you needed and leaving the store. <<set $MMScore-->>\ <<else>>\ You were easily able to pick up the @@.girlVoice;dress@@ you needed and hurried on. <</if>>\ <span class="gray">"There is a clearance sale at the...Jewelery Store."</span> <<if $traitShopaholic>>\ You @@.girlVoice;squealed@@ in excitement. There had been barely any clearance sales in the game and you'd missed the last one. You hurried your way to the Jewelery Store. Emily was already there, looking through the shelves for her required item. You took a more casual approach, strolling through the store looking for the best deal. It was so hard to pick...in the end you picked up a handful of things. Rings, necklaces, an anklet, all @@.girlVoice;super cute@@ and @@.girlVoice;super cheap@@. It had drained every dollar you had, but how could you say no to a sale like that? It was only after you exited the store that you realized you hadn't needed anything from the Jewelery Store at all. You'd just gotten @@.girlVoice;so excited by the sale@@ that you hadn't actually checked your shopping list. The ATM trip would waste your time...but at least you'd found a good bargain, and wasn't that the most important thing? <<set $MMScore-->>\ <<else>>\ As enticing as a clearance sale was, you didn't actually need anything at the Jewelery Store. So you ignored the sale notice and continued on your way to the next destination. <</if>>\ <<if $traitSweetTooth>>\ You made one small detour on your way to the next store, if this place had an ice cream shop you had to try one. A decision you didn't regret in the slightest. It'd wasted a bit of time and money, but it was @@.girlVoice;delicious@@ and really motivated you to continue. <<set $MMScore++>>\ <<else>>\ You were forced to take a small break before heading to the next store. @@.girlThought;These bags are too heavy...@@ This game was supposed to be about teenage girls going on a shopping spree, yet your arms were so weak that you could barely carry the bags. An obvious oversight, maybe they'd fix it in the next version. <</if>>\ [[The final items|Board Game Accept Shop 8]]You had two items left. Your first stop was the Accessory Store. <<if $traitOblivious>>\ You glanced at the shelves, looking for your desired item. @@.karaMomVoice;"Oh! That's a good sale!"@@ A voice drifted by you, but you @@.girlVoice;didn't pay any attention@@, you had more important things to do. Finally you managed to find your required item, hurrying it up to the cash register, @@.girlVoice;unaware@@ of the sale you'd missed. <<else>>\ In a stroke of good fortune you managed to notice one item that had been marked down lower than the others. Giving you a discount that meant you didn't need another ATM trip. <<set $MMScore++>>\ <</if>>\ The Department Store was your last stop, you'd been avoiding this particular purchase. Underwear. It wasn't like you'd have to wear it or anything but shopping for lingerie felt //weird//. <<if $playerMaturity >= 13>>You were a guy, at least mentally, you shouldn't be buying @@.girlVoice;women's underwear@@.<<elseif $playerMaturity >= 9>>This body wasn't really yours, even buying underwear felt oddly invasive.<<else>>It felt like something mom should be buying for you.<</if>> But you managed to push your way, picking something at random and throwing it haphazardly at the cashier. You felt better once it was actually in a bag, out of sight, out of mind. With your final purchase made it was time to escape. Unfortunately your exit point was on the other side of the mall. This time you straight up ran. <<if $mallMadnessGirl === "Megan" || $mallMadnessGirl === "Vanessa">>At least as fast as you could run in heels. You'd gotten used to walking in them, but they weren't meant for speed.<<set $MMScore-->><</if>> [[To the parking lot|Board Game Accept Shop 9]]<<if $MMScore > 2>>\ You panted as you finally made it into the designated parking lot. //Was I fast enough?// A klaxon blared and the speaker crackled to life, <span class="gray">...<<playerName>>...has won the game. Congratulations to...<<playerName>>.</span> //I won!// <<if $karaInferiorityComplex >= 2>>You were shocked at the result. @@.girlThought;How in the world did I beat Kara?@@<<else>>It was a surprising result, but not an unwelcome one.<</if>> You barely had time to celebrate before the world went dark and you found yourself whisked back to the real world. <<else>>\ You never made it. Half way there a klaxon blared and the speaker crackled to life, <span class="gray">Kara has won the game. Congratulations to...Kara.</span> You didn't even have time to be disappointed before the world went dark and you found yourself whisked back to the real world. <</if>>\ The five of you popped back into existence surrounding the game board, back in your "normal" bodies. Kara looked relieved to be back in her own body. Sophie was disappointed by the change, looking mournfully down at her flat chest. Miki was thrilled, but that was because she'd had so much fun, nothing to do with her physical changes. [[Game over|Board Game Accept Shop 10]] <<silently>>\ <<set $playerAge to $preMallPlayerAge>> <<set $mallMadnessTransformation to 0>> <<set $voiceClassOverride to 0>> <</silently>>\@@.emilyVoice;"Did everyone have fun?"@@ Emily smiled, also a little glad to be back to being herself. <<if $MMScore > 2>>\ Emily turned to you, @@.emilyVoice;"<<playerName>>. Since you won you'll now be given the title 'Queen of Shopping', congratulations."@@ <<if $playerMaturity >= 13>>\ You weren't sure if that was a compliment or an insult. You were happy to win, but you didn't want to be a 'queen' of anything, let alone shopping. <<elseif $playerMaturity >= 10>>\ You supposed it was a pretty apt title. 'Queen' seemed a little lofty, but you had won, so you'd take it. <<changeEmbarassment "small decrease">>\ <<else>>\ You were @@.girlVoice;delighted@@. You were the ''queen''. You'd have preferred if it was @@.girlVoice;princess@@, but you supposed the queen was in charge, so it made sense. You'd won so you should be in charge. <<changeEmbarassment "small decrease">>\ <</if>>\ <<else>>\ Kara was clearly happy that she'd won, but wasn't rubbing it in. @@.sophieVoice;"Dang Kara, how'd you figure out that game so fast?"@@ Kara looked embarrassed, @@.karaVoice;"oh just some beginners luck. And once you figure out the pattern of the sales it gets easier."@@ The girls looked at one another, clearly Kara was the only one to realize that there had been a pattern. You couldn't blame them, you hadn't noticed one either. <<if $karaInferiorityComplex>>@@.girlThought;How is Kara so smart? It's crazy.@@<<else>>Not that you wanted them to know that.<</if>> <<if $traitChatterbox>>\ <<playerVoice "\"There was a pattern?\"">> The question escaped your lips before you could stop it. Kara had won, @@.girlVoice;as you'd expected@@, no point complaining about the obvious outcome. <<else>>\ <<if $traitGRatedLanguageToddler>><<playerVoice "\"It's just a stu-silly shopping game, not like it matters.\"">> It continued to annoy you that "silly" was the most negative word you seemed to be capable of.<<else>><<playerVoice "\"It's just a stupid shopping game, not like it matters.\"">><</if>> @@.mikiVoice;"Don't be a sore loser!"@@ Miki shouted, uncharacteristically blunt. That was all she had to say on the matter. Glaring at you for your @@.girlVoice;immature@@ response to losing.\ <<changeHappiness "Miki" false>>\ <</if>>\ <</filterlinkreplace>> <</if>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $playerMaturity >= 13>>\ You had to admit that shopping was @@.girlVoice;more fun@@ than you'd expected. You weren't about to start spending your weekends there, but maybe you'd go with Emily or the girls some time. Run around the mall for a few hours looking for sales. //Heh, I guess $mallMadnessGirl rubbed off on me a bit.// <<changeMaturity "small">>\ <</if>>\ [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<set $boardGameActivityResult to 1>> <<pushJournalEntry "boardGame" "Journal Board Game">><<if $traitShopaholic>>\ You got to @@.girlVoice;shopping@@. Turned out the game didn't really care if you were getting the "right" items. You could still buy what you wanted, and the ATM still dished out more money. Though in disappointingly small amounts, even in a game about shopping you //still// didn't have enough money. After your umpteenth trip to the ATM you needed a break. <<if $mallMadnessGirl === "Megan" || $mallMadnessGirl === "Vanessa">>Your feet were killing you, walking in heels was such a pain.<</if>> <<else>>\ You weren't about to start running around a mall while stuck in this unfamiliar form. <<if $mallMadnessGirl === "Megan" || $mallMadnessGirl === "Vanessa">>Plus you might break your ankle in these shoes.<</if>> Best to just take a sit on a bench and wait it out. The girls would surely finish the game eventually and it wasn't like you really cared about winning. <</if>>\ Luckily this mall was furnished like a real one, despite its artificial nature. So it was easy enough to find a nice bench to sit on beside a rather impressive fountain. It was peaceful and relaxing compared to the craziness of the party. The peace was not destined to last. @@.randomGuyVoice;"What's a cute girl like you doing sitting there all by yourself?"@@ You looked up into the <<if $playerMaturity>=14>>smugly <</if>>smiling face of a <<if $playerMaturity <= 8>>@@.girlVoice;gross@@<<elseif $playerMaturity >= 14 || $sexualityLock>>random<<elseif $playerMaturity >= 11>>@@.girlVoice;handsome@@<<elseif $playerMaturity >= 9>>@@.girlVoice;cute@@<</if>> teenage boy. He was dressed normally, jeans and a long sleeve shirt, but they fit well on him and had no visible stains. Overall he looked quite well put together, a rarity for teenage boys. He'd seemed more dynamic when he greeted you, but maybe that had all been pre-programmed. Quickly enough you landed in front of the clothing store, "Jean Scene". He beckoned you inside, following close behind. The inside of the store was a surprise. It was just a simple board game, so you'd expected a basic layout with a handful of options. Instead it was a sprawling space with a sea of clothes in every direction. There was a small "men's" section, but the rest of the store was a dizzying array of women's clothing. A cursory inspection of the nearest rack showed that, somehow, everything was in exactly your size. It was obviously unrealistic, but also incredible handy. Sometimes this game was so detailed it was distressing, mom had clearly done some serious work in making this. @@.randomGuyVoice;"See anything you like? [[Shopping|Board Game Accept Sit 7]] <span class="smallestText">[[Please let me go|Board Game Accept Sit Escape Hard]]</span> <<set $npcTransformation to 3>>\ <<set $maxNPCTransformation to 3>>\You grabbed a dress. Showed it to your boyfriend. @@.randomGuyVoice;"That's super pretty on you. You should definitely buy it."@@ His words were meaningless now, you just needed the audio queue to continue your routine. Then you had to nod and get the next outfit. The entity designated as your 'boyfriend' continued to say his lines so you continued to follow your instructions. He was as meaningless as his words, you felt nothing about him. It wasn't that you disliked him, you didn't dislike anything. You should probably obey the player, let her do what she wanted and then re-assert your routines when she was done. [[The world went dark|Board Game Accept Sit 10]]<<set $playerAge to $preMallPlayerAge>>\ You blinked as you found yourself in an unfamiliar location, sitting with unfamiliar characters, maybe players, around a board that made you feel homesick. A couple moments ago you'd known everything there was to know about life. Now you didn't even understand why you looked so weird. [[The blonde furrowed her brow|Board Game Accept Sit 11]] <<set $npcTransformation-->>\ <<set $mallMadnessTransformation to false>>\At least that you understood. [[You refocused your mind|Board Game Accept Sit 12]] <<set $npcTransformation-->>\ <<set $voiceClassOverride to 0>>\@@.karaVoice;"Well that's because they weren't real. There had been a surety in that state, you knew //exactly// what you had to do. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<silently>>\ <<set $boardGameActivityResult to 2>> <<set $npcTransformation to 0>> <<set $traitAgreeable to true>> <</silently>>\You refused to obey the player. You had your directives, there were only two possibilities. If not being addressed by player 1. Select a random outfit. 2. Enter change room. 3. Change. 4. Exit change room. 5. Wait for audio queue. 6. Nod. 7. Go to 1. If being addressed by player 1. Select a random voice line list. 2. Speak voice line. 3. Pause for five seconds. 4. Go to 1. Going with this player was not part of any of those directives. It didn't matter what she said or did, you could only speak to her. [[Follow routine|Board Game Accept Sit Bad End 2]]Selecting random voice line @@.karaMomVoice;"I just love shopping, don't you?"@@ @@.emilyVoice;"<<playerName>> listen to me, this is serious, you //have// to come with me."@@ ... [[Follow routine|Board Game Accept Sit Bad End 4]]The lights in the mall suddenly went dark, signalling the exit of the players. All routines stop. Enter standby mode. You stood in place, what little remained of your mind shutting down into an inhuman sleep. ... ... ... As you waited in standby the game began to reset itself. Restoring the clothes to their original positions. Restocking the ATM. Clearing out any mess left by the players. And of course, resetting the NPCs. There was a slight hitch as the reset procedure passed you. There were parameters defined about you which did not fit any existing NPC class. Additionally your appearance matched with one of the player characters. Obviously this was an error. As you were found in the clothing store it defaulted you to a random NPC class normally found in that store. Your body instantly snapped into a new form. Female Model 3-B. A pretty blonde girl with no distinctive traits. Designed to evoke a reaction of being pleasant enough to look at, but not enough to catch attention for long. Any details quickly forgotten once out of sight. Just another background character in the mall. [[Standby...|Board Game Accept Sit Bad End 5]] <<set $npcTransformation to 5>>After your form had been reset it was time to reset your sub-routines. They seemed to be mostly correct, but there were still additional parameters that were player character only. Likes, Intelligence, Identity. None of this applied to you. You were reset to a generic NPC class. Generic Clothing Shopper - Female. A simple routine which looped on trying new outfits. Would continue to loop indefinitely. The only complex part was waiting for audio input, ostensibly a compliment from a male NPC, but even that was simplified to just wait for //any// audio input. A player dropping something loud would be enough to progress the routine. With the reset complete all the NPCs were left in standby. No sounds, no movement. Not even the rise and fall of a chest. Breathing was an unnecessarily complex behaviour to simulate. Players would never pay attention long enough to notice. ... ... [[New players|Board Game Accept Sit Bad End 6]] <<set $npcTransformation to 6>>Exiting standby mode Initialize "Generic Clothing Shopper - Female" Start default routine 1 Set tempOutfit to outfitList.random(); 2 Push tempOutfit to inventory; 3 Execute npcClass.move("change room"); 4 Set currentOutfit to temp outfit; 5 Execute npcClass.move("outside change room"); 6 Await audio input; 7 Execute npcClass.nod(); 8 GOTO 1; @@.momVoice;"$playerName is that you?"@@ Interrupt - Addressed by player Switching to player interaction routine 1 Set voiceLine to voiceLines.random(); 2 Execute npcClass.speak(voiceLine); @@.karaMomVoice;"Shopping is the best!"@@ @@.momVoice;"Acts like another generic one...There must be some discernible distinction, I just need to find it. Then I can ground the both of them for a week..."@@ Interrupt - Player exiting interaction zone Switching to default routine 1 Set tempOutfit to outfitList.random(); 2 Push tempOutfit to inventory; 3 Execute npcClass.move("change room"); 4 Set currentOutfit to temp outfit; 5 Execute npcClass.move("outside change room"); 6 Await audio input; 7 Execute npcClass.nod(); 8 GOTO 1; Ending 13 - undefined <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "" 24>>You stared at the next outfit in your hands, already moving towards the change room. @@.girlThought;Change into the outfit. Get praise. Get the next outfit.@@ The behaviour was almost automatic now, you didn't even have to think about it. Actually you weren't thinking about much at all. It was enough to just follow along to your instructions. @@.girlThought;Change into the outfit. Get praise. Get the next outfit.@@ You didn't actual parse what the praise was this time. It didn't matter, you'd gotten the audio queue and it was time to continue. But as you grabbed the next outfit you hesitated. Wasn't there something else you were supposed to do? You'd been with the players...a few minutes ago. But that seemed wrong, you shouldn't be interrupting their game, you just had to show outfits to your boyfriend. //Players? Audio queue? Boyfriend?// As you changed into the outfit a small part of your mind was screaming for you to run. That something terrible was happening to you. You staggered out of the change room, trying to reconcile the two voices in your head. @@.girlThought;Get praise. Get the next outfit.@@ //Get the hell out of here!// Stumbling past your @@.girlVoice;boyfriend@@ you tried to make your way towards the door. [[The alarm sounded|Board Game Accept Sit Escape Hard 2]]A steel vice took a hold of your wrist, @@.guardVoice;"Miss. You have to pay for that."@@ You turned to see the imposing countenance of the security guard. You were struggling to figure out what to do. You should be @@.girlVoice;trying on outfits@@. You didn't know about "paying". The longer he held on the more you were confused as to how you'd even gotten here. Your @@.girlVoice;boyfriend@@ was back by the changing rooms waiting to see your next outfit. @@.girlThought;Get praise. Get the next outfit.@@ The words hammered into your head. <<playerVoice "\"Sorry...\"">> you mumbled to the guard, your eyes glazing over as you turned to go back to your assigned position. Luckily before you could another customer bumped into the guard, separating the two of you. The two of you weren't supposed to have been standing there so he'd pathed right into you. Mustering the last of your will you took the momentary distraction to flee from the store, ignoring the still ringing alarm. Making your way back to the bench where this had all started. [[Take a seat|Board Game Accept Sit Escape 2]] <<addTrait "$traitShopaholic" "Shopaholic" "trait">>\You stared at the next outfit in your hands, just another one to try. Or maybe you'd already tried it? Did you even remember what you'd liked? What you wanted to buy? All you could seem to get your head around was the idea of just 'trying another outfit'. Something was terribly wrong about this... You shook your head, dropping the garment to the floor, <<playerVoice "\"I gotta go, sorry.\"">> You murmured as you tried to make your way out of the store. Your eyes catching on every @@.girlVoice;cute skirt@@, wondering how it would look if you ''tried it on''. Lingering on every @@.girlVoice;pretty dress@@ you should hurry and change ''change into''. But you managed to stumble your way out of the store. In the relatively fresh air you found your head clearing up. You were //not// going back into that store. Whatever had gone on in there was hazardous to your mental health. Even now you could feel the pull towards it. @@.girlThought;I should be shopping!@@ You grit your teeth and ignored the thought, heading back to the bench you'd started at. [[Take a seat|Board Game Accept Sit Escape 2]] <<set $npcTransformation-->>\Finally free of that infernal store you tried to get your mind pulled back together. Focusing on who you were and what you knew of yourself. <<if $npcTransformation >= 2>>\ You were...you had a name...you knew that @@.girlVoice;"babe"@@ was just a pet name. Maybe you were <<print $mallMadnessGirl>>? That felt right, but things were still a jumble. That store had been doing something terrible to you. It was like shopping was the //only// thing that mattered. That your entire existence was dedicated to it. Almost like you'd spend the rest of your life in this mall rather than becoming a...a... //Why can't I think of a job?// You racked your brain for something else you might want to do with your life, but came up blank. Were you really meant to just be in this mall forever? @@.girlThought;I should be shopping!@@ The thought had you off the bench and walking back towards a store...at the last moment you caught yourself. You tried to convince yourself there was more to life than shopping. Holding onto that fact even as your brain struggled to come up with what else there could be. It was a miracle that you'd left that store. Another few moments and @@.girlVoice;thoughts of shopping@@ might have been all that was left in your head. Just stuck in a meaningless loop of trying on clothes, getting rote vacuous feedback, and then trying another. The worst part was, you still wanted to. You could feel the urge to go back and try just @@.girlVoice;one more outfit@@. Mustering your tattered willpower you sat back on the bench. The girls would be back soon enough and then you could get out of here. <<else>>\ You were $mallMadnessGirl...wait no you were <<playerName>>. You were just in <<print $mallMadnessGirl>>'s body temporarily. Something about that store had been making you forget that. Making you think you were some @@.girlVoice;vapid shopping obsessed teenage girl@@. If you'd stayed there much longer you might have really believed it. You shuddered. That was a terrifying prospect...at a glance it didn't seem that different from what the rest of this sleepover had been doing to you. But something about this transformation felt different. It felt like there had been...less of you. That you'd been becoming a shell of yourself. Or maybe you were thinking about all of this way too hard. You were away from the store and now you could @@.girlVoice;get back to shopping!@@ You were half way off the bench when you caught yourself. Seems that you'd need a little more time to recover, hopefully this newfound @@.girlVoice;shopping obsession@@ would fade. <</if>>\ [[Wait for the girls|Board Game Accept Sit Finale]] <<set $npcTransformation-->> <<addTrait "$traitShopaholic" "Shopaholic" "trait">>\ <<set $boardGameActivityResult to 2>> <<pushJournalEntry "boardGame" "Journal Board Game">><<if $maxNPCTransformation >= 2>>\ By the time the girls arrived you had recovered most of your mind. More than enough to tell you who had won the game. <<if $karaInferiorityComplex >= 3>>Not that it was a surprise at all, @@.girlVoice;Kara was prodigy@@, of course she won.<</if>> @@.mikiVoice;"That was so much fun!"@@ Miki's excitement was almost overflowing, @@.mikiVoice;"can we play again?"@@ Emily laughed, @@.emilyVoice;"mmhmm, but not today. [[Back to the real world|Board Game Accept Sit Finale 2]]<<silently>>\ <<set $npcTransformation to 0>> <<set $playerAge to $preMallPlayerAge>> <<set $mallMadnessTransformation to 0>> <<set $voiceClassOverride to 0>> <</silently>>\ Back in the real world, in your own body with your own mind you were finally able to take a sigh of relief. Kara had won, but everyone had fun running around buying things they normally couldn't afford. There was a catharsis in @@.girlVoice;mindless shopping@@. <<if $maxNPCTransformation === 2>>\ A feeling you still knew all too well. A desire to learn about history buried under a desire to check out that @@.girlVoice;super cute jewelry store in the mall@@. <<if $playerMaturity < 16>>\ It wasn't the first time this had happened, but it was still concerning to feel it so keenly. Certainly not before the end of this party. <</if>>\ <<changeMaturity "small">>\ <</if>>\ [[Back to the party|Event Handler]]<<if $maxNPCTransformation === 1>>\ As you walked back to the bench you felt you found yourself assaulted by some random thoughts. They weren't important or relevant, just the normal chatter of a busy human mind. The only reason you even noted it was because, back when you'd been in that store, things had been so quiet. Just @@.girlVoice;mindlessly shopping@@ had been so simple and clear, it was almost a soothing experience. Still you'd rather have the noisiness. Something about that silence had been disturbing, an unnatural state, especially considering how much has been going. <<else>>\ <<if $consideredTakingHand>>\ For one brief terrible moment you'd actually considered taking his hand. You weren't about to start wandering around the mall with a stranger. The last thing you wanted was to be off somewhere wandering when Emily and the girls came back. Eventually he seemed to reset, standing up straight, shrugging and walking away without another word. <</if>>\ //Well that was strange.// You pondered on that boy's existence. You'd be rested...and refreshed...and... The clothes and accessories were tied to the game. Now that the game was over everything would reset in a few moments. True to her word your outfit poofed away a few moments later. Leaving you back in your <<print getCurrentOutfit().name>>. The wardrobe change you could take, but the loss of your @@.girlVoice;makeup kit@@ was a tragedy. Now you'd have to go all the way to a bathroom or something when you needed to check yourself in the mirror. You'd have to check mom's room later, see if there was something you could borrow for the day. Then again messing with mom's makeup might end up with you looking like a clown and that was //not// acceptable. <<if $mannequinTransformation >= 5>>\ However your body hadn't yet changed back. <<if $mannequinTransformation === 5>>You were still stuck with featureless <<if $playerMaturity >= 11>>@@.girlVoice;mannequin@@<<else>>@@.girlVoice;doll@@<</if>> feet. Even if your legs could move you daren't take a step, you doubted you could balance on these things.<<elseif $mannequinTransformation === 6>>Everything from your hips down was still featureless plastic. Even with the paralysis spell gone you couldn't move your legs. Your brain couldn't even comprehend //how// to move them. There was so little sensation that they didn't even feel like they were connected to you.<</if>> @@.emilyVoice;"I guess I should turn you back...even though you were such a pretty dolly."@@ She gave a wave of her wand, the plastic shifting and softening. The details coming back on your feet, once again the owner of a full set of ten toes. <<if $mannequinTransformation === 6>>\ Yet when you took your first step it was unusually awkward. Your legs were all flesh again, and the stiffness had subsided so it wasn't immediately clear what had happened. The next few steps were normal enough, but then you stumbled, barely keeping yourself upright. Looking back there was nothing on the floor to explain the near fall...you'd tripped over your own feet. Everything about your movements felt a little @@.girlVoice;clumsy@@. The transformation had left your coordination in shambles. Even the parts of you that hadn't changed seemed to not quite obey properly. You just had to hope things would go back to normal as the party progressed, but a feeling in the pit of your stomach said otherwise. <<addTrait "$traitClumsy" "Clumsy" "trait">>\ <<else>>\ You felt a little stiff from being held in place for so long, but otherwise no worse for wear. You breathed a sigh of relief. Clearly you'd stopped things before there had been drastic consequences. Though that was more luck than intention on your part. Who knows, if you'd kept being obstinate you might be fully plastic by now. You shivered. You doubted Emily would go //that// far, but you didn't want to test her, best to just get back to the party. <</if>>\ <<elseif $mannequinTransformation >= 1>>\ Emily also freed you from her paralysis magic, once again able to freely move your body. At first everything felt a little stiff, you'd been locked into position for so long. The stiffness abated only to be replaced by a terrible case of pins and needles. You had to awkwardly just stand there, waiting for it to pass, your face contorting whenever a slight shift caused discomfort. The girls just looked at you like you'd lost your mind. You felt like an idiot, even though you knew this was the best you could do. Finally you were able to move properly again, eager to get your legs back in gear, and get back to the party. <<changeEmbarassment "small">>\ <<else>>\ You'd just have to find another method to @@.girlVoice;keep yourself looking good@@. Until then you'd do your best and try not to let it bother you //too// much. <</if>>\ [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<silently>>\ <<set $boardGameActivityResult to 4>> <<pushJournalEntry "boardGame" "Journal Board Game">> <<set $mannequinTransformation to 0>> <</silently>>\<<playerVoice "\"Not happening. I'm out.\"">> You moved to walk away, but found your legs wouldn't obey you. No matter how hard you tried you couldn't get them to unstick from the floor. <<playerVoice "\"Emily. What did you do?\"">> @@.emilyVoice;"//Manny kin//...//manna qwin//...dress-up dolls don't move. So you have to stay."@@ One last push proved that your legs weren't going anywhere by themselves. However, the rest of your body was still free. Experimentally you grabbed one of your legs and forcibly moved it. It wouldn't be a quick solution, but you //could// leave if you still wanted to. @@.emilyVoice;"Stop moving,"@@ Emily's voice held a grave warning. [[Limp away|Board Game Decline Twice 2]] [[Stay for dressup|Board Game Decline 4b]] <<set $mannequinTransformation to 1>>\@@.emilyVoice;"I told you not to move!"@@ Emily shouted. You turned and began your slow march out of the room. Though you only managed two steps before you lost control of your arms. They were stuck in place, still wrapped around one leg. You willed them to move, but they refused to respond. It seemed whatever Emily had done to your legs she'd now duplicated on your arms. @@.emilyVoice;"Now turn back around."@@ Against your will you let go of your leg, turning on your heel, stiffly marching back to your spot beside Miki. Emily giggled, the wand still pointed at you. She gave it a small wave and you put your arms over your head. Another wave and you were up on one foot. You knew this pose, you'd seen Emily do it a hundred times, a classic @@.girlVoice;ballerina@@ position. @@.emilyVoice;"Now $theyre fully //poseybull//."@@ <<if $playerMaturity >= 11>>Poseable. Turned out she hadn't been kidding about you being a mannequin.<<elseif $playerMaturity >= 9>>Poseable. Turned out she wasn't kidding about you being a @@.girlVoice;doll@@.<<else>>You didn't know what "poseybull" meant, but you knew Emily had told the truth about you being a @@.girlVoice;doll@@.<</if>> @@.emilyVoice;"Now lets keep playing. It's your turn Kara."@@ [[Protest loudly|Board Game Decline Twice 3]] [[Stay for dressup|Board Game Decline 4b]] <<set $mannequinTransformation to 2>>\<<playerVoice "\"I'm not going to be your fucking doll!\"">> You shouted. You couldn't actually move much anymore, but that didn't stop you from speaking. Emily looked annoyed at your continued defiance. @@.emilyVoice;"You are my doll. See?"@@ Another twirl of the wand and you took another ballet pose. A plié if you recalled. @@.sophieVoice;"You should make $them dance."@@ Sophie suggested. But Emily shook her head. Making you walk had been hard enough, she could pose you, but complex movements were difficult. Though she did have other ideas. You felt your chest and neck freeze. You could still move your eyes and mouth, but that was it. You glanced between the girls, all curious about your current predicament. Though you couldn't even turn your head to see Miki's reaction. @@.emilyVoice;"Now be a good dolly~"@@ Emily had the wand pointed directly at you, daring you to continue being a pain. [[Continue to protest|Board Game Decline Twice 4]] <<contentWarning "Partial inanimate transformation.">> [[Stay for dressup|Board Game Decline 4b]] <<set $mannequinTransformation to 3>>\ <<changeHappiness "Miki" false>>\ <<changeHappiness "Emily" false>>\@@.emilyVoice;"I gave you a chance."@@ Emily sighed. You figured at this point she was probably going to just freeze your mouth so you couldn't talk, but she had other plans. Your head tilted down so you could see your bare feet. You still had no ability to control them, so you couldn't shift away from the growing discomfort. You watched helplessly as your feet changed. Everything was losing definition. Your toes grew closer and closer together until the gaps between them had almost disappeared, yet you couldn't feel them pressing against each other. <<if $playerAge >= 14>>The hair on your feet was entirely gone, they looked inhumanely smooth.<<else>>Your feet looked even smoother than before, smoother than any human foot should be.<</if>> Looking closer you could see that your nails were disappearing as well, blending into that unblemished smoothness. It didn't hurt, but it was deeply disconcerting. A feeling which didn't dissipate as your toes ceased to be toes, joining together in one single mass. Your feet were now nothing more than featureless blocks. The overall shape was the same as before, but all the details were gone. Even the color was wrong. It was vaguely skin toned, but it didn't match with the actual flesh on your legs. The transformation continued to crawl upwards, finally coming to a stop just above your now non-existent ankles. The girls looked shocked at the changes. Sophie and Kara whispering to each other as they glanced at your new "feet". Emily didn't say anything, her message had been clear enough. You should @@.girlVoice;be a good dolly@@ and stay quiet. [[Continue to protest|Board Game Decline Twice 5]] [[Agree to dressup|Board Game Decline 4b]] <<set $mannequinTransformation to 5>>\ <<changeHappiness "Miki" false>>\ <<changeHappiness "Emily" false>>\Emily didn't even blink at your continued shouting, merely giving another twist of the wand. The, what you guessed was plastic, continued to crawl up your leg. Each transformed inch gave a strange stiff sensation for only a moment before all sensation dulled down to almost nothing. You couldn't feel your feet at all, you couldn't even tell if they were still on the floor. As if in answer you found yourself tipped slightly forward onto the balls of your "feet". It looked like you were standing on tiptoes...if you'd still had toes. You couldn't see that you were actually supported by two small plastic poles running from your feet to the floor. Keeping you steady in place while giving the illusion you were @@.girlVoice;wearing heels@@. The transformation continued up past your knees. Once it passed there was still a bend in that spot, but no actual articulation. Merely plastic shaped to preserve the humanoid appearance of your legs. It continued past your thighs, starting to crawl onto your hips. Your body shifting position as you lost the ability to take the weight of your torso. From legs to hips you were perfectly straight, your torso leaned back slightly due to lack of support. Emily idly waved the wand in your direction, though no more changes happened...yet. This was your final warning. [[Continue to protest|Board Game Decline Twice 6]] <<contentWarning "Full inanimate transformation.">> [[Agree to dressup|Board Game Decline 4b]] <<set $mannequinTransformation to 6>>\This time she did freeze your mouth. @@.emilyVoice;"Dollies don't talk."@@ @@.karaVoice;"Emily, maybe that's enough...I think $they gets the point."@@ @@.emilyVoice;"Oh don't be such a worrier. I'll turn them back after the game."@@ Emily smiled, @@.emilyVoice;"until then we can play //all// the dressup we want."@@ She pointed the wand at you, a surge of power from it kicked the plastic back into action. It washed over your hips and groin. You couldn't properly see but <<if $playerAge <= 10>>you weren't a girl anymore, though you weren't a boy either.<<else>>you weren't a boy anymore, though you weren't a girl either.<</if>> There was nothing down there, but more smooth undefined plastic. <<if $traitCatgirl>>You felt your tail freeze. It too falling victim to the changes, locked into a cutely curled position outside of your vision.<</if>> <<if $playerAge >= 15>>As it passed over your hips it left them a little curvier than before. So not an actual woman, but you were being given the shape of one.<</if>> As it flowed over your stomach new sensations began to spring up, starting from your feet. It was subtle...or perhaps it was obvious but your dulled sense of touch couldn't discern. But as the feeling washed over your feet and began it's way up your legs you felt...lighter, less substantial...hollow. You didn't have much time to think on it as more sensations flowed from your core. [[The changes continued|Board Game Decline Twice 7]] <<set $mannequinTransformation to 7>>\There must have been something else in Emily's magic that was keeping your panic in check. You were turning into a plastic store <<if $playerMaturity >= 9>>mannequin<<else>>doll<</if>>, but it wasn't bothering you. You felt sedated, rationally you knew this should be <<if $playerMaturity >= 10>>terrifying<<else>>scary<</if>>, but you couldn't work up the emotions. The hollow feeling had almost caught up to the plastic. As the smoothness rolled over your stomach it gurgled once, stopped and then felt empty. It wasn't hunger, it was just...empty. <<if $traitFat || $traitChubby>>It seemed the magic had an intention of making you a "perfect" doll, as it smoothed out any extra pudge. Leaving your stomach perfectly flat.<<else>>It'd left your stomach @@.girlVoice;perfectly@@ flat.<</if>> You didn't even have an indentation where a belly button should be. It continued it's way up your chest and you thought your breath would hitch as it passed but it didn't, you weren't breathing in the first place. How long had it been since your last breath? You couldn't say, but it wasn't something you needed to do anymore. Likewise the spot where your heart had been went silent, with no blood to pump it served no purpose. @@.sophieVoice;"Emily...I think Kara's right, this is a bit much."@@ Sophie's voice contained more than a hint of concern. But it couldn't be stopped now, the magic had to run its course. [[The changes continued|Board Game Decline Twice 8]] <<set $mannequinTransformation to 8>>\Finished with your chest it flowed in three directions. Up your neck and down each of your arms. As it flowed down your arms they involuntarily straightened, held just away from your body. Your wrists bent slightly back, locking into place as your hands changed. Your hands maintained at least some of their former shape; you could still identify each finger and thumb. Though there were no fingerprints and the "nails" were just slight protrusions of the same plastic. There was a slight crack where each shoulder met your torso. A spot that, in comparison to the rest of you, felt a little loose. A facsimile of a ball joint remained, allowing for multiple arm positions. Your mouth had already been frozen so you hadn't been able to speak for a while, but as your neck transformed, your vocal chords vanished. Without the air from your former lungs they wouldn't have worked anyway. It moved up the back of your head, gently creeping around from all directions towards your face, but it paused there for a moment, as if unsure what came next. You shared that uncertainty, what would your face even look like? [[An entirely smooth blank|Board Game Decline Twice 9][$mannequinFace to 1]] [[Colorless plastic shaped like a face|Board Game Decline Twice 9][$mannequinFace to 2]] [[A detailed replica of your own face|Board Game Decline Twice 9][$mannequinFace to 3]] <<set $mannequinTransformation to 9>>\The uncertainty gone the plastic moved to complete your transformation. <<if $hairLength === "short">>Your hair grew out until it was just past your shoulders<<else>>Your hair looked mostly like it had<</if>>, though it was no longer actually attached to your scalp, merely placed there. <<if $mannequinFace === 1>>\ As the plastic moved to meet in the centre of your face it wiped away all distinguishing features. Leaving behind nothing but a smooth expressionless surface. It was clean enough it almost shined. <<elseif $mannequinFace === 2>>\ As the plastic moved to meet in the centre of your face it softened all of your features and simplified them. The shape of a nose, with no nostrils. The shape of lips, but no teeth behind them. The hollows of the eyes, but no actual eyes. Just enough to make your face look approachable without being too realistic. <<else>>\ As the plastic moved to meet in the centre of your face it did little to change it's appearance. Though your eyes were merely painted on, and there were no teeth behind your lips, you looked remarkably normal at a casual glance. <</if>>\ @@.sophieVoice;"Okay yeah no, this is way too creepy."@@ Sophie said. Kara nodded in agreement. @@.mikiVoice;"Creepy!"@@ Miki agreed. Despite your condition you could still hear what was going on, and even see things in the direction your head was pointed. This all seemed totally normal to you, as if things had always been this way. The situation raised no strong emotions within you, or any emotions at all. With your head as hollow as the rest of you it was only the magic that was allowing you any semblance of conciousness. Though it was a grossly simplified version. You could perceive things, but you couldn't really "think". You didn't have the brainpower for things like that. So you just dispassionately observed the goings on. @@.emilyVoice;"Okay okay...I'll turn him back."@@ Emily pouted, though she was secretly glad. This had gone //way// further than she'd intended. She'd let her temper get the best of her. [[Emily waved her wand|Board Game Decline Twice 10]] <<set $mannequinTransformation to 10>>\The girls waited as nothing happened. Another wave...to more continued nothing. @@.emilyVoice;"Crap,"@@ Emily uncharacteristically cursed. @@.karaVoice;"You can't turn $them back, can you?"@@ Kara surmised immediately. @@.emilyVoice;"How did you...no...I can't. Mommy will be able to do it, but I can't get it to work...it's harder to turn things //back//."@@ @@.sophieVoice;"So what are we going to do about...it?"@@ Sophie jerked a thumb in your direction. @@.karaVoice;"Is $they still concious?"@@ Kara desperately wanted the answer to be no. The idea of being trapped like that terrified her. @@.emilyVoice;"No...$they might still be able to see and hear, but there's no brain in there."@@ @@.karaVoice;"Is that going to be okay? I mean what happens when they turn back?"@@ @@.emilyVoice;"Everything will be fine, mommy will fix everything."@@ Emily's voice was confident, though the others still weren't fully convinced. @@.sophieVoice;"Well I'm going to put it over there...it creeps me out."@@ Sophie picked you up, @@.sophieVoice;"wow...it's so light. I think it's hollow..."@@ Not wanting to consider the matter further Sophie shoved you into a corner of the kitchen where no one had to see. There was nothing any of them could do after all, your presence would just cause even more stress. So out of sight and out of mind for the rest of the party. So you stood, motionless, staring into a corner, waiting until the moment your mother arrived. You thought little of this. The only vague thought that did cross you mind was a moderate disappointment. You'd managed to avoid dress up, like you'd wanted. But now, in this form, tailor made for it, it was a real shame you hadn't gotten to try on more clothes. Well... maybe next time you'll play along. [[Sit down|Braiding Hair Accept]] [[Walk away|Braiding Hair Reject]] <<addToActivityCount>>\<<if $hairActivityResult == 1>>\ <<if $playerMaturity < 10>>@@.girlVoice;Eagerly@@<<else>>Reluctantly<</if>> you sat down in front of Sophie. This time it felt like you'd been there for <<if $traitEnergetic or $playerMaturity <= 8>>@@.girlVoice;forever@@<<else>>at least five<</if>>, and she wasn't done. [[Chase her down|Agree to Climb][$startedTreeClimbLate to true]] <<changeEmbarassment "small">>You took off at a run, if you were going to catch her you couldn't waste any time. Even with your speed Sophie was already in the tree by the time you'd gotten there. There was a growing sense of unease with every step you took towards the tree. You dismissed it as nervousness about the race, you must just be eager. <<if $playerAge <= 10>>\ <<include "Agree to Climb Too Young">> <<else>>\ Getting up the first branch actually wasn't too bad, and once you were there the next couple were easily in reach. You were not okay. @@.girlThought;I wanna come down.@@ Rationally you knew you were only ten to fifteen feet off the ground, but right now it felt like you were clinging to the side of a skyscraper. The girls came to the bottom of the tree, peering up at you as you clung to the trunk like your life depended on it. They whispered among each other. Emily was chosen as the speaker, @@.emilyVoice;"<<playerName>>. I think you should come down."@@ [[Climb back down|Climb Tree Afraid of Heights 2]] <</if>>Now that was something you could agree to. Yeah. You could be brave and climb down. You just had to let go of this trunk. <</if>>\ Sophie was actually only a few feet above you, watching the whole situation unfold. There wasn't much she could do to help you, but even she knew better than to tease you right now. [[Climb back down|Climb Tree Afraid of Heights 3]]Very cautiously and very slowly you let go of the trunk and started making your way down the tree. Feeling for each new branch with your foot so that you didn't have to look down. It made the entire process painfully slow. At one point you nearly gave up, but the girls managed to convince you to keep going. Finally jumping the last couple feet and landing on blessed ground. The girls crowded around you. @@.mikiVoice;"You okay?"@@ @@.karaVoice;"You're not hurt are you?"@@ You weren't okay, you were still @@.girlVoice;shaking@@ from the experience<<if $playerMaturity <= 12 || $traitCrybaby>> and tears pooled in the corners of your eyes<</if>>. However, you hadn't gotten hurt. It had been a @@.girlVoice;harrowing@@ experience, but no permanent damage. Which meant Emily was able to scold you with no hesitation, @@.emilyVoice;"you have to be more careful. You could've gotten hurt."@@ On the one hand it sucked to get scolded and it made you feel so @@.girlVoice;childish@@, but on the other hand Emily's concern was comforting. Her being all authoritative as the @@.girlVoice;big sister@@ and you as<<if $playerMaturity <= 8>> the @@.girlVoice;little sister.<<else>>-no. You cut off that line of thinking. You were the elder sibling, not her.<</if>> Emily's lecture continued, with Kara trying to soften the rhetoric and Miki doing her best to cheer everyone up. You had to be more aware of your limits, someone who is so @@.girlVoice;afraid of heights@@ shouldn't be climbing trees. Sophie landed beside you with a thud, appraising your status, seeing that you were unharmed.\ <<if $sophieHappiness >= 7>>\ <<if $playerMaturity <= 10>>\ @@.sophieVoice;"Glad you got down okay kid,"@@ she tousled your hair, @@.sophieVoice;"leave the tree climbing to me next time eh?". <<else>>\ @@.sophieVoice;"Glad you're safe, but I don't think you should be climbing any more trees."@@ <</if>>\ <<else>>\ @@.sophieVoice;"What happened? [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<changeMaturity "small">>\ <<set $climbTreeResult to 4>>\ <<pushJournalEntry "climbATree" "Journal Climb Tree">>\You took off at a run, though slowed down as you approached the tree. Even with your speed Sophie was already in the tree by the time you'd gotten there. As you put your hand on the trunk you almost felt slightly ill at the thought of climbing this. <<if $traitDainty>>@@.girlThought;I don't want to break a nail.@@<<elseif $traitFashionista>>@@.girlThought;I might rip my clothes.@@<<elseif $traitNeat>>@@.girlThought;I don't want to get dirty.@@<<elseif $traitVain>><<if $hairstyle !== 0>>@@.girlThought;I don't want to mess up my hair.@@<<else>>@@.girlThought;I don't want to mess up my clothes.@@<</if>><</if>> You decided better of it.
