[[Watch Sophie|Climb Tree Vain 2]]Sophie was almost half way up the tree when she took a back to check on you. She'd seen you following at first, but now you were just hovering at the bottom of the tree. @@.sophieVoice;"Aren't you coming?"@@ You shook your head, you weren't interested in this little competition anymore, too many drawbacks. @@.sophieVoice;"Awwww, little girl scared she's gonna break a nail?"@@ You bristled at the accusation, <<if $traitDainty>>@@.girlVoice;even though it was true@@.<<elseif $traitFashionista>>though it @@.girlVoice;wasn't that far off@@.<<elseif $traitNeat>>just because you @@.girlVoice;didn't want to get dirty@@ didn't mean you were scared.<</if>> She didn't wait for a retort, not that you had one, and continued to climb the tree. She was shockingly fast and calm, even as she reached the peak she didn't seem bothered. She look down at you and stuck her tongue out. Her point made she began working her way back down. Simply leaping from the tree once she felt she'd gotten low enough. You held your breath as she jumped, sure she was going to get hurt. But she landed beside you with a cocky grin, @@.sophieVoice;"You worry too much, not everyone is a delicate little girl like you. Now come on, there are more games to beat you at."@@ [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<changeEmbarassment "small">>\ <<changeHappiness "Sophie" false>>\ <<set $climbTreeResult to 1>> <<pushJournalEntry "climbATree" "Journal Climb Tree">>You looked up, Sophie was almost at the top of the tree now. She stared down at you from on high. @@.sophieVoice;"Don't be scared,"@@ she yelled and you suddenly got extremely @@.girlVoice;nervous@@. She shouldn't be up that high, it was dangerous, what if she fell? This nervousness only grew as she climbed the last few branches. Emily had been right it'd be @@.girlVoice;way too scary@@ to climb that tree. You wanted to shout at her to come down, but you were worried it would break her concentration. Sophie reached the peak. She looked down at you and grinned. It was something you were positive would have @@.girlVoice;terrified@@ you. Climbing that high would have been @@.girlVoice;really scary@@ for you. @@.girlThought;Sophie is so amazing. She's up so high and looks so calm.@@ Her feat drew a small round of applause from the group, though both Kara and Miki had looked a little nervous. Once she'd come back down you were all ready to move on. <<addTrait "$traitAfraidOfHeights" "Heights" "fear">>\ <<set $climbTreeResult to 5>>\<<if $traitSkinnedKnee>>\ Sophie had reached the tree, quickly looking back to check on you, only to find out you hadn't moved at all. You pointed at your bandaged knee as an explanation. @@.sophieVoice;"Fine,"@@ she shouted back, @@.sophieVoice;"be a wimp about it."@@ But her voice lacked any real fire to it. Even she could admit that perhaps climbing a tree while injured would be a bit dangerous. None of the girls, including her, wanted a repeat of what had happened to you. But she was still determined to have some of her own fun. Climbing up and up while the rest of you took a little break before the next event. She called down to you all once you'd reached the top of the tree. Her feat drew a small round of applause from the group, though both Kara and Emily had looked a little nervous. Once she'd come back down you were all ready to move on. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<else>>\ Sophie had reached the tree, quickly looking back to check on you, only to find out you hadn't moved at all. @@.sophieVoice;"Aren't you coming?"@@ You shook your head, you weren't interested in this little competition. @@.sophieVoice;"Fine, be a baby about it,"@@ she called out as she began to climb. She was moving up it shockingly fast, and it was easy enough for her that she was able to tease you as she went. @@.sophieVoice;"I didn't know you were afraid of heights,"@@ she swung up another branch, @@.sophieVoice;"or maybe you were just afraid I was gonna beat you."@@ As she continued climbing you'd moved a little closer to the tree. You wanted to keep an eye on her progress, though it also meant you could hear her taunts even more clearly. You looked up, Sophie was almost at the top of the tree now. Staring down at you from on high. @@.sophieVoice;"Awwww, are you scared I'm so high?"@@ You suddenly got extremely nervous. She shouldn't be up that high, it was dangerous, what if she fell? [[Watch her climb|Refuse to Climb 2]] <</if>>\ <<set $climbTreeResult to 1>>\ <<pushJournalEntry "climbATree" "Journal Climb Tree">>This nervousness only grew as she climbed the last few branches. You wanted to shout at her to come down, but you were worried it would break her concentration. It was amazing that she looked so calm, even as she reached the peak. She looked down at you and grinned. It was something that you were positive would have terrified you. She was //that// high and didn't have a worry about looking down? You'd never really liked heights that much, but right now you hated the mere idea of it. Being up //that// high made you @@.girlVoice;shiver@@ instinctively. Even if you'd somehow gotten up that high, getting back down would be almost as bad. No, you were very glad to have stayed here on the ground. It seemed much safer. She stuck her tongue out at you before working her way back down. You held your breath with every move she made. Imagining your own @@.girlVoice;terror@@ if you'd been in the situation. Once she got low enough she just leapt from the tree. You let out an involuntary @@.girlVoice;squeal@@ as she jumped, sure that she was going to get hurt. But she landed safely beside you. Noticing your worried face and throwing you a cocky grin, @@.sophieVoice;"You worry too much. Remember, not everyone is a scaredy cat like you. Now come on, there are more games to beat you at."@@ The insult irritated you, but what could you even counter with? You'd stayed down on the ground for no apparent reason, while she'd bravely climbed the whole thing. She was right, you were a bit of a @@.girlVoice;scaredy cat@@ when it came to heights. Still, you'd much rather stay down here and get insulted than actually have to go up. Truthfully you were glad this whole ordeal was over and you didn't even have to think about the @@.girlVoice;too tall@@ tree. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<addTrait "$traitAfraidOfHeights" "Heights" "fear">>\ <<changeEmbarassment "small">>\ <<changeHappiness "Sophie" false>>\<<if $playerAge <= (8 + $traitChubby + $traitFat)>>\ You jumped towards the lowest branch only to fall short and only have your fingers brush the bark. The next few attempts were the same, you could touch the branch, but you couldn't get a grip on it. You simply couldn't jump high enough to grab it<<if $traitChubby || $traitFat>>, all your extra belly fat wasn't helping. Not to mention how uncomfortable it was every time you landed, and it all jiggled around.<</if>>. The trunk was too big to be able to wrap your arms around and shimmy up. You were stuck on the ground. <<set $grabbedTree to false>>\ <<elseif $playerAge <= (10 + $traitChubby + $traitFat)>>\ You jumped towards the lowest branch and managed to get your arms around it. Now you just had to pull yourself up and you could start your climb in earnest. You pulled, but couldn't quite get yourself all the way. You swung your legs to try and get them wrapped around, but fell short of the mark. You kicked your @@.girlVoice;little feet@@ to try and get a little bit more momentum, but you were still stuck. <<if $traitFat || $traitChubby>>If you didn't weigh so much you might have had a chance. But your extra fat was weighing you down and it was tiring just to hang here.<</if>> <<set $grabbedTree to true>>\ <</if>>\ @@.sophieVoice;"Having trouble short-stuff?"@@ Sophie peered down at you, squatting cautiously on a branch above you. You gave her an angry look but she was right, you weren't going to be able to even get *up* on the tree, let alone climb it. <<if $sophieHappiness >= 7>>\ <<if $grabbedTree>>\ Sophie hopped off of the tree and stood just under you. You suddenly felt your weight being shifted upwards. <<else>>\ Sophie hopped off of the tree and stood behind. She put her arms around your waist, @@.sophieVoice;"jump."@@ You did, and with her help you were able to get your arms around the tree. Sophie shifted and you suddenly felt your weight being shifted upwards. <</if>>\ @@.sophieVoice;"Now pull. Come on you can do it,"@@ she gave a small grunt of exertion as she did her best to boost you into the tree. <<if $playerAge >= 10>>It was clearly a struggle for her, considering how much you weighed, but she was still trying.<</if>> It was a little awkward having someone below you pushing on your ass, but it did make it a lot easier. Finally you worked your way onto the bottom branch, sweating from the exertion. @@.sophieVoice;"There you go. But don't go climbing any more than that."@@ Sophie's tone was firm. But you hadn't intended on going any further anyway, if you couldn't get up one branch yourself then climbing the rest was simply too risky. You stood up on the branch, using the trunk for support. It felt ''way'' higher now that you were up here. Maybe it was just because you were a lot shorter than before but the ground seemed ''crazy'' far away. After steadying yourself you decided it was time to come down. Sophie had jumped from even higher just a few moments ago, but you weren't confident enough for that. Instead awkwardly lowering yourself off of the bottom branch, Sophie caught you as you did the last drop. @@.emilyVoice;"If you two are done playing around let's do the next event."@@ Emily called over as you settled yourself back on the ground. @@.sophieVoice;"Come on. You'd never done it before, but apparently it was a pretty popular activity these days. Not just at the sleepovers of little girls, but among some adults as well. [[Decorate cupcakes|Cupcake Decorating 2 Join In][$sitOutCupcake to false]] [[Just watch|Cupcake Decorating 2 Sit Out][$sitOutCupcake to true]] <<silently>>\ <<set $cupcakeDecoratingActivityResult to 1>> <<addToActivityCount>> <<set $cupcakeTryAndStopTheFight to false>> <<set $cupcakeStayOutInitially to false>> <<set $cupcakeJoinIn to false>> <<set $cupcakeStayOutAgain to false>> <<set $cupcakeCounterattack to false>> <<set $cupcakeRefuseToTaste to false>> <<set $cupcakeEatMore to false>> <<set $cupcakeActivityCount to $activityCount>> <</silently>>\You watched as the girls settled in. They each had a half dozen cupcakes to work with, piping kits, sprinkles, the whole nine yards. Everything they needed to make the fanciest overdone cupcakes in the world. As they started you considered their varying approaches to the activity. Kara was focusing intently on drawing a star with a narrow tipped piping bag. She had already finishing one cupcake and you were shocked at the neatness of it. Considering the medium was icing you'd expected a mess, but Kara was fastidious and it reflected in the precision of her cupcake. Even her hands were nearly spotless. Emily was taking a more artistic approach. Her cupcakes weren't as neat, but they were very <<if $playerMaturity <= 11>>@@.girlVoice;pretty@@<<else>>girly<</if>>, all covered in rainbow sparkles and bright icing. If Sophie's cupcakes had any sort of theme it was impossible to know. She was less artistic than the other two, and lacked the patience to carefully complete her work. It seemed now that speed was her goal, to get through her cupcakes as quickly as possible, make up for quality with quantity. Miki was having a similar problem, but had come to a different solution. She was slathering as much icing as humanly possible on each one of her cupcakes. It wasn't neat or pretty, but it was ''a lot''. Her hands were already covered in as much icing as the cakes. However her enthusiasm did come with a drawback. She'd been having trouble keeping proper pressure on the piping bag. [[Miki lost control|Cupcake Decorating 3][$playerLostControlIcing to false]]You nodded and sat down at the table with the rest of them. You each had a half dozen cupcakes to work with, piping kits, sprinkles, the whole nine yards. Everything you needed to make the fanciest overdone cupcakes in the world. The other girls had already gotten started, each in their own unique ways. Kara was focusing intently on drawing a star with a narrow tipped piping bag. She had already finished one cupcake and you were shocked at the neatness of it. Considering the medium was icing you'd expected a mess, but Kara was fastidious and it reflected in the precision of her cupcake. Even her hands were nearly spotless. <<if $traitNeat>>You understood her intentions. Why would you ever //want// to make a mess? You'd even been careful about selecting which colors to use, you had a half dozen cupcakes so you'd be able to try a few different techniques. The first one would probably be rough, but that wasn't too much of a worry, that could be your test cupcake and then you'd get serious from there. You heard some giggling from the other girls but ignored it, you were trying to focus. //Almost done.// You stuck out your tongue as you put on the finishing touches, you were so happy about how it had come out. If the first one was that good then the rest. ''SPLAT'' Much to your surprise, a blob of green icing had crashed into your cupcake, splattering icing onto your cheeks. Apparently you'd been @@.girlVoice;too focused to pay attention@@ on what was going on around you. An impressive feat considering half the table was already covered in icing and it was rapidly getting worse. You had only a few moments to intervene if you wanted to stop this mess. Keeping your head down you focused on the cupcake before you, trying to make a proper swi- ''SPLAT'' A glob of pink icing thrown by one of the girls slammed into your cupcake, destroying any possibility of a proper swirl. You glared in the general direction of the throw, though they were all too engaged in the fight to notice. More icing was flying this way and that, some splattering onto you and more onto your formerly uniced cupcakes. They didn't seem to be stopping any time soon. Properly decorating your own cupcake would be near impossible under the conditions. But perhaps if you truly focused you could manage it. [[Keep trying|Cupcake Decorating Stay Out Of It 2][$cupcakeStayOutAgain to true]] [[Fight back|Cupcake Decorating Join The Fight][$cupcakeCounterattack to true]]''SPLAT'' Another cupcake ruined... ''SPLAT'' And another... It was becoming clear that no amount of focus was going to let you get this cupcake finished. Even the ones you hadn't touched were half iced from the ongoing battle. At this point the only reason to keep trying was to make a point, to very specifically show that you weren't going to get involved in some childish food fight, no matter @@.girlVoice;how much fun@@ it would be. <<if $playerMaturity <= 10>>[[Keep trying|Cupcake Decorating Forced Join The Fight][$cupcakeCounterattack to true]]<<else>>[[Keep trying|Cupcake Decorating Stay Out Of It 3][$cupcakeStayOutAgainAgain to true]]<</if>> [[Fight back|Cupcake Decorating Join The Fight][$cupcakeCounterattack to true]]Stubbornly you continued to refuse to enter the fight, though you weren't really decorating cupcakes either. There was no point in even trying. Instead you were just sitting there grumbling, getting increasingly annoyed as the moments passed and the icing continued to pile up. By the time the girls finally stopped the fight your frustration was clear to anyone with eyes. Arms folded across your chest, glaring straight forward, ignoring everything else around you. <<if $traitCrybaby>>It was a little hard to see past the icing, but you'd even @@.girlVoice;started crying@@.<</if>> You hardly noticed as the girls transitioned from fight to post-battle cleanup. @@.mikiVoice;"<<playerName>>?"@@ Miki's voice broke you from your reverie, you looked up to see her offering you an absurdly iced cupcake. @@.mikiVoice;"Here, its my best cupcake, it'll make you feel all better."@@ You glanced around, seeing the other girls glancing over to the scene as they cleaned up. Emily was paying particular attention, which made you suspicious of the whole thing. <<if $mikiHappiness >= 5>>But Miki was usually quite nice to you, you doubted she was anything but genuine.<</if>> [[Refuse the cupcake|Cupcake Decorating Stay Out Of It 4][$cupcakeRefuseToTaste to true]] [[Take the cupcake|Cupcake Decorating Tasting][$cupcakeRefuseToTaste to false]]You didn't want to have anything else to do with this whole cupcake debacle, and you certainly didn't want to take a suspiciously offered cupcake. Not at a party where magic was flying around at the whims of an eight year old girl. You had no idea what the pastry might do, but you didn't want to find out. <<if $traitSweetTooth>>\ <<playerVoice "\"I-\"">> you tried to decline, but found yourself struggling to get the words out. That cupcake just looked @@.girlVoice;so delicious@@. It would be @@.girlVoice;sweet@@ and @@.girlVoice;creamy@@ and you desperately wanted it. You just didn't want to say it. However, your poker face was even worse than you'd thought. Your eyes were wide, locked unflinchingly on the cupcake. You'd even opened your mouth a bit, at this rate you might start to drool. Miki giggled and pushed the cupcake closer to you. This alone was enough to crack your shallow facade. @@.girlVoice;Unable to help yourself@@ you took the offered cupcake. Staring at it as if it was the @@.girlVoice;best thing you'd ever seen@@. Waiting even a moment more would be torture. You leaned in for a big bite. <<else>>\ <<playerVoice "\"I'm not hungry.\"">> You growled. Your stomach growled in reply prompting a giggle from Miki. @@.mikiVoice;"Your tummy says you are."@@ She renewed her offer of the cupcake, your stomach growling even louder at the sight of the @@.girlVoice;delicious@@ looking cupcake. You'd unwillingly tasted plenty of icing during the fight, but now you somehow wanted more. This might be a bad idea but you couldn't help yourself, you reached out to take the cupcake, leaning in for a big bite. <</if>>\ [[Eat the cupcake|Cupcake Decorating Tasting]]<<if $traitSoftspoken>>\ <span class="smallText"><<playerVoice "\"That's enough girls. You glared at her as you felt the icing slide down your cheek. However, Sophie's attack had triggered something in the other girls. By silent agreement they'd come to an inescapable conclusion. If you weren't going to fight back... Icing began to hit you from all sides. <<if $traitFashionista>>\ <<playerVoice "\"Stop! Stop! Stop!\"">> <</if>>\ But your words fell on deaf ears as icing began to block your own ears. You felt dumb for not seeing this coming, and there was no telling when the attack would stop. [[Counterattack|Cupcake Decorating Join The Fight][$cupcakeCounterattack to true]] [[Weather the storm|Cupcake Decorating Tank It][$cupcakeStopTheFightStayOutAgain to true]] <<changeEmbarassment "small">>\You didn't really want to get involved in this situation. Even if you tried to break it up most of the damage had already been done. Walking over there was just guaranteeing that you'd get covered in icing as well. <<if $traitFashionista || $traitNeat>>You did ''not'' want to get your clothes covered in icing.<</if>> So you just observed as the fight escalated into full fledged icing war, cupcakes mostly forgotten as the girls focused on icing each other. Streams shot from piping bags, handfuls thrown, Emily had actually just thrown a whole cupcake at Sophie, all of them giggling the entire time. <<if $traitGiggly>>You couldn't help but @@.girlVoice;giggle@@ at Sophie's annoyed face as the cupcake slid down it.<</if>> The battle didn't go on terribly long, at some point they were all so covered that any further attacks wouldn't do much. However, through the mounds of icing, you could see that they were all smiling. You were jealous. It wasn't that you wanted to be covered in icing, but it did look like they were @@.girlVoice;having fun@@. You were just sitting there being @@.girlVoice;terminally bored@@. By the time they finished cleaning up you found yourself outright despondent. It was silly to feel left out of a messy food fight but you'd been sitting there stewing while they'd all had their fun. @@.emilyVoice;"Okay!"@@ Emily clapped and drew the girls attention, @@.emilyVoice;"time for the tasting."@@ Each of the girl's did their best to find an undamaged cupcake among the destruction. Finally coming to you with a shocking array of choices. @@.mikiVoice;"You hafta try one from each of us."@@ Miki offered you one of her overly iced cupcakes. [[Try the cupcake|Cupcake Decorating Tasting]]You tried to be mature and stay out of the fight, you really did. But it was @@.girlVoice;so annoying@@ getting hit with all that icing, and all the other girls looked like they were having @@.girlVoice;so much fun@@. It was impossible to just sit there quietly. Why should you sit there bored and annoyed when you could @@.girlVoice;play with everyone@@? Now you just wanted to wait for the right moment. If they thought you weren't fighting then it set you up better for a sneak attack. <<include "Cupcake Decorating Fight Fragment">><<if $cupcakeCounterattack>>\ You gripped your piping bag as another globule of icing flew right into you. You'd had more than enough of this. You weren't about to just sit there and get slathered in icing. Not going to helplessly sit there bearing the brunt of their assault. <<if $playerMaturity <= 10>>Plus you really @@.girlVoice;wanted to play too@@.<<else>>You rationalized to yourself, it wasn't that you @@.girlVoice;wanted to play with them@@, this was self defence.<</if>> <<else>>\ You gripped your piping bag as another globule of icing flew past your eye. 'He who hesitates is lost'. If you waited any longer you were going to get covered in icing one way or another. Better to find a way to defend yourself than to just be a victim. <<if $playerMaturity <= 10>>Plus you really @@.girlVoice;wanted to play too@@.<<else>>You rationalized to yourself, it wasn't that you @@.girlVoice;wanted to play with them@@, this was self defence.<</if>> <</if>>\ <<include "Cupcake Decorating Fight Fragment">>The opportunity presented itself. Emily was half turned trying to hurl a handful of icing at Kara, she was completely unaware of your backstab until the last moment. She turned, only to take a pile of blue icing straight to the mouth. @@.emilyVoice;"Mmph! Blech,"@@ Emily sputtered as she tried to clear the icing away. It wasn't that the icing tasted bad, it was actually delicious, but it was extremely sweet and unexpectedly having that high a dose all at once could be overwhelming. But she wasn't mad, far from it, she looked thrilled that you'd decided to join in. A look that was only marred by a sudden orange lump hitting her and a corresponding giggle from Miki. With the battle joined in earnest you took your place among the melee. <<if $playerMaturity >= 12>>At first you'd tried to be precise and technical. Staying in one spot, dodging what you could and using a piping bag to counter attack. This didn't last long.<<else>>After your first attack with a piping bag you realized how @@.girlVoice;slow@@ and @@.girlVoice;boring@@ it was to use. It was @@.girlVoice;way more fun just to throw it at people@@.<</if>> Quickly enough the five of you running around the kitchen hurling icing at one another. More than half of the attacks landing on the floor, or the table, or the walls, leaving the kitchen a technicolor nightmare of icing. [[The battle continued|Cupcake Decorating Join The Fight 2]] <<changeHappiness "Emily" true>>\As the battle wore on it was clear that your adversaries were wearing down. The piping bags had long since been emptied and no one had the time to refill them. So attacks had devolved to either throwing icing or trying to smear it on directly. You had been both the aggressor and the victim in regards to both techniques and the five of you were simply covered in icing. The sounds of @@.girlVoice;squeals@@ and @@.girlVoice;giggles@@ ringing out with each attack. Your own <<if $traitGiggly || $playerAge <= 12>>@@.girlVoice;shrill@@ <</if>>voice joining in with the chorus. At first you'd been somewhat reserved in your behaviour. Worried about running around too much, or making too much mess, but that concern had fled from your head. Now you were running around with the same reckless abandonment as the rest. If your mother saw your behaviour right now she'd probably be furious; no one watching this scene could in good conscience call you the 'babysitter', when you were as much trouble as the rest. <<if $traitImaginaryFriend >= 2>>\ $imaginaryFriendName was running around with the rest of you. Her own piping bag in her hand, though none of the girls noticed when she hit them. You couldn't help but fire at least a few shots her way. She made the funniest squeal when you hit her. <<playerVoice "\"Gotcha!\"">> You shouted, much to the confusion of the other girls since, to them, you'd just attacked empty air. <</if>>\ <<if $traitClumsy>>\ Unfortunately the mess also made your footing a little precarious. Chasing Miki around suddenly got dangerous when you slipped on an errant glob on the floor. <<if $playerAge <= 10>>\ You bumped into something, but managed to keep yourself upright. @@.emilyVoice;"Gotcha,"@@ Emily said from right behind you. That 'something' had been Emily, and she was the only reason you weren't currently on your ass. <<playerVoice "\"Thanks sis,\"">> you quickly mumbled out. She had saved you from a nasty spill. @@.emilyVoice;"You're welcome sis,"@@ she cheerfully responded. It seemed that she had enjoyed her little rescue, having her @@.girlVoice;new sister@@ relying on her. Not that it stopped her from then dumping a handful of icing onto your nose. <<else>>\ Your vision tilted as you found yourself pitched back onto the floor. Your tailbone hitting the floor with an uncomfortable ''thud''. <<playerVoice "\"owwww,\"">> you moaned. It hadn't really hurt that much, but you did feel like a dumbass for falling this way. Emily peered down at you, verifying that you hadn't injured yourself too badly. Once she'd confirmed that she dumped a handful of icing onto your head. <<if $traitCrybaby>>\ <<playerVoice ""\Emily!\"">> You @@.girlVoice;whined@@, already @@.girlVoice;sniffling@@. Why was she @@.girlVoice;so mean@@, you'd already fallen and then she did that? <<else>>\ <<playerVoice "\"Emily!\"">> You wiped the icing from your eyes. <</if>>\ <<changeEmbarassment "small">>\ <</if>>\ Emily giggled and ran before you could counter attack. You prepared to chase after her, rejoining the fight. <</if>>\ Though eventually all good things must come to an end. As icing reserves began to run low and non-iced space on you and the girls dropped, it was time to move on. @@.emilyVoice;"Okay okay. Truce! A few more errant strikes occurred, but on the whole everyone was about ready to stop...which just left the task of cleaning up the massive mess that you'd all left. [[Get clean|Cupcake Decorating Clean Up]] <<if $playerMaturity >= 8>>\ <<changeMaturity "small">>\ <</if>>\You focused, trying to calm your mind even as icing continued to shower down on you. There was already a mass of icing on you, some more wasn't going to make a difference. Getting involved would be immature, you were supposed to be the babysitter. A food fight wasn't appropriate behaviour for someone in charge. <<if !$sitOutCupcake>>You made a vain attempt to decorate one of your own cupcakes, but the shower of icing ruined any hope of that.<</if>> @@.emilyVoice;"Okay enough enough,"@@ Emily breathed out through manic giggles. A few more globs hit you before finally coming to a stop. At this point you couldn't even see what was going on, <<if $traitFourEyes>>your glasses were completely covered.<<else>>the icing was even covering your eyes.<</if>> So all you could perceive was the chorus of giggles. <<if $traitFourEyes>>\ You felt someone take your glasses away. Unsurprisingly you were absolutely covered in icing. You could feel the weight of what remained on your face and see it piled on everywhere else. The girls looked deeply pleased with themselves, but none more than Miki, @@.mikiVoice;"Ta dah!"@@ She gestured to you, @@.mikiVoice;"my mister piece cupcake."@@ The girls responded with raucous laughter. So pervasive was the icing that you needed some support to get rid of it all. @@.karaVoice;"Close your eyes,"@@ Kara ordered. You obeyed the command, feeling the cloth move across your face. Their attempts to clean themselves had left a significant amount of excess icing in nooks and crannies, forcing Kara to finish the job for them. The girls looked between each other, how could they handle this? <<if $playerAge <= 9>>\ Sophie stepped up, crossing the floor to stand in front of you. [[You took a breath|Cupcake Decorating Tasting 4 Accept Preteen 3]]Taking a moment you realized that your @@.girlVoice;outburst@@ had been a bit over the top. Continued yelling wasn't helping anything. You let the tension drop from your body. Giving the girls a weak smile as a sign of your new outlook. The girls were relieved to see you'd calmed down, but none of them looked happy about your behaviour. Not that you could blame them, you'd been yelling like some @@.girlVoice;spoiled brat@@. If Miki hadn't intervened there was no telling how long your @@.girlVoice;tantrum@@ would have gone on. You held your head, a headache blossoming from all your yelling. You'd calmed down almost as fast as you'd @@.girlVoice;blown up@@. The @@.girlVoice;mood swing@@ would have been amusing to observe, had it been someone other than you. Your emotions just came to you so strongly now that it was @@.girlVoice;difficult to control them@@. In the end it was just a @@.girlVoice;little pudge@@, and it wasn't like anyone else was going to see it. This was only for the party, by Monday you'd be skinny again like you should be, you just had to deal with it until then. Plus, if you gained the weight this fast maybe it would be possible to lose it just as fast. You just had to keep your eyes out for any 'anti-cupcakes'. <<filterlinkreplace "Apologize for the outburst">>\ You bowed your head. <<playerVoice "\"I'm sorry,\"">> actually apologizing only made you feel sillier about the situation. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<silently>>\ <<changeEmbarassment "medium">> <<changeMaturity "small">> <<pushJournalEntry "cupcakeDecorating" "Journal Cupcake Decorating" "activity">> <<changeHappiness "Miki" false>> <<changeHappiness "Sophie" false>> <<changeHappiness "Emily" false>> <<changeHappiness "Kara" false>> <</silently>>\Even with the amount of icing present the cupcake was @@.girlVoice;sweeter@@ than you even could have imagined. A hit of pure sugar in your mouth that should have overwhelmed any sense of good taste, but didn't. The cupcake was @@.girlVoice;delicious@@; you absolutely @@.girlVoice;loved@@ how it tasted. Despite the cloying sweetness you were already taking another bite, and another, within moments Miki's cupcake had been entirely devoured. @@.mikiVoice;"Did ya like it?"@@ Miki's eyes were hopeful. <<playerVoice "\"Mmmhmm,\"">> you mumbled, still swallowing down the last of the cupcake. There was no way you could have lied about how much you'd enjoyed it. Miki squealed in delight and the rest of the girls offered their own cupcakes. Dutifully you ate one from each of the girls. Despite their difference in style, they all tasted nearly identical. They were using the same ingredients after all, so it shouldn't have been much a surprise. What did surprise you is, after you'd finished off the fourth cupcake, was that you still wanted more. You'd just consumed four cupcakes in a row, your mouth was dripping with sweetness and you could almost hear the angry voice of your dentist...but you still wanted another one...or two...or half dozen... You eyed the remaining cupcakes. The girls had given you the more neatly decorated ones, but there were still a ton left that would be a little messy from the battle, but just as tasty. Miki caught your look, @@.mikiVoice;"have another!"@@ She offered you another cupcake, this one somehow had even more icing than the last. <<if $traitImaginaryFriend >= 2>>\ @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"Oh oh, get one for me too!"@@ $imaginaryFriendName squealed. <</if>>\ <<if $playerMaturity <= 8>>[[Have another one|Cupcake Decorating Tasting 2 Accept Too Young][$cupcakeEatMore to false]] <<else>>[[Have another one|Cupcake Decorating Tasting 2 Accept][$cupcakeEatMore to true]] <<if $traitSweetTooth>>@@.girlVoice;They looked ''so'' tasty.<</if>><</if>> [[You'd had enough|Cupcake Decorating Tasting 2 Decline][$cupcakeEatMore to false]] <<addTrait "$traitSweetTooth" "Sweet Tooth" "trait">>\ <<set $cupcakeTriedOne to true>>\You reached for Miki's cupcake, but found it plucked from her hand before you got ahold of it. @@.sophieVoice;"I think you've had enough,"@@ Sophie made it clear this wasn't a question or a debate, she was cutting you off. You were just annoyed that you had to be on the receiving end of it. @@.girlThought;I want another cupcake.@@ But you kept the thought to yourself for now, maybe you'd get an opportunity to sneak one away later. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<pushJournalEntry "cupcakeDecorating" "Journal Cupcake Decorating" "activity">>\ <<set $deniedMoreCupcakes to true>>You shook your head. Despite your mouth watering for another one, you knew better. Your stomach already felt stuffed and more cupcakes was only going to make it worse. At best you'd ruin any chance of having enough room for dinner, but it was more likely that you'd make yourself sick. You doubted any of the magic of the party protected from stomach aches. Miki was unphased, instead offering the cupcake to Sophie, who eagerly accepted. The girls had been so busy cleaning that they hadn't actually tried any of their creations. Trading them around they each got a chance to sample each other's work. Each one declaring how delicious and pretty the cupcakes of the others were. <<if $traitImaginaryFriend >= 2>>\ $imaginaryFriendName pouted. She'd wanted a cupcake as well, and you hadn't asked at all. Even though you knew she couldn't actually have one, she was currently giving you the silent treatment. <</if>>\ Finally, after the girls had had their fill, the remaining cupcakes were squirreled away. There was still a lot of party to go, there would always be a need for snacks later. Now that everyone was full and satisfied it was time to get onto the next activity. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<pushJournalEntry "cupcakeDecorating" "Journal Cupcake Decorating" "activity">>\You couldn't resist the siren call of another cupcake. <<if $traitImaginaryFriend >= 2>>\ <<playerVoice "\"Can I have another one for...\"">> You trailed off. <<if $girlsAwareOfImaginaryFriend>>\ @@.karaVoice;"For $imaginaryFriendName?"@@ Kara questioned, keeping any teasing out of her tone. Blushing you nodded, much to <<print $imaginaryFriendName>>'s glee. Though it still meant you were the one who actually had to do the eating, something which rapidly escalated. Smiling brightly Miki offered you another cupcake; since the competition had been started all the other girls had to offer you ones as well. You dutifully ate each of them, even as you started to feel more and more full. <</if>>\ <<else>>\ Miki was being so @@.girlVoice;sweet@@ about it, it would be rude to tell her no. What harm could another cupcake do? Or two...since Miki saw your eagerness and took it to mean you needed even //more// cupcakes. Or four, since Kara and Emily both didn't want to be left out of things. <</if>>\ Your stomach gurgled as you finished off another cupcake, licking the last of the icing off of your fingers. You couldn't believe that you'd been able to down so many<<if $playerAge <= 12>>, especially at your new smaller size<</if>>. Sophie looked on bemused, @@.sophieVoice;"don't stuff your face too much,"@@ her tone was almost lecturing, @@.sophieVoice;"too many cupcakes and you'll get big and slow."@@ You smiled, you'd almost expected her to warn you away from ruining your dinner, but what nine year old would be giving //that// warning? Apparently she'd instead taken queues from her gymnastics coach. It was a little intense to be worrying about weight at her age, but Sophie was a serious competitor, that came with extra restrictions. @@.emilyVoice;"Oh be nice Sophie, $they can eat however much they want,"@@ Emily stepped in, @@.emilyVoice;"here. I have a super special one for you."@@ She offered you the @@.girlVoice;most delicious looking cupcake you'd ever seen@@. Your mouth watered at the sight of it. You were already too full, and Sophie did make a decent point, but you couldn't stop yourself now. It was just one more cupcake. //This'll be the last one//, you promised yourself. [[Eat the cupcake|Cupcake Decorating Tasting 3 Accept]] <<changeHappiness "Miki" true>>\The cupcake was even more scrumptious than you could have imagined. Emily had clearly worked hard on this one. Maybe an apology for the big mess? Enjoy it you did. When you finished you made sure to suck every last crumb off your fingers, deeply satisfied with the experience. Your stomach grumbled aggressively and you put a hand to it. Maybe you //had// eaten too much? It had been...uh...a dozen? You did feel awfully stuffed, even as you pressed your hand into your stomach it felt bloated. @@.karaVoice;"You okay <<playerName>>?"@@ Kara winced at the pained look on your face. The grumbling increased, the bloated feeling growing worse. Then it felt like something dropped, the discomfort ceased and the grumbling stopped. Your stomach didn't feel bloated anymore, but your hand did seem to sink into it more than it should. You shifted awkwardly, something felt off, but you couldn't place it... All the girls glanced at Emily, who looked almost as surprised as the rest, @@.emilyVoice;"oops,"@@ she gave a weak smile, @@.emilyVoice;"I guess Sophie was right."@@ The meaning of her words came into focus. The odd heaviness, the squishy stomach, the tightness of your clothes...you looked down to see the @@.girlVoice;little pudge@@ you'd suddenly developed. You'd gotten @@.girlVoice;chubby@@! <<if $playerMaturity >= 10 && $playerMaturity <= 13>>[[Freak out|Cupcake Decorating Tasting 4 Accept Preteen]]<<else>>[[Protest the situation|Cupcake Decorating Tasting 4 Accept]]<</if>> <<addTrait "$traitChubby" "Chubby" "trait">>\<<playerVoice "\"But it was just some cupcakes!\"">> You whined, using both hands to grab at the newfound flab around your stomach. In truth it wasn't //that// much extra weight, mostly just a little extra around your midsection, but it's sudden appearance was distressing. Sophie had been right that eating too many cupcakes would make you gain weight, but it wasn't supposed to be //this// instant. @@.emilyVoice;"Yes...well...with all the magic I guess other changes happen faster too..."@@ Emily offered weakly, it seemed that she was speculating, but you were still suspicious of that final cupcake. @@.mikiVoice;"Well I think you're cuter now."@@ Miki suddenly burst in, stepping in front of the group. Kara picked up the thread, @@.karaVoice;"yeah, you look really good <<playerName>>. You have really cute pinchable cheeks."@@ <<if $karaHappiness >= 7>>Kara smiled, clearly she was doing her best to make you feel better.<<else>>Kara might not have been your biggest fan, but figured right now you needed support.<</if>> That kind of compliment was strange to hear, but right now it did make you feel a little better. You gave one last poke at your @@.girlVoice;chubby stomach@@, grimacing at the @@.girlVoice;plush@@ feeling. It wasn't the worst thing, and the girls were being nice about it for now. Plus if you'd gained it that fast it was possible you could lose it just as quick. However, it did make you a little self concious. Doing your best to adjust your clothes to hide the extra pounds you hurried to move on to the next activity. Even better equipped to compete next time. <<changeAge "small">>\ <</if>>\ [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<silently>>\ <<set $sophieOlympicScore+=25>> <<if $bestGymnasticScore > $emilyScore>> <<set $playerOlympicScore+=20>> <<set $emilyOlympicScore+=15>> <<set $mikiOlympicScore+=12>> <<set $karaOlympicScore+=11>> <<elseif $bestGymnasticScore > $mikiScore>> <<set $emilyOlympicScore+=20>> <<set $playerOlympicScore+=15>> <<set $mikiOlympicScore+=12>> <<set $karaOlympicScore+=11>> <<elseif $bestGymnasticScore > $karaScore>> <<set $emilyOlympicScore+=20>> <<set $mikiOlympicScore+=15>> <<set $playerOlympicScore+=12>> <<set $karaOlympicScore+=11>> <<else>> <<set $emilyOlympicScore+=20>> <<set $mikiOlympicScore+=15>> <<set $karaOlympicScore+=12>> <<set $playerOlympicScore+=11>> <</if>> <<changeHappiness "Sophie" true>> <<pushJournalEntry "gymnastics" "Journal Gymnastics">> <<set $acceptActivityCount++>> <</silently>>\Emily was up first in round one. Time to see what 'level' this competition was going to be at. She stepped up to the makeshift starting line, the rest of the girls lined up on the side as judges. She took a small run before leaping into the air. She threw her legs apart into a full split before landing back down. Everyone clapped. Miki and Kara didn't seem super impressed giving a 7 and a 6 respectively. Sophie clearly appreciated something about it, giving an 8. You still didn't really know the benchmarks for these things so you stuck in the middle and went with a 7. Kara was up next. It was clear that she was far less comfortable with this. She took no run up instead lifting up one leg and putting her arms above her head. She spun 90 degrees on her toe and put her other foot back down. It had been shaky, but maybe it was harder than it looked. The other girls were kind enough, giving 6s across the board, which you matched. <<if $playerMaturity <= 7>>You were really glad Kara was the one keeping track of all of these @@.girlVoice;big numbers@@. Adding them up would be hard enough, let alone trying to remember them all.<<elseif $playerMaturity <= 5>>You had @@.girlVoice;no idea how to add four numbers@@, let alone @@.girlVoice;figuring out which ones were bigger. You'd just have to trust her.<</if>> Finally it was your turn, the first two movements hadn't been too crazy, and you were sure you could do something equally, if not more impressive. What did you want to try? [[Forward Roll (Easy)|Gymnastics Attempt][$gymnasticsMoveChoice to 1]] [[Handstand (Medium)|Gymnastics Attempt][$gymnasticsMoveChoice to 2]] <<if $playerAge <= 10>>[[Round-off (Hard)|Gymnastics Attempt Too Young]]<<else>>[[Round-off (Hard)|Gymnastics Attempt][$gymnasticsMoveChoice to 3]]<</if>> <<if $traitImaginaryFriend >= 2>>@@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"Ooo! Do a cartwheel instead!"@@<</if>> <<if $playerAge <= 12>>[[Back Handspring (Extreme)|Gymnastics Attempt Too Young]]<<else>>[[Back Handspring (Extreme)|Gymnastics Attempt][$gymnasticsMoveChoice to 4]]<</if>> <<set $emilyScore to 28>>\ <<set $karaScore to 24>>\ <<set $gymnasticsActivityResult to 2>>\The moment you launched into the move you realized you should have taken Emily's offer. Unbeknownst to you your hair had gotten tangled around your ankle, which mean you fell before you could even start. In one way this was a mercy, since you hadn't built much speed the fall didn't really hurt. However, you had just enough forward momentum to cause you to roll once you landed. By the time you came to a halt you were @@.girlVoice;wrapped in your hair@@. Wrapped in such a way that you couldn't even stand. Freeing yourself was equally hopeless. With your arms pinned to your side you weren't able to much more than wiggle in place. You were stuck. You craned your neck up to see the girls standing above you. Each of them holding back their laughter until they were sure you were okay. Once they'd confirmed your safety they broke into a flurry of @@.girlVoice;giggles@@. <<if $traitGiggly || $playerMaturity <= 10>>\ <<playerVoice "\"Hehehe, oops\"">>, you couldn't help but join in with your own @@.girlVoice;giggles@@. Even trapped you could recognize how @@.girlVoice;silly@@ you looked. <<else>>\ <<playerVoice "\"Are you just going to laugh or are you going to help me get free?\"">> Emily put her finger to her chin, deeply considering the situation. It was tempting to just leave you there, but she did want you to participate eventually. <<changeEmbarassment "small">>\ <</if>>\ In the end they did decide to help out, rolling you back the other way so that you were mostly free, though there was still some hair wrapped around your ankle. [[Finish getting yourself free|Gymnastics Attempt Hair Too Long 2]]Getting the hair unwrapped from your ankle proved to be surprisingly difficult. Somehow it'd managed to get itself into a knot that only Sophie small, yet strong, hands were able to get free. However, your ordeal was not over. Rolling on the ground had not been kind to your hair, it was mess of @@.girlVoice;tangles and knots@@, covered in dirt and grass. Apparently it's magical ability to stay clean didn't extend to rolling around on the ground. This left you in a conundrum. It was clear that your loose hair made it impossible to participate safely. Sophie said she couldn't braid it while it was that much of a mess. And Emily wasn't about to reverse the magic. However she did have a partial solution, you wouldn't be able to participate, but at least your hair would be clean... @@.mikiVoice;"Your hair is so pretty,"@@ she cooed, gently tugging the brush through a small tangle. Miki was quite gentle, so it wasn't as uncomfortable as you'd expected. Luckily her work was almost done, there were only a few knots remaining. However it'd taken the combined effort of the group to get it that way. While they were waiting for their next turn to compete they would take turns brushing your hair. It was embarrassing to need all this help, but you couldn't deny how @@.girlVoice;nice@@ it felt now. It had been uncomfortable at first, when Sophie was working out the nastiest tangles, but now you really @@.girlVoice;liked it@@. <<if $traitCatgirl>>You even let out a small @@.girlVoice;purr@@ as Miki continued.<</if>> Of course it'd be better if you never got the tangles in the first place, and just skipped to this part. Maybe you should just be a little less active...leave the jumping around to Sophie, while you could sit and @@.girlVoice;brush your hair@@. <<if $traitDaydreamer>>You really would be like @@.girlVoice;Princess Rapunzel@@, sitting in your tower. Whiling your days away brushing your @@.girlVoice;beautiful hair@@<<if $playerMaturity <= 13>>, @@.girlVoice;waiting for your prince to come@@<</if>>.<</if>> [[Finish the competition|Gymnastics Attempt Hair Too Long 3]] <<changeEmbarassment "small">>\@@.emilyVoice;"And the winner is Sophie!"@@ Emily smiled at Sophie, @@.emilyVoice;"though we all knew //that// was coming."@@, the two of them grinned at one another. The competition had finally come to an end, ending in the most predictable way. In truth there hadn't been much need for scoring, Sophie blew the rest of you away. Your disastrous attempt meant that you were in dead last, apparently your attempt had been amusing enough to get a 20, but that still put you at the bottom of the pack. However, Emily said that since you had tried, it still counted as participating. But maybe next time you'd actually accept her offers. @@.emilyVoice;"Sometimes I just wanna look out for my <<playerTitle>>."@@ You couldn't decide whether that was just another part of her elaborate teasing, or if she genuinely meant it. In this case it likely would have been better to accept, but that might have also been coincidence. Either way, with your @@.girlVoice;beautiful long hair@@ restore to its usual lustre, it was time to get back to the party. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<silently>>\ <<set $sophieOlympicScore+=25>> <<set $emilyOlympicScore+=20>> <<set $mikiOlympicScore+=15>> <<set $karaOlympicScore+=12>> <<set $playerOlympicScore+=11>> <<set $gymnasticsLongHairDisaster to true>> <<pushJournalEntry "gymnastics" "Journal Gymnastics">> <<set $acceptActivityCount++>> <</silently>>\Taking a breath you took a few steps back. You were about to attempt something pretty difficult, but you got the feeling you had to if you wanted to have a chance at winning. Everything was @@.girlVoice;more work@@ than it should have been, the movements a little slower, a little more awkward. What exactly was the eldest girl capable of? She stood at the end of the runway taking a breath before breaking into a sprint. Suddenly she threw herself forward, springing off of her hands, twisting in mid air, landing facing the way she had started. The other girls were stunned, and you felt the same. That was //way// more impressive than what the other girls did, and more than you could manage. She got 9s across the board. The only reason they weren't 10s is that they were leaving some room for the next round. [[Round 2|Gymnastics Round 2]]It was clear that everyone was going to have to step up their game; if they were going to have a chance to usurp Sophie's spot at the top. You doubted any of them were capable of feats that impressive, but Emily wanted to give it an honest try. She sprinted forward leaping into the air. She twisted, doing one full revolution before landing on one foot, her other leg perpendicular to the floor. Clearly at least some of that ballet training had stuck. Miki gave it a 10, she loved ballerinas. Kara less so, so she gave an 8. Sophie once again appreciated the effort, giving a 9. <<if $playerMaturity >= 8>>Which left the breakpoint up to you. A 10 would put Emily in the lead, below and Sophie would be a lock for at least second.<<else>>But did you want to give Emily a good score too?<</if>> [[Score high|Gymnastics Round 2b][$emilyScoreLow to false]] [[Score low|Gymnastics Round 2b][$emilyScoreLow to true]]<<if $emilyScoreLow>>\ <<if $traitHonest>>\ @@.girlThought;Emily is so graceful.@@ Any attempt to low-ball her score was undercut by your pathological need to be @@.girlVoice;honest@@. Emily smiled at the excellent score, though you got the feeling she knew it hadn't been entirely willing on your part. <<set $emilyScore to 37>>\ <<elseif $playerMaturity <= 9>>\ The other girls were surprised at your low score. Now it was just time for everyone to watch Kara and Sophie <<else>>\ Your score barely mattered, it was all down to what Sophie did. <</if>>\ <</if>>\ Kara stayed with something simple for her second attempt, doing a back roll this time. She had looked incredibly awkward through that move, despite how easy it was. <<filterlinkreplace "Laugh at Kara">>\ <<if $karaInferiorityComplex >= 2>>\ You'd //never// tease a @@.girlVoice;genius@@ like Kara about something as silly as a roll.\ <<else>>\ You covered your mouth as if to stifle a laugh, but it was intentionally audible to everyone around. Kara's face fell. She'd already been feeling crappy about the performance and now felt even worse. You felt better, at least you'd been better than ''that''.\ <<changeHappiness "Kara" false>>\ <<changeEmbarassment "small decrease">>\ <</if>>\ <</filterlinkreplace>> Sophie took a deep breath and turned away from the track, there was a moment pause as she prepared herself. She threw herself backwards into, what she later told you was, a back round-off handspring. It was impressive enough on it's own but she wasn't done. [[Hide in your closet|Hide And Seek Hider Emily Your Closet][$emilyHidingPlace to 1]] [[Hide in her closet|Hide And Seek Hider Emily Her Closet][$emilyHidingPlace to 0]] <<set $preHideAndSeekOutfit to $playerOutfit>>\<<set _success to random(100) <= (40+$hidingBonus)>>\ <<if $traitBornToLose>>\ <<set _success to 0>>\ <</if>>\ One of the rules of the house was that you weren't allowed to mess with each other's stuff ''too'' much. This extended to your respective closets. She wasn't allowed in yours and you weren't allowed in hers. So maybe, if you hid in your own, she'd have the rule ingrained enough that she wouldn't even bother to check. You hurried up to your room, trying your best to be quiet on the stairs. Pulling the closet door closed behind you, you tried to stay quiet. The slats in the door meant you could see out a little bit and would be able to keep an eye out. <<if $traitGiggly>>\ <<include "Hide and Seek Giggly Caught">> <<elseif _success>>\ You held your breath when Emily entered the room, but it seemed like things were going to work out. Either you'd been right about the rules blinding her to the possibility, or she just wasn't paying enough attention. She didn't even cast a glance at the closet before she exited the room. [[Sophie's turn|Hide And Seek Hider Sophie]] <<set $hideAndSeekHidingWins++>>\ <<set $emilyHideAndSeekSuccess to true>>\ <<else>>\ @@.emilyVoice;"Found you!"@@, Emily suddenly squealed as she peered at you through the slats in the closet. Now come on, let's find the others."@@ She took your hand and started practically skipping down the halls. The rest of the game was lightning quick. Between her knowing the house and knowing the habits of her friends, she basically went straight to each. Miki was of particular amusement, as her hiding place under the bed did nothing to hide her feet. It seemed she was still getting the hang of hiding. There were some objections to you helping, but she assured everyone you weren't doing anything but following along. You were just her @@.girlVoice;little helper@@, and she'd brought you along so you didn't get lonely. The other girls accepted this justification, though not without a few giggles of their own. Soon enough you were all back in the living room, ready for the next round. [[Sophie's turn|Hide And Seek Hider Sophie]] <</if>>\<<set _success to random(100) <= (50+$hidingBonus)>>\ <<if $traitBornToLose || $traitAfraidOfTheDark>>\ <<set _success to 0>>\ <</if>>\ One of the rules of the house was that you weren't allowed to mess with each other's stuff ''too'' much. This extended to your respective closets. She wasn't allowed in yours and you weren't allowed in hers. Which meant she'd never suspect if you snuck into her closet. Assuming she didn't find you, you'd come out at the end of the game and she wouldn't even know you'd been there. You hurried up to her room, trying your best to be quiet on the stairs. You pulling the closet door closed behind you and settled in. <<if $traitGiggly>>\ <<include "Hide and Seek Giggly Caught">>\ <<set $caughtInEmilysCloset to true>>\ <<elseif _success>>\ <<include "Hide and Seek Hider Emily Her Closet Intro Fragment">> It was a oddly @@.girlVoice;pleasant@@ sensation, feeling her clothes against your skin. You'd never thought about how much @@.girlVoice;softer@@ and @@.girlVoice;silkier@@ girl's clothes were. There was a @@.girlVoice;delicateness@@ that guy's clothes entirely lacked. Or maybe that was just because of the age difference? Had your stuff used to feel like this? Regardless the longer you stayed here the more you ended up musing on the feelings, forgetting about the game that was going on in the background. Minutes continued to pass and the feelings only intensified, that @@.girlVoice;gentleness@@ wrapping around you. It was only Emily's call of, @@.emilyVoice;"olly olly oxen free,"@@ that broke you from the reverie. Part of you was tempted to stay. <<if $playerAge <= 10>>You were the right size after all, you could @@.girlVoice;try on anything you wanted@@.<<else>>A guilty curiosity about how they would @@.girlVoice;feel to wear@@.<</if>> [[Try something on|Hide and Seek Hider Emily Her Closet Try Something On]] [[Get out of there|Hide and Seek Hider Emily Her Closet Get Out]] <<else>>\ <<include "Hide and Seek Hider Emily Her Closet Intro Fragment">> @@.emilyVoice;"What do you think you're doing there?"@@ Emily shouted. You covered your eyes against the sudden burst of light, only occluded by the silhouette of your very annoyed sister. She had both hands on her hips and was glaring down at you. You almost had to laugh at how much she resembled your mother in that moment. But laughing was probably not the best choice when faced with an angry child witch. <<playerVoice "\"I-\"">> Emily held up her hand to cut you off, @@.emilyVoice;"I don't want to hear excuses,"@@ she took a moment, looking up and pondering her next move. How would she punish you for this? [[Emily smiled|Hide and Seek Hider Emily Her Closet Punishment]] <</if>>\<<if $traitFashionista>>\ You tried to clear your head and shake yourself loose of the strangely clingy clothes. It was like they //wanted// to be worn. @@.girlThought;And ''I'' want to wear them.@@ You bit your lip as your hand ran over the hem of a particularly @@.girlVoice;soft@@ dress. You could even see it @@.girlVoice;sparkle@@ in the dark. You were surrounded by a treasure trove of @@.girlVoice;cute clothes@@ in all sorts of styles. No matter how silly it was to randomly play dressup during hide and seek, @@.girlVoice;you just had to try something on@@. You just @@.girlVoice;loved clothes too much@@ to walk away. [[Try something on|Hide and Seek Hider Emily Her Closet Try Something On]] <<changeEmbarassment "small">>\ <<else>>\ You shook yourself loose of the strangely clingy clothes, your mind clearing up. You weren't about to start a random @@.girlVoice;dressup@@ session. You stepped out of the closet and back into Emily's room, hurrying out the door. Last thing you needed was for her to catch you //after// she'd given up. As it stood it seemed like your little cheat was going to go unnoticed. However, that feeling of @@.girlVoice;softness@@ continued to hang on, your own skin a little @@.girlVoice;smoother@@ from the experience, all the better for wearing those @@.girlVoice;delicate, girly@@ clothes. [[Sophie's turn|Hide And Seek Hider Sophie]] <<changeAge "small">>\ <</if>>\The mostly opaque closet door meant you couldn't see out very well; so you wouldn't really know if Emily was about to catch you, you'd just have to deal with the surprise if she did. <<if $traitAfraidOfTheDark>>Only after you'd closed the door did you realize how @@.girlVoice;dark@@ the closet had become. You scooched yourself closer to the front of the closet and the light. Trying, and failing, to not think about what might be @@.girlVoice;lurking in the dark@@ behind you.<</if>> As the moments passed you a creeping discomfort was building up. <<if $playerAge <= 12>>You'd been given a wardrobe change from this closet, but the girls had been the ones poking around in it, you'd never been inside.<</if>> The closet wasn't big enough that you could squat down without a few of Emily's garments brushing against you. <<if $traitAfraidOfTheDark>>You @@.girlVoice;yelped@@ the first time one touched you, thinking @@.girlVoice;a monster@@ had gotten you...but it was just a dress. Unfortunately your @@.girlVoice;scream@@ hadn't gone unnoticed.<<else>> You kept trying to move them off, so that you could be more comfortable, but they kept falling back on top of you.<</if>><<if $playerAge >=13>>\ <<Image 'HideAndSeek/PunishmentOutfit1.webp' "topRightCorner">>\ @@.emilyVoice;"Oh I get it,"@@ her smile widened dangerously, @@.emilyVoice;"you were jealous of our cute outfits and wanted one too."@@ She considered for only a moment before drawing something seemingly at random from her closet and tossing onto you. Your vision went dark for a moment and you were struck by the sensations of fabrics running over your skin. You couldn't actually see what was going on, but you could feel clothes sliding up and down. The roughness of your jeans fell away, something far more delicate sliding up your legs. Your coarse, tight t-shirt vanishing, letting your skin feel the breeze for only a moment before being replaced. Although your shoulders still felt exposed. When your vision finally cleared you took a moment to take stock of the situation. <<if $playerMaturity <= 12 || $traitFashionista>>\ The outfit was actually @@.girlVoice;surprisingly mature@@, at least for something coming out of an eight year old's closet. <<else>>\ You cringed at your new wardrobe. It was very @@.girlVoice;girly@@ and pretty @@.girlVoice;childish@@. Although you had it admit it was more mature than Emily's normal fare. But that was cold comfort, 'mature' meant it'd be suitable for a ten year old. Not for a teenager. <</if>>\ The top was a pale pink and the sleeves were multi-tiered with frills. However, the sleeves only actually started half way down your arm, leaving your shoulders and upper arms exposed. A black strap around your neck kept it up, tied at the front with a large bow. The cut was also lower than you were used to, nothing lurid but an unmistakably @@.girlVoice;feminine@@ cut. The bottoms were actually black shorts, and came to about mid thigh. You were actually shocked that it wasn't a skirt though they were baggy enough that when you stood it would be easy to mix it up. <<if $traitFashionista>>It was actually @@.girlVoice;very fashionable@@ and you were impressed in your sister's taste.<</if>> You'd never actually seen Emily wear this, perhaps it was for special occasions. Regardless it looked ridiculous on you. Mature or no it was still meant for a girl, and one much younger than you. You did not have legs that looked good in such delicate shorts and no one wanted your arms exposed like that. Emily however found it deeply amusing, @@.emilyVoice;"It looks so good on you!"@@ She sighed, @@.emilyVoice;"I'd dress you up with pretty shoes and a nice hat...but I guess we have to play first."@@ Her tone veered towards serious, @@.emilyVoice;"you have to wear it for the rest of the game. Then I'll give back your other outfit."@@ She squealed to herself. @@.emilyVoice;"The other girls are going to ''love'' this. I'm going to go get them, meet me in the living room."@@ Without a further chance to protest Emily darted out of the room. Leaving you there alone, awkwardly shuffling around in your new outfit. As tempting as it was to remove you supposed that you'd gotten off light. It was <<if $playerMaturity >= 12>>a dumb @@.girlVoice;girly@@ outfit, but it was only temporary, she could have done worse.<<else>>just a @@.girlVoice;girly@@ outfit, and only temporary to boot. She could have done much worse.<</if>> [[To the living room|Hide and Seek Hider Emily Her Closet Punishment 2a]] <<silently>>\ <<set $hideAndSeekDressedByEmily to true>> <<set $hideAndSeekDressedByEmilyMature to true>> <<set $playerOutfit to 11>> <</silently>>\ <<elseif $playerAge >= 11>>\ <<Image 'HideAndSeek/PunishmentOutfit2.webp' "topRightCorner">>\ @@.emilyVoice;"I didn't know you were so eager to play dress up again,"@@ her smile threatened to split her face, @@.emilyVoice;"let me find something ''extra'' cute for you."@@ Any protests on your part were roundly ignored as Emily dug into her closet for something suitable. Even she'd outgrown this outfit. It was...a lot. The dress was all a pale pink, very @@.girlVoice;sweet and innocent@@. The top part half was sane enough, thin @@.girlVoice;delicate@@ straps over your shoulders, a slight v cut, nothing unusual for a dress. That's when things escalated; there was a pale pink flower bow around hip height, as big as Emily's head. The skirt was absurd. There was ''a lot'' of frilly lacy layers. Watching her hold it up didn't fully express how much material there was. You actually had a specific memory of that. Later in the day Emily had run out of energy and fallen asleep. The dress was ankle length, but it had fluffed out behind her and she was literally using it as a bed. She giggled, @@.emilyVoice;"you can be a cute flower girl too."@@ Before you could say anything she threw the outfit to you, the fabric blocking your vision. [[Sophie's turn|Hide And Seek Hider Sophie]] <</if>>\ <<changeHappiness "Emily" false>>\ <<set $caughtInEmilysCloset to true>>\ <<set $hasWornSkirtTemporarily to true>>\You impatiently waited in the living room for the other girls to trickle in, but it seemed Emily had other plans. No matter how you felt about the outfit, you knew it looked ridiculous on you, it wasn't meant for a boy, certainly not one your age. It should be obvious that it would look silly, and that you should just own it, but you couldn't get the concern out of your head. There was a tense moment of silence when they walked into the room. Back in the light your @@.girlVoice;terror@@ was abating, but you were still @@.girlVoice;shaken@@ by the experience. You were glad no one had been here to see that, it'd been embarrassing enough on your own. <</if>>\ But if you couldn't hide here you needed somewhere else, and you were running out of time. [[Hide outside|Hide and Seek Hider Kara Outside][$karaHidingPace to 2]] [[Hide in mom's room|Hide and Seek Hider Kara Mom Room][$karaHidingPlace to 3]] <<changeEmbarassment "small">>\ <<set $hsKaraHideWastedTime to true>>\<<silently>>\ <<set _modifiers to []>> <<set _hideAndSeekBonus to 0>> <<if $traitRapunzelHair>><<set _modifiers.push(["Hair Sticking Out", -10])>><<set _hideAndSeekBonus -= 10>><</if>> <<if $traitBornToLose>><<set _modifiers.push(["Cursed", -100])>><<set _hideAndSeekBonus -= 100>><</if>> <<if $hsKaraHideWastedTime>><<set _modifiers.push(["Wasted Time", -10])>><<set _hideAndSeekBonus -= 10>><</if>> <<set $karaHideRandomRoll to random(100)>> <<set $karaHideRollTotal to $karaHideRandomRoll + _hideAndSeekBonus>> <<set $karaHideSuccess to $karaHideRollTotal >= 30>> <<set _successText to $seekSuccess ? "success" : "failure">> <</silently>>\ <<dieRollResult _successText $karaHideRollTotal $karaHideRandomRoll _modifiers>><<include "Hide and Seek Hide Kara Calculate Result">> This was a truly devious spot. You'd never have been able to fit when you were bigger, but now you were @@.girlVoice;small@@ enough to just squeeze in. Now it was a little bit risky. It'd been years since you'd played hide and seek, but you were pretty sure hiding in a dryer was a "bad idea". But that was just coming from overcautious parents, you weren't some @@.girlVoice;stupid kid@@, you'd be fine. Plus, since it was 'forbidden', Kara would never think to check. She was too much of a goody-goody to try something like that. So you hurried your way to the laundry room. It seemed that no one else had the idea to hide in here so you'd have a few moments of peace. Luckily you had a pretty big drier. <<if $playerAge >= 10>>It was a little awkward to get in, you weren't ''that'' @@.girlVoice;small@@, but you managed to contort yourself in, pulling the door closed behind you. It'd be uncomfortable long term, but how long could the game go?<<else>>It was almost shocking how easy it was to fit yourself into the dryer. You were @@.girlVoice;so small@@ now that you even had some extra space. You wouldn't say it was comfortable, but you could probably stay here for ages without cramping.<</if>> You waited...and waited...and waited...you wondered if the game was still going. Maybe your spot was so good that they were never going to find you. Hopefully you'd be able to hear the call out for the end of the game. Time continued dragging on, this was taking <<if $playerMaturity < 12 || $traitEnegetic>>@@.girlVoice;forever@@<<else>>longer than you expected<</if>>. Was Kara having trouble finding the others? Or were the other girls just much better at hiding than you thought? Maybe you should come out yourself? You didn't want to risk losing just because you were getting bored, but you also didn't want to stay in here forever; waiting for a signal that never came. <<if $karaHideSuccess>>\ [[Come out of hiding|Hide and Seek Hider Kara Dryer Come Out]] <<if $playerMaturity <= 9 || $traitEnegetic>>[[Keep hiding|Hide and Seek Hider Kara Dryer Stay Energetic]]\ <<else>>[[Keep hiding|Hide and Seek Hider Kara Dryer Stay]]<</if>> <<else>>\ [[Wait a few more moments|Hide and Seek Hider Kara Caught]] <</if>>\You resolved to stay here at least a little longer, so you did. Time to go. [[Come out|Hide and Seek Hider Kara Dryer Come Out]]You shifted in your hiding spot, you were starting to get stiff from staying in one place for so long. It felt like it'd been <<if $playerMaturity < 10>>@@.girlVoice;days@@<<elseif $playerMaturity < 13>>@@.girlVoice;hours@@<<else>>at least ten minutes<</if>>. But still no one had come for you. Initially you'd just been bored, but now you were starting to get lonely. What if they'd forgotten about you? What if they never came back to find you? You might just be here, by yourself forever. <<if $playerMaturity >= 11>>It was a ridiculous thought, but it stuck in your head.<</if>> <<include "Hide and Seek Hider Kara Dryer Come Out">>You figured that you'd been in here @@.girlVoice;long enough@@. You'd take the risk that you were being impatient and would get caught. You pushed the dryer door open...it didn't budge...you pushed again...same result. Panic rose in your chest. Why wasn't it opening? The door wasn't that heavy, you should be able to budge it...unless it had locked. You pushed at the door again in vain, shifting around to kick at it. It made some noise, but did nothing to dislodge it. You were stuck in here. [[Call for help|Hide and Seek Hider Kara Dryer Stuck]]You kept banging on the interior of the door to no avail. You'd thought you'd picked such a clever spot and now you were paying the price. You'd known this was dangerous but you hadn't bothered thinking through why. You felt miserable, you kept banging on the door and calling out. Still there was no response, your panic was building into full on terror. Freaking out wouldn't do anything useful, but you'd practically curled up in a ball to try and hold it together. <<if $playerMaturity <= 10 or $traitCrybaby>>Fighting building sniffles you continued to hold out.<</if>> @@.emilyVoice;"There you are!"@@, Emily's voice called out as the dryer was suddenly flooded with light, @@.emilyVoice;"We've been looking for you everywhere. [[Come out from under the bed|Hide and Seek Hider Kara Mom Room Open Box 2]] <<filterlinkreplace "Stay under the bed">> The dust was bothering you too much to stay under here. <</filterlinkreplace>>You crawled out from under the bed, casting a glance towards the door. Worse still under the bed wasn't the only spot that had been neglected. You stalked around the room, getting the lay of the land. You knew your mom wasn't the most fastidious when it came to cleanliness, but her room was worse than you'd expected. There was still no sign of your hunter, and you were bored enough that you were actually considering doing a little cleaning while you waited. Was it really a good idea though? What should you do? [[Find a cloth and dust|Hide and Seek Hider Kara Mom Room Open Box 2a]] [[Tidy things|Hide and Seek Hider Kara Mom Room Open Box 2b]]The dust was far too annoying to leave the way it was. By a stroke of luck there was a cloth left strewn on the dresser. Perhaps she'd started the job and never finished it. Though looking around it seemed any 'start' she'd made had been little more than wishful thinking. You rolled up your metaphorical sleeves and got to work. Though a proper cleaning did sound like a lot of work, maybe you could just give everything a quick pass and then get back to the game. @@#links;\ <<link "Dust thoroughly">> <<filterreplace "#links">>\ <<include "Hide and Seek Hider Kara Mom Room Open Box 2a Dust Thoroughly">> <</filterreplace>> <</link>> <<link "Dust casually">> <<filterreplace "#links">>\ You started your dusting job with the dresser you'd pulled the cloth off of. Though dusting was the kind of job you had to do again and again anyway, not like you could do it once and call it done. Considerations about a cleaning schedule bounced around your head as you continued to clean the room. There was a catharsis to actually making things cleaner. The dust bunnies under the bed were still bothering you, but at least you were making progress. There had to be a dustpan somewhere in this house, after the game you could go and find one to finish that particular job. After a few minutes the dusting was done to your satisfaction. It seemed there was less area than you'd thought, and with your level of focus the job actually went by pretty quickly. Though there was technically still a game going on, so you'd have to decide what you wanted to do. [[Keep cleaning|Hide and Seek Hider Kara Mom Room Open Box 3]] [[Keep cleaning|Hide and Seek Hider Kara Mom Room Open Box 3]]Looking around the room there were a distressing number of things out of place. Her bed wasn't even made properly. Sure she'd pulled the blanket up over it, but it wasn't tucked in at the corners, and you really should fold it back down on the top to make it look nice. You sighed and got to work. Wasn't this supposed to be your mom's job? You had to keep your own room clean, not that you ever did a good job, so shouldn't she be doing her own room? Practice what you preach and all that. Though you had to admit that even in this state it was a lot tidier than yours was. After you finished in here you should probably pop over to your room and take care of it. There was a lot to finish in this room though, and that wasn't even getting into the possibility that things inside the drawers or in the closet weren't organized. That was going to mean even more time spent to get it into respectable shape. You started, did you have that kind of time? You glanced at the door. Kara could be here at any moment, and you weren't exactly in a position that concealed your position. <span id="hideAgain">\ <span class="glitchy linkglitchy" data-text="Clean more">\ <<link "Hide again">>\ <<filterreplace "#hideAgain">>\ <<filterlinkreplace "Clean more">>\ No point leaving things half undone. If you'd started this job you were going to finish it properly. If you left a bunch of stuff undone it'd just look like no one had done anything. Plus once a room was nice and tidy it was much easier to keep it that way. Considerations about a cleaning schedule bounced around your head as you continued to clean the room. There was a catharsis to actually making things cleaner. The dust bunnies under the bed were still bothering you, but at least you were making progress. There had to be a dustpan somewhere in this house, after the game you could go and find one to finish that particular job. After a few minutes the obvious tidying was done. There was still the possibility of messes in drawers and cupboards, but that could be saved for another day. Would be a little rude to just start digging around in your mother's stuff anyway. As a bonus you hadn't heard or seen any sign of Kara so she was clearly somewhere else for at least a little longer. Though there was technically still a game going on, so you'd have to decide what you wanted to do. [[Keep cleaning|Hide and Seek Hider Kara Mom Room Open Box 3]] [[Keep cleaning|Hide and Seek Hider Kara Mom Room Open Box 3]] <</filterlinkreplace>>\ <</filterreplace>>\ <</link>>\ </span>\ </span>\Cleaning was a job that was basically never done. That didn't mean you weren't going to do your best here, @@.girlVoice;a clean house beget a clean mind@@. [[Your mind reeled|Hide and Seek Hider Kara Mom Room Open Box 4a]] <</if>>\Your brain played back the last few minutes. Your single minded obsession with cleaning. The dedication you showed to the task, the enthusiasm with which you approached it. It was all entirely unnatural...the reason for it was obvious in retrospect. That box under the bed, it had been trapped. Whether your mother had meant to specifically afflict you, or it was just a general trap you couldn't say. What you did know that that you had been utterly compelled to clean the room with no regard for anything else. Which is why you'd been standing out in the open making a bed while you were supposed to be playing hide and seek. Letting Kara trivially catch you. Though she still looked confused at the fact, why hadn't you even bothered to conceal yourself in the slightest? <<playerVoice "\"I-uh...needed to clean the room. The box made me do it.\"">> That was a terrible explanation but somehow Kara accepted it, clearly she was getting far too used to all this magic stuff. @@.karaVoice;"Well, finish up if you need to and then come down to the living room."@@ She spun on her heel and hurried off to find the others. [[Miki's Turn|Hide and Seek Hider Miki]] <<addTrait "$traitNeat" "Neat" "trait">>\ <<changeHappiness "Kara" true>>\ <<set $karaSawCatgirlMaid to true>>\Messing with your mother's stuff seemed like an absolutely terrible idea. Messing around with magic was dangerous at the best of times, let alone during this sleepover. So you didn't even touch the box as you waited for the game to go on. After a while it seemed that you'd been right about the advantages of hiding in your mother's room. Kara hadn't even come in yet and she should have had more than enough time. <<if $traitBornToLose>>\ But that quickly fell apart when Kara entered the room. You could only see her feet, but by the way she was shuffling it was clear that she was nervous about being in here. It seemed like a good sign, if she didn't want to be here she'd likely leave just as quickly. And she would have left, if that hadn't been the moment you were forced to shift in place. Your arm was falling asleep and needed a slight adjustment. It wasn't enough movement to make any noise, but it was enough to dislodge a dust bunny and drive it straight up your nose. You tried to suppress it, but you were far too late, letting out a painfully obvious sneeze. Kara would have to be deaf to miss that one, and she wasn't. She got down onto her hands and knees so she could see under the bed, easily spotting your prone form. @@.karaVoice;"Got you,"@@ she stated flatly. You cursed under your breath, you probably would have gotten away with this except for that stupid random sneeze. It had basically been self sabotage on that one. Still you'd been caught fair and square. So you wiggled your way out from under the bed. Heading to the living room as the other girls trickled in one by one. Kara earning herself a total victory and catching everyone in the group. <<else>>\ Even when she did finally come in she left almost as quickly. <<if $karaInferiorityComplex >= 2>>\ You were shocked. You'd been tensed up, ready to hear @@.karaVoice;"found you"@@, but there was nothing. You'd actually managed to get one past her. It discomforted you. You were happy that you'd won, but worried about how it had happened. Even when you came downstairs you cast a critical eye at Kara, making sure that she was doing alright. Nothing seemed amiss, it seems that you'd just managed to get lucky enough this time. You doubted it would happen again. <<if $hideAndSeekHidingWins>>You'd won every time so far, so you were feeling awfully good about yourself.<<elseif $hideAndSeekHidingWins == 0>>It was nice to finally get a win on the board, even though it'd just been @@.girlVoice;blind luck@@.<</if>> <<elseif $karaInferiorityComplex>>\ It was actually a little surprising.
