[[Hide under something|Hide and Seek Hider Miki Under][$mikiHidingPlace to 0]] [[Hide behind something|Hide and Seek Hider Miki Behind][$mikiHidingPlace to 1]]<<if $playerMaturity <= 7>>\ <<include "Hide and Seek Egocentric Caught Bed">> <<else>> <<include "Hide and Seek Miki Under Caught">> <</if>><<if $playerMaturity <= 7>>\ <<include "Hide and Seek Egocentric Caught Curtain">> <<else>> <<include "Hide and Seek Hider Miki Behind Success">> <</if>>With only moments to spare you slid into the spare bedroom, looking for a place to hide. The only one that stood out was an old trick, but it's possible Miki had never seen it. You slid yourself past the open door and nestled into the nook between the door and the wall. The position would be instantly revealed if Miki closed the door. But if she just wandered in and started looking around she probably wouldn't notice anything amiss. It was a weak play, but you'd been rushed, and no point in getting too hardcore in hiding from Miki. <<if $traitClaustrophobic>>It was a tight fit, and your @@.girlVoice;breath hitched@@ when you got the door into position. Holding your breath as she began her search. In one sense it was an extremely thorough search, checking under the bed, under the blankets. She was even checking under the pillows, as if it was possible for you to hide under one. She was so @@.girlVoice;cute@@ sometimes, but it was rapidly becoming clear that she wasn't actually going to find you. Her patience was coming to an end and was about to leave the room, her eyes never lingering on the door, the mere idea having slipped her mind. <<if $traitBornToLose>>\ You weren't sure exactly what happened next. Maybe you'd been standing in one spot too long and your legs had fallen asleep, or maybe you'd just lost concentration. Either way it ended up with you losing your balance and reaching out to the door for stability. It was enough to keep you from falling, but it also pushed the door in a way that left you completely exposed. Miki looked as shocked as you at your sudden appearance. But she wasn't about to let the chance go by. [[Miki pointed at you|Hide and Seek Miki Caught Generic]] <<elseif $traitAllergies>>\ Which was the exact moment you felt a tickle in your nose. You had been working very hard to resist the urge to sniffle while you were hiding, but this was harder. You tried to look up, to ward it off, but to no avail. Sneezing into your arm you cringed at the noise it'd made, made worse by the trio of sneezes that followed it. By the time you finished, an involuntary sniffle punctuating the fit, the door had been closed and your position revealed. [[Miki pointed at you|Hide and Seek Miki Caught Generic]] <<elseif $traitClaustrophobic>>\ Looking at her it was clear that she was frustrated. It had been a while before she'd entered this room, it seemed her searching for the others wasn't going well. Her search for you wasn't going much better, and she was ready to head out the door when something caught her eye. [[Miki pointed at you|Hide and Seek Miki Caught Generic]] <<else>>\ Looking at her it was clear that she was frustrated. Hurrying out of the room you considered your next move, you didn't know how long Miki would give you, but you needed a good spot this time. Your brain was whirring, trying to think of a good spot you could get to quickly, finally settling on an odd nook in a linen closet. It was nearby and should be easy to overlook. For a while it seemed that you'd made a good pick. You heard Miki wandering around, but nowhere near you...though you heard a lot of footsteps. //Is someone else moving around?// You leaned a little bit out of the closet to get a better listen, but the footsteps had stopped. You leaned out further just in case you were missing something. By the time Miki wandered by your spot you were half-way out of the closet. @@.mikiVoice;"Got you again!"@@ Her mood had improved, but her instructions stayed the same, @@.mikiVoice;"go hide again!"@@ She closed her eyes. You winced and moved out again. Her catching you the first time was expected, considering your terrible spot, the second time you'd picked a good spot. Your brain skipping over the fact you'd basically abandoned that good spot by leaning out so far. It was a little embarrassing for Miki to catch you out so easily. A third time would be shameful, so you needed a ''very'' good spot. [[Hide again|Hide and Seek Miki Under Caught 3]]This time you were pulling no punches, you racked your brain for a good spot, but things were @@.girlVoice;hazy@@. You found yourself thinking and discarding ideas almost at random. You just couldn't get a grip on what a 'good spot' would even be. Was under the bed good? Maybe. What about tucked behind the water heater? No, something felt off about that. Finally you took a blind guess and went for your closet, settling near the front so you see out. Of course you left the door open a little, you always did that, so it'd be suspicious if it //was// closed. Sure it would leave you more exposed but there was no way that Miki would- @@.mikiVoice;"Gotcha!,"@@ Miki giggled, @@.mikiVoice;"again! Again!"@@ by the time you'd stood, reeling from the catch, Miki had already shut her eyes. If you'd nestled further back or even more to the sides you would have been fine. But at the time you'd been worried more about seeing than unimportant angles. [[Hide once more|Hide and Seek Miki Under Caught 5]] <<changeEmbarassment "small">>\Your thoughts came in hitches and starts. [[The round ended|Hide and Seek Miki Under Caught 6]] <<changeEmbarassment "small">>\Having given up Miki called for the other girls. They all traipsed in from their various hiding spots, but Emily, as she often did, looked annoyingly smug. Was she proud about not getting caught by Miki? That wasn't a high bar...not that you'd managed to clear that bar. <<playerVoice "\"Of course!\"">> You suddenly shouted, spooking the group. You'd been racking your brain, trying to figure out how she'd caught you in that last spot. You just wanted this part of the game done. Emily frowned, clearly she'd had some grandiose explanation prepared and you'd rained on her parade. //Good. She doesn't get the satisfaction and another chance to tease me.// However, your brain felt a little @@.girlVoice;scrambled@@. You'd missed so many obvious things while playing, but still didn't understand why. Well, the moment had passed, Emily would keep that secret for herself. [[Your turn|Hide and Seek Seeker]] <<silently>>\ <<changeMaturity "small">>\ <<changeHappiness "Emily" false>> <</silently>>\@@.emilyVoice;"Well it didn't seem fair for Miki. You live here, you know it better."@@ You couldn't deny that, though Emily had the exact same advantage and hadn't done anything to even it out. @@.emilyVoice;"So I gave you a little //handsy// cap,"@@ she fiddled with the wand, @@.emilyVoice;"so you were thinking like Miki."@@ She glanced over to Kara, @@.emilyVoice;"it was Kara's idea."@@ Prompting the other girl for an explaination. Emily had done the magic, but Kara had the plan. @@.karaVoice;"I suggested the ''handy''cap"@@ Kara spoke, subtly correcting Emily. @@.karaVoice;"Sometimes Miki has trouble seeing things from other's perspectives. <<if $playerMaturity <= 10>>It's called //e-go-cent-rism//<<else>>It's called egocentrism<</if>>."@@ <<if $playerMaturity <= 10>>You had absolutely zero idea what that word was, or what it really meant.<<else>>You'd vaguely heard the term before, but didn't really know the details.<</if>> However, you understood the feeling she was talking about. It was the @@.girlVoice;childish@@ belief of, "if I can't see you, you can't see me." Except during the last game, in some moments, you'd believed it. The rest of the explaination was a little above your head, worse when Emily tried explaining some magic stuff, but you got the gist. She'd linked your brain to Miki's, so your 'hiding' ability was stuck with the same flaws as hers. Or at least close, Emily admitted it might have been, @@.emilyVoice;"just a little worse."@@ It explained why you'd missed so many "obvious" things, Miki might have made the same mistake. Emily claimed she'd severed the link and there should be no lasting effect, but your thoughts still felt slightly @@.girlVoice;scrambled@@ and there were a @@.girlVoice;few new holes@@ in your knowledge. [[Your turn|Hide and Seek Seeker]] <<changeMaturity "small">>\@@.mikiVoice;"Ready or not! Here I come!"@@ You panicked, you were out of time. You dove behind the nearest curtain and did your best to stay still and quiet. You could only see the vaguest of shapes through the material so you just had to hope that you wouldn't get spotted. It wasn't terribly far from the starting point, but initially it seemed that Miki had gone another direction. You'd had to wait @@.girlVoice;impatiently@@ while she searched for the other girls. You heard nothing. So either she was being very quiet about catching them, or she'd had no success so far. Then you saw a small shadow moving towards you. It stopped only a few feet away and you heard a @@.girlVoice;giggle@@. @@.mikiVoice;"I found you,"@@ Miki sing-songed. You didn't believe her. It wasn't like she'd moved the curtain. You could barely see her so there was no way she could know it was you behind the curtain. Maybe she was bluffing. Trying to get you to come out since she couldn't find you otherwise. [[Miki pulled back the curtain|Hide and Seek Egocentric Caught Curtain 2]]Miki's smiling face <<if $playerAge <= 8>>looked straight at you<<else>>looked up at you.<</if>> @@.mikiVoice;"I caugh-chu,"@@ she touched your arm to confirm her capture. <<playerVoice "\"How did you find me so fast?\"">> You felt a little put out, it hadn't been the best hiding spot, but you hadn't expected her to find you that easily. She giggled in response, pointing at your feet. @@.mikiVoice;"Your toes were sticking out. It was so funny."@@ <<if $playerMaturity <= 5>>\ You were still confused. How had she seen your toes? You couldn't see her from your spot, so how was she able to spot you? Coming out from behind the curtain didn't help. Looking back the curtain was just as opaque from this side, no way she could see through it. Though the curtain didn't actually come all the way to the floor... Your brain whirred for a moment before it became clear. So ''that'' was how she'd spotted you. Your feet had never been covered at all, finding you would have been trivial. You'd just had to see it for yourself, it was @@.girlVoice;too hard to picture it from her perspective@@. <<changeEmbarassment "small">>\ <<else>>\ You @@.girlVoice;flushed@@ at the mistake. How could you have missed something that obvious? You'd been in a rush to find a hiding spot, but you should have considered that. You'd assumed because you couldn't see her, she wouldn't be able to see you, ignoring the angle. Clearly your brain wasn't working as it should, if you'd @@.girlVoice;forgotten that she'd see things differently than you@@. <<changeEmbarassment "medium">>\ <</if>>\ Miki was delighted at the whole situation. The fact that neither of you were very good at hide and seek created some camaraderie. She'd probably made the @@.girlVoice;same mistake@@ during the game. The kind of mistake where you @@.girlVoice;forgot other people had different perspectives@@. It was the kind of mistake @@.girlVoice;no child above eight@@ would ever make, but you'd been stressed and pressured, and your brain @@.girlVoice;wasn't that advanced anymore@@. Having failed at your last attempt at hiding, it was time for you seek. [[Your turn|Hide and Seek Seeker]] <<changeHappiness "Miki" true>>\ <<set $mikiHideAndSeekEgocentricCaught to true>>\@@.mikiVoice;"Ready or not! Here I come!"@@ You panicked, you were out of time. Diving under the bed in the spare room, you wiggled forward until you felt safe. You could barely see anything from this angle, so it should be tough for Miki to find you. As time passed you were growing more confident. You could hear Miki wandering around but she hadn't actually checked this room yet. When she entered and you tensed, going completely silent. There was a long pause before she giggled. Why was she giggling? Had she been so thoroughly fooled by your cunning hiding spot that she'd broken down? Your confidence swelled, victory was assure-you let out a @@.girlVoice;squeal@@ as something grabbed onto your ankles. @@.mikiVoice;"Gotcha!"@@ The force began tugging, trying to pull you out from under the bed. [[Resist the force|Hide and Seek Egocentric Caught Resist]] [[Come out from under the bed|Hide and Seek Egocentric Caught Submit]] <<set $mikiHideAndSeekEgocentricCaught to true>>\Knowing you were caught you decided that resisting would only make things worse. Not like you could pretend you hadn't been found when they literally were holding onto you. There was a part of you that was worried it was a @@.girlVoice;monster@@ but you weren't a @@.girlVoice;scaredy-cat@@. The voice had sounded like Miki, and she was supposed to be seeking. So it had to be her, right? You wiggled your way out from under the bed. Once you'd gotten yourself free you looked up to see Miki's bright smiling face. @@.mikiVoice;"I caugh-chu"@@. [[You were shocked|Hide and Seek Egocentric Caught 2]]<<if $playerAge >= 8>>\ With your superior strength and size you were able to resist the dragging force. The force gave up for only a moment, before trying a new tactic. You felt a gentle pressure on your foot before the assault began. Trapped as you were you had no defence against the tickling fingers. <<playerVoice "\"Stop stop---I can't---\"">> Normally you weren't that ticklish but right now you were losing your mind. You were crying from laughing so hard and it was actually a little tough to breathe. <<if $traitWeakBladder>>Worse still you felt like you were about to @@.girlVoice;wet yourself@@.<</if>> <<playerVoice "\"Okay okay---I'm coming---out!\"">> Your every word was gasped out between @@.girlVoice;giggles@@. But your attacker understood, only continuing to tickle for a few more moments before letting you go. You wormed your way out from under the bed. Once you were fully out you flipped over to see Miki's bright smiling face. @@.mikiVoice;"I caugh-chu"@@. <<addTrait "$traitTicklish" "Ticklish" "trait">>\ <<set $mikiTickled to true>>\ <<else>>\ You resisted the best you could, but your angle gave you very little space to maneuver. Slowly but surely you were being dragged out from under the bed. The unrelenting force was simply too much to fight. You could only imagine how strong the one doing the pulling must be, to overpower you this way. You clawed at the carpet as a last ditch effort, but to no avail. Once you were fully out you flipped over to see the Hercules who had pulled you out. Instead you saw Miki's bright smiling face. @@.mikiVoice;"I caugh-chu"@@. She wouldn't know the house as well, but she was old enough that she'd be thorough. <<if $hideAndSeekHidingWins === 0>>And since you'd just lost to Emily you wanted to redeem yourself.<</if>> You could try to leverage the fact that you knew the house a lot better. She wouldn't know the basement very well, so you could probably hide down there. Or maybe you could try and abuse the fact she was awfully impulsive. [[Hide in the basement|Hide And Seek Hider Sophie Basement][$sophieHidingPlace to 0]] [[Hide behind the couch|Hide And Seek Hider Sophie Couch][$sophieHidingPlace to 1]]With your @@.girlVoice;new outfit@@ you waited in the living room for the other girls to trickle in. In Emily's room you'd been so confident in your outfit choice, but now, sitting here alone, you weren't so sure. <<if $playerAge >= 12>>\ You did look ridiculous in it after all, it was meant for a girl half your age. No way to know but to wait you supposed. <</if>>\ It seemed that Emily had taken the steps of gathering all the girls together before joining you in the living room. Surprisingly Kara was the first one to speak, @@.karaVoice;"ohmygosh, the outfit is sooo cute!"@@ The girls crowded around you, fawning over your @@.girlVoice;party dress@@. Time to get back to the game. Sophie, your turn."@@You hurried towards the basement. There was a good amount of junk down there so it should be possible to find some spot to tuck yourself into. Sophie probably wouldn't be patient enough to check everywhere. As you crossed the threshold to the basement you had an idea. At the bottom of the stairs there was a light switch. If you flipped it off then Sophie might not even realize that you'd come down here. Of course you'd have to find a hiding place in an almost pitch black basement<<if $traitAfraidOfTheDark>>...and that was @@.girlVoice;a super scary@@ idea<</if>>. <<if $traitAfraidOfTheDark>>[[Turn off the light|Hide and Seek Hider Sophie Basement Afraid of the Dark][$turnedOffBasementLight to false]]<<else>>[[Turn off the light|Hide and Seek Hider Sophie Basement 2][$turnedOffBasementLight to true]]<</if>> [[Leave the light on|Hide and Seek Hider Sophie Basement 2][$turnedOffBasementLight to false]]Working your way down the stairs you hesitated at the light. Your basement wasn't scary in general, but with all the lights out...it would be @@.girlVoice;awfully scary@@. But if you didn't do it then Sophie would know you came down here and you weren't sure you'd be able to find a good enough spot to fool her. So you took one last look at the room, planning your path, memorizing it so you could navigate it in the dark. Gathering your courage you flicked off the lights. ... The basement was pitch black. Without your sight your other senses heightened. You were more concious of the fact it was a little cooler down here, like some dark cave in the wilderness. Then there were the sounds. The near silence of the room made every sound stand out that much more. You recognized the hum of the air conditioner, but the other sounds were less familiar. There was creaking from above you. You looked towards it, but couldn't see anything in the dark. It sounded heavy, like some fearsome beast stalking it's prey. Then one of the noises started getting closer...and closer...and closer... [[It stopped above your head|Hide and Seek Hider Sophie Basement Afraid of the Dark 2]]<<playerVoice "\"Ahhhhh!\"">> You @@.girlVoice;squealed@@, fumbling around in the darkness for the light switch. <<if $playerMaturity >= 12>>Whatever it was was right on top of you.<<else>>The @@.girlVoice;monster@@ had to be right on top of you.<</if>> Your @@.girlVoice;panic@@ made your movements more awkward, flailing away at the light switch as your @@.girlVoice;terror@@ grew. Flicking it on you came face to face with...nothing. Looking around made it clear there was nothing else down here but you. Now, in the light, it was obvious what the noise had been. It'd just been the other girls wandering around trying to find their own hiding spots. Everything had just seemed @@.girlVoice;so much scarier@@ in the dark. But all of this had wasted more time, you'd never be able to make it back upstairs to a different spot. You had to find somewhere to hide down here, even if it was in the light and Sophie had no doubt heard your @@.girlVoice;scream@@ and would know you were down here. [[Wait for Sophie|Hide and Seek Hider Sophie Basement 3]]<<set $crossedBasementQuietly to true>>\ <<if $turnedOffBasementLight>>\ You took one last look across the basement. You flicked the light off, leaving the basement in near total darkness. <<if $traitCatgirl>>\ It turned out there was an unexpected benefit of being part cat. Your low light vision was excellent. Even in the gloom of the basement you could still sort of see. Everything was blurry and colorless, but it was enough to at least make out the shapes. <<if $traitClumsy>>However, being able to see didn't do anything to improve your @@.girlVoice;klutzy@@ nature. Finally you made it to your desired hiding spot, but it hadn't been a stealthy approach.<<set $crossedBasementQuietly to false>><<else>>Between that and being so light on your feet you were able to navigate the basement with relative ease and in near total silence.<</if>> <<include "Hide and Seek Hider Sophie Basement Wait Fragment">> <<else>> As you started to move across the room you realized you'd vastly overestimated your capabilities. After only a few steps you'd started to lose a sense of where you were in the space. You had no visual landmarks to help guide you. It was only once you bumped into a table, drawing a hiss of pain, that you were able to figure out where you were. <<if $traitClumsy>>\ <<include "Hide and Seek Hider Sophie Basement Lights Off Clumsy">> <<else>>\ In the dark it was near impossible to clearly see where you were going. Your mental map proving insufficient to prevent you from running into things. You tripped over a table, knocking something off of it, though you couldn't see what. Luckily you managed to keep your balance and continue. After a few more bumps and stumbles you were able to feel around the boxes at your desired hiding spot. You'd just have to hope that Sophie hadn't heard all the thumping you'd caused in your awkward stumble across the basement. <<include "Hide and Seek Hider Sophie Basement Wait Fragment">> <<set $crossedBasementQuietly to false>>\ <</if>>\ <</if>> <<else>>\ <<if $traitClumsy>>\ Even in the light your trip across the basement was @@.girlVoice;a bit of a disaster@@. First you tripped over a broom that you had totally seen leaning on the wall, you'd just misjudged how far the brush extended. You winced as it clattered to the ground with an unreasonable amount of noise. It wasn't the last thing you knocked askew. There was a book precariously balanced on the edge of the table and you'd managed to bump into it, knocking it onto the floor. It would be an obvious sign of your passage, but you didn't have time to fix it as Sophie would be done counting any moment. You hurried to your spot, half tripping over a box as you did. You'd just have to get lucky that Sophie did hear the noise, or notice the mess, or realize the light hadn't been on before...you had to admit things weren't looking great. <<include "Hide and Seek Hider Sophie Basement Wait Fragment">> <<set $crossedBasementQuietly to false>>\ <<elseif $traitOblivious>>\ Even in the light you trip across the basement wasn't entirely stealthy. You'd been so focused on your hiding spot that you were @@.girlVoice;completely oblivious@@ to everything else. You knocked over a broom that had been leaning against the wall, moving far too slowly to catch it. You winced as it clattered to the ground with an unreasonable amount of noise. You'd just have to hope Sophie somehow hadn't heard it. This mistake mostly kept you focused enough on the rest of the trip that you did manage to avoid a couple more near misses. Carefully moving around a delicately balanced broom, and an awkwardly placed table. Sophie would certainly see the light you'd left on, but you hadn't made a sound. Maybe she wouldn't realize it had been off before, and even if she did she couldn't be sure anyone had stayed down there afterwards. <<include "Hide and Seek Hider Sophie Basement Wait Fragment">> <</if>>\ <</if>>\<<silently>>\ <<if $traitBornToLose>> <<set _successChance to 0>> <<elseif $crossedBasementQuietly>> <<set _successChance to 100>> <<else>>\ <<set _successChance to 50>> <</if>> <<set _success to random(100) <= _successChance>> <</silently>>\ <<if $turnedOffBasementLight>>\ The lights to the basement flicked on. \ <</if>>\ You heard the creak of stairs as Sophie made her way down. With Sophie out of sight you shifted your position slightly, so you weren't as visible from the staircase. It would be embarrassing for her to find you accidentally when she came down the stairs. The sounds of the girls scattering reached your ears. You considered, if you just peeked through your fingers, it would give you an excellent sense of where the girls were going. [[Peek|Hide and Seek Cheater]] [[Play Fair|Hide and Seek Find Miki]] <<set $hideAndSeekActivityResult to 2>>\<<silently>>\ <<set $hideAndSeekGirlsFound to 0>> <<set $letMikiHide to false>> <<set $hideAndSeekLetMikiWin to false>> <<set $hideAndSeekMindsetCount to 0>> <<set $mindsetBonus to 0>> <</silently>>\<<if $playerMaturity <= 6>>\ <<playerVoice "\Twenty eight...twenty nine...fourty...">> You counted out loud, belatedly you realized the mistake. Hurriedly you tried to correct yourself, but you'd somewhat lost your place, <<playerVoice "\"thirty four...thirty five...\"">> <</if>>\ <<playerVoice "\"Fifty eight...fifty nine...sixty. Ready or not here I come!\"">> You opened your eyes to the empty living room, the girls having long scattered to their respective hiding places. You listened to see if there were any clues you could glean, but heard nothing. Wherever they'd scurried of to they were well settled. How to go about finding them? The house was pretty big and they could have gotten into all sorts of nooks and crannies. Plus if they were clever enough, they might re-hide themselves once you passed by. No one ever checked somewhere they'd already checked. <<if $playerMaturity <= 6>>You took a deep breath, @@.girlVoice;this was gonna be tough@@. The two of them conspiring to have a little fun with you. @@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@Aloha e aloha e@@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@ The sound managed to permeate your mind and though your eyes were still on the hoop your body started to move. @@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@A'Ano 'ai ke aloha e@@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@ You were only dimly aware of the movements your body was doing. Emily hurried off to get the requested materials. On the other hand you were struggling. You'd grit your teeth to try and get through it, but your eyes had started to water. Miki had been right, your knee looked practically covered in blood. <<if $playerMaturity <= 9 || $traitCrybaby>>\ You @@.girlVoice;whined@@ at the sight. [[Your last moments|Skinned Knee 1a]] <<else>>\ Rationally you knew it was probably not as bad as it looked. The blood has just spread out. There was a second scrape on your elbow, but it was less immediately visible so it wasn't causing the same distress. Your hands had also gotten some nasty scuffs, but at least they weren't bleeding. You'd never liked blood, but now it seemed more distressing than ever. Maybe it was the stress of the day or maybe it was the ambient magic messing with your mind. Either way the tears building in your eyes were about to overflow whether you wanted them to or not. [[Suffer through the pain|Skinned Knee 1b]] <</if>>\Your @@.girlVoice;continued wailing@@ was distressing the other girls. None of them knew what to do and Miki was about to start crying herself. Maybe you'd been a little overzealous to say you were going to die...it was just a scrape, just a little blood. @@.girlVoice;Blood was scary@@ and you were still @@.girlVoice;scared@@, but having the other girls there was helping. Worse you could already feel the tears threatening to burst forth again if you got too emotional. <<if $sophieHappiness >= 7>>@@.sophieVoice;"Well I guess I'll just need to keep $them out of trouble."@@<<else>>@@.sophieVoice;"Well I'll make sure not to tease $them too much, wouldn't want $them bawling again."<</if>> @@.emilyVoice;"Sophie..."@@ Emily's voice had a hint of warning, @@.emilyVoice;"don't be mean. <<playerName>> just had a really hard time. But lets take our minds off of it. What do you say we get back to the games?"@@ <<if $skinnedKneeReturnValue == 1>>\ [[Back to gymnastics|Gymnastics Round 1b]] <<elseif $skinnedKneeReturnValue == 2>>\ [[Back to gymnastics|Gymnastics Round 2c]] <<else>>\ [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<pushJournalEntry "climbATree" "Journal Climb Tree">>\ <</if>>\ <<addTrait "$traitCrybaby" "Crybaby" "trait">>\ <<set $traitSkinnedKnee to true>>\ <<changeMaturity "small">>\The group made the move to the final station, this one you didn't need an explanation for. @@.emilyVoice;"It's time for Twister!"@@ Emily seemed awfully excited for this one...that wasn't true, she was //always// this excited. @@.emilyVoice;"Now it says no more than four players, but that's for adults. So we can fit everyone."@@ She turned to you with her best puppy dog eyes, @@.emilyVoice;"You are going to play, right?"@@ [[You'll play|Twister Accept Start]] [[You're sitting out|Twister Reject Start]] <<set $miniOlympicsState to 5>>\ <<addToActivityCount>>\<<silently>>\ <<set $twisterSuccessChance to 40>>\ <<if $playerAge > 7 && $playerAge <= 12>>\ <<set $twisterSuccessChance+=5>>\ <</if>>\ <</silently>>\ @@.emilyVoice;"Yay!"@@ It seemed impossible, but her excitement had spiked even further. It was going to be tight fit <<if $playerAge > 10>>especially considering how much bigger you were.<<else>>with five @@.girlVoice;little girls@@ on one mat.<</if>> <<if !$awareOfSkirtIssues && (getCurrentOutfit().bottom === 'skirt' || getCurrentOutfit().bottom === 'dress')>>\ You were about to get into position when you realized something you'd never had to consider before. Huh, a cute little piece of magic, pretty niche but handy in this case. Sophie nudged you with an elbow, spurring you into motion. Right foot blue. Easy enough for now, but this was going to get messy quickly. <<if $traitRapunzelHair>>\ Your hair was going to be a problem. A serious one. If there was any mercy it was the fact that it might impede the other girls as much as you. <<set $twisterSuccessChance-=30>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $traitCatgirl>>\ Your tail twitched in anticipation of the continued competition. [[Continue the game|Twister Gameplay]]<<if $twisterSuccessChance < random(100)>>\ <<include "Twister Regular Success 1">> <<else>>\ <<if random(100) < 50 || $traitRapunzelHair>>\ <<include "Twister Regular Fail">> <<else>>\ <<include "Twister Critical Fail">> <</if>>\ <</if>>\@@.momVoice;"<<print $twisterLimbArray.random()>> <<print $twisterColorArray.random()>>"@@ You started to move through the mass of limbs surrounding you... You yelped as Miki suddenly snaked a limb underneath you, getting to a spot you thought had been blocked off. She twisted her head over to you and grinned, proud of her little maneuver. [[Next Round|Twister Regular Success 2]]<<set _currentLimb to $twisterLimbArray.random()>>\ @@.momVoice;"<<print _currentLimb>> <<print $twisterColorArray.random()>>"@@ <<if $playerMaturity <= 7>>\ <<if _currentLimb == "Right hand">>\ @@.mikiVoice;"That's your left hand,"@@ Miki whispered.\ <<elseif _currentLimb == "Left hand">>\ @@.mikiVoice;"That's your right hand,"@@ Miki whispered.\ <<elseif _currentLimb == "Left foot">>\ @@.mikiVoice;"That's your right foot,"@@ Miki whispered.\ <<elseif _currentLimb == "Right foot">>\ @@.mikiVoice;"That's your left foot,"@@ Miki whispered.\ <</if>>\ You silently thanked Miki. It was a @@.girlVoice;silly mistake@@, the kind you were worryingly making more and more of... <<changeEmbarassment "small">>\ <</if>>\ There was a gasp as Kara wobbled in place. At first it looked like she might be able to recover it but her balance wasn't as good as the other girls. She wasn't able to hold the odd position, crashing down to the mat. She let out of huff and left the mat. In the momentary distraction of Kara's fall you felt something poke at your side, nearly throwing you off balance. Once you recovered you twisted your head around to see the perpetrator. You saw Emily, head down, hands innocently on the ground. <<if $traitGiggly || $playerMaturity < 11>>You @@.girlVoice;giggled@@ at her sabotage attempt.<<else>>Annoying little brat had tried to knock you over.<</if>> [[Try to knock over Emily|Twister Regular Success 3][$tryToTripEmily to true]] [[Focus on playing|Twister Regular Success 3][$tryToTripEmily to false]]<<if $traitOblivious>>\ You saw the other girls start to move. @@.girlThought;Oh no. I wasn't paying attention.@@ You'd been so focused on balancing you'd entirely missed the instruction. She wormed her way off the mat, joining Kara by the spinner. [[Next Round|Twister Regular Success 4]]@@.momVoice;"<<print $twisterLimbArray.random()>> <<print $twisterColorArray.random()>>"@@ Emily screamed theatrically as she fell. Contorted as you were you didn't actually see what had managed to put her over the edge. Though looking at Sophie's grin it seemed there may have been some shenanigans at play. But her malicious actions came back to haunt her. She squealed as her hand slipped and she thudded against the ground. @@.sophieVoice;"Darn! Why was that spot so slippery."@@ With that you were the only one left on the mat. Despite all odds [[you've won!|Twister Win]]Unfortunately you were the first fall. <<if $traitRapunzelHair>>Your hair had been just as detrimental as you'd thought. You hadn't paid attention to it and it'd gotten under your hand which sent you right to the ground.<<else>>There was really no excuse for it, you'd just let yourself get distracted and that had been enough to throw off your balance.<</if>> So you were a little grumpy when you sat down by the spinner, by yourself. The others would be joining you soon enough, but for now it was just the shame of being the first out. It was mean to think so but you weren't surprised when Kara was the first one to fall. Sliding her away off the mat and making her way over to sit with you. She sat down in a huff, clearly not happy with the situation. This whole Olympics competition hadn't gone well for her. She was being routinely outdone by Emily and Sophie, but even Miki had beaten her a couple times. That had to be both frustrating and embarrassing. Sitting here after being knocked out first you could kind of understand the feeling. [[Talk to her|Twister Regular Fail 2][$twisterTalkToKara to true]] [[Stay Quiet|Twister Regular Fail 2][$twisterTalkToKara to false]] <<changeEmbarassment "small">>\<<if $twisterTalkToKara>>\ <<playerVoice "\"You doing alright?\"">> You did your best to keep your voice neutral, you didn't want to insult her if you were reading too far into things. @@.karaVoice;"I'm fine!"@@ Kara snapped, quickly proving that she wasn't. <<playerVoice "\"Well you did a lot better than me,\"">> <<if $playerAge < 7>>you weren't sure how much of a comfort that was considering you were even @@.girlVoice;younger@@ than her.<<else>>hoping that would be some comfort.<</if>> @@.karaVoice;"I did, didn't I?"@@ Kara smiled. She wasn't Sophie, so she wasn't going to rub in that fact, but it did make her feel better to not be last. <<if $karaInferiorityComplex >= 2>>It made you feel more comfortable that way, seeing Kara down about losing made you uncomfortable.<<elseif $playerMaturity <= 8>>It @@.girlVoice;really sucked@@ to admit you'd got beaten.<<else>>It was only a small sacrifice on your part to admit the loss.<</if>> However, as smart as she was, Kara was still 7, her emotions were going to be awfully fragile. <<changeHappiness "Kara" true>>\ <<else>>\ The two of you sat in silence as the game continued. [[Talk to her|Twister Regular Fail 3][$twisterTalkToMiki to true]] [[Stay Quiet|Twister Regular Fail 3][$twisterTalkToMiki to false]]<<if $twisterTalkToMiki>>\ <<playerVoice "\"Having fun?\"">> You knew that Miki had been struggling to keep up with the older girls. Arms snaked under legs and legs overtop of people's heads. All in all, a rather normal game of Twister just amped up by the overfull board. @@.momVoice;"'Left Foot Blue'"@@ That instruction was going to be awfully tricky, you had other limbs locked in ways that restricted motion, plus all the close circles were taken. You stretched out your foot...just a little further and you'd be able to...your toe touched it and you rejoiced. But the moment you tried to put any weight on it everything went wrong. You weren't actually sure if you were the one that fell first, or one of the girls had dragged you down. Regardless, the tangle of limbs meant that when one of you went down it was going to bring down the whole group. Which is where the real problem started. Packed as tightly as you were you'd ended up with arms and legs splayed out everywhere. It wasn't like one of you was on top and could get off first, it was some latticework where everyone was partially both over and under someone else. <<if $playerAge > 12>>Luckily you were near the bottom so you didn't end up crushing anyone. <</if>> Everyone began their attempts to get up. The first couple attempts went nowhere, Sophie tried to rise, but so did Kara, which ended up aborting both their attempts. Miki just failed outright and ended up thudding into you. You tried but you were basically buried under all of them. The next couple attempts went no better. Everyone had given up on trying to rise, too busy laughing at themselves. You could feel your own laugh building in your throat. He'd rode long and hard in order to slay the ''right hand'' of the ''red'' queen. At her ''left hand'' sat the mysterious ''blue'' lady. His ''right foot'' crunched onto the gravel, the ''green'' knight moved carefully. In truth he would give his ''right hand'' in order to save the princess in ''yellow''. His ''left foot'' stomped on a dry twig, alerting the dread wolves who roamed this forest. Their ''red'' eyes boring into him. Perhaps his offer of his ''right hand'' would be taken, as the ground was stained ''red'' with blood. Meanwhile the princess' ''right hand'' twirled a lock of her ''yellow'' hair. She was a fair maiden of only $playerAge, when would her knight save her? Instead she was stuck here under the cruel ''left hand'' of the ''blue'' lady. But she knew he would come and save her, oh he'd give his famed ''left hand'' in order to save his princess in ''yellow''... [[Back to the Party|Event Handler]] <<silently>>\ <<set $twisterActivityResult to 1>> <<changeEmbarassment "small">> <<addTrait "$traitDaydreamer" "Daydreamer" "trait">>\ <<set $sophieOlympicScore+=25>> <<set $emilyOlympicScore+=20>> <<set $mikiOlympicScore+=15>> <<set $karaOlympicScore+=12>> <<pushJournalEntry "twister" "Journal Twister">> <<set $declineActivityCount++>> <</silently>>\<<if $playerMaturity <= 6>>\ I won at twister! <<elseif $playerMaturity <= 10>>\ <<switch $twisterActivityResult>>\ <<case 1>>\ I @@.strikethrough;defeantly@@ totally didn't want to play Twister. She was so searious with those little chubby cheeks trying to comfort me.<</if>> I think Sophie won, but I wasn't really paying atenttion much\ <</if>>\ <<case 4>>\ I dunno how it happenned but I totally won at Twister! I only stuck my tonge out at them a little bit, they totally deserve it though, I bet Sophie was suuuper mad about losing she's super compeditive.\ <</switch>>\ <<elseif $playerMaturity == 13>>\ <<switch $twisterActivityResult>>\ <<case 1>>\ I had no interest in playing Twister, that's such a kids game, once you get big it totally doesn't work anymore. I kinda wanted another game, but we had other stuff to do. <<else>>\ <<if $twisterTalkToKara>>Kara lost next and she felt really crappy about it, I talked to her some to make her feel better though it only worked cause I'd lost worse.<</if>> <<if $twisterTalkToMiki>>Okay sometimes Miki is pretty cute. When she got knocked out she was all worried that I felt bad about losing. I don't really get it but I actually totally won. Like it wasn't easy, Emily and Sophie were so trying to trip me and Miki and Kara were trying super hard to but I still won which made it way more fun than it would have been otherwise.\ <</switch>>\ <<else>>\ <<switch $twisterActivityResult>>\ <<case 1>>\ I refused to play Twister, so I ended up calling out instructions instead. The whole thing was pretty boring and I ended up daydreaming to entertain myself. Something about the monotony of the words just lured me half to sleep. Unconsciously it ended up about princes and princesses and unicorns and witches and pretty jewels...uh anyway, Sophie won.\ <<case 2>>\ The Twister competition was a total disaster. Somebody fell, no one is quite sure who, and brought it down the entire group. The girls were just giggling about the whole thing. It even started an entire tickle fight which I couldn't escape from. Embarrassingly even I ended up joining in their girlish laughter. I was being tickled, of course I laughed, what else would you expect? Regardless in the game there were no @@.strikethrough;survivors@@ winners.\ <<case 3>>\ Apparently I'm not the best at Twister. I got knocked out first. <<if $playerAge >= 10>>I'd blame being bigger than them, but I'm not sure if that's an advantage or a disadvantage.<<else>>I was even the same size as them, maybe I'm just not used to my new reduced height.<</if>>\ <<if $twisterTalkToMiki + $twisterTalkToKara === 0>>\ I sat there in silence for the rest of the game. <<if $traitEnergetic>>It was really boring.<<else>>A little bit of quiet was nice.<</if>> \ <<else>>\ <<if $twisterTalkToKara>>I ended up talking to Kara. She was pretty broken up about losing, but I was able to cheer her up a little bit.<</if>> <<if $twisterTalkToMiki>>When Miki got knocked out she actually tried to comfort me about losing so early. It was rather sweet of her and actually did take off some of the sting.<</if>> \ <</if>>\ In the end Sophie knocked out Emily, though I'm pretty sure Emily just got bored and gave up.\ <<case 4>>\ Though it was a surprise to everyone, including me, I was able to pull out a win in Twister. However it wasn't without difficulty. Emily and Sophie tried to sabotage my attempts. Miki and Kara behaved, but Miki was so small she kept sneaking under me. Regardless I think they at least had some fun.\ <</switch>>\ <</if>>\@@.emilyVoice;"You are so immature,"@@ Emily pouted, the annoyance building on her face. @@.sophieVoice;"She's right, you've got to be able to handle losing without freaking out."@@ Emily's faced shifted from surprise to delight to determination in only a moment, @@.emilyVoice;"you're right Sophie, <<playerName>> needs to learn how to lose and not be a baby about it."@@ She threateningly brandished her wand. But she didn't point it at you, at least not at first. Instead she started chanting in what you assumed to be Latin, or maybe it was just gibberish. Either way it made you nervous, normally she just pointed at things and they happened. What sort of magic required her to actually use some kind of incantation? She continued to chant and you could feel a static charge building in the air. Even the other girls looked a little nervous at Emily's intensity. Finally the words came to a head and she pointed the wand at you, a bolt of pink lighting lancing from the tip and striking you straight in the chest and...nothing? The static charge dissipated and Emily sagged in place. Had her spell not worked? It didn't feel like anything had changed, then again if she was messing with your head would you really be able to tell? The girls had gone over to Emily when she slumped, worried about her health. Emily whispered something to Sophie who proceeded to stomp over to you, it seemed that some of Emily's annoyance had rubbed off. @@.sophieVoice;"We're going to play a little game,"@@ she smirked, @@.sophieVoice;"if you win then Emily will undo this."@@ Annoyingly she declined to identify what 'this' actually was. <<playerVoice "\"What sort of game?\"">> @@.sophieVoice;"Nothing too hard. Just a little rock paper scissors, best five of nine."@@ Shit, that was a pretty long match, but it was an easy enough game and your odds should be at least 50/50. It seemed like a good bet to at least try. [[You're on|Born to Lose curse 2]] <<changeHappiness "Emily" false>> <<changeHappiness "Sophie" false>> <<changeHappiness "Miki" false>> <<changeHappiness "Kara" false>><<if $rpsLosses === 0>>\ @@.sophieVoice;"Now I'm not very good at this, but don't go easy on me."@@ That was a strange admission from Sophie, normally she'd brag if she was good and stay quiet if not. What was her game? <<else>>\ You threw $rpsChoice but Sophie threw <<include "RPS Counterpick">>, so she'd won this round<<if $rpsLosses > 1>>, again<</if>>. <</if>>\ <<if $rpsLosses < 5>>\ What will you throw? [[Rock|Born to Lose curse 2][$rpsChoice to "Rock"]] [[Paper|Born to Lose curse 2][$rpsChoice to "Paper"]] [[Scissors|Born to Lose curse 2][$rpsChoice to "Scissors"]] <<set $rpsLosses++>>\ <<else>>\ @@.sophieVoice;"Last chance~"@@ Sophie teased, it seemed impossible, she'd beaten you 4 times in a row, without a single tie. Was she able to read your mind or something? Had that been the prize she'd gotten for winning? You did your best to blank your mind and choose randomly. <span id="rpsChoice">[[Rock|Born to Lose curse 3][$rpsChoice to $randomRPSChoice]]</span>\ <<repeat 1s>>\ <<set $randomRPSChoice to ['Rock', 'Paper', 'Scissors'].random()>>\ <<filterreplace "#rpsChoice">>\ [[$randomRPSChoice|Born to Lose curse 3][$rpsChoice to $randomRPSChoice]] <</filterreplace>>\ <</repeat>>\ <</if>>\You stared down helplessly at Sophie's choice of <<include "RPS Counterpick">>. @@.sophieVoice;"And that's five, better luck next time <<playerName>>,"@@ she turned to Emily and gave a thumbs up. You looked gormlessly between the two of them, what exactly was going on? <<if $traitCrybaby>> <<playerVoice "\"What did you do!?\"">> You @@.girlVoice;whined@@. You were already frustrated that you'd lost so many times, having a secret kept from you only made it worse. @@.sophieVoice;"Kicked your butt,"@@ Sophie unhelpfully retorted. Her juvenile jibe was enough to push you over the edge, <<playerVoice "\"Tell me!\"">> You screeched, about to cry. But Emily was having none of it. @@.emilyVoice;"Nuh uh, you're not crying your way out of this,"@@ any sympathy Emily had about your earlier crying sessions was gone. @@.emilyVoice;"You didn't play so you have to deal with the con-see-quen-sees."@@ Emily struggled through the word, but you got the message. Glancing around you could see that none of the girls were going to take your side. <<playerVoice "/"Fine,/"">> you stomped your foot and marched back inside with a huff, your face burning as you went. Now out of the moment you were mortified about how @@.girlVoice;immature@@ you'd been. Having a meltdown @@.girlVoice;like a toddler@@. You tried to calm yourself. This party was messing with your mind, it was hard but you couldn't let yourself slip into such @@.girlVoice;infantile@@ behaviour. You'd figure out what Emily had done eventually, you just had to be patient. <<if $traitEnergetic>>Even though you were @@.girlVoice;terrible@@ at being patient.<</if>> <<changeEmbarassment "medium">>\ <<changeMaturity "small">>\ <<else>> <<playerVoice "\"Does anyone want to tell me what just happened?\"">> @@.sophieVoice;"You got beat by a girl, that's what happened. You better used to it."@@ Sophie grinned at you, clearly that was all the explanation you were going to get. The other girls were already heading back inside for the next activity. Leaving you with the knowledge that Emily had done something terrible to you, but with no idea as to what. <</if>> [[Back to the Party|Event Handler]] <<addTrait "$traitBornToLose" "Born to Lose" "curse">>\ <<pushJournalEntry "olympicsFinals" "Journal Olympics Finale">><<if $rpsChoice === "Rock">>\ paper\ <<elseif $rpsChoice === "Paper">>\ scissors\ <<else>>\ rock\ <</if>>\Emily huffed, @@.emilyVoice;"Mommy and I worked so hard on this and you just wanna say it's boring?"@@ She looked down and took a steadying breath before looking back at you with a grin, @@.emilyVoice;"Well I think the problem is you think too hard. You've got all those dumb boy thoughts mucking it up."@@ <<if $playerMaturity >= 13>>You were about to correct her that those 'dumb boy thoughts' were better called 'being more mature than a toddler'.<<elseif $playerMaturity >= 9>>You were going to correct her that you didn't have many @@.girlVoice;dumb boy thoughts@@ anymore.<<else>>You were going to correct her that you didn't have any @@.girlVoice;dumb boy thoughts@@ anymore.<</if>> Yet it suddenly became hard to even form the thought, let alone trying to speak it. It felt like everything was moving through molasses, and only got worse if you kept reaching for that thought. Any attempt at forming some pithy response was met by powerful resistance. So you followed a path of less resistance, letting your mind @@.girlVoice;drift away@@ onto something else. It was a struggle to keep focus on anything concrete, so you let it drift to more amorphous idea. Following a @@.girlVoice;fantastical@@ line of thinking about //literally// being stuck in molasses and swimming around in it, then having a boat to sail on... @@.emilyVoice;"There,"@@ Emily's voice broke your dreamlike state, @@.emilyVoice;"now you'll be able to entertain yourself no matter what. [[Emily giggled|Olympics Critical Loss Bored 2]]@@.emilyVoice;"Don't you worry your pretty little head about it, it's complicated magic stuff. You wouldn't understand...just relax and have fun, it'll be way easier."@@ @@.girlThought;That does sound easier.@@ You tried to re-centre yourself, what had you been so mad about? It'd seemed so keen a few moments ago, but now you couldn't even remember the details. @@.girlThought;Whatever. If it was important I would have remembered.@@ The fact that Emily was still pointing her wand at you @@.girlVoice;slipped your notice@@. After a little bit she didn't even need to reinforce it, your brain was so @@.girlVoice;slippery@@ now, nothing really stuck. @@.emilyVoice;"See? Doesn't that feel much better."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Yeah...it does.\"">> Without anything negative to dwell on you felt a lot brighter. You took more than a few moments to think up a further response, but by the time you did Emily had already walked away. Joining the rest of the girls heading inside for the next activity. You tried to collect yourself, but your brain still @@.girlVoice;felt funny@@ when you tried to focus. You were sure it would clear, you just had to make sure you didn't lose yourself in @@.girlVoice;daydreams@@ of sailing on a sea of molasses...fighting terrifying pirates... [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<silently>>\ TODO: How to handle multiple trait additions <<pushJournalEntry "olympicsFinals" "Journal Olympics Finale">> <<addTrait "$traitDaydreamer" "Daydreamer" "trait">>\ <<addTrait "$traitOblivious" "Oblivious" "trait">>\ <<addTrait "$traitForgetful" "Forgetful" "trait">>\ <<changeMaturity "small">> <<changeHappiness "Emily" false>> <</silently>>\Emily sighed, @@.emilyVoice;"Why didn't you just say so dummy? <<if $skippingActivityResult === 1>>Miki taught you how to turn the ropes<<elseif $hulaAdviceFromEmily>>I taught you how to hula better<<else>>We're not that mean<</if>>, why didn't you just ask for more help?"@@ Kara cut in, @@.karaVoice;"it can be embarrassing to ask for help."@@ she spoke as someone who'd nervously been asked a lot of questions. @@.mikiVoice;"It's scary to ask!"@@ Miki helpfully added, which seemed to inspire the entire group. There was a spark of excitement and a sudden shared understanding of what to do. Miki and Kara each grabbed one of your hands and started dragging you back towards the Hula Hoop station. Sophie and Emily slid in behind you and Emily poked you in the back with her wand. It was clear this wasn't something you could decline. @@.emilyVoice;"You can ask us anything <<playerName>>. Ask all the questions you want. You've got so much to learn and we'll be your teachers."@@ <<if $playerMaturity <= 11>>You were @@.girlVoice;pretty excited@@, though you tried not to show it. If this was supposed to be a punishment you shouldn't look like you were enjoying yourself too much.<<else>>You weren't exactly thrilled by the concept. You were the eldest one here<<if $playerAge < 9>>, or at least you had been,<</if>> you were supposed to be teaching them. What were you going to learn from some grade schoolers?<</if>> What ensued was a whirlwind of training, as you went back over all of little games, now complete with incredibly detailed instructions. There was no competition, all the girls were working together towards the singular goal of teaching you. Which meant that ''all'' of the attention was on you. Every time you dropped the hula hoop, every time you stumbled trying to skip, they were right there correcting you. At first you tried to just stay quiet and do what they said, even when their instructions didn't make total sense. This went poorly; it was @@.girlVoice;taking an eternity@@ to learn anything. You couldn't stand it, so finally you started asking questions. Asking for little clarifications on this and that so you'd be more likely to succeed. This made things a little better, but there were still times when you fundamentally didn't understand something and were too embarrassed to ask. This came to a head when you once again tripped skipping, you couldn't figure out how to jump fast enough to deal with the speed section. Finally you broke down, <<playerVoice "\"I don't get it! How do you jump so fast?\"">> [[The girls giggled|Olympics Critical Loss Inept 2]]@@.mikiVoice;"You shouldn't jump silly."@@ Miki laughed. A laugh which travelled contagiously to the other girls. At first it was terribly embarrassing. You'd finally asked a vulnerable question and they'd teased you about your ignorance. Sophie patted your arm, @@.sophieVoice;"we were beginning to think you'd never ask."@@ <<playerVoice "\"You knew I didn't know?\"">> @@.sophieVoice;"Of course! We could all see you were doing it wrong, but we couldn't just tell you..."@@ <<playerVoice "\"I had to ask...\"">> @@.sophieVoice;"Exactly! I knew you'd figure this out eventually. Now let's show how you to do this properly."@@ [[The lessons continued|Olympics Critical Loss Inept 3]]The ensuing lesson was vastly more effective than the ones before, working all the way back to the basics. Basics that you didn't know, but had been too embarrassed to ask about. The longer it went on the more comfortable you were with asking even the 'dumbest' of questions. In fact it was like you couldn't stop asking things. Blurting out anything that @@.girlVoice;popped into your head@@. Now that you were asking questions you were @@.girlVoice;talking@@ as much as you were learning. But it was so much better! You learned things so much faster and your mistakes seemed less serious. Making a mistake wasn't an embarrassment you had to hide from, it was a @@.girlVoice;funny@@ error that you could learn from. It was for the best that you were learning to find the humor, because despite their best efforts you had //a lot// to learn. They were all being super nice about it though, and now you were joining in with their @@.girlVoice;giggles@@ when you got caught by the rope. [[More to learn|Olympics Critical Loss Inept 4]]However all this dry teaching was starting to become @@.girlVoice;boring@@ and you were all losing focus. Abandoning a complicated movement after only one failure because you wanted to just get to the next thing. Though sometimes that next thing got delayed by a random discussion about the girls at Sophie's gym, or Miki's play at recess or a dozen other unimportant, but @@.girlVoice;oddly interesting@@ topics. Kara was the one who realized things had entirely collapsed. You'd all been sitting in the grass @@.girlVoice;giggling@@ about something silly Miki's brother had done. @@.karaVoice;"I don't think <<playerName>> is going to learn much from this."@@ That set the entire group off into a @@.girlVoice;shrill, giggling mess@@. It hadn't even been that funny, but it was a little silly, and once one of you had started laughing, it was infectious. [[Time to head back|Olympics Critical Loss Inept 5]]All of you stood to head back inside. <<playerVoice "\"So your brother //really// thought he made the teacher change the answer?\"">> @@.mikiVoice;"Uh huh, he thought he was //so smart// that he'd outsmarted her."@@ <<playerVoice "\"He's eight!\"">> @@.mikiVoice;"I know! He's such a jerk."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Total jerk.\"">> The two of you laughed. @@.sophieVoice;"If you're all done gabbing, time to get back to playing."@@ Sophie teased. You @@.girlVoice;loved talking@@ to Miki, and wanted to keep swapping stories, but you were also @@.girlVoice;way too eager@@ to just keep sitting around. So you took off at a run, <<playerVoice "\"last one in is a rotten egg!\"">> Sophie barked in protest as you blew past her, but hurried to catch you. Emily and Kara drawn into your race as you passed them, Miki trailing in the back. This whole training session had made you feel @@.girlVoice;so much closer@@ with all the girls. Even if sometimes you'd @@.girlVoice;felt really silly and childish@@ they were still nice. Even when you @@.girlVoice;giggling on the ground@@ they still tried to pick you up. Excitement was @@.girlVoice;bubbling up@@ inside you. So many @@.girlVoice;games to play@@, @@.girlVoice;things to talk about@@, @@.girlVoice;jokes to tell@@. You were super excited to get to the rest of the party. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<silently>>\ <<pushJournalEntry "olympicsFinals" "Journal Olympics Finale">> <<changeEmbarassment "medium">> <<changeMaturity "small">> <<changeAge "small">> <<addTrait "$traitChatterbox" "Chatterbox" "trait">>\ <<addTrait "$traitEnergetic" "Energetic" "trait">>\ <<addTrait "$traitGiggly" "Giggly" "trait">>\ <<changeHappiness "Emily" true>> <<changeHappiness "Sophie" true>> <<changeHappiness "Kara" true>> <<changeHappiness "Miki" true>> <</silently>>\@@.sophieVoice;"Ha! I knew it, you're just a big baby."@@ Sophie chided. You bristled at the accusation, you weren't being a baby. You were just being practical. These events were obviously skewed towards their particular skills. You hadn't really known how to do any of them. Chances were good that you would have screwed up, looked silly and then gotten teased about it. You could tolerate teasing if you had to, but why would you put yourself into the position? @@.sophieVoice;"I don't get it. I screw up stuff all the time, you can't be scared about that."@@ @@.emilyVoice;"Other things are //way// scarier than losing."@@ Her tone was cryptic. She was begging you to ask the question, you didn't want to, but you felt @@.girlVoice;compelled@@ to find out. <<playerVoice "\"Like what?\"">> Emily smiled, @@.emilyVoice;"well Kara doesn't like heights."@@ @@.karaVoice;"Its scary,"@@ Kara admitted. <<if $traitAfraidOfHeights>>\ You understood her entirely you @@.girlVoice;hated@@ the idea of being high up. @@.karaVoice;"What if you fall? It's so high up and I get all dizzy-"@@ You cut her off, <<playerVoice "\"stop.\"">> Your own head was already swimming at the idea, you @@.girlVoice;didn't want to think about it.@@ <<else>>\ @@.karaVoice;"What if you fall? It's so high up and I get all dizzy and what if the thing you're standing on breaks?"@@ Anxiety was beginning to creep into her voice and it began to scratch at your own mind. Being up high was @@.girlVoice;kinda scary@@ when you thought about it. If you were up high enough then you could fall and hurt yourself. @@.karaVoice;"Did you know that twenty five percent of fatal falls are from less than 10 feet?"@@ An icy lance shot through your heart. <<playerVoice "\"Ten feet...\"">> You'd been thinking it might be @@.girlVoice;scary@@ to be at the top of a tree or a skyscraper. But ten feet was only as high as a ladder or a slide. You imagined yourself at the top of a ladder, an image that suddenly proved @@.girlVoice;terrifying@@. You could //die// up there. <</if>>\ Emily looked satisfied, @@.emilyVoice;"see? Way more scary. How bout you Sophie? Why don't you tell us what scares you?"@@ [[Sophie's fear|Olympics Critical Loss Scared 2]] <<addTrait "$traitAfraidOfHeights" "Heights" "fear">>\At first Sophie scoffed, @@.sophieVoice;"I'm not afraid of anything."@@ @@.emilyVoice;"Really Sophie? Nothing at all?~"@@ It was clear that Emily knew //exactly// what scared Sophie. The two of them locked eyes and Sophie was the first to look away. <span class="smallText">@@.sophieVoice;"Bugs"@@</span> @@.emilyVoice;"Hmmm? What was that?"@@ @@.sophieVoice;"It's bugs! I'm scared of bugs!"@@ Sophie turned to you awaiting your reaction. <<if $traitAfraidOfBugs>>\ You would never make fun of her for being scared of something like that. Bugs were just so @@.girlVoice;creepy@@ some of them had too many legs and they had weird heads and they were all @@.girlVoice;gross@@ and @@.girlVoice;slimy@@. You shivered, feeling slightly nauseous at the mere thought of those disgusting little things. <<else>>\ //Bugs? Really? That's it?// It was no wonder that she'd been loath to admit that fear. It was so stereotypically girly and clashed with her normally self-assured aura. It was hard to imagine her screeching and running away from a spider or a cockroach. You'd really be able to tease her about this one. @@.sophieVoice;"No one likes bugs,"@@ Sophie grumbled, @@.sophieVoice;"they're all creepy and crawly and eughh..."@@ she shivered. Your desire to taunt her started to wane. Bugs were kind of @@.girlVoice;weird looking@@ even at a distance, and up close they were worse. Wasn't like you loved bugs either. @@.sophieVoice;"Spiders are the worst,"@@ she stated with the utmost confidence, @@.sophieVoice;"they've got too many legs and sticky webs and you never know where they are."@@ The hackles rose on the back of your neck. Spiders were hard to track, they could hide almost anywhere, and it was so easy just to walk into a @@.girlVoice;gross@@ web. @@.sophieVoice;"One time one got on the back of my neck. I didn't see it, I just felt the tickling of something back there-"@@ As she spoke a tickle built on your own neck. You tried to convince yourself it was just a tickle, or the wind, but you swore you felt it moving, around to your face... <<playerVoice "\"Eeeep!\"">> You @@.girlVoice;squealed@@, jumping away from your current spot and slapping the back of your neck. There was nothing there, but the @@.girlVoice;anxiety@@ remained, you didn't want a @@.girlVoice;gross@@ spider touching you. Or any other bugs for that matter. You'd stick to fluffy things and let someone else take care of any @@.girlVoice;creepy bugs@@ you encountered. <</if>>\ Seeing your own panic Sophie relaxed, knowing you shared at least some of that fear...@@.girlVoice;a lot of that fear@@, you had to admit. She turned back to Emily, @@.sophieVoice;"and what about you Emily? If I have to say so do you."@@ [[Emily's fear|Olympics Critical Loss Scared 3]] <<addTrait "$traitAfraidOfBugs" "Bugs" "fear">>\For a moment it looked like Emily might not share her own fears, but having coerced Sophie into sharing hers she didn't have a choice. @@.emilyVoice;"I don't like being home alone."@@ In the rare occasions she had been left alone she was always clingy when mom came back, but you'd never connected it to a tangible fear. <<if $traitMonophobia>>\ A fear that you totally shared. At first being alone just sucked, but after a little bit it got worse. It only took one thing, a strange sound, catching something out of the corner of your eye, or even an errant thought. Anything that made you feel @@.girlVoice;terror@@ for even a moment. Once that happened it all spiralled out of control. With no one there to calm you down after that moment it just kept weighing on you. Now every sound and sight was another potential danger, adding to the anxiety. Making you keenly aware of just how @@.girlVoice;alone@@ and @@.girlVoice;vulnerable@@ you were. If something happened to you, there would be no one to help. No one would even know that anything had happened. That's why you much preferred staying with the crowd. <<if $playerMaturity <= 12>>The girls luckily made that quite easy.<<else>>Even if that crowd was a bunch of little girls.<</if>> <<else>>\ @@.emilyVoice;"I get scared something bad might happen...You're all by yourself and if something happens there is no one to help."@@ This was different from Sophie's and Kara's fear. Theirs was a keen instant fear, a reaction to an immediate 'threat'. Emily's fear was something slower and more insidious. There was no specific stimulus; instead her own imagination would provide endless horrors to worry her. Like if someone broke in, or she got into an accident, or a fire started... That shook you. Emily was a bonafide witch, she could handle //way// more than any eight year old should, probably more than most adults. If she needed help to deal with something, how could you ever handle them? If you were @@.girlVoice;stuck all alone@@ you might end up @@.girlVoice;totally helpless@@. You edged slightly towards the rest of the group. Maybe it was smarter, just for now, to @@.girlVoice;always stay with the group@@. You tried to convince yourself it was you doing them a favour. They probably didn't want to be alone, and if it meant you weren't alone either, that was just a bonus. <</if>>\ @@.karaVoice;"Will you tell us yours Miki?"@@ Kara's question was gentle, leaving Miki room to refuse. [[Miki's fear|Olympics Critical Loss Scared 4]] <<addTrait "$traitMonophobia" "Being Alone" "fear">>\@@.mikiVoice;"I'm 'fraid of the dark."@@ Miki offered instantly, without a hint of shame. <<if $traitAfraidOfTheDark>>\ It was a fear that you very much shared, though you lacked her confidence regarding it. It was embarrassing to get scared by a little darkness. You didn't want to have to sleep with a night light, but the idea of going to bed tonight in pitch black was @@.girlVoice;terrifying@@. Maybe, if you were lucky, Miki would request a night light herself. That way you wouldn't have to embarrass yourself further, but you also wouldn't have to be in the dark. <<else>>\ This was an entirely understandable. Fear of the dark was one of the oldest, primal fears. Though you were way too mature to be scared of something like that. @@.mikiVoice;"You can't see anything...anything could be out there."@@ That made you pause. It wasn't the dark that scared her, it was what out there in the darkness. That made things //way// worse. If something @@.girlVoice;scary@@ was out there you'd never see it coming. <</if>>\ @@.sophieVoice;"Are you still scared of monsters under the bed?"@@ Sophie gently teased. But before Miki could answer you interrupted, your @@.girlVoice;anxieties@@ spiked even higher. You'd been worried about there being //something// in the darkness, what if that something was a @@.girlVoice;scary monster@@? <<playerVoice "\"M-m-monsters? Monsters aren't real.\"">> It was a feeble attempt to convince yourself. The girls gave each other a glance, a wordless conspiracy formed. @@.sophieVoice;"What about ghosts?"@@ Sophie offered. Miki picked up the thread, @@.mikiVoice;"yeah! Super scary ghosts that jump out when you don't 'spect it!"@@ [[G-g-ghosts?|Olympics Critical Loss Scared 5]]//Ghosts aren't real. That's just kid stuff...I think.// @@.mikiVoice;"Or they sneak up behind you..."@@ At her words you felt a cold chill run down your spine, it felt like there was something behind you. Lurking, waiting for its moment. @@.karaVoice;"What about goblins?"@@ Kara added. @@.mikiVoice;"Goblins are even scarier!"@@ <<playerVoice "\"Scarier than ghosts?\"">> You tried to keep the @@.girlVoice;quaver@@ out of your voice to little success. @@.mikiVoice;"Ghosts just say boo, but goblins are dangerous. You were too @@.girlVoice;scared@@ to even remember to struggle. Ready to accept your fate... Then the monster giggled. @@.sophieVoice;"Gotcha~"@@ Sophie released her grip and stepped back from you. @@.mikiVoice;"Sophie...that was mean."@@ Miki chided, but it was a hollow thing, she was just as amused as Sophie. She'd grown out of believing in @@.girlVoice;monsters under the bed@@. The dark was scary, but she knew monsters weren't real. But you'd @@.girlVoice;believed in every single monster@@, which made it delightful to tell her little ghost story. Your heart was still pounding. You'd thought you were @@.girlVoice;about to die@@, so your continued survival took a few moments to get used to. @@.emilyVoice;"See?"@@ Emily concluded, the lesson complete, @@.emilyVoice;"lots of things are scarier than looking silly, so next time you should just play, okay?"@@ You nodded. You somewhat resented her comment, but she was right, you were @@.girlVoice;scared of so many things@@. So you hurried along to follow the girls inside, blushing at the fact that you @@.girlVoice;held Sophie's hand@@ the whole way. It wasn't even just straight forward spin the bottle and paint a color. There was a board with all sorts of minor variations. Painting someone else's nail, painting two the same color, painting one in two colors. You wouldn't say that it was complicated, but it was a little more involved than you had expected. While the first set had a 'flat' color these ones resulted in a 'shinier' coat. After a few more turns you had a trio of your own nails in the new glossy colors. They didn't really match your other nails, but 'matching' wasn't the goal here, it was just having some fun. When Sophie landed on 'Spin Again' it was decided that it meant you had to spin twice and take both results. You looked to Emily to see what the choice would be this time. @@.emilyVoice;"Lose a turn..."@@ Emily drawled, buying time for her to figure out what to do next, @@.emilyVoice;"that means that you don't get a choice at all."@@ Her voice gained steadiness as her confidence grew, @@.emilyVoice;"which means we can do whatever we want...but just to one nail."@@ She hurriedly added the last, no doubt to ensure the game didn't end too fast. [[The girls considered the options|Painting Nails Accept 7]] <<include "Painting Nails Image Fragment">><<set $rightThumbnailColor to 'pink-glitter'>>\ <<set $rightThumbnailDetailColor to $rightThumbnailColor>>\ <div style="display:flex;">\ <<Image 'PaintingNails/PinkGlitterPolish.jpg' "large">>\ <div>\ The girls murmured amongst one another before coming to a decision. Emily grabbed one of the bottles that hadn't yet been used. This one was a little more complex than the rest, it wasn't just one solid color. No Emily wouldn't be satisfied to just paint a nail @@.girlVoice;pink@@. It would be @@.girlVoice;pink@@ and @@.girlVoice;sparkly@@. <<if $playerMaturity <= 8>>You @@.girlVoice;loved@@ it.<<elseif $playerMaturity <= 11>>You had to admit it was @@.girlVoice;very pretty@@.<<elseif $playerMaturity <= 13>>It looked alright, but it was a little @@.girlVoice;childish@@.<<else>>It was annoyingly @@.girlVoice;girly@@ and @@.girlVoice;childish@@. Sure the rest of your nails were painted as well, but this one was somehow worse.<</if>> Emily looked deeply pleased with herself, having added to your mismatched matte, glossy and now sparkly set of nails. You only had two nails left unpainted and most of the girls were in a similar situation, the 'game' was coming to an end. @@.emilyVoice;"Since you've played along I'll let you choose,"@@ Emily gestured to the sets of bottles in front of her. The initial matte set, the second glossy set and a third set full of random items, including the pink sparkly polish, which you hadn't used yet. </div>\ </div>\ [[Matte polish|Painting Nails Accept 8][$bottleSet to 'matte']] [[Glossy polish|Painting Nails Accept 8][$bottleSet to 'glossy']] [[Random polish|Painting Nails Accept 8][$bottleSet to 'random']] <<include "Painting Nails Image Fragment">><<silently>>\ <<if $bottleSet === 'matte'>>\ <<set $fingerNailColorWheel to ['red', 'pink', 'orange', 'yellow', 'green', 'blue']>> <<set $leftIndexFingernailColor to $fingerNailColorWheel.random() + 'Nail'>> <<set $leftMiddleFingernailColor to $fingerNailColorWheel.random() + 'Nail'>> <<elseif $bottleSet === 'glossy'>>\ <<set $fingerNailColorWheel to ['red', 'pink', 'orange', 'blue', 'green', 'purple']>> <<set $leftIndexFingernailColor to $fingerNailColorWheel.random() + '-gloss'>> <<set $leftMiddleFingernailColor to $fingerNailColorWheel.random() + '-gloss'>> <<else>> <<set $fingerNailColorWheel to ['pink-glitter', 'bright-rainbow-glitter', 'rainbow-glitter', 'glitter-hearts', 'pink-polka-dot', 'white-polka-dot']>> <<set $leftIndexFingernailColor to $fingerNailColorWheel.random()>> <<set $leftMiddleFingernailColor to $fingerNailColorWheel.random()>> <</if>> <<if !$leftThumbailShape>> <<set $leftThumbailShape to '♥'>> <<set $leftThumbnailShapeClass to 'heart'>> <<if $leftThumbnailColor == 'yellowNail' || $leftThumbnailColor == 'greenNail'>> <<set $leftThumbnailShapeColor to 'blackNail'>> <<else>> <<set $leftThumbnailShapeColor to 'whiteNail'>> <</if>> <</if>> <</silently>>\ <<if $traitCatgirl >= 2>>The rest of the game finished mostly without incident, everyone was their last nails painted, but Kara //insisted// that she get to do at least two of yours. You had your suspicions Emily had ensured that particular spin.<</if>> Everyone was decked out in their @@.girlVoice;rainbow nails@@ to varying degrees of excitement. Emily and Miki were overjoyed with their @@.girlVoice;sparkly nails@@; while Kara and Sophie were slightly more reserved, they still liked them but they weren't quite as @@.girlVoice;giddy@@. @@.emilyVoice;"We have to take a picture!"@@ Emily suddenly shouted, much to the agreement of the other girls. At this point you had little reason not to agree. You all put your hands into a loose circle, a dizzying array of colors and sparkles. Sophie held up Kara's phone and took a picture from above. Once that was done she showed it to everyone. <<if $playerAge >= 12>>\ Your own hands stood out amongst the group. They were <<if $playerAge >=14>>larger and hairier than the rest.<<else>>still larger than the others.<</if>> Though having such @@.girlVoice;pretty@@ nails gave them a much more @@.girlVoice;gentle@@ appearance. They projected a @@.girlVoice;delicate girlishness@@ that just made them look smaller than before. <<changeAge "small">>\ <<elseif $playerAge >=10>>\ When you saw the picture you had a sudden panic. At first glance you couldn't even tell which were yours. After a few moments you managed to work it out, after all only Emily's looked //that// similar to yours. But your eyes alighted on the @@.girlVoice;pretty, sparkly@@ nails and it made the minor differences fall away. You doubted anyone else would ever notice a distinction. Just by your hands you looked like @@.girlVoice;one of the girls@@. <<changeAge "small">>\ <<else>>\ It wasn't a shock, but your own hands looked just like all the others. It was such a @@.girlVoice;cute@@ picture of all those @@.girlVoice;little@@ fingers painted such @@.girlVoice;pretty colors@@. <<if $playerMaturity >= 11>>You just couldn't believe that one of those sets was yours.<</if>> <</if>>\ With the painting done everyone was ready to move onto the next task, but before you could wander off Emily came over to you. [[She had an offer|Painting Nails Accept 9]] <<include "Painting Nails Image Fragment">>@@.emilyVoice;"Your nails look so pretty <<playerTitle>>,"@@ Emily smiled, showing off her own nails as she spoke, @@.emilyVoice;"but I wanna give you a choice."@@ You tensed. Emily's choices could have dire consequences if handled poorly. Emily giggled, @@.emilyVoice;"don't be so nervous. You played along so I'm being nice."@@ @@.emilyVoice;"Sophie was being fussy and said she just wanted one style."@@ You could sense Emily's annoyance <<if $sophieFriendship >= 6 && $emilyFriendship >=6>>. Likely Sophie's complaint was something to the effect of the whole mishmash being 'too kiddy'. If you want."@@ Emily brandished her wand, showing that this wouldn't be a long process. It threw into question why you'd all spent all that time painting nails if she could just magic it instantly, but it had been @@.girlVoice;pretty fun@@. @@.emilyVoice;"But only once!"@@ She sternly clarified. She'd probably prefer if you didn't change anything at all, but if you were going to she wasn't going to spend all day swapping them around. @@#links; <<link "You loved them like they were">> <<filterreplace "#links">> Emily smiled at your response, squirreling away her wand. @@.emilyVoice;"I knew they were pretty."@@ With that Emily spun on her heel and skipped back towards the rest of the group. Clearly very pleased with everything that had happened. [[Remove the fake nails|Painting Nails Decline 2]] <<include "Painting Nails Image Fragment">> <<set $paintingNailsActivityResult to 2>>\ <<set $havePrincessNails to true>>\ <<set $havePaintedFingernails to false>>\Emily looked on with a combination of annoyance and bemusement. You cast a glare at your <<sisterTitle>>, but she just smiled. Of course she wouldn't make it that easy. @@.emilyVoice;"Be careful <<playerTitle>> you ''wouldn't want to break a nail''."@@ All at once you stopped any attempt to remove the nails. Emily's words resonated in your soul. She was right. These nails were so @@.girlVoice;delicate@@ that any trauma at all might cause issues. You took a close look at them, checking whether any damage had been done, breathing a sigh of relief when you didn't see a chip or anything. This time you'd been lucky and everything was still perfectly intact, but you'd have to @@.girlVoice;be more careful@@ in the future. No more rough-housing for you. It wasn't just that you wanted to make sure you @@.girlVoice;didn't break a nail@@, the whole idea just didn't appeal anymore. All those hours in the weight room were just so rough on your hands, and wrestling in gym class was so @@.girlVoice;brutish@@. It seemed so absurd that you'd willingly participated in those kinds of activities, but that was the end of that. Emily gave a small giggle at your new enforced outlook on life and considered the outcome. Sure you didn't have painted nails like she'd wanted, but @@.girlVoice;princess nails@@? Even @@.girlVoice;cuter@@. And she was looking forward to your new, more @@.girlVoice;delicate@@ sensibilities. Miki was immediately excited, @@.mikiVoice;"I love skipping!"@@ The other girls smiled at her and Emily explained the rules. @@.emilyVoice;"As Miki said we're going to skip.
