Whoever gets furthest wins. Got it?"@@ @@.emilyVoice;"So <<playerName>>, are you going to play?"@@ [[Give it a try|Jump Rope Agree][$skippingActivityResult to 2]] [[Refuse|Jump Rope Refuse][$skippingActivityResult to 1]] <<addToActivityCount>>\You nodded your assent, might as well give it a shot. Though you had to be honest that Emily's performance had been pretty impressive. In truth you didn't think you had a chance of keeping up with her. But it wasn't always about winning, right? Maybe you'd still be able to have a little fun with it. @@.emilyVoice;"Alright Sophie, you're next!"@@ <<include "Double Dutch Sophie">>Emily stood between the ropes as Miki and Sophie started slowly turning them. Quickly enough Emily was into the rhythm and easily skipping with the ropes, hopping on two feet. @@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@Butterfly, Butterfly@@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@ The girls began to rhyme as the ropes continued their pace. Emily started hopping on one foot. Working hard to keep up with the tempo. @@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@Butterfly, Butterfly, throws a kiss, kiss, kiss@@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@ The ropes sped up and became a blur. Emily was forced to alter her skipping style. Though to you it looked more like she was running in place rather than jumping. It was actually moving way faster than you expected, it was an impressive feat of coordination. @@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@Butterfly, Butterfly, get out before you miss, miss, miss@@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@ The tempo changed and Emily started jumping with two feet again. You weren't sure what the difference was between this and how it had started. Though when you looked closed you realized that she was jumping high enough to let both ropes pass beneath her on each revolution. @@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@Butterfly, Butterfly@@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@ She continued hopping on two feet but then she suddenly pitched forward half landing on her hands. You realized that she'd placed a rock on the ground between her hops. She went to pick it up again but caught her hand in the ropes, bringing them to a halt.<<if $skippingActivityResult === 2>>\ The game started the same as last time. Moving at a fairly casual pace, which Sophie was having no trouble with. <<else>>\ You started off the game slowly and Miki, on the other side of the ropes, matched your pace. It was supposed to start slowly anyway so it was fine, but it was mostly you trying to get used to the feel of it. <</if>>\ @@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@Grace, Grace dressed in lace.@@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@ The girls were so fast with these rhymes. Clearly they'd done this enough that they had an entire repertoire of tunes. <<if $skippingActivityResult === 1>>It seemed like it was the responsibility of the ones swinging the ropes to lead the song. Luckily Miki was covering for you and singing extra loud so your quiet wasn't as obvious. Despite that you tried your best to follow along with the unfamiliar words.<</if>> @@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@Went upstairs to powder her face.@@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@ Sophie had no trouble with the one foot hopping, but the speed section was causing her more difficulty. In the end she managed it, but she looked tired from the experience. @@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@How many boxes did it take?@@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@ In contrast she seemed much more comfortable with the double unders. Her athleticism meant that consistently jumping high wasn't too difficult. @@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@1, 2, 3, 4@@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@ <<if $skippingActivityResult === 2>>You started humming along to the simple rhythm, even counting along with them at the end.<<else>>By the time they'd started counting you were properly singing along. The tunes were simple but catchy, so it was easy to follow.<</if>> As Sophie put down the rock her foot caught one of the ropes, putting an end to her turn. It had been a good run, though slightly behind Emily. She clicked her tongue and stepped out. @@.sophieVoice;"Alright, who's next?"@@ Kara cautiously stepped forward, already humming a rhyme to calm herself. [[Kara's turn|Double Dutch Kara]]Her nervousness was explained almost instantly. She was able to keep up with the normal double hops, but it looked much rougher than it had for Emily and Sophie. <<if $skippingActivityResult === 1>>Since Kara had already started humming the rhyme you were able to sing along from the very first word.<</if>> @@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@All in together girls@@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@ She wasn't much better with the single hops, you were really worried that she might fall and get hurt. @@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@How do you like the weather, girls?@@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@ But she was able to get through it, trying her best to get through the speed section...it was a narrow thing but she was running out of gas. @@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@January, February, March, April@@.musicalNoteEmoji;🎵@@ That fatigue caught up with her on the double unders. Unable to get sufficient height she caught her foot and tripped. Emily had gone easy on you, but didn't really want you to know that. If she was too nice, you might think she wasn't serious. <<if $traitAfraidOfTheDark>>\ You //deeply// appreciated her restraint. You were @@.girlVoice;terrified@@ of being in the dark. Being blinded would mean an entirely inescapable darkness. That would be a @@.girlVoice;nightmare@@. <<playerVoice "\"Thank you Emily.\"">> You tried to keep the @@.girlVoice;quaver@@ out of your voice, thinking about how close that had been to a disaster. <<else>>\ You were glad that the two of you had gotten closer over the party. Apparently she was willing to give you a bit more slack than before. <</if>>\ @@.emilyVoice;"Okay okay, enough of this. Let's go do something else."@@ You smiled, Emily was actually cute when she got flustered. But you'd leave it alone this time, no need to raise her ire when she was being so nice. Though you knew better than to think she'd //always// be nice, you'd just gotten lucky this time, but you could still enjoy it. [[Back to the Party|Event Handler]] <<silently>>\ <<set $watchingMLPActivityResult to 2>>\ <<pushJournalEntry "watchCartoons" "Journal Cartoon" "activity">>\ <<set $declineActivityCount++>> <</silently>>\<<Image 'WatchCartoons/Episode1.webp' "topRightCorner">>\ It seemed that Sophie wasn't entirely happy with the activity, grumbling about watching such a @@.girlVoice;kiddie show@@. @@.mikiVoice;"You hafta pick a favourite."@@ Miki spoke gravely, combined with a nod from Emily. So the game was set. You needed to pay enough attention that you could properly pick a favourite. So you dutifully watched the first episode with the rest. <<if $mlpKnowledgeLevel === 1>>\ It seemed that your moderate knowledge was enough to keep you up to speed with things. Twilight Sparkle was trying to find a place among all the groups trying to clean up winter. Without magic. You didn't understand why they wouldn't allow magic, but probably made it easier to teach a lesson. The other girls had their own contributions. Pinkie skated on the lake to break up the ice, while Fluttershy woke up the animals. It was interesting that the ponies literally controlled the weather, surely that was explained in more detail somewhere else. <<else>>\ Not knowing much about the show it was a little difficult to follow things. The purple one had a problem fitting in, and wasn't allowed to use magic. Though when she did it went badly, so maybe it was because she was bad at magic. The other ponies all had their own things to do. The pink one was skating and the yellow one was waking up animals. You hadn't paid enough attention to understand why they were literally changing seasons, but it didn't seem that important. <</if>>\ You hadn't really expected the singing, <<if $playerMaturity <= 12>>especially when it was this @@.girlVoice;entertaining@@.<<else>>though it was normal enough kids show fare.<</if>> <<if $traitEarworm>>\ <<playerVoice "\"Winter wrap up, winter wrap up. Maybe she'd just leave them on...or it maybe she'd fine a way to make you look even more obsessed. At the moment you really didn't want to antagonize her or Miki further, so you kept quiet. At this point the sound of her laughing was enough to make you laugh harder. It was hard to breath, the laugh coming out high and breathy, you even snorted once. The giggles were infectious and the other girls joined in with giggles of their own<<if !$traitGiggly>>, your tone starting to match theirs<</if>>. <<if !$traitGiggly>>\ As the giggles died down there was only one girlish giggle left. Should you [[change your outfit?|Magic Ring Dressup]] <</if>>\Eagerly you awaited the bolt to strike you. Being Lady Emily's familiar hadn't been the worst experience, but there was too much to look forward to as a human. You took the warm calm of a bath for granted until you had to use your own tongue to get the same result. As the magic wrapped around you, you took one last stretch, enjoying the obscene flexibility of your feline body. Still, it would be a small price to pay. Already you could see your fur falling out, pink skin starting to show on your paws. Shrinking down had been a harrowing experience that you could scarcely concentrate on, this time you had perfect focus. It quickly became uncomfortable to stand on all fours so you leaned back onto your haunches...your butt and watched as your claws disappeared. Your increasingly human fingers lengthening and consuming them until there was nothing left but boring, mostly dull, fingernails...toenails you corrected. Human digits were strange and different and it'd taken you a moment to remember how everything connected up. Things inside you shifted and rearranged, your limbs shooting out to incredible lengths as the rest of your body struggled to keep up. They felt noodly for a moment before everything locked into place and they felt solid and strong. Though strong was a relative term, you felt so damn heavy that a jump would be a pathetic stumpy thing at best. Still, you were almost back to entirely human. You had fingers and toes and arms and legs and a dozen other things that marked the end of your feline experience. Emily looked on with fascination, curious as to the process. [[The magic stopped|Get Away Bad End Escape 2]] <<set $catTransformation to 0>>\The magic abruptly stopped, leaving you to come to terms with your new gargantuan stature. As you rose you could see the world from an incredible angle, seeing distant objects, unobstructed by things like table legs. Though the couch still nearly matched you in height...was that right? Furiously your mind whirred, trying to pull up old points of reference. How tall had you been before? What did the couch look like from that angle? You remembered it looking so short before...your tail trashed in frustration, why was your brain struggling with this concept so badly? @@.momVoice;"Give it a moment sweetie. A whole new set of instincts can be very confusing."@@ That was an understatement. Going from a foot tall to almost four was a drastic change for anyone to come to terms with...that last statement was enough to clarify your mind. Four feet? You should be almost six! [[Shopping spree|Get Away Bad End Escape Kawaii 2]]<<Image 'Endings/GetAway/EmilyCloset2.jpg' "smallTopRightCorner">>\ <<Image 'Endings/GetAway/EmilyCloset1.webp' "smallTopRightCorner">>\ You dug to the back of Emily's closet where her old clothes would be. You'd broken the rules and gotten away with it scot free. You spent the next few days perfecting your craft. Mom took a moment to respond, @@.momVoice;"it is quite cute, I suppose if you like it there isn't any harm."@@ You cheered but remembered something important, <<playerVoice "\"Thank nyu for making it fit mommy.\"">> Mom's magic was easy to take for granted, but in moments like this it was amazing. @@.momVoice;"Oh, of course sweetie, now run along."@@ Once you'd gotten far enough away that she thought you couldn't hear, you heard her mumble, @@.momVoice;"I didn't do a thing to it, it even had a tail hole. How did Kara even..."@@ You didn't care about the fine details about how the dress had gotten as perfect as it was, it was perfect and you couldn't wait to start cleaning. [[Kara arrived|Get Away Bad End Escape Maid 4]]Kara had come home with Emily again today, though her voice was shaky even before she'd come through the door. It ended up being a very short visit. Kara spotted you in the outfit, made a high pitched noise and ran off again. This time she didn't even take the time to say goodbye to Emily. @@.emilyVoice;"Kara is weird."@@ Emily stated flatly, drawing nods from the rest of you. This pattern repeated itself a few more nights before Kara was finally able to stand in your presence. You'd grown awfully self conscious about the situation. Mom said it wasn't anything you were doing, that Kara was the one being skittish, but you still worried it was your fault. Kara approached you cautiously, as if you might bite. Admittedly you did have sharp teeth, but you'd never bite. <<playerVoice "\"Thank nyu for the dress Kara. I love it so much nya~\"">> Kara squeaked out something indescribable as her face grew so red you were worried she was sick. [[Kara stared|Get Away Bad End Escape Maid 5]]Kara's staring lasted an uncomfortably long time. <<playerVoice "\"Kara...are nyu ok-\"">> You hadn't finished speaking before Kara had launched herself at you. @@.karaVoice;"OhmygoshyouresocuteIcantevenstandit,"@@ she babbled, reaching towards one of your ears, it twitched in response and she squeaked again. Emily and mom looked upon the scene with utter confusion. They had their own theories on what was driving Kara's odd behavior, but this was still unexpected. @@.karaVoice;"Oh your ears are, I want to touch them, but I should ask, can I touch them, oh please let me touch them, I promise to be gentle."@@ Kara's babbling had slowed down enough to make it mostly comprehensible, but she was still manic. You gave a tiny nod, though she was already basically touching them before you'd agreed. As promised she was very gentle, it even felt nice, as odd as the situation was. After a few more minutes of examination and squealing and babbling Kara finally calmed down enough to be questioned about why she was freaking out so badly. [[Catgirl maids|Get Away Bad End Escape Maid 6]]@@.karaVoice;"Catgirls are the cutest things in the universe and catgirl maids are even cuter than that."@@ She spoke as if it was a cosmic truth, despite the flawed logic. @@.momVoice;"And..."@@ @@.karaVoice;"And what? That's it. Just look,"@@ she turned to you, the pitch of her voice rising, @@.karaVoice;"look how cute she is. I just wanna take her home with me!"@@ The next few minutes of questions revealed precious little new information. She just liked catgirls, //really// liked catgirls. She already owned that maid outfit before all this started, with a matching set of ears and a tail. When she'd seen you she just //had// to see you in it. The ears and tail were unnecessary of course, but she'd made some hasty alterations to make sure it would fit you better, and accommodate your actual tail. It wasn't clear if she'd done this all solo, or had assistance, regardless she'd stayed up all night to make sure it was //perfect// before giving it to your mother. She had to hand it off like that as she was too shy to do it herself. With the explanation complete your mother burst out laughing. You rarely saw her that full of mirth, but it brought a smile to your face. She put her hand on Kara's head, @@.momVoice;"you are a very unique girl."@@ It was meant as a compliment...probably. [[Kara's passion|Get Away Bad End Escape Maid 7]]With the barrier broken Kara was sure to come over every single day. Once your mom even had to ward her off because she was going to skip school just to play with you. You wouldn't have minded. She was fun to play with, and she kept bringing you new @@.girlVoice;cute outfits@@. It turned out that she had more than a passing interest in cosplay, and a good number of costumes to her name. The two of you were close to the same size, so it was only a few minor alterations to size things properly. Thus her cosplay costumes became your everyday garb. Though you had to admit that the maid outfit was still your favorite. You spent so much of your time cleaning it was nice to have an outfit that matched the theme. In all of this one important thing had been forgotten by all the parties involved...turning you back. You certainly weren't about to say anything, you were having the time of your life. Emily loved having a cute little sister and Kara ''loved'' how you were now. Which only left mom as someone who could remember to put a stop to it. Except you were being such a help around the house that her mind had drifted off to other concerns. One day someone would remember and put you back into your "proper" sixteen year old body, but until then you would spend every moment enjoying yourself. Which was to say, most of your time would be spent cleaning, because you didn't enjoy anything more than that. Other people probably would find it weird, but who were they to say what is normal for a former sixteen year old boy turned into a six year old catgirl. You were just made to be a maid and, for now, everyone wanted things to stay just the way they were. Ending 15s - Maid to Order <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "" 28>>It was a risk but you had to get yourself out of here. If you spent another minute here there was no telling what else was going to happen to your mind and body. Yes, the first time you tried to escape you'd ended up with cat ears and famgs, but that was almost tolerable. There was no way mom had actually set it up to turn you into an actual cat. You'd probably already triggered that particular trap and would be able to just walk out scot free. Where you would go for the rest of the day was an open question, you couldn't exactly be too public considering how you currently looked. But you'd figure that out after you'd gotten free. Taking a moment where Emily wasn't paying attention you snuck your way towards the door. Your hand was almost on the door when Emily caught you and called out. @@.emilyVoice;"I wouldn't do that <<playerName>>,"@@ her voice was equal parts teasing and warning, @@.emilyVoice;"though maybe you'd make a better kitty than a <<playerTitle>>."@@ She was bluffing, she had to be. Even if 'taking care of the girls' had never been your real purpose at the party, mom wouldn't want you to leave them entirely. Your hand reached out... @@.emilyVoice;"<<playerName>>! Don't!"@@ The teasing tone had dropped, replaced with genuine distress, but you weren't going to let that stop you. Even though you hadn't actually touched the handle yet you could already feel the static charge building. [[Grab the handle|Get Away Bad End 2]] [[Back away|Get Away Bad End Escape 1-1]]Your @@.girlVoice;cat ears@@ twitched as you backed away from the door, the charge fading as you did. Emily's words had been enough to warn you away from trying to leave. If she was being //that// serious, then maybe you actually would have ended up as a cat. As much as you wanted to get away from the party, you were more interested in keeping yourself on two legs. Emily relaxed as you sheepishly walked back to the rest of the group. You felt a little better as well. It wasn't total relaxation, but you'd be able to tolerate the party. At least for a little longer. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<set $humiliation to 5>>\ <<set $getAwayBadEndEscape to true>>\The moment you touched it you knew it'd been a mistake; you could feel the charge running through your body, an uncomfortable twisting in your gut. Spots of light started flashing in front of your eyes, and your vision wobbled, trying to make sense of a sudden rush of contradictory signals. You looked down at your hand, still gripping onto the door, and saw it changing. Your hand was already smaller than it'd been to start the day, but now it was shrinking even further. That perhaps wasn't entirely surprising, most of this party was trying to make you smaller. However, the <<if $playerAge <= 10>>yellow<<else>>brown<</if>> hair that was sprouting from the back of your hand was more novel. //No, not hair. Fur.// Your attention stayed focused on your hand, fascinated by the rapidly spreading fur. Though from the itching building on your chest, it wasn't just your hand that was getting fuzzier. Your whole body was getting smaller by the moment. <<if $playerAge <= 8>>With as short as you'd become in a few more moments you might not even be able to reach the handle at all.<<elseif $playerAge <= 14>>You'd already lost significant height at this party, and this shrinking showed no signs of stopping.<<else>>In a flash you'd lost over a foot of height, and your shrinking showed no signs of stopping.<</if>> You grit your sharp teeth against the continued sensations. [[Getting fuzzy|Get Away Bad End 3]]You began to lose your grip on the handle, though not for lack of trying. It was getting harder and harder to get your fingers to wrap around the knob. Not only did they feel increasingly stiff, but they were getting shorter as well. A quick glance to your other hand showed the same, the fur crawling onto your palms. There were some spots that were uncovered, but the skin there was turning an unnatural pink. Your "hand" on the door was barely holding on, merely resting on the top of the knob. You couldn't even move your thumb, it was stuck to the finger next to it. Your feet felt even stranger, and an attempt to wiggle your "toes" resulted in four movements in response, not five. This was far more intense than it had been before. The first time had been a warning, but this might be the real deal. If you kept holding on you might really get turned into a cat, or perhaps this was all just a bluff and the magic would cut out any second. [[Let go|Get Away Bad End Escape 2-1]] [[Use both hands|Get Away Bad End 4]]Roughly you pulled your hand-paw away from the door. Getting yourself free while your digits were something that could could charitably be called "humanoid". //I don't wanna be a cat.// However, the charge began to fade to a background buzz, disappearing entirely only a few moments later. With its disappearance your body seemed to be settling itself back into a more normal form. Though "normal" was a relative term at this point. Once again able to focus on non paw related matters, you realized that the other girls had been watching the entire incident. The looks on their faces were impossible to decipher, something between disappointed, fascinated, and amused. Except for Emily, she just looked annoyed. Glaring at you, hands on her hips. @@.emilyVoice;"I told you not to try and leave."@@ [[She was right|Get Away Bad End Escape 2-2]] <<set $traitCatgirl to 2>>\ <<changeAge "small">>\Emily was right, she had warned you about the consequences, and you'd chosen to ignore them. What surprised you was, as far as you could tell, a lack of serious consequences. Last time you'd pulled this stunt you'd been "gifted" with fangs, pointy ears and a love of string. You gave an awkward grin, showing off your still present fangs. <<playerVoice "\"Sorry Emily, I wanted to see what happened. And see, nothing bad, all in one piece and back to normal.\"">> @@.sophieVoice;"I can't believe $they hasn't noticed..."@@ Sophie shook her head and the other girls gave you goofy looks. <<playerVoice "\"Noticed what @@.noFilter;nya?@@\"">> The @@.girlVoice;cute little noise@@ you'd reflexively added at the end of that question made you take better stock of yourself. //What is Sophie talking about?// Your tail twitched in frustration. Wait. What. TAIL!?! Whipping around you grabbed at the offending appendage, drawing a wince from you. //I guess that confirms it's attached.// You held onto the tail, staring at it as if you could will it away. It stubbornly refused to disappear. It would obey instructions to move, but not to go away. Though the sensation of telling a tail to move was an entirely alien experience. [[Get to a mirror|Get Away Bad End Escape 2-3]]You hurried to a mirror, worried about what else might have changed. Luckily they seemed to be more modest. Your fingernails looked sharper than they had before<<if $havePrincessNails>>, yet the @@.girlVoice;princess press-ons@@ still covered them perfectly.<<elseif $havePaintedFingernails>>, yet the nail polish still covered them perfectly<</if>>. Looking closely it was obvious that your eyes weren't quite normal anymore. The pupils were narrower than they should have been, and the closer you stared the narrower they seemed to get. <<if $playerAge > 5>>\ There was also the fact that you'd gotten shorter again. It wasn't quite as extreme as last time, but you'd definitely been regressed. <</if>>\ <<playerVoice "\"Nyaaaa, it happened again.\"">> You @@.girlVoice;whined@@, though none of the girls seemed to have much sympathy. Not only had the same thing happened last time, but Emily had warned you...again. If you were going to ignore everyone and mess with the cursed door, you could face the consequences. So now you were stuck with @@.girlVoice;twitchy cat ears@@ and a @@.girlVoice;cute tail@@. Between those and your other smaller changes you were visibly inhuman. //Are people going to think I'm a mon-// @@.karaVoice;"Canitouchyourtail?"@@ Kara blurted out, having suddenly appeared in front of you. <<if $getAwayBreakResult === 1>>\ You'd denied her request last time, and considered doing the same again. It was strange enough having all these new appendages, did you really want to let her mess with them? <<else>>\ You had let her touch your ears last time, much to her delight. She'd been gentle, and it'd actually felt kind of nice. Though with how @@.girlVoice;catlike@@ you were now, it made you feel even more like a @@.girlVoice;pet@@. <</if>>\ [[Let her|Get Away Bad End Escape 2-4][$getAwayEscapeLetKaraTouch to true]] [[Deny her|Get Away Bad End Escape 2-4][$getAwayEscapeLetKaraTouch to false]]<<if $getAwayEscapeLetKaraTouch>>\ <<playerVoice "\"Fine, you can touch it.\"">> Kara squealed and quickly grabbed at your tail. Prematurely you winced, but despite her fervor she was still being gentle. @@.karaVoice;"It feels so real..."@@ Kara's voice was dreamlike. @@.emilyVoice;"It //is// real,"@@ Emily clarified. @@.karaVoice;"I wish I had a tail..."@@ Kara had been excited the first time when you'd got the ears, now things had escalated. <<changeHappiness "Kara" true>>\ <<else>>\ <<playerVoice "\"No you can not.\"">> Despite being disappointed by the denial she was still thrilled by your mere presence. The way you'd responded had been @@.girlVoice;so cute@@ that it was almost better than actually getting to touch it. <</if>>\ @@.mikiVoice;"Is <<playerName>> gonna turn into a kitty now?"@@ Emily turned to you, fixing you with a stare, @@.emilyVoice;"$theyll be fine as long as they don't try that again."@@ You nodded. That you could agree to, if you //ever// tried that again you'd be on all fours for sure, and you were more than enough cat already. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<set $humiliation to 5>>\ <<changeHappiness "Kara" true>>\ <<set $getAwayBadEndEscape to true>>\You were sure that your mother would never let you //actually// become a cat, at least not in this circumstance. It wouldn't be the first time you'd become an animal, but that'd been while she was close enough to supervise. Emboldened by your logic you grabbed at the door with your other "hand", though that term was becoming more inaccurate by the second. With your lack of manual dexterity the best you could manage was to press in from both sides. You couldn't actually turn the knob this way, but you still felt confident. A confidence that shattered when your vision dropped several more inches. This wasn't just getting shorter, your legs felt tremendously unstable. You had to lean into the handle in an attempt to keep upright, but this just intensified the charge. You @@.girlVoice;hissed@@ at the sensations. They were too strange to be called pain, but they were deeply uncomfortable. //I'd feel more comfortable on all fours.// It was a strange thought to cross your mind, though you instinctively knew it to be true. As much as your former hands weren't suited to turning a doorknob, your legs and former feet weren't suited to keeping you upright all on their own. Finally your instability combined with your minuscule stature was too much and you lost your grip on the door. As you fell you lost focus on the world, the bright spots covering your entire vision until you couldn't see a thing. [[You blacked out|Get Away Bad End 5]] <<set $oldPlayerAge to $playerAge>>\ <<set $oldPlayerMaturity to $playerMaturity>>\<<set $voiceClassOverride to 8>>\ When you finally awoke you felt terrible. It was hard to even get your head off of the pillow it was resting on. Opening your eyes your eyes was a mighty feat all on its own. Even when you finally managed it, it was clear that you hadn't really woken up properly. Your vision was spotty, sharp in some spots while blurry when you tried to look straight ahead. The colors around you were washed out. Like you knew the couch wasn't supposed to be that weird washed out brown. Even the table legs looked odd, you were staring straight at them, but they just didn't look normal. You realized the strangeness of the look was because you'd never looked at them from this angle. Generally you'd be looking down at them. Even laying on the floor this was oddly low angle. Involuntarily you yawned, and at the same time heard a cat yawn, <<playerVoice "\"mrowwww.\"">> You looked around for the source of the strange sound. Your sharp eyes weren't able to detect a cat, nor anyone else in the vicinity. But you were //sure// that you'd heard something. "This is weird," was what you intended to say, but all you heard was more @@.girlVoice;cat noises@@. Experimentally you tried to speak again, more @@.girlVoice;cat noises@@. It dawned on you that somehow the noises were coming from you. Though as you finally had the wherewithal to look down at yourself, the reason became apparent. [[Examine yourself|Get Away Bad End 6]] <<set $catTransformation to 1>>\ <<set $playerAge to 0.2>>\Change was a constant in your house, doubly so at this sleepover, but you'd never woken up as an animal before. On the one hand the change to your body was obviously radical. You had paws, were covered in fur and weren't even a foot long. On the other, by the standards of cats, you were entirely normal. Though as you considered your diminutive size "kitten" would be the more accurate term. Even in this the magic had made sure you'd gotten younger. As you continued to rouse, getting yourself unsteadily to your feet, that odd calm began to fade, anxieties creeping in. You'd been made into a @@.girlVoice;tiny kitten@@, even standing up you were only a few inches tall. Everything in the living room looked //enormous//. This was a space meant for humans not for @@.girlVoice;pets@@ like you. Hesitantly you began to crawl out of the blanket that you'd been laying on. Mercifully you'd been granted the instincts to be able to walk on all fours. Though even the blanket was causing you troubles. It kept sinking under your feet...paws...and throwing off your balance. You hadn't yet grown into "feline grace", and were still a little unstable. @@.mikiVoice;"Ah! She's awake!"@@ A voice boomed from across the room. Your head snapped in that direction and you saw two massive grey cylinders stretching into the sky. You craned your neck the best you could, eventually sitting down so you could get a better angle to see the giant before you. @@.mikiVoice;"Oh you're so cute!"@@ Miki's voice boomed again. She stomped over to you, her every step vibrating the floor beneath you. [[Miki looked down at you|Get Away Bad End 7]]With as close as she was you couldn't really get yourself in a position to properly see her face. Turning to see one of her arms swinging towards you meant that you couldn't keep the other in vision. Miki's hand scooped under you, lifting you up as if you weighed nothing at all. This was quite possibly the most terrifying experience in your entire life. You were casually swung into the air. All four of your paws unable to find traction on anything, it felt like you might plummet to the ground at any moment. Consciously you knew you were only a few feet in the air, Miki wasn't that tall, but in your current form you might as well be standing at the edge of a skyscraper. <<if $traitAfraidOfHeights>>Your @@.girlVoice;fear of heights@@ had little to do with this terror. Even the most stalwart soul would be scared.<<else>>Normally you weren't afraid of heights, but this was something else entirely.<</if>> @@.mikiVoice;"You're so soft!"@@ @@.playerVoice8;<<hovertip "Put me down!">>"Mew!"<</hovertip>>@@ You @@.girlVoice;squeaked@@ out. Though your protests only made her cuddle you even more. @@.karaVoice;"Miki you have to be careful. You need to support her."@@ Kara's voice thundered. Another hand slid underneath you, it wasn't enough to make you comfortable, but at least your life didn't feel in immediate danger. [[The girls crowded in|Get Away Bad End 8]]You'd thought they'd been excited to touch your ears last time, you were wrong. Now they wanted to touch all of you, and you didn't get a say in the matter, because none of them took a @@.girlVoice;tiny@@ @@.playerVoice8;<<hovertip "Stop it!">>"mew!"<</hovertip>>@@ as an order. @@.momVoice;"Now you girls be careful with her, she's very delicate."@@ You were now faced with the towering presence of your mother, a giant amongst giants. Despite this gargantuan size difference you tried your best to threaten her @@.playerVoice8;<<hovertip "Turn me back!">>"grrrr!"<</hovertip>>@@ @@.sophieVoice;"Oh my gosh that was //so cute//,"@@ Sophie leaned down and rubbed your stomach, @@.sophieVoice;"were you trying to be big and scary, yes you were."@@ Your feeble protests only encouraged further harassment so you just stopped moving. The lack of reaction was enough to get Sophie to back off in boredom. The other girls looked at her, shocked at such a girly reaction. @@.sophieVoice;"What?"@@ She cast an innocent look to the rest of the group, @@.sophieVoice;"I can think kittens are cute. Baby animals are cute."@@ Sophie's tone was growing increasingly defensive, but no one pushed the issue. You cared little for these interpersonal dramas and more about the fact that ''you'' were the @@.girlVoice;baby animal@@. [[Mom coughed|Get Away Bad End 9]]<<set $randomCatNames to ["Fluffy", "Princess", "Nibbles", "Twinkle"]>>\ <<set $catName to $randomCatNames.random()>>\ @@.momVoice;"Now that everyone is awake, and don't worry <<playerName>> can still understand what's going on."@@ <span class="mikiVoice">"@@.girlVoice;$catName@@,"</span> Miki corrected sternly, <span class="mikiVoice">her name is @@.girlVoice;$catName@@."</span> Mom smiled, <span class="momVoice">"Ah yes, I'd almost forgotten. Well now that @@.girlVoice;$catName@@ here is awake I'll explain what's going to happen."</span> <span class="momVoice">"When @@.girlVoice;$catName@@ tried to escape the first time she'd been,"</span> Mom paused for a moment, considering the term, @@.momVoice;"gifted some cat-like features. I would have thought that was enough of a clue that trying to escape was a bad idea, but evidently not."@@ <span class="momVoice">"By taking in far more magic than any sensible person would, little @@.girlVoice;$catName@@ got herself turned into an //actual// cat."</span> @@.momVoice;"So Emily, it seems you'll be getting a familiar after all. At least for a little while."@@ Any attempted protest on your part was drown out by Emily's excitement. You were nervous, what exactly did a familiar do? [[Emily's familiar|Get Away Bad End 10]] <<set $oldGirlName to $girlName>>\ <<set $oldGuyName to $playerName>>\ <<set $girlName to $catName>>\Most of it, it turned out, was not too different from just being a regular pet. Though you did get to see some new things. Mom and Emily usually trained in, well it wasn't quite secret, but it was clear you weren't invited. Now you got front row seats to Emily's magical education. Which was shockingly boring. Emily was still young so it wasn't like she was learning powerful world altering spells every day. No, she was still learning to properly control her magic, as well as the principles of magic itself. It was pretty boring, but you wanted to stay near Emily. Ever since your transformation you were uncomfortable whenever Emily was out of earshot. You slept through most of the day just so you could avoid the feeling while Emily was at school. You'd wanted to go along with her, but mom had shot that idea down. She wasn't going to explain to the teacher why Emily had a cat in her backpack. When she was home you followed Emily everywhere. Underneath the table at dinner, sitting on a chair when she had homework to do, curled up on the end of the bed while she slept. You were ''compelled'' to stay with her. It'd only been a couple days and you felt closer than ever to her. [[Time with your witch|Get Away Bad End 11]]You were dozing on the couch while Emily was in the other room reading some boring book. You contemplated where to sleep next when you heard Emily's voice. <span class="emilyVoice italics">"It's kinda sad I can't keep you this way."</span> You snapped awake, looking towards Emily, you could see her from here, but she was nose down in a book, she hadn't even turned. You began moving towards her. <span class="emilyVoice italics">"You're just so cute."</span> Still she hadn't turned, but the voice sounded crystal clear. <span class="emilyVoice italics">"Are you sure you don't want to stay a kitty cat?"</span> By now you'd managed to circle around in front of her only to see something shocking. Her lips weren't moving. <span class="emilyVoice italics">"Don't look so surprised, you're my familiar, I don't need to talk for you to hear me."</span> She closed the book but her lips stayed firmly shut. <span class="emilyVoice italics">"I'm speaking into your mind."</span> [[You stared in shock|Get Away Bad End 12]]//Into my mind? Can she really do that?// <span class="emilyVoice italics">"Yup! Isn't that cool?"</span> //She can understand me!? I didn't even say anything.// <span class="emilyVoice italics">"This is way easier than trying to figure out your cat noises."</span> Emily explained that witches and their familiars were mentally linked. As long as the two of you were close enough you could communicate telepathically. Not only that, but Emily would actually be able to see through your eyes, though she needed a little more time to figure that one out. This was a mercy. Once again you had a way to communicate with more than @@.girlVoice;incomprehensible meowing@@. Though it did have one major drawback, Emily had to act as your translator. And her translations weren't always faithful. ... @@.emilyVoice;"Of course she wants you to rub her belly!"@@ //No I didn't!// @@.emilyVoice;"Hurry up Kara! She just can't wait!"@@ //Emily! Stop making things up!// Emily just smiled, and you were subjected to more belly rubs. The worst part was the fact you //did// like them, it was just humiliating to say so. [[Life as a cat|Get Away Bad End 13]]As the week continued you began to grow concerned with the situation. Mom had said that it would take some time for the magic to work its way out of your body. But how long was that? You'd thought it'd be a few days, but it'd already been almost a week, what if it was going to be weeks? Or even months? Then again, you were actually enjoying your time with Emily, as strange as it was. It was pretty awesome to be able to take naps whenever you wanted. Head scratches were always a joy and Emily was a good mistr...owne...sister. A dull ache built in your head. The longer you spent in this form the more you were getting comfortable with the idea of being Emily's familiar. She wasn't doing anything to encourage it, but the constant connection to her just reinforced your new relationship dynamic. Emily could see through your eyes, hear through your ears, but you couldn't do the opposite. When she cast magic you could feel it moving through you, but you obviously couldn't do any of your own. She was the one who acted and you were there to support her. She took care of you and you provided some comfort. You were even reliant on her to communicate any of your needs more complex than hunger. Sometimes she didn't translate perfectly of course, and at first that had annoyed you, but now....now it felt like perhaps that she just knew better than you did as to what to say. Though her mother was always able to discern the moments where the translations were...looser. Her mother was supernaturally good at knowing if her child was lying, and it had nothing to do with being a witch. It was a normal "mom power". When you found yourself once again curled up in her lap about to fall asleep you were struck by a strange idea. It would be so easy to stay this way, wouldn't it? Mom had said that even when the magic faded she'd still need to cast a reversal. If you just did nothing, and let Emily make the decision then you'd probably just stay a cat. Things were so much easier when you let her make decisions for you... [[Living with Lady Emily|Get Away Bad End 14]]//Of course, Lady Emily.// You leapt off the bed, allowing Lady Emily to properly make her bed. Calling your former little sister "Lady", should have been something you'd refused to do. However, when she'd suggested it yesterday, half in jest, it had resonated so strongly in your mind that you couldn't help yourself. It just felt right to address her that way, she was your master, at least for the moment. Or maybe it was "mistress", that particular nuance of language wasn't one you felt the need to consider. You would be informed and then use the correct term as instructed. @@.emilyVoice;"This has been so much fun,"@@ Lady Emily cheered as she finished fluffing her pillow. She'd been enjoying you as her familiar, and even more now that you were addressing her with @@.girlVoice;proper respect@@. @@.emilyVoice;"Too bad you'll have to turn back into being my big dumb brother."@@ Right. Turning back. That was something you should probably have asked about. //Lady Emily. Do you know when the spell will end?// @@.emilyVoice;"I don't,"@@ she pondered for a moment, @@.emilyVoice;"mommy will though, gimme a sec, I'll go ask."@@ [[Wait for answers|Get Away Bad End 15]]<span class="emilyVoice">"Mommy, @@.girlVoice;$catName@@ wants to know when she'll turn back."</span> Mom looked surprised, @@.momVoice;"oh! Why didn't you say something earlier? I could have turned you back a couple days ago."@@ Your shock was obvious, but mom just laughed, @@.momVoice;"you don't get anything if you don't ask for it. Anyways, it seemed like you were enjoying yourself."@@ You couldn't entirely disagree, but you also felt foolish for not thinking of this earlier. All week you'd been ordered about and had your life planned for you. A normal @@.girlVoice;kitten@@ didn't exactly have much autonomy, and in some ways a familiar had even less. So you'd gotten into that dependant mindset, letting Lady Emily decide things for you. @@.momVoice;"Most of the feline magic has drained off and it will be little trouble to get you back on two legs again."@@ The idea of being on two legs wasn't as appealing as it sounded. You guessed that if you were turned into a human you'd be perfectly comfortable with it. But right now, on all fours, the idea of being on two legs sounded unstable and dangerous. //Turned ''back'' into a human,// you corrected mentally. It seemed silly from here, but you were once Lady Emily's older brother, though you shuddered at memories of your behavior at the time. [[Escape from kittenhood|Get Away Bad End 16]]@@.momVoice;"I just need a few things and we can get on with it."@@ Lady Emily's mother exited the room. In the moment of her absence Lady Emily picked you up, easily and securely cradling you in her arms. <span class="emilyVoice">"I'm going to miss having you around @@.girlVoice;$catName@@."</span> You were gripped with a sudden terror. If you were changed, then your connection with Lady Emily would be broken, you would be all on your own. Forced to face the world without her power to protect you, without her wisdom to guide you through life. Another part of you laughed at that mere idea. Lady Emily's wisdom and power were impressive to be sure, when compared to a @@.girlVoice;kitten@@, but a fully grown human would surely have more of both. @@.momVoice;"Alright this should do it,"@@ Lady Emily's mother returned, a small crystal in hand, @@.momVoice;"just stay right there and you'll be back to normal in a moment."@@ She muttered an incantation and a blue bolt emerged from the crystal. To your enhanced perception it seemed to be moving in slow motion. She'd told you to stay put, but it would be so easy just to step out of the way... [[Stay in place|Get Away Bad End Escape 1]] [[Dodge the bolt|Get Away Bad End Stay 1]]With a healthy dose of feline grace you sidestepped the bolt, which crashed harmlessly into the floor. Lady Emily's mother was stunned, @@.momVoice;"did you just...no, I just aimed poorly."@@ She lifted the crystal again, firing another bolt your way. [[Stay in place|Get Away Bad End Escape 1]] [[Dodge the bolt|Get Away Bad End Stay 2]]After you side stepped the second bolt your intentions were clear. This had been no accident, you were intentionally trying to avoid the magic. A third bolt and a third dodge confirmed it beyond a shadow of a doubt. Lady Emily's mother lowered the crystal and gave you a suspicious look, @@.momVoice;"$playerName, if you don't let me cast the spell, then you won't be able to turn back."@@ The name she used made you feel uncomfortable, you knew she was referring to you, but you didn't think of yourself that way anymore. //I know.// @@.emilyVoice;"She knows,"@@ Lady Emily translated for you. @@.momVoice;"And she ''wants'' to stay this way?"@@ //I do.// @@.emilyVoice;"She does."@@ @@.momVoice;"She wants to remain as your familiar forever?"@@ //Forever.// @@.emilyVoice;"Forever."@@ [[Everyone paused|Get Away Bad End Stay 3]]In the moments after Lady Emily spoke the air in the room changed. There was a stillness to it, locking you all in a sort of stasis. Lady Emily's mother sighed, @@.momVoice;"then the decision is made."@@ Her words echoed what you could feel in your soul, that little exchange had made things permanent. There was no turning back. This is what you would be. Forever. @@.emilyVoice;"I promise to be the best witch ever and take care of you and feed you and..."@@ Lady Emily swept you up into her arms and hugged you tightly. The warmth of her body dispelling any remaining doubts about your decision, a @@.girlVoice;purr@@ building in your chest. ... The next few days were surprisingly unchanged. You'd already been living the life of Lady Emily's familiar and you just had to continue as you had been. There were moments of disquiet. When your decision was explained to the rest of the girls there was an uncomfortable amount of attention, but it was tolerable. The contents of your old room being put into storage was unnerving. Though it was from it being an uncomfortable reminder of your old life, not a sense of longing about it. You were a familiar now, why would you worry about human possessions? [[A witch's familiar|Get Away Bad End Stay 4]]As the weeks progressed that mindset continued to solidify in your mind. You were Lady Emily's familiar and though you were both young, you'd grow together. Though you looked like a normal enough cat there were several important distinctions. One of which being your dramatically lengthened lifespan, so the two of you never had to worry about being apart from one another. Your mind was quite a bit sharper than your average feline, though nowhere near as sophisticated it had once been. Complex human skills like reading and writing had completely faded away, not that you'd be able to write with paws anyway. Decision making was difficult, it was easier to just let yourself move by instinct, or on the instructions of Lady Emily. She could do all that difficult thinking for you. A familiar didn't need to understand the underlying mathematics of an arcane circle, they just needed to stand with their master to act as a conduit or a stabilizer. Tasks like that, as complex as they sounded, came to you entirely naturally. The ability was coded into your very being. Not that you mourned the loss. Your imagination was rather limited now, but you couldn't imagine a better existence than one as Lady Emily's familiar. You would be at her side, and she would be at yours and the two of you could accomplish anything...after you finished this nap... Ending 15b - Ev’rybody Wants to Be a Cat <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "" 27>>Your last attempt to be insufferably obnoxious hadn't gone well. You'd tried cursing them out, saying enough mean things that they'd never want you to be around ever again. Instead you'd gotten shunted into some crazy classroom and now you couldn't say a @@.girlVoice;bad word@@ no matter how hard you tried. Which meant you were going to need a new strategy to drive them away. You couldn't say anything mean, but that didn't stop you from //doing// mean things. Though that was going to require some serious escalation to your previous behaviour. You weren't going to hurt anybody, but you might have to get a little pushy. Knock some stuff off tables, get in their way, mess with their stuff; basically you were going to need to act like a total pain in the ass. It wasn't going to be the most mature behaviour, but it might be enough to have them leave you alone. Of course there was no telling what kind of punishment Emily would visit upon you if you did. Time to get mean? [[Yes|Get Mean Ending 2-1]] [[Nevermind|Get Mean Ending Escape 1]]In the few minutes before the next activity you undertook your mission of becoming as unpleasant as possible. Knocking Kara's glasses case off the table while she was cleaning them. Blocking Emily's path when she was trying to get to the kitchen. Refusing to move when Miki wanted to sit down. It was nothing overtly violent, but it was decidedly unpleasant and you could see the increased annoyance of all the girls as you continued your mini tantrum. Finally Sophie stood up to confront you. Standing before you and <<if $playerAge >= 12>>looking up at you, fire in her eyes. The fact you were so much bigger than her didn't seem to phase her in the slightest.<<elseif $playerAge <= 8>>looking down at you. Using every iota of her superior height and size to drive home her physical superiority.<<else>>looking straight at you. You similar sizes meaning she was confident enough in her ability to take you, should it come to that.<</if>> @@.sophieVoice;"What's your problem?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"What do you care?\"">> You had to be very careful with your words, you really didn't want anything to get subbed out right now. @@.sophieVoice;"You're acting like a brat. You should apologize to everyone."@@ [[Apologize|Get Mean Ending Escape 2-1]] <<if $playerAge >= 10>>\ [[Push Sophie out of the way|Get Mean Ending 2-2]] <<else>>\ [[Push Sophie out of the way|Get Mean Ending Too Young Escape 1]] <</if>>\ <<silently>>\ <<changeHappiness "Emily" false>> <<changeHappiness "Sophie" false>> <<changeHappiness "Kara" false>> <<changeHappiness "Miki" false>> <</silently>>\<<playerVoice "\"Make me.\"">> <<if $playerAge >= 12>>You'd had enough of the situation. She fell backwards, crashing into Miki, who had been watching the intensifying conflict.<<else>>Sophie continued to look straight at you. The surprise of it was enough to knock her back, stumbling into Miki, who had been watching the intensifying conflict.<</if>> @@.mikiVoice;"Owwww,"@@ Miki sniffed. She'd clearly bumped hard into something in the fall. You weren't given a chance to examine the extent of the injury. Nor were you given a moment to explain yourself. @@.emilyVoice;"Enough!"@@ Emily shouted, staring at you from across the room. She was brandishing the wand, the tip of it quavering in your direction. She looked ''furious''. You realized that she also held a shard of glass in her hand. Instinctively you knew it was from the "swear jar" you'd smashed earlier. A fragment of the power was still there, and Emily could amplify it. [[Apologize profusely|Get Mean Ending Escape 3-1]] [[Keep walking|Get Mean Ending 3]] <<silently>>\ <<changeHappiness "Emily" false>> <<changeHappiness "Sophie" false>> <<changeHappiness "Kara" false>> <<changeHappiness "Miki" false>> <</silently>>\As you tried to walk out of the room you kept your eye on Emily. She glared at you, her irises suddenly disappearing, eaten by the black of her pupils. A malevolent aura built around her and the air grew thick with power. It was only a moment before a black streak leapt out of the tip of her wand. Striking you straight between the eyes and temporarily blinding you. ... You'd hoped that, once your vision came back, you'd still be in the living room with the girls, but you had no such luck. Once again you found yourself squeezed into an elementary school desk, staring at a blank blackboard. The room looked fairly similar to before, but seemed a little less childish. Everything was still friendly and brightly colored, but gone were the reminders of super basic stuff. Now there were grammar tips and simple math equations. You'd graduated, now you got to sit in Emily's grade 3 classroom. One thing that hadn't changed at all was the mom <<if $playerMaturity >= 12>>simulacrum<<else>>bot<</if>> standing at the front of the room. She looked angry with you, but that might just be you projecting your own emotions. Last time your outburst had resulted in education on not using "bad words", what was this going to entail? @@.momVoice;"I am very disappointed Emily."@@ //Here we go again with the "Emily" thing.// This time you didn't bother correcting her, she wasn't capable of learning. @@.momVoice;"Such behaviour is unbecoming of a girl your age."@@ [[The lecture began|Get Mean Ending 4]] <<set $getMeanEndingResist to 0>>\ <<set $oldPlayerAge to $playerAge>>\ <<set $oldPlayerMaturity to $playerMaturity>>\You prepared yourself for another bout of writing lines<<if $playerMaturity <= 5>>, though you @@.girlVoice;couldn't actually write anymore<</if>>. However, it seemed that your 'education' today would take a different form. She started writing out the platitudes on the board. <span style="color: lightgray">\ Good girls should never lie. Good girls shouldn't raise their voice. Good girls do as they're told. </span>\ ... She just kept writing, the mom-bot had a seemingly endless set of these platitudes. As she wrote more it was clear this was a rather old fashioned list. Very much in the "children should be seen and not heard" school of thinking. You doubted this was how your mom actually thought, but it was thematic for this classroom setting. <span style="color: lightgray">\ Good girls are always polite. Good girls control their emotions. </span>\ ... Writing more and more until the entire board was filled with these statements. You cringed at the set. Most of them were reasonable in isolation, but as a group they totalled to an extremely restricted existence. [[The lesson began|Get Mean Ending 5]]Pulling out a ruler she pointed to the first rule, @@.momVoice;"repeat after me. I will not use bad words."@@ @@.girlVoice;"I will not use bad words."@@ The words exited your mouth automatically. I will not use bad words."@@ @@.girlVoice;"I will not use bad words."@@ This didn't seem entirely necessary considering you'd already gone through it. But perhaps the "mom-bot" was actually different for each classroom, and they didn't compare notes. @@.momVoice;"I will do as I'm told."@@ [[I will do as I'm told|Get Mean Ending 6][$getMeanDoAsTold to 0]] [[Stay silent|Get Mean Ending 6][$getMeanDoAsTold to 1]]<<if $getMeanDoAsTold>>\ You weren't going to play this game. Last time you'd gone along with it you'd gotten pretty messed up. You didn't know how you were going to get out, but you also didn't want to get brainwashed again. @@.momVoice;"I will do as I'm told."@@ She repeated. The words were softer, just loud enough for teacher to hear. <</if>>\ Another rule, @@.momVoice;"I will always say please and thank you."@@ [[I will always say please and thank you|Get Mean Ending 8][$getMeanPlease to 0]] [[Stay silent|Get Mean Ending 8][$getMeanPlease to 1]]<<if $getMeanPlease>>\ @@.momVoice;"I will always say please and thank you."@@ An awkward silence. @@.momVoice;"I will always say please and thank you."@@ She only ever gave you a moment to start your response before moving on. <<set $getMeanEndingResist++>>\ <<else>>\ <<playerVoice "\"I will always say please and thank you.\"">> This one was totally fair, it was just @@.girlVoice;basic politeness@@. @@.momVoice;"Again."@@ <<playerVoice "\"I will always say please and thank you.\"">> It was @@.girlVoice;important to be polite@@ and to @@.girlVoice;mind your manners@@. <</if>>\ <<if $getMeanEndingResist === 0>>\ Your total participation seemed to satisfy the mom-bot, but it wasn't nearly enough to get you out of the situation. There were still dozens of phrases on the board, and at a minimum you were going to have and say them all. [[Repeat after her|Get Mean Ending Participate 1]] <<elseif $getMeanEndingResist <= 2>>\ It seemed that your partial participation hadn't been egregious enough to get you punished, but it did prevent you from moving on. She returned to the start. @@.momVoice;"I will not use bad words."@@ @@.girlVoice;"I will not use bad words."@@ @@.momVoice;"I will do as I'm told."@@ [[Repeat after her|Get Mean Ending Participate 1]] [[Refuse to say the words|Get Mean Ending No Participate 1]] <<else>>\ Your general lack of participation hadn't been punished thus far. At first it seemed that she might just keep going regardless of your participation, but after your third refusal it was clear that additional measures had to be taken. [[A new teaching style|Get Mean Ending No Participate 1]] <</if>>\@@.momVoice;"''Good girl'',"@@ mom's praise penetrated your psyche. That trigger was still strong. Hearing those words just made you want to follow along even more. It was easier just to go along with things; you might as well keep responding as she desired. As you continued you started actually considering the rules. At first you'd judged they harshly, but perhaps they were actually fairly reasonable? <<playerVoice "\"I will never lie.\"">> //Honesty is the best policy.// ... <<playerVoice "\"I will not run inside.\"">> //Running around inside is just asking to break things.// ... <<playerVoice "\"I will not be mean to others.\"">> //Everyone should try being a little nicer to each other.// ... The phrases went on and on, and you added a quick justification to each. Some of them turned out to be a bit more of a stretch, but they were all sensible on their face. Though you had to admit that it was getting rather boring and repetitive. Any hope of your compliance resulting in a quick freedom faded when, after finishing the first pass, you were forced into a second loop. [[I will...|Get Mean Ending Participate 2]]<<playerVoice "\"I will do as I'm told.\"">> @@.girlThought;I have to do what mommy tells me.@@ ... <<playerVoice "\"I will not raise my voice.\"">> @@.girlThought;Good girls were quiet and polite.@@ ... <<playerVoice "\"I will not run inside.\"">> @@.girlThought;I shouldn't run, or jump or climb or do anything rough in the house.@@ ... <<playerVoice "\"I will not have my toys at the table.\"">> @@.girlThought;Toys had to stay in their proper place.@@ ... The justifications were becoming more obvious with every line, your mind automatically providing why a @@.girlVoice;good girl@@ should @@.girlVoice;follow the rule@@. The second pass quickly blended into a third, and then into a fourth, at which point you lost count. It was easy to mindlessly follow along. After a bit @@.girlVoice;mommy@@ didn't even have to say anything anymore, she'd just point and you'd repeat. [[I will...|Get Mean Ending Participate 3]]<<addTrait "$traitCuteVoice" "Cute Voice" "trait">>\ @@.momVoice;"Very good."@@ Mom-bot finally broke the monotony of the repetition, though you were already repeating <<playerVoice "\"I will wash my hands before dinner.\"">> @@.girlThought;Good girls were always clean.@@ Some of the rules sounded more like something you'd tell a toddler to do, rather than a $playerAge year old like you, but that distinction had lost meaning. These were the rules you had to follow, it didn't matter. You were a @@.girlVoice;good girl@@ and you should @@.girlVoice;act like one@@. @@.momVoice;"I'll send you back if you promise to behave yourself. Do you promise?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"I promise to behave.\"">> You voice came out @@.girlVoce;soft@@ and @@.girlVoice;sweet@@, just like it was supposed to. @@.momVoice;"''Good girl''"@@ Those words again, but the effect had changed. You didn't feel any satisfaction at hearing them. You were @@.girlVoice;always a good girl@@, so it was just a statement of the reality of the situation. [[Back to the real world|Get Mean Ending Participate 4]]@@.karaVoice;"Whoa!"@@ Kara shouted as you suddenly appeared beside her. <<playerVoice "\"I'm sorry.\"">> You immediately apologized, @@.girlVoice;you shouldn't scare people@@. @@.karaVoice;"It's fine, you just spooked me. So..."@@ Kara cast a quick glance towards Emily, who's face was oddly serious. Kara continued, @@.karaVoice;"how are you feeling?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"I'm feeling wonderful. Thank you for asking.\"">> It was an obviously true statement and @@.girlVoice;you always had to tell the truth@@. Equally obviously you had to be @@.girlVoice;polite@@ and @@.girlVoice;always say thank you@@. Emily stepped over to you, @@.emilyVoice;"are you sure? That class was...scary."@@ You nodded. Staying entirely silent was even better than just being quiet. It wasn't a rule you'd been specifically told, but since you should @@.girlVoice;never raise your voice@@, this seemed safer. Anyway you didn't know what was so scary about it, you'd @@.girlVoice;learned so many important things@@. You'd get her a cookie, though you'd never have one, @@.girlVoice;you shouldn't spoil your appetite with treats@@. [[Emily stopped you|Get Mean Ending Participate 5]]@@.emilyVoice;"Tell me what happened in there."@@ It would be annoying to explain //everything// that had happened, but @@.girlVoice;you shouldn't complain@@, so you explained it in all the detail you could muster. ... Emily nodded as you finished, @@.emilyVoice;"thought so."@@ She turned to the group, taking on a lecturing tone. @@.emilyVoice;"Do you remember the magic school?"@@ <<if $playerMaturity <= 8>>@@.karaVoice;"The //brain washin,//"@@ Kara echoed, using an unfamiliar word.<<else>>@@.karaVoice;"The brainwashing,"@@ Kara echoed.<</if>> @@.emilyVoice;"Right."@@ Emily continued, @@.emilyVoice;"mommy said it was for training me. But it had to get harder as I got older."@@ Kara jumped in, @@.karaVoice;"so the swear jar school was for a younger you, but this one was for an older you?"@@ It was always impressive how Kara was able to intuitively grasp these things. @@.emilyVoice;"Right. So this was waaaaaayyyyy harder, but <<playerName>> hasn't trained so $theyre..."@@ @@.sophieVoice;"Totally brainwashed."@@ [[Emily nodded|Get Mean Ending Participate 6]]Emily turned to you, @@.emilyVoice;"you're a ''good girl'', aren't you?"@@ You nodded. @@.girlThought;Of course I'm a good girl.@@ @@.mikiVoice;"So..."@@ Miki hesitantly spoke up, a little bewildered by the situation, @@.mikiVoice;"<<playerName>> is gonna play with us now?"@@ All of the girls looked to you, @@.girlVoice;sitting there quietly@@ and listening to the ongoing conversation, a @@.girlVoice;placid pleasant smile@@ on your face. @@.emilyVoice;"I guess so,"@@ Emily giggled. [[Time to play|Get Mean Ending Participate 7]]You and the girls got back to the sleepover. There was still plenty stuff to do and now you were compelled to participate, whether you wanted to or not. Even if you didn't like an activity you'd had to follow the rules: @@.girlVoice;play nice with others@@, @@.girlVoice;no whining@@, @@.girlVoice;no talking back@@, @@.girlVoice;no being mean@@. @@.karaVoice;"$Theyre so well behaved, it's almost eerie."@@ The other girls nodded their agreement. You were making Kara look like a rebellious wild child. Sophie was put out because you never rose to any of her bait. No matter how much she teased you, you'd just smile and take it. @@.girlVoice;No making fun of people@@, even if Sophie wasn't following that rule, you had to. <<if $playerAge >= 10>>\ Even with your new compulsions the magic of the sleepover continued to do its work. You got @@.girlVoice;younger@@ and @@.girlVoice;girlier@@ until your body matched your behaviour. Interestingly your mind was untouched, it was buried under a mountain of rules, but you were still as intelligent as a $playerMaturity year old. <<set $playerAge to 8>>\ <<else>>\ Your total participation seemed to be enough to satisfy the magic of the sleepover. You'd already been the right age and gender, now you had the right behaviour. What else was there to change? <<if $playerMaturity >= 10>>Though your more mature mind was actually still intact. It was buried under a mountain of rules, but you were still as intelligent as a $playerMaturity year old<</if>>\ <</if>>\ When mom returned home she was given a report that you had behaved exactly as Emily had desired, that you'd become the "perfect little girl". She just didn't mention the fact it had come from severe brainwashing. So you found yourself spending longer in the form, unable to protest the situation, @@.girlVoice;I will not complain@@. Mom would figure out the ruse eventually, probably, but until then you'd' act the exemplar of a @@.girlVoice;good girl@@, following @@.girlVoice;every rule@@ you'd been taught. Your teacher would be so proud... Ending 12a - Sugar and Spice and Everything Nice <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "" 22>>It was clear that you weren't going to properly participate in the process. If you wouldn't say the words then how would you ever learn the lesson? Teacher seemed unphased by your refusal, it seemed that she was prepared for just such an eventuality. She walked to the back of the room, grabbing a previously non-existent television on a cart. Wheeling it to the front of the class she looked back at you with a cold glare. A shiver went up your spine and you suddenly found your desk to be the only one there. Straight in front of the television, only a few feet away. The lights went out and the screen flickered to life. The rest of the room was impossibly dark, the light from the screen didn't spread out at all, it illuminated you, your desk, and nothing else. You couldn't even see where the teacher had gone. A cartoon rabbit suddenly appeared on screen. @@.momVoice;"Hi there kids,"@@ the rabbit gave a wave. You realized with some amusement that the voice was actually just your mother's, with the pitch shifted up. [[The show began|Get Mean Ending No Participate 2]]What ensued was a truly insipid show with a painfully obvious message repeated ad nauseam. This show seemed more targeted at toddlers than someone Emily's age<<if $playerMaturity >= 10>>, and you were a lot more mature than that<</if>>. Though that might have been the point. It would have been embarrassing for Emily, the same way it was embarrassing for you right now. @@.momVoice;"And remember kids, you always have to do what mommy tells you."@@ It was probably the fifth time in the last five minutes that point had been made. You understood exactly what it was driving at, but that didn't mean you cared. You hadn't obeyed the mom-bot, why would you pay any attention to this stupid rabbit? Except it was the only thing you could pay attention to. The rest of the room was filled with impenetrable darkness, so there was nothing to see. The human mind wasn't good at ignoring bright flashing lights, and this was the only source in the room. So even when you tried to let your eyes wander they always wandered back to the screen. Your stomach tightened; this was going to take forever. There must have been twenty or thirty rules on the board, if each of these episodes was five minutes you'd be here for<<if $playerMaturity <= 8>>...a long time.<<else>> at least two hours.<</if>> Assuming you only had to watch them once. You knew time in here flowed differently, so it'd only be seconds on the outside, but that didn't speed it up at all for you, stuck in here. The next episode had started. @@.momVoice;"Oh no! Mr Puppy has made a mess. Remember kids, if you make a mess, you have to clean it up."@@ [[The show continued|Get Mean Ending No Participate 3]]One episode blended into the next. ... @@.momVoice;"Oh no, Mr. cat won't share his ball. What should we do?"@@ //Yeah yeah, sharing is great, everyone should share.// Was there any way to speed this up? You'd gotten so used to the format that you could practically predict the next line. Not that it was any great feat to do so, it was //that// obvious. Yet you still had nothing else to do but watch. You were trapped in this classroom. Even if you could leave your chair there was no where else to go. Until the teacher decided you'd learned your lesson, you wouldn't leave. Maybe you should have just parroted the lines, it would have been faster. More embarrassing, but faster. ... @@.momVoice;"And remember kids, if you use it, take care of it."@@ ... @@.momVoice;"...remember kids, always be nice to everyone you meet."@@ ... @@.momVoice;"no yelling or screaming"@@ @@.momVoice;"always keep your word"@@ @@.momVoice;"say please and thank you"@@ @@.momVoice;"be nice to everyone you meet"@@ @@.momVoice;"always be honest"@@ ... Not only was each episode repetitive to a painful degree, but sometimes a different episode had basically the same lesson. You'd heard variants of "do as you're told" and "be nice" a half dozen times each. [[The show continued|Get Mean Ending No Participate 4]]That was hardly the last time you would hear them. Your initial fears about twenty or thirty rules had proven to be grossly underestimated. Since you'd started counting you were already past 35, and you'd missed the first few. Yet it proved impossible to tune out. Even when an episode was riffing on a theme you'd heard before it was //just// different enough as to steal some of your attention. The words slightly change, or there were new characters, or a sudden song. You didn't want to concentrate on it, but when it was the only stimuli in the room, it was hard not to. ... Finally at your breaking point you shifted tactics. Maybe teacher would be satisfied if you properly watched a few. Really showed that you were paying attention. So you paid your full attention to the annoying rabbit, currently blathering on about the importance of @@.momVoice;"always making your bed."@@ Yet once you gave it your full attention, it proved difficult to get it back. There was something @@.girlVoice;captivating@@ about the way the bunny moved, always bouncing around the screen. It's voice, despite you knowing it's origin, was quiet enough to be soothing, but perky enough to be exciting. There were other characters, but they weren't important, they barely ever spoke. Your attention stayed squarely on the rabbit, your mind trying to figure out //why// you were so @@.girlVoice;fascinated@@. [[Follow the rabbit|Get Mean Ending No Participate 5]]With your attention fully on the rabbit the rest of the show seemed to fall away. You could hear the words, and see the other animal characters, but you weren't really aware of them. The words floated by your ears, directly into your subconscious. //Why can't I stop watching this rabbit?// There had been a discomfort building in your chest, an awareness that you should probably stop watching, but you couldn't get your eyes to obey. When you tried something would always happen to snap them right back. The rabbit always had the exact right timing to ensure you specifically never lost focus. So you watched...and watched...and watched... You noticed impossibly small details. Frames where the drawings were slightly off model, moments where the rabbit stretched its whole body for emphasis. You even discovered that it's eyes weren't perfectly black, but an incredibly dark gray. So you watched the rabbit...watched the rabbit...watched the rabbit...watch...rabbit... At some point your mind outwardly shut down. Your eyes still followed the rabbit, but there was no thought there. [[Watch the rabbit|Get Mean Ending No Participate 6]]''Click'' The TV turned off with a suddenness that had you staring at a blank screen for several more moments. Wiping the drool from the corner of your mouth you blearily looked around the room. The lights were back on, and everything looked basically the same as before. @@.girlThought;Where is the rabbit?@@ Instinctively you searched for it, it's presence having become a fixture in your mind. When it proved absent you weren't sure if you should be relieved or terrified. @@.momVoice;"That's enough television for today."@@ Teacher spoke as she wheeled the TV back to the corner of the room. Acting like it wasn't her that had caused that impromptu TV marathon. @@.momVoice;"You've learned your lesson, so you may go."@@ //Lesson? I didn't learn anything. That rabbit didn't say anything that wasn't blindingly obvious.// But you were glad to be free, so you took the easy route and just nodded. Teacher nodded back, @@.momVoice;"now remember to be a ''good girl''."@@ The words echoed in your head as the world disappeared. [[The next morning|Get Mean Ending No Participate 12]] <<set $playerAge to 6>>\When you awoke the next morning it quickly became apparently that your compulsions hadn't faded in the slightest. Ending 12b - The Stepford Child <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "" 23>>//On second thought, maybe not.// Getting mean was most likely going to just encourage Emily to make you even more compliant. Honestly, even this little diversion had been enough to calm you down a little bit. You still felt super awkward about the party, but you could tolerate it, at least a little longer. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<set $humiliation to 5>>\ <<set $getMeanBadEndEscape to true>>\<<playerVoice "\"I'm sorry.\"">> You slumped, the fight going out of you. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<set $humiliation to 5>>\ <<set $getMeanBadEndEscape to true>>\<<playerVoice "\"Oh gosh,\"">> you rushed over to Miki, <<playerVoice "\"I'm so sorry.\"">> Sophie turned to you with fire in her eyes. [[The aftermath|Get Mean Ending Escape 2-2a]] <<set $playerAge to 9>>\ <<set $getMeanBadEndEscape to true>>\ <<set $humiliation to 0>>\@@.sophieVoice;"Sit down."@@ Sophie placed her hands on your chest as she spoke, gently pushing you backwards. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<changeHappiness "Sophie" false>>\ <<set $humiliation to 5>>\<<include "Reset state for ending start">>\ Emily needed only a moment to come to a decision. The two of you had actually grown closer during the party, so you doubted she would do anything too terrible. Then again Emily's idea of 'reasonable' was rather warped. She'd thought regressing your mind and body had been great fun. It was fairly clear that you were going to end up some flavour of little girl, but what exactly did she have in mind? @@.momVoice;"Interesting,"@@ your mother spoke after hearing Emily's request, @@.momVoice;"we shall have to see how that goes."@@ Your mother finding something 'interesting' didn't make you feel any better. She'd probably thought this whole party was 'interesting'. You grumbled to yourself, how had you ended up with such a crazy sister and mother? Were all witches like this? Or did you just get a weird set? Either way there was little you could do about it right now. Your mother began to move her hands through an arcane gesture before you felt her power wash over you. [[Weather the changes|Emily High Happiness Ending 2]]The first thing you were struck by, as you felt the magic work over your body, was how familiar this felt. You wouldn't have said you could detect the 'flavour' of a magic, but you could recognize a pattern. <<if $oldPlayerAge >= 14>>You'd never actually had your body changed that much, so what came next was all new territory for you.<<elseif $oldPlayerAge >=11>>Though it felt stronger than it had last time. Likely this meant you'd end up younger than before.<<else>>You'd gone through this whole thing before. You just hoped it wouldn't become a routine.<</if>> You watched as your hand got smaller and smaller. It wasn't the only thing changing, but there was something fascinating about watching something so simple change into something nearly unrecognisable. Knowing something like the 'back of your hand' didn't really apply when that hand had lost every hair it'd had on it. When every rough spot was being smoothed out until it @@.girlVoice;shone like porcelain@@. When it ended up half the size it'd been before and it looked like it would shatter if you tried anything too strenuous. Even the lines on your palm seemed different. You couldn't exactly remember the pattern of them before, but they stood out stronger on your more youthful hands; no red dry patches to obscure their criss crossing pattern. Would your fingerprints even be the same now? Obviously they would be smaller than before, but what of the pattern? If TV was to be believed everyone had their own entirely unique fingerprint. Did you still have your unique pattern? Or was it a new one? This didn't matter, certainly not in comparison to the changes you felt washing over the rest of you. But you could deal with those changes later. You turned your hand this way and that, examining every nuance of it as the changes slowed. Marvelling at how thin your fingers were becoming. How the nails, which looked so @@.girlVoice;delicate@@ now, were just a touch longer than before, yet fastidiously taken care of. A sign of consistent nail care that you'd never done in your life. There was a strange implication of a little girl having nails that nice. Had you been taking care of them, for years, by yourself? Surely you would have been too young, mom must have. Did your mother know about the responsibility she was retroactively taking on? Surely you were looking far too deeply into this, but the hyperfocus helped keep you composed. Finally the changes seemed to come to an end, your new hands settling into their final form. Bereft of anything new to examine you took stock of the rest of your body. [[Check yourself|Emily High Happiness Ending 3]]It was no surprise that the rest of you had shrunk along with your hand. The loss in size made abundantly clear by the fact that your pants had fallen down and your socks were each big enough to hold two of your @@.girlVoice;dainty@@ feet. Your shirt was the only garment that had managed to hang on. Now acting as a loose oversized dress. Many of the changes you'd observed on your hand were replicated elsewhere. Limbs @@.girlVoice;small and delicate@@. Skin @@.girlVoice;soft and blemish free@@. Though it did leave one major question of what your face looked like. You already knew you had long blonde hair, it'd fallen across your vision almost immediately, but what of the rest?
