Your mother summoned a small mirror in front of you, letting you see the totality of your changes. Though at first you thought that the mirror was broken. The face staring back at you was vastly too familiar, in fact it was one that you saw basically every day. It was one of the few faces that you knew better than your own. Emily's bright blue eyes stared back at you. Wavy blonde hair framed an @@.girlVoice;angelic@@ face with @@.girlVoice;adorably rosy@@ cheeks. Normally it wouldn't be at all weird to see that face.It got weird when a second version of her came into frame, your sister having come to stand beside you. @@.emilyVoice;"We're twins!"@@ She squealed, clearly pleased with the results. She grabbed your hand, putting it palm out and then matching it with her own. True to her word they were an exact match, each finger as long and thin as it's reflection, @@.emilyVoice;"oh my gosh this is going to be so much fun."@@ You looked back into the mirror. The only difference between you being that you didn't match her wide smile. You were disconcerted by the change. A younger you was one thing, but this felt more personal. You weren't you anymore, you were her, or at least a copy of her. [[Finish the party|Emily High Happiness Ending 4]] <<set $playerAge to 8>>\ <<set $hairstyle to 1>>\ <<set $hairLength to "long">>\ <<set $epilogueStartAge to $playerAge>>\Breakfast passed mostly in silence, the girls just quietly chatting with each other until their parents came to pick them up. It all seemed normal enough until Kara left. @@.karaVoice;"See you on Monday!"@@ Kara called to you as she went out the door. You sighed, you'd almost forgotten you had to spend the whole week like this. Despite the results of the trial you wondered if you could get out of this. With all the girls gone surely you didn't //actually// have to stay a little girl. No doubt Emily would protest, but mom couldn't actually expect you to spend a whole week like this, could she? How could they explain that Emily suddenly had a twin that no one knew about? <<playerVoice "\"Mom? Can I go">> [[back to normal now?|Emily High Happiness Ending 5]]<<playerVoice "\"">>@@.momVoice;"I'm afraid not sweetie."@@ //Sweetie? Really?// Just because you were this small didn't mean you were okay with being 'sweetie'. @@.momVoice;"Your behaviour at the party has made it clear that you haven't quite learned your lesson."@@ Reflexively you wanted to protest, but the trial had been your chance for that, and you'd lost. @@.momVoice;"So you'll be staying like this for a week, as per your sentence. Emily will take you to school with her tomorrow."@@ <<playerVoice "\"School? But what about my school? I can't just show up at her school unnanounced.\"">> @@.momVoice;"Don't worry about that. A week off of high school won't put you too far behind, and you're already registered at Emily's school."@@ She offered you a piece of paper. A new student registration form. You looked down [[at the name.|Emily High Happiness Ending 6]]<<playerName>> You incredulously looked at your mother, when had she had time to set this up? Emily giggled at your plight, but didn't let it get too loud. Mom might not like it if she showed //too// much pleasure about the situation. <<if $oldPlayerAge <= 13>>\ @@.momVoice;"Now I know you have a new outfit from playing dressup yesterday. But I don't think it's quite right for school. Emily. Go and help your sister pick out something more appropriate."@@ <<else>>\ @@.momVoice;"Emily. Go and help your sister pick out an outfit for tomorrow."@@ <</if>>\ @@.emilyVoice;"Yes mommy,"@@ she singsonged, the perfect image of an obedient little girl. At least for as long as she was getting to play with her new @@.girlVoice;twin sister@@. @@.emilyVoice;"Come on ''sis'',"@@ she put all the emphasis she could on the last word, offering her hand to you. You took a glance at your mother, her face making it clear this wasn't optional. You sighed and followed your excited sister to her room, nervous the upcoming dressup session, as well as what was to come tomorrow. [[The next morning|Emily High Happiness Ending 7]]<<Image 'Endings/EmilyHigh/1.webp' "topRightCorner">>\ You tugged at the hem of your skirt and adjusted your silly bow tie, but your mother brushed your hands away. @@.momVoice;"Stop fussing. You look perfect."@@ Perfect for a little girl maybe, but far from your idea of perfect. This outfit was ridiculous. Emily went to public school, they didn't have uniforms, but that hadn't stopped her from dressing you up like a @@.girlVoice;preppy schoolgirl@@. You'd expected your mother to veto the outfit in lieu of something more sensible. But instead she'd been overjoyed at how @@.girlVoice;cute@@ you looked. White blouse, red plaid skirt and a bow tie to match. The skirt even had four gold colored buttons on the front. These did nothing but add some flair. Between that and the fake school crest it was clear that this wasn't a proper school uniform, but heavily evoking one while being extra @@.girlVoice;cute@@. Emily had even found some black Mary Jane shoes and white socks to round out the outfit. <<playerVoice "\"But mom,\"">> you hated how @@.girlVoice;childish and whiny@@ that sounded, but how else were you supposed to raise your concerns? @@.momVoice;"No buts. Emily picked a lovely outfit for you. I'm sure the other girls will love it."@@ You didn't want your wardrobe choices to be dictated by what would impress eight year olds, but between the two of them you didn't have much choice. [[Time for school|Emily High Happiness Ending 8]]Annoyingly Emily and your mother had been entirely right. The other girls, and even the teacher, //loved// your outfit. The boys scoffed at it, but most of them were still at the age where girls had @@.girlVoice;cooties@@. Furthermore it seemed your mom and Emily had worked out an entire backstory for this. You were a cousin from out of town...yes the two of you looked super alike...everyone always said you looked like you could be @@.girlVoice;twins@@...you weren't sure how long you'd be around. Emily even supplied the fact that you were @@.girlvoice;awfully shy@@, so all you had to do was nod along as Emily wove her tale. Class itself was obviously mind numbing. Your head was still a little messy from the party, but not so much that grade 3 Math would cause you problems. You'd learned how to carry the one for addition an eon ago. Apparently it was the newest concept for Emily and her peers. Although, once you all started on your worksheets it was clear you weren't the only one who'd been reading ahead. Kara was done in a flash and had moved on to help other students. Technically you could do the same, and better, but the last thing you wanted to do was draw any more attention to yourself. The rest of the day continued much as it started, learning trivial things you'd mastered ages ago. Lunch was perhaps the worst part. Every girl seemed to want to know more and more about you. Turned out that Emily was rather popular among her peers, which meant they were automatically interested in anyone related to her. With Emily's help you were able to get through without slipping up. Flying under the radar for the rest of the day. Only when you were walking home together did Emily drop the act. [[Did ya have fun?|Emily High Happiness Ending 9]]On the whole the day had been boring, frustrating and embarrassing. Though you had to admit that at lunch, despite how much you'd hated it at first, it was @@.girlVoice;kind of fun@@ to be among that gaggle of excited girls. There were no secret agendas or arcane social rituals there, they were just excited by the possibility of making a new friend. There was joy in the simplicity. But you weren't ready to admit that to Emily. So you simply shook your head and hurried home in silence. Mom asked the same question and you gave the same answer, excusing yourself to your room under the pretext of doing your 'homework'. Not that it would take you more than two minutes, it was for children after all. But you couldn't escape conversation forever and you'd been forced to come down to socialize during dinner. Mom asked for endless details about the day. Luckily Emily was more than happy to provide, giving a detailed run-down of every moment of the day. Though, to your ears, she was embellishing things. She made it sound like you'd had tons of fun and that you were already making friends. It seemed wrong, but it did make you consider, what if you had enjoyed it more than you were willing to admit? [[The next morning|Emily High Happiness Ending 9-2]]<<Image 'Endings/EmilyHigh/2.webp' "topRightCorner">>\ This thought stuck with you all the way until the next morning when it was once again time for elementary school. You had a whole new outfit. This time it less aggressively 'schoolgirl', but still undoubtedly 'little girl'. A white t-shirt emblazoned with "Love" and a black skirt with a little frill. Emily was her usual excited self; practically dragging you out the door. The day progressed much the same. Everyone was excited to see you. They loved your outfit. Class was boring. Lunch was socially overwhelming. You could barely believe that the girls were just as excited on day 2 as they had been on day 1. It was soothing in it's own way, that relentless optimism. So easy to get drawn into it and stop caring about the craziness and complexity of the 'big kid' world. Once you got home you made yourself a deal. Mom wasn't going to turn you back until you 'learned your lesson' and it seemed a large part of the benchmark for that was your participation. So for the last three days of the week you'd let yourself just be present and go with the flow. You weren't about to start @@.girlVoice;giggling about princesses@@, but you would at least try and participate. [[The week continued|Emily High Happiness Ending 10]]<div style="height: 332px;"> <<Image 'Endings/EmilyHigh/3.webp' "smallTopRightCorner">>\ On Wednesday you were sure Emily had gone too far. A blue @@.girlVoice;frilly@@ blouse with torn jean shorts. You figured it would look more at home on a five year old than an eight year old. But either your sense of the latest in grade three fashion was off. Or the other girls just loved to talk about clothes. It turned out to be both. Your outfits been the focus of the last few days. You were a novelty after all. But you'd been dragged into other conversations about @@.girlVoice;cute dresses and skirts@@. It seemed that @@.girlVoice;hyper girly and childish@@ were all the rage. Then again maybe these weren't childish to them, they were only eight after all. </div> <div style="height: 332px;"> <<Image 'Endings/EmilyHigh/4.webp' "smallMiddleLeft noTopMargin">>\ Thursday was a flowy white dress with black trim around the collar. A @@.girlVoice;delicate ribbon@@ looped around your neck and tied behind your back. It was pretty clear that Emily was trying to run you through the gamut of girl clothes. @@.girlVoice;Skirts and blouses. Dresses and ribbons.@@ The whole nine yards. As before everyone loved it. They wondered aloud how Emily would look in the dress before realizing the absurdity of the question. She'd look just like you did, since you looked just like she did. </div> <div style="height: 332px;"> <<Image 'Endings/EmilyHigh/5.webp' "smallTopRightCorner">>\ Friday's outfit was odd. Not because it was over the top, but because it wasn't. All the other outfits had clearly been Emily trying different things, going over the top into specific styles. But today it was simple. A white t-shirt and a jean skirt, with some roses for decoration. It felt less like Emily playing dress up with you as the @@.girlVoice;doll@@ and more like something you'd just wear on a normal day. That thought put you in an odd mental state. It was less a performance and more of just a day. Dozing through boring classes, eating lunch, wishing for the weekend. When the day ended you even reflexively said <<playerVoice "\"see you next week,\"">> as the girls waved goodbye. </div> [[The walk home|Emily High Happiness Ending 10-2]]Emily didn't bother you on the walk home. She knew you were upset, but wanted to give you space. Space wasn't something you had much of these days at this point the two of you spent almost every waking hour with each other. Heck, you even spent your sleeping hours together now, since you shared the same bed. You were pretty sure you were old enough to have your own bed, but Emily had insisted. It'd be annoying except you'd never slept better in your life. Sharing your morning routine also seemed to make the whole thing just a little more enjoyable. It'd been so easy to just follow along with Emily and mimic her actions until they became natural. But Emily was only eight, how was she supposed to broach this subject? It was way outside of her experience. Luckily mom noticed as well, and she had a much better sense of what was going on. She sat you down once you'd had a chance to decompress from the day. @@.momVoice;"Did you have a good day at school <<playerName>>?"@@ That name didn't even seem unusual anymore, you'd heard it so many times over the last five days that it really did feel like your name. <<playerVoice "\"I-I did, I think.\"">> [[Mom nodded|Emily High Happiness Ending 10-3]]She nodded, @@.momVoice;"Well I'm very proud of how you behaved this week. I can really tell that you've grown closer with Emily."@@ It was obviously true. Being immersed in that world reminded you of what it was like. It was mostly carefree fun, but it came with it's own set of challenges. So you understood better why sometimes it seemed like she was being a brat. Why sometimes she so desperately wanted your attention. @@.momVoice;"I have a proposal for you. This magic will hold basically indefinitely, and a two week absence isn't too different from one. So, if you want, you could spend one more week like this."@@ You bit your lip. At the start of the week your answer would have been obvious. You'd been counting down the minutes until you could be back to your normal self. But that had changed. This little body, waking up beside Emily, going to school with the girls, all felt normal. Better than normal in fact. Once you'd let yourself relax this week was way more better than high school ever had been. You'd already had more friends in Emily's class than you did in your own. One more week did have it's appeal... [[I'll stay like this one more week|Emily High Happiness Ending Stay Little 1]] [[I want to go back to normal|Emily High Happiness Ending Change Back 1]]It wasn't a truly horrible prospect, you had enjoyed some of it. But it wasn't who you were, you were just playing at being a @@.girlVoice;little girl@@. There was a difference between play acting for a week and actually living that life. Who wouldn't enjoy a week off as a kid? None of the responsibilities, no worries, no concerns, you could just relax. Your mom nodded, though she looked slightly disappointed about what you thought would have been the obvious answer. @@.momVoice;"That's fair, you must be true to yourself. I'll turn you back, but I do have a condition. I want you to prove to me that you've really learned your lesson. If at the end of next week you're still fighting with Emily, then you'll be spending another week in dresses. Fair?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"Fair,\"">> you agreed. It shouldn't be much of an issue, it was pretty easy to be on your best behaviour for a week. Plus you really had grown a little closer to Emily, so you'd probably pass even without trying. @@.momVoice;"Good. Now to keep things fair I'll be erasing this part of the conversation from your memory. It's not a real test it you know you're being tested. Now is it?"@@ Before you could protest there was a flash in front of your eyes. You blinked, trying to get your bearings. You'd been talking to your mom about turning back, and now you were back to normal. So mission complete? @@.momVoice;"A little disorientation is to be expected after such a dramatic change. Try not to do anything too strenuous this evening. Maybe you can get started on your homework from the last week.".@@ You groaned, you'd forgotten about the fact your real homework was piling up on the side. You'd been spending your time learning times tables and the names of baby animals, but no one could escape calculus forever. [[The next week|Emily High Happiness Ending Change Back 2]] <<set $playerAge to 16>>\The next week things were back to normal, the old normal. High school five days a week with all the attendant perks and annoyances. You'd enjoyed being able to glide through your homework in ten minutes. Now you had to actually work at it. Plus Emily had decided that you were also a valid source to ask for homework assistance, rather than just mom. At first you'd been inclined to just reject her and wave her off as usual. But having just gone through that homework yourself, you had a little sympathy. So you helped her out. It actually became a bit of a routine, and the two of you started doing homework in the same room. She benefited from the help, and you enjoyed the little breaks her presence provided. It wasn't that the two of you were best buddies, you were still eight years apart, but things were a lot better. At the end of the week your mother sat you down one more time. Snapping her fingers before she'd even spoken. Once she did the lock on your memory broke and your heart dropped. That whole week had been a test? Had you been that nice to Emily? Sure you'd helped her study but the two of you still clashed at least once a day. You weren't overly enthused about the idea of being back in a dress. [[You'd passed the test|Emily High Happiness Ending Change Back 3]]@@.momVoice;"You don't need to worry,"@@ she could see the concern in your eyes, @@.momVoice;"I'm happy with how you behaved. Yes the two of you fought, but I wasn't expecting perfection. A boy and a girl eight years apart? There are going to be fights, that's just having a sibling."@@ You knew your mom had a sister, and from the stories you'd heard the two of them had gotten into plenty of fights. And that was a fight with magic, so you could barely imagine how destructive that could get. @@.momVoice;"As long as the two of you can keep some amount of peace there isn't a need for anything more drastic. Just keep helping your sister with her homework and try to be patient with her. And I'll make sure she doesn't turn your entire wardrobe into pink frilly dresses...again."@@ You nodded, breathing a sigh of relief at the bullet dodged. Life was really and truly back to normal. Except now you and Emily actually got along...mostly. You'd even offered to supervise her next sleepover, under the caveat that your age and mind were off limits. You'd let them paint your nails and do your hair, but that was it. She'd smiled and agreed. You were fairly sure she'd do //something// to break the rules, she was eight after all, you couldn't expect her to behave like an adult. So as long as she didn't make you behave like a five year old you could tolerate it...probably...time would tell... Ending 2a: My Sister's Keeper <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "Emily" 2>>Mom agreed to letting you stay another week. You tried to justify the decision in that you needed more time to really learn your lesson. Though you never specified what the lesson actually was, or what it would take to learn it...so it was easy to ask for more time again the next week. One more week turned into two, then three, then a month and a half. Long enough that you were almost impossibly far behind in your 'normal' studies. For whatever reason mom didn't seem too concerned. Every week she asked you if you wanted to turn back and every week you deferred the decision another week. As much as class was boring, you were enjoying school. A respite from all the complications of your 'real' life. There was calming monotony to it all. Get up, pick a @@.girlVoice;cute outfit@@ with Emily and walk to school. Boring classes in the morning, @@.girlVoice;fun with the girls@@ at lunch, PE in the afternoon and then another boring class. Home time, dinner, finish your homework, get to bed. Every moment of it with Emily at your side. You'd actually started to get a little uncomfortable when she wasn't around, and she'd admitted the same was true for her. You had settled into such a rhythm that you had an automatic response to mom's question of 'one more week?' <<playerVoice "\"Um...uh...maybe I could stay just one more week?\"">> At this point it was obvious that you'd be saying 'one more week' forever. You just hadn't admitted it to yourself yet. But mother knows best. She sat down beside you and took your hand. @@.momVoice;"Sweetie,"@@ you'd gotten used to that nickname, @@.momVoice;"it's okay if you want to stay this way. Emily and mommy love you very much no matter what you look like."@@ You looked away, still feeling a little ashamed about your budding decision. You'd wanted to ask, but saying it unprompted...it was too much. Now mom had given you permission, which meant you were 'allowed' to say it. <<playerVoice "\"I-I wanna stay this way,\"">> your voice was so soft that it was barely audible. @@.momVoice;"That's very brave sweetie, I know that was hard to say,"@@ her voice was soothing and she gently kissed your forehead, dispelling any fears you'd had about her being mad. @@.momVoice;"I'll take care of everything to make it official."@@ The surety of how she spoke made one thing very clear, she'd already thought about this, she'd already planned this. She'd just been waiting for you to recognize your own feelings. @@.momVoice;"There is one more thing to consider. You've told me that school is awfully boring for you, since you've done it all before. I can fix that, but there are a few options."@@ [[Options?|Emily High Happiness Ending Stay Little 2]]@@.momVoice;"The mind is a complicated thing. A change to one thing can have unexpected side effects. It's simple enough for surface level, or temporary changes like you experienced at the party."@@ You hadn't really thought much about it, pretending to be an eight year old girl took up enough of your mental capacity. However, you realized that any mental alterations from the sleepover had faded away weeks ago. Mentally you were the 16 year old boy you. @@.momVoice;"I can only imagine the strain of having to juggle two personas. So, if you want, I can make some alterations to make things easier on you. Locking away all that old school knowledge. You'll still remember your old life, they'll just be a few holes here and there. But you will get all the fun of learning your times tables, same as your classmates."@@ You weren't sure that 're-learning times tables' was a major selling point for this plan. It was hard to say how you'd even feel about school going through it this time. It was such a different life that maybe you'd like French instead and hate Math, or maybe nothing would change at all. Either way it was appealing. You'd be spending more time doing homework, but you'd also be able to commiserate properly with the other girls, struggling and triumphing together. @@.momVoice;"There are two other options. Instead of just locking away the knowledge, I could lock away everything that happened to you after grade 3. You'd have all your normal memories up until that point, but after that would be blank. The sleepover would be the last day of the old boy you. Living your life unburdened by two sets of contradictory memories."@@ @@.momVoice;"The extension to that would be to remove all of them, of all your time being a boy. You'd still know about the existence of that old life, but it will feel more like a story than a memory. I'll craft you a whole new set of little girl memories to fill in those missing years. They'll be mostly based on Emily's and there may be some oddities, but most people can't remember much of their early childhood properly anyway. You'd have a whole new life to live."@@ You noticed she hadn't recommended or warned away from any of the choices. You'd tried to glean some preference off of her but she'd kept herself neutral. She wouldn't interfere with your choice. It was yours and yours alone. [[Don't touch anything|Emily High Happiness Ending No Changes]] [[Lock away the knowledge|Emily High Happiness Ending Knowledge Lock]] [[A blank slate|Emily High Happiness Ending Partial Memories]] [[A whole new life|Emily High Happiness Ending Full Wipe]]You didn't want her to change anything. That had been the life you lived and you didn't want to forget it. It was a part of who you were now. Your mother smiled and nodded, pleased with your decision. There were going to be some struggles with it. Keeping two sets of memories straight would be fraught with potential for misspeaking. Plus you'd have to deal with boring classes for years to come. But it would mean you'd have more time to goof off in the evenings after helping Emily with her homework. You'd just have to make sure you didn't perform //too// well at school. You wanted to be a normal girl, not some once in a lifetime genius who suddenly burned out at 16. [[Live your life|Emily High Happiness Ending Epilogue]]Those memories had been of the life you lived, and you didn't want to forget them. It was a part of who you were now. But you also didn't want to spend years being bored to tears learning elementary school Math and English. A few holes in your memory wasn't the worst thing. Mom had made it sound like it would mostly be unimportant stuff anyway. She put her hand to your temple. A pressure built at the front of your head, growing to an almost painful degree. Then there was a ''POP'' , the pain and pressure vanished. You felt normal, but there was a dim awareness that something had changed. @@.momVoice;"Sweetie, I have a Math problem for you. What's negative fifteen plus negative 9?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"Come on mom that's easy it's...it's uh...\"">> you were tempted to count on your fingers, but you didn't have enough for fifteen and what was a 'negative nine'? Mom smiled, @@.momVoice;"Don't worry sweetie, children your age don't know things like that. You'll learn about it in a few years."@@ Which meant the changes had worked. You searched your mind. Addition and subtraction were fine. You'd be able to multiply numbers as long as they were little, but division seemed hazy at best. A quick mental inventory showed similar gaps in all your school subjects. @@.momVoice;"Now why don't you head upstairs and help Emily with her homework?"@@ You groaned, glibly wondering maybe you'd made the wrong choice. Now you'd be struck doing difficulty homework every night. But that was just you being @@.girlVoice;whiny@@. You knew it was worth it. You smiled and nodded, engulfing your mom in a hug before heading upstairs to Emily's room. Though as you climbed it struck you. It was just as likely that she'd have to help you. You shrugged, if it got too bad you could always get Kara or Sophie to come over and help. [[Live your life|Emily High Happiness Ending Epilogue]] <<set $intelligenceOverride to 8>>\It felt like it would be a lie to create memories of a past you'd never had. But you didn't want to live a life with a second set of memories. You were going to make a whole new life and the future would be a mystery, as it should. She put her hand to your temple. A pressure built at the front of your head, growing to an almost painful degree. Then there was a ''POP'' , the pain and pressure vanished. You felt normal, but there was a dim awareness that something had changed. @@.momVoice;"Sweetie, I have a Math problem for you. What's negative fifteen plus negative 9?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"What's a negtive nine?\"">> You weren't sure you'd ever even heard that term before. Mom smiled, @@.momVoice;"Don't worry sweetie, children your age don't know things like that. You've still got all sorts of things to learn. Before you know it you'll be so smart they send you to high school. Do you know what high school is?"@@ Of course you knew what a high school was, you weren't a baby. <<playerVoice "\"It's where the big kids go to learn uh, big kid stuff.\"">>. That was the best explanation you could muster. You vaguely knew of its existence, but had no details. What did the school look like? What classes did they take? Did they have to read super long books like you did, or were they even longer? The answers to all of these questions came up blank. Which meant the changes had worked. You knew that you'd been a boy once, and that you'd changed, but those memories cut off at eight. You searched your mind. Addition and subtraction were fine. You'd be able to multiply numbers as long as they were little, but you had no idea what came next. That was stuff only the big kids knew. You imagined what it might be like, though that just ended up being how your class always looked but everyone was super tall and didn't fit in the desks. You gave a little @@.girlVoice;giggle@@ at the image. Mommy smiled at your answer, @@.momVoice;"why don't you head upstairs and help Emily with her homework?"@@ You groaned, glibly wondering maybe you'd made the wrong choice...you could have had homework be @@.girlVoice;super easy@@, but now it was going to be @@.girlVoice;super hard@@. You knew it was worth it. You smiled and nodded, engulfing your @@.girlVoice;mom in a hug@@ before heading upstairs to Emily's room. Though as you climbed it struck you. It was just as likely that she'd have to help you. You shrugged, if it got too bad you could always get Kara or Sophie to come over and help. [[Live your life|Emily High Happiness Ending Epilogue]] <<set $playerMaturity to 8>>\You wanted a fresh start. If you were going to live this life you wanted to jump into it with both feet. Wanted to be able to share everything with the other girls. Including memories sleepovers and parties, even if those memories weren't real. But that didn't matter, it was the memories you were going to make. She put her hand to your temple. A pressure built at the front of your head, growing to an almost painful degree. Then there was a ''POP'' , the pain and pressure vanished. You felt normal, but there was a dim awareness that something had changed. @@.momVoice;"Sweetie, I have a Math problem for you. What's negative fifteen plus negative 9?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"What's a negtive nine?\"">> You weren't sure you'd ever even heard that term before. Mom smiled, @@.momVoice;"Don't worry sweetie, children your age don't know things like that. You've got all sorts of things to learn, before you know it you'll be so smart they send you to high school. Do you know what high school is?"@@ Of course you knew what a high school was, you weren't a baby. <<playerVoice "\"It's where the big kids go to learn uh, big kid stuff.\"">>. That was the best you could muster. You kinda knew of its existence, but had no details. What did the school look like? What classes did they take? Did they have to read super long books like you did, or were they even longer? You imagined what it might be like, though that just ended up being how your class always looked but everyone was super tall and didn't fit in the desks. You gave a @@.girlVoice;little giggle@@ at the image. Mommy smiled at your answer, @@.momVoice;"why don't you head upstairs and help Emily with her homework?"@@ Emily, your twin sister. The two of you spent practically all of your time together. The two of you practically thought the same thoughts. Even if you were making up a totally new story Emily seemed to know exactly where it was going. If Emily had experienced something it basically meant that you had as well, even if you hadn't been there. You smiled and nodded, giving your mommy in a big hug before heading upstairs to Emily's room. Though as you climbed you knew that she'd probably have to help you. You always went back and forth on who understood which class better. Vaguely you knew that you might have known more about school once upon a time. But what good was knowing that maybe, possibly, some old version of you knew things? You put the hazy thought out of your head, you didn't like thinking about it. Even if it was just a vague memory of the existence of another you, it felt gross. You were you. That's what mattered. Right. No more silly daydreamy thoughts, you had to do your @@.girlVoice;stupid homework@@. If you had to you could always get Kara or Sophie to come over and help like they always did. Kara was @@.girlVoice;super smart@@ and Sophie was older, so they both knew things you and Emily didn't. But you'd know those things too, one day. [[Live your life|Emily High Happiness Ending Epilogue]] <<set $playerMaturity to 8>>\Your life continued much as it had in the past month. Some of the novelty had worn off, but it was still just as much fun. You and Emily went back and forth on picking outfits. Sometimes you were identical and other times you couldn't be further apart. It was fun seeing new people react to the sudden appearance of a copy, but in a new outfit. Your ballet teacher also had some clever ideas about what could be done with @@.girlVoice;twin ballerinas@@. All in all life was a joy. All of Emily's friends quickly became yours so you had endless people to hang out with. Of course you had plenty of @@.girlVoice;sleepovers@@ with Miki, Kara and Sophie. Even once the initial joy of the decision had worn off the two of you were closer than ever, as twin sisters should be. Soon enough you were officially sisters. Mom had 'adopted' you, so that there were less legal headaches. There were a few odd things that kept coming up about the situation. But between mom being so smart, and a little bit of magic, it was all easily settled. Life went on. Emily and you went to school. You sat through some fun classes, and some boring ones. You weren't always in the same classes, much to your mutual annoyance, but you were never apart for long. The only thing that really set you apart from the other kids was the fact you were both learning magic. Emily started off way better than you, but mom said you'd catch up quickly enough. You had the rest of your wonderful life ahead of you. But that was a story for another time... Ending 2b: The Trouble With Twins <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "Emily" 3>><<include "Reset state for ending start">>\ This might have been the worst case scenario. One of the other girls would have to come up with something on the fly. Emily on the other hand had no doubt been thinking about this for days. Worse still, mom had been trying to make the two of you get along better and things had just gotten worse. You would love to put the blame onto Emily, but it wouldn't work at this point, the other girls had backed her story that you were the issue. Which meant Emily didn't take any time at all to make her decision. Mom leaned down to hear her desire. It was loud enough that the other girls could hear it but you were left out of the loop. @@.momVoice;"Seems very reasonable,"@@ that was all mom said before she turned to you, hands extended. You braced yourself, you'd already been changed over the course of the party, but that had always been a slow thing. This change was likely to happen all at once. The best you could hope for was to mostly keep your mind, you knew your age and gender were forfeit. Mom began to mumble under her breath as her fingers weaved a complex pattern. You felt tingling begin to suffuse your body, your transformation was starting. [[Weather the changes|Emily Low Happiness Ending 2]]<<set $playerAge to 9>>\ <<set $epilogueStartAge to $playerAge>>\ <<set $playerMaturity to 9>>\ There was a pleasant warmth to the magic as it ran throughout your body. Apparently your mom didn't want the transformation itself to be a terrible experience. The life you'd have to live the week after was the punishment. Your head swam as your vision warped, your entire perspective of the room shifting. It wasn't a surprise that you were getting shorter but it was disorienting for it to happen this. You couldn't know when exactly that was going to stop but already your entire outfit had become a tent. Leaving you standing in a pile of clothes wearing naught but a shirt that was currently a mini-dress and inching closer to your knees every moment. You were concerned about how stable you would be post-transformation, so you took the risky move of stepping out of the pile. Leaving your pants, socks and underwear behind you. You looked down, the dress now to your knees, marvelling at how small your feet had gotten. It was a wonder you could even balance on something that small. They didn't even feel like they were yours. You wiggled your toes to confirm, watching to see your new @@.girlVoice;tiny toes@@ responded to your command. You @@.girlVoice;giggled@@ at how @@.girlVoice;silly@@ you were being, frowning once you'd caught yourself. The regression to your mind was becoming severe, if that'd been enough to amuse you. Little toes weren't the only think shrinking a distressing pace. The dress was past your knees now, but the body inside it only took up a fraction of the space. Even the sleeves of the t-shirt were starting to swallow your thinning arms. You were getting really young, potentially even younger than Miki<<if $oldPlayerAge < 6>>, though it wouldn't be the first time.<</if>>. [[The changes continued|Emily Low Happiness Ending 3]]<<silently>>\ <<set $voiceClassOverride to 8>> <<set $playerAge to 4>> <<set $playerMaturity to 4>> <<set $endingTraitEmilyLow to true>> <<set $traitAfraidOfTheDark to true>> <<set $traitMonophobia to true>> <<set $traitCrybaby to true>> <<set $traitAfraidOfHeights to true>> <</silently>> There was a change in how your body was morphing. It was subtle, but with nothing else to do you were very attentive to detail. You were still getting shorter, but you'd stopped getting thinner, in fact you'd started to gain some extra flab. Your legs got a little thicker, making them look a bit stumpy. The same was happening with your arms. You put your hands to your stomach, feeling the @@.girlVoice;little pudge @@that was building there. A quick pinch of your @@.girlVoice;chubby cheeks@@ confirmed what it was, @@.girlVoice;baby fat@@. That was when you really started to worry. How young was she planning to make you? Surely she couldn't be making you into an actual baby. What kind of lesson could be learned if you couldn't even speak? The 'dress' was down to your ankles, slipping off your shoulders and you were still shrinking. <<playerVoice "\"Mom?\"">> you squeaked out, shocked at how high your voice had gotten. Mom didn't answer, simply standing with the group and watching the final moments of your transformation. The hem of your dress touched the ground, starting to bunch up on the floor. The former shirt had fallen off your shoulders and was barely stuck holding onto your upper arms, leaving your collarbone exposed. Your hands were almost entirely engulfed by the sleeves. You elected to stay still, any shift might cause it to fall off entirely and you didn't want to end up completely in the buff. Mercifully the changes seemed to have stopped, but you'd ended up young, very young. A couple years younger than Miki, and at this age every year was a massive gap in physical and mental maturity. You waited another moment to ensure that everything had stopped, but the tingles had faded and your form had stabilized at @@.girlVoice;tiny and adorable@@. @@.momVoice;"Don't worry, that's as young as you'll get for now."@@ Mom's words did little to make you feel more comfortable, @@.momVoice;"Emily thought you would learn your lesson better if you had an age gap more like she'd had. I couldn't make you an infant, so a preschooler will have to do. Just be glad you're not a toddler".@@ [[You gulped|Emily Low Happiness Ending 4]]You wouldn't put it past mom to make you even younger. You'd have to be on your best behaviour if you wanted to keep your ability to walk and talk. <<playerVoice "\"Yes @@.girlVoice;mommy@@.\"">> Internally you winced at the word choice. You still wanted to try and keep some dignity, but calling her anything else felt too weird to even try. @@.karaVoice;"Oh my gosh she's so cute."@@ Kara squealed, to the agreement of the other girls. Within moments they had surrounded you. If you'd been unsure about your size this confirmed it. Even Miki had almost half a foot on you, Sophie seemed like a giant compared to you. @@.mikiVoice;"She needs a new dress,"@@ Miki giggled. They all thought your current apparel was @@.girlVoice;adorable@@, but it could slip off at any moment and was already a tripping hazard. @@.emilyVoice;"Come on, let's get you something."@@ Emily prodded you, offering her hand. The movement enough to dislodge the last of your clothes. Leaving you entirely naked in front of them. Your automatic response wasn't to cover yourself, in fact you didn't do anything, because you didn't feel like you needed to. You'd expected a rush of embarrassment and shame at the situation, but @@.girlVoice;none came@@. Nothing seemed odd about being naked in front of the girls, in fact you almost @@.girlVoice;felt more comfortable@@ like this. You'd seen this behaviour in toddlers before, nudity didn't bother them, they hadn't yet developed that @@.girlVoice;sense of propriety@@. The girls said nothing about the situation, though Emily and Sophie did cast each other an amused glance. The tripping hazard removed they started dragging you upstairs. The stairs were the first of many challenges that day. You were able to handle them, but it required serious concentration, and even with your full attention it was @@.girlVoice;slow and awkward@@. Your legs being so short was part of the problem, but there seemed to be a fundamental disconnect between your brain and your legs. Your control over them was coarse, sometimes moving more, sometimes less than you'd meant. Walking was fine enough, but climbing seemed to be a @@.girlVoice;developing skill@@. [[Get Dressed|Emily Low Happiness Ending 5]]<<Image 'Endings/EmilyLow/Day0.webp' "topRightCorner">>\ Apparently the oversized look was @@.girlVoice;too cute@@ to let go. The dress you ended up in was not dissimilar in form to the shirt you'd been wearing a few minutes ago. It still fit you like a tent, but the collar tapered down enough that it wouldn't fall off. Plus the hemline also stopped just above your knees, rather than on the floor. Thematically however, it was @@.girlVoice;unambiguously girly@@. It was @@.girlVoice;rainbow striped@@ with a prominent smiley face. So instead of stealing a shirt from your big brother, you'd stolen one from your @@.girlVoice;big sister@@. You did not consider this an improvement. At least it meant you didn't have to worry about tripping over the shirt, you'd just have to worry about your own feet... Once you'd all gotten back downstairs mom concurred with the girls on their choice, it was @@.girlVoice;very adorable@@. But then she shooed you all away, there was still a few hours before everyone would get picked up, no reason to stop playing. You would have much preferred to stay out of things and get this over with as quickly as possible. In a way you got your wish, but not in the way you would have wanted. After some time spent playing @@.girlVoice;silly childish games@@ the other girls wanted to @@.girlVoice;skip rope@@. Your eye-rolling about the activity didn't save you from being forced to try. The key word there was 'try', you weren't actually able to get over the rope more than once. The timing and coordination required was simply beyond you. After only your second failure you could feel the frustration @@.girlVoice;bubbling over@@. If you couldn't do it right you @@.girlVoice;didn't want to play at all@@. Luckily the girls agreed and let you sit out of that activity, and the next, and the next. It wasn't just because you were being sullen, but also because you were 'too little'. It frustrated you to hear, but you couldn't actually deny it. The games they were playing looked @@.girlVoice;really hard@@. Even if you could physically handle it, which was questionable, some of them had monstrously complex rules. One required you to count by 1s ''and'' 2s, you didn't even know how that was possible. [[The sleepover ended|Emily Low Happiness Ending 6]]Finally the other girls went home and the sleepover came to an end. It gave you a moment take stock of your situation. You'd been turned into a four year old girl. This meant that you were @@.girlVoice;small, weak and incapable@@ of most physical activities. Furthermore, you'd lost every piece of knowledge you'd ever gained at school. Even beyond raw knowledge that your mind felt '@@.girlVoice;slow@@'. It's a difficult thing to explain, but any complex thought felt like it took a while to come together. It was so much easier just to go with an fast thought and move on, even if the fast thought wasn't right or useful. Patience was not a virtue you possessed in any real amount. If you didn't remember that you'd been sixteen a day ago it probably would be tolerable. But you were stuck with this vague sense of loss, you knew that you'd known Math, but didn't even understand what Math was anymore. Maybe something to do with numbers? Still, you had to try and keep hold of yourself, you may look four year old, but you didn't have to act that way. Though this was a thought you could only hold rationally. Emotionally the idea didn't embarrassing at all, @@.girlVoice;what was wrong with acting four@@? A task that gained an extra wrinkle when mom revealed how you'd be spending your week. <<playerVoice "\"Daycawe?\"">> Again you winced. You kept saying things 'wrong', but you couldn't tell what 'right' was to correct it. You think it had something to do with 'letters'...but you didn't even know all the letters. @@.momVoice;"Yes,"@@ mom had already prepared your bag, with snacks and a few other bits and bobs, @@.momVoice;"I do have to work you know, so I need someone to take care of you while I'm out."@@ You didn't actually know what mom did for a living, and that wasn't a new gap in knowledge. She'd always been quite cagey around the specifics. You knew it had something to do with magic, but that was about it. You also wanted to protest that Emily got to be home all alone from 3-5, but you knew that was a fruitless argument, since she was four years older than you. Which meant you were shoved into a @@.girlVoice;booster seat@@ and driven to a nearby @@.girlVoice;daycare@@. Nervously walking through the door to an unknown fate. [[Daycare|Emily Low Happiness Ending 7]]Your senses were assaulted the moment you came in. The whole place was @@.girlVoice;rainbows and unicorns and cartoon rabbits@@. Lots of @@.girlVoice;shiny pretty things@@ to make all the other kids here feel more at ease. Even you had to admit that it lent a cheeriness to the place which calmed you somewhat. Nervousness had been eating at you the whole car ride. Sure it was just some stupid daycare for a week with a bunch of stupid little kids, but you couldn't help but feel @@.girlVoice;scared@@. Kids, toddlers and babies it seemed. Even if your eyes hadn't caught them, your ears were being attacked by the howling of a colicky baby. To compensate there was also light and happy background music suffusing the place. You had no idea what it was from, maybe from some children's show you missed by a decade. Well, missed the first time, you might get the full experience this week. The scent of the place was also a clue, it smelled clean, too clean. The only reason a place would smell like this is if there was reason to clean up all the time. Like if there were a dozen messy kids running around and babies who were still working on how to use the 'potty'. Your other senses were spared the initial assault, but that didn't last. Once mom had left and you'd joined the rest of the children it was time to 'play'. The first activity was, as it was described to parents, 'fine motor control practice'. In reality it meant @@.girlVoice;finger painting@@. It left you a rather interesting question, did you want to join in? If you didn't then there was nothing else to do...and it @@.girlVoice;looked awfully fun@@, and you were @@.girlVoice;bored of waiting@@. <<set $dontJoinCount to 0>>\ <<link "Don't join in">>\ <<set $dontJoinCount++>> <<switch $dontJoinCount>> <<case 1>> <<addclass "#fingerPaintAccept" "bigText">> <<case 2>> <<addclass "#fingerPaintAccept" "biggerText">> <<case 3>> <<addclass "#fingerPaintAccept" "biggestText">> <<case 4>> <<goto "Emily Low Happiness Ending 8">> <</switch>> <</link>> <span id="fingerPaintAccept">[[Try finger painting|Emily Low Happiness Ending 8]]</span>You simply @@.girlVoice;couldn't resist the urge@@ to join in. It would be way to @@.girlVoice;boring@@ to just sit around, so you might as well have a little fun while you're at it. You would have preferred actually having a paint brush, but as you quickly found our your subpar dexterity was far more suited to using your fingers. Your 'classmates' ranged in age from two to four, with the babies in a different room. You were able to keep yourself a little less messy than the toddlers, but you wouldn't say that your 'art' was all that much better. It really wasn't clear what you'd painted at all, it had some shapes, but they hadn't really coalesced into anything coherent. Still the daycare workers seemed very impressed by the work you were all doing. It was patronizing to have them compliment such sloppiness, but it also @@.girlVoice;felt nice@@ to hear. After only a few minutes task was over and it was on to the next thing. You were grateful, you'd been painting for ages and you'd been getting bored. The rest of the morning went fairly smoothly. You had your snack, requiring only a minor cleanup after you were done. Then it was story time. Story time went on for @@.girlVoice;way too long@@, but at least the story was fun. [[Time to go outside|Emily Low Happiness Ending 9]]Outside time was @@.girlVoice;extremely silly@@ but @@.girlVoice;extremely fun@@. No one was focused enough to actually be able to play any organized sport so it was mostly just random activities done at your whim. Some of the girls were trying to learn how to do cartwheels or little rolls. The two year olds were the @@.girlVoice;most adorable@@ on that point. They put their hands to the ground and then just sort of awkwardly stumbled over. Technically they started and ended in the correct position, they weren't actually able to do the complex bits in between. You were a @@.girlVoice;little better@@, your legs actually got off the ground, but you weren't able to keep them vertical like you were supposed to. After that it was just a bunch of random dancing. Once again you didn't know the origin of the music, but it was @@.girlVoice;super catchy@@ and you found yourself @@.girlVoice;joining in@@ with the awkward dancing of the others. Even the boys were part of this one, you supposed at this age there wasn't much difference between boys and girls. Girls just had @@.girlVoice;cuter outfits@@. [[TV Time|Emily Low Happiness Ending 10]]Before you could all have lunch the workers had to actual prepare it. Between you and the toddlers, and the babies in the other room there were a lot of mouths to feed. Which meant it was going to take some time to prep, time that they couldn't keep as good an eye on all of you. So they did what any good adult would when they needed to distract a child. They plopped you all in front of a TV. The show was @@.girlVoice;very kiddie@@, even by the standards of your regressed mind. But since it had to be inclusive of the toddlers, it had to be something simple they could enjoy. Which meant that all of the 'episodes' were only a couple minutes long, their attention wouldn't last any longer than that. @@.girlVoice;Nor did yours@@. As time passed and your stomach started grumbling you were done with TV and wanted food. Unfortunately there was still some work to do. They shuffled off the toddlers to get first dibs. Leaving the older kids with a new, more mature show. This one was about a doctor. She was seven so she knew about all sorts @@.girlVoice;big kid@@ stuff. Like how you shouldn't hug sick people, or that you should drink lots of water. The amount of info was almost overwhelming. You wished you had some way to note it down, but you could @@.girlVoice;barely hold a pencil properly@@, let alone write with it. @@.teacherVoice;"<<playerName>> it's time for lunch,"@@ the voice that came behind you was surprisingly stern. Looking around you realized that you were the only one still watching TV. She was stern because she'd called for you a bunch of times already. But @@.girlVoice;it wasn't fair@@, you wanted to keep watching! But your rebellion was short lived and you were coaxed to lunch by the offer of apple slices. After lunch, and a little free time, it was declared that it was quiet time now. Which was a nice way of saying 'nap time' without it sounding quite as @@.girlVoice;babyish@@. You had to admit to feeling a little tired, and since they had @@.girlVoice;helped you brush your teeth@@ you were basically ready for bed. [[Quiet time|Emily Low Happiness Ending 11]]Still it seemed that not all of the kids were actually going to take a nap. A couple of the other four year olds had some pictures books that they were reading under their blankets. Though they were just looking at pictures, like you they @@.girlVoice;couldn't actually read@@. As long as they were quiet they were allowed to do it. You wondered if you should do the same. You were getting tired, but you were also a @@.girlVoice;big girl@@ who didn't need naps anymore. If you put your mind to it you could stay awake for as long as you wanted. There were lots of pretty pictures to look at, and maybe something fun would happen. What if all the @@.girlVoice;big kids@@ had fun once all the babies were asleep and you missed it? You resolved to try and stay awake, stifling another yawn as you rubbed your eyes. <<filterlinkreplace "Try to stay awake">>\ <span class="smallText">\ <<filterlinkreplace "Try to stay awake">>\ <span class="smallerText">\ <<filterlinkreplace "Try to stay awake">>\ <span class="smallestText">[[Try to stay away|Emily Low Happiness Ending 12]]</span>\ <</filterlinkreplace>>\ </span>\ <</filterlinkreplace>>\ </span>\ <</filterlinkreplace>> [[Have a nap|Emily Low Happiness Ending 12]]Willingly or otherwise your body wasn't capable of staying awake any longer. You'd fallen asleep face down on your cot, one of the workers gently putting your blanket over you. This time you had no dreams at all, it seemed you were so tired that you didn't even have the energy to dream. You awoke with a start, not having really meant to fall asleep in the first place. You pulled your @@.girlVoice;thumb from your mouth@@ and wiped the @@.girlVoice;drool@@ onto your hand. Ignoring the wet spot you'd left on the pillow. It seemed the other kids were waking up as well, only one or two having actually read through all of nap time. Looked like you hadn't missed anything interesting this time. The time after the nap was rather chaotic. The remainder of the afternoon would be free play time, but first there was a lot to be attended to. First came the diaper changes, all of the babies needed them of course, and most of the toddlers. A couple even seemed embarrassed about that fact. It seemed that they usually didn't need diapers during the day, but night time was a different story and naps counted. You'd been lucky enough to keep your @@.girlVoice;potty training@@, as befit a @@.girlVoice;big girl@@. Mom had warned you that night might be an issue for you too, but the first night had been fine. You refused to let yourself be embarrassed that way, not that you had any idea how you could actually prevent it. [[End of the day|Emily Low Happiness Ending 13]]The rest of the day was a @@.girlVoice;ton of fun@@. They'd planned all sorts of games and activities to do and there were all sorts of @@.girlVoice;fun toys@@ and games. You played 'mommy' and 'daddy' with some @@.girlVoice;dolls@@ and the other girls. Then one of the babies had gotten sick, and you'd had to step in and @@.girlVoice;be a doctor@@ to make them feel better. When the crisis was averted the worker had said you were a 'very good doctor' and that you'd been a lot of help. @@.girlVoice;You were the best doctor@@. You hadn't even needed a steta-stehe-doctor thingy, to help you. The rest of the time flew and before you knew it @@.girlVoice;mommy@@ was at the door calling for you. Your heart leapt and you practically launched yourself at her, @@.girlVoice;grabbing onto her leg@@. @@.momVoice;"Hello sweetie, did you have fun today?"@@ You nodded. One of the workers had followed you here, since it had been your first day she wanted to let your mom know your behaviour. @@.teacherVoice;"<<playerName>> was very well behaved today. Girls her age often get fussy about naps, but she didn't complain at all and she played very well with the other children."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Imma doctah!\"">> You helpfully added, only belatedly realizing that you'd gotten a little too into your own fantasies. You'd lost track of the fact that you weren't actually a doctor, and that the sick baby was @@.girlVoice;just a doll@@. [[Ride home|Emily Low Happiness Ending 14]]Sitting in the @@.girlVoice;booster seat@@ on the way home you were able to take a moment to think about your behaviour. It was disconcerting. During the party you'd found yourself slipping into @@.girlVoice;childish@@ or @@.girlVoice;girly@@ behaviours on occasion, but only for a few moments. Today had been different, you'd slipped into that role for hours at a time. It wasn't anything conscious or intentional, it'd just been the natural way to act, the @@.girlVoice;only way you could even think of acting@@. Even now it was hard to parse which of those behaviour actually had been @@.girlVoice;childish@@ and which were mature. Your sense of the definition was blurry, the inscrutable actions of adults were too hard to understand. You still had your memories of being a teenager, but the memories were hard to understand. They were saying things and doing things that didn't make much sense. Why would you change clothes before playing outside? Why had those long writey things made you so anxious? Why did you spend so long staring at weird letters when you found it boring? You frowned. Was this something mom and Emily had added to make sure you'd behave properly? Or was your brain so small now that it couldn't handle all those adult thoughts? Even thinking about this all was making your head hurt, and @@.girlVoice;you were a doctor@@! Doctors are supposed to be smart. You bet even Emily wouldn't understand this. You were so proud of @@.girlVoice;being a doctor@@ that you forgot what you had actually been thinking about. Instead you began to regale mom with all the tales of your first day in daycare. The speed at which you told the story increased moment by moment as your excitement overwhelmed any concerns about staying coherent. But mom smiled and nodded as if you were telling her the most interesting things in the world. Even if by the end it was mostly @@.girlVoice;incomprehensible gibberish@@. [[You got home|Emily Low Happiness Ending 15]]Emily was somewhat less impressed with your stories, but she listened anyway. The only thing you couldn't understand was why she kept giggling at you so much. Some of the stories were pretty funny, but she was laughing at totally normal things as well. Why was it funny that you'd @@.girlVoice;really enjoyed finger painting@@? Or being @@.girlVoice;proud that you'd been well behaved@@? It was only after dinner, when you had a few moments alone on the couch that you were able to find enough clarity to realize everything that was happening. Emily was laughing not because the stories were funny, but because you were talking about them like a normal four year old would. In the car, you'd been thinking on this same issue, but you'd slipped back into thinking you were a doctor, before you could reason your way through things. You did your best to hold on to this train of thought, as much as you were already finding it @@.girlVoice;super boring@@ to think about. There was a reason they had turned you into a girl, but you couldn't remember exactly why. It was supposed to teach you a lesson about not being mean to Emily, but why did you need to be four to learn that? You hadn't been mean to her all evening, so it seemed like it was @@.girlVoice;super easy@@. @@.momVoice;"Bath time <<playerName>>,"@@ mom's voice startled you. How did she move so quietly? You nodded and began to work your way upstairs, only realizing once you'd entered the bathroom and stripped off that mom had followed you the whole way. Even Emily was standing shyly at the door. [[Bath time|Emily Low Happiness Ending 16]]Mom gave you an amused stare, @@.momVoice;"and what exactly do you think you're doing?"@@ You were confused, <<playerVoice "\"You 'aid was 'ath time,\"">> @@.momVoice;"Very good,"@@ she cooed, @@.momVoice;"it is bath time, but you weren't about to bathe on your own were you?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"Imma big giwl. I do allbynself.\"">> Mom just continued to smile, clearly not taking your protests seriously. Picking you up and putting you in the bathtub, kneeling beside the tub herself. What ensued was perhaps the most embarrassing part of your day. Now that you'd regained some clarity about your behaviour, you wanted to reclaim some independence. However, mom wasn't trusting you to bathe alone. Not just to make sure you were safe, but because she couldn't trust you to do it right. A trust that you didn't deserve anyway. You were given a brief opportunity to try it yourself, under her supervision. You'd successfully managed to wash about 20% of yourself before calling the job done, @@.girlVoice;beaming with pride@@. Instead you had to deal with mom scrubbing you and manhandling you and generally @@.girlVoice;treating you like a baby@@. Worse still was, when you were done, Emily went to have her own bath, //on her own//. Mom still stayed nearby, and kept checking in, but she was trusted to do that all by herself. [[Bed Time|Emily Low Happiness Ending 16-2]]<<Image 'Endings/EmilyLow/Pyjamas.webp' "topRightCorner">>\ Meanwhile you were on your bed in your underwear because you couldn't get your pjs on properly. It seemed like something you should be able to do, but it had been a long day, and you were already frustrated. @@.girlThought;I should ask mom for help.@@ You shook off the thought, you had to be able to do something on your own. But your attempts were continually frustrated, what you didn't realize was one of the legs had gotten inside out. But you were so focused on trying to just force it on you hadn't checked that. You could feel a @@.girlVoice;tantrum coming on@@. However, your energy reserves were low and you fell asleep, face down on your bed, one leg covered by pjs and one still bare, having @@.girlVoice;never successfully gotten dressed@@. [[The next morning|Emily Low Happiness Ending 17]]Once again your sleep was dreamless, but that didn't mean you weren't waking up into a dreamland. It was only Tuesday, you still had almost the entirety of the week before you. Maybe things would have been a little easier if you'd been in pre-school instead, at least that would try and engage your mind. Daycare didn't have those kind of educational goals, it was a place to drop your kids and keep them entertained until work was done. A normal child would have enjoyed that it was less learning and more playing. But to you it was all the more dangerous. It was much easier to fall into childish behaviours when watching a TV show than it was when trying to learn your letters. However, Tuesday went much the same as Monday. More of your time spent acting as a child than actually remembering who you'd been before. By Wednesday 'before' was becoming a very amorphous concept. How long ago had you been different? Was that an entirely different life? But the fading concerns about your situation meant you were able to enjoy yourself in new ways. Today the workers had put on some music so you could all dance. No particular reason, no greater purpose, just the fun of moving your body. @@.girlVoice;You loved it@@. It was so simple, but there was so much joy there, everyone looked so happy, which made you feel happy, which made you want to dance even more! Not that you actually did dance much longer. Despite the blissful experience it would quickly grow dull. Luckily the workers seemed to know, shuffling you all off to the next activity. @@.girlThought;Can they read my mind?@@ You wondered. @@.girlThought;Can I read minds?@@ You stared at one of the babies, but nothing came to you. Then again baby brains were really little, maybe you'd have to try with someone older later. [[The day continued|Emily Low Happiness Ending 17-2]]By the time lunch rolled around you'd full acclimatized to the situation. Concerns about anything before today, or after today, had fled your mind. You were having too much fun in the present to worry about that. As you watched you @@.girlVoice;new favourite show@@ you were briefly struck by the possibility that, despite it being a different episode, they were teaching basically all the same lessons. Maybe it was for the toddlers, they'd need to hear a lesson again and again to learn it...but you dismissed the concern. Today's episode was about the lion not wanting to share his ball with the others. You had a vague recollection that yesterday's had been about the hippo not sharing her kite. Totally different things. But you still felt @@.girlVoice;super smart@@ for even thinking about the possibility. The day had been full of opportunities to show how smart you were. Like when you'd stacked those blocks ''super'' high. Or when you'd correctly pointed out that the green balloon was bigger than the red balloon. Or when you'd identified at least three different letters, even if one had just been a guess. There was so much to learn and so much to do that you couldn't stand doing one thing for too long. Five minutes was best, ten if you really liked it. Sometimes you had to do something for a whole fifteen and that always made you impatient. @@.girlThought;This is amazing.@@ You couldn't imagine why you ever would have been averse to any of it. Maybe really old people, like Kara's big sister, didn't find it fun to moo like a cow, but you did. You found almost everything fun, which sounded way more fun than thinking things were boring. [[You loved daycare|Emily Low Happiness Ending 17-3]]As much as you @@.girlVoice;missed mommy@@ you found yourself wishing the day would never end. You had @@.girlVoice;so many friends@@ and @@.girlVoice;so many toys@@ that you'd be able to stay here ''forever''. Not that you really understood what 'forever' was. Complex concepts like that were becoming foreign to you. You could understand some hard ones, like things being 'bigger' or 'smaller'. But then someone had asked you 'what day it was tomorrow' and you couldn't even figure out what they meant. There were lots of concepts that were becoming fuzzy. For example, one of the boys had found a slug in the yard, and tried showing it to everyone else. The girls had thought it was gross, while the boys thought it was cool. That was enough to make you believe that wholeheartedly that @@.girlVoice;boys were gross@@. That was simple enough. But how were boys different from girls? You knew there was a difference. Boys were gross and liked slugs. Girls were nice and wore dresses. But if a girl liked a slug did that make her a boy? Or if a @@.girlVoice;gross boy@@ wore a dress were they not gross now? This seemed like something you should know, but you didn't. However, you felt your logic seemed sound, if a girl liked a @@.girlVoice;gross slug@@ then they'd be a @@.girlVoice;gross boy@@. You'd have to be super careful to not like anything gross. Explaining this revelation to the other kids did nothing to clarify the matter, and the daycare workers said you'd have to ask your mom about things like that. [[The week continued|Emily Low Happiness Ending 18]]It wasn't all @@.girlVoice;sunshine and rainbows@@. You grew more @@.girlVoice;easily scared@@ as the week progressed, finding yourself paralysed when things became overwhelming. Relying more and more on Emily and mom whenever a crisis arose. Like when you'd @@.girlVoice;spilled juice on the floor@@, or when you @@.girlVoice;couldn't undo the button on your blouse@@, or when there was @@.girlVoice;a bug in your room@@. How were you supposed to deal with any of that on your own? At first it had bugged you, but now you preferred it when Emily or mom did hard things for you. It was usually too frustrating to do them yourself. Strangers had taken on their own strange terror. When mom invited one of her witch friends over you had hidden behind mom the entire time. @@.girlThought;Witches are scary@@. Mom wasn't scary, but you didn't know about the rest. You'd told the other kids about how scary it was, but they all made fun of you. They said that witches weren't real and you were @@.girlVoice;dumb@@ for believing in them. You thought they were all dumb, but the daycare workers took their side. They said some magic was real, like @@.girlVoice;Santa Claus@@ and the @@.girlVoice;tooth fairy@@, but that @@.girlVoice;scary things@@ like witches and ghosts and goblins were only in story books. You had enough awareness to know that you'd been mixing up fantasy and reality a lot this week. But now you had confirmation from an adult, magic wasn't real and witches weren't real. This confused you more. You had this whole story in your head about how you used to be a boy. Why had you made that up? Did you used to like slugs and then you got better? You cried to mom about it when you got home that night. That you didn't want to like slugs, you didn't want any @@.girlVoice;scary witches@@ to get you. She didn't exactly understand what the trauma of liking slugs was, you'd never explained that particular chain of logic. But she said you didn't need to worry about any of that, that @@.momVoice;"Mommy will take care of everything for you"@@. Mom always took care of you. She made you food, and she washed you, and she helped you dress and she tied your shoes, you really couldn't do much without her around. That comforting thought carried you off to sleep, not knowing that Emily and mom were watching you from the door. [[You dreamt|Emily Low Happiness Ending 19]]As your slept your mind floated through all of the things that had happened over the course of the week. It was a jumble. Though you had a near complete memory of every moment, your feelings on the events varied wildly. For example the fact you were not able to dress yourself before bed. On the one hand it seemed entirely normal, @@.girlVoice;mommy@@ took care of things like that. You were only little, you'd be able to do it when you got older. But on the other hand you had a deep frustration at the fact. A bone deep knowledge that you //should// be able to do all of this. That something was wrong with your inability to tie your shoes or yours struggles with buttons. You should be bigger, stronger, more capable. You had memories of these things, but they seemed more like a story you'd heard than something you'd experienced first hand. The dichotomy hadn't bothered you much during the day, but now that you were alone with your own mind it came to the fore. You hated it. You didn't want to feel this way, but it seemed like as long as you had these intrusive thoughts you'd be stuck in this half way state. The question was, which ones were the errant thoughts? Were you a teenage boy? That all of these thoughts about relying on 'mommy' were aberrant. That you should be able to write essays, not struggle to even write a single letter, and not knowing what it meant when you did. You should be a capable almost adult, not a helpless little girl barely out of diapers. Or were you a little girl? It was entirely normal that you couldn't read or write, that shoelaces were an arcane mystery, and that slugs were @@.girlVoice;super gross@@. That you loved @@.girlVoice;princesses@@ and @@.girlVoice;ponies@@ and @@.girlVoice;mommy@@. You loved going to daycare every day and playing with all of your friends. [[You are a teenage boy|Emily Low Happiness Ending Escape 1]] [[You are a little girl|Emily Low Happiness Ending Stay 1]] <<contentWarning "Identity death.">>@@.emilyVoice;"She seems like she's forgetting things..."@@ Emily looked over to your sleeping form with concern, @@.emilyVoice;"it's only Thursday, but maybe we should turn her back."@@ Mom considered the suggestion, @@.momVoice;"And here I thought you were the one who wanted a baby sister."@@ She held up a finger to cut off Emily's protests, @@.momVoice;"I'm only teasing. But I don't think I'll be turning <<playerName>> back."@@ @@.momVoice;"Look at her sleeping there, look at how peaceful she is, sucking her thumb and dreaming of princesses. How happy she is. Have you ever seen <<playerName>> that happy?"@@ Emily shook her head, agreeing with mom. Before you had seemed awfully miserable, @@.momVoice;"she gets to be happy, you get a baby sister, and I get a beautiful baby daughter and a new apprentice...when she's old enough."@@ @@.emilyVoice;"But she's not...she should be a..."@@ Mom put her hand on Emily's head, @@.momVoice;"I'm glad you are so concerned, something like this should not be done lightly,"@@ she looked back to you, @@.momVoice;"but I can see into her dreams, nothing left in there but rainbows and unicorns."@@ @@.emilyVoice;"She's only four, couldn't you make her brain big again?"@@ @@.momVoice;"I could. But I don't think a four year old girl with a sixteen year old brain would be nearly as cute,"@@ her voice was wistful, @@.momVoice;"no. It's difficult to explain, but this was her choice. She wants to be your cute little baby sister and forget all those gross old boy thoughts. That's who she is now."@@ [[Emily looked at you|Emily Low Happiness Ending Stay 2]]<<set $playerAge to 3>>\ <<set $playerMaturity to 3>>\ Emily considered the matter, it did seem like it would be better for everyone involved. She was enjoying have an @@.girlVoice;adorable baby sister@@. She simply //loved// being a big sister, having her little sister relying on her. The other girls loved you as well, even if you were too young to properly play with them. If you wanted this as well then it seemed like a joyous outcome. @@.emilyVoice;"She might get mad if you call her a baby."@@ Mom inclined her head, ceding the point. Then she smiled and waved a hand in your direction. You squirmed and cooed, your body shrinking a little more. @@.momVoice;"There. Now she won't mind at all."@@ Mom grinned, the situation rectified. @@.emilyVoice;"Mom!"@@ Emily shouted, but mom just laughed. @@.momVoice;"Oh don't worry, she was too young to play with you anyway, what's another year younger?"@@ She smiled, @@.momVoice;"only a year though, I have no intention of dealing with diaper changes again. I just wanted a little more time with my baby girl."@@ Emily rolled her eyes at mom's capriciousness, but she had to admit you were even cuter now. By the way you squirmed and smiled as it had happened it seemed that you supported the change as well. [[Wake up|Emily Low Happiness Ending Stay 3]]When you woke up the next morning you'd been turned into a proper @@.girlVoice;toddler@@, so you were inarguably a @@.girlVoice;baby sister@@. Although you didn't realize anything had changed, and by the end of the next day of daycare you didn't remember you'd ever been anything else. With those @@.girlVoice;gross boy thoughts@@ gone for good life became better than ever. There were so many things that would have bothered you before that now seemed normal. Now you just @@.girlVoice;giggled@@ at the fact you couldn't catch a ball. Wetting the bed at night was annoying, but hardly embarrassing. You loved @@.girlVoice;baths with mommy@@ and you were @@.girlVoice;so proud@@ of the fact you could say your name //and// your age. You were <<playerName>> and you were...three years old. You were mommy's @@.girlVoice;perfect little angel@@, Emily's @@.girlVoice;adorable baby sister@@, and everyone would live happily ever after. Ending 3a: Daycare Ever After <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "Emily" 16>><<silently>>\ <<set $playerAge to 16>> <<set $playerMaturity to 16>> <<set $tempGirlName to $girlName>> <<set $girlName to "">> <<set $endingTraitEmilyLow to false>> <</silently>>\ @@.emilyVoice;"She seems like she's forgetting things."@@ Emily looked over to your sleeping form with concern, @@.emilyVoice;"it's only Thursday, but maybe we should turn her back."@@ Mom considered the suggestion, @@.momVoice;"And here I thought you were the one who wanted a baby sister."@@ She held up a finger to cut off Emily's protests, @@.momVoice;"I'm only teasing. You're right, we should turn $playerName back."@@ Mom sighed, @@.momVoice;"I was enjoying having an adorable baby girl again, but it wouldn't be fair to $playerName"@@ She smiled down at Emily, @@.momVoice;"well done Emily, you really are growing up."@@ Emily beamed at the compliment. Mom had been teaching her the responsibility that came with the power they had. Mom waved her hand over you, your body slowly morphing back into your normal self. [[You woke|Emily Low Happiness Ending Escape 2]]By the time you awoke the previous days seemed almost a dream. You knew they had happened, but the shrinking of your mind meant that the memories had become fuzzy. No one remembered things before age 5 after all. Though the grins your @@.noFilter;mom@@ and sister gave you when you came downstairs that morning confirmed that it was all real. It was almost strange to be back at regular high school, you kept having intrusive thoughts about how weird school was. That all of this was way too hard and you should go back to @@.girlVoice;coloring@@ or @@.girlVoice;playing with dolls@@ instead. You persevered and the thoughts quieted down, but always seemed to be lurking in the background. After school on Friday Emily revealed why these @@.girlVoice;toddlerish@@ thoughts were still bouncing around in your head. @@.emilyVoice;"Welcome home baby sis,"@@ Emily called as you came through the door. <<playerVoice "\"Ha ha very fun-\"">> Your words cut out as your head swam. When you finally came back to your senses you @@.girlVoice;giggled@@ at the @@.girlVoice;silly feeling@@. You ran to find Emily, ignoring how awkward your body felt, finding her in the living room watching a @@.girlVoice;big girl@@ show that @@.girlVoice;mommy@@ wouldn't let you watch. <<playerVoice "\"Hi Emiwy,\"">> you waved. Emily giggled at your failed attempt to say her name, but didn't correct you. @@.emilyVoice;"Did you have a good day at school today?"@@ [[You bit your lip|Emily Low Happiness Ending Escape 3]] <<set $playerMaturity to 3>>\ <<set $girlName to $tempGirlName>>\That was a surprisingly difficult question. Your memories of the day were fuzzy at best and you weren't sure how to answer. Emily just laughed, @@.emilyVoice;"don't think too hard sis, it was a trick question. You're much too little for school aren't you?"@@ You brightened, Emily's words having clarified the situation. Of course, you were @@.girlVoice;only three@@, you were way too young to be going to school.
