You nodded to Emily and she smiled back. @@.emilyVoice;"I've got some homework to do, why don't you play with your dollies?"@@ She handed you your @@.girlVoice;favourite baby doll@@ and you grabbed it excitedly. It felt like you hadn't played with her in forever. The next twenty minutes were spent playing with your @@.girlVoice;dolly@@ on the floor while Emily finished her work. You didn't understand why, but she kept smiling whenever she looked at you. Maybe she wanted to play too? @@.momVoice;"Emily I'm home and-oh!"@@ she startled at your unexpected position on the floor, @@.momVoice;"Emily, I see you wasted no time playing with your 'baby sister'. Did you check she didn't have any homework of her own first, like we talked about?"@@ Emily gave an embarrassed smile, clearly showing she hadn't. Mom sighed and snapped her fingers. [[Your head swam|Emily Low Happiness Ending Escape 4]]<<set $playerMaturity to 16>>\ At first you thought you still had to be addled, considering the fact you were on the floor pretending to feed a baby doll. A few more moments and you realized that, as weird as it was, that was the current situation. You stood, too dazed to actually put the doll down, <<playerVoice "\"What just happened?\"">> Your mind ran back the last twenty minutes, playing with this doll as if it was the most natural thing in the world. You'd been acting like...like you were three. Mom explained the situation, @@.momVoice;"sending you to daycare was proving too intensive. It was too difficult for your four year old mind to learn a lesson; as simple as the lesson should have been."@@ @@.momVoice;"So I'm making sure you have some time with your supposedly more mature brain to adjust your behaviour,"@@ she continued, @@.momVoice;"until then Emily can, at her discretion have some playtime with her 'baby sister'."@@ Your mind went fuzzy at the term, but mom kept your attention, @@.momVoice;"you'll still have to keep up with all your high school work of course, I'll make sure of that. But the rest of the time it'll be up to Emily whether you're playing video games or with dollies. Understand?"@@ You nodded, not seeing any other way out of the situation. Emily just smiled, all sweetness and light, acting as the shining example of innocence and purity. You just glared at her. Luckily, in this case you actually did have homework to do, homework you intended to stretch out for as long as possible this weekend. [[Time for homework|Emily Low Happiness Ending Escape 5]]<<set $playerMaturity to 3>>\ <<set $girlName to $tempGirlName>>\ Unfortunately mom saw directly through the ruse. As such you spent almost the entire weekend with the brain of a three year old girl. Emily explained that she wanted a proper @@.girlVoice;baby@@ sister, so you had to be three rather than four. Though at the time you were wholly focused on trying to draw a stick figure princess with crayons, so you didn't really understand. When you were altered it all seemed totally fine, it wasn't embarrassing at all to be a sixteen year old boy playing with dolls and doing finger painting. It was when you came back to your teenage senses that the shame burned your cheeks. To you this didn't seem like an at all reasonable way to 'teach a lesson', but you couldn't deny the effectiveness. At first you tried to behave better just so you didn't end up forgetting how to read. However, over time you started to genuinely understand. You could see how frustrating it could be when you were bored, or stuck, or needed help and Emily was 'too busy'. Just because the help you needed was something as simple as tying your shoes only made it more annoying when she didn't help. She could solve your problem in seconds, but refused to. It made her seem like a huge jerk, just like you had been. So when you were of the right mind to be able to help her, you tried your best to be attentive. It didn't stop her from making you into a toddler every time she got annoyed with you, but she left you alone the rest of the time. [[Learning your lesson|Emily Low Happiness Ending Escape 6]]Even after mom said that you'd 'learned your lesson', she left the trigger phrase. It had become a bit of a release valve in your relationship with Emily. It was hard to keep up a fight after you'd lost a dozen years of mental capacity and the ability to properly use 50% of your now greatly reduced vocabulary. Which was why you were now on the floor holding a pair of Barbie dolls and having them talk about their favourite princesses. The biggest thought now in your mind about how @@.girlVoice;overjoyed@@ you were that Emily had let you play with her @@.girlVoice;Barbies@@ like a @@.girlVoice;big girl@@. While Emily took a chance to cool off while enjoying the sight of her 'big brother' acting like a toddler. Some people might call the arrangement strange...okay it was strange...but what else could you expect when your mom and sister were witches? Your mom was happy that the two of you had stopped fighting, Emily was happy that you were treating her better than ever before, and you were happy that you could play with @@.girlVoice;your dollies@@ and no one would make fun of you. Not that you could ever admit that to //anyone//. It was too embarrassing to admit how much you loved slipping back into that toddler mindset. A world where even the silliest simplest thing could bring you abundant joy. No you'd just keep pretending to be mean to Emily sometimes, get 'punished', and no one would be the wiser. You made the dolls kiss and @@.girlVoice;giggled@@, <<playerVoice "\"and everyone lived happily ever after.\"">> Ending 3b: Toddler on Demand <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "Emily" 17>>\<<include "Reset state for ending start">>\ Kara, being her usual self, took her time to consider the possibilities. As the seconds ticked by you could see the impatience of the other girls. Then in a flash something came to her. She stared at you as if you were some alien species before blushing and looking away from you. It was a strange moment, but Kara was a strange girl. No real telling what was going on in her head. Nervously she looked at you one more time before nodding to herself. It seemed that she'd reinforced her resolve regarding the decision. Beckoning your mom to lean down so Kara could whisper the request. @@.momVoice;"That's not something I can do,"@@ she glanced at you and then dropped her voice so you couldn't hear. The two of them continued their conversation in a hushed whisper. The other girls seemed to be getting snippets of it, but you couldn't make out a thing. Finally they leaned apart, @@.momVoice;"Now that is something I can do,"@@ her voice returning to normal audible levels. She turned to you, @@.momVoice;"are you ready?"@@ You shrugged, saying no wasn't going to change anything, and was it ever possible to be ready for something like this? [[Weather the changes|Kara High Happiness Ending 2]]As the magic washed over you, sending tingles across your entire body it almost made you laugh. This was for two reasons. One, it was so strange how this feeling was becoming familiar to you. Two, it tickled. You weren't sure why it tickled this time when it hadn't before, but there you were, rapidly shrinking down and doing your best not to giggle uncontrollably. <<if $oldPlayerAge > 10>>You'd never actually gotten too young before, but it seemed this time you shrinking way down.<<else>>You'd gotten pretty young during the party and it seemed like you were heading that way again.<</if>> Everything played out as you would expect a transformation into a little girl to go. Your body shrank down, every part shrinking in lock step with each other. As your torso shrank so did your legs and arms, hands and feet. It wasn't long before your clothes were so baggy they were threatening to fall off. This seemed to trigger something in mom who waved her hands, altering the spell. Your clothes snapped to attention and began to keep up with the transformation. They were a little behind so things were still a bit loose, but at least you'd be able to stay covered. As much as you could, you tried to relax. It was only for a week after all, you didn't need to freak out that you were losing all your hard earned muscles. That you were rapidly becoming smooth and soft, the lack of body hair marking you as prepubescent. You just had to get through a week and all would be well. You could handle being four feet tall and fifty pounds, since all your classmates would be as well. As the changes began to slow you were settling around Kara's height. That wouldn't be so bad, Kara and you had gotten along fairly well, so you might even enjoy the time. Only when you'd finished shrinking down did you realize there was one major difference between this and your previous transformation. You certainly had become little, smooth and soft and delicate, but you weren't a girl. Your boy parts were...diminished...but they seemed proportionate for your new age category. Another minor indicator was the fact your hair hadn't gotten any longer. Between the short hair and the simplistic outfit it was pretty clear that you were a little //boy//. [[Express your surprise|Kara High Happiness Ending 3]] <<silently>>/ <<set $playerAge to 7>> <<set $epilogueStartAge to $playerAge>>\ <<set $playerMaturity to 7>> <<set $endingTrait7YearOldBoy to true>>\ <<set $voiceClassOverride to 3>>\ <<set $hairLength to "long">> <<set $hairstyle to 8>> <</silently>><<set $girlName to "">>\ Your continued masculine appearance proved to be a surprise amongst all the girls. Kara didn't look surprised, it had been her request after all, but she still seemed overwhelmed. The blush on her face had returned and she couldn't actually meet your eye. @@.mikiVoice;"Why doesn't <<playerName>> look like a girl? Is she still a boy?"@@ @@.momVoice;"On Kara's request <<playerName>> is still a boy. Though regressed to her age. So he'll be attending grade 2 alongside her this week."@@ The girls looked between one another, seeing if any of the others had an obvious explanation for the situation. None of them were able to work it out, and Kara wasn't forthcoming about the details of her wish, or why she'd made it. It was a very curious situation, but at least you'd have the entire week to figure it out. That was assuming you'd ever be able to get Kara to actually talk to you. Right now she wouldn't even look at you. Hopefully mom would be able to provide at least some explanation. Though for the remainder of the morning both were frustratingly tight lipped. Even when the other girls left mom still refused to tell you anything about the why of your form. She assured you that there would be no problem being in class for a week, and that she would ensure you had clothes to wear, but you were left ignorant of Kara's wish. [[Time for school|Kara High Happiness Ending 4]]At least once you both got to class she was willing to talk to you again, though still not about your most burning question. She was more than happy to answer questions about school, or your peers or a dozen other things, but not that. It was nice to have a close friend in class though. Your seven year old body had come with a seven year old mind, which meant new situations with a bunch of strangers made you deeply uncomfortable. Emily's presence was also a boon. She seemed to know every single kid in the school by name and knowing her meant you were automatically part of the group. Despite that you spent most of your time with Kara. She wasn't as popular as Emily, but she still had a small group of close friends. It wasn't a shock that they were the nerdier kids in class but it was unfamiliar crowd for you. You wouldn't say that you'd been a 'jock', you didn't actually play on any sports teams. But you did spend a lot of time in the gym and certainly hadn't been one of the geeks. Though that was rapidly changing. With Kara's support you were rediscovering several 'nerdy' interests you'd had in the past. Comic books and science fiction and fantasy books as a start. You'd even been willing to give chess a chance, though you were absolutely crushed by Kara in every single game. Somehow losing to her didn't feel as bad as you'd expected, she was gracious in victory and always took it as a chance to teach you something. It was only a few days before you'd truly integrated into the group, chatting away as if you'd been doing this for years. Kara was experiencing a special joy in this, since you hadn't been a geek, you hadn't seen a lot of the geek staples. So she had a near endless supply of things to suggest to you. Movies, shows, books and more. Though some of the books were a struggle, Kara was a very advanced reader, while you were closer to the norm for grade 2. You spent a lot of evenings at her place, under the auspices of doing homework, but really just mostly watching tv or having her read to you. In a flash you were done with the week, the weekend giving you even more time to hang with Kara, though this time she was at your house. There was a nervousness in the back of your mind, as much fun as you were having mom was likely to turn you back at any moment. Was there a way to keep enjoying this? It seemed unlikely. A sixteen year old hanging out with a seven year old would be more than odd, even if that seven year old was incredibly smart. [[Dinner time|Kara High Happiness Ending 5]]Kara had to return home for dinner, and Emily was over at Sophie's, so it was just you and mom for dinner. It was a quiet affair. You weren't quite sure what you wanted to say and mom was giving you the time and space to figure it out. Finally, as mom was washing the dishes, you worked up the courage to speak. <<playerVoice "\"Mom. Since this is my last day like this, can you tell me now what exactly Kara wished for?\"">> Mom paused her washing so she could focus her attention on you, @@.momVoice;"you want to know that badly?"@@ You nodded in response, @@.momVoice;"and what exactly would you be willing to do to find that out?"@@ You wracked your brain for possible incentives, but you were only seven, so your ideas were rather limited. To you they seemed rather dramatic, but it was hard to say if mom would agree. [[I'll do the dishes for a week, no, a month.|Kara High Happiness Ending 6]] [[I'll clean my room, top to bottom.|Kara High Happiness Ending 6]] [[I'll play with Emily whenever she wants, for a week.|Kara High Happiness Ending 6]]Mom laughed at your suggestion. At first you thought she was mocking you, but the laughter was light and seemingly genuine. @@.momVoice;"Oh sweetie."@@ It annoyed you a bit when she called you that. You might be little, but you weren't a girl, so you didn't want to be called sweetie. But cutesy nicknames weren't the concern right now. <<playerVoice "\"What if I did //all// of them?\"">> To you this seemed to be a grave suggestion, taking potentially infinite amounts of your time. Her laughter abated but did not stop. @@.momVoice;"I see you are very serious about this."@@ Looking at your adorable serious face she considered the situation, @@.momVoice;"How about this? I'll only make you clean the dishes, but you have to stay seven for another week."@@ That one stopped you in your tracks. You'd never even considered offering something like that. Partially because you'd forgotten to add 'I'll be sixteen tomorrow', in your calculations. It was an interesting counter offer, doing the dishes wouldn't take terribly much time, and it was only a week more like this. Kara had a ton of stuff she still wanted to show you, so the week certainly wouldn't be boring. <<playerVoice "\"Deal.\"">> Both the speed of your response and the surety of it proved surprising to her. But a deal was a deal and she was a woman of her word. [[Another week|Kara High Happiness Ending 7]]Her //exact// words it seemed. She'd agreed to tell you, but she hadn't agreed that it would be immediately. Still, you had to at least hold up your end of the bargain before she could ever tell you. Otherwise you might just take the information and then shirk your duties. So you were in for another week wallowing in ignorance. Your life continued much as it had in the previous week. At first you tried to convince yourself that the only reason you were staying this way was out of curiosity. This form was such a departure from everything else at the party it felt like there had to be some kind of greater purpose to it. This reasoning didn't hold up for long. At the end of the week it was revealed that you had made a very poor deal. She'd said she was tell you, but she'd never specified when. If you turned back there would be no reason to tell you, so the only way she would ever tell you was if you stayed this way...and cleaned your room. You hastily agreed, not mentioning that Kara's mom had already offered to take the two of you to a movie next week, and you didn't want to miss it. As the weeks went on even you had to admit that curiosity alone was not enough justification to have entirely abandoned your old life. Sure there wasn't terribly much to miss, you'd had no close friends and weren't in any clubs or teams, but this was still an almost unthinkable life change. Yet you couldn't actually say you were disappointed. It was...nice. You'd only been in Kara and Emily's class for a few weeks and you had more friends now than you'd had in your years at high school. Which meant you were almost overwhelmed by the number of people you could hang out with. Naturally you spent a good amount of time with Emily and the other girls. One of them came over basically every night. You also had time to spend with some of the other boys in your class. Still the bulk of your spare time was spent with Kara. The two of you had grown quite friendly during the sleepover, so it only seemed natural for it to continue, since you were actually peers now. Though you had to admit that she was smarter than you. You were decently clever, for a seven year old, but she was something else. Which meant at least some of her time was spent helping you with homework. You both enjoyed your study sessions, but it took a little bit to get over being taught by someone who used to be a decade younger than you. [[The year continued on|Kara High Happiness Ending 8]]The rest of the year was full of the same joys that the first few weeks had been. Hanging with the girls, school with your friends, and lots of time with Kara. You never wanted this time to end, but time marches on, even for those who'd been regressed to childhood. You couldn't stay seven, you wanted to stay the same as as Kara, but as you grew older certain changes became necessary. You'd actually been invited to a few more sleepovers after your regression. They were still filled with sickeningly girly activities. But at least this time you knew that the girls painting your nails would make you look more like a girl, but wouldn't actually make you into a girl. Eventually these had to stop. You were all reaching an age where boys and girls weren't allowed to sleepover at each other's houses anymore. It was...unseemly. Even beyond that you found yourself drifting away from the group. It wasn't that you disliked them or anything, but as you all pushed through childhood and were encroaching on teenagehood, your interests had diverged. Painting nails and doing makeup had never been your thing, but now it was painfully boring to even consider. So even when the sleepovers were at your house, you didn't really participate, and you were full on banned from Emily's room. There was one notable exception. You'd all gotten older and the girls had scurried off to Emily's room. You had no idea what they were doing, but you could hear them giggling over their loud music. Eventually you received a surprising knock on your door, opening it up to see Sophie grinning at you. Even now she was still taller than you, much to your chagrin, and she made sure you knew it. At least on most days, today it seemed she was playing nice, @@.sophieVoice;"Come to Emily's room. There's something you need to see."@@ You had no idea what she was referring to, but you had to at least check it out. [[Emily's room|Kara High Happiness Ending 9]] <<set $playerAge to 14>> <<set $playerMaturity to 14>> <<set $endingTrait7YearOldBoy to false>>\ <<set $endingTrait14YearOldBoy to true>>\ <<set $voiceClassOverride to 2>>\The door was mostly closed when you arrived, and even once it opened Miki and Emily were obscuring your view of what was inside. Finally they parted, revealing Kara standing behind them. Though it wasn't Kara as you'd ever seen her before. She was pretty nerdy and most of her attention was spent on academics rather than fussing about her appearance. But it seemed that at least part of this sleepover had been dedicated to makeovers and Kara had been the most obvious benefactor. She was wearing a knee length black dress with a slit on the side, combined with a set of black kitten heels. It was an outfit meant more for a formal dance than a casual sleepover, but a specific point was trying to be made. The girls had done an excellent job on her makeup. Subtle enough in most places that it hid imperfections, but you wouldn't notice it's existence. Except for her lipstick and eyeshadow, those were clearly meant to draw your eye. Similarly to the long necklace she was wearing which naturally drew your eye down to... You quickly looked away scratching your head, <<playerVoice "\"Oh Kara, I didn't know you were here,\"">> except you did know, and everyone knew you knew, you were just being awkward and nervous. You coughed and continued, <<playerVoice "\"you're dressed up so nicely, what's the occasion?\"">> Nervously you looked back at her but it seemed that she was equally, if not more, embarrassed than you. You'd thought they might have overdone the blush, but you quickly realized that it had come to her cheeks entirely naturally. [[The two of you stood in silence|Kara High Happiness Ending 10]]Miki giggled and Sophie grunted in frustration, @@.sophieVoice;"you two are impossible."@@ Miki interjected, @@.mikiVoice;"be nice Sophie."@@ She turned to you, @@.mikiVoice;"<<playerName>> why don't you tell Kara what you think of her outfit?"@@ Both you and Kara went beet red. You couldn't decide if you should be looking at her, or looking at Miki, or maybe just staring at the floor and running until you got back to safety... But all of the girls were waiting for an answer and Kara did look very pretty, it'd be rude not to at least say something. <<playerVoice "\"You, uh...you look very pretty Kara, the dress suits you.\"">> That was all Kara could handle, she squeaked something that might have been a 'thanks' and went to hide in Emily's closet. @@.sophieVoice;"All right, show's over, get out of here. Us girls need to talk."@@ Sophie shooed you out of the room, but you were all too happy to go. Your room was calm and safe and didn't have the danger of Kara's...well...everything. It was stupid, the two of you had been friends for years, you'd seen her nearly every day. So you'd seen her grow from a child to a girl on the cusp of womanhood, but somehow your mind had never made the switch. That had all changed now. Your heart was pounding in your chest and you couldn't get the image of her out of your head. Even when you went to sleep that night your dreams were filled with all the near romantic moments you'd missed. The signs that Kara wasn't a little girl anymore and that your feelings about her couldn't exactly be called 'platonic' anymore. [[Time passed|Kara High Happiness Ending 11]]After the incident at the sleepover the two of you actually distanced yourselves for a bit. The idea of one of your simple study sessions or movie outings had suddenly taken on a whole different connotation. One that neither of you was quite ready to acknowledge, let alone act upon. A school dance provided the perfect opportunity and it seemed the world was conspiring to make it happen. You normally didn't even go to these things, you didn't have a girlfriend and going alone seemed embarrassingly lame. This time however, everyone seemed to be going, all of your friends had dates and were constantly hounding you about who you were bringing. Little did you know but Kara was receiving the same treatment from her own friends. Finally it came to a head the day before the dance, the two of you had bumped into each other 'accidentally' in the hallway, suspiciously right beside a sign for the dance. <<playerVoice "\"Oh I'm sorry...I didn't mean to...are you okay?\"">> Your mind was whirring. Every time you spoke to Kara it seemed that you lost all ability for coherent conversation. Which is why these days you studied with other, less distracting, classmates. @@.karaVoice;"Oh I'm fine. I wasn't watching where I was going. You know how I can be."@@ True she did often have her nose buried in a book, and it had caused a few accidents, but this time there was no book to be found. There was a pregnant pause. The question hung in the air just waiting for you to ask, finally you worked up the gumption, <<playerVoice "\"Kara,\"">> her eyes snapped up to you, having previously been locked on the floor, <<playerVoice "\"do you have a date to the school dance?\"">> she vigorously shook her head no, <<playerVoice "\"Great. That's great. I mean, not great, but great for me and uh...would you maybe, if you're not busy, accompany me to the dance?\"">> The moment between asking the question and her enthusiastically saying @@.karaVoice;"yes"@@ was the longest in your life. [[A cheer went up behind you|Kara High Happiness Ending 12]] <<silently>>\ <<set $playerAge to 16>> <<set $playerMaturity to 16>> <<set $endingTrait7YearOldBoy to false>> <<set $voiceClassOverride to 0>> <<set $endingTrait14YearOldBoy to false>> <<set $endingTrait16YearOldBoy to true>> <<set $showTeenNPCDescriptions to true>> <</silently>>You turned around at the noise to see Sophie, Emily and Miki standing a bit behind you, having popped out from a nearby classroom. @@.mikiVoice;"Finally...I thought you two were going to spent another year being the biggest idiots in the school."@@ You bristled at the insult before realizing her tone was more exasperated than teasing. @@.sophieVoice;"Don't act all innocent short stuff,"@@ she walked up to you, //still// somehow taller than you, @@.sophieVoice;"you're the dumbass who kept being too much of a coward to ask her out."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Wait what? I mean...\"">> you turned to Kara who was steadfastly looking at a wall. You turned back to Sophie, <<playerVoice "\"why are all of you here? Is this a set up?\"">> @@.emilyVoice;"Of course it's a set up! Oh my god, I cannot believe my brother is so dumb. The two of you have been perfect for each other for //years// now. But //you// kept stubbornly not asking her out. Not that she was much better, even today she wouldn't totally admit it."@@ Emily sighed, dramatically holding her forehead, @@.emilyVoice;"God, you two are completely hopeless. What would you do without us?"@@ The three of them smiled as Kara and you alternated between confusion, annoyance, shock and delight. Emily was right of course, not that you could ever admit it. You should have asked Kara out ages ago, probably on the night you first saw her in that black dress...oh...//that's// why she'd been dressed up and you'd been invited to see...okay they were right, you were the biggest idiot at the school. Better late than never? [[The school dance|Kara High Happiness Ending 13]]The dance itself wasn't a particularly pleasant affair for either of you. Neither of you were big fans of loud music, big crowds or dancing. Which was why you'd decided to ditch early and were now sitting on the living room couch at your house. Currently occupying opposite sides as you both tried to work out exactly what to do now. But there was one question you still had, one you'd never gotten an answer for all these years, <<playerVoice "\"Kara. Why did you ask my mom to turn me into a little boy all those years ago?\"">> Once again she looked away, but you caught the flash of guilt in her eyes. For a moment it seemed she would continue the steak of not telling you, but tonight was something special. She took a deep steadying breath, @@.karaVoice;"Well at first I'd asked her to make you into a boyfriend for me."@@ You nearly fell off the couch, <<playerVoice "\"Boyfriend!?!\"">> She tried to calm you down, @@.karaVoice;"but your mom said she wouldn't do it. Said I was too young, that and something about magic not being able to make people fall in love. But I still wanted to spend time with you, at my level. So I asked if she could turn you into a boy my age, one who liked me. Which she did."@@ Another long pause. You were re-evaluating everything that had happened in the intervening years. All the time you spent with Kara, how you'd felt about her then, how you felt about her now, was that all from mom's magic? [[Mom appeared behind the couch|Kara High Happiness Ending 14]]Both of you jumped at her sudden appearance. You weren't sure if she'd teleported there, or it was just run of the mill mom sneakiness. @@.momVoice;"I think I need to explain a few things. Before either of you get too ahead of yourselves."@@ She looked back and forth at the two of you, still half frozen in shock. She gave you a moment to acclimatize to her sudden appearance before continuing, @@.momVoice;"everything Kara said is true."@@ Your heart sank, @@.momVoice;"but I never touched anyone's affections. As I told her, I won't make someone fall in love against their will."@@ @@.karaVoice;"But you said he would like me!"@@ Her tone had shifted. At first she'd clearly been guilty about asking, now she was indignant that she hadn't gotten her way. @@.momVoice;"Indeed I did, but that didn't mean I needed to change anything. Hadn't the two of you gotten quite friendly during the party."@@ @@.karaVoice;"Well yes we did but I...that's not what I meant...when I said 'like'..."@@ You burst out laughing, much to Kara's annoyance, <<playerVoice "\"Sorry, sorry, I just had to laugh. Seems mom got us both with the same 'exact words' trickery...I did dishes for years because of that.\"">> Kara had little idea what you were talking about, but mom smiled, @@.momVoice;"let this be a lesson to you, when dealing with genies, fae or witches, choose your words carefully. They will grant your wish, but careless speech can get you into trouble."@@ The two of you stared at her and you shivered. Sometimes you forgot how scary she could be. [[Mom began to walk away|Kara High Happiness Ending 15]]@@.momVoice;"I made you seven, but I didn't touch anything else,"@@ she paused for effect, @@.momVoice;"I'd thought you might end up staying in a new form at the end of the sleepover. But you still surprised me. You wanted the new start, a chance to make a new you, and you seized it."@@ @@.momVoice;"I just let nature run it's course. Both of you had freedom to date and kiss and fall in love with whoever you wanted, and here we are."@@ You both blushed, despite your ages, you both hadn't had your first kiss and the idea of love was a bit scary. @@.momVoice;"Well, I'm off for the evening. <<playerName>> I leave the house in your care, do make sure Emily gets herself to bed when she comes home. I don't need to find her unconscious on the couch again."@@ She looked at her watch and clicked her tongue, @@.momVoice;"have fun you two, just don't get into too much trouble."@@ And with that she vanished, leaving the two of you all alone on the couch. Two teenagers, who'd never kissed, alone in the house with no one coming home for hours. The only instruction being not to get up to //too// much trouble. A little trouble would be fine... The two of you scooted together closer on the couch. Kara was wearing the same lipstick she had that first night. The night that made you realize that 'like' and 'like like' were two very different concepts. You'd been thinking about kissing those lips ever since...the two of you moved closer...lips only inches apart...you could feel her breath...the warmth of her lips...you leaned forward... Ending 7: True Love's First Kiss <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "Kara" 9>><<include "Reset state for ending start">>\ Kara considered the matter. If she could give you another form for a week, what would it be? The two of you hadn't managed to get along at all during this party. Kara was generally a pretty nice girl, but she also had a shockingly devious mind, filled with sci-fi and fantasy. There was no telling what she'd want you as. You would protest the situation, but with mom there, and on their side, there wasn't much you could do. Though having your fate in the hands of nerdy seven year old wasn't the most comfortable position. Finally she seemed to come to a decision. Beckoning your mother to lean down and then whispering into her ear. No doubt Kara would be able to effectively explain specifically what she wanted. Though that level of detail might just mean you'd end up even stranger. @@.momVoice;"Ah yes. I understand, I can make something like that happen."@@ Kara looked abashed when she looked away from your mother. She couldn't even meet your eye, despite what was about to happen. Your mother began to move her hands through an arcane gesture before you felt her power wash over you. [[Weather the changes|Kara Low Happiness Ending 2]]<<silently>>\ <<set $playerAge to 7>> <<set $epilogueStartAge to $playerAge>>\ <<set $traitFat to true>> <<set $traitAllergies to true>> <</silently>>\ As the magic washed over you, you knew you were in for something dramatic. You felt drenched in it, clinging to you before you'd even started changing. It built until it felt like your whole body was saturated in magic, then you started to change. Your perspective dropped as you started to lose inches of height. You'd expected to have to go back through puberty, but something was off. Sure you were getting shorter, but your weight seemed to be lagging behind. It wasn't like you had a specific set of rules for these things, and since you were both becoming a girl and getting younger at the same time, it complicated matters. Despite that, you had an inkling that your newfound boobs should have been gone by now. Little girls were just as flat as boys, so what was happening? Your fixation on this one particular sign of femininity was no doubt a result of your still unchanged mind, causing you to miss other important details. Though maybe you had it all wrong. It wasn't like you had a little chart, 'what's the average cup size for a 14 year old mostly boy but some girl? How tall should I be and how much should I weigh as a 12 year old almost girl?' Google would have a field day trying to work out the answer to those ones. As it stood you were still a little taller than Sophie, though that was rapidly changing. Your chest wasn't the only spot where excess fat seemed to be stubbornly hanging on. Your stomach was the main offender, but every part of you had more heft than you'd expected. Finally you'd gotten down below Sophie's height. But there were still lumps on your chest, you were sure now that those should be gone. It was at this moment that you took stock of some of the other feelings in your body. You felt heavy. <<if $oldPlayerAge <= 15>>Last time your loss of physical maturity had come with a corresponding loss of mass. Ending up thinner and weaker seemed to be the end goal. <<if $oldPlayerAge <= 10>>By the time your changes had seriously progressed you'd felt like you weighed nothing at all.<</if>> Not so this time. If anything you felt //heavier// than usual. <</if>> That should be impossible, that much loss of height naturally dropped weight as well, but if your strength was dropping faster than you were shrinking...was Kara's change to make you really weak? It did make some sense. Her struggles with the physical activities were clear to all of you, maybe she wanted someone to outdo. Leaving you a feeble little girl could certainly achieve that. [[The changes slowed|Kara Low Happiness Ending 3]]<<silently>>\ <<set $traitBracesHeavy to true>> <<set $traitFourEyes to true>> <<set $traitLisp to true>> <<set $traitClumsy to true>> <</silently>>\ Your height was beginning to stabilize, the changes coming to a close. It looked like you'd end up somewhere around Kara and Emily's height. Which meant your former outfit was now pooling around your feet, only an oversized shirt remained, now a dress. You stepped gingerly out of the pile of clothes, the continued weighty sensation making it take more effort than you'd expected. The odd sensations only continued when you felt an odd wobbling sensation from your stomach after you'd stepped. Putting a hand to your stomach gave you your second clue as to what had happened. It was //way// bigger than it had been before, and extremely squishy. You couldn't quite see with your current outfit but you could feel the weight of your oversized belly pulling down. <<playerVoice "\"What is this?\"">> Your words came out with a severe lisp. You chalked it up to your current level of stress. <<playerVoice "\"Why is my stomach so big?\"">> Again, a lisp. If anything it was worse this time. You could see Emily and Sophie trying to suppress their giggles. <<playerVoice "\"Shut up! Why does my voice sound ridiculous?\"">> This was enough to set the two of them into fits of giggles. You weren't sure if you were more concerned about your fat belly or your sudden speech impediment when a third concern entered the picture. Your vision @@.blurry-text1;started to get blurry. It was only a little at first@@ @@.blurry-text2;but it was getting worse by the second.@@ @@.blurry-text3;Quickly enough the other girls@@ @@.blurry-text4;were little more than a blur.@@ <<playerVoice "\"What's going on? Why can't I see?\"">> @@.karaVoice;"Here. Take these."@@ @@.blurry-text4;A blur that sounded like Kara pushed something into your vision. Half blind you grabbed at it. You brought them close to your face, a pair of glasses, thick ones.@@ @@.blurry-text3;You slipped them on and the world@@ came back into focus. It took your eyes a moment to adjust to your new coke-bottle glasses. <<playerVoice "\"Thanks.\"">> Your voice didn't sound as grateful as your words implied. It didn't help that the glasses didn't seem to fit and kept @@.blurry-text3;falling down your nose.@@ @@.blurry-text4;So you couldn't see until@@ you pushed them back up. With one crisis solved it was time to get back to the other two. But before you could speak your tongue found the source of your second concern. Probing your teeth revealed there was something attached to them. <<playerVoice "\"Braces.\"">> You stated flatly. Braces. Setting aside the question of why you had them, why in the world had they made the word impossible to say for anyone who had them? It was just like 'lisp'; someone naming these things had a cruel sense of humour. But you were starting to get a sense of what had happened to you. Which was the exact moment the mental changes washed over you. [[Grit your teeth|Kara Low Happiness Ending 4]]<<silently>>\ <<set $playerMaturity to 7>> <<set $traitSweetTooth to true>> <<set $traitOtaku to true>> <<set $traitSelfConfident to true>> <<set $endingTraitKaraNerdFriend7 to true>> <</silently>>\ Considering the first wave had made you into a fat, short sighted, metal mouthed little girl, you were uneasy about what might come next. Unlike the physical changes there was no real way to objectively determine what was happening to you. Which made you suspicious of how normal things felt in the moments after the magic dissipated. You could feel that your mind had been regressed again, there were all manner of gaps in your knowledge and memory. But beyond that you seemed to be stunningly normal. No irrational fears, no clothing obsessions, no urge to bawl about how unfair this all was. You doubted that was it. No doubt there was something else going on that you just couldn't detect yet. It'd probably find some way to come up at the worst possible moment. But it did seem that everything was done, leaving you to grapple with the reality of your new situation. You cast your gaze onto Kara, standing only a couple feet in front of you. Her expression was difficult to judge. It wasn't Emily's devilish glee or Sophie's smugness or Miki's exuberance. Kara was clearly happy with the result, but there were other emotions marring the purity of that happiness and competing for attention. <<playerVoice "\"Kara,\"">> you were doing your best pick words that wouldn't cause your lisp to show, <<playerVoice "\"what did you do to me?\"">> That was a dumb question, it was clear //what// she had done, it was the //why// that was more interesting. <<if $oldPlayerAge <= 10>>This form was radically different than what you'd had before.<<else>>This form seemed rather different than what you'd been heading towards before.<</if>> <<playerVoice "\"Better question,\"">> why did English have so many words with 's' in them? <<playerVoice "\"why did you make me like this?\"">> Kara looked away for a moment. Staring at the floor and not meeting your gaze. @@.karaVoice;"I-uh...well you see I was thinking that maybe you could be...um..."@@ You never seen Kara this much at a loss for words, but you were struck by a distracting secondary thought. Why wasn't this bothering you? When it had been happening you'd been lamenting the changes to your body. Wondering why Kara would do something this cruel. But now your questions had come not from anger, but sheer curiosity. As alien and humiliating as this form should be, you were almost entirely calm. [[Kara took a steadying breath|Kara Low Happiness Ending 5]]@@.karaVoice;"I didn't want this specifically. I just..."@@ she trailed off again. @@.momVoice;"Come on girls, let's let the two of them talk."@@ Your mom shooed away the others, rescuing Kara from her embarrassment and allowing the two of you some privacy. You deserved to know Kara's reasoning, but it seemed like it wasn't something she wanted to say in front of the others. @@.karaVoice;"Everyone teases me that I'm really nerdy,"@@ this was an obviously true statement, she was awfully nerdy, but it didn't seem like the time to say so, @@.karaVoice;"I wanted there to be someone else they'd tease instead."@@ It was clear that she wasn't talking about the other girls, but the kids at school. This form had been chosen not for here and now, but for the upcoming week. @@.karaVoice;"Not that I want you to get made fun of!"@@ She hurriedly added, her guilt getting to her, @@.karaVoice;"I just wanted someone else like me..."@@ It seemed that mom's magic had taken some liberties with your transformation. Making changes that Kara would have never dared to ask for. You doubted she would have been mean enough to actually ask for you to be given a @@.girlVoice;big jiggly belly@@. @@.karaVoice;"I'm sorry. I'll ask her to change you back right away."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Thats okay,\"">> the words were out of your mouth before you'd even realized you were saying them. You'd just been given an out to go back to normal and you were declining? Though as you looked at Kara, her face having lit up at your words, you knew why you'd said it. As embarrassing as this form was, it was just a manifestation of the suffering Kara suffered every day at school. Perhaps that was over-talking it a bit, she just wanted another nerdy friend so that she wouldn't get teased as much. <<playerVoice "\"The deal was for a week. Mom is serious about the rules.\"">> You weren't sure if that was strictly true, but your empathy had gotten the better of you. You just had to hope you wouldn't regret the decision. But first things first, [[you needed a new outfit|Kara Low Happiness Ending 6]]You regretted the decision. You'd already gone through five different outfits and none of them had...how did Kara put it? They didn't 'suit your body type'. Which was a nice way to say that the jean shorts you'd just tried on gave you an extremely apparent muffin top. It wasn't that they didn't fit at all, Emily's closet apparently could even handle dramatic changes to a waistline, but they were deeply unflattering. @@.emilyVoice;"No that isn't going to work."@@ The latest attempt had been a tank top and skirt combo. The tank top technically got over your belly, but it looked strained, and was uncomfortably tight. You lifted it to relieve the pressure, but then you just had your belly hanging out and that was enough to spike your anxiety. You hadn't been bothered at first, but you were starting to get @@.girlVoice;self concious@@ about how you looked. Nothing was even meant for a @@.girlVoice;girl your size@@... <<playerVoice "\"Maybe this was a mistake.\"">> But Emily was having none of it, @@.emilyVoice;"Don't let a few bad outfits get you down! We're gonna find something super cute for you."@@ @@.sophieVoice;"Miki's got a chubby tummy and her outfit is cute. It just takes-"@@ @@.mikiVoice;"Hey! It's not chubby!"@@ Sophie gave a wolfish grin, @@.sophieVoice;"Oh it isn't? Well let's see if that tummy isn't ticklish either."@@ Sophie lunged at Miki, viciously tickling the younger girl. Miki protested, but was clearly enjoying herself. Emily just rolled her eyes and kept looking through her closet. @@.emilyVoice;"I've got it!"@@ She half dove into her closet, pulling out a dress. [[You were unconvinced|Kara Low Happiness Ending 7]]<<Image 'Endings/KaraLow/Day0.webp' "topRightCorner">>\ <<playerVoice "\"But I've already tried a dress,\"">> your voice came out whinier than expected. Emily scoffed, @@.emilyVoice;"And what would a boy know about dresses?"@@ You could protest that you weren't exactly a boy at the moment, but that seemed a waste of time. So you dutifully took the dress and gave it a try. @@.karaVoice;"It looks so good on you!"@@ Kara wasn't wrong, it definitely looked the best of anything so far, it was actually @@.girlVoice; pretty cute@@. No one was about to think you'd lost a dozen pounds, but it at least looked like it fit, though you didn't really understand why. Shockingly Sophie was the one to explain, having defeated Miki in their climactic duel, @@.sophieVoice;"Clever. With the cinch that high it looks normal for the dress to flare out around the stomach."@@ Every girl stopped to stare. @@.sophieVoice;"What? I'm still a girl, I know some things."@@ She folded her arms across her chest in mock indignation, but the other girls just laughed. @@.emilyVoice;"Okay now we just need six more."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Six? I only have to go to school for five days.\"">> @@.emilyVoice;"And then the weekend dummy. It's a //whole// week."@@ You grimaced. It seemed that your dressup session wasn't anywhere near complete. [[Fill out your wardrobe|Kara Low Happiness Ending 8]]It felt like it took a lifetime, but you'd managed to finally get an outfit for every day of the upcoming week. Sophie hadn't been kidding about knowing a few things. Between Emily and her they were able to offer outfits that, on the face of it, would look awful on you, but actually looked great. It became a little bit of a competition as to who could find the best outfits. Kara and Miki served as the 'impartial' judges. In the end you actually had more than seven to pick from, though you left that choice to the girls. Some of the outfits tried to hide your extra pudge, while others just embraced it. You had vague concerns about the latter, what would the kids at school think? But you kept those concerns to yourself, it was ridiculous to let yourself worry about the jibes of a few elementary school kids. Though the next day you found your confidence faltering as you were about to head out the door. @@.momVoice;"Why won't this hair..."@@ your mom continued in vain to try and get your hair to stay straight. <<playerVoice "\"Its okay mom, is fine.\"">> You tried to wave the brush away. In truth you just really wanted her to stop bugging you so that you could get on with your day. What was a bit of frizzy hair going to do? If people were going to make fun of you it wasn't going to be about that. They would have more than enough fodder if they wanted to go after you. Something you were getting increasingly nervous about. Children were cruel at the best of times, and you had several exploitable weaknesses. You wanted to say that you wouldn't be effected by the juvenile insults of children, but you couldn't be sure. Even as you walked to school with Emily you could feel your anxiety growing. Mom had said all of the official stuff was taken care of, so being a temporary student was no trouble. But how were you going to get along with a bunch of seven and eight year olds you'd never met? @@.girlThought;What if they're mean?@@ Maybe you could lean on Emily and Kara, but it was still @@.girlVoice;pretty scary@@. [[Time for class|Kara Low Happiness Ending 9]]As the teacher introduced you, you thought you could feel the eyes of every student on you. What did they think of you? What were they planning? What would they say? It seemed you'd have to wait for the answer. The teacher kept a pretty tight rein on the class during the lesson, so there wasn't opportunity for teasing. It was also in this moment that the regression of your mind really hit home. The first lesson had been Math and you were learning to add two digit numbers. Something so trivial to you that you'd forgotten it was something you'd ever had to learn. @@.karaVoice;"You forgot to carry the one."@@ Kara's gentle voice interjected. <<playerVoice "\"No. It doesn't need a carry, this isn't subtrac...\"">> Your voice trailed off as you realized she was right. Had you really made such a basic mistake? Of course you had, it was an incredibly common mistake for a seven year old learning addition. This stuff was @@.girlVoice;pretty hard@@ after all. You'd just forgotten the fact you had a seven year old mind to go with your seven year old body. And apparently it wasn't a mind that was as sharp as Kara's, since she'd already finished the whole worksheet and you were barely half way. Then again, looking around the room, you were ahead of basically everyone else. Kara was just @@.girlVoice;super smart@@, you shouldn't compare yourself to her. <<playerVoice "\"Thanks Kara,\"">> you mumbled as you fixed your mistake. @@.karaVoice;"Of course, let me know if you need any more help."@@ Her smile supported the sincerity of the offer. She wasn't teasing you for making a mistake, she just wanted to help. Why would anyone make fun of her when she was always @@.girlVoice;so nice@@? Your answer came as the bell [[rang for lunch.|Kara Low Happiness Ending 10]]Freed from their desks and with the teacher paying less attention, a trio of boys walked over to Kara and you. Kara winced at their approach, it seemed these were the origin of Kara's self doubts, and thus your current form. @@.playerVoice1;"Looks like the geek has a new friend."@@ @@.playerVoice2;"Looks like she's even more of a geek. What's your name brace-face?"@@ You were feeling petulant. The teacher had already introduced you, and apparently this boy hadn't bothered to remember it. <<playerVoice "\"I'm not saying anything to bullies like you.\"">> The trio just laughed, @@.playerVoice3;"You're not 'thaying' anything? Because you can't 'thay' it right? Is it too hard to say things with those braces."@@ He put emphasis on every 's' sound just to drive home the point. <<playerVoice "\"I'm not saying anything because jerks like you don't deserve my attention.\"">> The trio just redoubled their laughing. Even you had to admit your word choice was probably not the best considering your impediment. You could see Kara practically curling in on herself as the laughter continued. No doubt it'd been directed at her more than once. @@.playerVoice2;"Aw are we making the widdle baby mad? Why don't you run home to mommy and come back when you 'wearn how to spweak'".@@ First off. That wasn't even the right impediment. You weren't three; you just had braces. Second, was this really the best that they had? Kara's distress was obvious, but she was a shy seven year old who'd been suffering through this for who knew how long. You might not be able to add @@.girlVoice;big numbers@@ but you'd been in high school last week, these childish insults were laughable. [[So you laughed at them|Kara Low Happiness Ending 11]]Laughing at their childish attempts, <<playerVoice "\"Is that really the best you've got?\"">> The boys seemed startled at your defiance. Clearly they were used to Kara being meek and folding under the pressure. <<playerVoice "\"This is really sad,\"">> right now you didn't really care about the lisp, <<playerVoice "\"a bunch of scared little boys picking on some girls because they're jealous the girls are smarter than them.\"">> @@.playerVoice3;"We're not scared!"@@ @@.playerVoice2;"And were thmarter than you!"@@ They were on the defensive now, and it seemed the one had his own lisp when he got stressed. You stood. At this age boys are girls were the same height and you were a lot bigger than any of them, even if it wasn't exactly in muscle. <<playerVoice "\"Run along little boys. Maybe you can find some pre-schoolers to pick on to make yourselves feel better.\"">> You gave a beat for the words to sink in. You raised an eyebrow, <<playerVoice "\"Well? You bore me. Come back when you've got something worth listening to.\"">> This was not going at all how they had expected. Your display had already attracted the attention of a few of your classmates. Seemed Kara wasn't the only one they bugged. Their numbers advantage quickly vanishing as they realized the tide had turned. @@.playerVoice3;"Whatever. Let's go."@@ @@.playerVoice2;"We don't need to talk to some brathe fathe."@@ <span class="noFilter"><<playerVoice "\"Brace face,\"">></span> you corrected, taking great pains to enunciate the best you could. But it was enough to draw a distressed blush from the boy. Worried that his 'friends' might suddenly decide he was a good target. @@.playerVoice1;"Stupid geeks,"@@ was the last pathetic 'insult' they threw as they retreated. You turned to Kara, [[you okay?|Kara Low Happiness Ending 12]]Kara was looking at you with a mixture of shock and awe. @@.karaVoice;"How did you do that?"@@ You shrugged, <<playerVoice "\"They were supid little kids,\"">> turning back to your lunch, starting with the cookies. @@.karaVoice;"But that...I mean...they,"@@ Kara took a breath, trying to bite down on the nervousness the boys had caused. @@.karaVoice;"But how could you stand up to them so easily?"@@ You leaned in close so only Kara could hear, <<playerVoice "\"high school boys are much worse. This is nothing.\"">> Her eyes lit up with understanding, @@.karaVoice;"thank you <<playerName>>."@@ The two of you continued lunch and then the rest of the day in peace. You got a few nasty looks from the boys, but that was almost entirely beneath your notice. Soon enough it was time to head home. You waved goodbye to Kara and fell in line with Emily. [[Walk home|Kara Low Happiness Ending 13]]@@.emilyVoice;"How was your day?"@@ You took a moment to consider the matter, <<playerVoice "\"It was fun. Even if math is supid hard.\"">> You had some lingering frustrations about your inability, but you supposed it came with the territory, it'd be weird for a little girl to know calculus. You'd learn it eventually...again, if you stayed this way... <<playerVoice "\"The boys were annoying, but I think they shouldn't be a problem anymore.\"">> @@.emilyVoice;"What boys?"@@ Emily tone was severe. She'd let you and Kara spend most of your time together, but she wasn't about to ignore it if you were having problems. You explained the situation, or at least what you knew of it. But it seemed that all of this was a shock to Emily. She'd known those three weren't friends with Kara, but didn't realize they'd gone this far. @@.emilyVoice;"Why wouldn't she tell me that?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"She was probably embarrassed. Didn't want to worry you with her problems.\"">> The conversation continued for the remainder of the way home. Emily was sad that Kara hadn't talked about it, but was starting to understand why she'd stayed quiet. Her annoyance quickly shifting from Kara's silence to the boy's behaviour. She said she'd 'deal with the problem', but was vague on what exactly that meant. A chill went down your spine. You didn't even want to know what she was planning. [[The next day|Kara Low Happiness Ending 14]]You'd been concerned that Emily might use magic to mess with the boys. But it seemed she had a far more powerful tool at her disposal. Emily was popular, //very// popular. If the most popular girl in class told all of her friends that you were a bully, then you were only one step away from being a pariah. Normally you'd consider that sort of silent treatment to be cruel, but you had very little sympathy for bullies. If they wanted to rejoin normal relations, then they could stop being jerks. It was something that the trio learned very quickly. By Wednesday they were at Kara's desk apologizing for what they'd done. It was all you could do to not burst out laughing. Bullies always folded the second there were actually consequences to their actions. You dug into your lunch while they continued begging for forgiveness. This lunch was extra exciting because you'd managed to sneak in a few extra cookies. Yes, all these extra cookies were how you'd gotten this belly in the first place, but they were @@.girlVoice;so tasty@@. You shook your head at the incorrect reasoning. You kept defaulting into thinking this was your normal state, that you'd lived your whole life like this, and would continue living it indefinitely. Rationally you knew that wasn't the case, but you kept justifying situations as if it was. Mom was going to turn you into a boy at the end of the week. ''Back'' into a boy, you corrected. [[The week went on|Kara Low Happiness Ending 15]]With the bullies dealt with the rest of your week was rather pleasant. Mostly pleasant. On Wednesday night mom, having noticed your cookie sneaking habit, had hidden them out of reach. Which meant your lunches only had 1 cookie rather than a half dozen. It was disappointing, but you were usually able to trade other kids for a couple more treats. You just had to make sure that Emily didn't rat you out. You wouldn't want to get in trouble again about eating too much candy. Mom was trying to be more strict with that, she said you had to be on a diet. You weren't sure you wanted to diet. Giving up cookies just so you could have a little less tummy? That didn't seem like a fair deal at all...not that you'd have to stick to a diet. Because this was only temporary... @@.emilyVoice;"And what are you two up to?"@@ You gave a small squeak as Emily's voice suddenly emerged from behind you. How was your @@.girlVoice;big sis@@ //that// sneaky? You thought it must be magic, but she claimed it was just a natural talent. Hurriedly you shoved the last cookie into your mouth, hoping Emily hadn't noticed it wasn't the one mom had packed. @@.karaVoice;"Not too much. I was just telling <<playerName>> about an anime convention next weekend."@@ <<playerVoice "\"It sounds pretty fun. Do you think mom would let me go?\"">> Emily looked like she was going to say something, thought better of it, and then restarted, @@.emilyVoice;"You'll have to ask her. But if you're good for the next couple days I'm sure she will."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Yes! Did you hear that Kara? I just gotta be good and I can come on Saturday and maybe even Sunday!\"">> Emily gave an odd smile and let the two of you finish your lunch in peace. [[The week came to a close|Kara Low Happiness Ending 16]]With the school week done you had the whole weekend to enjoy yourself, and you took full advantage of it. You'd spent a good amount of the week at Kara's house and Saturday was no exception. The two of you had grown a lot closer as the week went by. Though your mind was mostly untouched, other than the regression, there was one major alteration. You were a total geek. Obviously you looked the part, but your behaviour made it just as apparent. On Monday Kara had given you a comic book to try out, @@.girlVoice;it was amazing@@, so amazing that you didn't want to stop reading it. Which is why your mother had to scold you about reading too late. An attempt the next night showed that the 'flashlight under the covers' trick was still painfully obvious. But comic books were just the start. Kara had all sorts of things to show you, each one leaving you more breathlessly excited than the last. Metaphorically breathless, asthma wasn't part of of your transformation. Mom wouldn't knowingly inflict you with a disease. Being overweight seemed to be where she drew the line. So you found yourself plopped in front of a screen at least half of the time. Munching on some chips, or any snack that was handy, while you watched Kara's latest suggestion. Obviously anime had been the one to catch your eye at the moment, but that didn't mean two weeks from now you wouldn't be absolutely obsessed with Lord of the Rings. Thus your Saturday had been spent almost entirely unmoving, your eyes glued to the latest adventures of Sailor Moon. Kara told you there were tons of seasons and it would take you weeks to get through them all. You couldn't wait. Unfortunately mom insisted you be home for dinner. That there was something important to discuss. [[Head home|Kara Low Happiness Ending 17]]So you waved your goodbyes and got yourself home. Sliding into your chair just under the wire. @@.momVoice;"Wash your hands before you eat."@@ Mom admonished. You blushed and did as you were told, doing your best to ignore Emily's smug look. @@.momVoice;"Did you enjoy your time at Kara's?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"Mmmhmm. Kara has a bunch of awesome stuff. The said that the would show me more next time I came over.\"">> Mom and Emily glanced at one another, @@.momVoice;"Isn't there something you should be asking about before you make more plans with Kara?"@@ You pursed your lips before it came to you. You had almost forgotten something //very// important. [[Ask about changing back|Kara Low Happiness Ending Change Back 1]] [[Ask about the anime convention|Kara Low Happiness Ending Stay 1]]<<playerVoice "\"Right, the week is almost over. I guess I should ask to be turned back.\"">> The melancholy was obvious in your voice. You did want to get back to being yourself, but it was complicated. You wanted to go to the convention, wanted to continue enjoying comics and anime with Kara. Despite your initial derision of the mere idea, you actually kind of liked being a nerd. Going back to your 'normal' self it felt like you'd have to give that all up. If nothing else you weren't really smart enough to hang with that crowd. Even if you were the damage it would do to your image sounded unbearable. You weren't like Kara, you didn't have dedicated friends to fall back on. If you slipped on the social ladder there would be no one there to catch you. Spending the rest of high school eating lunch alone in the bathroom wasn't an appealing thought Your hesitation was obvious enough that even Emily realized your concerns. She'd seen how well the two of you had gotten along this week. It would be a terrible shame to throw that away. Doubly so when Emily had never seen you as excited about something as you were about this convention. You'd discovered a whole new world and you wanted to dive in with both feet, but you had too many hang ups. You wished there was a way to keep pursing these new interests without drawing too much attention. You didn't need, or even want, to be loud and proud about it all. Just quietly enjoy them and slip under the radar, that was the ideal. Your mother was even more perceptive than your sister. She understood your concerns even before you'd voiced them in your own head. You'd never been happier than this week as a geeky little girl, yet you didn't want to give up your old life. She had just the idea. [[Mom made an offer|Kara Low Happiness Ending Change Back 2]]@@.momVoice;"Well you don't have to go completely back to the way you were."@@ You waited for your mother to continue. @@.momVoice;"After the sleepover your body is a bit...flexible. I can make you a teenager again, but it's possible for you to make some changes to yourself in the process."@@ <<playerVoice "\"What sort of changes exactly?\"">> Mom considered that for a moment, @@.momVoice;"well it'd have to be mostly within human bounds. You could make yourself stronger, but you aren't going to be lifting a truck. You could even make yourself smarter."@@ The ability to make such changes raised a question of why she hadn't made this offer before now. You'd been struggling with school for a while, getting a mental boost would have made things a heck of a lot easier. @@.momVoice;"All you have to do is hold an image in your head of the kind of person you want to be, the more specific the better. This situation is unique, it won't come up again, you only get one attempt."@@ @@.momVoice;"Ready?"@@ You hadn't expected it to be right now, but you supposed there was no reason to wait. [[Consider your form|Kara Low Happiness Ending Change Back 3]]If you could choose to change yourself in any way what did you want to do? Obviously mom had been driving at the possibility of you making yourself more, for lack of a better word, nerdy. Maybe nothing quite as obvious as you currently were, but someone who was more able to keep enjoying your newfound interests. You held an image of your old self. Your current form might be a basis for some of this, but you didn't want it to influence you //too// much. You'd need to be smarter of course. It wasn't a requirement to be smart to be a nerd, but if you were making changes no way you weren't going to take a boost. Maybe a fast reader, would let you churn through all those light novels much quicker. Could you make yourself nicer? Was that even an option? You knew it was a choice certainly, but maybe you could change your bent. Make it more natural to be sweet to other people. Would you have to be quieter too? It'd been fun to be a bit more boisterous this week, but you didn't really want to draw that much attention. Right, you didn't want to be some loud and obvious geek annoying everyone else. You just wanted to fly under the radar, sit in the corner reading your manga in peace. But how could you keep all of this in your head all at once? Thinking about all the things you wanted to do with your head was making you not think about how you'd look. [[Focus|Kara Low Happiness Ending Change Back 4]]<<Image 'Endings/KaraLow/Kotomi1.webp' "topRightCorner">>\ You smiled to yourself, realizing that your description was //very// similar to a girl in one of the anime you'd just seen. Kara had shown you a romance anime called Clannad. It wasn't your usual fare, but for some reason it had caught your attention and you'd watched a ton of it. There were a bunch of different girls but right now you were half describing Kotomi. Super smart girl, so smart that she didn't even have to go to class or anything because it'd be a waste of her time. Instead she spent most of her time library just reading whatever she felt like. At first you'd thought she was anti-social, but it turned out that she was just really shy. Once she opened up she turned out to be one of the nicest and sweetest characters in the whole show. She was also pretty funny, if unintentionally. Her violin playing was literally ear bleedingly bad and she had a complete and total inability to tell jokes. However, that just made her all the more endearing because she was so earnest about it. She wasn't annoying or trying to be a pain, she was just a bit dreamy and adorably awkward. You actually really liked her character. You didn't think you wanted to //be// her, but you did have to admit she was closer to your desired form than you expected. Even the purple hair was kind of neat, just something quirky and fun without really causing too much fuss...though you'd never really figured out why she liked being barefoot at the time. Maybe it was just because she considered the library to be like home? @@.momVoice;"Here we go."@@ Your mother intoned, starting to cast the spell. You snapped back to reality. Why had she started casting the spell? Was there a time limit? Or did she think you'd already made your decision? Yes you'd been thinking a lot about Kotomi, but that didn't mean...you tried to turn your mind elsewhere, to a different form, but you kept drifting back. You'd thought she was so @@.girlVoice;cute@@ from the first time you'd seen her, wishing you could be like that... [[The magic washed over you|Kara Low Happiness Ending Change Back 5]]<<Image 'Endings/KaraLow/Kotomi2.jpeg' "topRightCorner">>\ You made one last small attempt to form a new image in your head, but you didn't have your heart in it. If mom had asked you, you never would have said "like this bookworm anime girl", but it felt right to you. So when your eyes cleared and you looked down at your new form, you weren't really all that surprised. In contrast your mom and Emily looked entirely shocked by what had happened. They'd expected changes but they hadn't quite expected //that// many changes. You could understand their shock; your purple-blue hair and purple eyes were rather striking. They probably wouldn't be the first ones to stare at them, but hair dye and colored contacts were common enough. People would probably just think you were a bit quirky. Something they would be completely right about. You weren't a clone of Kotomi or anything, but you could feel that you'd picked up a few of her quirks. Even now you were thinking about how much you'd rather be in the library than in this awkward conversation. Though you'd also picked up at least some of her intellect, your mind felt like it was moving a mile a minute. Not that a quick mind made it any more obvious what you should say. Despite knowing this was all real you moved your hands to hold your own @@.girlVoice;smooth@@ face before giving them a pinch. <<playerVoice "\"Owww,\"">> you exclaimed at the surprising pain. You were a bit more delicate than you'd expected, both your body and your voice. It was @@.girlVoice;soft@@, @@.girlVoice;quiet@@ and slightly breathy. It sounded almost like you were out of practice at speaking and still getting comfortable with it. You weren't even sure you could yell with a voice like this. @@.momVoice;"You might need to explain this."@@ [[Your explanation|Kara Low Happiness Ending Change Back 6]] <<silently>>\ <<set $traitBracesHeavy to false>> <<set $traitFourEyes to false>> <<set $traitLisp to false>> <<set $traitClumsy to true>> <<set $playerAge to 16>> <<set $playerMaturity to 16>> <<set $traitSweetTooth to true>> <<set $traitOtaku to true>> <<set $traitBarefoot to true>> <<set $traitSoftspoken to true>> <<set $traitDaydreamer to true>> <<set $traitOblivious to true>> <<set $traitSelfConfident to false>> <<set $endingTraitKaraNerdFriend7 to false>> <<set $endingTraitKaraLowKotomi to true>> <<set $voiceClassOverride to 2>> <</silently>>\You assured your mother that this was no accident. This had been the form you'd been thinking of. Unintentionally to start with, but not unwanted. @@.momVoice;"So this is the form you want?"@@ You nodded. Your mother looked somewhere between a chuckle and a sigh, @@.momVoice;"never a dull moment..."@@ @@.momVoice;"I think you look lovely,"@@ she switched into full supportive mother mode, @@.momVoice;"a bold choice with the hair, but I think it suits you."@@ What ensued was a quick conversation about the mechanics of what happened next. She'd craft a charm so no one would think your new appearance was different than before, and then she'd take care of making sure all the relevant documentation was up to date. @@.momVoice;"So you'll go by $girlName from now on?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"No...Kotomi, I want to be called Kotomi.\"">> After all she was who you wanted to be, it felt only natural to share her name. Plus almost no one would know the reference. Except Kara, she'd know //exactly// what had happened and who you looked like. The conversation over you retired to your room for a few moments, exhausted from the day. [[Look at yourself|Kara Low Happiness Ending Change Back 7]] <<set $girlName to "Kotomi">>As focused as you'd been on the changes to your mind you hadn't really gotten too much chance to look at your body. You weren't exactly sure how anime proportions would translate into real life. Luckily nothing too unusual would give away the origin. Your eyes were a little larger than average, but you doubted anyone would really notice that. They'd be to focused on the fact they were purple. You knew only albinos could actually have violet eyes like this, but maybe you could twist the story a bit. You weren't actually sure //why// you knew that, another perk of your genius brain. The purple hair was easy enough to wave off as dye. Though you were going to need an intensive routine to take care of it, it was quite a bit of hair. Past that you seemed like a fairly normal girl. You were small and slim, and smooth and soft and everything you would expect from a girl. You skin had a hint of tan to it which definitely hinted at Japanese heritage, but not enough that you'd be blatantly unrelated to your mother. There was one thing you'd certainly inherited from your mother. The next focus after your eyes...at least for men. You cradled your new heavy breasts in your hand. You'd known that Kotomi was pretty well endowed, they'd even teased her about it in the show. But having them hanging off of your own chest was a different experience entirely. You didn't even know what size they were, but bras were clearly going to be a necessity to prevent back aches. Not that the rest of you wouldn't garner it's own attention. Your narrow waist only made your wide hips even more noticeable. You hadn't thought about it at the time but she did have quite the hourglass figure and now you did as well. At least your butt wasn't //too// big. You didn't want to deal with //another// jiggly bit. [[Back to school|Kara Low Happiness Ending Change Back 8]]Your first day back confirmed your suspicions about your figure. Mom had made sure that no one would be shocked that $playerName was suddenly a cute girl. But that didn't mean they wouldn't be ''very'' interested in a cute girl. If you had a dollar for every time you heard a variant, "I don't know how I haven't noticed you before", that day you'd have been able to buy a library all your own. The actual school library was somewhat disappointing, but it did provide a respite from the hustle and bustle of the rest of the school. You ate your lunch there, which some people might have said was 'sad', but you couldn't have been more content. Curling up in a corner with a good book, removing socks and shoes and just getting comfy. You didn't even want to go back to class. But you did, you weren't about to start ditching class on your 'first' day. Though it was a continued temptation throughout the week. Class was just so boring now. You'd thought being a genius would make class great, but when you already knew everything you didn't even know why you were even there. In time you might be able to get the same deal as your namesake, doing 'independent study' in the library instead of having to go to useless classes. Luckily your evenings were far more stimulating. Kara still had oodles of anime to show you which, unlike manga, had a consistent rate of consumption, so you wouldn't accidentally rush through them. You also took to volunteering at the public library on weekends. Somewhere, it turned out, Kara frequented herself. You didn't actually want to do much work, but it gave you access to every book there whenever you wanted, so it was a fair trade. [[Life continued|Kara Low Happiness Ending Change Back 9]]Your life continued on quietly from there, spending as much of your day reading as possible. You still were social at times of course. Spending time with Kara when you could, and your relationship with Emily was much improved. It turned out that having a genius for an older sister meant she'd learn at home in ten minutes what took a whole class at school. Your own marks of course went through the roof. If you weren't top of the school in a given subject, you were only a point or two back. You didn't even have to try hard. Though that fact was something you kept to yourself, you already got enough attention from being smart, you didn't want even more. You became the go to for teachers to call on, knowing that, even if you were looking dreamily out the window, you'd still have the answer. The boys also continued their incessant calls on you. No matter what you wore you couldn't really hide your figure and even if you did your eyes alone were apparently 'captivating'...except their own eyes always glided back down towards your ample chest. You had no interest in them. It wasn't that you 'didn't like' boys, it's just that none of them were worth your time. Maybe in University you'd find some who weren't just drooling over your body and actually stimulated you intellectually. Or maybe not. Boys, girls, or whatever, you weren't really interested in relationships right now. There were still so many books left to read...which reminded you a new batch was coming in today...you wondered if anyone would notice if you stayed at the library overnight... Ending 6b: Trapped In The Library <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "Kara" 19>><<playerVoice "\"Oh yeah! Next weekend can I go with Kara to an anime convention? Please? Her mom will take us there, so its safe.\"">> Your mother's look was inscrutable. So you did the only sensible thing considering the situation, sweeten the pot, <<playerVoice "\"I'll do extra chores. Wash dishes and dry them too. And clean my room, at least a little bit.\"">> The shy look that crossed your face was out of guilt at the fact your room was basically always a mess. It'd been tolerable at the beginning of the week, but it had degraded quickly. It wasn't gross, you dealt with anything that could go rotten, you just didn't notice when things got out of hand. @@.momVoice;"I'll think about it. Why don't you go start that cleaning after dinner and we'll see how it goes."@@ You nodded, hurrying through the remainder of your dinner before running upstairs. You might hate cleaning, but it was for a good cause. Emily and mom stayed at the table, finishing their dinner at a more sedate pace. Though it gave them a chance to talk [[without you hearing.|Kara Low Happiness Ending Stay 2]]@@.emilyVoice;"What happened to $playerName? It's like he doesn't even remember being a boy. Aren't you going to turn him back?"@@ @@.momVoice;"Oh she remembers, she'd just rather not."@@ mom saw Emily's obvious confusion and continued. @@.momVoice;"Do you know why <<playerName>> ended up in the form he did?"@@ Emily shook her head slowly, @@.emilyVoice;"didn't Kara pick?"@@ @@.momVoice;"Kara's influence certainly was part of it. But she just asked for someone who was nerdy like her. The final form was actually mostly a result of <<playerName>>'s will."@@ None of this was really clearing things up for Emily. Why would you have chosen that kind of form? To be nerdy she could understand, but you'd gone into the extreme. And why would you do something for Kara when the two of you had hated each other?
