She continued to speak as she collected plates, @@.momVoice;"It wasn't that <<playerName>> didn't get along with Kara, in fact <<playerName>> was just jealous, though at the time they'd never be able to admit it."@@ @@.momVoice;"Your brother never excelled at school, while Kara is remarkably intelligent. He was so concerned about other's perceptions of him that he wouldn't pick up any hobbies that might be objectionable. Meanwhile Kara is mostly unbothered by it. Certainly some people might not like her, but a few close friends are all she needs. <<playerName>> had lots of friendly acquaintances, but none he could really call friends."@@ [[Mom continued|Kara Low Happiness Ending Stay 3]]@@.momVoice;"He saw in her all these things he never had, and assumed he never could. It bred resentment and caused him to lash out. Yet at the end of the trial he was given an opportunity. A week in an entirely new form."@@ @@.momVoice;"Kara's words set the ball rolling, but <<playerName>> subconsciously set the details. Casting himself in a role where he was almost forced to be an outsider. Many would deride him at first glance, judging his weight or his unusual speech. A form like that would never have universal appeal, but to those who did like him, who wanted to be friends, would be truer friends than he'd ever had."@@ @@.momVoice;"Kara, being such a kind soul, would of course accept <<playerName>>, tummy and all. Now after only a week the two of them are incredible close. <<playerName>> he...she embraces her new form. She'd much rather be a seven year old geek, than a friendless sixteen year old boy. That's what she is in her soul, changing her back now would be cruel."@@ Emily was shocked, @@.emilyVoice;"Are you saying <<playerName>> is my little sister now?"@@ Your mother nodded. [[Emily's eyes lit up|Kara Low Happiness Ending Stay 4]]@@.emilyVoice;"I have a little sister!"@@ @@.momVoice;"Shhhh. Don't be too loud. <<playerName>> is at a very fragile point. It's best to not address the situation for a bit and let her act as she wants. A few days and she won't even believe you if you told her she'd been a boy."@@ @@.emilyVoice;"She's losing her memories?"@@ Mom clicked her tongue, @@.momVoice;"Its...complicated. Less that she's losing them and more that she's willing discarding them."@@ She dried her hands, dishes complete, @@.momVoice;"but for now I'm going to go check if your sister finally cleaned her room."@@ It transpired that you had cleaned it, kinda. You'd missed a bunch, but it was enough to satisfy mom. She agreed that, as long as you were good this week, you could go to the convention with Kara. You whooped and were practically vibrating with excitement. You'd never got to go to a convention. The best you had was watching anime on tv. Which gave you another thought. <<playerVoice "\"Could I maybe redecorate my room? It feels like a boy's room. I mean is not the worst, but I don't like it anymore.\"">> @@.momVoice;"Of course sweetie. But let's get through that convention first, okay?"@@ You quickly agreed to that deal. Chomping at the bit to tell Kara the good news. [[The next week|Kara Low Happiness Ending Stay 5]]The idea that you should have been attending high school and not grade school never even crossed your mind. You were working away subtraction with two digit numbers and learning about verbs, as happy as could be. Your enthusiasm for school did dampen as the week went on. You liked math, but no one enjoys grinding away at Math questions forever. You just wanted school to be done so that you could go to the convention with Kara. Finally, mercifully, the week did end and you were allowed to go. Mom had given you a whole bunch of instructions. What to do if you got lost. Not to leave the group. On and on and on...you didn't want all these rules, you just wanted to go. Eventually you were allowed your freedom. Mom thanked Kara's mom for taking on the task. You weren't aware of it, but the relevant people had been briefed on the situation. So the sudden presence of a seven year old girl, where a sixteen year old boy had been. didn't cause undue distress. But you were too busy planning the day with Kara to notice any of that. Emily had been invited as well but she'd declined, as you'd expected. She was nice enough about you enjoying it, but it wasn't her thing. That was fine. This could be something just you and Kara shared. The two of you even held hands as you walked through to doors to your very first anime convention. [[It would not be your last|Kara Low Happiness Ending Stay 6]]<<silently>>\ <<set $playerAge to 16>> <<set $playerMaturity to 16>> <<set $voiceClassOverride to 6>> <<set $endingTraitKaraNerdFriend16 to true>> <<set $endingTraitKaraNerdFriend7 to false>> <<set $traitLisp to false>> <<set $traitBracesHeavy to false>> <<set $showTeenNPCDescriptions to true>> <</silently>>\ You and Kara attended countless conventions. Not all of them were anime, there were comic books and games and all sorts of stuff. Some people may have decried it all as 'boy stuff', but they just didn't understand. Sailor Moon wasn't 'boy stuff', My Little Pony wasn't 'boy stuff'. Though that sort of commentary never bothered either of you. <<if $getAwayBreakResult !== 0>>Mom once even let you turn back into a catgirl as a 'costume'.<</if>> Even as you both grew older you continued to attend, your moms taking on the role of chaperone until you were finally old enough to go on your own to a small local expo. <<playerVoice "\"Is the bow sitting right? I can't see it.\"">> Kara cast you a quick glance, @@.karaVoice;"It's fine. You know it's fine, you worry too much."@@ Her shortness wasn't annoyance, she was just concentrating on finishing her own costume. At your first cons the two of you had just gone in themed outfits, then simple costumes and now the two of you were making them from scratch. Kara turned out to be quite the talented costume maker. Then again Kara was quite talented and successful at anything she put her mind to. You were no slouch academically, but Kara was on a whole other level. <<playerVoice "\"You're one to talk. You've resewn that button three times, and it was right the first time.\"">> Kara huffed and finished her work. It was important that both of your costumes were perfect, you were entering the Masquerade competition for the first time. As newcomers it was unlikely you'd be able to win, even at the Novice level, but with Kara in charge of costume design anything was possible. [[She up finished the costume|Kara Low Happiness Ending Stay 7]]<<Image 'Endings/KaraLow/ChibiMoonOutfit.webp' "smallTopRightCorner">>\ @@.karaVoice;"Are you sure you're up to everyone looking at us?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"I've told you a dozen times, I'm fine. You worry too much.\"">> You smirked at throwing her words back at her, but you knew it was just because she cared. Though you weren't quite as chubby as you were when you were little, you didn't exactly have a flat stomach. There were plenty of people out there who seemed to make it their mission to tear down anyone who 'wasn't the right shape' for a specific character. Now a good chunk of them were boys who wore maid outfits, but hypocrisy was nothing new. <<playerVoice "\"I look fabulous. Not my fault if some people are too blind to see it.\"">> Though you still had the tummy you'd managed to shed some of your other...questionable features. The braces had finally come off. Leaving you with both straight teeth and the ability to say 's' sounds. You still wore glasses when you wanted to be comfy, but contacts gave you plenty of extra options on con days. You weren't going to get reddish eyes like this naturally. <<Image 'Endings/KaraLow/SailorMoonOutfit.webp' "smallMiddleLeft">>\ Kara got herself dressed so that the two of you matched. A pair of eager Sailor Scouts. You'd gotten Sailor Mini Moon while Kara had gotten Sailor Moon herself. You'd wanted that role, but as the one doing most of the work on the outfits, she got first pick. It was fine though, even if pink wasn't your favourite color, the outfit was still @@.girlVoice;super cute@@. Kara offered you a hand. You'd walked hand in hand to your first con and you'd agreed to do the same to this one. Of course it was a lot more embarrassing to do it now, but you figured the whole 'sisterly' vibe that came with the outfits would cover for you. But the Masquerade wasn't until late in the evening. You had a whole day of activities to enjoy first. As you crossed the threshold you were tempted to break into a run to see everything faster. From Kara's smile she felt the same. The day passed in a flash and the two of you were backstage, about to be called. @@.playerVoice;"Now for some first timers. Give a warm welcome to Sailor Moon and Sailor Mini Moon!"@@ the announcer boomed as you got your cue. @@.karaVoice;"Alright. You ready?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"Born ready.\"">> @@.karaVoice;"Then let's go."@@ Ending 6a: Joining the Masquerade <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "Kara" 6>><<include "Reset state for ending start">>\ Miki considered the matter. The two of you had actually become fairly close during the party. This would come as a double edged sword. On the positive side she was unlikely to be vindictive and saddle you with a terrible form. However, it also meant that she'd want to keep playing with you, probably at something closer to her age. Finally she came to a decision. Beckoning your mother to lean down and then whispering into her ear. It seemed like Miki only whispered a few words. @@.momVoice;"Ah yes. I understand, I think you would both enjoy that."@@ Miki looked extremely excited. Clearly she hadn't given complex instructions. But your mother had an uncanny ability to detect surface thoughts. Pure thought explaining things that Miki's limited vocabulary couldn't. Your mother began to move her hands through an arcane gesture and you felt her power wash over you. [[Weather the changes|Miki High Happiness Ending 2]]From the moment the magic touched you, you were gripped with an uncomfortable sense of wrongness. Something about your body was fundamentally wrong, to the point that you felt like you wanted to escape it. At first you thought that the changes had caused it, but you couldn't even detect anything different. Certainly nothing that should cause such a visceral reaction. Though you only had a moment to consider that before the changes began in earnest. You were overwhelmed by a sense of vertigo as the ground suddenly got much closer to you. You'd lost probably two feet of height in a moment, so the fact you recovered so quickly was the real surprise. At least things felt a lot more natural looking from this angle. The loss in height was accompanied by the shortening of not only your legs and torso, but also of your arms. You looked at your short arms, grimacing at how they looked. Then from the tip of your fingers you saw something odd, there was a darkening of your skin. It wasn't extreme, but it was readily apparent. It travelled from your fingers, all the way up your hand, slowing as it crawled up the entirety of your arm. You couldn't see, but you could feel the tingles continuing to travel across your body, no doubt changing the rest of your skin. Looking at your beige skinned arms you breathed a sigh of relief, you felt much more comfortable now. Now you were about the right size, but there were still more changes to come. That sense of wrongness had abated, but it was still there, clawing at your mind. It wasn't something you'd be able to live with much longer, so you had to hope that it would fade away soon. [[The changes continued|Miki High Happiness Ending 3]]Currently stuck as a weird little boy the magic continued to work over you. It was a subtle thing, but you could feel parts of you getting a little softer, a little smoother. It wouldn't be something terribly noticeable until you got a bit older, then no one would ever think you could be a @@.girlVoice;smelly boy@@. The magic saw not only to your physical form but also to your clothes. Everything had almost fallen off of you but the magic caught them at the last moment. Shrinking them down to an appropriate size, but they didn't stay as jeans and a t-shirt. The shirt grew longer and thinner, a gentle pink starting to bleed into the formerly white fabric. It began bunching up in places but those quickly settled into gentle ruffles. The pink had continued to spread, now leaving your blouse a @@.girlVoice;bright pink@@. Your pants were undergoing a somewhat more complicated transformation. Part of it pulling tight to your leg, while another piece near the top started to become looser. The tightening part continued to pull itself tauter to your skin, all the while the fabric was thinning and becoming more porous. At the same time all the color seemed to be draining from it, leaving it a pale blue. That extra coloration seemed to flow into the loose part. Though it kept tight around your waist the rest had separated from your legs, joining together into a single nearly black piece. Your stockings finished their transformation, such a pale grey that it was almost white. Meanwhile your black skirt had flowed down to just above your knees, adding a @@.girlVoice;cute little extra ruffle layer@@ before it settled. As this occurred some very odd blond hairs fell in front of your eyes. It was so peculiar, you took hold of a few strands to take a look. But by the time you'd blinked and been able to focus it was it's normal dark black. You let it go, only feeling a small tug as a pair of pink bows materialized, pulling your hair back into @@.girlVoice;cute pigtails@@. A few extra details faded in, a silver bow on the chest, patterning on your stockings, which finished the look. Now you were back in the outfit you'd come in. Honestly you weren't sure why'd you'd had to change back. Why would you have ever been wearing @@.girlVoice;boring boy clothes@@? [[The changes finished|Miki High Happiness Ending 4]]Your former strange outfit wasn't the only oddity that was bouncing around in your head. There were a lot of confusing contradictory thoughts that were making your head hurt. You remembered coming to the party, but then you also remembered having already been here? Emily was mad at you, but why would Emily be mad at you? The two of you were best friends. There were also thoughts of all these people you didn't think you knew, teenagers you had no reason to ever encounter. The pain was coming to a head when it suddenly stopped. You relaxed, the headache fading away. You felt much better now, that sense of wrongness had almost entirely faded. Though it was even less clear why'd you'd ever felt that way at all. It wasn't like you were wearing anything weird or uncomfortable. You were just normal self. Awkwardly you gripped at the side of your skirt, shifting in place, trying to make yourself feel better. There was still something small bugging you, some little note gnawing at the back of your mind, but you couldn't place what it was. Suddenly there was a pinching around your @@.girlVoice;down there bits@@. It only lasted a moment but with it came a final sense of relief washing over you. Whatever had just happened had fixed that one last concern. Which meant you shouldn't just be here standing around, you should get @@.girlVoice;back to playing@@. The party was only going to be a little longer and you'd have to go home. [[Look at the other girls|Miki High Happiness Ending 5]]You looked over at the other girls which caused you quite a shock because another you was standing among them. You'd been standing over there a few moments agom about to transform $playerName into a playmate, but now you were standing over here //and// over there. It was confusing. @@.sophieVoice;"Holy..."@@ Sophie trailed off, not wanting to curse in front of Emily's mommy. @@.sophieVoice;"She looks //exactly// the same."@@ Emily's mom seemed surprised, @@.momVoice;"Miki had said she wanted a playmate 'just like her'. It seems that the magic took it rather literally."@@ In a flash the other you was standing in front of you. On the one hand it was weird staring into your mirror reflection, but on the other hand it was fascinating. The two of you began making faces and moving your hands, mirroring each other and delighting in seeing the action reflected back to you. @@.emilyVoice;"This is going to get confusing,"@@ she looked over to the two of you, @@.emilyVoice;"Miki!"@@ The two of you looked over, @@.mikiVoice;"Yes?"@@ You both answered, before looking at each other and giggling. @@.sophieVoice;"This is too weird,"@@ Sophie was stunned by the turn of events. @@.mikiVoice;"Can I...we go play now?"@@ You spoke, once again in Miki-stereo. You were @@.girlVoice;bored@@ of just standing around. There was only so much time left in the party and you wanted a chance to play with you. Stunned by the situation the rest of the girls mumbled their casual assent. [[The two of you walked away to play|Miki High Happiness Ending 6]] <<silently>>\ <<set $playerAge to 6>> <<set $epilogueStartAge to $playerAge>>\ <<set $playerMaturity to 6>> <<set $endingTraitMikiClone to true>> <<set $girlName to "Miki">> <</silently>>\The rest of the girls and Emily's mom stayed together while the two of you wandered off to play. @@.emilyVoice;"How did that happen? I know the magic can be..."@@ she struggled for the word. @@.momVoice;"Unpredictable,"@@ Emily's mom supplied, @@.momVoice;"yes. With a transformation like this it was never going to be exactly what anyone envisioned. Miki's will, $playerName's will, even my own prejudices all play into what actually happens. Apparently the conglomeration,"@@ Emily's mom looked at the group of children, quickly getting lost by her complex words. @@.momVoice;"The magic turned a request of 'just like her' into '//exactly// like her'. It's not wrong per say, but a little more dramatic than I'd expect."@@ @@.emilyVoice;"The two of them are pretty cute though."@@ The group of them looked back over to the two of you. Sophie was the first to voice the mistake they'd made. @@.sophieVoice;"Was anyone paying attention to which was the $playerName Miki and which was Miki Miki?"@@ The group stared at the pair of you. From the outside there was nothing to distinguish the two of you. Same hair, same clothes, even the same smudge on your cheek from breakfast. @@.momVoice;"Oh dear..."@@ @@.karaVoice;"Wait! I know how to solve this!"@@ [[Kara triumphantly stepped forward|Miki High Happiness Ending 7]]@@.karaVoice;"When you've got a duplicate you just have to ask a question that only the real Miki would know."@@ Kara explained. @@.karaVoice;"Miki!"@@ Kara called over and once again the two of you looked. She pointed at you, @@.karaVoice;"What book did Emily get you for Christmas?"@@ @@.mikiVoice;"Princess coloring book!"@@ You shouted, you @@.girlVoice;loved that book@@. @@.sophieVoice;"I think that might be a little easy. Anyone could know Miki loves princesses and coloring."@@ She pointed at the other you, @@.sophieVoice;"When we went to the aquarium, what happened to Kara?"@@ Kara looked horrified at the question, but the other you answered smoothly, despite her giggles, @@.mikiVoice;"She fell into the turtle pond."@@ You @@.girlVoice;giggled@@ as well, it'd been @@.girlVoice;so funny@@ when she'd gotten all wet and thought the turtles would attack. Sophie looked dejected and Emily stepped forward pointing at you again, @@.emilyVoice;"What did I first say to you about your brother?"@@ @@.mikiVoice;"You said he was stupid!"@@ Emily grinned, but you thought better of your answer. It hadn't been quite like that, @@.mikiVoice;"you said he wasn't as smart as he thought he was."@@ Emily's grin faded. The girls continued their impromptu interrogation regarding the most minute details of your life. But both you and the other you were able to answer every question. Even answering at the same time on more than one occasion. The one time you hadn't been able to answer something, the other you couldn't either. You'd both forgotten the details of that particular event. [[They gave up the attempt|Miki High Happiness Ending 8]]@@.karaVoice;"Darn! I thought that would work. It always works in the comics."@@ Kara looked dejected, but Emily's mommy stepped forward, @@.momVoice;"it was a very smart idea Kara. In most cases it would have worked, but it seems this transformation was thorough on both mind and body. I'll dispel it now so we don't let things get out of hand."@@ She waved her hand in your general direction, and you felt a small tingling in your scalp, but little else. You and the other you looked at each other, thoroughly unaffected by the unknown magic. She frowned and tried again, to the same lack of effect. @@.emilyVoice;"Mom?"@@ Emily's mom redoubled her focus, staring at the two of you as if she could see into your very souls. @@.momVoice;"Uh oh."@@ Everyone froze. It was never a good sign when an adult said 'uh oh'. Doubly so when that adult was a powerful witch. @@.emilyVoice;"What's going on?"@@ Emily was doing her best to keep panic out of her voice. Her mom sighed, @@.momVoice;"for reasons I don't understand right now, as far as I can tell, neither of them is transformed. They are just normal Mikis."@@ @@.sophieVoice;"How is that possible? I mean you did transform $playerName."@@ Sophie didn't really understand all this magic stuff, but even she could make that logical leap. @@.momVoice;"If I had to guess the magic took 'just like her' to the absolute extreme. Miki doesn't have a transformation on her. So her new identical playmate shouldn't either. The magic performed the transformation and then erased it's own presence."@@ @@.karaVoice;"But you can tell which is which, right?"@@ @@.momVoice;"I hope so..."@@ [[Emily's mommy continued to test|Miki High Happiness Ending 9]]But all these questions were super boring...you wanted to play more. You had your new twin to play with, and that was amazing, but it was always more fun to play with more people. You waved over to Kara for her to join the two of you. Despondent from failing to figure out the situation she was in desperate need of cheering up, and you and other you had the best idea... [[Kara walked over to play|Mikipocalypse 1]]<<contentWarning "Silly, Mass Twinning (Identity Death).">>Though after another battery of tests the mystery remained. There were two Mikis, each of you insistent they were the real one. Each of you not understanding why this was a big deal, now you had someone you could always play with. But it was not to be. As the minutes and hours had ticked by it came time for your mom to come pick you up. It was then that you realized the issue. Mom would expect to pick up you, not you and another you. It'd be confusing and more than a little scary. Which just so happened to be same concerns that Emily's mom was experiencing. She'd run every test she could think of and Miki's mom was about to arrive and find she now had two copies of her daughter. Explaining that one would be a herculean task. So she did the next best thing, avoided it. @@.momVoice;"Miki,"@@ the two of you looked and she grimaced. Pointing at the other you, she continued to speak, @@.momVoice;"you are going to stay here a little longer, while you,"@@ her pointer finger shifted to you, @@.momVoice;"are going to go home in a few minutes."@@ The other Miki looked a little distressed, why wasn't she getting to go home with mom? You sympathized, that sounded @@.girlVoice;pretty scary@@. But Emily stepped in, @@.emilyVoice;"It'll be fun! We can have another sleepover, just the two of us, and play all day."@@ Now you were torn. Going home was nice, but playing with Emily sounded nice too. Unfortunately there was no time to consider your position. Emily had pulled the other Miki away and Emily's mom was shepherding you to the door. [[Time to go home|Miki High Happiness Ending 10]]@@.momVoice;"Now Miki,"@@ at least now it was clear who she was talking to, @@.momVoice;"you're going to keep your promise about not telling, right? What happened with $playerName is our little secret."@@ You nodded, you'd made the deal and you weren't about to go back on it. But did that mean the other you was actually $playerName? You were sure that you hadn't been a teenage boy yesterday, but the other you had seemed pretty convinced as well. Again you weren't given a chance to really dive into this conundrum. Mom was here and it was time to go home. You held her hand as she walked you to the car. Thanking Emily's mom for hosting and taking care of you. You only resented that a little bit, you were a @@.girlVoice;big girl@@, you didn't need to be 'taken care of'. But mom often thought that you needed more care and attention than you knew you did. The car ride was quick, you didn't live too far away, but you were still @@.girlVoice;growing impatient@@. You hadn't thought about it until now, but without the party to distract you, you'd gotten homesick. It'd only been a night, but it felt like an eternity. Even if it meant dealing with your @@.girlVoice;meanie@@ older brother. You really didn't get along with him. The only nice thing he'd ever done for you was being the one who introduced you to Emily, and that was only by accident. Finally stepping through the threshold to your home you were struck by a second realization. You were @@.girlVoice;really tired@@. None of you had gotten much sleep, and the day had been rather eventful. You'd only just gotten to your room and started unpacking when the fatigue became overwhelming and you crashed face down on your bed for an impromptu nap. [[Time to wake up|Miki High Happiness Ending 11]]@@.mikiMomVoice;"Time to get up sweetie. It's time for dinner."@@ You woke up with a start. You hadn't meant to fall asleep, so being woken up was a surprise. But mom was always so nice that you didn't really mind it. You nodded and got yourself up. Yawning you noticed that all of your luggage had already been unpacked and put away. Mom's handiwork no doubt. The rest of the night wasn't worth talking about. It played out like a hundred other nights had. You dreaded the next day, but that was entirely normal. You didn't really like school and Monday's were the worst. The night came and went and the school day was upon you. It to was basically the same as always. The only strange thing was that Emily seemed to be a little off kilter when you saw her at lunch. She invited you to come over to her place after school, though she wouldn't specify why. The whole thing sounded more like an order than a request. When you got there the other you met you at the door. The two of you were able to have some fun for the remainder of the evening. Though some of that was marred by Emily's mom's insistence on asking all sorts of weird questions and doing all sorts of weird tests. In the end nothing was settled, and for some reason tonight you were going to stay here and the other you would be going home. Emily however was able to convince you that it was the best of both worlds. You hadn't got to play last night, so you would tonight. [[The other you went home|Miki High Happiness Ending 12]]Before the other you went home the two of you had to switch outfits. The other you had gotten a new outfit from Emily's magic closet, but your parents would expect you to come home in the same thing you'd worn this morning. Even if the you that came home wasn't the you that had left this morning. Plus you had to tell the other you what you'd done at school today. Thinking all this was making your @@.girlVoice;head hurt@@; having two yous was complicated. At least you knew your new outfit would be @@.girlVoice;cute@@, since you'd already seen how it looked on you. This shuffle continued for the rest of the week, alternating where each of you stayed. A few other women came to Emily's house and they to asked weird questions and did weird tests. However, all of them seemed to leave looking disappointed and a bit defeated. On Friday night the two of you pulled a bit of a trick. Instead of switching clothes you just left everything on and you stayed at Emily's for a second night in a row. No one seemed to notice, much to your amusement. [[The week ended|Miki High Happiness Ending 13]]Come the weekend the whole group was back together. Emily, Sophie, Kara, you and you. It seemed that Kara had something to announce to the group. @@.karaVoice;"So I was thinking about our Miki clone thingy,"@@ she was excited, @@.karaVoice;"I was reading a few of my comic books and I have an idea."@@ She cast a quick glance at Sophie, expecting some snarky remark about comics, but nothing came this time. @@.karaVoice;"We need to ask something that only one of them could remember"@@ @@.sophieVoice;"We already tried that."@@ @@.karaVoice;"Mmmhmm, and it didn't work because we were asking things that happened too far in the past. But there is one event that we //know// $playerName experienced, but Miki didn't."@@ She turned to the two of you, pointing at the other you, @@.karaVoice;"Potential Miki. When you first saw the other Miki, was she standing by herself, or with the rest of us?"@@ Emily gasped, and even her mom looked rather impressed. It was a very clever question. Everyone had been so busy trying to solve it with weird tests and magic, that they'd missed this one possible distinction. @@.mikiVoice;"She was standing by herself,"@@ the other you cast a guilty glance at you, as if she was ratting you out. @@.karaVoice;"And what about you?"@@ You considered the matter. If she had been standing alone that meant //you// were the original Miki, or at least thought you were. But if you'd seen the other you standing with the group, it meant you weren't the real one after all. Visions of both scenes danced in your head, but which one did you feel was true? [[She was standing alone|Miki High Happiness Ending 14]]<<contentWarning "Twinning (Identity Death)">> [[She was standing with the group|Miki High Happiness Ending Escape 1]]Kara's face fell. She'd thought she had a bulletproof way of figuring out which of you was which. Emily's mommy put a hand on her shoulder, @@.momVoice;"It was an excellent idea Kara. It seems the magic was rather thorough. It must have continued editing active memories until any distinction was erased."@@ Kara nodded, but she didn't look happier. @@.emilyVoice;"Are you saying there is no way at all to tell which is which?"@@ Emily asked, and her mom responded with a nod. @@.sophieVoice;"Couldn't we just pick one, transform them into $playerName and then it would all be fine?"@@ Emily's mom's face turned dark, @@.momVoice;"That would just end in misery,"@@ she took a moment, softening her look and her voice, @@.momVoice;"I'm sorry Sophie, that wasn't fair to you, you couldn't possibly know the implications of that suggestion."@@ Despite the softened response Sophie still looked abashed for making the suggestion. [[Emily's mom explained|Miki High Happiness Ending 15]]@@.momVoice;"Emily, let me know if I get too technical, sometimes I forget what children your age normally know."@@ @@.momVoice;"They say that water takes the shape of its container, but people are a little more complicated than that. There is some essential part of them that always remembers what they were. Even if you put them into another form and seal away all their memories. There is still something that echoes who they were. The form that, if all the magic were dispelled, they would return to."@@ Sophie was clearly deeply confused, Kara was vaguely following and Emily was mostly keeping up. @@.momVoice;"To put it simply, right now both of them are Miki down to their very core. If I were to turn one of them into $playerName it wouldn't make them $playerName. It would be Miki in $playerName's body. Eventually the magic would fade, or something would dispel it and they'd be right back to being Miki. Worse they would live their entire lives with an unexplainable discomfort with everything about themselves. It would be near impossible for them to ever be happy."@@ The other girls frowned. That seemed pretty clear. Even if they got it 'right' and transformed the real $playerName, they would be miserable for the rest of their life. Emily finally spoke up, @@.emilyVoice;"So what do we do now?"@@ [[There was a long pause|Miki High Happiness Ending 16]]@@.momVoice;"I don't know."@@ That was perhaps the most terrifying thing the girls had heard since this all started. They were little kids, they assumed that adults knew basically everything, that they could solve any problem. Having that image of omniscience shattered so suddenly was jarring. The situation did seem intractable. There were two Mikis where there should be one, and seemingly no way to separate the two or return $playerName to normal. Unless Miki's mom was willing to accept that she suddenly had identical twins there were no other straightforward options. It was a surprise to everyone when you provided a possible answer, @@.mikiVoice;"can we keep switching?"@@ It'd only been a week, but you actually quite liked this arrangement. Getting every other night away from your annoying brother //and// getting to spend it with Emily. Not surprisingly the other you felt the same, @@.mikiVoice;"oh! Can we? Can we?"@@ Initially everyone was against the idea, thinking of all the reasons it "couldn't work". It would mean you only were at school half the time. What if something happened to one of you, but then the other got asked about it? Wouldn't you be angry you couldn't go out together? But you were undeterred. The two of you understood each other better than anyone else possibly could. How hard could it be to keep each other updated with what you missed? You could even teach each other everything. @@.momVoice;"And it would be simple enough to have an illusion over one of them if they did wish to go out together..."@@ Emily's mom mused. [[Emily's mother relented|Miki High Happiness Ending 17]]So the group was left at an impasse, none of them seemed to know what else to do. Meanwhile you were just getting more and more excited. You had a //perfect// playmate, one who was just like you. You would be the best friend you could ever have. Lacking a better solution you went forward with the swapping plan. It was intended to be a stop gap solution until something else was figured out. But as they say, there's nothing more permanent than something being temporary. So days turned into weeks, months and years. Eventually Emily's mom revealed to you both that she had no intent to change you back. Even if a solution was discovered you were both so much older now, with years of experience and memories. No one could turn back time, and the two of you would never want them to. In the end it was a happy ending for '$playerName'...whichever one of you that used to be. Regarding the sleepover you were told there was something about curses and trials and souls, but it was all super complicated and you didn't really understand it. All that mattered was you were both happy with who you were. It wasn't to say that you never had struggles, sometimes switching lives every day could be annoying, but the two of you still @@.girlVoice;loved@@ it. You'd gotten a new sort of sister who you loved being around, and a new sort of mom who was able to do all sorts of fun things with magic. Much to her surprise it turned out you could do them as well. One day idly fiddling with Emily's wand had resulted in the other you having a pig nose, much to her horror. Emily's mom had quickly resolved the issue, but immediately undertook a training program so you'd both know how to use that power. [[High school|Miki High Happiness Ending 18]] <<set $endingTraitMiddleSchoolMikiClone to true>> <<set $playerAge to 12>> <<set $playerMaturity to 12>>By the time you hit high school the both of you were fairly well trained in magic, though you rarely used it. Magic could do some ''amazing'' things, but it also came with a host of rules and restrictions neither of you wanted to deal with. The biggest boon was making it much easier for the two of you to go out together. Until now, if you wanted to go out with the other you then Emily's mom had to cast an illusion to make one of you look like not you. Now you could cast it yourself, so you could go out whenever you wanted to. Sometimes you both cast the spell so you could go out entirely incognito, just for fun. As the two of you aged you found more and more fun in your duplicate nature. There wasn't a soul on Earth that could tell you apart, so you could swap on a dime and no one would be the wiser. Of course you made sure to keep each other perfectly up to date with each others actions. Except when it was more fun not to...going on a date where the boy had no idea why you seemed to keep losing track of the conversation whenever you went to the bathroom was //way// too much fun. There was a question about what would happen after school. Would you keep up your switching lifestyle? Would you start separate lives? Or would some other solution present itself? You weren't worried, the two of you would figure it out, you always did. As long as you had each other everything would be fine. Ending 5a: Miki Multiplication <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<silently>>\ <<saveEnding "Miki" 5>>\ <<set $endingTraitHighSchoolMikiClone to true>>\ <<set $playerAge to 16>> <<set $playerMaturity to 16>> <<set $showTeenNPCDescriptions to true>> <</silently>>\The group gave a collective sigh. If you remembered that it meant that you were actually $playerName and not the real Miki. There was a sick feeling in the pit of your stomach. Unconsciously you'd known that the entire time, but you couldn't bring yourself to admit it. Every part of you insisted that you were Miki, that it was ridiculous to think anything else. It was only that one troublesome memory that was evidence to the contrary. Emily's @@.girlVoice;mommy@@ saw the clear distress on your face and quickly moved into action. Mumbling something under her breath before you felt a familiar tingle rippling across your body. That feeling of wrongness returned, but now things were going in the opposite direction. After a few moments you were in the body of a teenage boy, it took another moment for you to come to terms with the fact that it was //your// body. A few more and you were able to accept that it was also the body you were supposed to be in. A few moments ago you'd been convinced you were Miki, and now that idea seemed ludicrous. Obviously you'd looked like Miki but how could you think that you actually were her. Without Miki's memories dominating your mind it was much easier to clearly see all the signs that had shown you were never the real one. Miki's face was a mixture of relief and disappointment. On the one had she'd be able to go back to her normal life and sleep in her own bed every night. On the other hand she'd lost what might have been the best playmate ever. You understood her feelings entirely. You'd miss playing with you...her. You'd miss playing with Miki. But she came over often enough, you would get other chances. You'd enjoy playing basically anything with her. Even silly games or a kiddie girly show. If it was with Miki it would be @@.girlVoice;fun@@. Plus there was nothing wrong with @@.girlVoice;Sofia being your favourite Disney Princess@@. [[Life returned to normal|Miki High Happiness Ending Escape 2]] <<set $girlName to "">> <<set $playerAge to 16>> <<set $playerMaturity to 16>> <<set $endingTraitMikiClone to false>> <<set $endingTraitFormerMikiClone16 to true>>The next Monday you were back at high school like you were meant to be. At first you'd been concerned that some of the knowledge you'd lost would stay lost. However, a few classes later you were comfortably back to normal levels. Though you did feel some oddity when interacting with your classmates. Some you'd sorta got along with now seemed less appealing, while others you really wanted to get to know better. Nothing that seemed too concerning, but it was something worth noting. The subsequent weeks showed that there were a few other changes. You didn't notice any of it at first, but Emily and @@.girlVoice;mommy@@ certainly had, and they felt obligated to let you know. They came to your room as you were working through your @@.girlVoice;newest coloring book@@. One had caught your eye in the store and on a lark you'd bought it. After you'd finished you'd had @@.girlVoice;so much fun@@ that you bought a few more. Plus getting a proper set of crayons. The ones that came with the books were pretty @@.girlVoice;poopy@@. @@.momVoice;"$playerName I want to have a little talk with you."@@ You looked up, slightly annoyed, you'd been very close to being done that page, but @@.girlVoice;mommy@@ probably had something important to say, <<playerVoice "\"Yes @@.girlVoice;mommy@@?\"">> Emily stifled a giggle at your response, but @@.girlVoice;mommy@@ just smiled. @@.momVoice;"Do you notice anything odd about what you just said?"@@ [[You didn't know what she was talking about|Miki High Happiness Ending Escape 3]]@@.emilyVoice;"You called her 'mommy', you've been calling her 'mommy' for weeks now."@@ Emily teased. You started, surely you hadn't been calling her...no you had been saying 'mommy', but wasn't that the normal thing to use? It seemed totally natural to you, but you knew Emily often used 'mom' and you'd never heard any of your classmates talk about their @@.girlVoice;mommies@@ that way. @@.momVoice;"Emily is telling the truth. That's not the only thing. I mean you are currently doing a Frozen coloring book."@@ You were about to protest. There was nothing wrong with @@.girlVoice;enjoying Frozen or coloring@@, but even you were starting to get the inkling that this wasn't exactly normal behaviour for a teenage boy. @@.momVoice;"Some of this is subtle, and I'm sure we've failed to notice some. But you spent half a day last weekend watching Sofia the First with Miki and then declared you wanted to be a princess."@@ Well princesses were @@.girlVoice;very pretty@@ and who didn't want to be rich...but they were girls and you shouldn't... @@.momVoice;"It seems obvious that your transformation back was somewhat incomplete. At least part of your mind is still Miki."@@ [[That didn't sound as crazy as it should|Miki High Happiness Ending Escape 4]]<<playerVoice "\"So what do we do @@.girlVoice;mommy@@...mom?\"">> Now that you were aware of it you could avoid the natural temptation, but it still felt weird to call her anything but @@.girlVoice;mommy@@. She fixed you with an odd look, @@.momVoice;"Nothing,"@@ she stated flatly, @@.momVoice;"after what happened I wouldn't dare do anything else to mess with your mind. There's no telling how that might end up."@@ <<playerVoice "\"I'm just going to have to live with part of Miki in my head?\"">> @@.girlVoice;Mommy@@ nodded, @@.momVoice;"For the moment. It might fade over time or the Miki fragment might just grow up."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Should I do anything to help it...go away?\"">> Your words trailed off by the end. You knew rationally you should want it gone, a teenage boy shouldn't want the occasional impulses of a six year old girl. But you also didn't want it to go away, you liked @@.girlVoice;Sofia@@, you @@.girlVoice;liked coloring@@, you liked @@.girlVoice;playing with Miki@@. Why did you have to get rid of that? Mommy's odd look softened and Emily was smiling, @@.momVoice;"Nothing to do really, as long as you're okay with it."@@ You nodded in response, @@.momVoice;"though perhaps you might want to clamp down on a few of those behaviours. I don't think you'll want your classmates to hear you calling me 'mommy'."@@ You flushed. That would be mortifying. <<playerVoice "\"Yes mom,\"">> the word still felt weird, <<playerVoice "\"I'll keep an eye on that.\"">> [[Your offbeat life continued|Miki High Happiness Ending Escape 5]]With the existence of your Miki fragment settled, life mostly went back to normal. Or at least the normal of a sixteen year old boy who's best friend was a six year old girl. It didn't bother either of you, though it wasn't something that you advertised to the world. No one involved wanted to answer all of the questions that would come along with it. School continued on as it had before, though you'd actually made a few more friends that before. Your new quirks had made you more charming to a few of the girls, though never in any romantic sense. But no matter how many friends you made you always made some time to hang out with Miki. Especially when she wasn't having a good day. You'd developed some kind of sixth sense for Miki's mood, even when you hadn't seen her. Her eight year old brother was a @@.girlVoice;jerk@@ and often the source of those foul moods. Even your @@.girlVoice;mood soured@@ whenever you encountered him, something you amusingly had in common with Emily as well. On the weekends the two of you took every chance you could to share in the things you both enjoyed. Sitting on the carpet watching @@.girlVoice;My Little Pony, coloring, reading picture books@@. The books were trivial to you, but it didn't mean they were any less fun. In the subsequent years your friendship didn't fade. Though as your mom had predicted, Miki matured, so did that part of you. @@.girlVoice;Coloring@@ gave way to painting. Books had only a handful of illustrations, if any at all. Though both of you still enjoyed @@.girlVoice;My Little Pony@@, even if she was a little old for it, and you were a lot too old. You didn't care. You enjoyed your role as Miki's friend/big brother/playmate and she enjoyed the close friend as well. Especially when that friend always knew exactly what to buy for her birthday and how to best cheer her up on bad days. The only problem was sometimes she felt bad that she wasn't as in tune with your feelings. But that didn't bother you at all, you knew she tried and that's the best you could ever ask for. The two of you were the best of friends and nothing was going to change that, not now, not ever. Ending 5b: Miki Mind Meld <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "Miki" 10>>Kara walked over to the two of you, @@.karaVoice;"you know, it's weird seeing two of you Miki...Mikis? Is there a plural for that?"@@ You @@.girlVoice;giggled@@ at Kara's deep consideration of the matter. She was thinking too hard. Kara was @@.girlVoice;super smart@@ but sometimes you thought it stopped her from just enjoying herself. Grabbing her hand you gently tugged at it, pulling her towards your clone, as you did there was a strange tingling in your fingers @@.mikiVoice;"come on, let's play!"@@ Kara looked concerned for a moment, but then a new expression crossed her face. She smiled, showing off her missing front tooth. The three of you launched into some silly make believe games as the rest of the girls and Emily's mom continued to talk. You'd been right, this was a lot more fun with an extra person, and you'd never seen Kara as at ease as she was right now. Though there was something else a little odd about her, was her hair getting darker? You shrugged and continued your game, if Kara wanted to dye her hair that was fine, then all three of you could have the same hair color. The play continued, though things began to become confusing. You turned to Kara to ask her a question but did a double take. The girl that looked back at you wasn't quite Kara, she actually looked quite a bit like you...in fact as you continued to watch you were sure of it. This girl looked like you with a little bit of Kara mixed in. She awkwardly grabbed at her skirt as it seemed to twist and morph. [[You watched the girl|Mikipocalypse 2]]You watched in fascination as the not Kara almost you started to look more and more like just you. Her now black hair pulled back into the same ponytails you had, complete with pink bows that appeared from nowhere. Her skin finished darkening to the same tone as yours. She hadn't shrunk much, but her clothes were doing a final shift to ensure they fit properly. Only a few moments later you were looking into another mirror version of you who looked almost as confused as you did. The other other you turned to see the scene of two more Mikis staring back at her. Since this had already happened once before the three of you knew exactly what you needed to do...have even more fun playing together! The trio of you got back to playing with each other. Sophie was the first one to notice what had occurred, @@.sophieVoice;"Holy crap,"@@ this time she couldn't suppress the mild curse, @@.sophieVoice;"uh you should look at this..."@@ she tugged at Emily's mom's arm, causing her and Emily to turn and look at the scene of three Mikis playing together. @@.emilyVoice;"Mom...Kara is gone..."@@ Emily's voice quavered. @@.momVoice;"Yes. It seems that way,"@@ her voice was outwardly calm but there was a hint of concern underneath. The three yous looked at the group, they all looked so serious and distressed. That was awful, they could be having fun like the rest of you. You glanced at the others, the same thoughts in their heads...you rushed over to the group, grabbing for Emily and Sophie. [[You took their hands|Mikipocalypse 3]]As stunned as they were by the situation Emily and Sophie didn't even react until you were already on top of them. @@.mikiVoice;"Come on. Let's play!"@@ A trio of voices echoed, each of you tugging at one of the girls, encouraging them to come play. Both seemed reluctant at first, before their expression changed, the same way Kara's had. They smiled, showing off their matching missing front tooth, both of them having regained a few lost baby teeth. Emily's mom had enough of her wits about her to back away from the scene, but that was fine with you. She was an adult, she wouldn't like playing games with you. Emily and Sophie would. Though both of them looked kinda funny. Emily's hair had dramatic black streaks and Sophie's still red hair had pulled back into pig tails with pink ribbons. Neither of them seemed concerned with the changes, and nor were you and the other Mikis. If two of you playing together had been fun, and three was better, then surely five would be bestest. Almost-Emily and almost-Sophie continued to play along as Emily's mom watched on in horror. The girls quickly lost height, until they stood as short as the rest of you, their clothes morphing to match. Emily's hair had gone completely black even though her skin was still a pale white. Meanwhile Sophie's freckles had grown and expanded, her skin tone matching yours, but her pigtailed hair was still red. You all watched in fascination as the changes continued to wash over them. Moments later the five of you looked between one another. It was disorienting, turning to look at different people but instead seeing the same person in a different spot. You all @@.girlVoice;giggled@@ at the absurdity of the situation. [[Emily's mom called out|Mikipocalypse 4]]@@.momVoice;"Stop!"@@ She shouted, @@.momVoice;"all of you just stay right there."@@ You all obeyed as she began to pace, mumbling to herself, @@.momVoice;"how could this happen? The magic should have...though the two of them were very close, that would have made it stronger...still it shouldn't proliferate like this. Unless each new Miki is directing the magic to make a new playmate? But how would it have the power..."@@ She trailed off, looking down as Miki tugged at the hem of her blouse, @@.mikiVoice;"are you okay? You seem upsat."@@ @@.momVoice;"Oh no,"@@ was the last thing Emily's mom spoke before her expression softened, smiling with a missing front tooth and a mouth full of baby teeth. The changes to her were almost as dramatic as the ones that had happened to $playerName, though they occurred even faster. A moment after Miki had tugged on her blouse she'd shrunk down to the same size, practically drowning in her too big adult clothes. This didn't last long, in a whirl of changing and tightening fabric they transformed to suit her new stature. They also seemed to transform her to suit them. Leaving a pair of Mikis staring at each other blinking in confusion. The six yous stared at one another, none of this had been what you expected, but it was @@.girlVoice;amazing@@. You had so many playmates now, all of whom wanted to play //exactly// the same thing you did. So play you did, an uninterrupted stream of games, flowing from one to the other without having to speak a word. [[There was a knock at the door|Mikipocalypse 5]]You opened the door, revealing Kara's mother. @@.coachVoice;"Oh, Miki, hello there. I'm here to pick up Kara, is she ready to go?"@@ She peered past you into the rest of the house. Clearly she hadn't expected you to answer the door and was looking for whoever was watching over the party. But you knew better. You were a @@.girlVoice;big girl@@ you didn't need anyone to watch over you and you knew just the way to prove it. You grabbed Kara's mom's hand, pulling her back into the house to play with the rest of the girls. By the time you got back to the living room and the other Mikis you looked over to see another identical you was holding your hand. It was a scene that played out again when Sophie's dad came to pick Sophie up but instead joined in the party. His transformation was done before he'd even made it to the living room. When your mom came to pick you up she quickly found herself buried under over half a dozen Mikis, but by the time the pile disassembled there were now nine of you. That was the first time any of you had gotten worried, it was one thing to have more playmates, but you still needed your mommy... Scared and not knowing what to do you all made the decision to go and find your daddy. Your house wasn't far, you could walk. You weren't supposed to walk alone, but you wouldn't be alone, you had eight other yous to walk with. [[Walk home|Mikipocalypse 6]]By the time you finally made it home your posse had increased to a full dozen. It seemed with every new Miki the magic grew stronger, now even the lightest touch was enough to make someone into a new Miki. Your brother didn't even get a chance to open the door before it hit him. By the time the door swung open you were staring at another, slightly confused, Miki. The rest of the house only revealed another two Mikis and no sign of your daddy. This was enough to cause even more panic in the group. This panic only caused the magic to spike further. Unbeknownst to any of you your neighbours houses were already filled with newly minted Mikis, and it was continuing to spread. Each new Miki wanting a new playmate 'just like her' and propagating and feeding the mass Mikification spell. What had taken minutes to transform one Miki under direct attention was now turning people into Mikis within seconds at a distance. Walls, floors, trees, nothing made a difference as the spell ripped through the city, leaving more distressed Mikis in it's wake. With an entire city of Mikis boosting the spell it easily spread further. Jumping from city to city, country to country, continent to continent. It only took two hours and forty three minutes until the entire world was composed of nothing but Miki. Luckily the spell mutated enough to allow for some flexibility. Mikis in cold climes came equipped with boots, a jacket and a hat, while Mikis in potentially dangerous situations found themselves whisked away to the nearest safe spot. With no one left to convert the magic finally came to a rest, it's mission fulfilled. Every Miki had as many perfect playmates as they could possibly want. And so the world ends, not with a bang, but with a global game of patty-cake. Ending 5-Secret: Mikipocalypse <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "Miki" 18>><<include "Reset state for ending start">>\ Miki considered the matter. If she could give you another form for a week, what would it be? The two of you hadn't been the best of friends this party. It was clear that whatever she picked it was going to be pretty far from a sixteen year old boy. You would protest the situation, but with mom there, and on their side, there wasn't much you could do. Though having your fate in the hands of a six year old wasn't the most comforting prospect. Finally she seemed to come to a decision. Beckoning your mother to lean down and then whispering into her ear. @@.momVoice;"Ah yes. I understand, that would be very cute."@@ Miki looked extremely excited. Her instructions had only taken a few moments. It might mean that she hadn't been able to express herself, or maybe the instructions just had been that simple. Either way you had no doubt mom would make it happen. Your mother began to move her hands through an arcane gesture before you felt her power wash over you. [[Weather the Changes|Miki Low Happiness Ending 2]]The changes that washed over you were significant. The changes didn't bother running through the gamut of puberty, simply going straight to child. You were rapidly shrinking down, losing feet of height and dozens of pounds. The speed of the loss causing a severe case of vertigo as your perspective plummeted towards the floor. It was more luck than coordination that prevented you from simply falling over. You tottered on your short hairless legs, stepping out of your absurdly oversized socks almost by accident. Your pants and underwear had also been lost in the shuffle. But your shirt was more than up to the task of covering you. Now an oversized dress that came all the way past your knees. You could feel a tingling on your face, a sure sign it was also changing, but without a mirror you couldn't really tell how. The long black hair that suddenly fell across your eyes was the best clue you had. You were worried that you'd be left as nothing more than a toddler, but the physical regression had seemed to finally come to a halt. <<if $oldPlayerAge > 5>>You'd never gotten this little before.<<else>>You were back to your five year old self.<</if>> It was disorienting to go straight from sixteen to five. Your body felt so weak, it was a wonder you could move around at all with so little muscle. You supposed you were also a lot lighter to compensate. Although perhaps not at light as you would expect. You poked at your @@.girlVoice;squishy@@ and padded stomach, it seemed you were carrying a few extra pounds there. It tickled and you tried hard to suppress a @@.girlVoice;giggle@@. You glanced over to your mother and Miki. Miki's eyes were as wide as saucers and it was taking all of her willpower not to simply run over and hug you. Mom summoned a mirror in front of you so you could get a look at yourself. It was a little hard to see the exact shape of your body with the shapeless dress covering you. But you could feel your chubby little body underneath. <<if $oldPlayerAge <= 10>>You were a little girl again, but you looked nothing like before.<</if>> You'd already noted your raven black hair, but you'd neglected to notice that your skin had turned a light brown. [[You looked at your face|Miki Low Happiness Ending 3]] <<SetPronouns "f">> <<silently>>\ <<set $playerAge to 5>> <<set $epilogueStartAge to $playerAge>>\ <<set $traitChubby to true>> <<set $traitClumsy to true>> <<set $voiceClassOverride to 8>> <<set $endingTraitMikiLowAge5 to true>> <</silently>>\Your face was where the new details really sank in. Your long straight black hair fell all the way to the small of your back. Your face was round and chubby, giving it a youthful innocence. Brown almond shaped eyes only pushed that image further. Your nose was actually quite big for your face but it's roundness suited the rest of you. You were @@.girlVoice;super cute@@, in an adorable kindergartener way. Looking over at Miki you realized that you were actually a couple inches shorter than her, though you probably weighed the same. But between the height and the girlishness of your face you looked noticeably younger than her, even if you were only a year apart. @@.sophieVoice;"Wait a second..."@@ Sophie moved a little closer and narrowed her eyes, studying your form. She suddenly let out a barking laugh, @@.sophieVoice;"she looks like Lilo!"@@ Miki gave an embarrassed giggle, but your mother came to her rescue, @@.momVoice;"she didn't ask for that specifically. But it was the image in her head, so the magic took inspiration from that."@@ You peered at yourself in the mirror again. It was hard to definitively say 'I look like the real life version of a cartoon character', but the resemblance was uncanny. Though if anything you thought you might be //younger// than Lilo was in the movie. <<playerVoice "\"I got a new dog. His name is Stitch.\"">> Sophie lost it, cackling at your tone. Your voice was high and light. It was a touch nasally which made it sound like you had a very light lisp. The whole package made you sound even more @@.girlVoice;cute and innocent.@@ But the girliness wasn't what had made Sophie laugh. She'd laughed because you sounded //exactly// like Lilo. Or at least like whoever voiced her. [[But the changes weren't done|Miki Low Happiness Ending 4]] <<set $hairstyle to 8>>\ <<set $hairLength to "long">>\ <<set $humiliation++>><<silently>>\ <<set $playerMaturity to 5>> <<set $traitForgetful to true>> <<set $traitSlowLearner to true>> <<set $traitDaydreamer to true>> <<set $traitOblivious to true>> <<set $traitCrybaby to true>> <<set $traitLoveYourStuffy to true>> <</silently>>\ Your body had reached the desired final form, but your mind wasn't yet done. You knew Miki wouldn't just want you to look this young, she'd want you to act that way too. A pressure began to build in your head. One of the few signs you knew for a dramatic mental change. The pressure built and built, it wasn't painful but it made your head feel overfull. There was too much thought in too little brain and you needed to get some of it out. Finally there was a ''POP'', and the pressure disappeared all at once. You reeled from the effects, your thoughts painfully making their way back to the fore. It felt like they were trudging through deep mud, and it was hard to keep a grasp on them. The keenness of the situation faded after a few moments, but you still found your thoughts coming to you distressingly slowly. @@.mikiVoice;"Let's play now!"@@ Miki grabbed your hand and began to pull you away. You hadn't even noticed her walk up. Your mother gave a cough, @@.momVoice;"Maybe we should get her something to wear first?"@@ You looked down, realizing that you were wearing nothing more than an oversized t-shirt. You gave a @@.girlVoice;nervous giggle@@, it looked @@.girlVoice;cute@@ but you must look @@.girlVoice;awfully silly@@. [[Get Dressed|Miki Low Happiness Ending 5]]<<Image 'Endings/MikiLow/Day0.jpg' "topRightCorner">>\ @@.emilyVoice;"Hey! <<playerName>>! What about this?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"Huh? Yeah. Sounds good,\"">> you answered before even looking at what Emily was offering. You were only half paying attention, you were preoccupied getting used to the new you. If you were going to be stuck like this for a week so might as well start. @@.emilyVoice;"Well are you going to put it on, or do we have to dress you?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"No, no, I can dress myself...\"">> you finally looked at the outfit on offer. A plaid patterned shirt in pink and white, with short flared sleeves. Along with a pair of denim shorts. Each of them had the extra embellishment of watermelon slices. The shirt was covered in them and the shorts had a fake rip on each leg which showed more of the same pattern. It was very @@.girlVoice;kiddy@@...then again so were you. Dutifully you went and got yourself changed. A more mature you might have noted that the shorts seemed awfully short. But you were too young for you, or anyone else, to think it was anything but @@.girlVoice;cute@@. You came back from the bathroom to model your new outfit. If nothing else it fit a lot better than a large men's shirt. Miki and Emily agreed with your internal assessment, declaring the outfit the 'cutest thing they'd ever seen'. @@.emilyVoice;"You're lucky I was here, Miki would have put you in a hula outfit or a...moo-moo?...that dress that Lilo wears."@@ Miki looked only slightly put out that she hadn't gotten her way. You shared her feelings, a hula outfit would have been @@.girlVoice;so cute@@. <<if $hulaActivityResult == 1>>You'd been thinking about wearing one pretty much all day and you //still// hadn't gotten a chance.<</if>> @@.emilyVoice;"And now the finishing touch."@@ Emily leaned over and put a pink bow into your hair. You thought the outfit was @@.girlVoice;totally adorable@@ but you had one concern. There was something about it that screamed you were too little to actually have picked it out yourself. The bow reinforced the childish vibe. It got to the point where it hinted that maybe you were too young to even put it on yourself. However, Emily and Miki were being so nice you let it go. [[Back downstairs|Miki Low Happiness Ending 6]] <<set $humiliation++>>The three of you came back down the stairs. Though you trailed behind the other two. On the way up the stairs you'd felt a little unstable, and the way down seemed even worse. You weren't sure if that was just a consequence of being five or if this was shaky even by those standards. Emily had offered you a helping hand, but it was too embarrassing to even consider taking it. Though it was dangerous, if your hubris meant that you tripped it'd be even worse. This time you safely tottered your way down. Into the focused gaze of the Sophie, Kara, and your mom. It seemed they were all excited to see your new outfit You were the littlest of the group, so you'd be considered cute by default. They had full faith Emily and Miki would embrace and enhance that cuteness. They were not disappointed. Kara squealed at the sight of you, @@.karaVoice;"Soooooo ccccuuuuutttteeee."@@ Sophie was impressed enough that she forgot to tease you, @@.sophieVoice;"Well didn't you end up adorable?"@@ Mom just smiled and sipped at her coffee. You weren't sure how to handle this attention. <<if $oldPlayerAge <= 12>>You'd gotten it from the girls at your last dress-up session, but this felt less like a game and more like a presentation.<<else>>Most of the time you would have loved a bunch of girls calling you 'cute', but not like this.<</if>> <<playerVoice "\"Yes yes, I'm very cute, can I go back to normal now?\"">> Emily shook her head, @@.emilyVoice;"Nuh uh, you know the deal. You've got to spend one whole week this way."@@ @@.mikiVoice;"You gotta come to school with me."@@ Miki added. You winced. You hadn't forgotten about that, but you'd hoped you might be able to get out of it. It wasn't like you'd agreed to that 'deal' anyway. Plus, you were even //younger// than Miki, you wouldn't even be in the same class. <<playerVoice "\"Do I have to?\"">> You tried to ignore how whiny you sounded. [[Mom nodded|Miki Low Happiness Ending 7]] <<set $humiliation++>>\@@.sophieVoice;"Don't worry squirt, it's only a half days for kindergarteners right now."@@ That didn't make you feel any better. Sure it meant less time surrounded by little kids...@@.girlVoice;kids your age@@. But it also implied you were so little you couldn't handle a whole day away from home. Which actually led to the question, how mature were you right now? You hadn't had a chance to really contemplate your current mental state. You'd only been changed for moments before Miki and Emily had dragged you away for dressup. That activity had consumed all of your mental capacity. Perhaps more than your capacity consider how often you'd been distracted. It wasn't even like you were distracted by anything tangible, you'd just sort of @@.girlVoice;lost focus@@. Your head felt like it was filled with @@.girlVoice;cotton candy@@. You suddenly noticed Miki pulling insistently on your hand, @@.mikiVoice;"You don't hafta worry. Imma kindergarten helper so I'll be there too."@@ That did explain some of Miki's eagerness. Though you were surprised she was allowed to help while being so young. Maybe she was some sort of bridge between the older helpers and the really little kids...@@.girlThought;really little kids like me@@, you grimly added. @@.momVoice;"Emily can walk you to school,"@@ your mom added, @@.momVoice;and we'll make sure someone is free to walk you home at lunch. Won't that be nice sweetie?@@ It seemed your mom was really leaning into this one. 'Sweetie'. As if you were //actually// a little girl. But acting bratty about it would be childish, and who knew if it'd make things even worse for you. [[You nodded|Miki Low Happiness Ending 8]] <<set $humiliation++>>\@@.mikiVoice;"Yay!"@@ Miki was practically dancing. It was very difficult to get angry about the situation when she was being that cute. Plus it was only a week, surely it couldn't be that bad. You didn't have to maintain any of those relationships so you could act however you wanted and then discard the whole persona at the end of the week. You just had to grin and bear it, then mom would turn you back and you could forget about this whole insane regression sleepover thing. Which is what you did for the rest of the morning. You had to tolerate all of the cooing and 'so cute's that came from them. Even if all you'd done was @@.girlVoice;clumsily drop something@@ or @@.girlVoice;trip over nothing@@. It was a little humiliating every time, but it seemed that none of the girls had any intention of teasing you for it. You still weren't sure if you were clumsy for a five year old, or five year olds were just clumsy. You'd seen Miki have similar issues, but you weren't sure she was a good comparison point. It felt like your muscles wouldn't obey you properly. You received a fresh round of embarrassment with each parent that showed up. Your presence was brushed off as a cousin staying over for the week. An apparent delight which was met to a chorus of you being 'the cutest little watermelon' they'd ever seen. You smiled and said 'thank you' and prayed for them all to leave. Finally the house had been cleared of all of the visitors. Leaving just you, mom and Emily. It didn't make your current form any less annoying, but at least there were fewer people around to witness it. You took the opportunity to wander upstairs to your room, grumbling about how much focus you had to give to the 'simple' act of climbing tall stairs. [[You got to your room|Miki Low Happiness Ending 9]] <<set $humiliation++>>\You crawled onto your now too tall bed, grunting with exertion. Your bed felt enormous, almost intimidatingly so, but it was familiar and that comforted you. Flopping down on your back, trying to enjoy moment of peace. What had you gotten yourself into? On Friday you'd been a normal 16 year old boy, now you were a five year old Hawaiian girl from a Disney cartoon. You wondered if this was a normal consequence of having witches in the family, or if they were even weird by those standards. Maybe after all this was done you could start a support group for men unjustly transformed into women. You sighed and shifted resting your head on your pillow. The moment you did a wave of sleepiness hit you, glancing over at the clock it was only 7:03PM. It was hours earlier than you'd normally go to bed, but it didn't stop the @@.girlVoice;squeaky yawn@@ that escaped your throat. You were a lot younger now and little kids did have to go to bed early...not that you were a kid...but you were awfully...tired... [[...|Miki Low Happiness Ending 10]]<<set $humiliation to 2>> <<Image 'Endings/MikiLow/Day1.jpg' "topRightCorner">>\ @@.emilyVoice;"Wake up sleepyhead! It's time for school!"@@ Your eyes fluttered open to the sight of Emily's face inches from your own. You gave a small yelp of surprise, much to Emily's amusement. As you tried to sit you felt woozy. Emily was too big, your bed was too big, the whole room was too big. It took you a few more moments to recall that it wasn't that everything else was huge, it was that you were @@.girlVoice;tiny@@. You were practically drowning in blankets. You'd fallen asleep on top of the blankets so someone, likely mom, had tucked you in while you slept. She'd also placed a @@.girlVoice;cute cloth dolly@@ beside you. It seemed too childish, but there was something compelling. You reached out to it, holding it close to you. The @@.girlVoice;relief@@ was immediate, and you cuddled it closer to strengthen the feeling. Childish or not, it was helping, so you wouldn't let it go for now. You were still wearing your @@.girlVoice;cute little watermelon outfit@@, but it'd gotten wrinkly overnight. Emily had you covered. There was a whole outfit laid out at the end of your bed. It was different that your current getup, but it still drove home a certain theme. A white long sleeve with a pink @@.girlVoice;Hello Kitty@@ silhouette with a bow. This was the more restrained of the two piece outfit. The skirt was naturally a bright pink and the rest of it was...a lot. You weren't sure the right term for it but it had three layers and all of them were lacy and fluffy. In case that wasn't enough there was a little pink ribbon just to confirm the girl wearing this was as @@.girlVoice;girly@@ as humanly possible. You had zero doubt this was Emily's choice. If she was getting the chance to dress up her 'big brother' as a kindergarten girl, she was going to take full advantage of it. Inwardly you grumbled, but there wasn't much you could do. You did have to go to school today, and it wasn't like anything you owned would work. It was Emily's new choice, or what you already wore. You current outfit was both crumpled, and equally childish, so you were stuck. Plus mom would probably insist you look good for your 'first day'. Glumly you got yourself dressed, once again denying Emily's offers to assist and headed downstairs. [[Start the day|Miki Low Happiness Ending 11]]<<Image 'Endings/MikiLow/ShoesDay1.webp' "topRightCorner">>\ It seemed that mom was entirely on board with the situation. After breakfast you found that she already had a @@.girlVoice;Hello Kitty@@ backpack ready for you. How her and Emily had acquired this matching outfit and accessory you had no idea. You hadn't been packed a lunch, since it was only a half day, but there was a snack prepared for you. @@.momVoice;"Are you excited for your first day sweetie?"@@ You rolled your eyes, but the warning look you got from mom snapped you to attention. You nodded with feigned enthusiasm, <<playerVoice "\"uh-huh,\"">> you didn't need any more trouble than you already had. @@.momVoice;"Then time to get yourself ready to go."@@ It wasn't much of a surprise when your new shoes were also @@.girlVoice;Hello Kitty themed@@. What turned out to be more of a concern was the laces. It wasn't that you'd forgotten how to tie your shoes, but you were @@.girlVoice;struggling@@ to get your fingers to run through the motions. Finally you managed it, but the knot was both @@.girlVoice;sloppy@@ and loose. Still, better than letting your '@@.girlVoice;mommy@@' tie them for you. [[Walk to school|Miki Low Happiness Ending 12]]Unfortunately this @@.girlVoice;stubbornness@@ came back to bite you when you were only a few steps from the house. @@.emilyVoice;"Stop!"@@ Emily called, before you could even step onto the side-walk, @@.emilyVoice;"your shoes are untied."@@ You looked down in disbelief, but you confirmed Emily's words. Not just one, but both shoes had become untied. You leaned down to fix it, but Emily was faster. She'd knelt down to tie them for you. Looking around you grew increasingly mortified, other people could see this happening. To them it was nothing out of the ordinary. A @@.girlVoice;little girl@@ being helped by her @@.girlVoice;older@@ sister. But in your head you were a sixteen year old who'd just failed to tie their shoes, and now needed an eight year old to help them out. @@.emilyVoice;"There you go,"@@ Emily stood back up, your shoes now properly tied, @@.emilyVoice;"come on, let's go."@@ She offered you a hand to hold but you shook your head. You could walk on your own, you didn't want any anymore childish treatment. A desire that would soon be quashed. [[Your first day at school|Miki Low Happiness Ending 13]] <<set $humiliation+=2>>\It'd been over a decade since you'd attended kindergarten, so your memories of it were pretty hazy. You'd expected it to be designed for children, but you hadn't been prepped for the technicolor assault on your senses. Everything in the room was a @@.girlVoice;bright rainbow@@ of colors, complete with cartoon suns and animals. The chairs looked heavily cushioned and even the floor was a colorful play mat. Everything in here had been crafted to make five year olds as comfortable as possible. Since school was an entirely new thing for them it could be @@.girlVoice;awfully scary@@. This wasn't your first time at school, but you had to admit your nervousness. Last week you'd been dozing in jeans surrounded by teenagers. Now you were @@.girlVoice;holding your sister's hand@@, in pink @@.girlVoice;Hello Kitty@@ sneakers, surrounded by children. //When did I start holding her hand?// Had it just been when you came into the room? As a reflexive response to your nervousness? Or had you been holding it before that? It didn't really matter though, since she was about to leave. @@.emilyVoice;"Now you be good. I'll come take you home at lunch, okay?"@@ You nodded in response, still overwhelmed at the situation. You didn't trust your voice right now, it might betray how @@.girlVoice;scared@@ you were. There was a part of you that just wanted Emily to stay, and you subtly @@.girlVoice;squeezed her hand@@ as she pulled it away. With that she was gone and it was time for class. You looked around for Miki, but it seemed she wasn't here yet. You'd never admit it, you'd @@.girlVoice;feel much better if she were around@@. [[Time for class|Miki Low Happiness Ending 14]] <<set $humiliation++>>Another thing you'd noted when you came in the room was how much of the decor was dedicated to 'educational content'. As much as you could consider the letters of the alphabet or the numbers from one to ten to be educational. You didn't exactly need the days of the week listed on the wall for you to remember them. //Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday...Tues//...you glanced at the wall, //Thursday, Friday...// another glance, //Saturday, Sunday//. See? Easy. You expected the rest of class to be that simple. You were wrong. Since it was only a half day you only had so much time for actual learning. In older grades this would have meant time for only one or two subjects, but here you were still going to push through four separate things. The teacher had called it 'circle rotation', which you didn't properly understand, but figured you'd be able to just follow the other kids. Mercifully the other children seemed more than happy to include you in their group. A few of them were a bit shy about the newcomer, but the more brash among them were quick to start dragging you along. Since this was your first day you weren't expected to actually do any work, and were welcome just to follow along. Initially you weren't concerned about that. It was kindergarten, it wasn't like you would need a day to ramp up to the 'complex' lessons they had. Plus each lesson was no more than 20 minutes. Presumably the teacher didn't believe that the kids could focus for any longer than that. However, you were only an hour in and that confidence was beginning to erode. The initial concerns had crept in during the reading circle. You'd been "reading" along with another student, but if she stopped saying the words out loud, you lost track of things. Alone you weren't sure you could read it at all. But the issue crystallized when you got to the math circle.
