[[Time for Math|Miki Low Happiness Ending 15]] <<set $humiliation++>>\It was subtraction, apparently a mostly new concept. The group worked together trying to solve each question, with the teacher keeping an eye out for struggles. @@.playerVoice2;"What is six minus three?"@@ Your neighbour Ashton read out the next question. From the silence that followed it was clear that no one was confident, even if they thought they knew the answer. @@.playerVoice3;"It's nine?"@@ Kevin offered cautiously. You didn't feel the need to speak up, no point messing with the learning process for the rest of them. Anyways, Kevin @@.girlVoice;had it right@@, it was just for the rest of the group to understand why. @@.playerVoice5;"Nuh uh. That's adding,"@@ Ashley corrected and your heart fell, realizing the truth of her words. How had you got that wrong? You'd done addition and not subtraction. A @@.girlVoice;mistake@@ on something that should be trivial. @@.playerVoice5;"I think it's uh...three?"@@ The teacher had slid in behind you at this point and nodded her assent, bringing a smile to Ashley's face. The rest of the group nodded their agreement, even if they still didn't understand. You wouldn't admit it to yourself, but you were part of that unenlightened group. At least after that it was time for a break. All of you were ushered out onto the playground for a short recess. Even for you it was a welcome change. Everything had been a bit @@.girlVoice;overwhelming@@, so just enjoying some simple sun would be nice. @@.mikiVoice;"<<playerName>>! How are you?"@@ Miki suddenly chirped from behind you. Turns out that this is where she helped out, being an extra set of eyes at recess. [[You turned to Miki|Miki Low Happiness Ending 16]] <<set $humiliation+=2>>\You turned to her, deeply conflicted on what to say. You weren't exactly having a good time, but this was supposed to be a week of you learning a lesson. If you whined and complained all week then mom might think you hadn't learnt anything. Who knew what the consequences of that would be? Another sleepover? Another week in kindergarten? You really didn't want to find out. <<playerVoice "\"I'm okay. Itsa lot to get used to,\"">> hopefully a middle of the road answer would satisfy, but Miki looked concerned. @@.mikiVoice;"It's okay. I'm here for you."@@ she suddenly engulfed you in a hug. You were struck by a sudden whirlwind of emotions. It was a strange reminder of how small you'd become and it felt like an unnecessary comfort meant for a child. On the other hand it did make you @@.girlVoice;feel a lot better@@. You hadn't realized how tense you'd gotten. The day was pretty @@.girlVoice;overwhelming@@ and having a point of stability, even if it was just Miki, was nice. She finally broke the hug, smiling at you, a @@.girlVoice;small grin@@ sneaking onto your own face. Miki took ahold of your hand and lead you over to the rest of the group. A game of tag had broken out which, at Miki's urging, you reluctantly joined. And since Miki was the oldest one they decreed that she should be 'it' for the first round. [[Play tag|Miki Low Happiness Ending 17]] <<set $humiliation-=2>>\Miki wasn't particularly athletic, so many of the kindergarteners were able to evade her, at least for a bit. It quickly turned out that you had @@.girlVoice;no such ability@@. It would be trivial for Miki to catch you if she wanted, but she being nice and avoided targeting you. In traditional elementary school fashion whoever got caught would become 'it'. It was a tremendously unfair situation really. The first one caught would usually be one of the slowest. Which meant it was going to be difficult for them to catch anyone else. Which turned out to be the case. Suzy had been Miki's first catch and now she was struggling to tag anyone else. Once again it seemed that she was avoiding going after you. Likely it was because it would be mean to target the 'new girl'. Suzy was a nice girl, but after a number of failures it was clear that she didn't want to be 'it' anymore. Her chase of you was brief. You'd had a head start, but had @@.girlVoice;stumbled@@ over a 'bumpy patch' of grass. Your @@.girlVoice;clumsiness@@ meant she was able to easily tag you. Which meant it was now your turn to hunt down your new classmates. It went @@.girlVoice;poorly@@, @@.girlVoice;very poorly@@. It seemed like every one of them was @@.girlVoice;faster than you@@. Eventually you managed to get enough of a jump on a daydreaming Zack that you'd be able to get him. Except once again you @@.girlVoice;tripped@@ over a 'bump', missing the tag and crashing into the ground. The fall hadn't hurt much, but you still felt @@.girlVoice;tears@@ stinging at the corner of your eyes. It was so frustrating not being able to catch a bunch of kids. Even if you were the same size as them, you'd thought you'd be able to get at least one. Miki came to your rescue. She came over to check on you. @@.mikiVoice;"You okay?"@@ You did your best to hold back tears, but were already @@.girlVoice;sniffling@@, <<playerVoice "\"I'm fine.\"">> You weren't about to start whining and crying over such a minor fall. Assured that you were okay she 'accidentally' let herself get tagged. Though she helped you back up before she ran off. You were of course safe from Miki as there were no tag backs. [[The game continued|Miki Low Happiness Ending 18]] <<set $humiliation+=2>>\You took your momentary invulnerability to sit on a nearby rock and have a rest. Everyone made the comment that @@.girlVoice;kids your age@@ had boundless energy. You didn't feel that way at all. It seemed that in terms of raw endurance you were on the @@.girlVoice;lower end of the scale@@, the extra weight on your stomach probably didn't help. After a few more moments you were back up and most ready to go...just in time for the bell to go off and be forced back into class. The second half of the morning was no better for you. Art had never been your strong suit and trying it with a fraction of your normal coordination seemed like a recipe for disaster, so you contented yourself with just watching. A trend you continued into the writing circle. You'd been all ready to write something that would blow everyone else away, but a few words in you realized it wasn't going to happen. You @@.girlVoice;couldn't remember@@ whether you were supposed to use 't' or 'T' for 'the'. You weren't even sure if you'd spelt the first couple words right, and they certainly hadn't stayed properly on the line. @@.girlVoice;Sheepishly@@ you tried to hide your @@.girlVoice;botched attempt@@ and pretend you were just watching. This seemed to work, but as the circle ended you realized that the teacher had spotted your paper and was reviewing it. Meeting your eye she just gave you a gentle smile. If she had any comments or critiques she would get to them another day, right now was just about getting you settled. [[Continue the day|Miki Low Happiness Ending 19]] <<set $humiliation+=2>>\<<Image 'Endings/MikiLow/ShoesDay2.webp' "topRightCorner">>\ Mercifully the rest of the day was passive enough. Being read a story, a little playing around and then it was time to pack up. Emily was already waiting for you when you exited. @@.emilyVoice;"How'd it go?"@@ She questioned, after the two of you had gotten some distance from the school. You mumbled something vague about it being @@.girlVoice;overwhelming@@ and she was gracious enough to accept it. On your part you just wanted to get home as quickly as possible and forget all about the day. Until it came you were going to do your best to ignore that tomorrow even existed. Mom of course had more questions at dinner, but you were able to give enough non-committal to satisfy her for the moment. The evening was depressingly short, since you were @@.girlVoice;out cold by 7:30@@. At least tonight you'd been concious enough to get yourself under the blankets, even if mom had insisted on tucking you in. You'd kept the @@.girlVoice;dolly@@ with as she did, it having travelled with you all day. Though you tried to keep it hidden under the blanket, she didn't need to know you @@.girlVoice;needed a dolly@@ to sleep. ... Seemingly only moments later you were looking up at Emily's smiling face. @@.emilyVoice;"Wakey wakey. Time for school."@@ You groaned but acquiesced, following the same routine you had the day before. Getting put in overly cutesy clothes, mom making you a snack, Emily urging you to hurry up. It was still somewhat discombobulating but you were aware enough to notice the subtle change in your shoes. There were still laces on the bottom half of the shoe, but they were mostly decorative. What actually held it in place was a simple velcro strip. Simple enough that you managed to do it on your own. But how to feel about it? Proud that you got your shoes on @@.girlVoice;all by yourself@@? Or mortified that velcro was the best you could do? Tough decision. [[Day 2|Miki Low Happiness Ending 20]] <<set $humiliation to 3>>\<<set $timeRemaining to 20>>\ <<set $flowerCount to 0>>\ <<set $previousFlower to 0>>\ <<set $flowerQuality to 0>>\ <<set $flowerColors to ['red', 'blue', 'yellow', 'purple', 'pink', 'orange']>>\ Day two started much the same as the first day. A little music, a small stretching activity and a little story. Then it was time for circles, which is where your real nightmare began. First was art, and this time you couldn't just sit and watch. The task was simple enough, draw three flowers. It was left to your creativity about the kind of flower and they were allowed to all be the same. Most it seemed were going with the classic, vaguely daisy looking flower, though even some of those were already devolving into just being colored circles. You had twenty minutes to complete the task. What did you want to draw first? <<include "Miki Low Happiness Drawing Flower Fragment">><<silently>> <<switch $previousFlower>> <<case 1>> <<set $humiliation+=2>> <<set $timeRemaining-=8>> <<case 2>> <<set $humiliation++>> <<set $timeRemaining-=6>> <<set $flowerQuality++>> <<case 3>> <<set $humiliation++>> <<set $timeRemaining-=8>> <<set $flowerQuality+=2>> <<case 4>> <<set $timeRemaining-=4>> <</switch>> <</silently>>\ <<if $timeRemaining < 0>>\ @@.mikiMomVoice;"Time's up!"@@ The teacher called. Panic rose in your chest, your last flower wasn't done yet. You hurriedly tried to scribble something onto the page, but apparently the teacher had decided to check your work first. So you were left with only two flowers. [[Brace for her response|Miki Low Happiness Ending 22]] <<else>>\ <<set $flowerCount++>>\ <<if $flowerCount === 3>>\ You put your crayons down. Three flowers done and dusted. <<if $timeRemaining > 0>>Even with some time to spare. You took the spare time to look at the other student's work. It was a mixed bag. A few were similar to yours, while others were clearly better. <<else>>You weren't sure if you were really happy with your work, but you had tried.<</if>> You consoled yourself, art had never been your best subject. It was to be expected that you wouldn't have done a fantastic job. @@.mikiMomVoice;"Time's up!"@@ The teacher called. Nothing to do now but wait for her review of your work. [[Wait|Miki Low Happiness Ending 22]] <<else>>\ <<switch $previousFlower>>\ <<case 1>>\ You wanted something with a little more nuance so you decided to draw a rose. At first it went alright, you had a vague shape, but you didn't know what to do next. It needed something to detail it so it'd look like more than a blob, but the more you tried the more it just looked like a scribble. Eventually you grew too frustrated with it and gave up, a scribble would be good enough. <<case 2>>\ Following the crowd you decided to go with a simple daisy, a <<print $flowerColors.random()>> one. Working away at it diligently you were able to produce something that was at least tolerable. It wasn't pretty but it was definitely a flower. <<case 3>>\ You didn't quite want to follow the trend, but you didn't want to do something too complex. A sunflower would stand out without taxing you too badly. In the end it came out alright, though it had taken longer than you expected. <<case 4>>\ You thought the whole task was silly, but you weren't actually confident in your skills, so you went with something simple. A <<print $flowerColors.random()>> blob with a black dot in the middle. It was a disappointing attempt, but it had at least been done quickly. <</switch>>\ You have drawn $flowerCount flower<<if $flowerCount > 1>>s<</if>>. You have $timeRemaining minutes left. <<include "Miki Low Happiness Drawing Flower Fragment">> <</if>>\ <</if>>\What will you draw? [[Draw a Circle|Miki Low Happiness Ending 21][$previousFlower to 4]] [[Draw a Daisy|Miki Low Happiness Ending 21][$previousFlower to 2]] [[Draw a Sunflower|Miki Low Happiness Ending 21][$previousFlower to 3]] [[Draw a Rose|Miki Low Happiness Ending 21][$previousFlower to 1]]With the circle over the teacher took a chance to look at everyone's work. You felt a shocking amount of trepidation when she looked at yours first. <<if $flowerCount < 3>>\ @@.mikiMomVoice;"I see you worked very hard on this sweetie. But you were supposed to draw three flowers, this is only two. See? One, two,"@@ she pointed at the flowers while counting on her fingers, @@.mikiMomVoice;"and then you add one more,"@@ she held up a third finger, @@.mikiMomVoice;"and how many would that be?"@@ You were so ready to defend yourself that you didn't immediately answer the question. Glancing back to her extended fingers to make sure you had understood. One, two, three...<<playerVoice "\"Three,\"">> you stated with all the surety you could muster. @@.mikiMomVoice;"Very good!"@@ she trilled. You tried to ignore the @@.girlVoice;excitement bubbling up@@ in you. @@.mikiMomVoice;"Next time we'll count together and you'll draw lots of pretty flowers. Ok?"@@ You dumbly nodded. Why was she not admonishing you for your failure? You hadn't finished the task. Was counting to three enough to satisfy her? You didn't understand, but it was time for the next circle. <<set $humiliation++>>\ <<elseif $flowerQuality < 2>>\ The teacher didn't fully mask the concerned frown that crossed her face. Was she disappointed? You knew the flowers weren't the best, but you had tried and that would be enough right? You braced yourself for the lecture you usually received on lacklustre work like this. @@.mikiMomVoice;"I see you worked very hard on these. Next time we draw, I want to draw with you, would that be ok?"@@ You were dumbfounded, she spoke like she wasn't mad at all. Like it was fine you'd done a poor job. So you nodded back to her, only realizing her intentions after she'd already moved to the next student. She wanted to 'draw' with you because she thought you couldn't do it on your own and needed help. You bristled at the implication, but looking at your 'art', you couldn't say she was wrong. <<set $humiliation++>>\ <<else>>\ @@.mikiMomVoice;"Very good! These are very pretty <<playerName>>. You did a very good job."@@ The teacher smiled and moved onto the next student. You breathed a sigh of relief. One activity successfully done. Three to go. <</if>>\ [[Time for Math|Miki Low Happiness Ending 23]]You were concerned about the Math circle. It had been your speciality before, but you weren't working with that mind anymore. Initially you tried to just stay quiet and let the other students answer. But Suzy, wanting to be inclusive, made sure that you got a turn as well. @@.playerVoice6;"What's..."@@ she took a moment to peer at the numbers, @@.playerVoice6;"seven,"@@ she was still hesitant, @@.playerVoice6;"minus two."@@ She had finished strong, but now you had to provide an answer. You knew this one. It was the almost the same as the question yesterday, Ashley had even explained it. You glanced around the group, a few eager faces waiting for an answer, while a few more just looked bored. Underneath the table you tried to @@.girlVoice;count things on your fingers@@, but since you couldn't see them it @@.girlVoice;didn't really work@@. You took one last look at the seven butterflies that accompanied the question on the worksheet. You took a breath. [["Nine"|Miki Low Happiness Ending 24][$mathMistake to 1]] [["Three"|Miki Low Happiness Ending 24][$mathMistake to 2]] [["Four"|Miki Low Happiness Ending 24][$mathMistake to 3]]Suzy made a face, it was clear that she thought you were wrong, but wasn't confident enough to come out and say it. @@.mikiMomVoice;"That was a good try,"@@ the teacher's voice suddenly rang out behind you. It was very gentle, but you could almost hear the incoming lecture. @@.mikiMomVoice;"What do you think it is Suzy?"@@ You could see that she was tempted to just go with your answer rather than putting forward her own attempt, but she found her courage. @@.playerVoice6;"five...I think."@@ @@.mikiMomVoice;"That's correct. Very good Suzy. And how did you get that answer?"@@ Suzy was glowing at the praise, enough that she launched right into her explanation, @@.playerVoice6;"Well if you have seven,"@@ she held up six fingers. Five on one hand, and one on the other, before hurriedly adding a second on her other hand. @@.playerVoice6;"And then you have two,"@@ she drew focus to her hand with two fingers. @@.playerVoice6;"So if you take away two,"@@ she put down two fingers, @@.playerVoice6;"then you have five left."@@ A confused look flashed across your face. She'd just said a whole lot of numbers in a row and you @@.girlVoice;weren't quite sure@@ how they all fit together. @@.mikiMomVoice;"An excellent explanation Suzy."@@ the teacher's continued compliment had Suzy beaming, @@.mikiMomVoice;"if you all work together I'm sure you will learn this in no time."@@ You were still trying to figure out where you had gone wrong.\ <<switch $mathMistake>> <<case 1>>\ You realized it was because you'd made the same mistake you made yesterday. That was a 'minus' and you'd done addition. You @@.girlVoice;flushed@@ at the fact you'd made the same @@.girlVoice;simple mistake@@ twice in a row. Running the question through your head to try and hammer home the difference. <<case 2>>\ You realized it was because you gave the exact same answer Ashley had yesterday. You'd remembered that was the right answer to a 'minus' question and had just parroted it. You @@.girlVoice;weren't understanding@@ the actual mechanism that had got her to that answer. <<case 3>>\ In truth it wasn't that you'd gone wrong anywhere. You'd had @@.girlVoice;no idea what the answer was@@ and just threw something out there. You were pretty sure it couldn't be 2 or 7 so you'd thought you had a good chance. <</switch>>\ @@.mikiMomVoice;"Time for recess,"@@ the teacher's voice broke your reverie and relief washed over you. Recess, you could do that, it wasn't full of hard questions. [[Time for recess|Miki Low Happiness Ending 25]] <<set $humiliation+=2>>\Unfortunately recess wasn't the relaxation that you'd hoped for. Today it was 'Red Light, Green Light'. The game was a little more complicated than tag, but you were sure you still had the rules well in hand. Plus this one didn't require you to be more physically adept than your classmates, you just had to be patient and react quickly. You weren't able to manage either. Once you'd made even a little progress you got @@.girlVoice;excited@@. Which meant that you tried to go as fast as possible at the first opportunity. After the embarrassment of yesterday you really wanted to win. But that meant you had way too much momentum to stop when 'Red Light' got called. Once, when Mark was feeling particularly clever he'd managed to trick you into moving while he was staring at you. He'd called 'Red Light' and turned to look at you all, catching out a couple, but you'd managed to stop. But then he called out 'Red Light' //again// without turning around. You'd run half a dozen steps before you processed what had happened. You weren't the only one to get caught, but that didn't make it feel any better. By the time recess was over you were even more on edge than before. You'd never even come close to winning, even when Miki started giving you hints by watching from the other side. You were just so @@.girlVoice;frustrated@@, you were stuck in this stupid body that couldn't do anything right. You'd been capable of so much more only a few days ago, but now you were basically helpless. Worse still, the day wasn't even over. <<set $humiliation+=2>>\ <<if $humiliation >= 10>>\ [[You couldn't take it anymore|Miki Low Happiness Embarrassment Break]] <<else>>\ [[Back to class|Miki Low Happiness Ending 26]] <</if>>\It was time for the reading circle. Yesterday you'd mostly managed to just glide along under the radar, but today you were going to have to actually pick something to serious read. There was a staggering number options, but they had been separated into three categories. 'Cool': Which had a series of picture books. 'Warm': Which had books with fewer pictures and more words. 'Hot': Which had long books with only a couple pictures. The other students had already picked their books. Most of them had taken something from the 'Cool' or 'Warm' pile, but a couple had grabbed something from 'Hot'. Your memory wasn't perfect but you were pretty sure all the 'Hot' students had the same books yesterday. Maybe that made sense. The books were too long to be read in twenty minutes, so they had to take multiple days. But what did you want to read? [['Cool': The Dot|Miki Low Happiness Ending 27a]] [['Warm': Good Night, Good Knight|Miki Low Happiness Ending 27b]] [['Hot': Dora Fantasmagory|Miki Low Happiness Ending 27c]]You let your concerns get the better of you and picked the simplest thing that you could find. Lots of other kids were taking books just like it, so it wasn't like you were going to stand out. You settled in a nearby beanbag chair and got to reading. Well perhaps "reading" was a generous way to refer to it, 90% of each page was taken up by the pictures. They were very @@.girlVoice;pretty pictures@@. As you continued you found it was easier to @@.girlVoice;follow the pictures@@ than the accompanying text. The text was @@.girlVoice;boring@@ and @@.girlVoice;complicated@@. The book was all about art anyway, so shouldn't you just look at pictures? It turned out that you were taking a little too long staring at the pictures, because the teacher said that reading time was over and you had to move on. You were disappointed, you'd wanted to finish that book. It was thirty pages and you'd made it over half way! Maybe you could continue tomorrow? Assuming you came back again. [[The last lesson|Miki Low Happiness Ending 28]]You decided to follow the smaller, but still significant group, taking what appeared to be the middle option. You still had some amount of pride, you weren't some baby who could only read picture books. Though once you really dove into the book you had revise your opinion. This book was still about 50% pictures, but still there was a lot more text than anything would have in the 'Cool' section. On the cover were three @@.girlVoice;cute@@ little dragons in pyjamas and a man in metal with a horse peering at them. You had @@.girlVoice;little idea@@ what it could be about. It was called 'Good Night, Good Knight'. Knight. The word was unfamiliar. You tried to sound it out. <<playerVoice "\"K-nai-t\"">> You knew the word "night" so you'd just said it with a 'k' in front. It hadn't helped, you still didn't know the word. How could you not know a word this small? You should know @@.girlVoice;big kid@@ words. @@.mikiMomVoice;"Very good!"@@ The teacher called out from behind you. //How is she always there?// @@.mikiMomVoice;"That is exactly how it looks like it should sound."@@ @@.girlThought;Looks like it should sound? Didn't words always do that?@@ @@.mikiMomVoice;"Knight is a very hard word because the 'K' is silent."@@ [[Silent?|Miki Low Happiness Ending 27b 2]]<<playerVoice "\"Silent?\"">> @@.mikiMomVoice;"That's right,"@@ she made it sound like you'd uncovered some great secret, @@.mikiMomVoice;"you don't say the 'K' at all. And if you don't have to say the 'K' what would it sound like?"@@ You looked back to the word, <<playerVoice "\"K--\"">> no that was silent, you had to skip it...which meant...<<playerVoice "\"nai-t...night!\"">> @@.mikiMomVoice;"Very good!"@@ The teacher clapped her hands, @@.mikiMomVoice;"now do you know who the knight is?"@@ She pointed at the word "knight" to ensure you knew what she was referring to. This was easy, you hoped. You knew the dragons were dragons, and the horse was a horse, and the trees were trees. Hesitantly you pointed at the man in armor, the knight(?). @@.mikiMomVoice;"You're doing so well!"@@ She once again cheered. Emboldened you took one last look at the title, understanding dawning on you. <<playerVoice "\"It's good nai-t, good nai-t!\"">> You shouted, the teacher pausing at your exultation, but not saying anything. <<playerVoice "\"Good nai-t,\"">> you pointed to the dark night sky. <<playerVoice "\"Good nai-t,\"">> you pointed to the knight. You carefully enunciated each word, to make sure she understood. Even though the words sounded the same, they actually meant //different// things. @@.mikiMomVoice;"It is,"@@ the teacher spoke gravely. To you it confirmed that you'd realized something and only your explanation had made her realize it. @@.mikiMomVoice;"Oh that's wonderful,"@@ she continued, @@.mikiMomVoice;"those are very hard words to understand."@@ Your grin just kept getting wider. @@.mikiMomVoice;"I see you're working very hard with your book, I'm very impressed."@@ You puffed your chest out. @@.mikiMomVoice;"you'll have to show me any other hard words, okay?"@@ You nodded eagerly, looking back to your book for more great mysteries you could solve. [[You continued to read|Miki Low Happiness Ending 27b 3]]Things went downhill from there. The title was only three different words, and the teacher had helped you with one of them. The rest of the book had //a lot// of words, a ton of which you didn't recognize. The pictures helped you enough that you could mostly get the gist of what was happening, but the details eluded you. 'Dense', 'kingdom', 'faraway', what did these words mean? You could understand "far away", but what was "faraway"? To make your life easier you starting skipping @@.girlVoice;hard words@@ entirely. Furthermore you'd realized how silly your earlier success was. You'd managed to pronounce one word correctly, after assistance. The teacher had known the whole time. She was just patronizing you. Maybe an actual five year old would consider it real praise, but to you it was galling. Frustrated you tried to continue pushing through the book, each new unfamiliar word slowing you down, and sapping your enthusiasm to continue. You glanced over at the 'Cool' table, regretting your choice, those books looked a lot shorter. The one was ''fifty'' pages, even if you just looked at pictures that felt @@.girlVoice;near impossible@@. You let your eyes drift to see what everyone else was reading. This actually went on for several minutes before the teacher called for the end of the activity. Looking down you realized how little progress you'd made. You could see that more pages were on the "unread" side of the book than the "read" side. Which meant...You changed tact, page...eighteen. And there were fifty pages so... You abandoned the @@.girlVoice;frustrating@@ math and @@.girlVoice;even more frustrating@@ book. You hadn't been able to keep attention on a book even for twenty minutes and you'd @@.girlVoice;lost focus@@. You'd read books that were //hundreds// of pages before. Now you were stuck at eighteen and you were almost sure that eighteen was less than hundreds. <<set $humiliation++>>\ <<if $humiliation >= 10>>\ [[You couldn't take it anymore|Miki Low Happiness Embarrassment Break]] <<else>>\ [[The last lesson|Miki Low Happiness Ending 28]] <</if>>\You weren't about to let yourself get scared off by a book having 'too many words'. Books were supposed to have lots of words and you were going to read a proper one. You didn't actually know what a 'Fantasmagory' was, you didn't even know how to say the word, but it sounded interesting so you picked it up. This turned out to be a disaster. There were just @@.girlVoice;so many words@@ and you kept coming across ones you didn't know. At first the pictures were enough to keep you on track. The main character was a little girl named Dora. She was six and if you'd read the first chapter title right, "Such a Baby", then all those word bubbles were probably making fun of her for being a baby. This was difficult enough to follow, but after some deep thought you realized that five was less than six, so you were @@.girlVoice;even younger@@ than her. If Dora was a baby, what were you? The bigger problem was what happened next, which is to say a confusing jumble of things. You'd underestimated the number of words this book had and the amount of characters it expected you to follow. Part way through the first chapter there were Dora, and her two siblings and a @@.girlVoice;scary monster@@. It kept having the word "Mary" with pictures of the monster so you figured that must be the monsters name. @@.girlThought;That's a weird name for a monster...maybe Mary is actually the sister?@@ You'd made it all the way to page twelve, fooling yourself into thinking you understood things. But then things reached a breaking point. Theyy started adding even more monsters, each one with a different name and sometimes the pictures weren't any help. Some of them made sense, the "Toilet Monster" had a picture of a toilet beside it. But what was a "Ketchup Monster"? What was a "Living Room"? You knew each of the words individually, but the picture showed the monster on a couch...was a "living room" a fancy word for couch? How was any of this supposed to help you understand the @@.girlVoice;complicated words@@? Eventually you simply closed the book with a frustrated huff. You didn't want to @@.girlVoice;read dumb books@@ for kids anyway, you had better things to do. Though all you had at the moment was to wait the @@.girlVoice;eternity@@ until the end of the activity. When it finally came you were eager to move on and get this day over with. <<set $humiliation+=2>>\ <<if $humiliation >= 10>>\ [[You couldn't take it anymore|Miki Low Happiness Embarrassment Break]] <<else>>\ [[The last lesson|Miki Low Happiness Ending 28]] <</if>>\The last activity proved to be your breaking point. Just like yesterday it was a 'simple' writing task. You just had to write what you were going to do on the weekend and draw an accompanying picture. This proved to be nearly impossible. To start with you were in a somewhat complicated situation. It made it @@.girlVoice;difficult to comprehend@@ what exactly the weekend would bring. Even when you tried to default to something simple, 'I am going to the shopping mall.' It didn't work. You stared down at your attempt: <section class="paper paper--postActivity">\ <div class="papertext">\ <span class="journal7">iM a. <span style="letter-spacing: -4px;">soqaLL</span></span> </div>\ </section>\ Even knowing what you were trying to write you @@.girlVoice;couldn't understand what you were supposed to do@@. You couldn't get the words out of your head onto the page, you just @@.girlVoice;didn't understand how writing worked@@. So you'd ended up with this random jumble of letters. Looking around you were hardly the only one struggling, a few classmates hadn't even tried to write anything, just focusing on their picture. On the other hand you read one which said 'I am garben with mommy I like garben Flower is prety'. It was still somewhat broken, but you were actually able to almost understand it. You hadn't even come close to that. No one would be able to make heads or tails of your uneven chicken scratch. [[You couldn't take it anymore|Miki Low Happiness Embarrassment Break]] <<set $humiliation to 10>>\All of this had been entirely too much. Having all these kiddie activities thrown at you, ones you should be able to cruise through without even a thought. Instead you were failing at them! Repeatedly! It seemed like over half the class had been better than you at everything you'd tried. You wouldn't say you were the dumbest kid in the room, but you'd be in the running. @@.girlThought;It's not fair!@@ Why had Miki wanted you like this? Why had mom turned you into this? Why was everybody being so mean to you? You'd only misbehaved a little at a @@.girlVoice;stupid@@ sleepover for little girls. You didn't deserve any of this! This time you weren't able to @@.girlVoice;hold back the tears@@, and that was just the start of it. @@.girlVoice;Tears@@ beget @@.girlVoice;sniffling@@ and once you were @@.girlVoice;crying and snotty@@ you felt even more humiliated about the situation. Here you were a @@.girlVoice;five year old girl@@, not able to handle even a @@.girlVoice;half day@@ of kindergarten. The thought made you @@.girlVoice;feel even worse@@ and you started @@.girlVoice;wailing@@. What ensued was either a @@.girlVoice;temper tantrum@@ or a @@.girlVoice;meltdown@@ depending on your perspective. Regardless the teacher hadn't been able to @@.girlVoice;calm you down@@, even when she'd taken you out of the classroom. In the end they'd called your mom to come and pick you up a little early. The teacher explained the whole situation when she arrived. She apologized to them for your behaviour, but the teacher shook her head. After that the two of them launched into a somewhat heated conversation. You weren't close enough to be privy to the words themselves, but from the tone your teacher was concerned about something. When it was over you mom had a strange look on her face. She didn't look angry, it wasn't even disappointment. Your best guess was that now mom shared whatever concern the teacher had. [[Go home|Miki Low Happiness Ending 29]]You didn't speak the whole way home. Your mom made a few attempts to get you to open up but you rebuffed her. Once you got home you marched up into your room and @@.girlVoice;slammed the door@@. Or at least @@.girlVoice;as much as a five year old could@@ slam a heavy wooden door. @@.girlVoice;Collapsing onto your bed@@ you felt the @@.girlVoice;tears returning@@. But you'd lost the fiery anger you'd had before. There was no yelling and wailing this time, you were simply there on your bed @@.girlVoice;sobbing and sniffling@@. When there was a knock on the door you reflexively told them to <<playerVoice "\"Go away!\"">> Without even giving them a chance to speak. You even tossed your stuffed doll at the door to drive home your point. Though you regretted that decision immediately, it'd been the @@.girlVoice;only thing comforting you@@. This only made you feel worse, because you realized you'd become reliant on @@.girlVoice;having your dolly@@. But your door didn't have a lock, so it swung open. Your mom stood in the doorway, Emily and Miki trailing behind her, the girls looked like they'd been crying a little too. Miki didn't even give your mom a chance to speak before she was running across the room. You'd sat up to look at them only to find yourself tackled back onto the bed in a hug. @@.mikiVoice;"I'm sorry,"@@ Miki was crying, @@.mikiVoice;"I didn't...want...to make...you sad."@@ Her words were interspersed with sniffles and hitched breaths. It wasn't exactly solving the issue, but knowing that Miki felt so bad did make you feel a little better. Mom explained, @@.momVoice;"your teacher explained the situation and I also have to apologize. I hadn't considered how frustrating the situation could potentially be."@@ <<playerVoice "\"It's not fair! I'm dumb and slow and weak and stupid...\"">> [[Miki's crying suddenly redoubled|Miki Low Happiness Ending 30]]You winced, you hadn't meant to make her feel even worse about this. No doubt she was already berating herself about her decision. @@.girlThought;Good. She should feel bad.@@ The bitter thought tempted you, but you fought to keep control. Mom continued, @@.momVoice;"which is exactly the way that Miki felt."@@ The words hit hard. Casting a glance at Emily you could see that she was crying as well. The whole situation crystallized in your mind. Miki was the youngest in the group. At that age every year brought dramatic changes. Miki was less mature, both mentally and physically. The girls would have a natural edge on her physically, and the one girl who should be close to her mentally, Kara, was ridiculously gifted. Merely being around an @@.girlVoice;athlete@@ like Sophie, a @@.girlVoice;genius@@ like Kara and a literal witch like Emily was bound to make her feel inadequate. You tried to keep your voice gentle despite your emotional turmoil, <<playerVoice "\"and she wanted me to feel that way instead.\"">> @@.mikiVoice;"No! I just didn't wanna feel dumb..."@@ At this point Emily crossed the floor throwing both of you into a hug. @@.emilyVoice;"I'm so sorry Miki. I didn't know."@@ There was a catharsis in that moment. No one had any malice to anyone else, no one was //trying// to be cruel. Insensitivity from all sides had caused unnecessary and unintended pain. You couldn't even hold yourself innocent on that point, not after the sleepover. It wasn't that Miki wanted you to get frustrated or be made fun of...okay maybe a little...but mostly she just wanted the burden shifted off of her. [[Mom coughed|Miki Low Happiness Ending 31]]@@.momVoice;"I have a solution,"@@ all three of you looked at her, @@.momVoice;"I think <<playerName>> should finish out the week in this form. That was the punishment after all."@@ You opened your mouth to protest, but she held up a finger cautioning you to wait, @@.momVoice;"but. It isn't fair to leave things like this."@@ She held up a vial pulled from an unknown pocket. @@.momVoice;"We'll use this. I'll extract <<playerName>>'s memories of everything after age 5 and store them in here. That way you won't be frustrated by what you think you should be able to accomplish."@@ She moved over to the bed and held your hand, @@.momVoice;"Your teacher tells me that you're doing perfectly fine for someone your age. But you can't see that, because you're comparing yourself to someone a decade older. With this you'll be able to spend the week still learning about Miki and Emily's world, but without all that baggage. Does that seem fair?"@@ It didn't seem fair, you just wanted to go back to normal. But looking at Emily and Miki's red faces and puffy eyes it felt like a betrayal to not finish the week. If you didn't have to remember being older it should make everything more tolerable. It wasn't like the activities had been entirely unpleasant, you'd just been constantly burdened by the knowledge of how far you'd 'fallen'. So you nodded, still @@.girlVoice;sniffling@@. Mom unstoppered the vial and held it up beside your face. Before you could ask what she was doing one of the remaining tears fell out of your eye and into the vial. There was a moment of blackness and you felt something tugging at your mind, but then it was over. Mom was stoppering the vial full of an unknown clear sparkly liquid and squirreling it away back into it's secret pocket. @@.momVoice;"How are you feeling?"@@ [[Everyone waited on your answer|Miki Low Happiness Ending 32]]How were you feeling? It was an excellent question. It took you a few moments to terms with the sudden shift in your memories. You knew consciously that mom had taken a huge chunk, but you couldn't actually feel the loss. You couldn't remember the things you didn't remember, so to you, you couldn't remember losing anything. The change retroactively made your recent behaviour very odd. It wasn't surprising that you'd been on edge, it was an entirely new school, new teacher, new classmates. But everyone had been so friendly, and the teacher was so nice, and the activities were kinda fun... It was your poor performance that had bothered you. But now it didn't seem like anything worth having a meltdown about. You hadn't been doing great, but there were other students at about your level, lots in fact. You didn't need to be the smartest girl in the room to be happy. As long as you weren't //too// far behind you could still having fun. <<playerVoice "\"I feel...better,\"">> you finally offered. This brought a smile to the faces of the two girls still half attached to you. Their pleasure resulting in a renewed hugging session from the group. What transpired from there was a much more collaborative plan for the next few days. How to make sure that you had the support you would need. It wasn't like you were going to have the time to learn anything, but Emily and mom would help get you through the lessons a bit smoother. Miki would also keep a better eye on you during recess to make sure that you weren't struggling unnecessarily. On the other side Emily swore that she'd make sure Miki never ever ever felt inferior again. She'd relay this entire story to Sophie and Kara, to make sure that they were all more sensitive to Miki's feelings. Mom assured you that if the issue was other students, she'd be sure to talk to Miki's mom, and the school if required. And if that didn't solve anything, then a few hours spent as a toad was a very effective method of correcting the behaviour of wayward children. From the smile she gave you weren't entirely sure if she was kidding or not. When you fell asleep that night, your @@.girlVoice;dolly clutched to your chest@@, at the @@.girlVoice;incredibly late@@ hour of 8pm, you were actually @@.girlVoice;a little excited@@ for what tomorrow might bring. [[The next day|Miki Low Happiness Ending 33]]You were right to have been excited. When you woke you practically jumped out of bed, well before Emily came to wake up. You even gave your own input on your outfit for the morning. The newest outfit went great with your @@.girlVoice;cute little Hello Kitty sneakers@@. Sneakers which you were able to put on @@.girlVoice;all by yourself@@. Mommy said that was very impressed and said that one day you'd even be able to have full laces. You smiled and thanked her, @@.girlVoice;taking Emily's hand@@ as she walked you to school. The teacher was keeping an eye on you as the day started out, being even more gentle with you than usual. She wanted to ensure that you felt as comfortable as possible. But you didn't really have any worries today, you'd @@.girlVoice;brought your dolly@@ in case you got stressed. Though the lessons themselves didn't go any better than before. @@.girlVoice;Reading was hard@@, though you did @@.girlVoice;enjoy your picture book@@. @@.girlVoice;Writing was worse@@, but you still got to @@.girlVoice;draw a pretty picture@@. The post recess lessons went much the same. @@.girlVoice;Math was super hard@@, but everyone made mistakes so you were all there to help each other. You also got to learn lots about the different parts of the body, even if you'd @@.girlVoice;forgotten most of the words already@@. You could just @@.girlVoice;go with the flow@@. All in all you'd actually enjoyed yourself in circles, and those lessons had been the worst part of the day. The teacher had read you an @@.girlVoice;amazing story@@, you all got to have fun @@.girlVoice;singing and dancing@@ and at recess you got to draw with chalk and @@.girlVoice;play hopscotch@@. You kept making mistakes with the counting, but it was still @@.girlVoice;lots of fun@@. By the time Emily came to pick you up you didn't want to go. She promised you that you'd get to come back and see all your friends tomorrow, so you relented and walked home without any further fuss. [[The week continued|Miki Low Happiness Ending 34]]The rest of the week continued much the same. The lessons and games changed, but you were still having @@.girlVoice;so much fun@@, undeterred by your many setbacks and failures. It was actually a little surprising how much variance there was to everything. What you hadn't noticed is that they were actually all teaching the same lesson. Counting with apples was actually the same as counting with marbles was actually the same as counting with cartoon dolphins. But to you it felt like something entirely new each time, not noticing that your counting was improving day by day. Walking home on Friday you were @@.girlVoice;gushing@@ to Emily about all the things that you were going to do next week. It was only at dinner that mom reminded you that next week wouldn't be the same. @@.momVoice;"You've been very good this week <<playerName>>,"@@ she offered you the sparkling vial of your memories, @@.momVoice;"you remember what this is right?"@@ You nodded in response and took the vial. @@.momVoice;"When you're ready just take it to your room. If you drink it it'll give you back your memories and turn you back into a sixteen year old boy."@@ You nodded again, fiddling with the vial all through dinner. Your preoccupation meant your food had gotten cold, having barely been touched. Not wanting cold peas, you excused yourself. [[Up to your room|Miki Low Happiness Ending 35]]You sat down on your @@.girlVoice;too tall@@ bed, @@.girlVoice;smoothing out your skirt@@ once you'd settled. You held the vial in front of you, peering closely at it. The liquid was @@.girlVoice;very very pretty@@ and @@.girlVoice;sparkly@@, but that wasn't the important part. You knew it was supposed to contain your old memories, but you didn't actually know what those were. You'd got some hints of your old life from mom and Emily, but otherwise it was almost entirely a mystery. Popping the cork you sniffed at the liquid. The scent was entirely unfamiliar. You decided that it was an entirely unique 'memory smell'. In truth it's scent was close to Rosemary, but at five you hadn't smelled Rosemary, at least not that you remembered. Delaying your change, you swirled it around, watching the way that it sparkled as it caught the light. A specific glint triggered something in your mind. Mom said that if you drank it, then you'd go back to the old you. But the only memories you had of the 'old you' was from the first two days of this week, and that person had been miserable. What kind of life could it have been if you'd been willing to give up all those memories? You'd never let anyone take your memories of the last three days. And that was only a handful of days. Was this vial full of years and years of misery. [[Consider your options|Miki Low Happiness Ending 36]]<<set $playerMaturity to 16>>\ As you continued to swirl the vial you dimly realized that your mind seemed to be sharper. Mom would have made sure you had all of your faculties before making a decision like this. //Decision? Was this supposed to be a decision?// The obvious thing was to drink it and turn back, mommy had said you should...no...she hadn't. She'd said ''if'' you drank it you'd go back. Did that mean you didn't have to? As you considered the first half of the week. All the misery. Embarrassment at every mistake, berating yourself even long after the situation had passed. It had been an extreme example but you felt your 'old life' wasn't much different. Endlessly worrying you'd do something wrong, or say something stupid, a constant weight on your mind. The back half of the week, in contrast, had been a joy. You'd made endless math mistakes, tripped over your own feet, and couldn't write anything...and you just @@.girlVoice;giggled@@ your way through it. Little embarrassments passed through your mind with nary a trace, accepting them and then moving onto the next thing. Why linger on an error when you could try again, maybe you'd do it right that time. Every success was a @@.girlVoice;joy@@, even if it was just successfully counting a handful of butterflies. You tilted the vial, the liquid coming to the edge of the lip, threatening to spill out. If you tilted a little further all those miserable memories would be gone for good, the old you would be gone. You'd get to live this life forever. Is that what you wanted? [[Drink the vial|Miki Low Happiness Ending Drink 1]] [[Dump the vial|Miki Low Happiness Ending Dump 1]]<<contentWarning "Identity Death">><<set $girlName to "">>\ <<set $playerAge to 16>>\ <<set $playerMaturity to 16>>\ You weren't about to throw out the entirety of your old life, even if you didn't totally remember it right now. So you tipped the vial back and swallowed down the surprisingly sweet liquid. It took only a moment for the effects to kick in, your stomach twisted and you doubled over. It wasn't terribly painful, but it was deeply uncomfortable. You had no idea why but shrinking had been much more pleasant than growing was now. In a rare moment of foresight you hurriedly removed your outfit before the transformation continued. Clothes didn't seem to usually change with the transformation and you didn't want to tear one of Emily's outfits apart. Likely this was why mom had suggested doing the transformation in your room, but you hadn't taken the hint. The rest of the transformation wasn't worth dwelling upon, you knew what you were turning into. So it was just the straightforward change from A to B with no surprises. Mostly it was just everything about you getting bigger and hairier. Quickly enough you were back to your normal self, or at least close enough that you couldn't tell the difference. With your memories restored this form felt as natural as your 'Lilo' form had a few moments ago. You grabbed a outfit from your closet, glad to be back into simple guy clothes. Though even you had to chuckle at how limited your options were in comparison to a girl. [[Back downstairs|Miki Low Happiness Ending Drink 2]]Mom and Emily didn't look surprised when you came down the stairs in your normal form, though there was an air of disappointment. @@.momVoice;"Everything back to normal <<playerName>>?"@@ Mom asked mildly. <<playerVoice "\"Two legs, two arms, everything checks out.\"">> @@.momVoice;"Emily, would you say he's learned his lesson?"@@ Your heart sank for a moment, but Emily didn't leave you hanging long, @@.emilyVoice;"I think so. He's still a stupid boy, but he's a little better now."@@ You inclined your head in thanks and breathed a sigh of relief. It seemed that your hands on experiences with girlhood were over and you could go back to normal life. [[Life continued|Miki Low Happiness Ending Drink 3]]An experience like that was bound to leave some lingering effects, both on you and the rest of the group. On their part they tried to be a lot more patient with Miki. Acknowledging the fact that she was younger, but working hard to not make it exclusionary. Emily made sure that Miki's voice was heard more often and that she could make some of the group's decisions. Sophie cut back on some of her more cutting jibes. When Miki wasn't able to do some physical task, instead of teasing her Sophie would help out or, if possible, try and teach her. Kara might have been the one with the most work to do. Watching the things that she said and making sure that, if it was too complicated, she explained it before moving on. In the end Sophie and Emily appreciated the explanations as well. They were older than Kara but sometimes she went over everyone's head. You also had a new appreciation for the group as a whole. Both in the lives that they lead and the struggles they went through. You couldn't even imagine the number of times you'd made Emily feel just like Miki had. So you did your best to be patient with her, even when she was being immature, or couldn't seem to understand something. That extended to the entire group when the occasion arose, though you always paid special attention to Miki on that point. Another side benefit was the extra perspective you'd been granted. You'd had a week where you couldn't spell, could barely read, and didn't understand subtraction. Giving completely wrong answers with no hesitation, to no real consequences. High school was obviously a little harsher, but in the end all your mistakes and embarrassments were fleeting. The rest of the world would quickly forget, so why should you make yourself miserable and linger on it? Easier said than done of course, but you were improving. Miki blossomed under the new circumstances, growing more confident with herself day by day. She still had her limitations, but that was just a matter of time. As she got older she'd grow out of all of those 'babyish' traits, there was just the annoying task of waiting it out. You'd be there to see it all, the big brother to Emily that you always should have been, and the pseudo big brother to the rest. It'd be a bumpy ride, but you were in it together. Ending 4a: O'hana Means Family <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "Miki" 4>><<set $playerMaturity to 10>>\ You tipped the vial over, letting the liquid spill onto the floor, soaking into the carpet. Your mother suddenly appeared in your room as the last drop fell to the ground. There was a clear panic on her face, but when she met your eyes she began to calm. She relaxed, holding her hand over her still pounding heart, @@.momVoice;"I was worried that you'd dropped it. Pulling it out of the carpet wouldn't have been easy. If you didn't want to drink it sweetie, you should have said so."@@ You were surprised by her words, you'd thought she'd be mad, or at least that she would demand an explanation. Instead she seemed almost relieved. It was enough that you couldn't even get your brain engaged properly. She knelt down to hold your hand as Emily also came running into the room. She spotting the empty vial in your still five year old hand, but she stayed quiet, at least for the moment. @@.momVoice;"I will love you no matter what. This is what you wanted to be and I support you with all my heart and love."@@ @@.emilyVoice;"But,"@@ Emily was on edge, @@.emilyVoice;"she's only five, she shouldn't be deciding this."@@ It was a rare moment of rational insight from your young...@@.girlVoice;older sister@@. But she made a good point, you hadn't known how to subtract two numbers today, should you have been allowed to throw away a decade of your life? [[Mom gripped your hand tighter|Miki Low Happiness Ending Dump 2]]<<set $playerMaturity to 5>>\ @@.momVoice;"As long as you held that vial you had all the faculties of your 16 year old self. I foresaw this possibility and wanted to make sure that any decision you made was done with the intelligence you'd started with. Though now that you've dumped it on the floor,"@@ she grimaced at the strange sparkly wet spot on the carpet, @@.momVoice;"you'll go back to normal in a few moments."@@ Normal. Right, a five year old brain was your new normal now. Not that it bothered you, you couldn't remember having anything else. This was as smart and mature as you'd ever been, probably. There was definitely a strange jump in your mind, where you'd been a five year old boy until the start of this week, then ''bam'' Lilo-ified. It felt right though, to have those memories, as incongruous as they were. Though you didn't really want to linger on them. The idea of being a boy was @@.girlVoice;too weird@@ and you didn't want to try and compare yourself. What did it matter if the boy version of you had been smarter, or more athletic, or more mature? You were happy with who you were now. @@.emilyVoice;"So I have a little sister now?"@@ There was an excitement tinging Emily's voice as she asked the question. Your mother nodded in response and you once again found yourself engulfed in a hug from Emily, one your mom quickly joined. The start of the new version of your family. [[The year marched on|Miki Low Happiness Ending Dump 3]]From there you quickly fell into a normal routine. Walking to school with Emily, seeing Miki at recess and coming home at lunch to mom. It took her a little bit to adjust as well. It'd actually been the desired outcome of the sleepover, but she hadn't expected to be raising a live action Lilo. She loved it though. If she ever complained when you were in earshot she always followed it up by saying you were the @@.girlVoice;cutest little girl@@ in the world and pinching your nose. You always objected like you hated it, but you never actually tried to stop her. The rest of the year went much the same as that first week, just without the meltdown. There were a few dramatic shifts, when the half day became an extended day, and then to a full day. However, you weathered that change quite well. There were a lot of things you weren't good at, but you were excellent at handling change. For your age you were actually impossibly good at it. Unfortunately you didn't get graded on 'ability to handle change' and your actual grades were @@.girlVoice;middling at best@@. Good enough to get through, but with the teacher encouraging you get some extra support. Luckily you had a whole network of girls who were around to assist. Kara was @@.girlVoice;unbelievably@@ smart and was a master of every single subject. Emily was basically just as smart, at least when it came to assisting in kindergarten learnings. And since you actually lived with her, she was your main source of assistance. Sophie tried to help sometimes, but her explanations weren't the best and she quickly got frustrated. You didn't ask for her help much. Miki knew the least overall technically, but she was only a year older that you, so all of this work was fresh in her mind. Plus she was the best at bringing the explanations down to your level. Though it wasn't all work, their group of four had become a group of five and you all played together a lot. In the new group dynamic they did their best to make sure you and Miki were included. Though sometimes it was handy that the three of them could go do something @@.girlVoice;super complicated@@ while Miki and you did something @@.girlVoice;more fun@@. [[The years went on|Miki Low Happiness Ending Dump 4]]As the years passed Miki ended up growing out of much of her youthful awkwardness. Shedding the last of her baby fat and catching up with the rest of her peers, mentally and physically. Originally her parents had been concerned about her lagging behind on some developmental milestones. Those concerns vanished over time and by age seven she was right on par. Her marks never excelled, but it was fairly smooth sailing in the middle of the pack. You on the other hand had no such luck. Even by age ten you were @@.girlVoice;still struggling@@ with basically every class and you'd gained quite a reputation for your @@.girlVoice;clumsiness@@. You'd tried to work on it of course. Miki and you had even joined up for dance classes together when you were still only five. You were no good at most styles, however it had afforded you the opportunity to finally get your @@.girlVoice;hula outfit@@. That style you were shockingly good at, something that confused your instructor and brought Miki endless amusement. The two of you were very close, even though you were never in the same class. Sometimes you actually thought you were closer to Miki than to your sister. Three years was a big age gap when you were both so young. Sometimes she just had 'better things to do' than playing with you, much to your frustration. If you'd remembered it this would have been deeply ironic, considering where this had all started. Your relationship with Emily improved as you both aged, the gap seeming less and less severe each year. By the time you'd gotten into middle school the two of you were as close as could be. Not that anyone would believe you were related. Once you got to high school things got even better. It was much easier to mingle with older students, so Miki and you could spend more time together. You probably would have spent more time with the other girls, but they all had such busy lives to lead. Kara had been skipped forward a grade, but was still taking advanced classes. Emily seemed to be in every club the school had, and invented a few it didn't. Sophie was about to head to college on a gymnastics scholarship, so she spent a lot of time training. She also spent some time as a cheerleader. Emily teased her relentlessly about the girly outfit, but Sophie insisted it was just about the physical exercise. Although, even though it was optional, Sophie always wore her cheerleading garb on Spirit Days. [[You turned sixteen|Miki Low Happiness Ending Dump 5]] <<silently>>\ <<set $mikiLowHappinessEndingAge16 to true>> <<set $playerAge to 16>> <<set $playerMaturity to 16>> <<set $voiceClassOverride to 6>> <<set $traitChatterbox to true>> <<set $traitVain to true>> <<set $traitFlirty to true>> <<set $showTeenNPCDescriptions to true>> <</silently>>\By the time you hit sixteen you could feel that the end of high school was rapidly approaching, and you weren't happy about the prospect. As much as the other girls said college was a blast, you loved your time in high school with Miki. Since you hadn't gotten heavily involved with clubs like Emily or Sophie you had a whole lot of free time on your hands. Free from all the stress and responsibility they'd had to deal with. You wanted to say you spent the extra time studying...but you didn't. You had a ton of friends, and those friends had tons of parties. Between all those parties, weekends at the mall, and general hanging out you didn't have a lot of time for studying. Class was also usually terminally boring and you'd become an expert at surreptitiously texting under your desk. Overall you really didn't like the whole 'school' part of high school. It reflected in your marks, they were...well...they were bad. It'd be enough to graduate, barely, but you weren't going to get into post-secondary. Miki was still debating on that herself, her marks were probably good enough, but she'd have to work hard in her last year to have a proper chance. But all that studying didn't stop the two of you from spending time on romantic pursuits. At first you'd thought you only liked girls, but some time over the last few years boys had become ''very'' interesting as well. It was high school, so relationships never lasted long, but they were fun while they lasted. A fun that Miki enjoyed as well. Miki never had any trouble finding a boy. She was still a tiny girl, 5' 1" and a touch under 100 pounds, but lots of guys liked that. It helped that she'd retained much of her sweet giggliness from when you'd met her at six. A little @@.girlVoice;giggle@@ and a light touch on the arm and most guys were already hooked. You were only a couple inches taller than her but you'd ended up...what was word that boy had used before you dumped him? 'Thicc'? But long legs and nice curves gave you your fair share of admirers, even if your thighs were a bit bigger than you wanted. Miki insisted your resemblance to Lilo had persisted all the way to teenagehood. You disagreed, but she had 'proof'. Turned out there was a Lilo & Stitch tv show, and there had been an episode where Lilo had turned into a teen. You'd watched it with her, marvelling the similarities on display. Reflexively checking your own body as Lilo checked herself in a mirror. But you refused to admit that Miki was right, you couldn't give her the satisfaction. Another thing you still both shared was dance. Though lately you'd found yourself working more and more behind the scenes. You were having more fun doing all the other girl's makeup than actually going on stage to dance. Turned out hula wasn't popular enough locally to maintain a troupe. [[Preparing for a performance|Miki Low Happiness Ending Dump 6]]@@.mikiVoice;"Maybe you should do make-up professionally?"@@ Miki suggested as you finished up her sparkly make-up. It was overdone, and some people might see that as a lack of skill on your part, but it was a lack of understanding on their part. Dance make-up always had to be overdone. It had to be noticeable not just to the people in the front row, but the people all the way in the back. So Miki looked a little silly up close, but you were confident it'd look great on stage. <<playerVoice "\"Hmmmm, that could work,\"">> you'd never really considered that possibility. You'd treated it as something fun to do, but doing it for money was a whole new idea. @@.mikiVoice;"Well we both know you're not getting into college."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Hey! That isn't nice.\"">> @@.mikiVoice;"Am I wrong? Maybe if you spent more time studying and less time making out with Mark..."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Ugh, you are so unfair. I didn't make out with him //that// much. Anyway. Mark and I aren't even dating anymore, and Noah is a much better kisser.\"">> @@.mikiVoice;"Oh my god! You have a new boyfriend again?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"Oh shut up. You're no better. You and Mark only lasted a few weeks.\"">> And yes it was the same Mark. Miki had warned you he wasn't a great kisser, but he'd been cute enough that you couldn't resist trying, <<playerVoice "\"same with Tommy...and Brad...and Aaron...\"">> You let the rest of the list go unspoken. Miki just huffed and ignored the bait. Anyone overhearing this conversation might think you hated each other, and were showing it by being catty. You knew better. You were the best of friends. It's just that you loved to tease each other, sometimes Miki made it so easy...not that you didn't give her plenty of ammunition to use against you. She was an equal opportunity teaser, she'd find an angle no matter who you'd been making out with, even when it'd been that @@.girlVoice;super cute@@ cheerleader. It only got worse if you actually started dating them. The two of you continued teasing one another until it was finally Miki's turn to get on stage. You thought about how smart Miki was sometimes, her idea about being a make-up artist sounded great. After all Miki looked //great// up there and that was your handiwork. Maybe you could have a future in making everyone else look great too? It'd be another big change in your life, but you were always able to ride the tides of change. Life went up and down, you were just along for the ride. Ending 4b: Kindergarten Rollercoaster Ride <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "Miki" 11>><<include "Reset state for ending start">>\ Sophie pondered on the point. Sometimes it was hard to tell exactly how Sophie felt about someone. She teased everyone whether she liked them or not. You figured that whatever she picked it would be something that gave her plenty of ammunition for that teasing. When she cracked a grin it did little to assuage that concern. Your mother leaned down to hear the verdict, Sophie whispered so that you wouldn't be able to hear. Wouldn't want to ruin the surprise after all. @@.momVoice;"An interesting choice. Not quite what I expected, but it does make sense,"@@ your mother mused as she turned back to you. You were half convinced she'd said that just to keep you off balance and concerned. However, the look currently on her face showed her taking this situation rather seriously. Sophie had made the suggestion, but your mother had her own plans and reasons for this. For now though you were going to have to have to deal with whatever the two of them had cooked up. She moved her hands in an arcane gesture before pushing it out towards you. The tingles broke out on your skin immediately. Nothing to do now but see what happened. [[Consider the changes|Sophie High Happiness Ending 2]]A pleasant warmth suffused your whole body, spreading to every part of you. Currently there didn't seem to be anything changing. It made you think about how the magic would actually work. It wasn't as simple as just giving you long hair and shrinking your arms and legs. There were internals to rearrange and hormones to balance. Did it actually rewrite your DNA? You couldn't even imagine the complexity of that, but did mom actually know all that? Or did the magic just handle the fine details on its own? None of this mattered. When faced the the imminent loss of your gender and maturity, you'd gotten overly analytical, if only to distract yourself. You turned your attention inward, you wondered if you would be able to feel the changes inside you as they happened. What was the sound of your insides turning inside out? Was there a sensation to your chromosomes flipping? Or would you not even be able to detect it as your brain shrank down? Frustrated by the lack of understanding of what was happening inside of you, you turned your attention back to your outsides. The girls were all watching in fascination as the changes began to manifest on you. [[Weather the changes|Sophie High Happiness Ending 3]]Once the power had suffused your body all the changes seemed to happen at one. Your insides had changed and now the rest of the body was forced to follow suit. Your vision warped as you dropped towards the floor, dozens of pounds shedding off of you, disappearing into nothing. Maybe in some alternate universe there was a version of you who kept gaining weight but could never figure out why. It wasn't clear exactly how small you were going to get. Eyeballing things you were already Sophie's size and getting smaller. Though it wasn't just your height that changed, many of those shed pounds were coming from your muscles. A feeling of weakness flooded through you. In your minds eye you tried to imagine what you could lift now. Maybe you'd be able to handle those little pink one pound weights, but that was about it and that might be a struggle. Everything about you felt small and weak, a feeling that continued to intensify even as your body stopped shrinking. Mercifully you seemed to still be a little bigger than Miki, but even Kara was bigger than you now. Internally you groaned, she was only 4 feet tall, which meant you were under... There was also a change to your skin, it was becoming paler than before. You weren't turning albino, but it looked like you weren't well acquainted with the sun. The little spots started to appear, at first just a few but they quickly spread everywhere. You couldn't see it but your face was now covered in freckles. Auburn hair fell across your vision, bouncing in a messy curl. [[The magic faded|Sophie High Happiness Ending 4]] <<silently>>\ <<set $playerAge to 7>>\ <<set $playerMaturity to 7>>\ <<set $epilogueStartAge to $playerAge>>\ <<set $endingTraitSophieFangirl7 to true>>\ <<set $traitClumsy to true>> <<set $traitSoftspoken to true>> <<set $traitShort to true>> <<set $traitHopelessRomantic to true>> <<set $sophieInferiorityComplex to 4>> <</silently>>As the magic faded you felt yourself sag in place, looking down to see that almost your entire outfit had fallen off. Only your shirt was holding on, though it was more accurately a dress at this point. The other girls simply stared for a moment before Sophie smiled and came over to you. @@.girlThought;She's so tall. Is she a foot taller than me? Two?@@ She loomed over you, her eyes boring into yours, @@.sophieVoice;"Hey there squirt. How you feeling?"@@ At first you couldn't even answer. Her eyes had captivated you. You felt like a rabbit in the gaze of a wolf. @@.girlThought;She's so big, she's practically an adult.@@ <<playerVoice "\"I'm, uh, fine. Thank you for asking.\"">> Your politeness only made Sophie smile wider. @@.girlThought;She has such a pretty smile.@@ Mom took a moment to interject, @@.momVoice;"Perhaps we should get <<playerName>> something to wear other than an oversized man's shirt."@@ The other girls nodded, moving back towards Emily's room. @@.sophieVoice;"Come on,"@@ she grabbed your hand, @@.sophieVoice;"time to get you dressed."@@ @@.girlThought;She's so mature, I better just follow along.@@ [[You went upstairs|Sophie High Happiness Ending 5]]<<Image 'Endings/SophieLow/Day0Outfit.webp' "topRightCorner">>\ Sitting on Emily's bed you watched as the girls rifled through Emily's closet. <<if $oldPlayerAge <= 12>>This wasn't the first time you'd been dressed up, but this time Sophie seemed to be taking the lead.<<else>>Sophie was taking the lead on the hunt for something more befitting your new stature.<</if>> It seemed that since she got to choose your physical form, she wanted to pick your outfit as well. @@.girlThought;Sophie is so smart, she probably knows better anyway.@@ In the moments before they settled on something you were able to take a few moments to take stock of the situation. It seems Sophie had wanted you as a seven year old red head. It made you look more like her sister than Emily's, though your hair was a duller red, and you had more freckles. So the physical form was simple enough, but what about your mind? Maybe it'd be best to ask her about it. @@.girlThought;Better not. She's busy and it's not that important.@@ You straightened in shock. It'd been happening for a few minutes, but you just realized that your internal monologue wasn't consistent. There was another voice, well it was still your voice, but it was encouraging you down a different path. Was this the seven year old girl part of your brain chiming in? @@.sophieVoice;"How about this?"@@ Sophie held up a dress for your inspection. It was bright pink, with flowers sprouting from the hemlines. The sleeves were white but absolutely covered in butterflies and flowers. There was a visible pocket on the front, the same style as the sleeves. @@.girlThought;It's really cute, I should try it on.@@ [[You tried to ignore the thought|Sophie High Happiness Ending 6]]You tried to ignore that thought. It was @@.girlVoice;cute@@, but it was also aggressively girly and childish. It was in your size, but you could imagine seeing a toddler in the same outfit. @@.girlThought;But Sophie picked it just for me. It would be rude not to try it.@@ You found yourself reaching out for the dress before you could think better of it. With it in your hands the urge to try it grew even stronger. You capitulated. If you were going to have to fight your own mind you'd have to pick your battles, you needed an actual outfit, this would have to do. Though once you got it on you reconsidered the situation. The style made it seem like you were still wearing an oversized shirt. Though now the hem stopped mid-thigh and the sleeves actually fit properly. It made you look even smaller than you were. @@.girlThought;I'm so adorable.@@ It was @@.girlVoice;cute@@, @@.girlVoice;too cute@@. You already looked a little small for seven, a dress like this made you look Miki's age, or maybe even younger. @@.sophieVoice;"Very cute,"@@ Sophie spoke and a pleasant sensation washed over you, @@.sophieVoice;"what do you think?"@@ Your mind was still recovering from the compliment, @@.girlThought;Sophie is so nice@@, and it degraded your ability to object, <<playerVoice "\"I agree, It's very cute.\"">> The fact that you weren't sure if you wanted to look cute was left unspoken. @@.emilyVoice;"With that settled why don't we play some more until everyone's parents come?"@@ [[Downstairs to play|Sophie High Happiness Ending 7]]The rest of the morning was spent playing a haphazard assortment of games, none lasting more than a few minutes. Though the situation was rather illuminating to you. You were starting to understand exactly what Sophie had done to you. @@.sophieVoice;"Well done <<playerName>>!"@@ Sophie called after you'd scored. Once again the pleasant feeling assaulted you, leaving you with a @@.girlVoice;dopey grin@@. Though Sophie immediately one up'd you with a far more impressive goal. @@.girlThought;Sophie's so amazing.@@ You shook your head. The theme was becoming clear now. Yes it was a 'normal' little girl voice that just wanted you to be @@.girlVoice;cute and have fun@@. But there was a second aspect that seemed to be in total awe of Sophie. Whenever she did anything, regardless of how impressive it was, the voice felt the need gush over it. Then again Sophie was awfully impressive compared to you. Sure you were younger than her but she seemed so strong and fast and...you cut off that line of thinking, you didn't need to add fuel to the fire. It was almost a relief when Sophie's mom came to pick her up. On the one hand, you didn't want to see her go, you wanted to keep playing. On the other you hoped that with her gone you'd be able to clear your head. Luckily you'd correctly deduced the situation. With Sophie gone the voice seemed to go almost entirely silent, leaving you alone with your own thoughts. Unfortunately, those thoughts were preoccupied with the fact you were going to wake up this way tomorrow. A skinny little seven year old red-headed girl...that had to go to grade school. [[First day of school|Sophie High Happiness Ending 8]]You shifted uncomfortably in your seat. It was deeply strange to be back in grade two, doubly so because this time you were in a skirt. Mercifully Emily had gone easier on you this morning. It was inarguably a girl's outfit, but at least it made you look your age. There was a part of you that was very worried about what the other kids thought of you. You were only going to be there for a week, so you shouldn't care, but... @@.girlThought;I want them to like me.@@ You couldn't disagree on that point, and at Emily's urging you introduced yourself to the rest of the class. Emily and Kara were comforting presences in the room, you weren't the best of friends but you knew they were on your side. Your mind had regressed enough that the school work was challenging, but nothing you couldn't handle. Everything was calm enough until lunch. Outside all the grades were able to mix and mingle, which put you back in direct contact with Sophie. Or it would have if she didn't get dragged into an impromptu soccer game. A game that you were helplessly drawn to, you simply had to watch. Your attention rapt on the game as it progressed, though Sophie took up an abnormal amount of your focus. @@.girlThought;She's so good at this.@@ There was a moment, while Sophie was carrying the ball, that one of the boys slid in for an aggressive tackle. He missed the ball but clipped Sophie's foot. You held your breath as she stumbled, but she recovered and still kept possession of the ball, @@.girlThought;it was amazing@@. <<playerVoice "\"Go Sophie!\"">> You shouted as she dribbled her way towards the goal. Your awareness expanded enough to notice that you'd drew the stares of half of the yard with your outburst. You blushed and went quiet, it was just a silly playground game, Sophie didn't need a cheerleader. Though it didn't stop you from cheering when she did score. The bell rang and you were all forced back inside, never even getting a chance to congratulate her on the win. [[The week went on|Sophie High Happiness Ending 9]]It became clear as the week went on that you'd been afflicted with a serious case of 'hero worship', heroine in this case. You idolized Sophie, you couldn't help yourself. She just seemed so impossibly perfect in everything she did. You knew consciously that you were ignoring anything negative that didn't fit that image. But the moment she did something impressive you revered her even more. Which meant that her compliments, even her attention, made you melt into childish reverence. In the quieter moments you were able to clear the thoughts from your head, but other times you @@.girlThought;wanted to be just like her@@. It had become a little more difficult to separate your own thoughts from that intrusive voice. It was a deeply conflicting situation. Was it worth fighting that voice when you'd be back to normal in a week anyway? Sophie hadn't explained her plan to the other girls, so they had to find out by watching your odd sycophantic behaviour. When she worked it out Emily was deeply annoyed. @@.emilyVoice;"She's supposed to be my little sister.
