Why does she like Sophie so much?"@@ Emily pouted, folding her arms. @@.karaVoice;"Well,"@@ Kara was trying her best to defuse the potential conflict, @@.karaVoice;"Sophie and <<playerName>> did get along really well at the party. They probably just wanted to play with each other for a little longer, it's only a week after all."@@ This rationale was enough to mollify Emily, though she was still disappointed at her missed opportunity to be a big sister. Your own feelings on the matter continued to drift. At the start of the week you'd thought of it as a bit of a prank. Make you into a little girl so you could get even more experience seeing how @@.girlVoice;amazing she was@@, but now you were really starting to see it as a blessing. As a teenager you'd grown a lot more cynical about people. Everyone had their flaws, worshipping your heroes was bound to get your heart broken. But your mind was a lot simpler now. So it was easy to believe @@.girlThought;Sophie was actually perfect@@ and not let anything shatter that faith. Might as well enjoy it while it lasted. So you did, you followed her lead on everything. Doing whatever she suggested and having way more fun than if you'd made your own decisions. [[End of the week|Sophie High Happiness Ending 10]]On Saturday the girls were coming over again, though this time it was just for the daytime. At this point your devotion had reached it's peak. You basically acted as Sophie's shadow all day, lapsing into unrestrained awe when she did something even moderately impressive. @@.girlThought;She's so strong and beautiful. I wish I could be like that.@@ The other girls teased you about the behaviour, but Sophie was loving all the attention. It had been her wish after all. Your heart skipped a beat, @@.girlThought;she wished for me! All the choice in the world and she picked me!@@ Though you weren't concious of it your internal monologue had almost entirely harmonized. There wasn't 'another' voice telling you how amazing Sophie was. You didn't need anyone to tell you that. The activities of the day just reinforced it further. Every time the two of you 'competed' that day you'd found yourself outdone by her. In truth it wasn't really much of a competition. But you didn't mind losing, since it was her. @@.girlThought;I could never beat her, she's just too good.@@ Kara slyly commented to Sophie that maybe your outlook was causing you to sabotage your own attempts, but Sophie waved it off. Sophie was riding high on the adoration and wanted to enjoy it while she had it. She wasn't abusing that fact too much, she wasn't teasing you and wasn't ordering you around much, she just enjoyed having you around. [[After dinner|Sophie High Happiness Ending 11]]After dinner, but before the other girls had left, mom pulled you aside. @@.momVoice;"I've talked to the other girls, and they all think you've learned your lesson. So I'm willing to reduce your sentence. I'll turn you back right now, if you like."@@ A few days ago you couldn't have imagined that even being a question. Of course you'd want to be turned back...except... <<playerVoice "\"N-not right now...\"">> You couldn't meet mom's eye, <<playerVoice "\"It's supposed to be a week, and Sophie said...\"">> Once again you trailed off. Sophie hadn't actually said anything about you not changing back early, but you didn't want the fun to end prematurely. @@.girlThought;I want to spend more time with Sophie."@@ Mom raised an eyebrow, @@.momVoice;"I see,"@@ her voice was calm, not giving anything away, @@.momVoice;"perhaps tomorrow then.@@ There was a pause, @@.momVoice;"well run along and go have some more fun with Sophie, she'll be heading home soon."@@ You raced back to the other girls like you'd been shot out of a cannon. @@.mikiVoice;"What was dat about?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"N-nothing, I just had to tell her that I uh, that I...\"">> Sophie rescued you, @@.sophieVoice;"Wanted to keep playing, eh?"@@ Sophie had correctly intuited the result of the conversation, but how deep did that understanding go? Either way you wanted to get @@.girlVoice;back to playing@@. [[Evening continued|Sophie High Happiness Ending 12]]The evening came to an end distressingly quickly and your fun was cut short. Leaving you alone with Emily, who looked a little bereft of attention. @@.emilyVoice;"Come on, we can keep playing."@@ You didn't feel the same cloying need to follow her like you did with Sophie. But she was your @@.girlVoice;big sister@@, and you didn't know what else to do, so you followed her. The rest of your play was tinged with a melancholy. Both of you knowing that things had to go back to 'normal' tomorrow. Though when tomorrow came there was an unexpected complication. @@.emilyVoice;"What do you mean you can't turn him back?"@@ Emily had accompanied mom to observe your transformation, but things hadn't gone as planned when mom's spell failed to do anything. @@.momVoice;"This spell can only be easily dispelled if the subject wishes to be turned back."@@ Mom cast you a glance and you blushed. It wasn't like you were trying to make this difficult. Last night you'd been thinking on the situation. You sort of wanted to go back to normal, but that thought was overpowered. You'd been @@.girlVoice;so much fun@@ with Sophie that you didn't want it to stop. Right now you were more interested in being with her, than being a teenage boy. That reluctance was enough to interfere with the reversal. @@.momVoice;"Well <<playerName>>,"@@ she began to walk away, @@.momVoice;"come and talk to me if you change your mind."@@ It was almost strange to hear her say it that way. 'If'. Was it possible you could never turn back at all? [[The day went on|Sophie High Happiness Ending 13]]You tried to will yourself into wanting to go back to normal, but counter thoughts kept getting in the way. //I should turn back into being a boy.// @@.girlThought;But if I turn back I can't play with Sophie anymore.@@ //I'm want to be a grown up again.// @@.girlThought;But not like that. I want to be like her when I grow up.@@ //I'm supposed to be a boy.// @@.girlThought;Why would I want to be a smelly boy?@@ Your attempt was weak and you knew it; you didn't want to turn back. The intrusive voice in your head had been gone for days. All that praise and adoration had been provided solely by you. At the party she'd been impressive, and the two of you had gotten really friendly. But seeing her so much this week, how she acted and what she was capable of...your respect had turned into idolization. In the moments you didn't @@.girlVoice;want to be her@@ you still desperately @@.girlVoice;wanted to be her friend@@. You weren't mad, @@.girlThought;I love who I am now@@, but you were worried how mom would feel. How could you convince her to let you stay this way? Convince her that this was how you truly felt, not some magically induced mania. You spent the rest of the day into the evening pondering the issue, sitting on your bed and devoting all your degraded brainpower to the task. You hadn't had any success when a solution suddenly presented itself. There was a knock on your door, <<playerVoice "\"Come in!\"">> As the door opened you saw the most beautiful sight. <<playerVoice "\"Sophie!\"">> You rushed across the room and threw yourself into a desperate hug. Tears suddenly sprung to your eyes, you hadn't realized how distressed this situation was making you. @@.girlThought;Sophie is super smart, she'll know what to do.@@ @@.sophieVoice;"Aw squirt, what's wrong?"@@ How were you supposed to explain any of this? [[Mom cleared her throat|Sophie High Happiness Ending 14]]@@.momVoice;"I'm glad to see my hunch was right'."@@ She'd known you didn't want to turn back, but it wasn't entirely sure of the reason until now. Sophie was still confused. She'd received an urgent invite from your mom, with scant details. @@.momVoice;"Simply put, <<playerName>> doesn't want to change back. Do you sweetie?"@@ Still buried in the hug you chose not to respond, nor to make eye contact. @@.momVoice;"It seems Sophie, that <<playerName>> took her worship of you to heart."@@ @@.sophieVoice;"But I-I didn't mean...it was only for a week, just some fun..."@@ Sophie sputtered. It made you feel queasy, she was normally so composed. @@.momVoice;"I know you didn't and the magic wasn't strong enough to do even half of this. The spell gave her an idealized mental image of you, and a dash of self doubt, that's it. Thrown into an unfamiliar situation and form, she'd naturally want to be led. Given her diminished abilities it would be enough to leave her in awe of you. At least for a couple days, she would be naturally inclined to cling to you."@@ She cast a curious glance at you, @@.momVoice;"However, that feeling should have already faded, but that's only if <<playerName>> wanted it to. If instead she chose to lionize your character and eagerly follow your lead. Building up a mythic version of you to aspire to. Well, this could happen."@@ That was ridiculous, your opinion of Sophie was totally reasonable. @@.girlThought;Sophie didn't have any flaws, she was the best.@@ Okay, that //was// a little extreme. You'd let yourself build a habit of putting her on a pedestal, very nearly worshipping her. So you could go a little over the top, but that didn't mean you wanted to change anything. [[Everyone paused|Sophie High Happiness Ending 15]]@@.sophieVoice;"So what now?"@@ Sophie disappointingly broke the hug. Things were serious enough that she wanted to be able to focus. Mom sighed, @@.momVoice;"That's up to <<playerName>>. Her mind is clear enough to make her own decision."@@ @@.sophieVoice;"Wait, so she could just stay like this? Forever?"@@ Mom gave a small laugh, @@.momVoice;"well not forever, everyone grows up eventually. But yes she could stay like this and grow up as a normal girl. Maybe she would even grow up to be just like you."@@ Mom's words hit you like a hammer blow. It was almost unfair on her part, to say something that attacked your psyche so directly...A psyche that you had intentionally constructed. All she was saying is that your dreams could come true, how could that be bad? @@.momVoice;"Is that what you wish <<playerName>>? Is this who you want to be?"@@ You could just be hearing things, but you thought mom might disapprove of the decision. Did she just want you to turn back to normal? Even if she did disapprove she'd left the decision up to you. [[Stay like this|Sophie High Happiness Ending 16]] [[Turn back|Sophie High Happiness Turn Back 1]]You shook your head. As much @@.girlVoice;fun@@ as the last week had been, it wasn't really who you were. You had a life that you'd left behind and one that you wanted to get back to. Sophie seemed slightly disappointed with the decision, but she understood. It'd been fun to have her own personal cheerleader, but you couldn't live your whole life that way, right? ... It turned out that Sophie had been half wrong. She was right that you weren't going to be her own personal cheerleader, but that didn't mean you weren't going to give the girls all the support you could. Your time at their level had made it abundantly clear how amazing this group was. Sophie was a star athlete, Kara was a genius, Miki had endless potential and Emily was a literal witch in training. Individually they'd be able to accomplish wonderful things, but together they could do almost anything. It almost seemed like your responsibility to help support them all. You could be the supportive big brother to all of them. In a literal sense for Emily of course, but Kara and Sophie didn't have an older brother at all. Miki did, but you didn't doubt she'd enjoy sort of having another. [[Life continued|Sophie High Happiness Turn Back 2]] <<include "Reset state for ending start">>\ <<set $playerAge to 16>>\ <<set $playerMaturity to 16>>\It turned out that your new outlook had some unexpected side benefits. Of course your relationship with Emily improved greatly, and you grew closer with the other girls, but even your high school relationships improved. It had occurred by happen-stance on one of your group excursions to the mall. The five of you had been in a kid's clothing store looking at various girly outfits. Though you didn't have the greatest insight the girls had taken to asking you your opinions on the relative cuteness of different @@.girlVoice;skirts@@ and @@.girlVoice;dresses@@. This is when you'd been caught by a gaggle of your female classmates. You'd been concerned that they'd think you were weird or tease you, that you'd be a social pariah after then...but they'd been incredibly supportive. They bemoaned their own brothers. The boys absolute distaste for anything they even remotely considered girly. They would have //loved// to have a brother they could take shopping, if only to help carry their bags. By the end of the conversation you'd received an invite for another shopping trip the next day, this time with girls your age. It was more similar than you'd expected. At first there had been a little big of awkwardness, but by the end you were entirely part of the group. This sort of trip became routine and you found yourself at the mall multiple times a week. Sometimes with your sister and her friends, sometimes with your own high school group. There was one major distinction in the shopping trips. Emily and co were almost entirely concerned about what they thought about the outfit. The girls your age were //very// interested in how the other boys at school would feel about their outfits. There was a shocking amount of @@.girlVoice;gossip@@ regarding the various relationships blossoming and withering at school. You were part of all of it, hearing about every asshole ex, and the cute new boy who inevitably turned into an asshole ex. [[Shopping with your friends|Sophie High Happiness Turn Back 3]] <<set $traitFashionista to true>>\ <<set $traitShopaholic to true>>\ <<set $traitChatterbox to true>>\ <<set $traitVain to true>>\They wished there were 'more guys like you', but your relationship with them was different. In the end you saw a lot more half naked girls than //any// other guy at school. But in those moments you were determining if the swimsuit suited the figure or if the bra was the right size, rather than ogling. More than once you'd ended up getting questioned about panty choices, they just //loved// seeing you get all blushy about it. You were 'one of the girls', according to the consensus of the group. Something that would have galled the old you, but now felt entirely natural. It was equally natural that you started to pick up a few of their interests. Your inclination towards @@.girlVoice;fashion@@ was obvious enough, but the @@.girlVoice;pop music@@ was a new one. So was an increasing love of @@.girlVoice;trashy sitcoms@@. They'd even managed to convince you to start your own @@.girlVoice;Instagram@@ account. You didn't post much but pictures of the group, but it was a start. This also did wonders for your social life at school in general. You hadn't realized, but you'd somehow fallen in with the popular girls. The kind who never would have even spoken to the old you. Which meant every guy in the school was buttering you up trying to get information about how to get a hook up. Something you generally denied, you didn't mind them being pushy, but you had to defend your girls. However, the occasional guy was cute enough to give him a shot. Those relationships never lasted long anyway, so dumb but cute would suit the girls just fine. Though this wasn't without consequences. With your increased social life you'd lost time for some of your old activities. You never got a chance to go to the gym anymore, which caused much of your hard earned muscle to fade away. Though Cadence had given you a quick but effective home routine that you managed to work in every day. It was a little more focused on your butt than you'd expected, but you couldn't deny the results. That wasn't the last piece of 'health' advice you received from the girls. It led you to trying all sorts of wacky things, but again the results spoke for themselves. Your acne was gone, leaving you nice and smooth, even if the rest of your body hair had gotten thinner. You //swore// that Madison's suggestion of a 'weight loss' pill had actually just redistributed mass from your upper body to your thighs, but the rest of the girls decried the pill as bogus, so you weren't sure. The blonde streaks in your hair hadn't technically been a 'health' suggestion, but they did look @@.girlVoice;cute@@ with your lengthening hair. [[Part of the group|Sophie High Happiness Turn Back 4]] <<set $endingDescriptionFemme16Boy to true>>\ <<set $traitVain to true>>\Your new @@.girlVoice;cuter@@ look sparked an idea in the girls, they decided your wonderful advice on cute clothing should be repaid. Which is how you found yourself once again in the mall, your opinion being requested on the latest cute dress. Except this dress was for you. Your wardrobe was dreadfully small and you couldn't keep borrowing their stuff forever. It was a development that your elementary school friend group also enthusiastically supported. Emily providing you with unfettered access to her closet. You took less advantage of it than you'd expect, sure everything fit, but it was an eight year old's wardrobe. Sure some of her shirts and skirts were cute enough when sized up, but you didn't want to be //that// cutesy. Which is why you declined the current dress on offer. You wanted something a little more elegant this time, something your friends were more than happy to help with. After all they had a plan to 'accidentally' run into some of their crushes a bit later, and it was important that all of you looked your best. You knew you were going to get flirted with, again, by a boy who didn't have the whole story, but that was kind of fun too. Who didn't like getting a little attention sometimes? Maybe some day you'd take things a little further than that, but you hadn't decided yet. You sighed. //The things they drag me into.// But you still smiled, you loved all your friends, high jinks and all. Plus the sleepover crew would get a kick out of the story, though it still made you blush when Sophie made fun of you for being so @@.girlVoice;girly@@. You knew she wasn't wrong per say, you //were// about to put on a dress, but...you didn't know where this was going...enough thinking, time to get going. The group was on the move and you all had some fun to have. Ending 9b: One of the "Girls" <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "Sophie" 18>>\<<playerVoice "\"I wanna stay like this.\"">> The conviction in your voice surprised even you. It should have been an unthinkable thing to admit, but you knew how much you wanted it. You didn't care what other people thought. Just this once you'd stand your ground even if Sophie disagreed. She didn't. Nor did mom. @@.momVoice;"If that's what you want sweetie,"@@ the seriousness of her tone had disappeared entirely, @@.momVoice;"I just wanted to make sure you knew the gravity of your choice. If you're so willing to stand up for it despite my disapproval, I know you mean it."@@ You squealed in delight and threw your arms around both of them, or at least your best attempt to do so, you were awfully small. All the tension had dropped out of you. Mom //was// happy with the decision, she'd just been testing you, and you'd passed. Or at least you were treating this as passing. The rest of the evening and the subsequent morning were a whirr of activity. It wasn't too difficult to convince people you were staying for another week; making it a permanent arrangement was significantly more onerous. However, Mom had seemingly endless connections, between that and some judiciously applied magic, it wasn't long before your registration was official and you'd be attending elementary school full time. The other girls were excited by the sudden addition to their group. You'd all gotten along alright at the party, but last week they'd met a whole new you. Emily did have some reservations. Between your auburn hair and freckles you still looked more like Sophie's little sister than hers. @@.girlThought;I wish I was Sophie's little sister.@@ But mom reassured her that you were in fact her @@.girlVoice;little sister@@, that she was now a @@.girlVoice;big sister@@. The change in title enough to make Emily happy for the moment. And thus life went on. All of you going to school together, Kara, Emily and you even being in the same class. Every lunch you spent your time with Sophie; acting as her personal cheerleader for sports and games. Of course you took part sometimes, but you enjoyed watching more than playing. It didn't help that you weren't particularly athletic. Your academics weren't much better. You weren't in danger of failing, but you were a distinctively mediocre student on all counts. [[The year went on|Sophie High Happiness Ending 17]]Now that everything had been settled and you were officially Emily's @@.girlVoice;little sister@@ things settled into a nice routine. School was boring, but it didn't bother you much, you still had plenty of fun the rest of the time. You had your @@.girlVoice;big sister@@ Emily, your mom, Miki, Kara and of course your mentor and idol Sophie. All the friends you could ever want. Though it didn't stop you from making other friends, both in your grade and among the older girls. Since you spent so much time with Sophie you also ended up making friends with her friends. This trend continued for years, until it was time for Sophie to graduate to high school. Since you were two years apart it meant you'd been attending different schools for a while. Sophie wasn't the only one who was gone, all of her friends had graduated as well. So you'd lost a massive chunk of your social circle. You still had friends in middle school, but not too many. Your constant companion was now someone you could only see on evenings and weekends. You felt aimless, however, this forced you to confront the realities of your relationship with Sophie. Until now you'd practically worshipped the ground she'd walked on. But that was childish hero worship. It'd been cute when you were eight and she was ten, but you were thirteen now, that kind of devotion just plain creepy. More than that you realized it was all one sided. Sophie could do all these amazing things, but what could you do? You were always there to cheer for her, but was it really enough just to cheer? You wanted to be the kind of girl who was worthy of Sophie's attention, not some charity case. You took the intervening years to begin that journey. Of course you still saw Sophie, but being at different schools meant you had a lot more time apart from her. This allowed you to do some of the work surreptitiously, so you could surprise her when you were reunited. It was a relief and a delight when you finally became a freshmen and joined her in high school. [[Freshman year|Sophie High Happiness Ending 18]] <<silently>>\ <<set $playerAge to 15>> <<set $playerMaturity to 15>> <<set $endingTraitSophieFangirl16 to true>> <<set $endingTraitSophieFangirl7 to false>> <<set $sophieInferiorityComplex to 1>> <<set $voiceClassOverride to 6>> <<set $showTeenNPCDescriptions to true>> <</silently>>\Sophie was already a junior, so she had a well established place the endless cliques. Actually she was basically the 'alpha' of one of those groups, specifically the cheerleaders. Sophie was the captain of the squad, her gymnastics training giving her a natural aptitude for the sport. Sophie had also become a lot more comfortable with her own femininity; you wouldn't call her 'girly', but she knew how good she looked in a cheer uniform. So good in fact that it was almost frustrating. She had blossomed into a full figured woman, tall and lithe. Meanwhile you'd hit puberty late and even then it seemed like your chest wasn't getting the message. Mom said you just had to be patient, that the family had "good genes". You weren't convinced you had those genes at all, you didn't look like your mom or sister at all. Over the years you'd gotten real tired of insisting that you weren't adopted. Reunited with Sophie it was easy for you to slip into her posse. You weren't athletic enough to join cheer, but you found your place. One of the talents you'd acquired over the last few years was a passing knowledge of medicine. You weren't a nurse or anything, but you'd picked up some useful tips from Kara and her mom. Since cheerleading was a never-ending parade of bumps, scrapes and sprains, your talents came in very handy. You couldn't count the number of times you'd had to tend to the newest of Sophie's injuries. She was tough, but not invulnerable, as you continually tried to remind her. Though you knew she'd never listen, so you always kept a small first aid kit in your backpack. Perhaps not surprisingly some of cheerleaders abused their position. Being on cheer made them popular, and they thought it made them better than others. Something they let others know, including you. But only when Sophie wasn't in ear shot. Sophie didn't approve of that kind of teasing and let everyone know it. One girl had been run off of the team when she wouldn't clamp down on the behavior. Sophie herself didn't need to insult other to pump her ego, she radiated a natural aura of self confidence. Some called it arrogance, but you knew better. Sophie didn't self aggrandize about how amazing she was, but she didn't downplay her successes either. That was a part of why you admired her so much, one of many reasons. You weren't a child anymore, so you didn't idolize her quite so utterly, but you still had a deep admiration for her. Your youthful desire to be more like her slowly morphed into something else entirely. As you'd both pushed into teenagehood you'd realized this shift, though it took you some time to identify what it was. Kara had been the first one you confided in, being the most discreet of the group. That you thought your feelings for Sophie might be more than platonic. In response she'd shown you a litany of high school anime with schoolgirls who were...close...with each other...very close...embarrassingly, blush inducingly close. Though discussion with her, a full watch of Madoka, Utena and Sakura Trick, and lots of self introspection you confirmed your initial suspicions. [[Freshman year continued|Sophie High Happiness Ending 19]]This realization, that your feelings for Sophie were turning romantic, caused an internal crisis. What would you do with the information? The idea of telling Sophie was entirely out of the question. The possibility of rejection was more than enough to keep you quiet, but you still wanted to find ways to show your affection. Inspired by Kara's anime education you worked on improving your cooking skills. Sophie often forgot to bring enough for lunch, neglecting the fact she burned so much energy with her endless athletics, so you started bringing things for her. At first it was just little snacks, something to help bridge the gap to dinner, but it progressed into making entire lunches. You had a private joy every time she smiled at seeing one of your home cooked meals and barely concealed joy when she complimented it. It made all those early mornings worth it. You'd even tried to pick up a little magic to see if it would help, but to no avail. It seemed you had little aptitude for it, and lacked the 'force of will' to do even the most basic cantrip. That didn't stop you from being helpful in other ways, your first aid skills were improving almost every day. Though those moments where you were cheek to cheek with Sophie tending to some bruise, took on a whole new meaning. More than once you'd had to hurriedly run off when the contact became too much to bear and your blushing was far too obvious. Sometimes you swore that Sophie was doing it intentionally. That she was purposely leaning into you or brushing her hand against your skin. Once you'd been //sure// she was going to kiss you, only for her to pull back at the last second. You'd convinced yourself that you were just projecting your own wishes onto her, but the rest of the girls thought differently. Emily in particular encouraged you to at least //ask// Sophie about it. Your sister was far more bold than you were, always pushing you outside of your comfort zone, even about something as terrifying as admitting your feelings to Sophie. [[Junior year|Sophie High Happiness Ending 20]]Which is why you now found yourself, starting your second year, standing under a tree, letter in hand, waiting for Sophie to arrive. Kara had insisted this was the right way to do, though you were suspicious she'd let anime influence her too much. Still the idea of handing Sophie a love letter under a tree, even if it wasn't a sakura tree, was too romantic to ignore. Your heart leapt as you saw her in the distance, clutching the letter so hard you started to crumple it, heart pounding in your ears. She smiled and waved as she spotted you, nearly melting you on the spot. The anxiety rising in you with her every step towards you. She stood before you, @@.sophieVoice;"<<playerName>>. What's up? You look so nervous."@@ She moved even closer to get a better look at you, @@.sophieVoice;"don't tell me I'm //that// scary. Mean Sophie is just for the other girls on the squad, you know I'm always nice to you."@@ The smile she gave you threatened to destroy what little resolve you had. You would do anything to keep seeing that smile. <<playerVoice "\"Sophie I-I...\"">> you tried to steady your trembling voice, <<playerVoice "\"the reason I called you out here is-is to..to...\"">> you almost faltered, barely managing to spit out <<playerVoice "\"to give you this,\"">> before your voice failed you entirely. You held out the letter, sealed with an obvious heart. This had all gone much more smoothly in your head. Instead of being all cool and romantic you were so nervous that you couldn't even look at her, and you could feel your face getting redder by the moment. [[Sophie took the letter|Sophie High Happiness Ending 21]] <<set $playerAge to 16>> <<set $playerMaturity to 16>>Your heart stopped, she took one look at it, but she didn't read it, she didn't even open it. Instead stepping in closer to you, reflexively you backed up, bumping into the tree, she leaned down to you, lips only inches from yours. @@.sophieVoice;"You're so cute when you blush."@@ You just about died. Any response you could have had died in your throat. @@.sophieVoice;"But so dramatic,"@@ she held up the letter, idly examining it before looking back to you, @@.sophieVoice;"Kara suggested this didn't she?"@@ You swallowed and nodded. Sophie laughed, @@.sophieVoice;"Of course she did. She's always trying to come up with the clever solution. I much prefer the direct approach."@@ Before you could react she leaned in and kissed you. If this had been an anime, this was the part where steam would have shot out of your ears and hearts would appear in your eyes. It disappointingly didn't happen in reality, but you later told the story like it had. Time froze and you hoped it would never unfreeze. Sophie broke the kiss, a blush having crept onto her own cheeks. You reflexively leaned forward, following her lips, but she was too quick. You fell forward, leaning into her chest, you could feel her heart pounding. She scratched the back of her head, @@.sophieVoice;"though I guess I can't blame you too much. I kept teasing you, but could never quite say it out loud..."@@ Her blush deepened, God she was even prettier when she blushed. The two of you stood there leaning into each other, hearts pounding. As a leaf fell from the tree and in that moment anyone watching would have seen a cherry blossom float through the air. This time you leaned up to kiss her. A kiss she eagerly accepted. Sophie had wished for you and in return you'd gotten more than you could ever ask for. Ending 9a: Everyone Wants Cheerleaders <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<silently>>\ <<set $playerAge to 16>> <<set $playerMaturity to 16>> <<set $voiceClassOverride to 6>> <<set $endingTraitSophieFangirl16 to true>> <<set $endingTraitSophieFangirl7 to false>> <</silently>>\ <<saveEnding "Sophie" 15>><<include "Reset state for ending start">>\ You grimaced as Sophie considered her options. As far as you were aware there were no limitations about what she could do. Mom likely wouldn't let her do anything that was actively harmful, but as long as you were a normalish little girl, she'd probably agree to it. The fact that Sophie was taking a while to decide might mean she didn't have anything particularly devious, or potentially she had something incredibly devious and wanted to plan it out as well as possible. Finally she beckoned your mother to lean down, whispering her final decision into her ear. Mom smiled, @@.momVoice;"yes. I think that would be very appropriate."@@ She turned back to you and her smile only widened. You quailed at her gaze, was she was enjoying this? This all seemed a little extreme to encourage you to get along better with Emily. You'd save questioning her parenting style until you were back to normal. She began to wave her hands and chant, a gentle glow flowing from her hands over to you. Tingles began to flow across your body, making the hairs rise on the back of your neck. There was nothing you could do but watch as the changes washed over your body. [[Weather the changes|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 2]]One thing you had to appreciate in all of this was that the changes never really hurt. There was some discomfort to be sure, but that was more your own mental discomfort rather than physical. Hell, plenty of times during the party you hadn't even noticed that changes had occurred until after you'd had a moment to reflect. This time though there was nothing else to focus on, so you were able to take in as it happened. <<if $oldPlayerAge >= 10>>You'd never actually gotten as young as the girls, but you got the feeling you were about to.<<else>>You'd already regressed down to their age before, so you had some idea of what to expect.<</if>> There was something a little different about this transformation, but you couldn't quite put your finger on it. You watched as your entire body slimmed down. Once again losing those hard earned muscles, though it was currently beneath your notice that it wasn't accompanied by the same feelings of weakness you'd had before. Your limbs looked long and supple, at least compared to your decreasing stature. There was something oddly fascinating about watching every hair fall out of your arm, but then disappear before it hit the floor. It seemed that mom had ensured the magic didn't make too much of a mess. Your arms and legs had become smooth long before the transformation had actually finished. Something you were able to confirm when your pants suddenly fell down. You'd hurriedly grabbed at them, but your arms weren't the length you'd expected; despite how quick you'd been you missed the grab. Luckily your shirt now served as a sort of dress. For a moment it was a dangerously short dress, but that quickly changed. Covering you all the way down to your knees. It was a slightly annoying situation, surely mom could have made it so your clothes changed with you. If you could change a human being, how hard could some fabric be? Then again this was supposed to be a punishment so perhaps that was part of it. [[The changes continued|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 3]] <<set $playerAge to 11>>\You were stuck in your impromptu dress as the changes finished washing over you. Your body had shrunk down before a lot of the other details about you had changed. You could feel a tickle of hair on your back, pulling a strand around you were able to watch as it changed from it's normal dark brown to a bright blonde. The same color as your sister, but not the same as your mother's. You'd always wondered where in the family tree it came from. Though the length was more annoying than the color. If you didn't style it, it'd end up flying all over the place whenever you moved. You didn't want that kind of hassle. Your face tingled, making changes that you couldn't see but seemed to be fascinating the others. There was a momentary blur in your vision, forcing you to blink. When you re-opened them your bright blue eyes met Sophie sparkling green ones. Her eyes looked dangerous, it looked like she was looking for a fight. Not that you were in any condition to fight, your legs felt steadier now but that didn't mean you were ready for a dust up. Not that you had any reason to fight Sophie, but something in her eyes made you want to challenge her. That strange feeling held on even as your body settled into it's final form. You felt small and delicate, but that was in relation to your perceptions as a sixteen year old boy. By the look in Miki's eyes she was rather more impressed with the result. Such a point of pride, having a six year old think you cut an impressive figure, you wanted to see that same look in Sophie's eye, now that would mean something. [[The aftermath|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 4]] <<silently>>\ <<set $playerMaturity to 9>>\ <<set $playerAge to 9>>\ <<set $epilogueStartAge to $playerAge>>\ <<set $endingTraitSophieRival9 to true>>\ <<set $voiceClassOverride to 7>> <<set $traitGraceful to true>> <<set $traitAthletic to true>> <</silently>>You took stock of the situation. Your best guess was that you'd ended up the same age as Sophie. A quick glance confirmed that she was a touch taller than you, but not by much. <<if $oldPlayerAge >= 10>>You weren't exactly sure how a nine year old girl body was supposed to feel, but this seemed normal enough.<<else>>You'd been this age before, but it felt rather more normal this time. Perhaps that was a bad sign for your mental state. <<if $traitCatgirl>>Though there was a lot less going on now. For example, you no longer had @@.girlVoice;cat ears@@.<</if>><</if>> If anything, it was a little suspicious. Sophie had clearly made a distinct request and 'make <<playerName>> nine', didn't seem like it would fit the bill. Which meant there was something else going on. <<playerVoice "\"Okay Sophie, what's the catch?\"">> @@.sophieVoice;"Catch?"@@ She did her best innocent look, @@.sophieVoice;"You're just an entirely normal nine year old girl."@@ You narrowed your eyes at her, but she didn't budge. You were confident she was messing with you, but she wasn't forthcoming with any more information. You'd have to figure out any weirdnesses on your own. For now you were stuck with this body. So you shrugged and walked back to finish your breakfast. You could work on getting a proper outfit afterwards. Right now you were hungry. The walk revealed one additional feeling. Your body felt //great//. It felt like your entire being was thrumming with energy. You knew kids had more energy, but this was on another level. You wanted to run and jump through a field, leaping chasms and climbing mountains, and it felt like you'd be able to do it. It was hard to compare to the old you, but it felt like you might actually be fitter than before. You weren't 'strong', after all you were nine, but you didn't feel weak either. Strange. Hard to know if that was normal for this form, or part of Sophie's plot. Either way, food first, concerns later. [[Everyone ate breakfast|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 5]] <<silently>>\ <<set $traitEnergetic to true>>\ <<set $traitCompetitive to true>>\ <</silently>><<Image 'Endings/SophieHigh/Day1Outfit.webp' "topRightCorner">>\ During breakfast you tried to prod Sophie for more information but the best you got was @@.sophieVoice;"Oh, we're gonna have fun this week you and me."@@ She wouldn't elaborate any further. You doubted it would stop at just getting stuck in grade 4 again. You couldn't remember much about what sort of work you'd have, but you figured that part would work itself out. After breakfast mom insisted that you get something to wear that wasn't an oversized men's t-shirt, threatening to slip off of your shoulders. Sophie and Emily were more than happy to oblige the request. <<if $oldPlayerAge <=12>>Once again going through Emily's magic closet for something that fit the bill.<<else>>You'd thought that whatever they picked would be too small, since you were still bigger than Emily, but it seemed a little magic smoothed that over.<</if>> Though they didn't stop there. You had an entire week ahead of you, which meant at least six outfits. Though neither you nor Sophie had the patience to do all of that now. Plus Sophie said that since the two of you were so closely sized you'd also be able to borrow her clothes. Perhaps it was that influence which ensured your new outfit wasn't as girly as you'd expected. Yes it was a purple shirt with a rainbow unicorn and yes it was a denim skirt with a floral belt but...okay you had to admit that your baseline had clearly drifted if this didn't count as girly. Still, you'd seen Emily in much girlier outfits and she could have picked any of them. @@.sophieVoice;"Hmmm. Cute enough, I suppose it'll have to do for now."@@ You quirked an eyebrow. Sophie was acting so strangely. Then again strange was a relative term when you'd just had your gender swapped and age regressed. You were sure you'd figure it out eventually. The two of you had been fairly friendly at the party, you doubted it was anything too nasty. [[School week|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 6]]As you walked to school with Emily you braced yourself for the upcoming day. It'd been a while since you were in grade 4 so memories were hazy. Plus there was the usual trepidation about being with a new group of people. Even if it was a bunch of kids that you were only going to know for a week, it was human nature to be concerned. You'd say that everyone wants to fit in, but you most emphatically did not want to 'fit in'. You were going to get through this week and then get back to normal life. You'd play nice of course, pissing off mom sounded like a recipe for an even longer time in a skirt, but that was it. Finally you arrived. Sophie was already waiting for you at the entrance. @@.sophieVoice;"Took the two of you long enough, I was starting to think you'd chickened out entirely."@@ Emily spoke up in your defence, @@.emilyVoice;"Now now, you can't rush it. A girl needs time to get ready."@@ You weren't thrilled with that defence, but it was enough to have Sophie back off. @@.sophieVoice;"Come on. I'll show you the way."@@ She gestured and then turned, walking away before you could even respond. Leaving you forced to jog to catch up. The school wasn't terribly big so it wasn't long before you'd gotten to class. Somehow Sophie had already secured you a seat right beside her. Sitting down you tried to get your bearings. Grade 4 wasn't quite as extreme as you'd expected. There were some colourful informational posters on the wall, but that was the only thing that stood out. Otherwise it was fairly similar to your high school classroom. It made sense, they were on the cusp of not being children, they wouldn't want the room to be silly and kiddy anymore. It was time to become serious students. Or at least that's what you supposed they felt. From your perspective it was clear that they were still kids. We were still kids, you corrected. You didn't want to join in too much, but you didn't want to cause a stir. It wouldn't go well if you started acting like you were so above it all. Looking over to Sophie her sparkling emerald eyes met yours. It seemed she'd been watching you the entire time. She grinned at you, but you just rolled her eyes. [[Class began|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 7]]The entire day you were waiting for the other shoe to drop. Where it would turn out you were an awful student? Or too clumsy to play tag? Or any of a dozen other potential quirks? The suspicion continued over the day but you hadn't caught anything untoward. Your education had been stripped down to an age appropriate level, but you were still keeping up. You weren't going to be an exceptional student, but you'd do alright. As for being clumsy, if anything it was the opposite. A game of tag at lunch had revealed that Sophie and you were two of the fittest people in the entire grade. Puberty hadn't really kicked in yet so the boys were on an even playing field with the girls. Though Sophie still seemed to take a special pleasure in catching some of the more arrogant boys. You'd accuse her of being arrogant as well, you'd certainly thought so at the party, but watching her here among her peers had changed your mind. It wasn't unearned arrogance, it was earned confidence. Certainly she was brash about it, but she was awfully athletic compared to the rest. Which made it even more odd that you could keep up. At the party the girls had been pushing you towards a more stereotypical little girl, weak and delicate. Now you were even more suspicious. There //had// to be something you were missing. [[The day continued|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 8]]Only at the end of the day were Sophie's intentions finally revealed. At the final bell you were ready to find Emily and head home, glad to be done the day. Sophie had other ideas. @@.sophieVoice;"No rushing away you,"@@ she grabbed your hand, @@.sophieVoice;"we've got practice to go to."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Practice?\"">> Suspicion crept into your voice, <<playerVoice "\"practice for what exactly?\"">> @@.sophieVoice;"Gymnastics of course,"@@ she smiled innocently, @@.sophieVoice;"no need to be so suspicious. Now come on, I wanna show you off."@@ It turned out the gym where Sophie practised wasn't particularly far away, though she was still scant on details even as you walked. She dragged you into the changing room despite your protests. @@.sophieVoice;"You're a girl now, you're allowed to be in here. Stop being a baby."@@ Sophie was an indomitable force when she wanted something. She wasn't about to let something like, 'you used to be a sixteen year old boy,' stop her from getting you into a leotard. [[Get dressed|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 9]]<<Image 'Endings/SophieHigh/Leotard1.webp' "topRightCorner">>\ You got lucky on two fronts. First there were stalls available, so you could change without being out in the open. Second, it seemed like you'd come early enough that foot traffic was low. There was one other girl who came in, but you just @@.girlVoice;hid in the stall@@ until she left. @@.sophieVoice;"Come on. There's no one else here. You're taking forever."@@ Hesitantly you exited the stall. It wasn't just the possibility of others that had you nervous, you also weren't sure about your own garb. In truth it was a very simple one piece leotard with no sleeves. A little pink and black design with a few sequins for visual appeal. You knew it'd come from Sophie's wardrobe, which only made the whole situation all the more surreal. <<playerVoice "\"Are all your leotards pink?\"">> It was a weak attempt to diffuse your own anxieties. She rolled her eyes in response, but then grinned, @@.sophieVoice;"The pink suits you. I've got to make you look good for your first day. Anyway,"@@ a gentle flush crept onto her cheeks, @@.sophieVoice;"I like pink."@@ Another time you would have teased her about this. She always seemed somewhat embarrassed about some of her more 'girly' interests and this was a prime opportunity to needle her. However, you also got the feeling she was revealing this just to make you feel better. So you let her off the hook. Meekly giving a, <<playerVoice "\"thanks,\"">> as the two of you went back out to the main gym. [[Time for practice|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 10]]Your anxieties only got worse as the two of you got onto the floor. It wasn't a massive gym, but it was packed with equipment, a large empty space in the center. Sophie would later inform you it was for practising 'floor routines'. At this point you didn't really care about any of the equipment, you felt ridiculous in this leotard. No one was paying you any attention, there was nothing at all odd about appearance from their perspective, but you still felt @@.girlVoice;awkward and exposed@@. @@.sophieVoice;"Breathe,"@@ Sophie whispered into your ear, @@.sophieVoice;"I'm the only one who knows anything, you're fine."@@ She leaned back and raised her voice, @@.sophieVoice;"now come on, let's practice."@@ There was a cough from behind you, @@.coachVoice;"I'll be the judge of that."@@ The two of you turned, @@.sophieVoice;"Ah coach. Of course, I meant after you said okay."@@ You'd learned something new about Sophie, she was a terrible liar. Coach, you didn't have an actual name yet, smoothly continued, @@.coachVoice;"Welcome to our gym. Sophie tells me you have some experience. I'll need to see what you can do before I let you run loose."@@ She took the two of you to the empty mat, @@.coachVoice;"Let's see a move or two. Whatever you feel comfortable with."@@ You didn't feel comfortable with anything right now. Your previous attempt at gymnastics had been dicey at best. But Sophie seemed entirely comfortable, clasping your shoulder, @@.sophieVoice;"Come on girl. You've got this, go for it."@@ Staring at the expanse of empty space you considered what you should try. [[Round-off (Easy)|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 11]] [[Handstand Forward Roll (Easy)|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 11]] [[Back Handspring (Medium)|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 11]] [[Front Handspring (Medium)|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 11]]You let out a breath as you cleanly landed the move. Sophie clapped, though the coach was less impressed. You were in shock. How had you just managed a move like that? It wasn't flawless, but it was a solid attempt and you knew you could do better next time. @@.sophieVoice;"Told you it'd be fine. Now try something a little more your level,"@@ Sophie's voice made it clear that she wanted you to raise your level, not lower it, @@.sophieVoice;"you know all the moves I do after all."@@ Your eyes widened in surprise, even as the coach looked even less convinced. So //that// was the game. The increased athleticism, the excellent balance, the precise bodily control. This wasn't the form of some average nine year old, this was the body of nine year old gymnast. Apparently one on par with Sophie, because all of your knowledge had actually come from her. So you literally knew everything she did about gymnastics, and had the skills to execute it. What ensued was an extremely impressive sequence of moves. It wasn't a proper floor routine; you were haphazardly chaining moves, and entirely skipping the artistic component, but it was an excellent demonstration of your capabilities. When you finally came to a rest, once again sticking the landing, you could feel the sweat beading on your forehead. Your heart was pounding and you were breathing heavily. But it wasn't because you were tired. Far from it, @@.girlVoice;you were elated@@, you felt like you could do this for days. It was the exhilaration. You'd never felt anything like this. It was one thing to be able to do a pull-up like you used to, but this was something extraordinary. You had practically flown across the mat, twisting and spinning and flipping on a whim. This body was capable of marvels and you @@.girlVoice;loved how it felt@@. [[The coach clapped|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 12]]@@.coachVoice;"Seems you weren't exaggerating Sophie, she's quite impressive. Though she does share some of your bad habits."@@ Coach fixed Sophie with a mild glare. Later Sophie confided in you that she'd been slacking a little lately and not working on fixing those habits. @@.coachVoice;"But clearly experienced enough that I don't have to be concerned. You have free reign. If you need anything just shout, otherwise I'll check on you every so often."@@ With that she walked away, her gaze fixed on a girl doing a terrible job on a balance beam. She wasn't gripping enough with her toes, that was going to make proper balance impossible. @@.sophieVoice;"Come on, let's have some fun."@@ She grabbed your hand, breaking you from your private critiques. As she pulled you over to the vault you ruminated on how you'd recognized balance beam girl's mistake. However, it wasn't something you could really discuss in public. So for now you followed Sophie's lead as she practised a variety of flips. Turned out today was just a drop-in free practice session. There were no lessons or schedule to worry about. Which meant the two of you had the run of the place. You took full advantage of that. Trying to get yourself onto every piece of equipment you could find. Just because you mentally knew how to do the move, didn't mean you knew how it felt. Knowing the mechanics of an aerial flip was a pale imitation of feeling the wind whipping through your hair. Of feeling the fine control as you twisted your body, all in preparation of a clean landing. Sophie had been true to her word, you were capable of everything she was. She'd had an edge at first, as you were getting used to the feeling and figuring out your limits. However it wasn't long until the two of you were pushing each other into moves at the very edge of your abilities. Safely of course, the two of you had been doing this long enough that you weren't stupid...well Sophie had been doing it and you'd gotten a copy of knowledge. It was weird having knowledge you had no memory of learning, but it was awfully handy. [[Practice ended|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 13]]By the time practice ended, you were completely wiped, and Sophie was no better. You'd both pushed pretty damn hard today, and you did have some limits. God it was the @@.girlVoice;most fun you'd ever had@@. The ease at which you could do such complex manoeuvres was intoxicating. It made you want to keep pushing further, so that you'd be capable of even more. The smile didn't leave either of your faces until you'd left the building. You'd been riding enough of a high that you hadn't even worried about the change room this time. As if the pure feeling wasn't enough, Coach had gone out of her way to compliment both of you on your performance. Though Sophie received some gentle admonishment about not working that hard the rest of the time. Out of earshot Sophie finally revealed the full shape of her plot. @@.sophieVoice;"I wasn't done beating you,"@@ she confided, @@.sophieVoice;"so I wanted another week to prove I'm better than you. But this time we'd start on even footing."@@ It took you a few moments to process this. You knew Sophie had enjoyed your little competitions, but you'd never thought she would take it this far. Making you her literal equal was an interesting choice. She could have just as easily requested that you were strictly inferior to her. Make it easy to crush you at everything you tried all week. But no, she'd wanted a rival, someone on her level, at least for the week. @@.sophieVoice;"Same time tomorrow?"@@ The hopefulness was obvious in her voice, and you had no intention of declining. <<playerVoice "\"Totally,\"">> you might not like being a little girl, but if you were stuck this way you could at least enjoy it. Plus you @@.girlVoice;couldn't think of anything more fun@@ than jumping around, barely touching the ground. [[The next day|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 14]]The rest of the next day might as well have not existed until the school day was done. You'd spent the entirety of class staring at the clock, watching the seconds painfully tick by, counting down towards your freedom. It was enough that the teacher had even called you out on it. You took the small lecture with an appropriate amount of contrition. It had been a long time since a teacher had talked to you that way, like you were, well, a child. It was more intimidating when they nearly doubled your height. Still you managed to apologize well enough that you got out of any real trouble. The real nightmare would have been having to stay for detention. You didn't want to miss any gym time this week. Neither did Sophie. So when the bell rang the two of you were out the door like a shot, racing each other to the gym. The two of you were panting and sweating even before you'd had time to change. Not that it was going to slow either of you down. Another boon of this body was the recovery time. If there had been any soreness you'd acquired yesterday, it was gone now. You'd run yourself ragged and you still felt one hundred percent ready to go. And go you did. Now that you were comfortable with this body you were ready to push it to the limit. You even managed one move that Sophie couldn't replicate as cleanly, much to her chagrin. Afterwards she confronted you on that point. @@.sophieVoice;"How were you able to do that? I thought we knew the same things!"@@ She wasn't actually angry, despite her tone. But it'd been a long while since someone her age had been able to outperform her. You didn't know for sure, <<playerVoice "\"you're a little taller than me. Maybe that changes the leverage point?\"">> At this point you'd stopped being surprised by all the random knowledge you had. @@.sophieVoice;"Maybe...and maybe if I..."@@ Sophie looked like she was about to go back in the gym to try again, but you both did need to get home. You would settle it tomorrow. [[Wednesday|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 15]]<<Image 'Endings/SophieHigh/Leotard2.webp' "topRightCorner">>\ It was clear Sophie had been thinking on the move all night and was ready to practice it until she got it. So that's what you both did, spending the entire practice session working on that singular move. Working on getting Sophie just a little tighter so she could stick the landing. Naturally the coach came over to assist, but didn't stay long. The two of you had the gist of what Sophie needed to do, it was just a matter of practice. In the end she got it almost as cleanly as you, which was enough to satisfy her for the day. Though she had a little surprise for you when you both came in the next day. @@.sophieVoice;"Here,"@@ she handed you a leotard you didn't recognize. You'd been borrowing her stuff all week, and you would normally tease her about having //another// pink leotard, but this one somehow felt different. <<playerVoice "\"What's this?\"">> It was a @@.girlVoice;very pretty@@ garment, predominantly pink but white around the collar with silver and gold streaks intertwining across the torso. @@.sophieVoice;"It's for you. I thought you should have your own, so you weren't borrowing mine all the time."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Aw, that's so sweet. But I don't really...\"">> your words trailed off. @@.sophieVoice;"I know,"@@ the melancholy was heavy in her voice, @@.sophieVoice;"still, I hope you like it."@@ You'd both avoided saying the words that neither of you wanted to say. You didn't really need your own outfit because you'd only be a girl for a couple more days. This was almost your last practice. Wasn't like 16 year old male you could suddenly take up the sport and compete. Still you put on your @@.girlVoice;best smile@@ and slipped into your @@.girlVoice;new leotard@@. It fit perfectly. Maybe it was the sweet gift or maybe it was because you both knew this was coming to an end, but you didn't feel as competitive today. You were still trying things, but it was more congenial and sedate. That would change on the last day. [[Final practice|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 16]]@@.sophieVoice;"Alright. Competition time."@@ Sophie stated bluntly as you left the change room. <<playerVoice "\"What?\"">> @@.sophieVoice;"You've had a week to get used to...everything. So now it's time to put it to the test. Coach will judge which one of us is better."@@ That dangerous glimmer had re-entered her eyes. The two of you were growing close, but she wasn't going to hold back anything today. She wanted to beat you. To prove to you that all that 'arrogance' you'd accused her of was more than warranted. You felt much the same and were determined to match every bit of her ferocity. The change had the coach in near shock. You both were a little stiff on the artistic sections, but she'd never seen Sophie be so precise with her movements. Especially when she was going for some pretty complicated moves. You were no slouch yourself, matching Sophie move for move. Wincing at every slight mistake. A little stumble on a landing, an insufficient tuck on a flip. There was still so much you wanted to improve, but you had to focus on right now. You were //not// going to let Sophie beat you. By the time it was done the two of you were genuinely exhausted, sitting on the ground sweating and panting. Youthful recovery or not you were going to feel this tomorrow. Which only left the matter of the results. [[The results|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 17]]@@.coachVoice;"I just want to say I'm very proud of both of you. That was some impressive work, best I've seen out of either of you.@@ She took a pause, @@.coachVoice;"It was a close thing. At first I thought I'd just eyeball the comparison, but it was tight enough I actually marked it all down. In anything less serious than a professional competition I'd just say you tied."@@ @@.coachVoice;"However,"@@ Coach met both of your eyes, still fierce despite the fatigue, @@.coachVoice;"neither of you would accept a tie so...by the numbers, the winner is...Sophie. Congratulations.@@ You expected some excitement, some cheering and maybe even some teasing, but you got nothing. She simply nodded in acknowledgement and got to her feet. @@.sophieVoice;"I'm going to head home now. I'm pretty beat,"@@ and with that she was off to the change room, nary a word about her victory. Coach sighed, @@.coachVoice;"It's a real shame this is your last day with us. I've never seen Sophie that fired up. With the two of you driving each other, no telling how far you could go."@@ You nodded, but didn't have too much else to say. Following Sophie's lead, though too late to catch her, you got yourself changed and headed home as well. Haphazardly throwing your bag onto your bed when you got there, your new leotard half slipping out. You pulled it out and stared at it. Sophie had gotten this just for you, even knowing you wouldn't wear it more than twice. Just because she was enjoying your competition so much. Maybe you could...no...that'd be crazy. You set the leotard aside and continued with your evening. Both your mom and Emily noticed your melancholy, though neither pushed on the matter. There was so much going on it was probably best to leave you some space. Not long after you went to bed, mentally and physically exhausted. [[You dreamt|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 18]]Your dreams that night were pleasant though somewhat surprising. Sophie and you had been at each other's throats at the party, but now you were the best of friends. You ran back all of the fun times you and Sophie had at the gym these last few days. All the moves you'd managed to do, all the ones you wanted to try. Watching the smile on Sophie's face when she finally landed that tricky twist. Things that you would never see or do again. When you woke up your melancholy had only deepened. This would be so much easier if you'd hated the whole experience. But no, you'd enjoyed almost every part of it. Now that you knew Sophie better all that brashness and confidence seemed well earned. You knew how hard she had to work to get where she was, and it made you want to work just as hard. You'd never had something feel so //good// as gymnastics had. You could pour your heart and soul into the competition and not regret a moment. Furthermore, you still couldn't get over the fact Sophie had beat you yesterday. You weren't mad, there was no reason to be mad, but it made you want to work even harder to get back at her. The feeling was intoxicating, a powerful drive that motivated you like never before. You glanced over, seeing that you'd left the leotard beside you all night. In a strange way it was the source of all these divergent feelings, good and bad...but were there even any bad feelings? You looked @@.girlVoice;super cute@@ in it, and it'd been a @@.girlVoice;lot of fun@@. The rest of the girls were supposed to come over today before you turned back. Maybe it was a chance to show it off one more time before you'd have to give it up. As you held it there was a tingle in your fingers. You assumed it was just your excitement, but it sort of felt like mom's magic. Regardless you slipped the leotard on, throwing the rest of your clothes over top. It wasn't the most comfortable thing, but it'd be a fun little surprise. At least that's what you'd expected to happen. In reality you never even got the chance. [[Mom stopped you|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 19]]There were still a few hours left before the girl's arrival when mom caught you in the living room. @@.momVoice;"Emily tells me you've been very good this week. Even she hadn't expected you and Sophie to get along so well, and for you to play along so completely. As a reward I'll restore you to your normal self now. Then you can go out and do whatever you wish, I'll take care of the girls today."@@ You almost shook your head, you had really wanted the other girls to see what you could do. Your own little gymnastics demonstration, before you got all big and clunky again. But you couldn't exactly tell your mom that. So you just stared. Which she took as an acknowledgement. Once again you felt her magic wash over you. Hoping that, at a minimum, your clothes changed with you this time. Shrinking out of an outfit was embarrassing, but not destructive. Growing up would shred your @@.girlVoice;favourite leotard@@. You waited for the changes, closing your eyes so you could try and feel which parts changed and how...you waited...and waited...and waited... You opened your eyes, confirming what you'd been feeling. You were entirely unchanged. Glancing at mom it seemed this hadn't been an intentional misdirect on her part. Her look slid from confusion to concern as she took in the situation. Finally her expression changed into one of suspicion. @@.momVoice;"Are you wearing something underneath your outfit?"@@ Mom's voice was cool, but you could tell something was off. It wasn't like you were embarrassed about your current fashion choices, but how did she know and why did it matter? [[Admit the truth|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 20]]<<playerVoice "\"My leotard.\"">> Saying it out loud was a little more embarrassing than you'd thought. Here you were, ostensibly excited to get turned back into a teenage boy, and you were wearing a @@.girlVoice;pink leotard@@. To your surprise your mother smiled. @@.momVoice;"You really enjoyed your time with Sophie, didn't you?"@@ You gently nodded. @@.momVoice;"I thought so,"@@ your mother continued, @@.momVoice;"it must be exhilarating to be able to use your body that way. An inspiration to push yourself even further. I heard Sophie managed to beat you yesterday, and I'm guessing you want a chance to get your revenge."@@ You stood, stunned. Leave it to your mother to see the truth of things, even things you weren't ready to admit to yourself. She knelt down so you were eye to eye, her intensity was almost overwhelming. The gravity of the situation was obvious. [[She explained|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 21]]@@.momVoice;"I gave you this form for that very reason,"@@ she began, @@.momVoice;"the entire situation is...complicated, but suffice to to say this form was no accident. Sophie provided the inspiration, but it was influenced by your soul."@@ @@.momVoice;"You didn't get along with Sophie, because you saw her with all these things you could never have. Now that you do, you've quickly become best friends. There is no reason that has to stop."@@ Her voice trailed off for a moment, letting the implications of her words sink in. She was saying you could stay this way. She brushed your hair out of your face, @@.momVoice;"If you wish, and only if you wish, you can remain this way indefinitely. Live your life as Sophie's rival and best friend."@@ She stood again, @@.momVoice;"it's obvious you're comfortable in the form, the joy has been written on your face all week. But it is your choice. Go to the bathroom. If you wish to remain this way, keep the leotard on, if not, remove it and return. Understand?"@@ [[You nodded|Sophie Low Happiness Ending 22]]You closed the door to the bathroom behind you, stripping off the rest of your clothes, leaving you clad only in your @@.girlVoice;leotard@@. Mom was right, it suited you. Not only did you like how it looked, but you liked how it made you feel. It wasn't just the garment itself, but all the feelings it engendered in you. It made you feel strong and confident. The strength was far more than physical. Your sixteen year old self had been an order of magnitude stronger, but bigger muscles had never made you actually feel good about yourself. All that time in the gym had just been rote, putting in no serious effort. There was no joy in it, it was just something you were 'supposed to do'. Now you had something that you @@.girlVoice;loved@@. Something would happily work at every day. Every success lifting you higher and every failure making you want to work harder. Your success would be in your own hands, down to your own drive and determination. You had all the tools to excel. You were equal to Sophie in every way. No more need for jealousy, you had all she did, if you wished to take it. [[Leave it on|Sophie Low Happiness Leave On 1]] [[Take it off|Sophie Low Happiness Take Off 1]]As much as you had loved your time in this form, it didn't truly feel like you. You were supposed to be older, you'd been on this planet to long to go back to being nine. You had a newfound respect for Sophie abilities, but your feelings weren't competitive. Seeing her improve would be a sight to behold, but you weren't going to be her rival. You returned from the bathroom with the leotard in hand rather than under your clothes. Mom gave a subtle nod, @@.momVoice;"Put it down over there, otherwise it will cause trouble."@@ You had zero idea of how a leotard could cause any issue when it came to powerful magic, but she was the expert, so you put it on the couch. You awaited a second casting of the spell. [[The magic washed over you|Sophie Low Happiness Take Off 2]]This time when the magic hit you, you could feel the changes. A sense of vertigo dizzying you as you shot back up, inches at a time. Luckily your outfit did seem to be keeping up. It was a girl's outfit, but you didn't want to be naked, and Emily would kill you if you tore one of her outfits. Your limbs quickly followed suit, though there was a funny moment when you'd been stuck with far too short arms on a quickly lengthening torso. A torso that was also gaining some of it's mass back. You'd been strong as a nine year old, but it didn't compare to the real muscles you'd earned in the gym. It was a little unfair in truth, that guys were able to build muscle so much easier, but it was a discussion for another day. You were almost back to full size now, but a few crucial details hadn't changed yet. For one you were still basically hairless, save for the still too long hair tickling your neck. Still, it was only a matter of time, the changes were slowing down so that would all come in shortly. Which it did, kinda. You could see hairs on your arms and legs, but they were extremely fine, barely visible at a distance. You huffed in frustration. What was going on? Dimly becoming aware that your dramatic sigh had caused some uncharacteristic bouncing. You'd felt the mass coming back to your chest and ass, and had assumed it was just muscle. Now that you stared at it you were increasingly unsure. The mounds of flesh on your chest were well past what anyone could call pecs, and they were still growing. [[The changes finished|Sophie Low Happiness Take Off 3]]<<silently>>\ <<set $playerAge to 16>> <<set $playerMaturity to 16>> <<set $endingTraitSophieRival16 to true>> <<set $endingTraitSophieRival9 to false>> <<set $voiceClassOverride to 6>> <<set $showTeenNPCDescriptions to true>> <</silently>>\ As the changes slowed to a stop you were still several inches shorter than you'd been originally. However, diminished height was not the thing that currently held your gaze. That honor was held by the two breasts, there was no other word for them, hanging off your chest. <<playerVoice "\"Mom?\"">> Your words trailed off, demanding an explanation in their absence. @@.momVoice;"Interesting. Yet you don't seem upset."@@ To your surprise you had to admit she was right, you'd been shocked by the unexpected form, but it didn't feel unpleasant. She took on a lecturing tone, @@.momVoice;"Soul magic is complex, but in short; you accepted a gift befitting your other form. Not only accepted, but used it, loved it, truly making it yours. That sort of thing has consequences. I'd thought you were just borrowing Sophie's stuff, I hadn't realized she'd taken that initiative."@@ @@.momVoice;"Well sweetie,"@@ her voice was concerningly sweet, @@.momVoice;"looks like you'll be spending a little longer as a girl."@@ The feeling in your heart was complicated. You'd wanted to get back to who you were, but you'd also wanted to keep playing with Sophie, that conflict had left you in this half state. The ensuing discussion revealed that, at least for the moment, there was nothing to be done. Next week you'd go back to high school and resume normal life until further notice. A simple charm would make everyone accept that you were a girl. A simple hitch in the mind before declaring 'of course she's always been a girl'. The human mind was lazy, easier to believe that memory was faulty than that a boy suddenly turned into a girl. Your protests were half hearted at best, going through the motions of objecting. Yet your heart wasn't in it, part you was glad she wasn't going to turn you back. Perhaps she'd figure something else out eventually. [[Back to school|Sophie Low Happiness Take Off 4]]It was remarkable how quickly you fell back into your normal routines. School really wasn't all that different than before. Sure you hung with the girls rather than the boys, but half the time the conversations were the same. Speaking of boys, they //really// needed to be more discreet about where they were staring. You definitely had no interest in exploring that side of your, now more mature, femininity. The idea of holding a boy's hand, let alone kissing one was gross. You didn't need stubble scratching your face. Though your current chromosomal makeup did allow for one activity you'd been bereft of before. Sophie's gymnastics gym was still open to you. It wasn't that men weren't allowed in there, but they were a drastic minority, and none past the age of ten. Seemed that gymnastics was still relegated to being a 'girly' activity. You didn't feel that way, there was a grace and elegance to it, but it also required a massive amount of physical strength and endurance. Something that this body had been blessed with. It seemed that you were the sixteen year old version of your previous gymnast self, one who had continued training. So you were in fantastic physical condition. Your skills were little better than they'd been at nine, so you were lightyears behind when it came to competition, but good enough to not stand out. Sophie wasn't sure how to feel about it at first. Your increased physical attributes meant you were able to outdo her at basically everything, at least for the moment. However, she was mollified by the fact you more than half a decade on her and all that knowledge had come from her anyway. To make it up to her, you made her an offer. You weren't ever going to be in competition shape, it would take too long for your skills to catch up. But you knew enough to be able to help her with her own training. Since you wanted to spend time in the gym anyway you were willing dedicate a some time to just helping her. An assistance that quickly branched out into other girls. Nothing official, but a pointer here or a correction. Coach noticed, and you were worried you might be kicked out. Instead you'd been taken on as an 'assistant coach', and were spending basically every night at the gym. [[Weeks passed|Sophie Low Happiness Take Off 5]]Initially you checked in every day with mom, if she'd figured out a way to make you a man again. It was to be expected. After continued rejections you started to ask only every few days, then once a week, once a month...after a while you couldn't even remember the last time you'd asked. You'd had a growing suspicion that there was no way back, but it was matched by a growing indifference to the idea. Between school and coaching you had too much on your mind to care. Being a girl wasn't all that different, and you enjoyed most of the changes that had come with it. Every thirty days or so you reconsidered that position, but on the whole you loved who you were. Coaching had given you a sense of purpose that you'd lacked previously. That new drive manifested itself in myriad ways. Your marks improved, you made new friends, you even got along better with your sister. A sister who had taken a while to warm to the idea of a 'big sister'. It was certainly an improvement on 'big brother', but she'd still liked the idea of 'baby sister'. Nonetheless she came around to it, especially once she realized your coaching prowess could help her with ballet as well. At this point the idea of ever going back to being a boy had completely left your head. You'd have to give up too much to ever want to make the swap, you were going to stay as <<playerName>> forever. And to think, if Coach hadn't guilted you about leaving, none of it might have happened. For want of a nail you supposed, but you didn't have time for philosophizing. Sophie had a competition coming up, and if you didn't kick her butt she'd get lazy again. You sighed, a coach's work is never done. But you still smiled, after all, you couldn't think of anything you'd rather do. Ending 8a: Thanks Coach <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "Sophie" 14>>You put your other clothes back on, over your leotard. The implications of this decision were dramatic, but you were still stuck on the fact you really wanted to show it off to the girls. Perhaps it wasn't the best reason to start a whole new life, but it felt right in the moment. Without saying anything your mother knew you decision, giving you a gentle smile before casting another spell. The tingles raced across your body, stronger than before. However, it still seemed that nothing was happening to your body, though it felt like your leotard was getting hotter by the moment. Perhaps wearing so many layers in summer wasn't a good idea, but this wasn't a normal heat. It built to the point that you were worried it was going to melt into you. Finally the heat abated and you were able to take a steadying breath. @@.momVoice;"How are you feeling?"@@ It was a normal question to which you had a shockingly normal answer, <<playerVoice "\"Great. I feel great.\"">> Your mother nodded, @@.momVoice;"I doubt you understood the metaphysical implications of accepting a gift like that, but in the end..."@@ she paused, realizing that this conversation was going over your head. You wouldn't have understood it at sixteen, considering your lack of magical training. At nine things were even more confusing. @@.momVoice;"Soul magic is complex, but in short; you accepted a gift with all your heart and soul. Not only accepted, but used it, loved it, truly making it yours. That sort of thing has consequences.
