In cases like this it resonates with your own soul, strengthening it."@@ [[Your confusion deepened|Sophie Low Happiness Leave On 3]]@@.momVoice;"Simply put I couldn't change you back as long as you kept wearing Sophie's gift. All my spell did was lock that resonance in."@@ Mom seemed like she had more to say, but was staying quiet for the moment. @@.momVoice;"Well your friends will be here soon, try not to cause too much trouble."@@ With that you hurried off to prepare for girl's arrival. The day itself was a @@.girlVoice;ton of fun@@. Just as you desired you got to show off your @@.girlVoice;new leotard@@. Jumping around the yard and showing all the new moves you were capable of. Sophie and you put on quite a display for the others. Though Kara insisted on putting a stop to it when it was clear you were both trying some risky moves not meant to be done on grass. She was right of course, but it'd been easy to get caught up in things. Since it wasn't a school night they were all able to stay over for dinner and even pretty late into the evening. By the time bed time came you were completely exhausted by all the fun you'd had. Collapsing onto your sheets before you'd even fully undressed, sleeping in your new @@.girlVoice;favorite garment@@. Once again your dreams were filled with the joys of the week, but this time you felt much less conflicted. They were just fun, there was no reason to hesitate about that, you could just enjoy yourself. When you finally awoke it felt like a burden had been lifted, you felt better than you ever had before, and you'd felt great this week. Still something else was different, but you couldn't quite place it. Either way you headed down to breakfast with a spring in your step. [[Breakfast|Sophie Low Happiness Leave On 4]]@@.emilyVoice;"You know you can't wear that leotard all the time, right?"@@ Emily had come down before you and was almost done her own meal. You flushed, you were still wearing your leotard, and you'd been wearing it all night. It was just so comfortable, it didn't feel like you were wearing anything, like it was a part of you. @@.momVoice;"Oh she can wear what she wants,"@@ mom countered. There was a flutter of happiness in your stomach. At her permission you wore it for the remainder of the day. Taking moments when you could do play around in the yard. Despite knowing it was silly, you even slept in it again. Which made it more surprising when you woke up the next morning and it was gone. You panicked, tearing apart your room looking for it. You threw on a robe and hurried downstairs where mom was drinking her morning coffee. <<playerVoice "\"Mom!\"">> You took a breath to calm down, <<playerVoice "\"my leotard is gone!\"">> You were struck with a sudden thought, <<playerVoice "\"did you take it to wash it?\"">> You tried your best to keep the accusatory tone out of your voice, but it was a somewhat dramatic suggestion. She would have had to strip you overnight for that to happen. @@.momVoice;"No need to panic sweetie, you still have it. In a manner of speaking."@@ //Why is she always so cryptic?// @@.momVoice;"It's part of you now. Although I suppose that isn't going to work for actual practice."@@ What did she mean [[part of you?|Sophie Low Happiness Leave On 5]]@@.momVoice;"When I said I couldn't change you back while you wore it I was serious. A gift accepted with your whole heart is a powerful thing. It would ward off any magic that tried to change you."@@ <<playerVoice "\"But I'm not wearing it anymore, it's gone,\"">> a fact you were still upset about. Mom set down her coffee and fixed you with an amused stare, @@.momVoice;"I think you understand exactly what happened."@@ You wanted to say you had no idea, but the knowledge had been lurking in the back of your mind. Obviously you couldn't really wear your leotard all the time, if nothing else you'd need to wash it. If it came off, the magic would weaken, over time it might weaken enough that you could even be turned into a boy again. So mom had made it possible to wear it all the time. Not in the physical world of course, but in your mind. Your self image could be of a nine year old in a leotard and whatever you wore in reality wouldn't change that. It had become a fundamental part of you, which meant that no one would //ever// be able to turn you back. You gave a wide smile to mom. It'd been exactly as she promised, you'd be able to stay this way forever. You just hadn't realized how important that leotard had been to the whole process. she smiled back, @@.momVoice;"it will take a little time but I'll get things set up so it's official. For now just say you're staying in town a few more weeks."@@ She didn't mention all the paperwork that she'd need to do, or the fact she'd also need to ensorcell a few people. You didn't need all the gory details, you were just a little girl, that was an adult concern. As celebratory gift she waved her hand and summoned a copy of the leotard. To the eye it was identical, but instinctively you could tell that it was just a copy. Still, it was the best you were going to do now that the original was literally inside you. [[Back to school|Sophie Low Happiness Leave On 7]]Your day back at school was quite enjoyable. It was fun progressively shocking every one of the girls. Your classmates just thought it was nice you could stay longer, but the group knew better. Emily was the first to get the shock when mom revealed you were going to walk to school together. Sophie was next, watching her eyes goggle out when you walked into the room was a joy. It was all you could do to not burst out laughing then and there, but you restrained yourself until lunch. Which was when you got to bring Kara and Miki up to speed. Both of them were excited, Miki moreso, but she was always the more excitable one. @@.karaVoice;"You're really staying this way?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"Mmmhmm.\"">> @@.sophieVoice;"And you say it's because I got you that leotard."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Yup.\"">> Your voice was light, but it was clear that Sophie was conflicted. She felt guilty about the situation, thinking she got stuck in this form. Except you didn't think of it as 'stuck' at all. You threw your arms around her, <<playerVoice "\"don't look so sad. I promise I'll let you win sometimes.\"">> @@.sophieVoice;"That not..."@@ she took another glance at you and your unrestrained smile. She matched it with her own, @@.sophieVoice;"Big talk. I won you last time, and I'll beat you again next time."@@ The two of you continued grinned at each other, drawing a laugh from Kara and Miki and an eyeroll from Emily. [[Back to the gym|Sophie Low Happiness Leave On 8]]<<silently>>\ <<set $endingTraitSophieRival9 to false>> <<set $endingTraitSophieRival16 to true>> <<set $voiceClassOverride to 6>> <<set $playerAge to 16>> <<set $playerMaturity to 16>> <</silently>>\ The coach was excited to see you back even if, at first, it was supposed to be for just a few weeks. Now with endless time to practice you and Sophie renewed your training regimen. Anyone who thought you'd drop your level was proven dead wrong. As hard as you'd both trained last week for your single competition, now you had the long view to consider. It wasn't about beating Sophie at the end of the week, it was about beating Sophie every week, for months and even years. So the two of you spent all the time you could in the gym. Though you both knew better than to neglect your studies. You actually managed to get some pretty good marks, though more from sheer bloodymindedness than raw intelligence. That intensive work ethic meant you could succeed at anything you tried, as long you had time to work at it. Emily sometimes complained that you never spent any time with her, but she still much preferred it to the old you. This competitive nature didn't abate as the two of you grew older, even at the beginning of high school you were both still clashing at every competition. This rivalry having driven you both to higher heights. You were already considered stars at the local level, but buzz about you was starting to make it's way into the wider world. So your paths were set. You were both gunning for college scholarships in gymnastics. Though this still meant education was important, as much as it sometimes bored you. Luckily you always had the two of each other to fall back on, helping each other with academics as much as gymnastics. [[Becoming a woman|Sophie Low Happiness Leave On 9]]As you grew from girls into women your bodies went through dramatic changes. Sophie always stayed a little taller, and you grudgingly admitted, a little stronger. While you stayed slighter. Though of the two of you, you were the one who had been 'blessed' with the bigger chest, much to Sophie's chagrin. Though she got her vengeance when you had to deal with the discomfort of constricting sports bras. Naturally your fit figures cut a rather appealing look, bolstered by the fact you'd both become co-captains of the cheerleading squad. Neither of you took cheer too seriously, but it was still good practice, and looked good on an entrance application. This combination of factors meant that you drew //a lot// of attention from horny teenage boys. In fact, you got even more attention than Sophie. She claimed it was because you, in her words, had 'cow tits'. A term that annoyed you to no end, even more when she emphasized the point by grabbing them from behind. Initially you'd said it was because she was too scary, but she claimed that none of the boys were her type. Though at the time only the two of you knew how true her statement was. Much to the frustration of the legion of boys, neither of you ever even gave them the time of day. The claim was that you needed to focus on competition, especially the one that was coming up soon. [[The competition|Sophie Low Happiness Leave On 10]]@@.sophieVoice;"You ready?"@@ Sophie was doing final checks on her outfit, nervously tugging at it to make it sit perfectly. It was cute seeing her so flustered when she was normally so brash, but you understood. Rumour had it there was going to be a scout in the audience, coming to see if all the buzz about the two of you was justified. It was still a bit of a pipe dream but this might even be the first step towards competing in the Olympics. But that was a dream for another day, today you just had to keep focused on the competition. <<playerVoice "\"Ready to kick your butt. As always,\"">> you gently teased. The two of you usually traded victories back and forth, the loser inevitably training even harder so it didn't happen again. But that didn't stop both of you from acting like you were leagues ahead of the other. @@.sophieVoice;"Big talk shorty,"@@ she was still a few inches taller and loved to tease you about it. She stepped closer, doing her best to loom over you, @@.sophieVoice;"shall we make a wager on it?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"Same terms as always?\"">> In recent years you'd escalated your little bets, at first it was just silly kid stuff, but now the winner had to treat the other to a fancy dinner. Though it was always nice when the both of you got dressed up pretty, considering how much time you both spent sweating in gym clothes. @@.sophieVoice;"Deal,"@@ and the two of you sealed the pact, as you always did now, with a good luck kiss. Just a peck mind you, you didn't want to draw too much attention. Everyone knew about the two of you, but you still liked to keep things mostly low key. Unlike Sophie... [[The previous year...|Sophie Low Happiness Leave On 11]]@@.playerVoice1;"I'm just saying people would stop spreading rumors if you just got a boyfriend."@@ Blake suggested to you, leaving unspoken that //he// wanted to be that boyfriend. This was not the first time this conversation had occurred. The boys at school were relentless in trying to get with you or Sophie, endlessly hinting at things and suggesting that 'certain rumors' would stop if you just got with a boy. Rumors you knew were actually spread by the girls as much as the boys. Teenagers were often cruel for no particular reason. You tried not to let it bother you too much, but made you wonder if things would be easier if you just made your relationship public. Then again the fact the relationship was with //Sophie// might cause even more hassle than just staying quiet. It wasn't a secret from the 'sleepover crew' of course, in fact Emily was the first one you'd confided in. To your delight she was entirely supportive, though miffed that she owed Miki $20. Apparently Miki had seen this coming long before anyone else, well before you and Sophie had even realized it. That girl wasn't the best at school in general, but she had an almost supernatural sense when it came to matchmaking. Not long after both your parents had been let in on the secret. Much like Emily, your mom entirely supported it. There was some concern about Sophie's parents, they were rather more traditional, but they loved their daughter and came around to the idea almost immediately. Telling the general school population was another matter entirely. Which is why you were sitting through the latest lecture/teasing session about your being single. [[Sophie stood up|Sophie Low Happiness Leave On 12]]@@.sophieVoice;"People are spreading rumors?"@@ She raised an eyebrow, causing many at the lunch table to look away. Sophie could be awfully scary when she wanted to be, @@.sophieVoice;"well let me fix that."@@ She marched over to you. <<playerVoice "\"Sophie what are-\"">> you sputtered, a premonition building about her intentions. Your words were cut off by Sophie leaning down and kissing you full on the lips. Holding the kiss long enough that there could be no doubt this was no prank. This was a declaration. She broke the kiss, looking down at your shocked face with her annoyingly smug one...it made you want to kiss her again. This was hardly the first time you'd kissed, but never had it been so public. The rest of the table was stunned for a moment before a near riot broke out. The teachers actually had to step in to get everyone to calm down. You knew that story would make it's way around the entire school before the lunch hour was even over. <<playerVoice "\"Sophie. A word.\"">> You grumbled at her, pulling her out of the lunch room into a semi secluded hallway. You fixed her with a glare, hands on your hips, <<playerVoice "\"did you think you should have maybe run that by me first?\"">> You were annoyed that she'd made such an important move without consulting you, but also relieved that it was finally out. Sophie just grinned at you, fully aware that your annoyance had no teeth behind it. You rolled your eyes, <<playerVoice "\"come here you,\"">> you grabbed the front of her shirt, pulling her into another kiss. No doubt someone would spot your little tryst, but you almost wanted them to. Dispel any remaining notions that either of you had an interest in boys... [[You broke the kiss|Sophie Low Happiness Leave On 13]]You broke the kiss, smiling back at the memory of Sophie's wild proclamation. It had caused a stir for a few days, mostly sour grapes from boys who felt they had been denied some chance they never had in the first place. Some nasty rumours had been spread, but they didn't last long. For one both you and Sophie could kick the ass of most of the school population, including the boys. Second, Emily confided in you later that she'd 'discussed' the matter with one of the boys saying the nastiest things, and that he wouldn't be an issue anymore. You never did find out the exact contents of that 'discussion'. But considering the lecture Emily had received about 'reckless use of magic', you doubted it had just been a formal debate. Though even seeing the lecture it was pretty clear your mom's heart wasn't in it. Mom probably actually supported Emily's 'debate tactics', but didn't want to set the precedent. <<playerVoice "\"I'm looking forward to that dinner.\"">> You purred. @@.sophieVoice;"You wish."@@ Sophie retorted. You both smiled before putting on your serious faces. This was the most important competition of your lives, and a step into the big time. It was terrifying, and Sophie clearly felt the same. She quickly grabbed your hand and gave it a squeeze. You nodded and then headed out. It was scary, but you couldn't imagine having anyone else at your side. Your eternal rival and perhaps, someday, something even more. Ending 8b: Eternal Rivals(?) <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "Sophie" 12>><<include "Endings Variable Init">>\ Emily whispered something to Kara and Kara spread the news to the other two. The pleasant static quickly spread to your entire body. It felt oddly familiar. Mom started getting taller, wait no, that wasn't right. You were getting shorter, //a lot// shorter and it was happening in a hurry. You watched as the hard won muscles in your arms and legs shrank away into nothing. Leaving behind smooth arms that seemed like they couldn't lift a feather; and hairless legs that seemed so thin you were shocked you could still stand. Your hands and feet followed suit with their attached limbs. Shrinking down into @@.girlVoice;soft, delicate@@ little things that felt awkward to use. The rest of the muscles in your body followed suit. Gone were your pecs, replaced instead with a small undefined chest. Gone were your abs instead a @@.girlVoice;a cute little tummy@@ that had just a bit of pudge on it. Your well toned glutes? Gone. Leaving behind an entirely flat @@.girlVoice;bum@@. All the hard work you'd done as you became a man, gone. Though perhaps being concerned about your 'manliness' wasn't a big deal when you weren't even 'male' anymore. Long blonde hair tickled your narrow shoulders as you tried to grapple with what had happened. Mom simply smiled mildly and waited for the inevitable questions. [[Check yourself|Golden Ending 5]] <<silently>>\ <<if !$oldPlayerAge || $oldPlayerAge > 10 || $oldPlayerAge < 5>> <<set $playerAge to 6>>\ <<else>> <<set $playerAge to $oldPlayerAge>> <</if>> <<if !$oldPlayerMaturity || $oldPlayerMaturity > 10 || $oldPlayerMaturity < 5>> <<set $playerMaturity to 7>>\ <<else>> <<set $playerMaturity to $oldPlayerMaturity>> <</if>> <<set $ringPlayerAge to $playerAge>> <<set $ringPlayerMaturity to $playerMaturity>> <</silently>>\<<playerVoice "\"What happened?!\"">>, you gasped at the sound of your own voice. Though you still had all of your acquired quirks. <<else>>\ Your mind felt hazy, but familiar.
