Mom just smiled down at you and sighed. @@.momVoice;"I almost miss when you were this cute,"@@ she pinched your nose which drew a @@.girlVoice;giggle@@ out of you. @@.momVoice;"But I suppose I'd better change you back soon."@@ She grinned at you, @@.momVoice;"All that milk in your tummy and you'll need a diapee change in no time."@@ she began to ruthlessly tickle your @@.girlVoice;tummy@@. <<if !$noWettingInEnding>>It was threatening another accident.<</if>> You didn't really care about that. You were consumed with the sudden thought of how much you @@.girlThought;loved your mama@@. <<if $noWettingInEnding>>\ @@.momVoice;"Hmmm, you are //ragressun// faster then //eshpectud//. Is little <<playerName>> //ashully njoyin'// this?"@@ <<else>>\ Your @@.girlVoice;giggling@@ cut out for a moment and you made a funny face. You weren't sure what you were feeling, but the @@.girlVoice;spreading warmth@@ was a pretty clear sign. You hadn't even felt it happen. Mom crinkled her nose, @@.momVoice;"Well I suppose I brought that one upon myself."@@ She peered closer at you, her eyes boring into your soul, @@.momVoice;"you are //ragressun// faster then //eshpectud//. It was starting to scare you and not knowing what else to do you started to @@.girlVoice;cry@@. @@.momVoice;"There there baby. Mama's here for you. I don't know why its //happnin// so //kwikly// to you."@@ You scrunched your face, mom looked scared, you get scared too and start @@.girlVoice;whimpering@@. You should at least be able to nod."@@ You gave a jerky nod. As you considered the matter, you could feel your mind slowing back down. Simplifying down until nothing but base instincts and @@.girlVoice;loving mama@@ would be left. It was another chance at life. You hadn't done much with the first one, only people who would miss you would already know what happened... [[Buh buh buh|Nightmare Ending 10]]<<contentWarning "Regression to infant.">> [[Baaaaahhh|Nightmare Ending Last Second Escape 1]]<<contentWarning "Stuck. [[Sleep...|Nightmare Ending 13]]<<set $playerMaturity to 0.1>>\ <<set $playerAge to 0.1>>\ As you slept the magic finished it's final touches on you. You would start right from the beginning. A @@.girlVoice;newborn baby girl@@ entirely dependant on her @@.girlVoice;mama@@ and @@.girlVoice;big sister@@, not that you even really understood what those were anymore. Your mother and sister got to work preparing the house for the sudden arrival of the new baby. Both of them were in a similar emotional state. A little confused, but filled with a nervous excitement. It wasn't what either of them had expected to come out of the party. But the conclusion was a happy one none the less. You would be happy as well, once you woke. With all of those nasty teenage boy thoughts thoroughly purged from your head you'd having nothing left but @@.girlVoice;happy simple baby thoughts@@. You'd have a mother and sister that loved you and would dote on you. Your happy little family would make sure that you were taken care of for all of your days. One day you would grow up of course. Would you learn magic like your sister? Would the two of you get along? Would you be allowed into her sleepovers? There were endless questions about the future, but that was simply life for everyone. None of that was a concern right now. You could just enjoy yourself and @@.girlVoice;mama would take care of you@@. Ending 10a: A Brand New Start <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "" 8>><<set $playerAge to 4>>\ <<set $playerMaturity to 5>>\ Mom nodded, moving her hands through a series of odd gestures. You felt tingles spreading through your body, but they were weak, almost ticklish. Mom frowned before moving through another set, murmuring something under her breath. The tingles grew stronger but even you could tell that something was off. Finally the sensations coalesced into something more tangible and you could feel your body begin to change. You stretched and fidgeted as your limbs lengthened. As muscles returned you were regaining proper control. You couldn't test it right now, but you knew that you'd at least regained your ability to stand. A few more moments and you'd be able to walk again. You braced yourself for the continued changes, a small concern building at the back of your mind about how much weight this table could bear. It wasn't a real changing table so it could probably handle some serious weight. But a hundred plus pound man was a far cry from a dozen pound baby girl. However, you didn't seem to be reaching that size any time soon. The changes had been quick at first but they seemed to be slowing down. You'd quickly progressed through infancy and toddler-hood but now you seemed to be languishing as a young child. Mom noticed the same and once again began to mumble. [[Her hands moved over you|Nightmare Ending Last Second Escape 2]]<<set $playerAge to 7>>\ <<set $playerMaturity to 5>>\ <<set $hairLength to "medium length">>\ Your changes began to progress again. More of the baby fat shrinking off of your body being replaced by a modicum of muscle. It wasn't like you were anywhere near strong, but at least you'd be able to walk without worrying about falling over. After that minimal progress the changes came to a stop again. Your mom's redoubled efforts didn't seem to be making any progress, you couldn't feel anything but the lightest of tingles. The magic faded away and your body settled into it's final form. Mom was breathing hard and taking a break. You sat up and took s quick look in a nearby mirror. Embarrassingly you were still clad in nothing but a diaper. You were clearly too old for one, but the magic had made sure that it continued to fit. There was a dark amusement that the same thing probably would have happened, even if your progression had reached it's intended age. Instead you were still a little blonde girl sitting on a table wearing a diaper. Your resemblance with Emily was unsurprising, at the moment the two of you were sisters, though you were a little bit younger. No doubt she'd get a kick out of that, not that you intended to stay this size much longer. <<playerVoice "\"Mommy?\"">> Your head had cleared quite a bit and you could speak properly again. However, it was also a far cry from where it should be. You were struggling to find the right words to ask your next question and you couldn't help but see your mom as, well, mom. <<playerVoice "\"Why am I still widdle?\"">> You knew that didn't sound quite right, but that was a concern for later. Mom took a moment to consider the matter, @@.momVoice;"It seems that magic did more of a number on you than I had expected. Whatever effect caused it to run so far out of control was still holding on. For the moment I can't seem to push you past this age, at least not mentally."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Menwawy?\"">> Mommy frowed, @@.momVoice;"Yes sweetie. Your mind had almost slipped away to just being an infant. It's proven hard to pull back...I'll need some time,"@@ she paused for a moment, @@.momVoice;"go downstairs and have breakfast with the other girls. I'll be down shortly."@@ [[You went downstairs|Nightmare Ending Last Second Escape 3]]You were already half way down the stairs when you realized you were still wearing nothing more than a diaper. Maybe it was just because of everything else going on, but it @@.girlVoice;didn't really feel weird to wear@@. Still, you weren't about to let the girls see you that way. You hurried back up, quickly raiding Emily's closet for something that looked like it fit. A long dress seemed to be your best bet for the moment. As embarrassing as you knew the diaper should be, you didn't have access to other underwear and needed to wear something. This should at least cover it until mom was focused enough to help you. Timidly you went back downstairs. Knowing the girls would have no idea that you would look like this, and paranoid that they'd somehow know the full details of your makeshift outfit. Emily was the first one to spot you sneaking into the kitchen. @@.emilyVoice;"<<playerName>>!"@@ She ran up to you, coming to a stop only a few inches from you. Looming over you by a few inches, confirming that she was taller and likely older, @@.emilyVoice;"Mommy thought you should play with us a little longer?"@@ You nodded, it seemed like as good a reason as any and required way less explanation. <<playerVoice "\"I pway a widdle wonner.\"">> That was rough and you knew it. You should be about seven, but you were talking like you were a toddler. Fortunately, or perhaps unfortunately, all the girls seemed to think that was @@.girlVoice;incredibly adorable@@. You spent the rest of breakfast trying to speak as little as possible, even as the girls tried to goad you into it. [[You ate|Nightmare Ending Last Second Escape 4]]Finally your mom came down to rescue you, but by the look on her face it didn't seem like the news was good. It wasn't. It seemed that your little foray into infancy had left some pretty dramatic mental ramifications. The kind that definitely shouldn't have happened, but definitely did. She was vague on the exact reasons and you wondered if she just didn't know, but didn't want to reveal that. The summation was that, for the moment, you were stuck like this. Emily was of course delighted. The other girls were less convinced. After all you'd been quite the jerk at the party, they didn't want any more of you regardless of age. Emily, who was going to have to deal with you no matter how old you were, was much more enthused by the idea of an @@.girlVoice;annoying little sister@@, than an annoying big brother. It turned out to be something she got to enjoy for the entirety of the next week. You'd taken the week off school, since you couldn't exactly show up to your high school classes like this. Mom ran all sorts of tests and cast lots of spells on you, but nothing seemed to change the reality of the situation. A reality that you were begrudgingly having to deal with. Each day bringing new realizations. First it turned out that your speech errors from the first day weren't going away. It was a strange sensation having an inkling that something was wrong, but still continually making the same mistakes. Some of the mistakes were normal enough for a seven year old, but others were more common with five, four, and even three year olds. Which made it all the odder that your writing was, by grade 2 standards, not too bad. Mom said that it was because your brain had progressed and regressed somewhat haphazardly. But that wasn't much comfort when you had to <<playerVoice "\'pway\'">> with your <<playerVoice "\'sissie\'">>. Or when you needed a <<playerVoice "\'brewa\'">> to go out in the <<playerVoice "\'wain\'">>. Those were at least understandable. You had another terrible habit of just dropping the last syllables of words. This could leave you entirely incomprehensible, no one knew what you meant when you'd said <<playerVoice "\'I wan weed boo\'">>. [[That wasn't all|Nightmare Ending Last Second Escape 5]] <<set $hairstyle to 3>>\The girls never found out about your diaper and it mercifully wasn't something that you had to wear again. At least not during the day. As you'd found out on that first night, your bladder control while sleeping was basically non-existent. Mom insisted it actually wasn't too unusual for girls your age, but every time it happened you felt like a baby. Emily didn't tease you about it at all, which only made it worse. You knew she'd kicked that habit well before school, so her not teasing you meant that her 'baby sister' was too delicate a target. Your motor skills in general were underdeveloped from where they should be. You'd been right about the fact you could stand and walk properly. But your hands weren't quite as cooperative. Dressing yourself was a major obstacle and shoe tying seemed to be entirely impossible. Both mom and Emily were very helpful with both issues, but again it was another prick to your pride. So many things you could no longer do, when they'd once been automatic. Over the course of the week all of the other girls visited again, driving your home your deficiencies. Kara proved herself to be shockingly smarter than you were now. Sophie was impossibly athletic by comparison. Even Miki was proving both smarter and fitter than you in most activities. Something that you professed to your mother when you finally reached your breaking point. <<playerVoice "\"You hafta chain me ba.\"">> @@.momVoice;"'Change me back'."@@ Your mother gently corrected, carefully enunciating every word. She'd had to do that a lot lately, but for whatever reason the lessons weren't sticking. Stupid little kid brain. [[She knelt down beside you|Nightmare Ending Last Second Escape 6]]@@.momVoice;"That isn't going to be possible,"@@ the graveness in her voice made it clear this wasn't just her extending the punishment. @@.momVoice;"The magic I cast to encourage you to fit in at the party was powerful to start with. With Emily's contributions it grew even stronger."@@ She sighed, @@.momVoice;"but your behaviour was so appalling that it was working overtime to make you fit in. And it continued it's work even after I made you into a baby. When I tried to turn you back, instead of being dispelled, the two magics combined. Which is why you mostly look seven, but lack motor control. It's also why you write like a second grader, but sometimes speak like you're three."@@ Mom was saying a lot, but none of this sounded like a way to turn you back. She confirmed your suspicions, @@.momVoice;"Which means you'll be staying like this."@@ <<playerVoice "\"I hafta gwow up dis way?\"">> There was an obvious quaver in your voice. It was one thing to get stuck as a little girl for a sleepover. Another thing entirely to have to grow up as one. @@.momVoice;"No,"@@ her voice was firm but gentle, you got the feeling she'd thought about how to present this, @@.momVoice;"you're going to stay exactly like this for a very long time. The magic will weaken eventually and let you grow up normally, but it is hard to say how long that will take. A few years maybe."@@ <<playerVoice "\"I don wanna be a widdle giwl! Dis isn faiw!\"">> Your panic was rising. She had to be missing something, you couldn't get stuck like this for years. <<playerVoice "\"Thewe ha be wawa.\"">> Mommy quirked her head in confusion. It seemed your speech degraded further when you got stressed, even she didn't understand that sentence. [[Take a breath|Nightmare Ending Last Second Escape 7]]<<playerVoice "\"I wanna be bib oy, bib oy,\"">> you scrunched your face, you knew you'd still @@.girlVoice;said that wrong@@, but you couldn't figure out why. Wetness built at the corners of your eyes, you felt like you were @@.girlVoice;about to cry@@. Mom at least understood this time, @@.momVoice;"I know sweetie. But there is simply nothing left to be done. I've consulted with every colleague I could find. This magic was rather unusual to start with, so there are no experts. The only ideas anyone had were experimental, inconsistent and even if they worked would have drastic consequences."@@ <<playerVoice "\"I wan twy neway,\"">> you didn't care about a few side effects, you wanted to be sixteen again. To be able to speak like an adult. She shook her head, @@.momVoice;"As much as I know you hate this, it is better than the alternatives. Unless you'd like to be a sixteen year old girl with the mind of a toddler. At least this way you can read, and even write a little. With that choice you'd be doing little more than babbling. And that was the //best// option."@@ You reeled, apparently there were things worse than your current fate. You didn't want to lose any more of your mind. You'd experienced infancy only a week ago and had no desire to go back. @@.momVoice;"Don't worry sweetie. Mommy will be right here to take care of you."@@ Her voice was as gentle as possible. Whatever she'd had planned for this party, it wasn't this. There was genuine regret in her eyes, she wanted to make this right, but simply couldn't. You bore some responsibility for the outcome, if you hadn't acted so reprehensibly it never would have gone this far. But how could you have known? [[Time marched on|Nightmare Ending Last Second Escape 8]]Mom kept her word. She was always there to take care of you despite the strangeness of the situation. You'd spent several months grieving your lost life, as middling as it had been. @@.girlVoice;Pouting, raging, sulking and screaming@@ in equal measure. Mom was patient through all of it. Even Emily had apologized for how things turned out. But none of that changed the reality of the situation. Though eventually even you calmed down. It was hard to stay that indignant for that long. Humans can get used to anything given enough time. Another issue was the soul-crushing boredom. You'd barely left the house during that time and you avoided the other girls when they came over. You'd started to crave social interaction that wasn't Emily or mom. Mom suggested you go to school, if only as a distraction. A suggestion you eventually begrudgingly accepted. <<if !$girlName>>\ Since $playerName wasn't exactly a sensible name for a 7 year old girl you'd been forced to take a new one. It'd been the subject of much debate between the girls, but they'd finally decided on @@.girlVoice;Bunny@@. It was a name that would only work for a very young girl. Past the age of ten it would just be a source of derision. But since you weren't going to age... <<set $girlName to "Bunny">>\ <</if>>\ School was a mixed bag. It was nice having others around, but they were all children. Though your brain was on par with theirs when it came to intelligence, you still had the memories of an older boy. Which made it all the more frustrating that the actual lessons were a nightmare. When mom had said you wouldn't grow up you didn't quite realize that your mind was locked at the same level. Some classes you could handle, but others went further and further beyond your capabilities. A normal child would have been learning to keep up with the increasingly complex content, but you @@.girlVoice;couldn't seem to learn anything@@ new. It wasn't that you forgot that you'd learned it. Your memory was fine, but the lessons never stuck. You could add little numbers, but multiplication and division continued to be a mystery no matter how many times you had it explained. The teachers were concerned. It didn't help that your speech was, in their experience, seriously developmentally delayed. Eventually she was forced to pull you out to prevent too many awkward questions. But it seemed she had some contingencies. After all it was going to be suspicious if you kept taking the same grade and never seemed to grow. [[You switched schools|Nightmare Ending Last Second Escape 9]]This time you were put into Grade 1. Your limitations were less apparent here. It was only near the end of the year that a few concepts seemed to be stretching beyond your capabilities. Your speech skills were, though clearly lagging, not as concerning for that grade. At the end of the year your mom was given the suggestion to get additional speech lessons over the summer. She dutifully nodded, though she knew enrolling you would be useless. Instead she planned where you would attend next year. This repeated several times. Each new year was a whole new set of classmates, but they temporary friends that couldn't last. As an additional layer of safety you also had to change your name with each new school. @@.girlVoice;Minnie, Boo, Cookie,@@ each more @@.girlVoice;childish and girly@@ than the last. But stuck in Grade 1 it just came across @@.girlVoice;cute.@@ Meanwhile the girls of the group continued to grow. It wasn't long before you were the youngest in the group, struggling to keep up with their activities. A little longer and they were too old to let you play at all. It was a shocking experience when Emily had grown big enough that she could pick you up. You'd long ago come to terms with being the @@.girlVoice;'little sister'@@ but now you felt well and truly like the @@.girlVoice;'baby sister'@@. As she continued to grow she started drifting further and further from you, the age gap making it harder to properly sympathize with you. It wasn't that she was being mean, but she was a pre-teen now. It wasn't that much fun to hang out with a little kid. It was only now that you finally started to understand Emily's frustrations from all those years ago. [[But there was hope|Nightmare Ending Last Second Escape 10]]It wasn't much but the previous year you'd actually grown a little, and the lock on your mind had begun to loosen. It wasn't enough to actually let you move on to grade 2, but it was a step in the right direction. It was hopeful that this year might be the last time you had to go through this. For now you had to get ready for your latest first day. You'd newly been christened @@.girlVoice;Hope@@ just in time for Grade 1 at a new school. It was a girly name, and perhaps a little bit on the nose, but it was special to you. This was a name you could grow up with. In truth it was actually an old school, enough time had passed to pass you off as a younger sister. There were only so many schools in town after all. You weren't very nervous, by now you were an expert at this. It'd be no problem to make yourself, if not liked, at least tolerated by everyone. Though you still felt butterflies when you saw your new classmates. Classmates that you might just grow up with. This wasn't you trying to make casual acquaintances to just get through the year. Some of these boys and girls might become friends for life. It'd been a long path to get here, but you were finally ready to start your new life. You were confident it'd be better than your last. In all those years you hadn't been able to learn a thing about math, but you had finally learned a lesson about kindness, and wasn't that the most important lesson of all? Ending 10b: Better Late Than Never <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "" 13>> <<set $girlName to "Hope">><<if $playerAge >= 15>>\ @@.momVoice;"He looks like he barely changed at all, but you say he actually participated?"@@ \ <<elseif $playerAge >= 11>>\ @@.momVoice;"I'm surprised to see that your brother kept so much of his form. You say he actually participated?"@@ \ <<else>>\ @@.momVoice;"Well he certainly looks the part for the sleepover, but did he actually participate?"@@ \ <</if>>\ Your mother spoke as she looked down at your sleeping form. <<if getGroupFriendliness() >= 21>>\ @@.emilyVoice;"Mostly,"@@ your sister demurred, @@.emilyVoice;"I thought he was gonna be a big jerk about it. But he was mostly okay."@@ @@.momVoice;"Mostly?"@@ <<if getBestFriend() === "Emily">>\ @@.emilyVoice;"Well he's still a stupid boy, so sometimes he was still a jerk. But he wasn't ''so'' bad...I guess we even got along some."@@ <<else>>\ @@.emilyVoice;"Well he's still a stupid boy, so sometimes he was still a jerk. But he wasn't ''so'' bad...He even made friends with <<print getBestFriend()>>."@@ <</if>>\ <<else>>\ @@.emilyVoice;"Kinda..."@@ your sister considered her words. @@.emilyVoice;"He was still kinda a big jerk."@@ @@.momVoice;"Kind of?"@@ @@.emilyVoice;"Well sometimes he played nice and sometimes he was a meanie. Don't worry, tomorrow we'll get to see the whole story. Thank you Emily."@@ Emily beamed at the compliment and looked back down to you, eager for morning. [[You dreamt|Dream Start]]<<if $playerAge > 10 && $playerMaturity > 10>>\ @@.momVoice;"I'm surprised to see that your brother kept so much of himself, but you say he actually participated?"@@ Mom spoke as she looked over to your sleeping form. @@.emilyVoice;"Mhhhmmm,"@@ your sister chimed, @@.emilyVoice;"I thought he was gonna be a big jerk about it. But he actually played with us."@@ She giggled to herself, @@.emilyVoice;"He was part of the group, mostly."@@ @@.momVoice;"Mostly?"@@ @@.emilyVoice;"Well he's still a stupid boy. But he wasn't *so* bad this time."@@ <<elseif $playerAge > 10>>\ @@.momVoice;"He looks like he barely changed at all,"@@ your mother looked down at your sleeping form. Emily giggled,@@.emilyVoice;"He may look like a stupid boy but he didn't act like one. You should have seen him and Miki, it was so cute."@@ <<elseif $playerMaturity > 10>>\ @@.momVoice;"Well he certainly looks the part for the sleepover, but how did he behave?"@@ Your mother spoke as she looked down at your sleeping form. @@.emilyVoice;"He was still kinda a stupid boy,"@@ your mother raised a curious eyebrow at Emily's vague words. Emily considered her words carefully, her thoughts on the matter were somewhat complex. @@.emilyVoice;"He played with us, and he was nice. But he still acted like my stupid big brother sometimes.@@ @@.momVoice;"Ah. So despite his body looking this young, his mind was still that of a teenage boy? Just a much nicer one than usual?"@@ Emily nodded. <<else>>\ @@.momVoice;"Well he certainly looks the part for the sleepover, but how did he behave?"@@ Your mother spoke as she looked down at your sleeping form. @@.emilyVoice;"She-he was a lot of fun to play with,"@@ your mother noted the pronoun confusion, clearly you'd quite integrated with the group. Emily continued, @@.emilyVoice;"he played with us, and he was nice. I sorta forgot he was my stupid big brother and not a nice new sister.@@ <</if>>\ @@.momVoice;"So you all enjoyed yourself?"@@ @@.emilyVoice;"It was a lot of fun, I think even <<playerName>> enjoyed himself."@@ @@.momVoice;"Well I'm glad to hear that it all went so well. I think he learned his lesson. Don't you?"@@ @@.emilyVoice;"Yeah..."@@, Emily agreed, but seemed to be disappointed by the answer. She'd had fun with you today and wasn't excited about you going back to normal. Mom smiled, @@.momVoice;"Don't worry sweetie, I've got just the idea." [[You dreamt|Dream Start]]Your mother frowned, gazing down at your sleeping form. She turned to Emily. @@.momVoice;"Judging by your face I assume he didn't behave himself."@@ @@.emilyVoice;"I wish he hadn't been there at all."@@, Emily crossed her arms and pouted, @@.emilyVoice;"He was such a brat. He's usually a jerk, but today he was a brat too."@@, her pout deepened, @@.emilyVoice;"he ruined the party."@@ @@.momVoice;"I had hoped that the mental alterations would correct his outlook, but it seems I was mistaken."@@ Emily looked confused, mom had used a lot of big words. Mom simplified matters, @@.momVoice;"He was still a big meanie,"@@ she paused, @@.momVoice;"What do you think we should do sweetie?"@@ Emily considered the possibilities for a moment before giving an evil grin and whispering to your mother. @@.emilyVoice;"He acted like a bratty baby, so I think he should be a baby."@@ Your mother mumbled, @@.momVoice;"Hmmm, it might work. A little more dramatic than I wanted, but desperate times..."@@ She turned back to Emily, @@.momVoice;"We'll see how he behaves tomorrow morning. If he doesn't apologize then you'll have a little baby sister to take care of. You'll have to help of course, being a big sister comes with responsibilities."@@ Emily nodded, excited for the possibilities of morning. Though she was slightly torn, she'd ''love'' to see you as a little baby, but if you apologized it would make her feel a lot better. You'd have to make your choice tomorrow, not that you knew the consequences of that decision. [[You dreamt|Dream Start]]<<if getGroupFriendliness() >= 35>>\ <<include "Golden Ending Dream">> <<elseif getGroupFriendliness() < 10>>\ <<include "Nightmare Ending Dream">> <<else>>\ <<include "Neutral Ending Dream">> <</if>>As you slept you were subjected to a set of fragmented dreams. At first it was flashes of all of the activities that you'd done. However, as the night progressed your mind seemed to focus not on the sleepover itself, but the attendees. Faces and phrases floated through your mind. The moments when you got along with them, and the moments you didn't. All of it playing back in your head as if judging your actions. Finally your mind settled on one girl in particular, giving her a peculiar importance you didn't yet understand. <<if getGroupFriendliness() >= 21>>\ <<switch getBestFriend()>>\ <<case "Emily">>\ @@.emilyVoice;Emily@@ Your poor relationship with her had been the entire catalyst for this sleepover. The age difference between the two of you had made it difficult to see eye to eye. Mom had come to the theory that if you were to be regressed to be closer to Emily in age, you'd be able to get along better. <<if $oldPlayerAge === 16>>In the end it turned out to not even be necessary, the two of you had mended fences all on your own.<<elseif $playerAge >= 11>>You'd never quite gotten as young as Emily but even that change had been enough for the two of you to make amends.<<else>>She'd been right. Brought to the same level you were able to understand your sister much better than before.<</if>> You'd been judging her behaviour by unreasonable standards. Expecting an eight year old to be able to keep up with you. For her to be patient and thoughtful. What you derided as toddler-like behaviour was just normal for a girl her age. It made you regret your behaviour until now. Emily was a great little sister, in her own way, but you'd been too blind to see it. Too stubborn to change your outlook and try to understand her better. After this you'd spend all the time you could with her, make up for those lost years. The two of you would be as @@.girlVoice;close as twins@@. <<case "Kara">>\ @@.karaVoice;Kara@@ Despite your differences the two of you had become fast friends, though you couldn't really pin down why. She was a nerd, fascinated by comic books and anime, while you eschewed all of that stuff. And it wasn't like she'd aggressively sought out the friendship, she was far too reserved to do that. Still, something about her had made you grow a fondness for her. The girl was shockingly intelligent. There were obvious gaps in her knowledge, she was still quite young, but she had a fast and precise mind. More than once she'd surprised you with some insight that you had missed. Yet she never lorded that over anyone. She could think circles around the rest of the group, but she always stayed humble about it. Perhaps too humble. You doubted that Kara was able to see how amazing she actually was. Too often she got bowled over by the more forceful personalities of Emily and Sophie. Her clever ideas being adopted by the group, but not receiving her due credit. But you'd noticed. In the course of the party you'd had little chance to impress that upon her but going forward you'd endeavour to do so. That girl deserved someone to help her see her own brilliance. <<case "Sophie">>\ @@.sophieVoice;Sophie@@ The two of you had grown shockingly close in the last day. At first you hadn't been sure how to feel about her. She seemed arrogant and prideful. The idea of a nine year old girl challenging a sixteen year old boy seemed laughable on the face of it. But something in her eyes had made you realize she was serious. Over the course of the party you found that all that arrogance was confidence. She was able to back up her braggadocious words and prove herself in those challenges. Even at sixteen you sometimes failed to outdo her. <<if $oldPlayerAge <= 12>>As you'd gotten younger, her aptitude became even more apparent. Even when you were few years older it was always a struggle to try and keep up with her.<</if>><<if $oldPlayerAge <= 9>>By the time you were her age it seemed almost hopeless.<</if>><<if $oldPlayerAge <= 8>>Once she was bigger than you, the best you could manage was to follow her lead.<</if>> She'd look at you, those eyes would sparkle defiantly and you'd find yourself drawn into another silly contest. Though sometimes the intensity of that gaze made you want to just sit back and watch, to see what she was capable of. She was an impressive girl, and you @@.girlVoice;wanted to keep watching@@. <<case "Miki">>\ @@.mikiVoice;Miki@@ It was a surprise that you'd grown so close to a girl who was so many years your junior. <<if $oldPlayerAge <= 8>>Though maybe less surprising as you'd gotten closer to her age.<</if>> However, the girl was just such a delight to be around. Emily was always energetic and bubbly, but she was a prankster at heart. Miki had just as much energy, but also with an abundance of empathy. She didn't seem to bear anyone any ill will and got the most upset when others were feeling low. Despite all the things that were happening at the sleepover you always felt like Miki was 'on your side'. She'd be the one to reach out her hand when you were feeling self concious or stressed. Playing with her always ended up being a relief. You didn't have to worry about traps and tricks, Miki just wanted some innocent fun. It was an attitude that rubbed off on you<<if $oldPlayerMaturity <= 14>>, often literally. Playing with her often had a persistent detrimental effect on your mental maturity, but with her it always just made you enjoy yourself more<</if>>. It was a real shame that you wouldn't be able to play with her much after this. Maybe if you were @@.girlVoice;more like her@@, a little @@.girlVoice;younger@@ and a little @@.girlVoice;bubblier@@ you could play together all the time... <</switch>>\ <<else>>\ <<switch getWorstEnemy()>>\ <<case "Emily">>\ @@.emilyVoice;Emily@@ Your sister and you had never gotten along, and the party hadn't improved things. You simply couldn't tolerate how immature she was. She was eight, but sometimes she acted like she was three. She thought it was cute but you just thought it was infantile. She was annoyingly persistent, always pestering you to do some new inane task. She never left you alone despite the fact you'd made it clear you weren't interested. She was a brat through and through. Though as your brain circled on the thought there was another feeling lurking behind your annoyance. A justification for all of that unwarranted distaste. Jealousy. Your concious mind would never admit it, but you were jealous of Emily. That 'immature' outlook meant that she could find fun even in mundane tasks. Whereas you spent most of your life bored. She had an energy an excitement that meant she always wanted to try something new, while you'd gotten stuck in the same habits. It was that, plus her charm, that meant she made friends wherever she went, while you...you secretly wished to have some of that @@.girlVoice;childlike wonder@@ to have the same @@.girlVoice;vigor for life@@ she did. <<case "Kara">>\ @@.karaVoice;Kara@@ You and the nerdy girl had constantly been at odds. She was only seven, but she acted as if she was wise to the world. Trying to act as a 'voice of reason', when she still played with dolls. If she was so smart she'd know that her geeky habits didn't make her special. Her know it all attitude was a constant source of frustration for you. Though as your brain circled on the thought there was another feeling lurking behind your annoyance. A justification for all of that unwarranted distaste. Jealousy. Your concious mind would never admit it, but you were jealous of Kara. You'd never excelled at school, never had the intelligence or focus to be able to learn like she did. Willing to pursue her passions, even if they weren't perfectly socially acceptable. You'd shied away from any 'geeky' habits for fear of being ostracised. But she didn't need everyone to like her, a few close friends were far more important. You longed to be @@.girlVoice;part of a passionate community@@, one which @@.girlVoice;accepted you for you@@. <<case "Sophie">>\ @@.sophieVoice;Sophie@@ You and the fearsome red head had never truly gotten along. There was something about her that rubbed you the wrong way. She was brash and arrogant. She bossed the others around. She was overly prideful of her physical ability and aggressively competitive. The reluctant tom-boy's mere existence seemed to bother you. Though as your brain circled on the thought there was another feeling lurking behind your annoyance. A justification for all of that unwarranted distaste. Jealousy. Your concious mind would never admit it, but you were jealous of Sophie. Your dislike for her 'arrogance', a cover for your own insecurity. You thought her bossy, because you so often found yourself being led, unwilling to step up. Her competitiveness giving her a drive you'd never possessed. Sophie knew who she was, what she was capable of and made no apologies for it. You longed to be that @@.girlVoice;self-assured@@, that @@.girlVoice;confident@@ in your own mind and body. To be able to take the reins of your own life. Pushing yourself to be @@.girlVoice;awesome@@ at something, to make Sophie @@.girlVoice;recognize your talent@@. <<case "Miki">>\ @@.mikiVoice;Miki@@ You and the young girl had never quite clicked. She was nice enough, but it always seemed so shallow to you. Not a concious choice, but merely a placid behaviour to make others like her. The girl drifted from activity to activity, never thinking too hard about what she did. A dopey optimism blind to the troubles that crossed her path. Her carefree attitude annoyed you. Though as your brain circled on the thought there was another feeling lurking behind your annoyance. A justification for all of that unwarranted distaste. Jealousy. Your concious mind would never admit it, but you were jealous of Miki. The girl was fundamentally happy in a way you could barely understand. Nothing seemed to bring her down, she was able to bring light to any situation, regardless of the darkness. Being a little clumsy, or making a silly mistake didn't bother her because she knew it didn't matter. You wished you could have a fragment of that happiness for yourself, to be able to @@.girlVoice;take life as it came@@ and @@.girlVoice;smile@@ no matter what. <</switch>>\ The truth of your feelings danced at the edge of your understanding. An awareness of the fundamental source of your animosity, but buried too deep to penetrate to your concious mind. <</if>>\ The memory of these dreams faded only moments after you awoke, but a part of the feeling lingered. It was an omen for what was about to come next. [[Go downstairs|The Trial 1]]Your dreams were strange, it was difficult to even explain them. Everything was just so abstract, colors and shapes and sounds all connected in ways you didn't understand. It was clear that your mind was trying to work something out, but wasn't capable of making sense of the stimulus you were getting. There was an ever building sense of dread and the weight of your behaviour on the day came crashing down on you. This party had supposed to be a chance for you and Emily to make up. To better understand her and her friends. Instead they liked you even less than before. Despite everything they'd done to try to include you in their games you'd been an ass to them at almost every turn. You could almost feel your mother's anger at the situation, about your complete inability to learn a lesson. You didn't know what her response would be, but you doubted you'd enjoy it. When you awoke perhaps it would be best to apologize, profusely, to the girls and to your mother. Hope that they might be lenient in whatever punishment was planned. Or maybe you had no regrets over what you'd done, the girls were a bunch of brats and they'd deserved that kind of treatment. You'd accept whatever fate had in store. [[Your judgement|The Trial 1]]Your dreams were filled with all the fun you'd had that day. At first you'd been reluctant to get involved in a party full of little girls. <<if $oldPlayerAge <= 10 && $oldPlayerMaturity <= 10>>Once they'd shrunk your body and brain you'd been much more involved, but you still could never quite relax.<<elseif $oldPlayerAge <= 10>>Once they'd shrunk your body down it'd been easier to fit in in the games. But you'd never really gotten the hang of all the 'girliness' of things.<<else>>It was a little awkward playing when you were so much bigger than them, even when you got into the games you could never quite relax.<</if>> There was always the knowledge that you were supposed to be a sixteen year old male babysitter. As you awoke there was a tinge of disappointment to seeing your body restored to normal. It wasn't that you'd wanted to stay changed, you liked who you were, but it did mean that the fun was over. Though as you shifted in your sleeping bag you realized one thing that hadn't changed much. A quick peek into the bag confirmed it, you still had your @@.girlVoice;<<print getCurrentOutfit().name>>@@ on, somehow in your size. Considering everything else that had gone on, this was a minor point. Though for reasons you couldn't quite explain you kept them on even as you headed downstairs, maybe the girls would get a laugh out of seeing them. Even with the restored clarity of your mind it still felt natural to have some fun with them. [[The mood changed|The Trial 1]]<<silently>>\ <<set $playerOutfit to 0>> <<include "Reset state for ending start">> <<set $girlName to "">> <</silently>>\ The day had been a whirlwind for you, so it was no surprise that you were barely able to drag yourself to bed. <<if $playerAge <= 13>>Nothing you had fit so <<else>>You didn't need them but<</if>> Emily had provided a simple set of @@.girlVoice;pink pyjamas@@. You were asleep the moment your head hit the pillow. All the insanity of what had happened and the things you'd become weren't enough to stop the sandman from claiming you. This also meant that you were completely unaware of when your mother got home. Also unaware of when your sister crept out of her sleeping bag to let mom know about all that had happened. <<if getGroupFriendliness() >= 35>>\ <<include "Golden Ending Night Before">> <<elseif getGroupFriendliness() < 10>>\ <<include "Nightmare Night Before">> <<else>>\ <<include "Neutral Night Before">> <</if>><<link "Play Again?">><<script>>UI.restart()<</script>><</link>> <<link "New Game+" "Opening Passage">> <<include "New Game Init">> <<include "Endings Variable Init">> <<set $playerAge to $oldPlayerAge || $playerAge>> <<set $playerMaturity to $oldPlayerMaturity || $playerMaturity>> <</link>><<silently>> <<set $oldPlayerAge to $playerAge>> <<set $oldPlayerMaturity to $playerMaturity>> <<set $oldGirlName to $girlName>> <<set $playerAge to 16>> <<set $playerMaturity to 16>> <<set $humiliation to 0>> <<set $hairstyle to 0>> <<set $hairLength to "short">> <<include "Traits Init">> <<include "Endings Variable Init">> <</silently>>The girls all turned towards you as you entered, but it was your mother that spoke first. @@.momVoice;"Emily told me all about how you behaved."@@ You tensed. @@.momVoice;"I can't quite decide whether you've truly learned your lesson. But Emily had an excellent idea. A trial."@@ <<playerVoice "\"A trial?\"">> @@.momVoice;"Each of the girls will present their case for or against your behaviour. In a form of their choosing."@@ You were about to object, but she continued over you, @@.momVoice;"Emily, if you would begin."@@ [[The trial commenced|The Trial 2]] <<hovertip "This is probably a *really* good time to save if you want to hunt some endings.">>🐉<</hovertip>>@@.emilyVoice;"We will now commie-comma...start the trial of <<playerName>>."@@ Emily put all the gravitas she could into her voice. Which wasn't much for an eight year old girl but it was a worthy attempt. You would laugh at the silliness of the whole situation, if your mind and body weren't on the line. It was difficult to know exactly how this was going to play out. So much had happened the previous day that it was difficult to even remember it all. Your mother seemed to be amused by the entire situation. Sitting at the kitchen table drinking a coffee, while Emily took on the role of prosecutor. @@.emilyVoice;"He is charged with being annoying, not properly playing with us and acting like a big jerk."@@ It wasn't the most official sounding set of charges, but the severity of the consequences were still far too real. @@.emilyVoice;"I call Kara to the stand!"@@ Emily proclaimed. Though in this case 'the stand' was literally just standing up. [[Kara's Testimony|The Trial Kara]]Kara stood to present her case against you. <<if $karaHappiness >= 7>>The two of you had actually grown fairly close during the party. You hoped that her testimony would reflect that.<<elseif $karaHappiness <= 3>>The two of you hadn't gotten along well, you doubted this was going to go well.<<else>>You wouldn't say that Kara hated you, but you wouldn't say you were friends either. This could go either way.<</if>> She cleared her throat gently. It was clear that she wasn't overly enthused about the situation. We all got to touch them, it was nice."@@ Kara blushed, she was clearly embarrassed for even mentioning it. But it was clear that she'd enjoyed the situation. <</if>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $twisterActivityResult === 3>>\ @@.karaVoice;"When we were all playing Twister I..."@@ she paused, considering her words. But <<playerName>> cheered me up, it was nice."@@ She gave a shy smile in your direction. <<else>>\ At which point you'd completely ignored her. But <<playerName>> just sort of sat there. A seven year old was calling you immature...not that she was wrong. @@.karaVoice;"<<playerName>> tried to cheat and hide outside, which wasn't allowed. I don't really have an opinion."@@ Hmmm, it wasn't the worst, but it wasn't the best either. Sophie stood up next. [[Sophie's Testimony|The Trial Sophie]]Sophie walked over to present her case. <<if $sophieHappiness >= 7>>This actually didn't worry you too much. Sophie wasn't always the easiest to get along with, but the two of you had formed a sort of bond. But @@.girlVoice;whining@@ about it now likely wouldn't work in your favour. <<if $acceptOlympicsLoss>>\ @@.sophieVoice;"Although he was much more mature about losing the Olympics, so they did learn their lesson there./"@@ <</if>>\ <<else>>\ Sophie pondered on it for a moment, @@.sophieVoice;"It was a nice little competition."@@ <<if $climbTreeWin>> You noted that she didn't actually mention who had won, no doubt because she didn't want to admit to her loss.<</if>> <</if>>\ <<case 3>>\ Sophie grinned and you reflexively blushed, remembering what happened, @@.sophieVoice;"He was a little too small to compete, but at least they tried."@@ <</switch>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $gymnasticsApologizeForClumsy>>\ @@.sophieVoice;"<<playerName>> was polite sometimes. He said sorry when he wasn't being careful and almost hurt people."@@ You remembered that fall during the gymnastics event, but you hadn't realized how much your apology had meant. <</if>>\ <<if $letMikiWin>>\ @@.sophieVoice;"During hide and seek when he was seeking he was very nice and let..."@@ Sophie paused, reformulating her words. She wanted to give you credit for letting Miki win, but didn't want to let Miki know. @@.sophieVoice;"He made sure everyone had fun." <</if>>\ @@.sophieVoice;"That's all I got,"@@ she took a pause, dragging out her conclusion. To you it seemed that she was just trying to torture you. \ <<if $sophieHappiness >= 7>>\ @@.sophieVoice;"I suppose that, for a stupid teenage boy, he was actually pretty fun to be around. At least when he's a little smaller and cuter."@@ You stifled a laugh. Considering it was Sophie that was actually pretty high praise, but she still had to throw in a jibe or two. Couldn't ruin her image by being too nice. <<elseif $sophieHappiness <= 3>>\ Sophie's eyes narrowed at you, and you felt a sense of dread settle over you, @@.sophieVoice;"<<playerName>> was mean, not just to me, but to the other girls."@@ Honestly it seemed she was more annoyed about you being mean to the others rather than just her. She could take the hits, but fiercely protected the others, and you'd pissed her off. @@.sophieVoice;"If he does it again..."@@ she let the words trail. She couldn't really directly attack a sixteen year old, but she'd find a way. <<else>>\ She shrugged, @@.sophieVoice;"He was alright I guess."@@ And that was it. Apparently Sophie didn't really have many thoughts on you. You doubted that would reflect particularly well on you. <</if>>\ Sophie smiled and walked back to the rest of the group. Now it was Miki's turn. [[Miki's Testimony|The Trial Miki]]Miki walked up to present her case. She was doing her best to put on a serious face, acknowledging the seriousness of the situation. <<if $mikiHappiness >= 7>>This actually might go alright for you. Miki was pretty happy go lucky by nature and the two of you had bonded somewhat. That was nice."@@ It was a nice start, <<if $mikiPickedPony>>@@.mikiVoice;"He wouldn't pick a //favrit// so I had to,"@@ she giggled, though mostly to herself, @@.mikiVoice;"I picked $favouritePony so that's his //favrit// okay?"@@ <<else>>@@.mikiVoice;"He even said $favouritePony was their //favrit//!" Her grin was so wide as she said that, as if she was revealing some great truth to the world.<</if>> <<case 2>>\ @@.mikiVoice;"<<playerName>> a meanie,"@@ Miki spoke and you winced, that was a bad start, @@.mikiVoice;"I just wanted ta watch My Little Pony. But <<playerName>> was mean and //wouldn// watch."@@ <</switch>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $playedWithMikiHideAndSeek>>\ @@.mikiVoice;"When we were playing hide and seek and I lost <<playerName>> was really nice and played with me and made me feel better."@@ <<elseif $hideAndSeekDidntTrustKaraAndMiki>>\ @@.mikiVoice;"When we were playing hide and seek they were mean and didn't trust us."@@ Miki apparently didn't feel like clarifying any further, so hard to say how your mom would take it. <</if>>\ <<if $hulaDancingContinued>>\ Miki's face suddenly lit up, remembering one of her most favourite moments of the sleepover, @@.mikiVoice;"<<playerName>> danced with me! We did a hula dance and they looked really funny, but it was really fun."@@ She turned to you, @@.mikiVoice;"I wanna do it again."@@ As sweet as the statement was you weren't allowed to respond at the moment. Though you @@.girlVoice;did want to dance again@@. <</if>>\ @@.mikiVoice;"Dat's all I can remember,"@@ she took a pause, scrunching her face to think of more. But nothing seemed to come to her. <<if $mikiHappiness >= 7>>\ @@.mikiVoice;"I like <<playerName>>. I wanna play with him more, can he play again next time?"@@ She turned to your mom, who merely gave a smile back in response. It was a good sign, that was basically the highest praise you could have received. <<elseif $mikiHappiness <= 3>>\ She folded her arms and pouted, @@.mikiVoice;"I don't like <<playerName>>. They were mean."@@ That was it from her. Simple, succinct and reflected absolutely terribly on you. <<else>>\ Miki seemed to be struggling with coming up with a summation for her arguments. Instead just shrugging and sitting back down. <</if>>\ With that over you braced yourself for the most dangerous part of this trial. Next was Emily's turn. However the rest of you had shrank as well, and you'd lost another few inches. @@.emilyVoice;"Now say 'thank you Emily'"@@ Given the previous demonstration of her power you were inclined to do as she said. She followed you back down, no one else was aware of exactly what had transpired but it was obvious you looked a little @@.girlVoice;smaller@@ and @@.girlVoice;softer@@ than you had before. <<changeAge "small">>\You were struck by a sudden memory of your time in the classroom with the mom-a-like. @@.girlThought;I will not use bad words.@@ That mantra had been running through your head ever since it had happened. Preventing you from using curse words like...well you couldn't actually conceive of them anymore so it was hard to even describe them. The best you could do was that if you tried to say damn it would just come out as damn. However, at this point it hardly seemed like a limitation. So much of your language had @@.girlVoice;simplified@@ and @@.girlVoice;sanitized@@ that you doubted you'd say them even without the restriction. At this point the strongest curse you could get your head around was @@.girlVoice;poop@@. Though if you knew it was a 'curse word' didn't that mean it was also a 'bad word'? Even if it was more harmless than it's adult counterpart... @@.girlThought;I will not use bad words.@@ You held your head as a headache formed. Your mind racing through your vocabulary, looking for anything your $playerMaturity old mind now considered a 'bad word'. It didn't matter if it was something as benign as 'stupid', or 'jerk', or '@@.girlVoice;poopyhead@@', you shouldn't be using that kind of language. @@.girlThought;I will not use bad words.@@ [[The headache abated|G Rated Language Evolution 2]]<<set $traitGRatedLanguageToddler to true>>\ Finally your head cleared, the pounding drum beat of your mantra fading into the background. You wanted to consider that a good thing, but what had it taken with it? How would you even remember what had been lost? When this happened last Emily tried to make you say @@.girlVoice;'shoot'@@ and Sophie had said @@.girlVoice;'weewee'@@. So if a word even implied a curse word, it was scoured from your mind. Like you couldn't even think of what @@.girlVoice;'bleep'@@ might once have been. If the word was @@.girlVoice;potty talk@@ you still knew of //a// way to say it, but the translation...@@.girlVoice;peepee@@, @@.girlVoice;poopoo@@, @@.girlVoice;bumbum@@. It was all @@.girlVoice;baby talk@@. Not only as innocent as possible, but also simplified so infants could actually manage it. Perhaps the most frustrating was the prohibition against 'mean' words. Somehow 'bad' and 'mean' had gotten twisted in your head. It was possible, with great effort, to remember the word @@.noFilter;'dumb'@@, but you could //never// use it to describe someone. @@.girlVoice;Mommy@@ would be mad if you did that, and you still wanted to be a @@.girlVoice;good girl@@. Insulting someone was entirely impossible. You could laugh at them, since it wasn't a word, but that was it. None of this was information you wanted to share with the girls. They'd pick up on it soon enough, but you didn't want to volunteer the fact that you were stuck talking like a @@.girlVoice;toddler in church@@. It was a shame not to feel the grass under your feet. The two of you came to a stop in a particularly lovely patch of pink flowers. You didn't even know what the flowers were, but they were undoubtedly the prettiest flowers you'd ever seen. That, plus the calm of this place, made it hard to get too upset about it.<<else>>It was a relief. You hadn't wanted to be a boy anymore, at least you could be what you wanted to be in your dreams.<</if>> <<elseif $oldPlayerAge == 10>>\ You thought you might have gotten a little younger, but it was hard to tell. You were still taller than your friend, so at least you were still older than her. <</if>>\ The last change to catch your attention was the fact that you had a new outfit. Or more accurately you had on her old outfit. The @@.girlVoice;lacy white dress@@ fit you perfectly and it was everything you had imagined. You loved the way it felt on your body. The way the hem tickled your bare legs. How @@.girlVoice;light@@ and @@.girlVoice;airy@@ it was. You just felt so @@.girlVoice;pretty@@ in it. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"I saw you staring at my dress before. I thought, if you liked it so much, I should let you try it on."@@ [[I love it|Imaginary Friend Dream 3-3][$imaginaryDressFeeling to 1]] [[Thank you|Imaginary Friend Dream 3-3][$imaginaryDressFeeling to 2]] [[I don't want it|Imaginary Friend Dream 3-3][$imaginaryDressFeeling to 3]] <<set $playerOutfit to 22>>\<<switch $imaginaryDressFeeling>>\ <<case 1>>\ <<playerVoice "\"I love it.\"">> She was right, you'd been staring at it, marvelling at how it looked on her. Wondering how it might feel to wear. Now that you had it you weren't sure you ever wanted to take it off. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"Then it's yours. You can wear it all you want."@@ You were @@.girlVoice;elated@@, you had this @@.girlVoice;pretty dress@@ all your own. Though the joy lasted only for a moment. You could wear it all you wanted //here//, this dress didn't exist in the real world. It couldn't exist there. Even if someone made a dress that looked just like it, it wouldn't be the same. It'd have to be made of real fabric and cloth, while this one seemed to be made of @@.girlVoice;clouds@@ and @@.girlVoice;happy thoughts@@. <<set $loveDreamWorld++>>\ <<case 2>>\ <<playerVoice "\"Thank you.\"">> She was right, you had been staring at it, marvelling at how it looked on her. Perhaps you hadn't been considering how it would feel for you to wear it, but now that you were you the feeling was @@.girlVoice;delightful@@. The only issue was that the dress wasn't real. So any delight would only be temporary. <<case 3>>\ <<playerVoice "\"Just because I was looking didn't mean I wanted it. Oh I know!"@@ Once again she grabbed your hand, dragging you through the field. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"You were just bored!"@@ She tittered. Her assertion was incorrect, but her solution had been effective. You felt better now, getting to run around made you forget about everything else. Your @@.girlVoice;beautiful dress@@ trailing out behind you, the cool earth under your feet. You could run through this meadow forever. [[Run|Imaginary Friend Dream 3-4]]As you ran you did have one thing pricking at the edge your mind. $imaginaryFriendName, where had she come from in the first place? Even though she seemed different now, with a new wardrobe and a new attitude, it'd seemed that she had been here before you'd ever come. She had been waiting for you after all... Had she spent all this time here alone? It wouldn't have been a bad existence, this was paradise, but it might have been lonely. It wasn't surprising that she'd been so eager to spend more time with you. She came to a sudden stop. There was a flash of frustration across her face as she reproached you, @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"you're thinking too much!"@@ @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"Just have fun!"@@ She giggled as she pushed at you, throwing you into a spin. As you watched the world blur past you, you relaxed, letting yourself experience the moment. Everything outside of here could wait until later. You'd just enjoy what you had right now. The sun and the flowers. The blue sky and your pretty dress. You let out your own @@.girlVoice;giggle@@, letting yourself twist and turn, dancing to music you could almost here. She joined you, dancing until you got so dizzy you fell down. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"Maybe that's //too// much fun."@@ [[She sat down beside you|Imaginary Friend Dream 3-5]]<<if $playerMaturity >= 11>>\ <<set $playerMaturity to 10>>\ <</if>>\ @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"Here."@@ She handed you a small white flower and you @@.girlVoice;marvelled@@ at the beauty of it. It was only one of many, you were surrounded by endless fields of flowers of equal beauty. The two of you spent some time sitting in the grass, picking at flowers and giving them to each other. Fascinated even by the blades of grass you plucked from the ground. You spent what felt like hours picking at flowers and you realized you'd been wrong about her being lonely. Once you @@.girlVoice;let go@@ and @@.girlVoice;just enjoyed yourself@@ this place was an endless source of pleasure. She might have been alone, but she wasn't lonely. Of course she also enjoyed sharing it with you, but you could imagine spending weeks in here without another soul in sight and loving each moment. <<if $oldPlayerMaturity >= 13>>\ As you continued you found that your mind felt...@@.girlVoice;simpler@@. Fewer of those intrusive complicated thoughts buzzing around in it anymore. It was a blessing, to have a bit of quiet, it meant you could enjoy this place even more. <<elseif $oldPlayerMaturity >= 11>>\ Your mind felt a little simpler. You were in this paradise, what need did you have complex math equations? <</if>>\ You continued to pick flowers, @@.girlVoice;losing yourself@@ to the mere joy. Time lost all meaning, but eventually you realized $imaginaryFriendName wasn't even participating anymore, she was just gazing at you. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"You really love it here don't you?"@@ [[I love it|Imaginary Friend Dream 3-6][$imaginaryWorldFinalFeelings to 1]] [[I like it|Imaginary Friend Dream 3-6][$imaginaryWorldFinalFeelings to 2]] [[I hate it|Imaginary Friend Dream 3-6][$imaginaryWorldFinalFeelings to 3]]<<if $imaginaryWorldFinalFeelings === 1 || $imaginaryWorldFinalFeelings === 2>>\ <<if $imaginaryWorldFinalFeelings === 1>>\ You nodded enthusiastically, how could you not love it? For you."@@ She offered you the flower. It felt like your own form was the unstable one. <<playerVoice "\"Maybe I shouldn't leave yet...\"">> @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"Don't worry, we'll be back soon. But for now we've got to go."@@ <<else>>\ You shook your head. Every moment in this place was a seductive nightmare. It wasn't that it wasn't a paradise, it was, that was the problem. This was just a constructed dream world, but every part of it seemed to want to make you stay. Whether or not the sleepover was your favourite thing, at least it was the real world. A look of annoyance crossed <<print $imaginaryFriendName>>'s face, one you didn't miss. If the world wasn't suspicious enough then this girl made it even worse. [[Wake up|$imaginaryFriendReturnPassage]] <<set $traitImaginaryFriend to 3>>\You awoke again in the field, a feeling of peace and tranquillity washing over you. [[She took the flower from her hair|Imaginary Friend Dream 4-2]] <<set $oldPlayerOutfit to $playerOutfit>>\ <<set $playerOutfit to 22>>\She toyed with the flower in her hand. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"I am really glad I met you. It was so much fun to play with someone else."@@ Her voice was wistful as she looked out over the meadow, @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"it is beautiful here, isn't it?"@@ You nodded your assent. <<if $loveDreamWorld < 0>>Even if you didn't like it here, it was as beautiful as you could imagine. <<else>>It was as beautiful as you could ever imagine.<</if>> She took one last look at the flower in her hand, nodded to herself and then offered it to you. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"I think you should have it. I think it's meant for you now, and not for me."@@ The flower she offered you seemed bursting with color and vitality, standing out even against the other flowers around you. This flower was special. This flower had power. The one who had this flower was the master of this meadow. <<if $loveDreamWorld >= 1>>\ [[Eagerly accept it|Imaginary Friend Dream 4-Accept]]<<contentWarning "Role swap.">> [[Regretfully decline|Imaginary Friend Dream 4-Gentle Refuse]] <<else>>\ [[Decline|Imaginary Friend Dream 4-Gentle Refuse]] [[Destroy the flower|Imaginary Friend Dream 4-Angry Refuse]] <</if>>\You took the flower from her, and then tore it to shreds. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"What are you doing?!"@@ A dark look crossed her face, as a sudden shadow fell across the sky. <<playerVoice "\"I'm not staying here.\"">> You were wise to her game. If you put that flower into your hair you'd be taking her place in the dream. She'd already dressed you up, the flower would be the finishing touch. The world around you sheared in an impossible way, it made you feel ill. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"I wasn't trying to make you stay! I just thought you'd like the flower..."@@ She looked about to cry and your heart twisted. Had you been wrong about all of this? Was she just the innocent and pure girl she appeared? @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"You broke it..."@@ she moaned, looking at the tattered remnants of the flower. The world continued to deform and distort. Your own body felt like it might twist in upon itself, and $imaginaryFriendName didn't look much better. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"Wait! We can fix this."@@ She ripped a few flowers from their stems, scattering them around the torn flower. She cupped her hands over the pile and when she removed them there was a new intact flower. But it looked fragile, as if even a light breeze would tear it apart. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"Quickly! You have to wear it to make it real. It has to be worn."@@ She desperately offered you the flower. You had only a moment to make a decision. It seemed that the world was going to tear itself apart and you weren't sure what would happen to you if you were here when it did. [[Continue to refuse|Imaginary Friend Dream 4-Angry Refuse 2]] [[Wear the flower|Imaginary Friend Dream 4-Angry Refuse Ending 1]] <<contentWarning "CW: Dark. Role swap. Trapped.">>You weren't about to wear that flower, even if the world tore itself apart. $imaginaryFriendName seemed to intuit your decision and her face fell. The flower coming apart in her hands. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"I just wanted to get out of here..."@@ she mumbled. You'd been right, she was trying to trick you, and that flower had been the way to do it. <<playerVoice "\"Was that your plan the whole time?\"">> You shouted. She opened her mouth to answer, but no words came out. The tearing increased and the darkness closed in, swallowing her up. You were left alone in the darkness. What had she been? Another entity inside you trying to escape? Or just a figment of your imagination? Had she always been trying to escape this place? Or had your hatred of it twisted her? It seemed that you'd never get those answers. As the darkness swallowed you up you knew you'd never be back here again. This world, and this figment, were gone. [[Wake up|$imaginaryFriendReturnPassage]] <<set $imaginaryFriendRouteComplete to true>>\ <<set $traitImaginaryFriend to 0>>\Hurriedly you put the flower in your hair. The moment you had the world around you snapped back into focus. The bright sun, the pretty flowers, everything was back to the way it was. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"Thank you. I thought you actually might not do it."@@ She looked at you with a wide smile, but there was something predatory about it. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"Don't worry, you'll learn to love it here."@@ Your heart dropped as you looked at the world around you. You felt connected to it in a way you hadn't before, this wasn't just a dream you visited anymore, this was your domain. This had been her plan the whole time. Slowly taking more and more control of your life, leaving you more and more in her old role. A @@.girlVoice;sweet@@ and @@.girlVoice;innocent@@ girl who wiled away her days idly picking flowers. You reached up to remove the flower from your hair, but it was impossible. It was part of you now. You'd been wrong about the flower making you the master of this place, it made you it's prisoner. [[The darkness crept in|Imaginary Friend Dream 4-Angry Refuse Ending 2]]You saw the darkness begin to creep in at the edges of the world. But it wasn't centred on you anymore, it was centred on her. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"I really mean it, you'll learn to love it."@@ Her voice sounded wistful, @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"This place is paradise, in it's own way. If you hadn't come and shown me what was out there I'd have stayed here for eternity, blissfully unaware of the world outside."@@ You couldn't find your voice. What did you say in this situation? Curse her? Beg for freedom? Scream at her to let you out? What good would that do? You were just a @@.girlVoice;figment of her imagination@@, you didn't have any real power over her. The darkness continued to creep in, obscuring her figure. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"I'll come visit. You try and enjoy yourself. Bye for now."@@ With that she was gone. The darkness receded and left you alone in the beautiful meadow. Your new home. [[Time passed|Imaginary Friend Dream 4-Angry Refuse Ending 3]]At first you tried to find a way to escape, but the place was endless, and you walked for a long time. You never tired, you never got sore, so you didn't have to stop. This was a dream, it didn't have to obey physical limits, even your feet and your dress stayed pristine no matter what you did. Though 'long time' was a term without meaning here. The sun never wavered, so it was impossible to track time. Even if you could you weren't sure it ran at a consistent pace. There moments where you felt like huge chunks of time had passed without you even noticing. After a while you lost all sense of time. It was a thought that didn't belong in this place, along with so many others. In this world of flowers and grass and sun you didn't need complicated thoughts about math or school. You didn't need to worry about any of the trials and tribulations of the real world. It was perfect in here, you just had to let yourself enjoy it. It took a bit, but <<print $imaginaryFriendName>>'s words proved to be true. You were learning to love this place. As your mind @@.girlVoice;slowed@@ and @@.girlVoice;simplified@@ you were able to find joy in the little things. Staring at flowers or picking at grass could be @@.girlVoice;endlessly fascinating@@. It began to feel less like a prison and more like a @@.girlVoice;playground@@. It wasn't long before you'd @@.girlVoice;forgotten there was anywhere else@@, this meadow was your whole world, the only world you ever needed. Dimly your mind considered the world you'd come from. Would those people notice the swap? The sudden change in personality? Your journal would have left breadcrumbs...but that was as long as you could hold on that thought, drifting back to the sensations of the meadow. You spent your days in @@.girlVoice;bliss@@. Dancing through the grass, enjoying the squish of dirt between your toes, the scent of flowers in the air, the warm sun on your skin, the breeze against your dress. Every sensation tailor made to bring you @@.girlVoice;endless joy@@. You could spend forever in this @@.girlVoice;paradise@@ and thanks to <<print $imaginaryFriendName>> you would. Ending 11a - Trapped in a Dream <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "" 21>>\ <<set $playerMaturity to 5>>\The moment you put the flower in your hair you felt a shift in the world, though you couldn't place it. Looking around everything seemed the same as before. The same @@.girlVoice;beautiful sunny day@@ with the same @@.girlVoice;gorgeous flowers@@, and it was all yours. That was it. That was the difference. Before you had just been visiting this place, visiting <<print $imaginaryFriendName>>'s domain. Now it was yours. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"It looks lovely on you."@@ $imaginaryFriendName ran her fingers through your hair, toying with your flower. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"You're sure about this?"@@ You nodded. You'd never been more sure about anything in your life. This was where you belonged. $imaginaryFriendName belonged out in the 'real' world dealing with all the traumas and trials that came with it. You would stay here in paradise. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"I'll come visit, okay?"@@ You were surprised by the abruptness of her departure, but you saw the darkness creeping in. It was time for you...no, time for her to wake up. You gave her a gentle wave, <<playerVoice "\"have fun. I'll see you soon.\"">> And with that she was gone, leaving you alone in the sunny meadow. [[A dream|Imaginary Friend Dream 4-Accept 2]]For a while you just sat there, picking at the grass. You'd actually done it, you got to stay here. You weren't how long you spent sitting there. You quickly discovered that time was a fuzzy concept here. The endless daytime made tracking difficult, but even beyond that the place worked on dream logic. Sometimes you'd feel like running and it'd take as long as you wanted to get somewhere. Other times, when you wanted to do something else, you could cross the distance immediately. It wasn't a concious decision, it just sort of happened. Nothing here required particular thought and the more you played the more those unnecessary thoughts seemed to @@.girlVoice;fall away@@. Worries and concerns about school, or money or anything about the outside world. You could spend an eternity just @@.girlVoice;picking flowers@@ and @@.girlVoice;love every minute@@. Every activity held endless fascination, as long as you let yourself @@.girlVoice;just let go@@ and enjoy it. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"How are you doing?"@@ <<print $imaginaryFriendName>>'s voice broke you from your reverie. Looking down at the circle of flowers you'd taken...minutes...hours...possibly days...to make. It didn't matter, you'd loved making it. You gave her a smile, <<playerVoice "\"perfect.\"">> You stood, offering her your hand, <<playerVoice "\"come on.\"">> [[You ran|Imaginary Friend Dream 4-Accept 3]] <<set $playerMaturity to 5>>\The two of you ran through the meadow with @@.girlVoice;joyous abandon@@. Letting her forget any of the trials that she was now facing. Though once you stopped and sat she told you about what had happened. She had completed the sleepover in your place. Though she'd been more to happy to become a six year old girl in body as well as spirit. She'd also been more than eager to stay that way once the party was over. Everyone seemed thrilled by her new behaviour, even if they didn't fully understand the sudden change of heart. Her relationship with Emily, her mother and the other girls improved immensely and she'd even started going to school in Miki's class. You listened with rapt attention, though the situation felt distant to you. You were her friend, so of course you would listen to her problems, but you really just @@.girlVoice;wanted to play@@. But $imaginaryFriendName couldn't just play all day, she had responsibilities and homework and a dozen other things that stole her time and attention. That's what you were there for, to pull her away from that @@.girlVoice;boring@@ stuff to have fun. To play in the yard and pretend to be @@.girlVoice;princesses@@ or @@.girlVoice;mermaids@@ or whatever $imaginaryFriendName could think of. $imaginaryFriendName was so creative, she could draw beautifully, write pretty stories and tell funny jokes. Everyone particularly loved stories about her closest companion, you, her @@.girlVoice;imaginary friend@@. All the wild adventures the two of you went on, even if no one else could see you. You didn't need anyone else to see you or hear you, that wasn't important. You got to live in @@.girlVoice;paradise@@ and $imaginaryFriendName would always be with you and she was all the friend you'd ever need. Ending 11b - Journey into Imagination <<include "Post Ending Choices">> <<saveEnding "" 20>>You shook your head, pushing the flower back to her. <<playerVoice "\"No, it's yours.\"">> $imaginaryFriendName took the flower back, hesitantly putting it back in her hair. [[Wake up|$imaginaryFriendReturnPassage]] <<set $traitImaginaryFriend to 2>>\ <</filterreplace>> <</link>> <<link "She had to stay in here">> <<filterreplace "#links">>\ <<playerVoice "\"I think you should stay here.\"">> You felt bad saying it, but her coming out was causing untold problems. [[Wake up|$imaginaryFriendReturnPassage]] <<set $traitImaginaryFriend to 1>>\ <</filterreplace>> <</link>> @@ <<set $imaginaryFriendRouteComplete to true>>\<<if $playerMaturity <= 6>>\ <<elseif $playerMaturity <= 9>>\ I had a drem wear I was in a feeld and there was a girl andshe was a litle girl. She had a cute new outfit, but I dunno why I was in hers. <<if $imaginaryDressFeeling === 3>>I do *not* want a dress like that, it's for kids.<<else>>It's a incedbly pretty dress, and super cute on me.<</if>> Feels totally weird though...like shes in charge or somethin. <<else>>\ Things with $imaginaryFriendName are continuing to escalate. It almost seemed like she was the one going back to the real world, and I was just following. <</if>>\<<if $playerMaturity <= 6>>\ <<elseif $playerMaturity <= 9>>\ <<switch $traitImaginaryFriend>>\ <<case 0>>\ $imaginaryFriendName is not friend. She noticed your approach, though didn't share your caution, @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"are you done sitting around now? Are we going to go play?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"No. I mean yes we are, but no...\"">> you cast another glance at the girls, nervous about talking to what they would see as empty air, <<playerVoice "\"how are you here?\"">> @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"You brought me with you, remember? I forgive you."@@ <<playerVoice "\"But I still want to know-\"">> @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"You worry too much."@@ $imaginaryFriendName patted your head. <<if $playerAge >= 11>>You were too tall for her to actually be able to do that, but she didn't exactly have to abide by the laws of physics.<</if>> @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"Just do what I say and it'll be great!"@@ She puffed out her tiny chest, enjoying the idea of ordering you around. [[Back to the group|Imaginary Friend Confrontation 5]]As you walked back to the rest of the group it was clear from their faces that they'd all either seen or heard about your "new friend". You weren't worried about Miki, she had wide eyes and a huge grin. You guessed she couldn't wait to talk to you about your @@.girlVoice;imaginary friend@@. Chances were good she had one of her own. Kara had already been supportive, which meant your real concern was Emily and Sophie. The way they glanced at one another you got the sense they'd already briefly discussed their approach to this. <<if $emilyHappiness + $sophieHappiness >= 14>>\ Their soft smiles worried you for a moment, bracing yourself for an oncoming onslaught of teasing. But on closer inspection you realized how friendly those smiles were. Maybe they were going to be nice? Or was this just a trick? This still might be a trap. Telling everyone you had an @@.girlVoice;imaginary friend@@ would be @@.girlVoice;terminally embarrassing@@, but only at first. Once they knew about it, they'd probably let you off easier if they caught you chatting with empty air. Depending on the situation you might not even have the opportunity to explain, meaning might set yourself up to get caught and @@.girlVoice;embarrassed again and again@@. [[Introduce her|Imaginary Friend Confrontation 6a]] <<if $traitImaginaryFriend >= 3>>[[Deny it|Imaginary Friend Confrontation 6c]]<<else>>[[Deny it|Imaginary Friend Confrontation 6b]]<</if>>You tried to keep the all consuming blush off of your face, but you pushed through it. <<playerVoice "\"This is $imaginaryFriendName,\"">> you gestured in her direction. $imaginaryFriendName waved, @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"hi everyone!"@@ The girls looked in <<print $imaginaryFriendName>>'s direction, though they obviously couldn't see her. <<if getGroupFriendliness() >= 11>>\ <<include "Imaginary Friend Confrontation Admit Friends">>\ <<else>>\ <<include "Imaginary Friend Confrontation Admit Enemies">>\ <</if>>\ <<changeEmbarassment "medium">>\Since you'd actually admitted it, even Emily and Sophie felt compelled to be nice about it. @@.emilyVoice;"Hello there $imaginaryFriendName. <<playerName>>, how did you two meet?"@@ With the cat out of the bag you revealed everything. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<set $loveDreamWorld-->>\<<playerVoice "\"I don't know what you're talking about, I was just">> @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;talking to $imaginaryFriendName.@@<<playerVoice "\"">> Your attempted denial was cut short by $imaginaryFriendName taking over. @@.sophieVoice;"$imaginaryFriendName?"@@ Sophie questioned. <<playerVoice "\"She's my best friend!\"">> Annie continued with your voice.
