You could come back here a thousand times and you always enjoy it; if only as a reprieve from the occasional craziness of the outside world. But all good things had to come to an end. This was just an imaginary place in your head, you did have to get back to the real world. [[Wake up|$imaginaryFriendReturnPassage]] <<set $imaginaryFriendVisit to true>>\<<include "Imaginary Friend Wakeup Fragment">> [[Back to the party|Event Handler]]<<if $imaginaryFriendRouteComplete && !$imaginaryFriendRouteCompleteReactionComplete>>\ <<set $imaginaryFriendRouteCompleteReactionComplete to true>>\ <<switch $traitImaginaryFriend>>\ <<case 0>>\ You snapped awake in a cold sweat. Still collecting yourself after the terrifying experience within the dream. That girl had very nearly managed to replace you. If things had played out a little differently then she might be standing here in your body while you were trapped in that false paradise. Perhaps you should consider yourself lucky. Despite all the drama you had come out of it seemingly unscathed. She was gone and you had full control of your body. No longer did you need to deal with her interrupting your life. Though you still had to deal with the rest of the party, a party you really had to get back to. Shaking off the last of the mental clutter, you refocused yourself, feeling better than ever. <<case 1>>\ You gently opened your eyes, a little surprised to be back in the real world. As you roused you felt a touch of melancholy, $imaginaryFriendName was nowhere to be found. You'd told her she had to stay inside, but you'd gotten used to her presence. It felt strange to be without her. Though it was for the best. Flights of fantasy were one thing, but you'd nearly lost yourself to that world. It'd be best to put up a bit stronger barriers. She'd stay in there, and you'd stay out here. You'd just be sure to visit once in a while. <<case 2>>\ The two of you woke up at nearly the same time, your eyes meeting as you roused from your slumber. She was still holding your hand and her eyes were alight. @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"I'm so glad you let me keep coming out and playing."@@ She paused, @@.imaginaryFriendVoice;"I'm sorry I got so...pushy...I was just having so much fun..."@@ You squeezed her hand, you understood why she'd acted the way she had, and the apology was more than enough for you. Rising up you tugged her along with you, <<playerVoice "\"come on, let's go play.\"">> <</switch>>\ <<pushJournalEntry "imaginaryFriendDream" "Journal Dream 4">>\ <<elseif $imaginaryFriendRouteComplete>>\ <<switch $traitImaginaryFriend>>\ <<case 0>>\ You awoke only moments later from a mercifully dreamless sleep, feeling refreshed and ready to get back to the party. <<case 1 2>>\ You awoke with a smile on your face. It was always nice visiting that little paradise in your mind. You got to spend some quiet time with $imaginaryFriendName without all the craziness of this sleepover. A sleepover you //did// have to get back to. <</switch>>\ <<else>>\ <<switch $traitImaginaryFriend>>\ <<case 1>>\ You awoke with a jolt. The image of the girl still in the forefront of your mind. Was there another entity living in your brain?<<else>>Though this didn't worry you much, she seemed so pure and innocent, she wasn't a threat to anyone.<</if>> It had only been a dream; a figment of your imagination. The beautiful flowers, rolling fields, it was an imaginary paradise. Yet the girl had seemed so real. <<if $loveDreamWorld < 0>>You had to admit your curiosity, but you weren't sure you ever wanted to go back.<<else>>You wanted to see her again...but that would have to wait. Buuuuttttt, what month were you born?"@@ Emily teased, clearly knowing something you didn't. <<playerVoice "\"Uhhh...\"">> You stalled while you tried to get your mind engaged, you knew this, you //had// to. @@.karaVoice;"Starts with an S"@@ Kara offered softly. @@.mikiVoice;"Ooo! You flushed, realizing that Miki was right and that you'd said something close, but not quite... @@.karaVoice;"You were very close <<playerName>>, and now you know for next time, right?"@@ Kara did her best to soften the blow...and it worked. It meant that you knew it, just like Miki, that you were @@.girlVoice;just as smart as her@@. Emily was eager to hurry this process up, @@.emilyVoice;"and what month was I born?"@@ [[You knew this one|Little Sister Discussion Kindergarten 2]] <<changeHappiness "Kara" true>><<playerVoice "\"May!\"">> You were proud you knew this one, and a little relieved it was an easy word. @@.emilyVoice;"That's right!"@@ Her voice contained genuine pride and you drank in the praise, @@.emilyVoice;"now what does that mean?"@@ This was much trickier. You knew the months had an order, you could kind of picture it, though there was some fuzziness. Emily smiled and watched as you puzzled through the situation, Miki and Sophie were whispering to each other, both grinning. @@.girlThought;May is before September, I think...and if it's before that means...something@@ Emily was too impatient to let you keep struggling, @@.emilyVoice;"it means that ''I'm'' older, so ''I'm'' the big sister."@@ You were suspicious of her words, but the rest of the girls seemed to be in agreement. You thought about the situation for a few more moments and came to the same conclusion as Emily. <<playerVoice "\"I'm your little sister!\"">> You chirped, finally coming to the conclusion. You were actually happy about this turn of events. It felt weird to be the 'big' anything now. @@.emilyVoice;"And //how// much older am I?"@@ @@.karaVoice;"I think that's enough,"@@ Kara interjected, saving you from admitting you had //no// idea of the answer. @@.sophieVoice;"Why don't we get back to the party?"@@ Sophie added. @@.emilyVoice;"Just one more thing."@@ [[Emily pulled out her wand|Little Sister Discussion 3a]] <<changeHappiness "Emily" true>>\@@.emilyVoice;"Same year. Buuuuttttt, what month were you born?"@@ Her voice dripped with self satisfaction. <<playerVoice "\"September.\"">> @@.emilyVoice;"And what month was I born?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"May.\"">> @@.emilyVoice;"And so..."@@ <<if $playerMaturity <= 7>>\ It took your brain a moment to parse through the question, but it became clear. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<set $momObservation1 to true>>\<<set _groupHappiness to getGroupFriendliness()>>\ //Elsewhere// Emily's mother watched the continued goings on of the party with a \ <<if _groupHappiness >= 35>>\ wide smile. It seemed almost hopeless at this point. <<playerName>> had seemingly hated the entire sleepover and there wasn't enough time left to recover the situation. She'd need to do something drastic to have any hope of getting the message across. <<playerName>> just couldn't let himself enjoy things, they were too attached to $their manhood and maturity. He was supposed to be the mature one, even if Emily was a brat sometimes it was his perojative to rise above it. Instead he let himself go down to her level and acted like a child. His behaviour had been unacceptable and needed to be punished. There were more straightforward methods of course, but this particular path had resonated. It would give <<playerName>> a chance to understand life at Emily's level, both the things she enjoyed and the things she hated. That closeness should breed a familiarity that strengthened their relationship. Emily might even grow a little as a pleasant side effect. Though she was nagged by another thought. <<playerName>>'s life so far had been, well she'd never say it directly, but a disspointment. He seemed to have an unease with his very being, struggling to find himself. This wasn't uncommon with teenagers, but it'd been a problem his entire life. He had few friends, none of them close, his marks were middling at best, he simply lacked the kind of motivation needed to excel at anything. Perhaps he would be better suited to another life, restarting things with a few tweaks. This sleepover was a chance for him to explore that other path, maybe find a life he'd enjoy better. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<set $momObservation2 to true>>\As you sat on the couch fiddling with your hair you couldn't help but wonder. Was Emily really serious about these hair clips? Were they really the only thing keeping your hair from growing longer? Or was this just another tease on Emily's part? Maybe she just wanted you stuck in these @@.girlVoice;girly@@ hair clips for her own amusement. Glancing around you it seemed that no one else was looking, a perfect opportunity for a little experiment. You fumbled around, removing the first clip and waited...but nothing happened. Feeling emboldened you went to remove the second, this was a mistake. The moment the second clip came undone your entire head began to tingle. You watched in terrified fascination as your hair, already pooling on the floor started to grow again. In a panic you re-clipped it, but the growth didn't even slow. It had already gained a couple extra inches and showed no signs of stopping. You hurried to get the other one back on, your haste making it slower than if you'd actually managed to do it calmly. You finally got it clipped, breathing a sigh of relief; with the clips restored your hair had stopped its growth. Out of the corner of your eye you realized that Emily was watching you, and by her smile she'd seen at least some of your little 'experiment'. You looked away sheepishly, @@.girlVoice;innocently twirling a lock of your even longer hair@@. Lesson learned, don't mess with magic hair clips. [[Back to the Party|Event Handler]] <<silently>>\ <<changeEmbarassment "small">> <<set $removedHairClipsEvent to 1>> <</silently>>\<<set _playerOutfitLink to $outfitMap[$playerOutfit].imageLink>>\ <<Image _playerOutfitLink "topRightCorner">>\ <<if $hasWornSkirtTemporarily>>\ It wasn't the first time today you'd worn something with a skirt. Steeling your resolve you made your way to the front door. @@.emilyVoice;"Where do you think you're going <<playerName>>?"@@ Emily's voice held little actual concern. <<playerVoice "\"Out. I've had enough of the party.\"">> @@.emilyVoice;"Mommy said you weren't allowed to leave. You wouldn't want to make mommy mad would you?"@@ There was a slightly warning tone underpinning her words. You brushed away the concern and continued. Your mother might not want you to leave, but she wasn't here now. Consequences could come later, when your identity wasn't under constant threat. There was only a little hesitation before you grabbed the door handle. Surely she wouldn't have set something up, that'd be too dangerous. What if there had been an emergency? There had to be a way to get out. You grasped the handle and the [[world went white.|Get Away 2]]You came back around lying on your back a few feet from the door, the faint smell of ozone in the air. @@.sophieVoice;"Holy crap! That blew $them back like four feet."@@ It seemed that Sophie wasn't too concerned about your well-being. @@.karaVoice;"Are you okay?"@@ Kara asked an excellent question. Your head had been so jostled that you hadn't actually taken a moment to examine your condition. Your hand was still tingling, but other than that you felt fine. If anything your body felt *better* than it had before. You got yourself into a seated position, stretching your arms above your head. @@.girlVoice;"Nyaaaaa."@@ Your eyes went wide at the sound. You hadn't meant to say it, it just came out naturally. The other girls were grinning wide at the @@.girlVoice;adorable@@ noise. <<playerVoice "\"What's going on?\"">> You fixed your gaze upon the group. Miki gasped at your stare, while Emily and Kara seemed fascinated. @@.sophieVoice;"You might want to check the mirror."@@ The grin that accompanied Sophie's words was slightly concerning. Annoyed at their vague words you hopped up onto to your feet. You *did* feel good. Not that standing was hard or anything, but you felt like you could have done a @@.nofilter;flip@@ if you wanted. Though that good mood only made what you saw in the mirror all the more shocking. [[Check the mirror|Get Away 3]]@@.girlVoice;"NYAAAA!"@@, you'd made the sound involuntarily again, but that wasn't the main concern. Instead your eyes were locked on the pair of cat ears poking out of your hair. As if in response the right one twitched, just to confirm they were real. Tentatively you reached up to pull on one, wincing at the sensation when you did. They were definitely real, and definitely attached to your head. The other change was a little harder to see. You opened your mouth, pulling on the side with one finger to see better. Yup, as you'd suspected, your canine teeth were significantly sharper than they had been before. Though not so intense as to be anything but @@.girlVoice;cute@@. Oddly the whole process had calmed you down rather than freaked you out more. No doubt some magic was at play, making you accept the changes. But it did mean you were sedate enough to not try escaping again. You looked back to see the girls lurking around. It was clear that they wanted a closer look at you as well. [[The girls crowded in|Get Away 4]] <<changeAge "medium">>\ <<addTrait "$traitCatgirl" "Catgirl" "curse">>\ <<set $humiliation to 0>>\As the girls crowded in you realized that there was one other critical change, though this one wasn't of the feline persuasion. <<if $playerAge < 10>>You'd shrunk, //a lot//. Apparently @@.girlVoice;cute ''little'' catgirl@@ had been the target here.<<else>>You'd gotten a lot more feminine. Apparently cat@@.girlVoice;girl@@ had been the target here.<</if>> @@.karaVoice;"Do you think $theyll let us touch them?"@@ Kara whispered to Emily, but you were able to hear it as if she was speaking straight to you. @@.emilyVoice;"I dunno. $They might need a minute."@@ @@.karaVoice;"But they look so soft, those ears are just so cute."@@ Your ears twitched as if in response to Kara's compliment and you heard Kara's tiny squee at the sight of them. Finally it seemed her curiosity and eagerness outweighed her nervousness and she walked up to you. @@.karaVoice;"<<playerName>>. Could I uh...could I...couldipleasetouchyourears?"@@ It took a moment for your brain to parse the single word sentence. In truth you still weren't sure about your new appendages, let alone letting other people touch them. They were sensitive, what if they pulled too hard? Or rubbed the wrong way? But the look in Kara's eyes made it seem like she'd never wanted something more in her entire life. It'd probably make her night and the others would like it as well. [[Let Them|Get Away Girls Feel]] [[Ignore Them|Get Away Girls Rejected]]<<playerVoice "\"Go ahead,\"">> you sighed. Might as well let them have their fun. If they didn't do it now then they were going to sneak it in later. <<if $playerAge > 12>> You sat down so they could all actually reach your ears.<</if>> The girls swarmed you. There was a press of bodies as they all tried to get their hands on your new feline parts. You were inundated by grabbing hands and girlish giggling. Luckily they all seemed to be aware enough that they were attached, and it would hurt if they pulled too hard. So they mostly contented themselves stroking your new <<print $playerHairColor>> fur. @@.mikiVoice;"It's so soft,"@@ Miki cooed, drawing murmurs of agreement from the others. @@.sophieVoice;"You should have told us you had your own pet catgirl."@@ Sophie wasn't quite as adoring as the rest, but it seemed even she enjoyed the change. <<if $playerAge > 10>>\ @@.emilyVoice;"Catboy,"@@ Emily half corrected. She'd seen fit to defend your gender, but not the fact you were a pet. <</if>>\ Though you found it a little difficult to disagree on that point at the current moment. All the stroking was shockingly soothing, you actually felt yourself almost off drifting to sleep. A noise rumbling in your throat that vaguely approximated a purr. [[Continue to get scratches|Get Away Girls Feel 2]]Kara was delighted by the situation, but still curious about what exactly had happened. @@.karaVoice;"Did you know that would happen?"@@ @@.emilyVoice;"Sorta. Mommy said that if he left she'd punish him and I'd get a familiar."@@ The conversation continued on with Emily explaining what a familiar was, all while continuing to stoke your fur. You probably should have been more concerned that you nearly had ended up as Emily's cat, rather than just a <<if $playerAge > 10>>catboy<<else>>@@.girlVoice;catgirl@@<</if>>. Eventually they seemed to acclimatize to your new form. They would undoubtedly still want to pet you once and a while, but the novelty of it had settled somewhat. Everyone was ready to get to the next event. You looked back at the door. It seemed that you'd actually gotten lucky all things considered. If you'd actually managed to get the door open you would have ended up on all fours. You did nyat want that to happen. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]]\ <<changeHappiness "Miki" true>> <<changeHappiness "Emily" true>> <<changeHappiness "Kara" true>> <<changeHappiness "Kara" true>> <<set $getAwayBreakResult to 2>><<playerVoice "\"Back off,\"">> you narrowed your eyes at the girls, which seemed to actually make them back off. The girls were disappointed, but accepted your decision. It was your ears after all, you got to choose who touched them and when. But you did hear them mumbling among themselves before you got back to the party. Seemed that the ears had their perks as well. @@.karaVoice;"Did you know that would happen?"@@ @@.emilyVoice;"Sorta. Mommy said that if he left she'd punish him and I'd get a familiar."@@ The conversation continued on with Emily explaining what a familiar was, but before long they'd wandered off, beyond the range of even your new hearing. You looked back at the door. It seemed that you'd actually gotten lucky all things considered. If you'd actually managed to get the door open you would have ended up on all fours. You did nyat want that to happen. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]]\ <<changeHappiness "Emily" false>> <<changeHappiness "Kara" false>> <<set $getAwayBreakResult to 1>>You'd had more than enough of Emily and her magic wand. It felt like she'd been using it strictly for the purposes of humiliating you. If you got hold of it then her power should be neutered somewhat. It wouldn't stop everything, but maybe she'd have to be nicer to you. The question was how to go about getting it. It was always on her person, but she didn't seem to be very cautious. She probably thought you'd never do anything that rash. If you were able to get the drop on her you should be able to wrest it from her grasp. <<if $playerAge <= 10>>In fact, since you were a girl now, it might be possible to use the wand yourself. You didn't have any training, but the women in your family had power so maybe you did as well.<</if>><<if $playerAge <=8>>Though it was risky at this point, before you had an immense physical edge on her. Now it seemed impossible that you'd be able to actually overpower her.<</if>> But it was going to have to be a surprise. If she caught on to what you were doing then she could blast you first, and who knew what that would do? In the few minutes before the next activity you did your best to keep an eye on her, looking for weaknesses. It didn't take long. She'd gotten into an animated discussion with Sophie and was just waving the wand around as she gestured. A quick sneak up behind her and it'd be easy to snatch it away and turn the tables on her. <<if $traitWellBehaved>>Your brain was screaming at you that @@.girlVoice;good girls don't steal@@, but you couldn't stand being humiliated any more. It wasn't really stealing anyway, it was just...forceful borrowing. You'd give it back eventually. Your weak rationalization seemed to be enough to assuage some of the guilt in your mind. There was still a sick feeling in the pit of your stomach, but you'd still be able to enact your plan. <</if>> [[Grab the wand|Get Even Break 2]]At first your plan went off without a hitch. Your sister had never been the most attentive person. You already had your hand almost around the wand before she even noticed. <<if $traitClumsy || $playerAge <= 8>>\ <<if $traitClumsy>>\ Unfortunately, your body didn't quite follow your instructions. Your hand brushed the wand, but never actually managed to properly grasp it. Having missed the wand you were left grasping at air and horribly off balance. The attempt to recover yourself went poorly. You tripped, landing hard on your ass. Not only did it hurt, but you were mortified by how it had played out. Emily hadn't even done anything, you'd managed to trip yourself all on your own. <<elseif $playerAge <= 8>>\ It seemed that your fears about your diminishing physical prowess were not unfounded. She reacted quick enough that she took a firm hold before you were able to pull. Before it would have been a simple thing to rip it out of that weak grip. Now it was an even match. You put all of yourself into the struggle that ensued. Though the actual weight of the pull was only a fraction of what you'd been capable of before. As the tug of war reached it's peak you felt your hand began to slip, your grip strength failing and finally slipping free...you found yourself falling backwards, landing on your ass. <</if>>\ <<playerVoice "\"Owwwww,\"">> you rubbed at your sore ass, as Emily loomed over you. @@.emilyVoice;"Awwwww did <<playerName>> hurt $their bumbum?"@@ This was humiliating. You'd been <<if $traitClumsy>>outdone<<else>>overpowered<</if>> by your former little sister, and now she was talking at you like were a clumsy toddler. @@.emilyVoice;"This wand is very special,"@@ she twiddled the wand in her fingers, @@.emilyVoice;"it's not a toy. It's too dangerous for baby girls like you. Maybe you can touch it when you're older."@@ <<if $sophieFriendship + $karaFriendship + $mikiFriendship >= 22>>\ The other girls shifted uncomfortably. Emily was being awfully vindictive with the teasing. Then again, you had tried to steal the wand, you couldn't just be allowed to get off scot free. <<else>>\ The other girls giggled at your plight. Your attempt to grab the wand had failed, but an attempted theft was still a crime. You couldn't be allowed to walk away unpunished. If Emily wanted to tease her <<playerTitle>> about it, it was only fair. <</if>>\ @@.emilyVoice;"But bad little girls have to get punished,"@@ you tensed as Emily pointed the wand at you, the tip brightly glowing, @@.emilyVoice;"and learn to ''do what they're told'',"@@ the last four words hammered into your mind with an almost physical force. The bright glow of the wand taking over the entirety of your vision as you stumbled... [[Dizziness overwhelmed you|Get Even Break 3]] <<else>>\ With your superior athletic ability it was a fairly simple matter of snatching the wand out of her hand. Jumping away once you had your prize. All of the girls looked shocked at what had just happened, but none moreso than Emily. However, her shock was quickly replaced with a disconcerting smile. <<if $playerAge > 10>>\ @@.emilyVoice;"I wouldn't do that big brother,"@@ she stressed the last word, @@.emilyVoice;"boys aren't allowed to do magic."@@ She put her hand out, @@.emilyVoice;"Give it back and I won't punish you...much."@@ You scoffed. There was no way you were going to do something that risky and then just hand it back. You'd won this round and you intended to take full advantage of it. Just a question of //how// to best take advantage. Perhaps you should have considered a follow-up plan... Before you could really consider your next move there was a tingling sensation from your hand. The wand had started glowing. It was tempting to drop it, but your hand remained steadfastly locked around it. The glowing and the tingling both intensified, the tingle quickly crawling all the way up your arm and into your head. You suddenly felt very faint, reaching out for a wall to steady yourself, but finding nothing... [[Dizziness overwhelmed you|Get Even Break 3]] <<else>>\ @@.emilyVoice;"Sis,"@@ her voice had a warning tone, @@.emilyVoice;"this is a bad idea. You don't know how to use that."@@ You had to work hard to suppress a victorious grin. Emily didn't realize what she'd just revealed. 'Don't know how to use that', meant you //could// use it. Instead you levelled the wand back at her, trying to envision what you wanted to do. @@#links; <<link "Reverse your changes">> <<filterreplace "#links">>\ You reversed the aim on the wand, instead pointing it at your own chest. Closing your eyes and focusing on the way you were before this party started. You could feel something begin to build, an amorphous power that you didn't recognize. Letting it build a little more before finally releasing it. It hit your chest and you staggered, waiting for some indication that you'd changed. Instead you just felt unstable, wobbling in place... [[Dizziness overwhelmed you|Get Even Break 3]] <</filterreplace>> <</link>> <<link "Turn Emily into a boy">> <<filterreplace "#links">>\ You did your best to imagine your little sister as a little brother. Give her a taste of her own medicine. A rugged little boy with dirty blonde hair, scuffed knees and a dirty face. She'd be absolutely horrified. Then //she'd// be the one getting teased by the other girls. You could feel something begin to build, an amorphous power that you didn't recognize. You let it build a little more before finally releasing it. You waited to see Emily's changes, but instead she just continued smirking at you. Her image began to blur and you staggered in place... [[Dizziness overwhelmed you|Get Even Break 3]] <</filterreplace>> <</link>> <<link "Make Emily obey you">> <<filterreplace "#links">>\ You were the one that was supposed to be in charge of this sleepover. Your sister was the one who was being a brat and misbehaving. It was your responsibility to bring her back into line. You focused on the idea of her being a 'good little girl', behaving properly and following your instructions. You could feel something begin to build, an amorphous power that you didn't recognize. Letting it build a little more before finally releasing it. There wasn't anything to see, but you knew that something had been released. @@.drunk;<<playerVoice "\"Now Emily, behave yourself...\"">>@@ Your words slurred as you wobbled in place. Emily's smiling face becoming increasingly blurry as you lost balance... [[Dizziness overwhelmed you|Get Even Break 3]] <</filterreplace>>\ <</link>>\ <</if>>\ <</if>>\<span class="karaVoice drunk">"Is $they ok?"</span> <span class="emilyVoice drunk">"$Theyll be fine"</span> <span class="mikiVoice drunk">"Why's $they just lying there? You didn't want to speak. You were sitting on the floor, slumped against a wall, but you couldn't be bothered to move. @@.emilyVoice;"They're in a hype-nic state."@@ <<if $playerMaturity <= 10>>Emily said, though you had no idea what 'hype-nic' was.<</if>> <<if $playerMaturity <= 9>> @@.karaVoice;"//Hipnotic//,"@@ Kara said, though the new pronunciation didn't help you understand the unfamiliar word any better. <<else>> @@.karaVoice;"Hypnotic,"@@ Kara reflexively corrected. Easy."@@ The excitement of the girls was palpable. Why can't I remember my name?\"">> Emily gave her best puzzled look, @@.emilyVoice;"What do you mean <<playerName>>? You just said it. I'm jealous, <<playerName>> is such a cute name."@@ <<if $playerMaturity <= 14>>She was right of course. <<playerName>> was a @@.girlVoice;super cute@@ name. It just didn't feel like it was your name. <<if $playerMaturity <= 11>>Even if you kinda wished it was.<</if>><<else>>You didn't care if it was a @@.girlVoice;cute@@ name, you didn't want a @@.girlVoice;cute@@ name.<</if>> @@.karaVoice;"Well, if you remember what it is, then you can just tell us."@@ Kara gave a furtive look at the ground when you turned to look at her. Clearly she was in on whatever had happened. But what were you supposed to do? Yelling that your name wasn't '<<playerName>>' didn't work when it was the only name you could remember. Maybe it was a lingering effect of your 'nap', but you couldn't even build up a proper level of outrage. You felt oddly calm about the whole situation, even your new name. You supposed it wouldn't be too bad. <<playerName>> was a @@.girlVoice;cute@@ name, and the girls seemed to like it, maybe that was enough for now. When you remembered your //real// name you could make a big deal of it, but until then you would go by <<playerName>>. Before you headed back you were struck with a sudden realization. Your journal. You'd written your name at the top. Hurriedly you flipped to the first page. It was right there...your hand suddenly moved of its own accord, scribbling out the @@.girlVoice;incorrect name@@. Blotting out any chance of reading what it had been. But that wasn't the end of your compulsion. You couldn't just have a line like that with no name written. With the steadiest hand you could manage you wrote out your @@.girlVoice;real name@@, <<playerName>>. A wave of satisfaction washed over you. You might have missed out on reading your old name was, but at least you'd corrected it and written down your @@.girlVoice;proper name@@. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<set $getEvenBreakResult to 1>>You'd had enough of this stupid party. Enough of the girly games, enough of the vapid conversations, enough of this giggling group of girls. <<if $playerMaturity <= 8>>You knew you'd been laughing along with them not five minutes ago, but that was in the moment.<<elseif $playerMaturity <= 12>>Sure you'd enjoyed a few moments here and there, but that was in the moment.<</if>> Now that you had some downtime, you could calmly examine the situation. But how were you supposed to get out of this? So many of the obvious options had been blocked off...but what if you could make it so the girls //wanted// you to leave them alone? You could still have the veneer of watching over them, so mom wouldn't get mad, but you wouldn't have to take part in their annoying party. How to best go about it? Emily was pretty hell bent on getting you to play. Even when you didn't participate she found ways to still have fun with it. You had to make your presence actively unpleasant whether you participated or not. Maybe it could be as simple as just yelling at them. If you were over the top enough, they might be cowed by your fury. <<if $playerAge <= 9>>Sure you were the same size as them now, but that just meant your screeching would be even more annoying.<<else>>They were just kids, they wouldn't be able to stand up to that kind of intensity.<</if>> <<if $traitSoftspoken>>It was going to be tough to actually //yell// at them, but this was too important to stay quiet.<</if>> Emily came over to you, ready for your next selection. She wasn't prepared for what came next. <<if $playerMaturity < 12>>You steadied your mind, you kept falling into using over sanitized words. It would be hard to take you seriously if you started calling people 'meanies'. It wasn't like you'd forgotten the words, they just didn't feel natural to say. But this required proper emphasis.<</if>> <span class="noFilter"><<playerVoice "\"I'm fucking done with your stupid baby games.\"">></span> [[Emily gasped|Get Mean Break 1a]]Emily gasped and the other girls looked up in distress. They were all too young to use that kind of language. And you knew Emily had been chastised lately for some, admittedly less severe, words. @@.emilyVoice;"<<playerName>>! You aren't supposed to say-"@@ <<playerVoice "\"No. ''You'' aren't supposed to say that,\"">> you pointed an aggressive finger at her, <span class="noFilter"><<playerVoice "\"I can say whatever I want. You're all just dumb little kids and I'm not going to play your idiotic games anymore. Dumbass.\"">></span> The last bit felt tacked on, but you had to keep up the pressure. Sophie had covered Miki's ears at your continued aggression and was just glaring at you. @@.emilyVoice;"No bad words! You hafta put money in the ja-"@@ <<playerVoice "\"I'm not putting any of my bloody money in the jar,\"">> you were laying it on thick here, but you could see Emily's increasing distress. It was working, she wouldn't put up with much more of this. <span class="noFilter"><<playerVoice "\"Now. You are all going to shut the hell up and leave me the alone. I've had enough.\"">></span> You stomped over to the couch and sat down, doing your best @@.noFilter;'piss off'@@ face. Emily ran over carrying a small glass jar filled with coins, the fabled 'swear jar'. Mom had introduced the thing a year or two ago when Emily had picked up a bad word from you. @@.emilyVoice;"Mommy said you had to put money-"@@ <span class="noFilter"><<playerVoice "\"Look. I'm not putting any money in, not one damn cent.\"">></span> It was true that those 'rules' applied to you as much as to her, but mom wasn't here right now. You could deal with the consequences of using some bad language. @@.emilyVoice;"No no no. You ''have to'' put something-"@@ <<playerVoice "\"ENOUGH!\"">> You roared, batting away the swear jar hard enough that it flew out of her hands, shattering on the floor. The last thing you heard was an @@.emilyVoice;"Oh no"@@ from Emily before the [[world went black|Get Mean Break 2]]You weren't sure exactly what you expected to see upon waking up, but it wasn't a black board. Looking around did little to reduce the oddity of a situation. You were in a classroom, or at least a copy of one. Rows of desks, blackboard, walls covered in all sorts of posters and banners. But outside the windows there didn't seem to be anything. Not 'empty fields', nothing. You got the eerie feeling that wherever you were began and ended in this classroom. The classroom had it's own oddities, at least to what you were used to. Those banners and posters were cloyingly cheery and stunningly basic. One poster was just a big explanation of the 'right ways' to read, another had a schedule in rainbow colors. One just had a bunch of basic numbers listed, like days of the week, weeks in a year, and some basic examples of addition. Further more the top of the room was ringed by the letters of the alphabet. It was pretty clear that this wasn't a high school class. It might even be a little too young for Emily. Grade 2 maybe? Maybe even Grade 1? It'd been long enough since you'd learned this stuff you had no idea what age you actually learned it at. @@.momVoice;"Ahem."@@ A voice cleared their throat at the front of the room. Your head snapped up to look. [[Mom?|Get Mean Break 3]]@@.momVoice;"While we are in class you will address me as 'Teacher'."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Sure, sure, very funny mom. But how are you here? Where even is this?\"">> @@.momVoice;"While we are in class you will address me as 'Teacher'."@@ She echoed. <<playerVoice "\"Oookay...Teacher. How are you here? Where are we?\"">> @@.momVoice;"Because of your poor behaviour, you will be given some additional education."@@ Her voice was odd. It was your mom's voice, but it was far more stilted than usual. @@.momVoice;"I'm very disappointed Emily. Using such foul language. You know the rules, and the punishment."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Emily? I'm not Em-\"">> @@.momVoice;"Don't interrupt. You're in enough trouble as it is."@@ There was an awkward pause... @@.momVoice;"You have been gifted with an incredible power Emily, and you must use it responsibly. That includes having proper control of your speech. At your age it is not appropriate-"@@ <<playerVoice "\"I told you! I'm not Emily, isn't that ob-\"">> @@.momVoice;"Don't interrupt. You're in enough trouble as it is."@@ Another pause... You interjected before she could continue. \ <<if $playerAge < 16>>\ <<playerVoice "\"I'm sixteen,\"">> or at least you had been, <<playerVoice "\"I'm old enough to use whatever lang-\"">> <<else>>\ <<playerVoice "\"I'm sixteen, I'm old enough to use whatever lang-\"">> <</if>>\ [[Don't Interrupt|Get Mean Break 4]]@@.momVoice;"Don't interrupt. You're in enough trouble as it is."@@ She repeated, the exact same tone and cadence as the last two times. A dread washed over you. Whatever you were looking at wasn't actually your mother. It looked like her, it sounded like her, but it was something else entirely. It was like one of those digital assistants. A Siri or Alexa that only knew a few phrases to respond to, otherwise it just went back to a default response. Which meant it was running off a predefined 'script'. There was no way you'd be able to negotiate with it, it wasn't capable of that kind of free thinking. <<if $playerMaturity <= 10>>Despite it just being a fake you were still a little nervous. Mom could be scary sometimes. Swearing when she wasn't around was one thing, but with her image standing in front of you it was a different matter entirely.<</if>> It went back onto it's script, @@.momVoice;"you will stay here and write lines until you have learned your lesson."@@ Writing lines? How old-school was this punishment? Writing lines hadn't been a thing in decades on anything but the Simpsons. @@.momVoice;"You will write the line, 'I will not use bad words'. One phrase on each line. I will let you know when to stop. Begin."@@ Looking down you realized a sheet of paper and pencil had materialized on your desk. The automaton masquerading as your mother just stood at the front of the room, unmoving, staring at you. It was deeply unnerving. It didn't look like there was any other option. There was literally nowhere to go, this room was your whole world. And no amount of cajoling was going to make a robot change it's mind. Plus how bad could a few lines be? You picked up the pencil. [[I will not use bad words.|Get Mean Break 5]]<<set $journalClassName to getCurrentWritingStyleClass($playerMaturity)>>\ <section class="paper paper--writingLines"> <article class="paperheader"></article>\ <div class="papertext"> <<if $playerMaturity <= 5>>\ <div @class="$journalClassName"><span position: relative; top: -6px;">wo wo wo</span> ba<span style="position: relative; top: 4px;">ewiue</span></div> <div @class="$journalClassName"><span position: relative; top: 4px;">iLlu baba.</span> ?<span style="position: relative; top: -4px;">ba</span></div> <div @class="$journalClassName"><span style="letter-spacing: -3px;">aAA www</span> !!y y...</div> <div @class="$journalClassName"><span style="position: relative; top: 8px;">b</span>wuwu</div> <<elseif $playerMaturity <= 10>>\ <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words</span> <<elseif $playerMaturity <= 8>>\ <span @class="$journalClassName">I wil not use bad words</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I wil not use bad words</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I wil not use bad words</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I wil not use bad words</span> <<else>>\ <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <</if>>\ </div> </section> <<if $playerMaturity <= 5>>\ You growled in frustration. At first you tried your best, but it quickly became clear that you weren't writing anything sensible. You could @@.girlVoice;barely read@@ but even you knew this was just a mess. [[I will not use bad words.|Get Mean Break 7]]<section class="paper paper--writingLines"> <article class="paperheader"></article>\ <div class="papertext"> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> <span @class="$journalClassName">I will not use bad words.</span> </div> </section> You'd filled the whole page. [[I'm Done|Get Mean Break 8]]<<playerVoice "\"I'm done, can I go-\"">> @@.momVoice;"You will write the line, 'I will not use bad words'. One phrase on each line. I will let you know when to stop."@@ <<if $playerMaturity <= 8>> @@.momVoice;"I'm disappointed in the sloppiness of your writing. You're mixing capitals and lower case letters."@@ Had you been? You weren't even sure. You'd been writing the letters as you thought they were supposed to be. But as you considered the matter you did have some fuzzy spots in your knowledge of the alphabet. You knew all the letters, but you wavered on which version was capital and which was lower. You bit your lip, was she going to deny the whole page? The bot stopped, twitched for a moment and then it's face softened. @@.momVoice;"It's okay sweetie."@@ The smile on its face was disconcerting. @@.momVoice;"All this writing isn't very fun is it? So you're going to repeat after me, okay?"@@ [[The room shifted|Get Mean Break Call and Answer]] <<else>>\ <<if $journalClassName === 'journal3'>>\ @@.momVoice;"And no more of that childish writing. Is have dots. Not hearts."@@ You'd thought the @@.girlVoice;hearts were cute@@, and it was a nice distraction. But it seemed you'd have to write 'properly'. <<set $journalClassName to 'journal2'>>\ <</if>> You looked down at the now entirely blank page. <section class="paper paper--writingLines"> <article class="paperheader"></article>\ <div class="papertext"> </div> </section> You made an indistinct noise of frustration and got back to work. It wasn't fair that you had to keep doing this. But what other choice did you have? [[I will not use bad words.|Get Mean Break 9]] <</if>>\The room twisted and warped. You closed your eyes to ward off the sudden headache, trying to ignore your rising nausea. But just as quickly as it had started it was over. As you opened up your eyes you realized the room had changed. It was still a classroom, technically, but the educational content had degraded further. Nothing more about reading or math. Instead it was just colorful pictures of @@.girlVoice;smiling faces@@ and @@.girlVoice;cartoon animals@@. The letters of the alphabet had taken a place of prominence, almost an entire wall dedicated to "Mr. A", "Mrs. B" and the rest. Another wall had a @@.girlVoice;rainbow caterpillar@@ with the numbers 1 to 10 and the words "Let's Count". That phrase was actually the most complex thing in the room, everything else seemed was aimed towards being friendly and comforting rather than anything approaching educational. Even your desk had been replaced with a tiny chair around a large round table. Even kindergartens would find the room patronizing, somehow this place had become a daycare. @@.momVoice;"Are you ready?"@@ She spoke the words painfully slowly, over enunciating each one, @@.momVoice;"repeat after me. 'I will not use bad words'".@@ [[Wait|Get Mean Break Call and Answer 2]]Having to write the phrase down like a kid in detention had been humiliating enough, but now she wanted you to play call and answer like a pre-schooler. <<if $playerMaturity >= 6>>It wasn't fair, you'd almost written it correctly. If she'd given you one more chance you would have gotten it for sure.<<else>>Not that you had been able to write it down in the first place. Repeating the words out loud was seemingly the best you could do.<</if>> @@.momVoice;"Come on Em, use your words."@@ That confirmed the targeted age of this room. Mom hadn't called Emily that since she was three. Why had the room regressed //that// far back? It struck you. Emily had started writing letters around age four. They hadn't been sentences or anything comprehensible, but it had been the start of her ability to 'write'. Since you'd failed at writing, this teacher had snapped back to a pre-writing method of teaching. <<if $playerMaturity >= 6>>The fact that your failure had just been a missing period didn't seem to factor in. A failure was a failure.<</if>> @@.momVoice;"Em. You have to use your big girl words."@@ [[Repeat after her|Get Mean Break Call and Answer 3][$callAndAnswerRepeat to true]] [[Stay quiet|Get Mean Break Call and Answer 3][$callAndAnswerRepeat to false]] <<set $getMeanBreakResult to 2>><<if !$callAndAnswerRepeat>>\ You stayed silent and the teacher stayed silent. An unblinking face with an unmoving smile just waiting for you to respond. The world outside the windows as empty and black as ever before. This stalemate when on for an eternity. Nothing ever changing in this classroom in the void. She wasn't going to budge, she probably wasn't even capable of budging. //This isn't going to work.// <</if>>\ Despite all the changes to the room it hadn't really changed the situation. You weren't going to be able to get out of this room until the teacher let you out of the room. Whether that meant writing lines or parroting phrases, you had to do what you could to get out of here. <<playerVoice "\"I will not use bad words.\"">> @@.momVoice;"Good girl. Now say it again, but say it loud."@@ <span style="font-weight: bold"><<playerVoice "\"I will not use bad words.\"">></span> @@.momVoice;"Now quiet."@@ <span class="smallText"><<playerVoice "\"I will not use bad words.\"">></span> <<if !$callAndAnswerRepeat>>\ Having to say it in all these silly voices made it all the more galling. You hadn't wanted to say it in the first place and now this? But what choice did you have? <</if>>\ @@.momVoice;"Now in a big scary monster voice. Rawr!"@@ [[Repeat after her|Get Mean Break Call and Answer 4]]After dozens more variations in tone the teacher finally considered the lesson to be learned. However, this didn't mean you got to leave yet. Now that you'd learned the basic concept she had to make sure you understood it in practice. @@.momVoice;"Now what would you say if you were really mad about something that happened?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"Dang?\"">> You knew there were worse words you could use, but you @@.girlVoice;didn't like using them@@ anymore anyway. She shook her head, @@.momVoice;"you can't use that word,"@@ her voice was stern, but not angry, @@.momVoice;"that's almost a bad word and good girls don't use those. If you have to, you can say shoot. Can you say that?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"Shoot?\"">> You were still a little confused, what was the bar for 'bad words' here? @@.momVoice;"If you fell down backwards what would you land on?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"My butt,\"">> you felt a little @@.girlVoice;naughty@@ just saying the word. Once again she shook her head, @@.momVoice;"your bumbum,"@@ she corrected, @@.momVoice;"say it with me."@@ Grimacing you repeated the word, <<playerVoice "\"bumbum,\"">> that was aggressively @@.girlVoice;infantile@@. Most parents would try and wean their kids off of @@.girlVoice;baby words@@ like that, and push them towards the proper term. But not your teacher she was teaching you the @@.girlVoice;toddler@@ version of words, and that wasn't remotely the last word she objected to. [[The lesson continued|Get Mean Break Call and Answer 5]]It turned out the list of 'bad words' was longer than you ever could have imagined, though you were able to put them into three categories. The first was proxies for curse words. 'Dang', 'fudge', 'gosh', were all too close to actual bad words, so they should be avoided. Basically all of those words should just be either, 'shoot' or 'jeez' or 'rats'...and that was about it. Dozens of words boiled down to three or four options. The second was 'potty talk'. These were to be avoided if at all possible, but in the extreme case where they were needed you had to use the most @@.girlVoice;saccharine@@ version possible. 'Poop' was 'poopoo', 'boy privates' was 'peepee', 'girl privates' was 'foofoo'. Anything to take it as far away as possible from it's actual meaning. The last was strictly banned words. These were any words that were too 'mean' to say to other people. 'Stupid', 'dumb', 'fat' weren't permissible descriptors and you could never tell someone to 'shut up' or that 'they suck'. You couldn't even say someone else was 'mean'. She drove these lessons home again and again, making you repeat the most innocent words and admonishing you whenever you slipped and said anything she deemed inappropriate. [[The lesson continued|Get Mean Break Call and Answer 6]]She held up a picture of a toilet. @@.momVoice;"What do you call this?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"A toilet,\"">> you responded incredulously. The teacher tutted, @@.momVoice;"that's a potty. Say it with me. //P-aw-t//"@@ <<playerVoice "\"A potty?\"">> @@.momVoice;"Good. Now how about this."@@ She held up a picture of a slightly different toilet. It was clear there was only one way you were going to make progress, <<playerVoice "\"a potty.\"">> @@.momVoice;"Very good Em."@@ @@.momVoice;"How about this?"@@ Another picture another toilet...@@.girlVoice;potty@@, you internally corrected. Your brain felt like it was melting. All this insipid language was almost making you forget the actual terms for things. If you were ever going to get out of here you'd have to satisfy Teacher, and she wanted you to @@.girlVoice;talk like a toddler@@. [[Endless words|Get Mean Break Call and Answer 7]]<<playerVoice "\"Rats\"">> @@.momVoice;"Good."@@ . <<playerVoice "\"Wee wee.\"">> @@.momVoice;"Good girl."@@ . <<playerVoice "\"Can you please be a little more quiet please?\"">> @@.momVoice;"Excellent."@@ . . @@.momVoice;"Now do you know any other words for this?"@@ She held up a picture of a @@.girlVoice;potty@@. You stared at the picture. Of course you did, she wanted you to call it a @@.girlVoice;potty@@, but you could also call it a...a... <<playerVoice "\"Potty,\"">> you blurted out, struggling to grasp any other terms. Surely there was //something// else to call it. @@.girlVoice;Babies@@ called it a potty but @@.girlVoice;big kids@@ could call it a...a...@@.girlVoice;potty@@? @@.momVoice;"Very good Em! You're such a good girl."@@ [[The lesson ended|Get Mean Break Call and Answer 8]]After an eternity the lesson came to a close. Your mind still on auto-pilot after all those questions and flash cards and repetition. @@.momVoice;"Very good!"@@ The mom-bot cheered, still keeping that overly cheery demeanour. @@.momVoice;"You're such a good girl Em."@@ Your heart leapt, a tingle flowing through your entire body, a delight for being praised. Your mind had become attuned to those words, knowing they were the only way forward. @@.girlThought;I will not use bad words. Good girls don't use bad words.@@ Only after repeating the mantra in your head, did you realize that you'd actually be done with this endless punishing repetition. @@.momVoice;"Now remember to keep being a good girl,"@@ Teacher warned, @@.momVoice;"otherwise we have to do all this again and again until you learn."@@ With that ominous warning the classroom started to warp and shift. [[The world went black|Get Mean Break 12]] <<addTrait "$traitGRatedLanguageToddler" "G-Rated Speech" "curse">>\It would have been merciful if you'd only had to write one more page, but it wasn't that easy. Every time you finished one page another one would appear. Or maybe it was the same page just getting cleared, there really wasn't any way to tell. You'd expected it to be annoying, what you hadn't expected was how boring this was. It's not like you had to think about what you were writing. By the dozenth attempt it was automatic and you were well past a dozen. You felt like it had been hundreds of lines, the pattern of the letters felt burned into your brain. And there wasn't anything to distract yourself. Mom-bot didn't do anything but creepily stare, the posters around the room were insipid, and there was not another soul in existence. The one time you'd tried to get up to stretch your legs you'd found yourself teleported instantly back into your seat. At least if you had some music you'd have something to occupy your mind, and to fill this endless silence. Eventually you resorted to singing to yourself just to have some auditory stimulus. However, as automatic as the writing was, it still consumed some of your mental capacity. Any attempt to sing something ended up only having the words 'I will not use bad words', to various beats. Eventually it devolved into just a steady chant. <<playerVoice "\"I will not use bad words.\"">> <<playerVoice "\"I will not use bad words.\"">> All in time with your writing. <<playerVoice "\"I will not use bad words.\"">> <<playerVoice "\"I will not use bad words.\"">> [[I will not use bad words.|Get Mean Break 10]] <<set $getMeanBreakResult to 1>>\Your self soothing had the desired effect, or at least something close. It helped distract you enough that you weren't noticing the time pass by. Empty sheets, full sheets all blurred into each other. You just kept writing. All to your own chant. <<playerVoice "\"I will not use bad words.\"">> <<playerVoice "\"I will not use bad words.\"">> It was like a drum beat on your mind, blotting out any other thoughts. It was such a simple phrase that it shouldn't have taken up that much capacity, but it was so insistent that it pushed everything else out. <<playerVoice "\"I will not use bad words.\"">> <<playerVoice "\"I will not use bad words.\"">> @@.momVoice;"That's enough."@@ <<playerVoice "\"I will not use bad words.\"">> <<playerVoice "\"I will not use bad words.\"">> You felt Teacher's hand on your shoulder, finally breaking you from the reverie. It took you a few more moments to break yourself from the monotonous chant. You still felt it replaying in your brain even though you were saying it or writing anything. With no clocks you completely unsure how much time had passed, it might have been minutes, it might have been hours. From how stiff you felt you leaned towards hours. @@.momVoice;"That's enough. Now what have you learned?"@@ [[I will not use bad words.|Get Mean Break 11]]<<playerVoice "\"@@.girlVoice;I will not use bad words.@@\"">> The response came to your lips as automatically as the writing had. And what won't you do any more?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"@@.girlVoice;I will not use bad words.@@\"">> You shivered but again the words came unbidden. <<if $playerAge > 10 || $playerMaturity > 10>>You hadn't even been able to object to the 'girl' part.<</if>> Maybe mom wasn't the only one on a script. @@.momVoice;"Good girl. Are you going to use bad words?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"N-@@.girlVoice;I will not use bad words.@@\"">> You'd tried to just say 'no' in response, but something else in your mind had overruled you. You had to say the complete phrase for it to be right. Your head felt tingly, it'd started only moments ago, but it was getting steadily stronger. @@.momVoice;"Good girl,"@@ you realized that every time Teacher used that phrase the tingling got more intense. It was a deeply pleasant experience and despite yourself you were hoping for another chance to hear it. Teacher picked up your paper to look at it, as if Teacher wasn't already aware what was on it. But what Teacher saw seemed to satisfy whatever algorithm was running in its head. @@.momVoice;"Good,"@@ your body held on edge, waiting for the completion of the phrase. <<if $playerMaturity > 10>>It was embarrassing that you were actually looking forward to Teacher saying you were a @@.girlVoice;'good girl'@@.<<else>>@@.girlVoice;'Good girl. So she knew what'd been done to your mind. Miki laughed, @@.mikiVoice;"Hehe, <<playerName>> is a ''good girl''."@@ The tingles redoubled. You wanted to be annoyed at how easily it had been triggered, how easily it overtook your emotions...but being praised just made you feel good. The only thought that managed to permeate was the fact that the phrase itself was enough, the context didn't really seem to matter, nor did the identity of the speaker. Emily simply gave a wolfish grin, pleased with your obedience. You'd really had to hope that you got over this soon. Otherwise Emily was liable to have way too much fun at your expense. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<set $emilyHappiness to 1>>\ <<changeEmbarassment "medium decrease">> <<else>>\ Emily looked very pleased with what had transpired. You'd managed to complete the task in time, preventing any unwanted <<if $emilyLowHappinessBladderThreat>>accidents<<else>>issues<</if>>, but you'd only done it with her help. You'd been desperate enough that you'd been willing to call her 'big sis'. She rather liked the idea of having a 'little sister' relying on her so much. Though since you were back to being older you weren't quite so helpless and needy, but that didn't mean she couldn't still have some fun. @@.emilyVoice;"How are you feeling?"@@ This feigned concern was pretty rich considering this entire mess had been her doing. 'Big sis'? When had you started calling her that. Sure you had in a moment of desperation during the 'game' but you hadn't meant to this time. <<if $playerAge >= 9>>You were older than her! Shouldn't she be the little one?<<elseif $playerAge === 8>>You were the same age! You didn't want to be the "little" one.<<else>>Then again, you were younger than her, so it wasn't entirely unreasonable.<</if>> <<playerVoice "\"Hey @@.girlVoice;big sis@@?\"">> Emily smiled in your direction, waiting for you to continue, but you'd gone silent. [[Consider your words|Emily Low Happiness Event Aftermath 2 Little Sis]] <<addTrait "$traitLittleSister" "Little Sister" "curse">>\ <</if>>\No matter how much you'd intended to say "sister" or "sis" or "big sis" or "little sister" or any other of the myriad more mature ways to refer to her, you just couldn't. Emily was your <<sisterTitle>> and it felt wrong to refer to her any other way, even if you could. Emily just giggled at you sudden silence, @@.emilyVoice;"sometimes my baby sister is so silly."@@ She'd said that to the other girls, but it was clear you were meant to hear as well. It took you another few moments to realize what was off with that one. "Baby sister", you weren't a @@.girlVoice;baby@@ at all! Yes Emily was your <<sisterTitle>> so she was obviously going to use a @@.girlVoice;cutesy@@ title for you. <<if $playerAge <= 8>>You weren't //that// much younger than her, she shouldn't treat you like a @@.girlVoice;toddler@@.<<else>>You were //older// than her and she was referring to you like a @@.girlVoice;toddler@@.<</if>> <<playerVoice "\"@@.girlVoice;Sissie@@...I mean Emily,\"">> luckily you still could use her real name, <<playerVoice "\"why are you calling me @@.girlVoice;baby sister@@? Isn't that right?"@@ Despite your best intentions you just nodded. You wanted to say no, but you couldn't think of anything else you could possible. No matter how @@.girlVoice;girly@@ and @@.girlVoice;infantile@@ it made you sound, Emily was your <<sisterTitle>> and you were her <<playerTitle>>, that's just how it was. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<set $emilyHappiness to 3>>\You'd meant to just say 'sis' or 'sister' or maybe even 'little sister' just to needle her, but you couldn't. It's not something you'd thought about back when you were more than three feet tall. Standing on your tip toes you are just able to grab the bottom of the handle. Pulling the door from this position with your @@.girlVoice;feeble@@ arms proves difficult, but in the end you are able to get it open. <<set $fridgeStatus to "open">>\ <<set $bladderPressure++>>\ <<elseif $playerPosition === "chair" && $chairPosition === "fridge">>\ From your elevated position it is a simple matter to get ahold of the handle and pull the door with all your strength. The door slowly opens before bumping into the chair. With the chair in front of the fridge you won't be able to open it at all. <</if>>\ <<include "Emily Low Happiness Event Action Handler">> <<set $bladderPressure++>>\<<if $playerPosition === "floor">>\ Despite your successes in getting the fridge door open the jelly is simply too high in the fridge for you to be able to reach. Even stretching as far as you can leaves you at least a foot away. <<elseif $playerPosition === "chair" && $chairPosition === "fridge">>\ With the extra height given by the chair you are able to easily grab the jelly. <<set $playerHasJelly to true>>\ <</if>>\ <<include "Emily Low Happiness Event Action Handler">> <<set $bladderPressure++>>\As you walked your way over to Emily her glare intensified and her frown deepened. You could understand her reaction. At the start of the party the two of you hadn't liked each other much. You'd fought nearly every day. Which was in fact the whole reason that you'd ended up at this sleepover in the first place. A vain attempt to get the two of you to get along. So far it hadn't worked. Not in the slightest. The two of you hated each other even more than before. You were more convinced that she was an immature brat who didn't deserve any of your time. And she was...well you didn't really care what she thought of you. You weren't the one running an insane transformative slumber party. Weirdly enough that wasn't actually the thing that annoyed you the most. It was how infantile she was acting through the whole thing. Sulking when she didn't get her way, playing all these stupid baby games. That didn't mean you didn't enjoy anything. You did get a certain amount of joy out of needling your <<sisterTitle>>. Watching all her little silly plans crumble around her, or even just getting in a good jab or two when the moment was right. Coming to a stop in front of her you wondered if the moment was right. [[Tease Emily|Emily Low Happiness Event 2]] [[Avoid her entirely|Emily Low Happiness Event Abandon]]//Nuh uh. No way.// There was something in Emily's eyes that scared the hell out of you. As much as you loved needling her you didn't want to push her any further. If you poked at her right now, you got the feeling you'd be stuck in something ''terrible''. Mom had no doubt put some rules on her, to prevent her from going too wild, otherwise you'd probably be a @@.girlVoice;giggly little girl@@ already. But Emily was //pissed// right now and she might decide that breaking a few rules was worth it to teach you a lesson. Maybe she'd decide that "little girl" meant "baby girl" and stick you in diapers. That was something you weren't willing to risk. @@.emilyVoice;"What do you want?"@@ Emily huffed. <<playerVoice "\"Ah nevermind, it was nothing. Just seeing what you were up to.\"">> With that you turned and walked away, leaving Emily confused and suspicious, but a little less mad at you. It turned out that you were capable of being civil and maybe that was enough to make you tolerable...for now. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<changeHappiness "Emily" true>>\ <<set $emilyLowHappinessEvent to 2>>\<<playerVoice "\"Awww Emily looks so grumpy, did someone miss her nap time?\"">> Despite her, in your opinion, childish behaviour she was still a growing girl. She wasn't an adult and she had no delusions about that, but she wasn't a toddler anymore and resented it when you insinuated she was. Emily to her credit, ignored the barb. @@.emilyVoice;"I'm just..."@@ she looked away for a moment, @@.emilyVoice;"having a little trouble with something. I need to chop something up, but I'm not supposed to use the knife."@@ That was your mother's rule, the kitchen knives were quite sharp. @@.emilyVoice;"Could you help me?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"No way.\"">> Even if it was only going to be a few minutes you didn't want to help her with anything right now. Even if it was totally on the level you didn't exactly feel like helping her out. <<playerVoice "\"You can wait for mom to get home to help you.\"">> @@.emilyVoice;"I was hoping you'd say that."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Huh?\"">> Was all you were able to say before Emily's angrily levelled her wand at you, an odd gem in the other hand. She chanted something and there was a [[flash of light|Emily Low Happiness Event 3-1]] <<set $emilyLowHappinessEvent to 1>>\<<silently>>\ <<set $oldPlayerOutfit to $playerOutfit>> <<set $oldPlayerAge to $playerAge>> <<set $oldPlayerMaturity to $playerMaturity>> <<set $oldPlayerUnderwear to $playerUnderwear>> <<set $playerOutfit to 21>>\ <<set $playerAge to 3>>\ <</silently>>\ Whatever Emily had just done it was stronger magic than her usual fare. Even now you could see the aura surrounding you, though so far it seemed nothing had changed. Emily smiled, and moved closer to you, @@.emilyVoice;"and down you go."@@ She gave another wave of her wand and the aura sprang to life. It felt like you were being gently crushed from all sides. It basically locked you in place, as moving against the pressure seemed near impossible. <<if $oldPlayerAge >= 10>>You were able to tilt your head just enough to look down at her. <<elseif $oldPlayerAge >= 7>>You locked eyes with your sister.<<else>>You were able to tilt your head just enough to look up at her.<</if>> She looked eminently pleased with herself. The crushing intensified and you were struck with a sudden bout of vertigo. <<if $oldPlayerAge >= 10>>You kept your eyes on Emily even as her position in the room seemed to change. A moment ago you'd been looking down at her, but now your eyes were level with hers. She stuck her tongue out at you, grinning at the fact you were only as tall as her. A grin that only widened as you were forced you to tilt your head //up// to try and keep her eyes in view. You hadn't had time to come to terms with shrinking down to her height, and now you were getting @@.girlVoice;even shorter@@. <<elseif $oldPlayerAge >= 7>>You tried to keep your eyes locked with hers but the task was becoming increasingly difficult. Emily's position was shifting and now you were forced to look //up// at her, an angle that was getting more extreme by the moment.<<else>>You'd already been looking up at your <<sisterTitle>> but the angle was getting more and more extreme. You had to crane your neck to even try to keep her eyes in view.<</if>> Emily wasn't the only thing that looked askew, the whole world around her seemed off kilter. Looking around the room nothing looked like it was supposed to, everything was too big and too tall. @@.emilyVoice;"Awww...you okay down there <<playerName>>?"@@ [[Emily stood over you|Emily Low Happiness Event 3-2]]You turned to look up at Emily only to find your eyes having gotten to her chest. With difficulty you craned your neck trying to look her in the eye. She was @@.girlVoice;enormous@@. She had at least a foot on you and standing as close as she was she looked positively @@.girlVoice;gigantic@@. You tried to take stock of your body, or at least what was left of it. In an flash you'd lost <<if $oldPlayerAge <= 7>>at least half a foot of height and maybe a dozen pounds. It didn't sound like a lot but considering how @@.girlVoice;small@@ you had been it was still a dramatic shift.<<elseif $oldPlayerAge <= 11>>over a foot of height and a few dozen pounds.<<elseif $oldPlayerAge <= 14>>at least two feet of height and more than fifty pounds.<<else>>at least two and a half feet of height and something like a hundred pounds. You were less than half the height you used to be and a quarter the weight.<</if>> Emily was very much the @@.girlVoice;big sister@@ right now, she could probably pick you up if she wanted to. And you almost wanted her to; your legs felt unsteady, as if it was a chore to even keep you upright. You @@.girlVoice;tottered@@ in place, struggling to find a proper balance point. <<if $traitChubby>>You stomach wasn't the only @@.girlVoice;chubby@@ part of you now.<</if>>Everything on you seemed to have a little extra layer of fat. //Baby fat//, you realized. And that extra fat wasn't hiding any muscles underneath, everything about you felt @@.girlVoice;pathetically weak@@. At this size you were practically a @@.girlVoice;baby@@! <<if $oldPlayerAge >= 11>>You could also feel that your manhood had been taken. So not just a @@.girlVoice;baby@@ but a @@.girlVoice;baby girl@@.<</if>> //I'm practically a baby!// you raged. //Wait...a baby?// If you were a baby...you hadn't actually paid any attention to your wardrobe yet. You cast your attention lower, nervous about what you would feel beneath your clothes. [[A diaper|Emily Low Happiness Event 4][$emilyLowHappinessDiaper to true]] <<if !$diaperFlag>>\ [["Regular" underwear|Emily Low Happiness Event 4][$emilyLowHappinessDiaper to false]] <</if>>\<<set _playerOutfitLink to $outfitMap[$playerOutfit].imageLink>>\ <<Image _playerOutfitLink "topRightCorner">>\ <<if $emilyLowHappinessDiaper>>\ You <<if $traitCrybaby || $playerMaturity <= 9>>@@.girlVoice;burst into tears@@<<else>>almost @@.girlVoice;burst into tears@@<</if>> on the spot. A @@.girlVoice;diaper@@. You were wearing a fucking @@.girlVoice;diaper@@. You swayed in place, reeling from the shock, further horrified by the crinkling of your @@.girlVoice;diaper@@ as you did. <<if $traitCrybaby || $playerMaturity <= 9>>However this was enough to staunch your tears for the moment, this was too important to just @@.girlVoice;wail@@ and @@.girlVoice;moan@@.<</if>> <<set $playerUnderwear to "diaper">>\ <<changeEmbarassment "large">>\ <<else>>\ Mercifully, you were wearing what seemed like regular underwear. <<if $oldPlayerUnderwear === "boxers">>Although your boxers had been replaced with <<if $playerMaturity >= 11>>what you hoped were briefs.<<else>>what felt like @@.girlVoice;panties@@.<</if>><</if>> However there was something slightly off about them. They felt a bit heavier than they should, a little thicker maybe, and not as soft as you'd expect. <<set $playerUnderwear to "training pants">>\ <</if>>\ The rest of your outfit was shockingly simple. You were barefoot and wearing a simple dress. It was a strappy dress, no sleeves and came down to mid-thigh<<if $emilyLowHappinessDiaper>> dangerously close to showing your diaper to everyone<</if>>. It was covered in @@.girlVoice;polka dots@@ and there was a @@.girlVoice;rainbow@@ across your chest. But that was it. In a moment of dark humour you wondered if you should consider yourself lucky, Emily had restrained herself from putting you in a @@.girlVoice;pink frilly tutu@@...or a @@.girlVoice;onsie@@. Not that it's simplicity made you feel any better. Instinctively you understood why it was so simple. You were at an age were buttons and zippers were @@.girlVoice;impossible@@ for you to manage. The only kind of outfit you had any hope of being able to put on yourself was something like this. Even sleeves might have complicated matters too much for you to be able to handle it unassisted. It also made it simpler, in the case you didn't want to wear it, for someone to easily shove you into it with minimal fuss. @@.emilyVoice;"Earth to <<playerName>>."@@ Emily snapped her fingers to get your attention and your head snapped back to her and her infuriating grin. She knelt down so she'd be at eye level with you, @@.emilyVoice;"we're going to play a little game."@@ [[A game?|Emily Low Happiness Event 5]]<<playerVoice "\"What kind of game?\"">> You marvelled at how @@.girlVoice;high pitched@@ and @@.girlVoice;squeaky@@ your voice was. However, you could still speak mostly normally. As far as you could tell your mind had been untouched in the change and most of advanced speech was mental conditioning. @@.emilyVoice;"It's a food making game. It's very simple, you're going to make me a peanut butter and jelly sandwich."@@ <<playerVoice "\"That's it?\"">> @@.emilyVoice;"That's it."@@ <<playerVoice "\"And then you'll change me back?\"">> @@.emilyVoice;"Mmmhmm, just like before."@@ <<if $playerAge < 16>>You got the feeling "before" would only turn back the clock to the age you were a few minutes ago. No way you were going to be sixteen again.<</if>> <<playerVoice "\"Any other rules?\"">> @@.emilyVoice;"You can't ask any of the other girls for help."@@ You cast your eyes over to the entrance to the kitchen where the rest of the girl's had assembled. Miki and Kara were looking at you with wide, eager eyes, ready to gush over the new @@.girlVoice;adorable baby@@ addition to the party. Sophie wasn't much different, though she was trying to hide it. @@.emilyVoice;"There is one more thing..."@@ [[You felt a pressure in your head|Emily Low Happiness Event 6][$emilyLowHappinessBladderThreat to false]] [[You felt a pressure in your bladder|Emily Low Happiness Event 6][$emilyLowHappinessBladderThreat to true]]<<silently>>\ <<if $traitLittleSister>> <<set $emilyHelpPhrase to "Big sis, I can't do it">> <<else>> <<set $emilyHelpPhrase to "Emily, I need your help">> <</if>> <</silently>>\ Emily continued, her voice was sickly sweet, @@.emilyVoice;"you are on a sort of a timer."@@ She let that hang in the air for a moment, knowing you'd be desperate to ask, but she was enjoying your discomfort. <<if $emilyLowHappinessBladderThreat>>\ <<if $emilyLowHappinessDiaper>>@@.emilyVoice;"Well you //are// in a diaper.@@<<else>>@@.emilyVoice;"Well you wouldn't want to ruin your new training pants.@@<</if>> @@.emilyVoice;Little baby <<playerName>> doesn't know how to use the potty yet."@@ At her words you felt a disturbing pressure in your gut, a slight urge to use the washroom building in the back of your mind. Whether you really needed to, or it was just psychosomatic pressure from Emily's words, you weren't sure. She was wrong though, you knew //exactly// how to use the toilet. The knowledge wasn't the issue; the problem was your body. You doubted you'd be able to even get onto a regular toilet without help, and Emily wouldn't help. This was compounded by the fact that your tiny bladder, plus poor awareness, meant you could go from zero to accident in moments. <<if $emilyLowHappinessDiaper>>Wearing a diaper was bad enough, wearing a //wet// diaper would cause you to die of shame.<<else>>That explained the thickness of your underwear. They were "training pants", meant for kids old enough to be potty trained, but with a little extra padding just in case. That made it worse. You were //supposed// to be mostly trained by the time you were wearing them, an accident would be a mortifying failure.<<changeEmbarassment "small">><</if>> <<else>>\ @@.emilyVoice;"Well your brain is awfully little now. Hard to keep all those big kid thoughts. They might just go ''pop''."@@ She giggled at the last word. At her words you felt a disturbing pressure in your head. You weren't sure if it was something real, or just Emily's words messing with you, but something did feel wrong. It was taking so much work to keep yourself focused. Every complex thought seemed to increase the pressure on your head. If that pressure did finally "pop", what would be left of your mind? <</if>>\ @@.emilyVoice;"And if you need any help just say "$emilyHelpPhrase", and I'll come and help you, no strings."@@ Her smile was inscrutable, @@.emilyVoice;"what are you waiting for, better hurry."@@ [[Check the room|Emily Low Happiness Event 7]]You took a moment to collect your thoughts. A peanut butter and jelly sandwich. Normally this would be a trivial task, but in this body you doubted it'd be so simple. First a checklist, what would you need to get? Peanut butter, jelly, bread...simple enough. Oh, and a knife to spread it with. Four items then a little bit of work and Emily would have what she wanted and you could go back to normal. Time to get to work. You scanned the room. The jelly was high up in the fridge, the bread was on the kitchen counter, the peanut butter was in the condiment cupboard high above the bread and the knife would be in the drawer just under the counter. The only other furnishings of note was the kitchen table, in the center of the room set away from the counter and fridge and one wooden chair. This is where the problems became apparent. The chair, normally something you didn't even think about, was now a significant obstacle. Standing in front of it the seat was level with your chest. Just 'sitting down', would be impossible, you'd have to climb to even make it up there. Which meant the rest of the room was even worse. You couldn't even see the top of the counter if you were standing beside. If you reached up you could get a hand up there, on tip toes maybe even your wrist, but there was zero chance you could clamber your way up unaided. You'd have to climb up on the chair first, then onto the counter. Maybe you could handle the fridge, or the cutlery drawer, but you weren't sure. This chair was about to become your new best friend. [[Time to make a sandwich|Emily Low Happiness Event 8]] <<silently>>\ <<set $bladderPressure to 1>> <<set $chairPosition to "table">> <<set $playerPosition to "floor">> <<set $playerHasKnife to false>> <<set $playerHasPeanutButter to false>> <<set $playerHasJelly to false>> <<set $playerHasBread to false>> <<set $fridgeStatus to "closed">> <<set $drawerStatus to "closed">> <<set $condimentCupboardStatus to "closed">> <<set $emilyAskForHelpCount to 0>> <</silently>>\<<playerVoice "\"Oh no,\"">> you were out of time, the pressure in your brain was unbearable. @@.emilyVoice;"Is baby <<playerName>> having trouble?"@@ Emily cooed into your ear. With grammar you didn't even know the rules, or that there were rules, so how could you be doing it wrong? @@.karaVoice;"It's called //dooplo-k-teon//, where they //ree-pete// the //sil-a-bull// //in-sted// of finishing the word."@@ Kara clarified. I just need to focus.// @@.karaVoice;"I've got lots of //cuz-ins// and my mom is a //pee-dee-ah-tri-c-an//. //Ch-ill-hoo-duh// //dev-l-oop-meh-nt// comes up a lot."@@ //Okay maybe it's just Kara I can't understand.// @@.mikiVoice;"My mommy talks about it sometimes. Whatever it had meant, it was more words you didn't know, even a six year old was talking impossibly above your level. You might as well be listening to gibberish. You couldn't stand it, you wanted to know what they were saying! <<playerVoice "\"//Wan ter baba na//!\"">> You suddenly shouted. But the girls didn't understand you at all, the words having come out @@.girlVoice;jumbled@@. @@.emilyVoice;"Water ban?"@@ Emily considered, @@.emilyVoice;"are you //thurs-t-ee//?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"No! //Wan ter baba na//!\"">> You shouted again, somehow thinking saying it louder would make them understand better. You knew it @@.girlVoice;sounded like nonsense@@, you'd barely even spoken words there. But the more stressed you got, the more mistakes you made. I'll //re-ver-ss// the spell."@@ You waited patiently to change back...for about 2 seconds which was the most patience you could handle. <<playerVoice "\"//Chain bak//! //Chain bak//!\"">> Once again relying on volume when coherence wasn't an option.
