[[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<pushJournalEntry "9To8Age" "Journal 9 to 8 Age" "regression">>\<<if $playerMaturity <= 6>>\ <<elseif $playerMaturity <= 9>>\ We gots to play dressup and dress up is lots of fun. I had fun waring Emilys clothes. <<if $age8DressupUnicornDress>>She gave me a prety unicorn dress and I look like a prinsess.<<else>>Here clothes were very prety and cute. and I liek them better than old clothes.<</if>> <<elseif $playerMaturity <= 13>>\ I still need to think about what just happened. I'm smaller, yeah, but like, I didn't know how small. I got Emily's clothes. I mean like straight from her cloest, no magic, no growing, just her clothes. It's conserning. How much smaller am I going to get? I'm going to be a little sister soon, Emily even called me a little sister even though we're the same size...I don't know where I'm going with this...it's just...it's weird to not be the 'big' sibling anymore. <<else>>\ My regression continues unabated, once again causing me to shrink out of my clothes. Which distressingly meant it was time for another dressup session. It doesn't really matter what I ended up in<<if $age8DressupUnicornDress>>, though a rainbow unicorn dress was particularly galling<</if>>. The concerning part is that it came straight from Emily's closet, no magic, just sharing clothes with my sister. This needs to stop before it goes any further. <</if>>\Your mind was still reeling from the last activity. Though it'd been happening for a while you'd never get used to the feeling of your brain @@.girlVoice;slipping away@@. It was strange because, usually, you were aware of the things that had been lost. A normal...let's say nine year old, wouldn't bemoan the loss of knowledge of algebra. They wouldn't even know what algebra was. Yet even now you still remembered the existence of high school Math concepts...you just @@.girlVoice;had no idea how they worked@@. It was an extremely frustrating situation, doubly so because there was nothing you could do about it. Even if you'd had the time to leaf through a Math textbook there was no way your mind would be able to re-absorb the information. There was too much going on, you felt like your head was going to... @@.sophieVoice;"What's going on with you?"@@ Sophie's voice broke you from your train of thought. You hadn't even heard her come up behind you. She took a closer look at you, @@.sophieVoice;"you doing ok? You look..."@@ she hunted for the word, @@.sophieVoice;"painy."@@ Was the best she came up with. <<playerVoice "\"I'm alright, I think,\"">> you muttered, <<playerVoice "\"my brain is all...is all...uhh...\"">> The word escaped you so you mimed your head coming apart, complete with sound effect. Sophie quirked her head, @@.sophieVoice;"what are you saying? I don't get it."@@ You furrowed your brow in frustration. [[Think harder|10 to 9 Maturity Change 2]]It came to you, <<playerVoice "\"it\'s all \'splody.\"">> You weren't one hundred percent confident in that word, but it seemed close enough. @@.girlVoice;'splody@@ was be the word for when your head went 'boom', right? @@.karaVoice;"I think $they mean 'exploding'. 'My head is exploding'"@@ Kara smoothly explained, having overheard the last part of the conversation. You opened your mouth to respond, but quickly realized she was right. How had you forgotten the word? Was there more than just Math leaving your head? What if you started forgetting @@.girlVoice;big words@@ entirely? You took a breath to steady yourself. It had just been one word and it was an odd one. It was hard to explain a situation that was so abs...abs...@@.girlVoice;weird@@. <<playerVoice "\"I need a minute,\"">> you squeaked out and hurried away. You took ahold of your jour-@@.girlVoice;diary@@. [[Open your diary|10 to 9 Maturity Change 3]]<section class="paper paper--postActivity">\ <div class="papertext">\ <<set _entryClass to getCurrentWritingStyleClass($playerMaturity)>>\ <span @class='_entryClass'>\ I am cheking to make sure that I can still rite I dont want to @@.strikethrough;forg@@ not no how to rite. </span>\ </div>\ </section>\ You stared down at the page, you could tell something was off, but it was difficult to see where. The thoughts in your head just @@.girlVoice;didn't seem right@@ on the page. <section class="paper paper--postActivity">\ <div class="papertext">\ <<set _entryClass to getCurrentWritingStyleClass($playerMaturity)>>\ <span @class='_entryClass'>\ sophie was @@.strikethrough;dishrack@@ talking to me and then kara came and said a word I didnt know but I used to no the word. I think I used to no the word </span>\ </div>\ </section>\ You bit your lip. You were fairly confident that you'd spelled 'sophie' right, but it hadn't been automatic. Her name was weird, it had letters that it didn't need. And reading it back the flow was @@.girlVoice;all wrong@@, your grammar was degra-degri-@@.girlVoice;bad@@. You needed to know if you could at still spell. <section class="paper paper--postActivity">\ <div class="papertext">\ <<set _entryClass to getCurrentWritingStyleClass($playerMaturity)>>\ <span @class='_entryClass' style="white-space: pre;">\ grade @@.strikethrough;ahvenoh@@ space suprise sandwitch naybor rahpid responsbility freight @@.strikethrough;prezinta@@ @@.strikethrough;pressunta@@ tipe @@.strikethrough;consissn@@ @@.strikethrough;consistn@@ </span>\ </div>\ </section>\ You put down your pen, things had started okay, the first column looked mostly correct. But once you tried to do bigger words it had started to @@.girlVoice;fall apart@@. @@.girlVoice;By the end you couldn't even make a good guess.@@ @@.sophieVoice;"I keep wondering what you're writing in there."@@ [[Sophie snatched the diary|10 to 9 Maturity Change 4]]As distressed as you were about your poor spelling performance you were too slow to stop her. She read through the current page and laughed, @@.sophieVoice;"do you usually do spelling tests for fun?"@@ She handed the @@.girlVoice;diary@@ back to you, @@.sophieVoice;"there is no 't' in sandwich...and I think freight is wrong, the 'i' is supposed to be before the 'e'."@@ You flushed at the corrections, though you couldn't actually be sure if she was right. Regardless it still felt pretty awful to be corrected by a nine year old. @@.sophieVoice;"Don't worry about it,"@@ Sophie waved off your concerns, @@.sophieVoice;"it's easier to look at someone else's and see what's wrong. I make those kind of mistakes all the time."@@ You weren't sure if that was supposed to make you feel better. She was saying your writing wasn't particularly bad...by @@.girlVoice;grade four standards@@. Though to be fair, those were the highest standards of the group. Sophie was the oldest so she probably wrote the best. @@.sophieVoice;"I mean I could do better if it was for school,"@@ she bragged and then grinned at you, @@.sophieVoice;"but is that the best you can do?"@@ Her eyes sparkling as her competitive streak shone through. [[Answer her|10 to 9 Maturity Change 5]]You glanced back down at your @@.girlVoice;diary@@, quickly scanning the older entries, they weren't much better. Your @@.girlVoice;diary@@ was just a personal log so you hadn't been correcting grammar or spelling. But it was clear that things were @@.girlVoice;getting worse@@. Maybe you could do better if you really tried, but did you even want to? Sophie was being awfully nice to you right now, even though it seemed like something she could easily tease about. Except since you were having the same issues she did, she didn't really have any ground to stand on. You wondered if she'd be like that with other things, would the others? Maybe Emily would be nicer to you if she thought you were more like her. Until now you'd been a lot smarter than the rest of the group, but now it was questionable. Sophie and Kara would both challenge you in their own way, and Emily wouldn't be far off. Did you want to cling on to being the smart one? What if the other girls @@.girlVoice;thought you were a snob@@? Maybe it would be better just to let yourself slack off a bit, slide into the @@.girlVoice;middle of the pack@@, not stand out. [[Try your best|10 to 9 Maturity Change 6a]] [[Dumb it down|10 to 9 Maturity Change 6b]] <<changeEmbarassment "small">>\<section class="paper paper--postActivity">\ <div class="papertext">\ <<set _entryClass to getCurrentWritingStyleClass($playerMaturity)>>\ <span @class='_entryClass'>\ I can @@.strikethrough;rite@@ write better than the other writing. I just have to focuss and I can write better then @@.strikethrough;s@@Sophie. Writing is not tearably hard as long as I try. </span>\ </div>\ </section>\ You worked hard and even did a second pass to correct the couple small mistakes that you saw. The words had still came out @@.girlVoice;pretty awkward@@, and you really weren't sure about 'tearably', but it was cleaner than before. Sophie took a look at your work and frowned, reading through it again. She was trying to find mistakes, but was struggling to do so. Watching her mouth move through the word 'terribly' you were sure she also suspected the spelling was wrong, but wasn't confident enough to correct it. @@.sophieVoice;"You use 'I' too much. Teacher says you have to use other words too."@@ Despite her suggestion she wasn't forthcoming about exactly //what// you should be using instead, maybe she didn't know. [[Kara checked the paper|10 to 9 Maturity Change 7]]<section class="paper paper--postActivity">\ <div class="papertext">\ <<set _entryClass to getCurrentWritingStyleClass($playerMaturity)>>\ <span @class='_entryClass'>\ I am riting @@.strikethrough;dis@@ this to shoo how well I can rite. If I focuss then I can rite as well as sophie. Riting is verry hard but I try my best </span>\ </div>\ </section>\ In truth you mostly just let yourself write normally, mistakes @@.girlVoice;happened plenty@@ on their own. You just didn't go back and fix the one you did see. You worried that maybe you'd done //too// good a job and were tempted to go make another mistake, but Sophie didn't give you the chance. Sophie took a look at your work and smiled, @@.sophieVoice;"well I see you tried really hard,"@@ she couldn't keep the superiority out of her voice, @@.sophieVoice;"but 'write' has a 'w' in the front, and you forgot a period at the end, and my name is supposed to have a big S."@@ She beamed, having found at least one mistake per sentence. Though you surprisingly didn't feel particularly embarrassed. Sophie wasn't teasing you, she'd actually praised you in her own way. This kind of writing was @@.girlVoice;totally normal for grade 4@@, so you just blended in. [[Kara checked the paper|10 to 9 Maturity Change 7]] <<changeHappiness "Sophie" true>>@@.karaVoice;"Well I think $they did a very good job."@@ Kara spoke warmly and you blushed at the compliment. <<if $karaInferiorityComplex>>Kara was @@.girlVoice;really smart@@, so if she thought it was good then you were sure it was.<<else>>Maybe having a seven year old compliment your writing wasn't the highest praise, but Kara was @@.girlVoice;really smart@@. She probably knew better than Sophie @@.girlVoice;or you@@ did.<</if>> @@.karaVoice;"You shouldn't be such a bully,"@@ Kara admonished Sophie, @@.karaVoice;"trying hard is what's important."@@ Even Sophie looked a little abashed at that and your heart soared. Kara was right, Sophie was being a @@.girlVoice;mean bully@@ and you hated those. You folded your arms across your chest, swelling with righteous fury. @@.sophieVoice;"I'm sorry,"@@ Sophie murmured, much to your surprise. Your indignation fading away almost instantly. It seemed like she really was being nicer to you now. Maybe she felt worse now that she was teasing someone more @@.girlVoice;at her level@@, rather than someone who could easily take it. @@.sophieVoice;"Oh!"@@ Sophie exclaimed before rushing off. You and Kara looked to each other and Kara shrugged. When Sophie returned she was holding a box of @@.girlVoice;pencil crayons@@, @@.sophieVoice;"here,"@@ she offered you the box, @@.sophieVoice;"you can use these to write your diary."@@ The box was clearly a peace offering on Sophie's part. Your eyes went wide at all the @@.girlVoice;pretty colors@@, there were so many options. Your eyes settled on one pencil, in a particularly @@.girlVoice;bright pink@@. Normally you wouldn't have even considered it, but you couldn't help but think how much @@.girlVoice;prettier@@ your @@.girlVoice;diary@@ would be if you used a pencil like that. You took the box and nodded, <<playerVoice "\"I'm going to write my diary now. Sophie, the pencils are apreci-apriee-thank you for the pencils.\"">> Excited for your next @@.girlVoice;diary@@ entry you wandered away. [[You grunted|11 to 10 Maturity Change 2]]@@.karaVoice;"So once you have the foundation on you can apply blush."@@ With your eyes closed, you couldn't really see any of what was going on. The only thing you could discern was the feeling of the brush on your cheeks. You could almost feel Kara's intense focus. @@.karaVoice;"You have to be really careful with eyeliner or it'll look silly."@@ You got the distinct feeling you might already look silly. @@.emilyVoice;"Can I do the other eye?"@@ You tried to signal your disagreement with this suggestion. But they either didn't notice or didn't care. Emily's touch was even less sure than Kara's. You almost abandoned the whole thing when you heard Miki give a small hiss, no doubt cringing at some mistake. @@.karaVoice;"Okay <<playerName>> don't open your eyes, but try to look down."@@ You didn't totally understand how that was possible, but you tried to [[look down.|11 to 10 Maturity Change 4a]]You felt a small tug on your eyebrow and then something brushing through your eyelashes. Though you weren't really sure why thick lashes were the goal. @@.karaVoice;"Oh shoot, I forgot to,"@@ Kara noticed your concern, @@.karaVoice;"almost forgot to curl them."@@ You felt a new sensation on your eyelashes, gently pulling at them. @@.mikiVoice;"It looks the same."@@ @@.karaVoice;"Hmmm, well $they already had such nice lashes, I guess it doesn't do much."@@ You weren't one hundred percent sure how to feel about having @@.girlVoice;long pretty lashes@@, but it was surely better than having short ugly ones. @@.karaVoice;"Now let me finish the mascara,"@@ Kara started working on the first eye again. You got the feeling you'd been taken somewhere else, but where? [[Search for a light|12 to 11 Maturity Change 1c]]<<if $traitAfraidOfTheDark>>\ You fumbled around for a light switch. All you had to do was find a light and you'd be fine, you just had to find it. Your desperate search became more and more frenzied. You'd already banged yourself against half a dozen unknown objects, which only made you more panicked. Revealing the fact that the mystery location was just the basement. <</if>>\ Heading up to the basement door you tugged on it, to no avail. Locked. Shouting for someone to open the door had no effect. It looked like you'd been grounded and were stuck in 'time out' until Emily decided otherwise. <<if $traitSoftspoken && $traitGRatedLanguage>>\ But you probably deserved it. You'd yelled and been a @@.girlVoice;bad girl@@. You @@.girlVoice;weren't supposed to raise your voice@@ like that, and you felt @@.girlVoice;really guilty@@. You wanted to go up and apologize right now, but the door stubbornly wouldn't open. It'd be at least a little while before you could go. Maybe you could find something to do? <<elseif $traitSoftspoken>>\ Honestly it was a bit of a shock that you'd been able to raise your voice like that at all. You'd just been so mad that it seemed to overwrite your normal behaviour. Now you'd have to take some time and get yourself calmed down. You needed to find something to do to burn off some stress. <<elseif $traitMonophobia>> But being in the light didn't fix the whole issue. You were still down here entirely by yourself for the foreseeable future. There had to be a way that you could get yourself back upstairs with the group. Maybe if you could distract yourself, calm down, she'd let you back up. <<else>>\ You'd gotten your alone time, but it'd come at a cost. It was calm, too calm, there wasn't anything to do //at all//. You groaned, you might be stuck down here all day, @@.girlVoice;mind numbingly bored@@. <</if>>\ [[Find something to do|12 to 11 Maturity Change 2]]Your mother had never gotten around to finishing this basement. Which meant it was a concrete floor and blank walls. Within five minutes you were @@.girlVoice;going crazy@@ it was so @@.girlVoice;boring@@. Then your eye caught something in the corner...your old laptop! It was a miracle. It was going to be seriously out of date, but at least it was something. You just had to see what games you had available. Surprisingly you actually had a pretty good number of choices, but most of it didn't seem that appealing. Best to start with an old standby. [[Overwatch|Video Game Overwatch]] [[Street Fighter|Video Game Street Fighter]]<<Image 'VideoGames/Stills/Overwatch.webp' "medium">>\ Shooters were always a good way to burn off some frustration and Overwatch was one of the best. Fast paced, lots of variety, fun characters. Should be a nice little distraction for a bit. You were pretty good at the game after all, so a few crushing wins should really raise your mood. Though your first game was terribly unlucky. You usually played Reinhart, big guy, tanky, but slow. Great at defending the team, but couldn't push without support...and you weren't getting any. Your team kept yelling at you saying you were 'out of position'. It was annoying but you knew it was @@.girlVoice;all their fault@@. You were just pushing forward while they were just waiting around doing nothing. Your next few games were no better, and you were getting really tired of waiting around. Beyond people being passive in game, everything was so slow. There were queues for the game, then picking characters, then a countdown, and then you had to wait ages every time you died. You'd had enough, time for a change. Tracer. She was like the fastest character in the game so you wouldn't have to wait around. Though before you could actually play you had to choose the right cosmetics. You hadn't cared with Reinhart, but Tracer was @@.girlVoice;way cuter@@. Finally you managed to settle on a skin and get into a game...then the second you taunted you realized the skin didn't look right from the back. You considered what to do...Your team was losing badly anyway, might as well leave and fix it. You quit out to pick a new one. You had middling success, they weren't really //that// many outfits and they all were pretty much the same. Before you even got into another match you'd gotten bored of the whole procedure. You weren't into Overwatch today, you needed something else. [[Choose another Game|12 to 11 Maturity Change 3]]<<Image 'VideoGames/Stills/StreetFighter.webp' "medium">>\ Street Fighter seemed like something you could get into. It required such a level of focus that you'd be too engaged to worry about everything else. Logging in you went to your old standby, Ken. Sure he wasn't the most exciting character, but excitement wasn't as important as winning. If only you could get a win. Maybe it was the laptop, maybe it was rust, maybe it was just being in the wrong headspace, but you couldn't seem to land anything. Your opponents seemed to be able to read every single move you made. After a particularly brutal beating by a Karin player you were about to throw in the towel. But maybe if you can't beat them, join them. Karin time. Your first game was ok, you didn't win but things did feel closer. But you hated how she looked by default, going straight to the costumes after the games. There were a good number of options, but most of them were just color variations. At least the nostalgia costume was @@.girlVoice;cute@@ and the 30th anniversary one was @@.girlVoice;pretty@@, but you were bored of the whole thing. You didn't want to play this any more. You needed something new. [[Choose another Game|12 to 11 Maturity Change 3]]Well that hadn't gone well, clearly you weren't in the right mind space and those games weren't meant for a laptop anyway. Maybe something a little slower paced? [[Splatoon|Video Game Splatoon]] [[Hyperdimension Neptunia|Video Game Neptunia]]<<Image 'VideoGames/Stills/Splatoon.webp' "medium">>\ Shooters were pretty high tempo, but you could play one single player and still have fun. With advances in emulator technology you could even play a Wii game. Time for a classic, Splatoon. Bunch of squid kids having a glorified water gun fight, what could be more fun than that? The game was fun...for about half of the first game. Turns out your mind wasn't really in this one either, the AI kept sneaking up on you or sniping you. Every time it happened it made you @@.girlVoice;more annoyed@@. The more annoyed you got the worse you played. This continued a little while longer before you gave up entirely on playing matches. Instead messing around with some of the social features, this was limited considering you were offline. There were some customization though but changing your Inkling's 'hair' colour wasn't really that fun. You sighed, if you were going to keep getting distracted with @@.girlVoice;dressing up@@ your character, you'd be better off finding something that properly supported it. [[Choose another Game|12 to 11 Maturity Change 4]]<<Image 'VideoGames/Stills/Neptunia.webp' "medium">>\ A drastic change of pace was in order. Your laptop wasn't really up for the task of hardcore competitive gaming and to be honest neither were you. A JRPG sounded like a good idea. Turn based, so it didn't matter if the controls were awkward and you didn't have to think nearly as fast. Plus the Neptunia games were pretty easy, a fun romp with some @@.girlVoice;cute anime girls@@ rather than anything challenging. Though these games weren't made with the highest budgets, so you ended up seeing the same enemies again and again, just in different color palettes. After the third variant color of a Doggo you were bored of the whole thing. At least the game had a few other things to keep attention. The cutscenes were pretty funny and it was fun messing around with gear choices. Every girl had a super mode, and you could equip different armor pieces for that mode. The legs, the arms, the headgear, etc. But even this wasn't able to hold your attention long. After all the options were also mostly palette swaps. The only thing that seemed to be holding your attention right now was customization, maybe you could find a game to scratch that itch? [[Choose another Game|12 to 11 Maturity Change 4]]You still weren't finding anything that you could sink your teeth into. Everything was either too hard, too boring or both. You wanted something that would let you play with some more character personalization. [[The Sims|Video Game The Sims]] [[Stardew Valley|Video Game Stardew Valley]]<<Image 'VideoGames/Stills/TheSims.webp' "medium">>\ If you weren't in the mood for anything with real action, maybe a simulation game would suit you. The Sims wasn't your usual fare, you'd usually found it too uneventful. It was basically just interior decorating the game, but you'd never gotten around to deleting it. Today was different; you were invested in your Sim and the life they were living. If nothing else it was cathartic to have a proper set of customization options. This all came to a head when it was time for a wedding. You'd totally gotten into it now, there was so much to prepare and you really had to focus. By the time your Sim was walking down the aisle you were feeling the palpable relief of a job well done. Well, that and enjoying how @@.girlVoice;pretty@@ the @@.girlVoice;wedding dress@@ you'd picked was. How you were going to make such a @@.girlVoice;lovely bride@@...well not you, but your Sim...wait, since when were you playing the bride instead of the groom? You'd thought that you were planning for the groom...but no you remembered picking out dresses and shoes for the @@.girlVoice;bride@@. You shook your head, the bride had more options anyway, that's probably how it'd happened. But you still didn't like how into the role you'd gotten. Maybe there was something else. [[Choose another Game|12 to 11 Maturity Change 5]]<<Image 'VideoGames/Stills/StardewValley.webp' "medium">>\ If you weren't in the mood for anything with real action, maybe a simulation game would suit you. Stardew Valley wasn't your usual fare, you'd played it before, but bounced off of it pretty quickly. Today it was much more your speed. There was something calming about slowly expanding your farm. You were even able to get some chickens and even a cow to take care of. It might have been over the top but you made sure to go and talk to each of them twice in a day, it seemed to make them happy. Time blurred as your kept playing, it was hard to tell if you'd been playing for minutes or hours... It gave you time to build relationships with all the people in town. They were such an interesting group of people Marney was the one who'd sold you the animals. Harvey had some sad secret that you hadn't been able to figure out yet. Maru was really energetic and Jas was adorable. Though you ended up spending a lot of time with Elliot. His story was interesting and you had a good sense of what gifts he liked, so the two of you quickly grew closer. You didn't really know where the relationship was heading, but you were eager to find out. Next he'd invited onto a boat and was blabbering on about his book, and how you'd supported him and he suddenly @@.girlVoice;kissed you@@. You @@.girlVoice;squealed@@ out loud at the sudden turn of events. He was @@.girlVoice;so cute@@ and for a moment you felt just as happy as your character did. It seemed only moments later that the two of you were going to get married. There was a small panic because your character had nothing but overalls, luckily through some swift dyeing and tailoring you were able to make a proper @@.girlVoice;wedding dress@@ It was only a sprite based game, but in your imagination it was so @@.girlVoice;elegant@@. You shook your head, you hadn't even realized you'd been playing as a girl the whole time. You'd blame the simple graphics for the confusion, but even you didn't believe that. It'd just felt natural to play as a girl, and to be @@.girlVoice;kissing boys@@ but mooning over a @@.girlVoice;wedding dress@@? That was too much, you needed a change of pace. [[Choose another Game|12 to 11 Maturity Change 5]]That was it, you'd tried every game that you had that was worth trying. You felt like you'd calmed down, but there was no sign of impending freedom. All this over some dumb sports trophy. You didn't even know what it was for except that it'd gotten you in trouble. Sports were always trouble, games like these were way more fun. You could play @@.girlVoice;dress up@@ and didn't have to get all dirty. In desperation you pulled out your phone. You had never installed any games on it before, but now seemed like a good time to break that trend...except you couldn't get a signal down here and were stuck with whatever you had. Calculator. Maps. Calendar. Contacts. Settings. Clock. Love Nikki? Huh? You didn't recognize that app at all, when had you installed it? Maybe it was a preload? Either way, 'Love Nikki' was such an odd name that you had to try it, even if you didn't know what to expect [[Check it out|Video Game Love Nikki]]<span id="nikkiImage"><<Image 'VideoGames/Stills/Love-CuteGirly.webp' 'medium'>></span>\ When you opened it you were bombarded with a dizzying array of unfamiliar options. Events and quests and achievements and countdown and frostbite and wardrobe...Wardrobe you at least understood, so you started your investigation there. Once again you were entirely overwhelmed by what you saw, this was no ordinary wardrobe, there were //thousands// of items to choose from. Apparently you already owned a small fraction of them, and even that would be enough for a vast wardrobe in the real world. You scrolled through the options: hairstyles, dresses, shoes, accessories, makeup, it was a //crazy// amount of stuff. Clearly a lot of work had been put into this, but how much detail did they have? You clicked on a random item, "Snow Kite Elf". Turned out to be a @@.girlVoice;super cute pink dress@@. But you only got to see the dress itself, not how it looked on a character. Annoyed you clicked again to actually put it on...but you didn't own it...in fact you had to make something else first and then dye it into this. You cast a glance at the door, still locked, so you had a bit of time to kill. It was going to be a process. You needed to play a few levels to get the items to turn into the dress, and then you had to find a way to get the dye and have enough money for the whole process...you hunkered down and got to work. The 'game' itself turned out to be a series of @@.girlVoice;dress-up competitions@@. Making the best outfit you could based upon a given theme. Sure it was @@.girlVoice;girly@@ but it had a somewhat interesting story as. Plus you just needed to know what that dress looked like and then you'd be done, just scratching that curious itch. What ensued was a flurry of competitions, trying your best with your limited resources. <<if $traitShopaholic>>At least until you found the store. You could get a //ton// of resources and seriously speed up the process. Hurriedly you put $20 onto your account, that was enough to buy a super booster pack..and you had a few dollars left for a pack that was on sale. It was usually almost $20 on it's own, so it was a great bargain. The fact it was a @@.girlVoice;'princess set'@@ was secondary.<<set $loveNikkiBoughtGold to true>><</if>> Though the early levels weren't expecting you to have anything too fancy, so you were winning almost every time. @@.emilyVoice;"That's a pretty cute dress <<playerTitle>>."@@ You jumped at the sudden voice, almost dropping your phone. Emily moved back and just giggled. You'd been too engrossed in the game and hadn't even noticed her sneaking up behind you. @@.emilyVoice;"Are you ready to apologize?"@@ Her look was hesitant, unsure of your current mental state. But you had calmed down, a lot, and realized how much of a jerk you'd been. The only reason you hesitated was that you hadn't actually gotten to see the dress. But you could always @@.girlVoice;play later@@. You nodded to Emily and she motioned towards the now open door. I mean...enough about me, let's talk about you\"">>, you scanned to see if there was anything you could talk about. <<playerVoice "\"Oh! Your bracelet is @@.girlVoice;cute@@, tell me about it.\"">> Miki's eyes lit up and you breathed a sigh of relief. //Perfect. She'll go on and on about the bracelet and I won't have to think of other things.// It worked, almost too well, you weren't sure how long you'd ended up talking. But you knew way more about @@.girlVoice;jewellery@@ than ever before, and Miki said she would teach you to make a friendship bracelet. @@.sophieVoice;"Come on you two, time for the next activity."@@, Sophie shouted. You'd achieved your goal, successful distraction. Time for another game so you didn't have to think about <<if $sexualityLock>>@@.girlVoice;kissing@@<<else>>@@.girlVoice;cute boys@@<</if>> anymore. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<pushJournalEntry "14To13Mat" "Journal 14 to 13 Maturity" "regression">>\<<if $sexualityLock>>I'm suddenly totally obssessed with kissing.<<elseif $admitLikingBoys>>I think I totally want to kiss a boy.<<else>>@@.strikethrough;I don't want to admit it, but I think I want to kiss a boy.@@<</if>> This is totally getting worse, I can almost like feel my mind changing. I don't know what other stuff is different, but clearly some of my perferences are changing, I was thinking about football and it was totally super boring, I'm pretty sure I used to like football, @@.strikethrough;and not just cause of the uniforms@@ Anyway I was talking to Miki about jewellery and it was totally fasinating. I'll have to work hard, to keep straight which thoughts are mine and which aren't.\You were hit by another dizzy spell, almost immediately followed with a rush of anger. This was insane, how was it even remotely reasonable that your sister would be allowed to mess with you like this? How could your mother not just allow this, but actually set it up and encourage it? @@.girlVoice;It's just not fair.@@ You exhaled, trying to center yourself. It was no good to let your emotions get the better of you. You had to keep yourself in check so you could actually understand what was happening to you. But how could you use an altered mind to examine whether it had been altered? Maybe your memories? You knew what a normal day and a normal week was, so maybe you could use that as a baseline and see what changed? Yesterday was Friday, what classes did you have on Fridays? The morning was English and History. In English you were reading Brave New World, a complicated book, but you mostly got it. History was just more about World War 1, too many dates to remember, but that was standard. Lunch. Usual table, usual classmates. You weren't really close to anyone, but you'd been chatting to Mark about cars, a conversation that went on for far too long<<if !$knowledgeCars>>, and you @@.girlVoice;didn't understand@@<</if>>. Right right, then the pair of you had somehow gotten dragged into the girl's conversation on @@.girlVoice;shoes@@. At the time you'd been bored to tears but as you reminisced it was actually @@.girlVoice;pretty interesting@@. There was apparently a whole community about it on Instagram that you'd never heard about. The afternoon was your favourite subject, Math. It was actually pretty neat, you'd just gotten into pre-calc which you could use to<span class="blurOutText"> do all kinds of neat stuff. For example, in the syllabus there was vectors for forces, some basic probability, matrices, though you didn't know much about them yet.</span>...what was it again? You remembered going to the class, but the details that were discussed eluded you. What about the week before? Linear equations which were...about lines or something? You couldn't remember, that Math knowledge was gone. No doubt other stuff as well, but it is an impossible task to remember all the things you'd forgotten. You glanced over at your sister, happily chatting away with the others. Apparently her threat extended beyond just acting like a kid. If this kept up you ''were'' going to end up empty headed and giggling for real. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<pushJournalEntry "15To14Mat" "Journal 15 to 14 Maturity" "regression">>\ <<silently>>\ <<if $showAnimations>> <<timed 2s>> <<script>> $(".blurOutText").addClass('blurry-text6'); <</script>> <</timed>> <<else>> <<timed 0s>> <<script>> $(".blurOutText").css('text-shadow', '0 0 10px #fff'); <</script>> <</timed>> <</if>> <</silently>>The attack on my mind is only getting worse. It's not just enticing me to join the party, it's literally draining knowledge out of my head. All my high school Math knowledge is gone. Hopefully it won't @@.strikethrough;affect@@ @@.strikethrough;effect@@ impact my writing too much, but maybe it already has, I dunno how I'd even know. Anyway I better keep sharp or this journal is going to turn into total mess.\You were suddenly struck with a dizzy spell. @@.karaVoice;"Are you alright? You look faint."@@ Kara's voice was filled with genuine concern. But you weren't exactly sure of the answer to that. <<if $playerAge < 16>>\ You tried to calm yourself and analyse what you were feeling. The obvious likelihood was that you'd gotten even younger. A quick check in the mirror dismissed that possibility. No, it wasn't anything physical. At least not something obvious. <</if>>\ You glanced over to the other girls. Miki and Emily were giggling about some inane thing and Sophie was trying, and failing, to not join in. Quick enough all of them were in fits of giggles, they looked like they were having @@.girlVoice;so much fun.@@ You started the thought. Emily nodded and came over to speak with you, @@.emilyVoice;"Why are you over here by yourself? You should come play with us! I can see that you want to."@@ She grabbed your hand and began to pull you over to the others. You pulled your hand away, you weren't going to play her game. You were going to do this sleepover on your terms. Emily took it in stride, @@.emilyVoice;"Okay, be alone and bored. Soon you'll wanna play with us all the time."@@ [[You narrowed your eyes|16 to 15 Maturity Change 2]]<<playerVoice "\"What exactly do you mean by that?\"">> @@.emilyVoice;"I told mommy that you were a stupid-head and wouldn't want to play."@@ A rather insulting way of putting it, though she wasn't entirely wrong. @@.emilyVoice;"But mommy said you'd want to play for sure. That 'ventually you wouldn't be able to help yourself."@@ <<if $extraEagerness>>\ <<playerVoice "\"So you're saying that if I don't play along, then the magic will make me want to anyway?\"">> Emily smiled, @@.emilyVoice;"yup! And if you're a meanie then mommy said I could make you less mean."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Less mean?\"">> @@.emilyVoice;"Lemme show you,"@@ Emily waved the wand in your direction, a light fog settling over your mind. You kept hold of her hand, you didn't want to be @@.girlVoice;meanie@@ or a @@.girlVoice;stupid-head@@. <<else>>\ <<playerVoice "\"So you're saying that if I don't play along, then the magic is going to dumb me down until I'm empty headed and giggling with the rest of you?\"">> @@.emilyVoice;"Why are you so mean?"@@ Emily pouted, but only for a moment, then a wicked smile lit up her face, @@.emilyVoice;"Mommy said if you were a meanie I could make you less mean."@@ She pointed her wand at you and your dizzy spell redoubled. @@.emilyVoice;"That's better,"@@ she stated pridefully, @@.emilyVoice;"now come."@@ This time when she took your hand you followed her along, you didn't want to be @@.girlVoice;meanie@@ or a @@.girlVoice;stupid-head@@. <</if>>\ After a few minutes of @@.girlVoice;idle gossip@@ with the girls your head started to clear up. Emily's influence began to wane and you saw the conversation for the @@.girlVoice;childish vapid talk@@ that it was. For now you were able to pull yourself away, but you knew this wasn't going to be the end of your trial. [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<pushJournalEntry "16To15Mat" "Journal 16 to 15 Mat" "regression">>\I've uncovered part of Emily's scheme with this party. It seems that if I participate in activities my mind regresses. However, the more that I decline to participate, the more the magic of the party would 'encourage' me to play along. Maybe during competition with Kara the other girls mention ways Kara is smarter than they are ("I wish I were as good at maths as you are" or something similar) and as they mention things like that the MC is dropped down to below Kara's level.You were walking around idly as you waited for the next activity. It wasn't that you didn't have anything to do, it's that you didn't know what you wanted to do. This party had presented you with a million possible activities, but you were unfamilar with so many of them. They //sounded// like fun, but you couldn't be sure. Glancing around you tracked what the other girls were doing. Emily and Miki were sitting on the floor writing on a paper in front of them, while Kara and Sophie had made their way into the kitchen. Writing something sounded @@.girlVoice;super boring@@ so you decided that you should go and see Sophie and Kara. Feeling @@.girlVoice;oddly proud@@ that you'd been able to decide on your own. Though the scene you walked in on made you reconsider the wisdom of your choice. @@.sophieVoice;"I think should be an eighth."@@ @@.karaVoice;"I think you're maybe doing the math wrong, and it should be about an quarter."@@ @@.sophieVoice;"How do you even know how to do that math? //I'm// just learning about it now."@@ @@.karaVoice;"Well I read ahead a little and my mom was helping me with it..."@@ Sophie noticed your presence, @@.sophieVoice;"oh! I know, <<playerName>> can figure it out for us."@@ @@.karaVoice;"I don't know if..."@@ @@.sophieVoice;"Don't worry about it, <<playerName>> would have learned this ages ago."@@ [[The recipe|8 to 7 Maturity Change 2]]It turned out that the issue was a complicated one. See Kara and Sophie had been put in charge of a little baking project while Emily kept Miki entertained. The concept was simple enough, a few ingredients in a mug, throw it in the microwave, wait a couple minutes and you'd all have brownies. Mom had made sure things were all prepared since you were all @@.girlVoice;too little@@ to play with the oven. <<if $cupcakeDecoratingActivityResult>>\ You weren't sure why you needed cupcakes //and// brownies. <<if $traitSweetTooth>>But you would @@.girlVoice;never say no to a sweet treat@@.<<else>>But one was decorating and this was making, so it was technically different.<</if>> <</if>>\ The complication apparently came from the recipe itself. It had all been written pre-written on the back of the box and at a glance it all looked fine. <div class="recipe-paper">\ Serves 8 2 cups of brownie mix 1/8 cup water 1/3 teaspoon miniature marshmallows 1/2 cup vegetable oil 1/2 cup egg product 1. In small bowl, mix brownie mix, egg product, vegetable oil and water. 2. Microwave uncovered on High 40 to 50 seconds, immediately top with marshmallows. Wait 1 minute to cool. Serve. </div>\ It had been written for a single tray, serving eight people, not how much it would be for five. Even if it had been for five you'd still need to break it up into the five separate mugs. [[Complex math|8 to 7 Maturity Change 3]]@@.sophieVoice;"So you see the problem, Kara and I are struggling to get the math right."@@ <<if $karaInferiorityComplex>>You didn't belive that for a second. Kara knew how to do it. Sophie was just being stubborn.<<else>>The look on Kara's face intoned that in fact Sophie was the only one struggling, but was keeping quiet to preserve her ego.<</if>> @@.sophieVoice;"So you do it for us okay? How much brownie mix for each cup?"@@ You looked between the box and the mugs. A knot built in the pit of your stomach. This was //a lot// of different numbers to be playing with all at once. And you weren't going to mention that you had little idea what "immediately" meant or "miniature" or "uncovered"... //I should know these words, I must have heard them before. I just need to think. Immediately...Immediately is "put it on"? But then why wouldn't it just say "put it on", it must mean something else.// @@.girlThought;Or maybe 'top' means the toy! I bet you put the marshmallows on a top and spin them. So "immediately" is a fancy word for "spin".@@ Emboldened by your "success" at working out the @@.girlVoice;complex words@@ you eagerly turned to the next problem. Turning away from the girls you began to count on your fingers. With your back turned they couldn't entirely see what you were doing, which is just what you wanted. You really didn't want them to know you were @@.girlVoice;using your fingers@@. Except your body didn't really block out your hands when you put them that far in front of you, so the @@.girlVoice;finger counting@@ was obvious. [[Time for math|8 to 7 Maturity Change 4]]//So if it's two cups and it's for eight people...//@@.girlThought;that means there are two eights and eight plus eight is...@@ despite your lack of remaining fingers, you were still able to work it through @@.girlThought;"sixteen."@@ You nodded to yourself, proud of your progress. @@.girlThought;And then you have a five and five sixteens is...way too big a number to do in my head.@@ However, even with the number being too big it didn't feel right. You were adding numbers together and you should be doing...@@.girlVoice;something else@@. A @@.girlVoice;shaky@@ attempt at subtraction resulted in even more confusion. @@.girlThought;You can't take eight away from two, it's impossible.@@ A flash of insight into the number line confirmed it, @@.girlVoice;you can't go past zero, there's nothing there.@@ So subtraction was clearly wrong as well, but @@.girlThought;what else was there@@? ... @@.karaVoice;"You doing alright?"@@ Kara called from behind you. Your @@.girlVoice;growing frustration@@ was obvious by the way you kept @@.girlVoice;angrily@@ putting out and pulling back your fingers. @@.karaVoice;"You don't have to if you don't want to. Though your stubborn determination lasted only a few more moments. You'd tried adding things //and// subtracting things again, but @@.girlVoice;none of it made sense@@. You do it!\"">> You snapped again, turning to the girls who were currently looking at a paper. <<include "8 to 7 Maturity Change 5 Fragment">> <<changeEmbarassment "medium">>\<<playerVoice "\"You can't do it.\"">> You @@.girlVoice;hesitantly@@ offered, <<playerVoice "\"eight is bigger than two and...\"">> Your voice trailed off, even though you knew it was impossible, explaining it to someone else was @@.girlVoice;even more daunting@@, <<playerVoice "\"you can't take big things from small things because then you have no things.\"">> The confused look on Kara's face made it obvious your explanation had provided no benefit. @@.karaVoice;"Let me show you both."@@ Kara pulled out a piece of paper and began scribbling a bunch of numbers on it. <<include "8 to 7 Maturity Change 5 Fragment">> <<changeEmbarassment "small">>@@.karaVoice;"See? [[Math magic|8 to 7 Maturity Change 8]]8+8=16 16+16+16+16+16= You scratched out that line, you'd tried that last time. Numbers that big were @@.girlVoice;too hard@@ for you. And it was obviously wrong, you had to use that 2 somehow. 2+2=4 4+4+4+4+4= You'd gotten yourself into the same issue again, the numbers were smaller this time, but there were @@.girlVoice;too many@@. You @@.girlVoice;didn't want to try@@ something that looked that hard. Even if Kara was about to open her mouth to assist you. 2+8=10 10-5=5 This seemed promising. All the numbers were small enough to work with and the last number was a number you obviously knew. <<playerVoice "\"Five!\"">> You shouted triumphantly, circling the number so they knew which one it was. @@.sophieVoice;"That's not even-"@@ @@.karaVoice;"That's right!"@@ Kara interrupted, @@.karaVoice;"two plus eight is ten and ten subtract five is five. You did want to play, but admitting that to Emily... <<if $emilyHappiness <= 5>>\ Emily stood up, @@.emilyVoice;"well I'll let you two play with the dollies, while I go check on the other girls. Now both of you play nice."@@ You @@.girlVoice;flushed@@. Instead assigning you the important responsibility of //helping// Miki @@.girlVoice;play with dollies@@. <</if>>\ Looking down you were finally able to see what was on the paper. It was a simple questionnaire about the dolls. "My name is _____", "My favourite game is _____", and so on. It wasn't terribly dissimilar to the "All About Me" document you'd been filling out earlier. Though Miki was struggling with this much worse than you had. You smiled at Emily, <<playerVoice "\"of course I'll help.\"">> After your failures in the kitchen you were eager to be the smart one again. Even if it was just being better at writing out the made up facts about a doll. [[Writing with Miki|8 to 7 Maturity Change 11]]At first things were fine. You helped Miki spell a couple words properly, or at least what you thought was properly; gave her the idea of making the one doll a @@.girlVoice;princess@@; and figured out the perfect animal to be another doll's favourite. A @@.girlVoice;bunny rabbit@@ of course. You'd only come up with it because it was @@.girlVoice;your favourite@@, but Miki didn't need to know that. Then in a flash everything fell apart. @@.mikiVoice;"I want her to fly!"@@ <<playerVoice "\"But this says her 'dream job'.\"">> @@.mikiVoice;"Flying is her job."@@ Miki responded as if you were a total idiot. <<playerVoice "\"Flying isn't a job.\"">> You rationally countered. @@.mikiVoice;"Flying is too a job."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Nuh uh, birds don't have jobs.\"">> Which to you was an incredibly obvious point. @@.mikiVoice;"Birds don't fly!"@@ <<playerVoice "\"Of course birds fly!\"">> At this point you were sure Miki wasn't smart like you, and didn't understand basic things like birds. I fly with mommy!"@@ <</if>>\ Before the fight could escalate further Sophie appeared, @@.sophieVoice;"why is everyone yelling? What's going on?"@@ <<playerVoice "\"Miki thinks she can fly!\"">> @@.mikiVoice;"<<playerName>> says flying isn't a job!"@@ The two of you shouted simultaneous, explaining little. [[Sophie mediated|8 to 7 Maturity Change 13]] <<changeHappiness "Miki" false>>\Sophie knelt down between the two of you, @@.sophieVoice;"now that's enough yelling from both of you."@@ <<if $playerAge >= 13>>The fact you were so much bigger than her did little to dampen the authority of her words.<<elseif $playerAge >= 10>>The fact you were still bigger than her did nothing to damper the authority of her words.<<else>>Since Sophie was the @@.girlVoice;big girl@@ of the group, she was showing she was in charge.<</if>> @@.mikiVoice;"Sorry Sophie..."@@ <<filterlinkreplace "Apologize">>\ <<playerVoice "\"Sorry Sophie...\"">>\ <<changeHappiness "Sophie" true>>\ <</filterlinkreplace>> @@.sophieVoice;"Don't apologize to me, apologize to each other."@@ Sophie didn't have Kara's empathetic touch when it came to conflict resolution, but she knew how to keep people in line. @@.mikiVoice;"I'm sorry <<playerName>>."@@ @@.sophieVoice;"Sorry for what."@@ @@.mikiVoice;"I'm sorry for yelling."@@ <<filterlinkreplace "Refuse to apologize to Miki">>\ You folded your arms and looked away. Now let's try explaining things again, //without// yelling this time."@@ Miki started, @@.mikiVoice;"we were writing about our dollies."@@ Sophie smirked at the word "our", but didn't interrupt, so Miki continued, @@.mikiVoice;"I said Angel wanted to fly, but <<playerName>> said she couldn't fly."@@ <<playerVoice "\"Angel isn't an angel, so she can't fly for a job,\"">> you interjected, making sure Sophie knew you were right, because angels //could//. Sophie took a moment to parse the haphazard info that had been presented to her. @@.sophieVoice;"Miki, are you saying Angel wants to fly a plane?"@@ Miki nodded vigorously, @@.mikiVoice;"uh huh, she's gonna fly all round the world."@@ You realized in that moment how little the two of you had understood each other. You'd been arguing about two entirely different things, but no one had explained themselves clearly enough to be understood. <<playerVoice "\"She didn't say about the plane...\"">> you grumbled. Now it looked like //you// had been wrong when it was Miki's fault for not explaining herself. @@.sophieVoice;"Well I think flying around the world is a great job, don't you <<playerName>>?"@@ You nodded, utterly defeated. [[The other girls returned|8 to 7 Maturity Change 15]]Kara and Emily walked into the room each carrying two mugs and matching spoons. They saw the @@.girlVoice;grumpy@@ faces on both you and Miki and Sophie merely shrugged in response. @@.karaVoice;"Here you go Miki,"@@ Kara handed Miki a mug with a brownie inside, but that isn't what caught your eye. The brownie had been dotted with marshmallows in the shape of a @@.girlVoice;bunny@@ face. <<playerVoice "\"I want a bunny!\"">> You @@.girlVoice;whined@@, quickly sinking into a @@.girlVoice;pout@@. However, Emily just gave a small laugh and handed you your mug, with a matching @@.girlVoice;bunny@@ face. With @@.girlVoice;bunnies@@ and brownies all the animosity was quickly forgotten. You and Miki bonding over your shared @@.girlVoice;love of bunnies@@. The other girls just smiled and looked on as the two of you excitedly gushed about @@.girlVoice;cute things@@. You'd come a long way from where you started the party. Back then you'd been far too mature for this kind of @@.girlVoice;childishness@@. Now most of the group had outstripped you and were grinning at //your// childishness. How long before Miki was doing the same? [[Back to the party|Event Handler]] <<pushJournalEntry "8To7Mat" "Journal 8 to 7 Maturity" "regression">>\ <<changeHappiness "Miki" true>>\Kara not let bake. Say bake to hard. I need know big number. I know big number. I count all way 100. Emily send me to miki. Miki playing with dolls and I playing with dolls. I right storee for doll. Miki not liking storee. I had fight with miki Sistr bring cokies. I like bunny cokie. righting boring I play now.@@.sophieVoice;"So you //like// him?"@@ Sophie was incredulous. @@.emilyVoice;"Shhh! Not so loud!"@@ Emily hissed, far too loudly. Clearly you weren't supposed to be hearing the current conversation. You'd just been on your way back from the bathroom and now you were just around the corner from an apparently juicy conversation. You couldn't help yourself, you had to hear what was going on. @@.sophieVoice;"So are you boyfriend and girlfriend now?"@@ Sophie teased. @@.emilyVoice;"No no, we're just friends."@@ @@.sophieVoice;"But you //did// hold his hand."@@ @@.emilyVoice;"No...well yes...but that doesn't mean..."@@ @@.sophieVoice;"Doesn't mean that you want to //kiss// him?"@@ @@.emilyVoice;"Sophie!"@@ Emily voice sounded like it had risen a whole octave and even from around the corner you could see the blush on her cheeks. But it wasn't a denial. If anything Emily's visceral response basically confirmed it. Sophie just laughed, @@.sophieVoice;"Awwww is Emily embarrassed? So much blushing."@@ @@.emilyVoice;"Well I bet you want to kiss a boy too!"@@ @@.sophieVoice;"Not a chance."@@ <span class="smallText">@@.emilyVoice;"There //must// be one you like."@@ @@.sophieVoice;"Nope"@@</span><span class="smallestText">@@.emilyVoice;"Come on Sophie, you can tell me."@@ @@.sophieVoice;"I'm telling you, there's no boy..."@@</span> The two of them moved out of earshot, leaving you to consider the conversation you'd just overheard. [[Gather your thoughts|9 to 8 Maturity Change 2]]You found yourself terribly confused by that conversation, it raised almost as many questions as it answered. Clearly Emily had held some boy's hand, something Sophie thought was a scandal by itself. Yet Emily rejected the possibility of kissing the same boy, even though she was clearly interested in the concept. It seemed like thinking about it was one thing, but actually doing it was years away. Yet Sophie, a year older, wasn't even interested in the idea, or at least was consistent at denying it. But none of this answered the fundamental question of why anyone would want to do any of that ever. @@.girlVoice;Boys were gross@@. The idea of holding one's hand was @@.girlVoice;double gross@@ and //kissing// one was @@.girlVoice;infinity gross@@. <<if $playerAge >= 11>>The fact that technically, physically, you were still sort of one was far from your mind. You @@.girlVoice;didn't think of yourself as a boy at all@@ anymore.<</if>> You tried to run the scenario in your mind, but couldn't @@.noFilter;stomach@@ it for more than a moment. <<playerVoice "\"Gross,\"">> you made a face like someone who'd just tasted sewer water and wanted it out. No. No way. There was no way you would //ever// want to do something like that. You had a vague awareness that your opinion might have been different a bit ago, but you @@.girlVoice;knew better now@@. Best to stay away from boys so you didn't get @@.girlVoice;cooties@@. [[But what about girls?|9 to 8 Maturity Change 3]]You considered the idea of doing that with a girl instead. Girls weren't gross, and they didn't have @@.girlVoice;cooties@@, so holding one's hand would probably be fine. You would hold @@.girlVoice;mommy's@@ hand after all, and she was a girl. If you were crossing the street together, or didn't want to get separated in a crowd...there were tons of reasons you might hold another girl's hand. As for kissing, you could see @@.girlVoice;mommy kissing you goodnight@@ and you would @@.girlVoice;kiss her back@@. So kissing girls was okay obviously, so why had this all seemed like a big deal? Maybe Emily was just embarrassed because @@.girlVoice;boys were dirty@@ and she'd accidentally held one's hand? Instead of @@.girlVoice;knowing better@@ like you and Sophie. Emily was @@.girlVoice;so stupid@@ sometimes, doing something @@.girlVoice;gross@@ like that. That's how you knew you were still @@.girlVoice;smarter@@ and @@.girlVoice;more mature@@ than her. You paused, there was something off about this train of logic, but you couldn't place what. Was there some deeper reason someone might want to kiss a boy or a girl? It was impossible for you to even conceive of. Maybe you could ask Sophie? No, too embarrassing. You couldn't ask Emily, she clearly didn't understand anything about this. You'd have to @@.girlVoice;ask mommy@@ later, she could explain. Shaking your head you once again tried to marshal your thoughts, it was getting harder and harder to keep things straight. Every year younger was more dramatic than the last. The difference between a sixteen and a fifteen year old was pretty slight. While the difference between Miki at six and Kara at seven seem gigantic. Though maybe that wasn't fair to Miki, Kara was @@.girlVoice;super smart@@...it might even be possible @@.girlVoice;Kara was smarter than you@@ now. No no, impossible, she was just a little girl and you were...were... [[You bit your lip|9 to 8 Maturity Change 4]]This was all too much thinking, it felt like your brain was going to overload. You needed to unload some thoughts or you might @@.girlVoice;'splode@@. Moving away from your surreptitious eavesdropping spot you moved to somewhere you could write in your @@.girlVoice;diary@@ in peace. However, when you found a table, just away from the girls you found something surprising. <<Image "Regressions/AllAboutMeBW.webp">> You weren't sure exactly what this was, but it seemed like the perfect thing for this situation. It was hard trying to remember all these things about yourself and how you were supposed to think. So you could just write them down. Abandoning your diary for the moment you sat down to get to work. [[Fill out sheet|9 to 8 Maturity Change 5]]<<set $tempOldName to $girlName || $playerName>> You took another look at the sheet, it had more questions than you'd initially realized. Though it looked like you only needed to write a word or two for each. Considering how difficult writing was becoming that was probably for the best. <<if $girlName && !$knowledgeBoyName>>\ Things started off obviously. Name. <<playerName>>. What else could you possibly put? You @@.girlVoice;couldn't remember@@ any other possible name and you @@.girlVoice;liked@@ your name. [[Fill out your name|9 to 8 Maturity Change 6][$allAboutMeName to $girlName]] <<elseif $girlName>>\ Technically you had a choice here. You went by <<playerName>> now, but you know you used to be called $playerName. But you wrote down $girlName, you much preferred it. $playerName was a @@.girlVoice;stupid boy name@@. [[Fill out your name|9 to 8 Maturity Change 6][$allAboutMeName to $girlName]] <<else>>\ You were about to write down your name when you were struck with a realization. You @@.girlVoice;didn't like@@ the name $playerName it was a @@.girlVoice;dumb boy name@@ and it didn't suit you at all. But you could write something else down, pick a new name for yourself. There was no guarantee the other girls would use it, but maybe you'd feel better about it? My Name: <<textbox "_allAboutMeNameTemp" $playerName>> <<link "Fill out your new name" "9 to 8 Maturity Change 6">> <<set $allAboutMeName to _allAboutMeNameTemp>> <</link>> <</if>>\ <<include "Show Sheet Fragment">><<set $bannedNames to ['kara', 'miki', 'emily', 'sophie']>>\ <<set $currentYear to new Date().getFullYear()>>\ <<if $bannedNames.includes($allAboutMeName.toLowerCase())>>\ You hesitated on the choice, you got the feeling that this sheet had come from one of the girls. Maybe a project or homework. So you made a guess, wrote down "$allAboutMeName" and moved on. <<elseif $allAboutMeName === $playerName>>\ In the end you decided to stick with your old name. You didn't really like it, but you still sort of felt attached to it. Plus you couldn't think of anything better so best to stick with it for now. <<elseif $allAboutMeName !== $girlName>>\ <<set $girlName to $allAboutMeName>>\ As you wrote down your @@.girlVoice;new name@@ a calm settled on your mind. Even the act of writing it felt comfortable. You'd picked a @@.girlVoice;good name@@. <<playerName>>. Yeah, you'd go by that now, if you could convince the other girls to call you by it. Maybe it'd be as simple as <<playerVoice "\"Hi, I want you all to call me $girlName now. Don't call me...\"">>, for a moment you blanked on your old name. You rallied, <<playerVoice "\"don't call me $playerName anymore.\"">> It wasn't like you'd forgotten it, it just felt @@.girlVoice;weird@@ to think about it, like it @@.girlVoice;belonged to someone else@@. <<set $pickedNewName to true>>\ <<else>>\ You mindlessly wrote down your @@.girlVoice;pretty@@ name. <</if>>\ <<if $playerAge === 16>>\ This was easy. You were sixteen. Even if your brain didn't feel like it anymore, your body hadn't changed. <<else>>\ The next blank was technically trivial, you just had to put in your age. But your age had been in constant flux since this sleepover had started. So you couldn't be totally sure how old you were, and did it want the answer for your mind or for your body. 'You're only as old as you feel' came to mind, but that phrase wasn't considering the current situation. To prevent any further confusion you decided on just putting your body's age...now you just had to figure that out. <<if $playerAge <= 5>>\ You were @@.girlVoice;smaller than Miki@@, which meant you were probably younger as well. Miki was six...so maybe five? Unless it was four...no that sounded too young. If you were four there would have been more signs. So five it is. <<elseif $playerAge === 6>>\ You were @@.girlVoice;about the same size as Miki@@, which meant you were probably six just like Miki. <<elseif $playerAge === 7>>\ You were @@.girlVoice;about the same size as Kara@@, which meant you were probably seven like Kara. <<elseif $playerAge === 8>>\ Emily was @@.girlVoice;basically your twin@@ so you //had// to be the same age. Which meant you were eight. <<elseif $playerAge === 9>>\ Sophie was only a fraction bigger than you, but she was big for her age. So you were probably still the same age as her. Nine years old, just @@.girlVoice;on the small side@@ of it. <<elseif $playerAge === 10>>\ Sophie was a little smaller than you, and she was nine, which meant you probably weren't much more than ten. <<else>>\ This was going to be complicated. You were a good amount bigger than any of the girls, but still @@.girlVoice;smaller@@ than you had been. Not to mention the fact you were somewhere between boy and girl, making your current status even more ambiguous. Making your best guess you put down $playerAge. In the end it wouldn't actually matter, and it did //feel// right. <</if>>\ <</if>>\ Having your age down made grade a lot easier. <<if $playerAge <= 4>>Though since you were @@.girlVoice;too young for school@@ you just left it blank.<<elseif $playerAge === 5 >>You were a year younger than Miki, and she was in 1st grade, which meant...well you knew the answer was 'kindergarden', but that wouldn't exactly fit. At a loss you just put '0th' and moved on.<<elseif $playerAge >= 6 && $playerAge <= 9>>If you were the @@.girlVoice;same age@@ as one of the girls, then you'd be in the same grade. <<if $playerAge === 6>>Though you did almost write down '1th'.<<elseif $playerAge === 7>>Though you did almost write down '2th'<<elseif $playerAge === 8>>Though you did almost write down '3th'<</if>><<else>>Unfortunately since you were older than the girls you'd have to do a little math. //So if Sophie is nine and in grade 4 and I'm...// you took a pause...you'd gotten a little confused with three different numbers running around. It was okay though and you'd figured it out a moment later, you were in <<print ($playerAge - 5) + 'th'>> grade. Why had that @@.girlVoice;been so hard@@? You were able to work through it, but it wasn't automatic anymore, @@.girlVoice;you had to focus to do simple math@@.<</if>> Next was 'teacher' which totally didn't matter so you just scrawled in the first thing that came to mind. Ms. Frizzle. Good enough. Though this space was so small you'd had to squish it in. Birthday was also straightforward. It was September 7th. Though you supposed that the year would have changed. If the year was $currentYear, and you used to be 16 and now you were $playerAge then you were born in... You abandoned the task, you were sure you could figure it out. But cal-calu @@.girlVoice;mathing it@@ would take too long, best to move on. [[Continue the sheet|9 to 8 Maturity Change 7]] <<include "Show Sheet Fragment">> <<silently>>\ <<set $allAboutMeAge to $playerAge>> <<switch $playerAge>> <<case 5>> <<set $allAboutMeGrade to '0th'>> <<case 6>> <<set $allAboutMeGrade to '1st'>> <<case 7>> <<set $allAboutMeGrade to '2nd'>> <<case 8>> <<set $allAboutMeGrade to '3rd'>> <<default>> <<set $allAboutMeGrade to ($playerAge - 5) + 'th'>> <</switch>> <<set $allAboutMeTeacher to 'Ms. Frizzle'>> <<set $allAboutMeBirthday to 'September 7th'>> <</silently>>The next question was another easy one. Your favorite color was @@.girlVoice;pink@@ and you were about to write it down when you realized. @@.girlThought;I should write this with my pink pencil crayon.@@ Though this raised a much greater concern. This page was @@.girlVoice;so boring@@. Your eyes cast over to your @@.girlVoice;box of pencil crayons@@. There was so much to @@.girlVoice;color in@@ and you had so many @@.girlVoice;colors@@ to choose from. It wouldn't take too long to color everything, right? [[Color the page|9 to 8 Maturity Change 8]] <span id="linkLayerOne">\ <<link "Just move on">>\ <<filterreplace "#linkLayerOne">>\ <span id="linkLayerTwo">\ <<link "Just move on">>\ <<filterreplace "#linkLayerTwo">>\ <span id="linkLayerThree">\ <<link "Just move on">>\ <<filterreplace "#linkLayerThree">>\ [[Just move on|9 to 8 Maturity Change 9]] @@.girlThought;''I wanna color!''@@\ <</filterreplace>>\ <</link>> @@.girlThought;But I have so many pretty pencil crayons.@@\ </span>\ <</filterreplace>>\ <</link>> @@.girlThought;But it's so ''dull'' in black and white.@@\ </span>\ <</filterreplace>>\ <</link>>\ </span> <<include "Show Sheet Fragment">> <<set $allAboutMeColor to "pink">>\You settled in and spread out your pencil crayons, there was a ''ton'' of space to @@.girlVoice;color@@. By your current reasoning, any space that wasn't saved for text was fair game. You considered for a moment doing @@.girlVoice;everything in pink@@ but as much as you @@.girlVoice;liked pink@@ that would get boring. So you'd do the border in @@.girlVoice;pink@@ and then use all your other pencil crayons on everything else. As you got into coloring the border it was clear that this was going to take longer than you anticipated. <<if $traitNeat>>Especially since you were working so hard to keep //exactly// in the lines.<<set $allAboutMeColoredNeat to true>><<else>>You were trying to keep in the lines after all.<</if>> <<if $playerAge <= 7>>This was going //badly//. Your physical body was even younger than your mind and you'd lost a lot of precision in your movements.<<else>>Though it wasn't going particularly well. Some of your coordination came from your mental capabilities, and those had deteriorated.<</if>> So you kept over and undershooting your target, leaving it @@.girlVoice;messier@@ than you'd intended. But you weren't about to let a little @@.girlVoice;sloppy coloring@@ stop you from enjoying yourself. You were almost done the border and there was still so much to do. @@.mikiVoice;<<print $tempOldName>>!@@ Miki yelled from the other room, @@.mikiVoice;"time to play!"@@ <<if $traitOblivious>>\ @@.girlVoice;You were too engrossed in your coloring to even notice Miki calling to you.@@ Forcing her and Kara to come into the room where you were. She stood right behind you to ensure you'd hear. @@.mikiVoice;"<<print $tempOldName.toUpperCase()>>!!!"@@ Miki cried from behind you, startling you and making you mess up another border box. <<else>>\ <<playerVoice "\"One minute...\"">> you mumbled, you wanted to finish this first. Miki and Kara entered the room and stood behind you. @@.mikiVoice;"Come on, I wanna play."@@ <<playerVoice "\"I said a minute!\"">> You snapped, didn't she understand you wanted to finish this? In truth this was @@.girlVoice;self centred@@ thinking, you hadn't even told Miki what you were doing. <</if>>\ [[Miki folded her arms|9 to 8 Maturity Change 8b]]@@.mikiVoice;"Emily said its time to play and you hafta come."@@ This was not a question. <<playerVoice "\"I wanna finish,\"">> you responded flatly. @@.mikiVoice;"You hafta come."@@ <<playerVoice "\"I don't wanna.\"">> @@.mikiVoice;"Emily said you hafta come."@@ <<playerVoice "\"I'll come after I'm done.\"">> It was clear that this discussion was getting nowhere and would continue indefinitely unless something was done. @@.karaVoice;"Miki, lets leave <<playerName>> to $their coloring. I'm sure Emily will understand."@@ Kara intervened, having checked your worksheet. <<if $pickedNewName>>Though you didn't notice it in the moment, but she'd also used your @@.girlVoice;new name@@ without you saying anything.<</if>> Miki didn't seem entirely pleased with this outcome but capitulated and followed Kara out of the room. Left alone you got back to your color, entirely losing track of time as you @@.girlVoice;colored and colored@@. When you finally finished you were @@.girlVoice;so proud of yourself@@. In your opinion you'd done an excellent job...now you just had to actually finish the rest of it. [[Continue the sheet|9 to 8 Maturity Change 9]] <<include "Show Sheet Fragment">> <<set $allAboutMeColored to true>>\Now the questions were starting to get into more complicated things. Or at least things where the answer wasn't immediately obvious. This should help get your thoughts in order. Best Friend. You tried to think back to school, your old school, the one with all the @@.girlVoice;big kids@@. It seemed so impossibly far away right now, you could barely picture yourself going somewhere like that. Surely you had friends there... There were some @@.girlVoice;gross boys@@ you remembered knowing fairly well, but now you couldn't imagine why. You could //never// put a boy as your best friend. Which left the girls. Except you couldn't use them either. You could remember their faces well enough, but their names lingered at the edge of your mind. Even when you managed to get one you couldn't be sure it was for the right girl. Clearly you hadn't known the girls very well either. And they were all @@.girlVoice;big kids@@, basically adults, you doubted any of them would be your 'best friend'. An unexpected @@.girlVoice;panic@@ gripped your heart. //Do I not have any friends?// That couldn't be true. You had to have //a// friend. @@.girlThought;What about the girls?@@ <<if $sophieHappiness >= 7 || $karaHappiness >= 7 || $emilyHappiness >= 7 || $mikiHappiness >= 7>>\ <<set $allAboutMeBestFriend to getBestFriend()>>\ Of course. You'd been @@.girlVoice;playing with the girls all day@@, that should make at least some of you friends. They were all friends already and you @@.girlVoice;wanted to be friends with them as well@@. <<if $allAboutMeBestFriend === "Emily">>Your answer was surprising, but the more you thought about it the more it made sense. You scribbled down 'Emily'. It wouldn't have been your answer twenty four hours ago, but it'd been a paradigm shifting day.<<else>>But you had to think that $allAboutMeBestFriend was your //best// friend. You just hoped the other girls wouldn't get mad they hadn't been picked.<</if>> <<else>>\ Of course. You'd been @@.girlVoice;playing with the girls all day@@, that should have made you friendly with at least one of them. But it hadn't. None of them really liked you. They were all friends already and you @@.girlVoice;wanted to be friends with them, but they wouldn't be your friends.@@ You choked back a @@.girlVoice;sudden tear@@. There was one person who would always be there for you... You scrawled down 'MY MOMMY'. You'd expected to be embarrassed by such an answer, but you weren't. You @@.girlVoice;loved your mommy@@ so why wouldn't she be your best friend? In fact now you were sure it was the //right// answer, and you'd @@.girlVoice;tell anyone@@ who asked. <<set $allAboutMeBestFriend to "My Mommy">>\ <</if>>\ [[Your Favourite Things|9 to 8 Maturity Change 10]] <<include "Show Sheet Fragment">>You realized that you'd been at this for a while and hadn't really done anything to figure yourself out. Focusing you swore you'd hurry through the rest and get the answers that you sought. That's when a hand landed on your shoulder, @@.sophieVoice;"hey, enough being on your own. Time to come back."@@ <<playerVoice "\"But I'm not-\"">> @@.emilyVoice;"You can come back and do it later."@@ Emily smile belied the fact she knew something more about this sheet. <<playerVoice "\"But I need-\"">> @@.sophieVoice;"Enough enough,"@@ Sophie tugged at you, @@.sophieVoice;"come on, don't be boring."@@ <<if $playerAge >= 10>>Despite being bigger than Sophie there was something intimidating about her. An authority in her voice that you really didn't want to fight against.<<else>>Sophie was bigger than you, and in this moment seemed even more intimidating. @@.girlThought;I'd better just do what she says.@@<</if>> You weren't happy about the situation, you hadn't really successfully figured out anything, but your time was up. You shoved the paper into your journal. Emily said you could finish later, you knew you'd be able to find the time somehow. [[Back to the Party|Event Handler]] <<include "Show Sheet Fragment">> <<pushJournalEntry "9To8Mat" "Journal 9 to 8 Maturity" "regression">>\ <<set $showAllAboutMe to true>>\<<link "Show Sheet">> <<script>> Dialog.setup(); Dialog.wiki(Story.get("All About Me Fragment").processText()); Dialog.open(); <</script>> <</link>><div id="allAboutMe" style="position: relative;">\ <<if $allAboutMeColored>>\ <<Image "Regressions/AllAboutMeColor.webp">> <<else>>\ <<Image "Regressions/AllAboutMeBW.webp">> <</if>>\ <span class="journal5"> <div id="allAboutMeName">\ $allAboutMeName </div>\ <div id="allAboutMeAge">\ $allAboutMeAge </div>\ <div id="allAboutMeGrade">\ $allAboutMeGrade </div>\ <div id="allAboutMeTeacher">\ $allAboutMeTeacher </div>\ <div id="allAboutMeBirthday">\ $allAboutMeBirthday </div>\ <div id="allAboutMeColor">\ $allAboutMeColor </div>\ <div id="allAboutMeBestFriend">\ $allAboutMeBestFriend </div>\ </span> <span class="journal6"> <div id="allAboutMeHobby1">\ $allAboutMeHobby1 </div>\ <div id="allAboutMeHobby2">\ $allAboutMeHobby2 </div>\ <div id="allAboutMeFaveFood">\ $allAboutMeFaveFood </div>\ <div id="allAboutMeFaveSong">\ $allAboutMeFaveSong </div>\ <div id="allAboutMeFaveMovie">\ $allAboutMeFaveMovie </div>\ <div id="allAboutMeFaveSport">\ $allAboutMeFaveSport </div>\ <div id="allAboutMeFaveTvShow">\ $allAboutMeFaveTvShow </div>\ <div id="allAboutMeGoodAt">\ $allAboutMeGoodAt </div>\ <div id="allAboutMeWhenIGrowUp">\ $allAboutMeWhenIGrowUp </div>\ <div id="allAboutMeSpecial">\ $allAboutMeSpecial </div>\ <div id="allAboutMeSelfPortrait">\ $allAboutMeSelfPortrait </div>\ </span> </div>\Sophie and emily talk about gross boys. >= playerAge; i--) { $("#playerAge" + i + " .heightChart-name-left").show(); } $("#playerAge16 .heightChart-name-left").show(); if (playerAge < 1) { scrollOffset = 1000; $("#playerAge6Month .heightChart-name-left").show(); } else if (playerAge <= 3) { scrollOffset = 600; } else if (playerAge <= 6) { scrollOffset = (7 - playerAge) * 75; } document.querySelector("#ui-dialog-body").scrollTo(0, 350 + scrollOffset); <</script>> <</timed>> <</silently>>\Inspired by games such as: <a Skills:\ <<if $playerMaturity >= 14>> You're able to eloquently explain yourself, even when describing complex concepts. You're able to mediate differences of opinions. <<elseif $playerMaturity >= 12>> You're able to explain concrete ideas, but you sometimes struggle with abstract concepts. Differences of opinion can be very frustrating. <<elseif $playerMaturity >= 10>> Your speech is nearly on an adult level. But you find it difficult to explain ideas to those who have a different understanding. <<elseif $playerMaturity == 9>> In speech you're able to use grammar correctly most of the time, but your written words are more error prone. Fully explaining your thoughts and feelings can be difficult. <<elseif $playerMaturity >= 7>> You're able to express simple concepts verbally, but often find your vocabulary lacking. Writing is a struggle, you're wrong more often than you're right. You're able to read some things, but unfamiliar words still trip you up. It is difficult to comprehend a differing point of view. <<elseif $playerMaturity == 6>> You're able to express simple concepts verbally, but find your vocabulary extremely lacking. Writing is a serious struggle, only able to get across the most basic of concepts, and often still not making sense. Likewise you can only read the most basic of phrases. It is near impossible to comprehend a differing point of view. <<elseif $playerMaturity == 5>> People are able to understand what you are saying, but the words are simple and things like tenses are often wrong. Writing is impossible, little more than near random letters. You cannot read or write. <<elseif $playerMaturity >= 1>> You know no more than a handful of words. Making explaining or understanding anything beyond the most basic of concepts impossible. bouncy ass.\ <<elseif $playerAge >= 11>>\ You've got wide hips and a big jiggling ass.\ <<elseif $playerAge >= 9>>\ You've got hips with a negative curve and an oversized ass.\ <<elseif $playerAge >=
